| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1001: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1002: अतः परं तृतीयं तु ज्ञेयमारण्यकं महत् |` | "Next after this, the third great section to be known is the Āraṇyaka [Forest Book]," |
| `Line 1003: पौरानुगमनं चैव धर्मपुत्रस्य धीमतः ||१०५||` | "And the following of the wise Dharmaputra [Yudhiṣṭhira] by the citizens. ||105||" |
| `Line 1004: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1005: वृष्णीनामागमो यत्र पाञ्चालानां च सर्वशः |` | "Where the arrival of the Vṛṣṇis [Krishna's clan] and all the Pāñcālas [Draupadi's people] is described," |
| `Line 1006: यत्र सौभवधाख्यानं किर्मीरवध एव च ||१०६||` | "Where the narrative of Saubha's destruction and the killing of Kirmīra [demon] are also told. ||106||" |
| `Line 1007: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1008: अस्त्रहेतोर्विवासश्च पार्थस्यामिततेजसः ||१०६||` | "And the departure of Pārtha [Arjuna] of immeasurable splendor for the sake of weapons. ||106||" |
| `Line 1009: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1010: महादेवेन युद्धं च किरातवपुषा सह |` | "And the battle with Mahādeva [Shiva] in the form of a Kirāta [mountain hunter]," |
| `Line 1011: दर्शनं लोकपालानां स्वर्गारोहणमेव च ||१०७||` | "The vision of the Lokapālas [world guardians] and the ascent to heaven as well. ||107||" |
| `Line 1012: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1013: दर्शनं बृहदश्वस्य महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः |` | "The meeting with Bṛhadaśva, the great sage of purified soul," |
| `Line 1014: युधिष्ठिरस्य चार्तस्य व्यसने परिदेवनम् ||१०८||` | "And the lamentation of the distressed Yudhiṣṭhira in his misfortune. ||108||" |
| `Line 1015: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1016: नलोपाख्यानमत्रैव धर्मिष्ठं करुणोदयम् |` | "The story of Nala is also here, righteous and arousing compassion," |
| `Line 1017: दमयन्त्याः स्थितिर्यत्र नलस्य व्यसनागमे ||१०९||` | "Where is described Damayantī's steadfastness during Nala's misfortune. ||109||" |
| `Line 1018: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1019: वनवासगतानां च पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् |` | "And of the noble-souled Pāṇḍavas dwelling in the forest," |
| `Line 1020: स्वर्गे प्रवृत्तिराख्याता लोमशेनार्जुनस्य वै ||११०||` | "The account of Arjuna in heaven is narrated by Lomaśa [sage]. ||110||" |
| `Line 1021: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1022: तीर्थयात्रा तथैवात्र पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् |` | "The pilgrimage to sacred places of the noble-souled Pāṇḍavas is likewise here," |
| `Line 1023: जटासुरस्य तत्रैव वधः समुपवर्ण्यते ||१११||` | "The killing of Jaṭāsura [demon] is also described there. ||111||" |
| `Line 1024: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1025: नियुक्तो भीमसेनश्च द्रौपद्या गन्धमादने |` | "And Bhīmasena was sent by Draupadī to Gandhamādana [mountain]," |
translations: | `Line 1001: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 1003: पौरानुगमनं चैव धर्मपुत्रस्य धीमतः ||१०५||` | "And the following of the wise Dharmaputra [Yudhiṣṭhira] by the citizens. ||105||" |

| `Line 1006: यत्र सौभवधाख्यानं किर्मीरवध एव च ||१०६||` | "Where the narrative of Saubha's destruction and the killing of Kirmīra [demon] are also told. ||106||" |
| `Line 1007: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1008: अस्त्रहेतोर्विवासश्च पार्थस्यामिततेजसः ||१०६||` | "And the departure of Pārtha [Arjuna] of immeasurable splendor for the sake of weapons. ||106||" |
| `Line 1009: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1010: महादेवेन युद्धं च किरातवपुषा सह |` | "And the battle with Mahādeva [Shiva] in the form of a Kirāta [mountain hunter]," |
| `Line 1011: दर्शनं लोकपालानां स्वर्गारोहणमेव च ||१०७||` | "The vision of the Lokapālas [world guardians] and the ascent to heaven as well. ||107||" |
| `Line 1012: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1013: दर्शनं बृहदश्वस्य महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः |` | "The meeting with Bṛhadaśva, the great sage of purified soul," |
| `Line 1014: युधिष्ठिरस्य चार्तस्य व्यसने परिदेवनम् ||१०८||` | "And the lamentation of the distressed Yudhiṣṭhira in his misfortune. ||108||" |
| `Line 1015: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1016: नलोपाख्यानमत्रैव धर्मिष्ठं करुणोदयम् |` | "The story of Nala is also here, righteous and arousing compassion," |
| `Line 1017: दमयन्त्याः स्थितिर्यत्र नलस्य व्यसनागमे ||१०९||` | "Where is described Damayantī's steadfastness during Nala's misfortune. ||109||" |
| `Line 1018: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1019: वनवासगतानां च पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् |` | "And of the noble-souled Pāṇḍavas dwelling in the forest," |
| `Line 1020: स्वर्गे प्रवृत्तिराख्याता लोमशेनार्जुनस्य वै ||११०||` | "The account of Arjuna in heaven is narrated by Lomaśa [sage]. ||110||" |
| `Line 1021: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1022: तीर्थयात्रा तथैवात्र पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् |` | "The pilgrimage to sacred places of the noble-souled Pāṇḍavas is likewise here," |
| `Line 1023: जटासुरस्य तत्रैव वधः समुपवर्ण्यते ||१११||` | "The killing of Jaṭāsura [demon] is also described there. ||111||" |
| `Line 1024: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1025: नियुक्तो भीमसेनश्च द्रौपद्या गन्धमादने |` | "And Bhīmasena was sent by Draupadī to Gandhamādana [mountain]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 101: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 102: युगस्यादौ निमित्तं तन्महद्दिव्यं प्रचक्षते |` | "At the beginning of a yuga [cosmic age], they declare that great divine cause," |
| `Line 103: यस्मिंस्तच्छ्रूयते सत्यं ज्योतिर्ब्रह्म सनातनम् ||२८||` | "In which is heard that truth, the luminous eternal Brahman [absolute reality]. ||28||" |
| `Line 104: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 105: अद्भुतं चाप्यचिन्त्यं च सर्वत्र समतां गतम् |` | "Wondrous and inconceivable, having reached equality everywhere," |
| `Line 106: अव्यक्तं कारणं सूक्ष्मं यत्तत्सदसदात्मकम् ||२९||` | "The unmanifest, subtle cause, which is the essence of both being and non-being. ||29||" |
| `Line 107: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 108: यस्मात्पितामहो जज्ञे प्रभुरेकः प्रजापतिः |` | "From which was born the grandfather [Brahma], the one lord, Prajapati [lord of creatures]," |
| `Line 109: ब्रह्मा सुरगुरुः स्थाणुर्मनुः कः परमेष्ठ्यथ ||३०||` | "Brahma, the preceptor of gods, Sthanu [Shiva], Manu, Ka [Prajapati], and Paramesthi [supreme one]. ||30||" |
| `Line 110: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 111: प्राचेतसस्तथा दक्षो दक्षपुत्राश्च सप्त ये |` | "Then Prachetasa Daksha and his seven sons," |
| `Line 112: ततः प्रजानां पतयः प्राभवन्नेकविंशतिः ||३१||` | "From them arose twenty-one lords of creatures [Prajapatis]. ||31||" |
| `Line 113: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 114: पुरुषश्चाप्रमेयात्मा यं सर्वमृषयो विदुः |` | "And the Purusha [cosmic being] of immeasurable nature, whom all sages know," |
| `Line 115: विश्वेदेवास्तथादित्या वसवोऽथाश्विनावपि ||३२||` | "The Vishvedevas [universal gods], the Adityas [solar deities], the Vasus [elemental gods], and also the two Ashvins [divine physicians]. ||32||" |
| `Line 116: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 117: यक्षाः साध्याः पिशाचाश्च गुह्यकाः पितरस्तथा |` | "The Yakshas [wealth spirits], Sadhyas [celestial beings], Pisachas [fiends], Guhyakas [hidden beings], and also the Pitris [ancestors]," |
| `Line 118: ततः प्रसूता विद्वांसः शिष्टा ब्रह्मर्षयोऽमलाः ||३३||` | "Then were born the learned ones, the distinguished, pure Brahmarshis [sage-seers]. ||33||" |
| `Line 119: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 120: राजर्षयश्च बहवः सर्वैः समुदिता गुणैः |` | "And many Rajarshis [royal sages] endowed with all excellent qualities," |
| `Line 121: आपो द्यौः पृथिवी वायुरन्तरिक्षं दिशस्तथा ||३४||` | "Water, heaven, earth, wind, sky, and the directions as well. ||34||" |
| `Line 122: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 123: संवत्सरर्तवो मासाः पक्षाहोरात्रयः क्रमात् |` | "The year, seasons, months, fortnights, days and nights in sequence," |
| `Line 124: यच्चान्यदपि तत्सर्वं सम्भूतं लोकसाक्षिकम् ||३५||` | "And whatever else exists, all that has come into being, witnessed by the world. ||35||" |
| `Line 125: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 101: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 102: युगस्यादौ निमित्तं तन्महद्दिव्यं प्रचक्षते |` | "At the beginning of a yuga [cosmic age], they declare that great divine cause," |
| `Line 103: यस्मिंस्तच्छ्रूयते सत्यं ज्योतिर्ब्रह्म सनातनम् ||२८||` | "In which is heard that truth, the luminous eternal Brahman [absolute reality]. ||28||" |
| `Line 104: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 105: अद्भुतं चाप्यचिन्त्यं च सर्वत्र समतां गतम् |` | "Wondrous and inconceivable, having reached equality everywhere," |
| `Line 106: अव्यक्तं कारणं सूक्ष्मं यत्तत्सदसदात्मकम् ||२९||` | "The unmanifest, subtle cause, which is the essence of both being and non-being. ||29||" |
| `Line 107: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 108: यस्मात्पितामहो जज्ञे प्रभुरेकः प्रजापतिः |` | "From which was born the grandfather [Brahma], the one lord, Prajapati [lord of creatures]," |
| `Line 109: ब्रह्मा सुरगुरुः स्थाणुर्मनुः कः परमेष्ठ्यथ ||३०||` | "Brahma, the preceptor of gods, Sthanu [Shiva], Manu, Ka [Prajapati], and Paramesthi [supreme one]. ||30||" |
| `Line 110: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 111: प्राचेतसस्तथा दक्षो दक्षपुत्राश्च सप्त ये |` | "Then Prachetasa Daksha and his seven sons," |
| `Line 112: ततः प्रजानां पतयः प्राभवन्नेकविंशतिः ||३१||` | "From them arose twenty-one lords of creatures [Prajapatis]. ||31||" |
| `Line 113: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 114: पुरुषश्चाप्रमेयात्मा यं सर्वमृषयो विदुः |` | "And the Purusha [cosmic being] of immeasurable nature, whom all sages know," |

| `Line 115: विश्वेदेवास्तथादित्या वसवोऽथाश्विनावपि ||३२||` | "The Vishvedevas [universal gods], the Adityas [solar deities], the Vasus [elemental gods], and also the two Ashvins [divine physicians]. ||32||" |
| `Line 116: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 117: यक्षाः साध्याः पिशाचाश्च गुह्यकाः पितरस्तथा |` | "The Yakshas [wealth spirits], Sadhyas [celestial beings], Pisachas [fiends], Guhyakas [hidden beings], and also the Pitris [ancestors]," |
| `Line 118: ततः प्रसूता विद्वांसः शिष्टा ब्रह्मर्षयोऽमलाः ||३३||` | "Then were born the learned ones, the distinguished, pure Brahmarshis [sage-seers]. ||33||" |
| `Line 119: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 120: राजर्षयश्च बहवः सर्वैः समुदिता गुणैः |` | "And many Rajarshis [royal sages] endowed with all excellent qualities," |
| `Line 121: आपो द्यौः पृथिवी वायुरन्तरिक्षं दिशस्तथा ||३४||` | "Water, heaven, earth, wind, sky, and the directions as well. ||34||" |
| `Line 122: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 123: संवत्सरर्तवो मासाः पक्षाहोरात्रयः क्रमात् |` | "The year, seasons, months, fortnights, days and nights in sequence," |
| `Line 124: यच्चान्यदपि तत्सर्वं सम्भूतं लोकसाक्षिकम् ||३५||` | "And whatever else exists, all that has come into being, witnessed by the world. ||35||" |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1026: यत्र मन्दारपुष्पार्थं नलिनीं तामधर्षयत् ||११२||` | "Where he violated that Nalinī for the sake of Mandāra flowers [celestial blooms]. ||112||" |
| `Line 1027: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1028: यत्रास्य सुमहद्युद्धमभवत्सह राक्षसैः |` | "Where his great battle occurred with the Rākṣasas [demons]," |
| `Line 1029: यक्षैश्चापि महावीर्यैर्मणिमत्प्रमुखैस्तथा ||११३||` | "And also with the mighty Yakṣas [wealth guardians], led by Maṇimat. ||113||" |
| `Line 1030: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1031: आगस्त्यमपि चाख्यानं यत्र वातापिभक्षणम् |` | "Also the tale of Agastya, where the devouring of Vātāpi [demon brother] occurred," |
| `Line 1032: लोपामुद्राभिगमनमपत्यार्थमृषेरपि ||११४||` | "And the sage's union with Lopāmudrā for the sake of offspring. ||114||" |
| `Line 1033: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1034: ततः श्येनकपोतीयमुपाख्यानमनन्तरम् |` | "Then immediately follows the story of the hawk and the dove," |
| `Line 1035: इन्द्रोऽग्निर्यत्र धर्मश्च अजिज्ञासञ्शिबिं नृपम् ||११५||` | "Where Indra [king of gods], Agni [fire god], and Dharma [righteousness] tested King Śibi. ||115||" |
| `Line 1036: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1037: ऋश्यशृङ्गस्य चरितं कौमारब्रह्मचारिणः |` | "The story of Ṛśyaśṛṅga [deer-horned sage], who practiced celibacy from childhood," |
| `Line 1038: जामदग्न्यस्य रामस्य चरितं भूरितेजसः ||११६||` | "And the story of Rāma Jāmadagnya [Paraśurāma], of immense splendor. ||116||" |
| `Line 1039: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1040: कार्तवीर्यवधो यत्र हैहयानां च वर्ण्यते |` | "Where the slaying of Kārtavīrya [thousand-armed king] and the Haihayas is described," |
| `Line 1041: सौकन्यमपि चाख्यानं च्यवनो यत्र भार्गवः ||११७||` | "And also the tale of Sukanyā, where Cyavana of Bhṛgu's lineage [sage Bhārgava] appears. ||117||" |
| `Line 1042: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1043: शर्यातियज्ञे नासत्यौ कृतवान्सोमपीथिनौ |` | "In Śaryāti's sacrifice, he made the Nāsatyas [Aśvin twins] drinkers of Soma [ritual beverage]," |
| `Line 1044: ताभ्यां च यत्र स मुनिर्यौवनं प्रतिपादितः ||११८||` | "And where that sage was restored to youth by those two. ||118||" |
| `Line 1045: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1046: जन्तूपाख्यानमत्रैव यत्र पुत्रेण सोमकः |` | "Here also is the story of Jantu, where Somaka with his son," |
| `Line 1047: पुत्रार्थमयजद्राजा लेभे पुत्रशतं च सः ||११९||` | "The king performed a sacrifice for sons and obtained a hundred sons. ||119||" |
| `Line 1048: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1049: अष्टावक्रीयमत्रैव विवादे यत्र बन्दिनम् |` | "Here also is the story of Aṣṭāvakra [eight-crooked sage], where in a debate with Bandin," |
| `Line 1050: विजित्य सागरं प्राप्तं पितरं लब्धवानृषिः ||१२०||` | "Having conquered him, the sage recovered his father who had gone to the ocean. ||120||" |
translations: | `Line 1026: यत्र मन्दारपुष्पार्थं नलिनीं तामधर्षयत् ||११२||` | "Where he violated that Nalinī for the sake of Mandāra flowers [celestial blooms]. ||112||" |
| `Line 1027: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1028: यत्रास्य सुमहद्युद्धमभवत्सह राक्षसैः |` | "Where his great battle occurred with the Rākṣasas [demons]," |
| `Line 1029: यक्षैश्चापि महावीर्यैर्मणिमत्प्रमुखैस्तथा ||११३||` | "And also with the mighty Yakṣas [wealth guardians], led by Maṇimat. ||113||" |
| `Line 1030: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1031: आगस्त्यमपि चाख्यानं यत्र वातापिभक्षणम् |` | "Also the tale of Agastya, where the devouring of Vātāpi [demon brother] occurred," |
| `Line 1032: लोपामुद्राभिगमनमपत्यार्थमृषेरपि ||११४||` | "And the sage's union with Lopāmudrā for the sake of offspring. ||114||" |
| `Line 1033: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1034: ततः श्येनकपोतीयमुपाख्यानमनन्तरम् |` | "Then immediately follows the story of the hawk and the dove," |
| `Line 1035: इन्द्रोऽग्निर्यत्र धर्मश्च अजिज्ञासञ्शिबिं नृपम् ||११५||` | "Where Indra [king of gods], Agni [fire god], and Dharma [righteousness] tested King Śibi. ||115||" |
| `Line 1036: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1037: ऋश्यशृङ्गस्य चरितं कौमारब्रह्मचारिणः |` | "The story of Ṛśyaśṛṅga [deer-horned sage], who practiced celibacy from childhood," |
| `Line 1038: जामदग्न्यस्य रामस्य चरितं भूरितेजसः ||११६||` | "And the story of Rāma Jāmadagnya [Paraśurāma], of immense splendor. ||116||" |
| `Line 1039: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1040: कार्तवीर्यवधो यत्र हैहयानां च वर्ण्यते |` | "Where the slaying of Kārtavīrya [thousand-armed king] and the Haihayas is described," |
| `Line 1041: सौकन्यमपि चाख्यानं च्यवनो यत्र भार्गवः ||११७||` | "And also the tale of Sukanyā, where Cyavana of Bhṛgu's lineage [sage Bhārgava] appears. ||117||" |
| `Line 1042: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1043: शर्यातियज्ञे नासत्यौ कृतवान्सोमपीथिनौ |` | "In Śaryāti's sacrifice, he made the Nāsatyas [Aśvin twins] drinkers of Soma [ritual beverage]," |
| `Line 1044: ताभ्यां च यत्र स मुनिर्यौवनं प्रतिपादितः ||११८||` | "And where that sage was restored to youth by those two. ||118||" |
| `Line 1045: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1046: जन्तूपाख्यानमत्रैव यत्र पुत्रेण सोमकः |` | "Here also is the story of Jantu, where Somaka with his son," |
| `Line 1047: पुत्रार्थमयजद्राजा लेभे पुत्रशतं च सः ||११९||` | "The king performed a sacrifice for sons and obtained a hundred sons. ||119||" |
| `Line 1048: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1049: अष्टावक्रीयमत्रैव विवादे यत्र बन्दिनम् |` | "Here also is the story of Aṣṭāvakra [eight-crooked sage], where in a debate with Bandin," |
| `Line 1050: विजित्य सागरं प्राप्तं पितरं लब्धवानृषिः ||१२०||` | "Having conquered him, the sage recovered his father who had gone to the ocean. ||120||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1051: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1052: अवाप्य दिव्यान्यस्त्राणि गुर्वर्थे सव्यसाचिना |` | "Having obtained divine weapons by Savyasāchin [Arjuna] for his teacher's sake," |
| `Line 1053: निवातकवचैर्युद्धं हिरण्यपुरवासिभिः ||१२१||` | "The battle with the Nivātakavacas [demon clan], dwellers of Hiraṇyapura [golden city]. ||121||" |
| `Line 1054: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1055: समागमश्च पार्थस्य भ्रातृभिर्गन्धमादने |` | "And the reunion of Pārtha [Arjuna] with his brothers at Gandhamādana [fragrant mountain]," |
| `Line 1056: घोषयात्रा च गन्धर्वैर्यत्र युद्धं किरीटिनः ||१२२||` | "The Ghoṣayātrā [cattle-station expedition] and where the battle of Kirīṭin [Arjuna] with the Gandharvas [celestial musicians] occurred. ||122||" |
| `Line 1057: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1058: पुनरागमनं चैव तेषां द्वैतवनं सरः |` | "And their return to the Dvaitavana [forest of duality] lake," |
| `Line 1059: जयद्रथेनापहारो द्रौपद्याश्चाश्रमान्तरात् ||१२३||` | "The abduction of Draupadī from the hermitage by Jayadratha. ||123||" |
| `Line 1060: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1061: यत्रैनमन्वयाद्भीमो वायुवेगसमो जवे |` | "Where Bhīma pursued him with speed equal to the wind," |
| `Line 1062: मार्कण्डेयसमस्यायामुपाख्यानानि भागशः ||१२४||` | "The various narratives during the meeting with Mārkaṇḍeya [sage]. ||124||" |
| `Line 1063: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1064: संदर्शनं च कृष्णस्य संवादश्चैव सत्यया |` | "The meeting with Kṛṣṇa and his conversation with Satyā [Draupadī]," |
| `Line 1065: व्रीहिद्रौणिकमाख्यानमैन्द्रद्युम्नं तथैव च ||१२५||` | "The tale of Vrīhidrauṇika [rice measure] and likewise that of Indradyumna. ||125||" |
| `Line 1066: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1067: सावित्र्यौद्दालकीयं च वैन्योपाख्यानमेव च |` | "The story of Sāvitrī, the tale of Uddālaka, and also the narrative of Vainya [King Pṛthu]," |
| `Line 1068: रामायणमुपाख्यानमत्रैव बहुविस्तरम् ||१२६||` | "The narrative of the Rāmāyaṇa [Rama's journey] is also here in great detail. ||126||" |
| `Line 1069: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1070: कर्णस्य परिमोषोऽत्र कुण्डलाभ्यां पुरंदरात् |` | "Here is the story of Karṇa being deprived of his earrings by Purandara [Indra]," |
| `Line 1071: आरणेयमुपाख्यानं यत्र धर्मोऽन्वशात्सुतम् ||१२७||` | "The Āraṇeya tale where Dharma [Yudhiṣṭhira] tested his son. ||127||" |
| `Line 1072: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1073: जग्मुर्लब्धवरा यत्र पाण्डवाः पश्चिमां दिशम् ||१२७||` | "Where the Pāṇḍavas, having obtained boons, went toward the western direction. ||127||" |
| `Line 1074: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1075: एतदारण्यकं पर्व तृतीयं परिकीर्तितम् |` | "This Āraṇyaka [Forest] Parva is proclaimed as the third book." |
translations: | `Line 1051: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 1053: निवातकवचैर्युद्धं हिरण्यपुरवासिभिः ||१२१||` | "The battle with the Nivātakavacas [demon clan], dwellers of Hiraṇyapura [golden city]. ||121||" |

| `Line 1055: समागमश्च पार्थस्य भ्रातृभिर्गन्धमादने |` | "And the reunion of Pārtha [Arjuna] with his brothers at Gandhamādana [fragrant mountain]," |

| `Line 1056: घोषयात्रा च गन्धर्वैर्यत्र युद्धं किरीटिनः ||१२२||` | "The Ghoṣayātrā [cattle-station expedition] and where the battle of Kirīṭin [Arjuna] with the Gandharvas [celestial musicians] occurred. ||122||" |
| `Line 1057: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1058: पुनरागमनं चैव तेषां द्वैतवनं सरः |` | "And their return to the Dvaitavana [forest of duality] lake," |
| `Line 1059: जयद्रथेनापहारो द्रौपद्याश्चाश्रमान्तरात् ||१२३||` | "The abduction of Draupadī from the hermitage by Jayadratha. ||123||" |
| `Line 1060: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1061: यत्रैनमन्वयाद्भीमो वायुवेगसमो जवे |` | "Where Bhīma pursued him with speed equal to the wind," |
| `Line 1062: मार्कण्डेयसमस्यायामुपाख्यानानि भागशः ||१२४||` | "The various narratives during the meeting with Mārkaṇḍeya [sage]. ||124||" |
| `Line 1063: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1064: संदर्शनं च कृष्णस्य संवादश्चैव सत्यया |` | "The meeting with Kṛṣṇa and his conversation with Satyā [Draupadī]," |
| `Line 1065: व्रीहिद्रौणिकमाख्यानमैन्द्रद्युम्नं तथैव च ||१२५||` | "The tale of Vrīhidrauṇika [rice measure] and likewise that of Indradyumna. ||125||" |
| `Line 1066: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1067: सावित्र्यौद्दालकीयं च वैन्योपाख्यानमेव च |` | "The story of Sāvitrī, the tale of Uddālaka, and also the narrative of Vainya [King Pṛthu]," |
| `Line 1068: रामायणमुपाख्यानमत्रैव बहुविस्तरम् ||१२६||` | "The narrative of the Rāmāyaṇa [Rama's journey] is also here in great detail. ||126||" |

| `Line 1070: कर्णस्य परिमोषोऽत्र कुण्डलाभ्यां पुरंदरात् |` | "Here is the story of Karṇa being deprived of his earrings by Purandara [Indra]," |
| `Line 1071: आरणेयमुपाख्यानं यत्र धर्मोऽन्वशात्सुतम् ||१२७||` | "The Āraṇeya tale where Dharma [Yudhiṣṭhira] tested his son. ||127||" |
| `Line 1072: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1073: जग्मुर्लब्धवरा यत्र पाण्डवाः पश्चिमां दिशम् ||१२७||` | "Where the Pāṇḍavas, having obtained boons, went toward the western direction. ||127||" |

| `Line 1075: एतदारण्यकं पर्व तृतीयं परिकीर्तितम् |` | "This Āraṇyaka [Forest] Parva is proclaimed as the third book." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1076: अत्राध्यायशते द्वे तु सङ्ख्याते परमर्षिणा ||१२८||` | "Here, two hundred chapters have been enumerated by the great sage [paramarṣi]. ||128||" |
| `Line 1077: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1078: एकोनसप्ततिश्चैव तथाध्यायाः प्रकीर्तिताः ||१२८||` | "And sixty-nine chapters have thus been proclaimed. ||128||" |
| `Line 1079: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1080: एकादश सहस्राणि श्लोकानां षट्शतानि च |` | "Eleven thousand and six hundred" |
| `Line 1081: चतुःषष्टिस्तथा श्लोकाः पर्वैतत्परिकीर्तितम् ||१२९||` | "and sixty-four verses are declared in this parva [section]. ||129||" |
| `Line 1082: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1083: अतः परं निबोधेदं वैराटं पर्वविस्तरम् |` | "After this, understand the extensive Virāṭa Parva [section]," |
| `Line 1084: विराटनगरं गत्वा श्मशाने विपुलां शमीम् ||१३०||` | "where, having gone to Virāṭa's city, at a cremation ground, a large śamī tree [sacred tree] ||130||" |
| `Line 1085: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1086: दृष्ट्वा संनिदधुस्तत्र पाण्डवा आयुधान्युत ||१३०||` | "the Pāṇḍavas saw and concealed their weapons there. ||130||" |
| `Line 1087: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1088: यत्र प्रविश्य नगरं छद्मभिर्न्यवसन्त ते |` | "Where, entering the city in disguise, they dwelt," |
| `Line 1089: दुरात्मनो वधो यत्र कीचकस्य वृकोदरात् ||१३१||` | "where the wicked Kīcaka was slain by Vṛkodara [Bhīma]. ||131||" |
| `Line 1090: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1091: गोग्रहे यत्र पार्थेन निर्जिताः कुरवो युधि |` | "Where, in the cattle-raid, the Kauravas were defeated in battle by Pārtha [Arjuna]," |
| `Line 1092: गोधनं च विराटस्य मोक्षितं यत्र पाण्डवैः ||१३२||` | "and where Virāṭa's cattle wealth was liberated by the Pāṇḍavas. ||132||" |
| `Line 1093: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1094: विराटेनोत्तरा दत्ता स्नुषा यत्र किरीटिनः |` | "Where Uttarā was given by Virāṭa as daughter-in-law to the diadem-wearer [Arjuna]," |
| `Line 1095: अभिमन्युं समुद्दिश्य सौभद्रमरिघातिनम् ||१३३||` | "designating Abhimanyu, the son of Subhadrā, the slayer of foes. ||133||" |
| `Line 1096: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1097: चतुर्थमेतद्विपुलं वैराटं पर्व वर्णितम् |` | "This extensive Virāṭa Parva [section] is described as the fourth," |
| `Line 1098: अत्रापि परिसङ्ख्यातमध्यायानां महात्मना ||१३४||` | "here also the number of chapters by the great soul [sage] ||134||" |
| `Line 1099: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1100: सप्तषष्टिरथो पूर्णा श्लोकाग्रमपि मे शृणु |` | "is sixty-seven complete, and now hear from me the number of verses:" |

| `Line 1077: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1078: एकोनसप्ततिश्चैव तथाध्यायाः प्रकीर्तिताः ||१२८||` | "And sixty-nine chapters have thus been proclaimed. ||128||" |

| `Line 1092: गोधनं च विराटस्य मोक्षितं यत्र पाण्डवैः ||१३२||` | "and where Virāṭa's cattle wealth was liberated by the Pāṇḍavas. ||132||" |

| `Line 1094: विराटेनोत्तरा दत्ता स्नुषा यत्र किरीटिनः |` | "Where Uttarā was given by Virāṭa as daughter-in-law to the diadem-wearer [Arjuna]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1101: श्लोकानां द्वे सहस्रे तु श्लोकाः पञ्चाशदेव तु ||१३५||` | "Two thousand and fifty verses only ||135||" |
| `Line 1102: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1103: पर्वण्यस्मिन्समाख्याताः सङ्ख्यया परमर्षिणा ||१३५||` | "Have been enumerated in this Parva [section] by count by the great sage ||135||" |
| `Line 1104: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1105: उद्योगपर्व विज्ञेयं पञ्चमं शृण्वतः परम् |` | "The Udyoga Parva [Effort/Preparation section] should be known as the fifth, supremely worth listening to," |
| `Line 1106: उपप्लव्ये निविष्टेषु पाण्डवेषु जिगीषया ||१३६||` | "When the Pandavas were settled in Upaplavya with the desire for victory ||136||" |
| `Line 1107: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1108: दुर्योधनोऽर्जुनश्चैव वासुदेवमुपस्थितौ ||१३६||` | "Both Duryodhana and Arjuna approached Vasudeva [Krishna] ||136||" |
| `Line 1109: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1110: साहाय्यमस्मिन्समरे भवान्नौ कर्तुमर्हति |` | "'You should render assistance to us in this battle,'" |
| `Line 1111: इत्युक्ते वचने कृष्णो यत्रोवाच महामतिः ||१३७||` | "When these words were spoken, Krishna, the great-minded one, replied ||137||" |
| `Line 1112: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1113: अयुध्यमानमात्मानं मन्त्रिणं पुरुषर्षभौ |` | "'O best among men, myself non-fighting as an advisor,'" |
| `Line 1114: अक्षौहिणीं वा सैन्यस्य कस्य वा किं ददाम्यहम् ||१३८||` | "'Or an Akshauhini [large army unit] of troops - to whom shall I give what?' ||138||" |
| `Line 1115: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1116: वव्रे दुर्योधनः सैन्यं मन्दात्मा यत्र दुर्मतिः |` | "Where the dull-witted, evil-minded Duryodhana chose the army," |
| `Line 1117: अयुध्यमानं सचिवं वव्रे कृष्णं धनञ्जयः ||१३९||` | "Dhananjaya [Arjuna] chose Krishna as a non-fighting counselor ||139||" |
| `Line 1118: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1119: सञ्जयं प्रेषयामास शमार्थं पाण्डवान्प्रति |` | "He [Dhritarashtra] sent Sanjaya to the Pandavas for the purpose of peace," |
| `Line 1120: यत्र दूतं महाराजो धृतराष्ट्रः प्रतापवान् ||१४०||` | "Where the mighty king Dhritarashtra sent an envoy ||140||" |
| `Line 1121: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1122: श्रुत्वा च पाण्डवान्यत्र वासुदेवपुरोगमान् |` | "And having heard about the Pandavas led by Vasudeva [Krishna]," |
| `Line 1123: प्रजागरः सम्प्रजज्ञे धृतराष्ट्रस्य चिन्तया ||१४१||` | "Sleeplessness arose in Dhritarashtra due to anxiety ||141||" |
| `Line 1124: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1125: विदुरो यत्र वाक्यानि विचित्राणि हितानि च |` | "Where Vidura spoke words that were wonderful and beneficial," |
translations: | `Line 1101: श्लोकानां द्वे सहस्रे तु श्लोकाः पञ्चाशदेव तु ||१३५||` | "Two thousand and fifty verses only ||135||" |
| `Line 1102: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1103: पर्वण्यस्मिन्समाख्याताः सङ्ख्यया परमर्षिणा ||१३५||` | "Have been enumerated in this Parva [section] by count by the great sage ||135||" |
| `Line 1104: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1105: उद्योगपर्व विज्ञेयं पञ्चमं शृण्वतः परम् |` | "The Udyoga Parva [Effort/Preparation section] should be known as the fifth, supremely worth listening to," |
| `Line 1106: उपप्लव्ये निविष्टेषु पाण्डवेषु जिगीषया ||१३६||` | "When the Pandavas were settled in Upaplavya with the desire for victory ||136||" |
| `Line 1107: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1108: दुर्योधनोऽर्जुनश्चैव वासुदेवमुपस्थितौ ||१३६||` | "Both Duryodhana and Arjuna approached Vasudeva [Krishna] ||136||" |
| `Line 1109: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1110: साहाय्यमस्मिन्समरे भवान्नौ कर्तुमर्हति |` | "'You should render assistance to us in this battle,'" |
| `Line 1111: इत्युक्ते वचने कृष्णो यत्रोवाच महामतिः ||१३७||` | "When these words were spoken, Krishna, the great-minded one, replied ||137||" |
| `Line 1112: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1113: अयुध्यमानमात्मानं मन्त्रिणं पुरुषर्षभौ |` | "'O best among men, myself non-fighting as an advisor,'" |
| `Line 1114: अक्षौहिणीं वा सैन्यस्य कस्य वा किं ददाम्यहम् ||१३८||` | "'Or an Akshauhini [large army unit] of troops - to whom shall I give what?' ||138||" |
| `Line 1115: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1116: वव्रे दुर्योधनः सैन्यं मन्दात्मा यत्र दुर्मतिः |` | "Where the dull-witted, evil-minded Duryodhana chose the army," |
| `Line 1117: अयुध्यमानं सचिवं वव्रे कृष्णं धनञ्जयः ||१३९||` | "Dhananjaya [Arjuna] chose Krishna as a non-fighting counselor ||139||" |
| `Line 1118: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1119: सञ्जयं प्रेषयामास शमार्थं पाण्डवान्प्रति |` | "He [Dhritarashtra] sent Sanjaya to the Pandavas for the purpose of peace," |
| `Line 1120: यत्र दूतं महाराजो धृतराष्ट्रः प्रतापवान् ||१४०||` | "Where the mighty king Dhritarashtra sent an envoy ||140||" |
| `Line 1121: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1122: श्रुत्वा च पाण्डवान्यत्र वासुदेवपुरोगमान् |` | "And having heard about the Pandavas led by Vasudeva [Krishna]," |
| `Line 1123: प्रजागरः सम्प्रजज्ञे धृतराष्ट्रस्य चिन्तया ||१४१||` | "Sleeplessness arose in Dhritarashtra due to anxiety ||141||" |
| `Line 1124: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1125: विदुरो यत्र वाक्यानि विचित्राणि हितानि च |` | "Where Vidura spoke words that were wonderful and beneficial," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1126: श्रावयामास राजानं धृतराष्ट्रं मनीषिणम् ||१४२||` | "He made the wise king Dhritarashtra listen. ||142||" |
| `Line 1127: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1128: तथा सनत्सुजातेन यत्राध्यात्ममनुत्तमम् |` | "Thus, through Sanatsujata [eternal youth sage], where the supreme spiritual knowledge," |
| `Line 1129: मनस्तापान्वितो राजा श्रावितः शोकलालसः ||१४३||` | "Was made to be heard by the king who was afflicted with mental anguish and overwhelmed with grief. ||143||" |
| `Line 1130: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1131: प्रभाते राजसमितौ सञ्जयो यत्र चाभिभोः |` | "At dawn, in the royal assembly, where Sanjaya [charioteer-messenger] of the sovereign," |
| `Line 1132: ऐकात्म्यं वासुदेवस्य प्रोक्तवानर्जुनस्य च ||१४४||` | "Declared the oneness of Vasudeva [Krishna] and Arjuna. ||144||" |
| `Line 1133: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1134: यत्र कृष्णो दयापन्नः सन्धिमिच्छन्महायशाः |` | "Where Krishna, filled with compassion, desiring peace, the greatly renowned one," |
| `Line 1135: स्वयमागाच्छमं कर्तुं नगरं नागसाह्वयम् ||१४५||` | "Himself came to make peace to the city called Nagasahvaya [Hastinapura]. ||145||" |
| `Line 1136: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1137: प्रत्याख्यानं च कृष्णस्य राज्ञा दुर्योधनेन वै |` | "And the rejection of Krishna by King Duryodhana indeed," |
| `Line 1138: शमार्थं याचमानस्य पक्षयोरुभयोर्हितम् ||१४६||` | "Who was pleading for peace, for the benefit of both sides. ||146||" |
| `Line 1139: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1140: कर्णदुर्योधनादीनां दुष्टं विज्ञाय मन्त्रितम् |` | "Having known the evil counsel of Karna, Duryodhana and others," |
| `Line 1141: योगेश्वरत्वं कृष्णेन यत्र राजसु दर्शितम् ||१४७||` | "Where Krishna displayed his lordship of yoga [divine powers] among the kings. ||147||" |
| `Line 1142: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1143: रथमारोप्य कृष्णेन यत्र कर्णोऽनुमन्त्रितः |` | "Where Karna was counseled by Krishna, having taken him up in his chariot," |
| `Line 1144: उपायपूर्वं शौण्डीर्यात्प्रत्याख्यातश्च तेन सः ||१४८||` | "With diplomatic means, but he (Karna) rejected him (Krishna) out of valor. ||148||" |
| `Line 1145: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1146: ततश्चाप्यभिनिर्यात्रा रथाश्वनरदन्तिनाम् |` | "And then also the marching forth of chariots, horses, men, and elephants," |
| `Line 1147: नगराद्धास्तिनपुराद्बलसङ्ख्यानमेव च ||१४९||` | "From the city of Hastinapura, and also the enumeration of forces. ||149||" |
| `Line 1148: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1149: यत्र राज्ञा उलूकस्य प्रेषणं पाण्डवान्प्रति |` | "Where the king's sending of Uluka [owl-named messenger] to the Pandavas," |
| `Line 1150: श्वोभाविनि महायुद्धे दूत्येन क्रूरवादिना ||१५०||` | "For the great battle to come tomorrow, as an envoy with harsh words. ||150||" |
translations: | `Line 1126: श्रावयामास राजानं धृतराष्ट्रं मनीषिणम् ||१४२||` | "He made the wise king Dhritarashtra listen. ||142||" |
| `Line 1127: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1128: तथा सनत्सुजातेन यत्राध्यात्ममनुत्तमम् |` | "Thus, through Sanatsujata [eternal youth sage], where the supreme spiritual knowledge," |
| `Line 1129: मनस्तापान्वितो राजा श्रावितः शोकलालसः ||१४३||` | "Was made to be heard by the king who was afflicted with mental anguish and overwhelmed with grief. ||143||" |

| `Line 1132: ऐकात्म्यं वासुदेवस्य प्रोक्तवानर्जुनस्य च ||१४४||` | "Declared the oneness of Vasudeva [Krishna] and Arjuna. ||144||" |
| `Line 1133: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1134: यत्र कृष्णो दयापन्नः सन्धिमिच्छन्महायशाः |` | "Where Krishna, filled with compassion, desiring peace, the greatly renowned one," |
| `Line 1135: स्वयमागाच्छमं कर्तुं नगरं नागसाह्वयम् ||१४५||` | "Himself came to make peace to the city called Nagasahvaya [Hastinapura]. ||145||" |
| `Line 1136: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1137: प्रत्याख्यानं च कृष्णस्य राज्ञा दुर्योधनेन वै |` | "And the rejection of Krishna by King Duryodhana indeed," |
| `Line 1138: शमार्थं याचमानस्य पक्षयोरुभयोर्हितम् ||१४६||` | "Who was pleading for peace, for the benefit of both sides. ||146||" |
| `Line 1139: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1140: कर्णदुर्योधनादीनां दुष्टं विज्ञाय मन्त्रितम् |` | "Having known the evil counsel of Karna, Duryodhana and others," |
| `Line 1141: योगेश्वरत्वं कृष्णेन यत्र राजसु दर्शितम् ||१४७||` | "Where Krishna displayed his lordship of yoga [divine powers] among the kings. ||147||" |

| `Line 1144: उपायपूर्वं शौण्डीर्यात्प्रत्याख्यातश्च तेन सः ||१४८||` | "With diplomatic means, but he (Karna) rejected him (Krishna) out of valor. ||148||" |

| `Line 1147: नगराद्धास्तिनपुराद्बलसङ्ख्यानमेव च ||१४९||` | "From the city of Hastinapura, and also the enumeration of forces. ||149||" |

| `Line 1150: श्वोभाविनि महायुद्धे दूत्येन क्रूरवादिना ||१५०||` | "For the great battle to come tomorrow, as an envoy with harsh words. ||150||" |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1151: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1152: रथातिरथसङ्ख्यानमम्बोपाख्यानमेव च ||१५०||` | "The enumeration of warriors and chariot-warriors, and also the narrative of Ambā [princess's story], ||150||" |
| `Line 1153: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1154: एतत्सुबहुवृत्तान्तं पञ्चमं पर्व भारते |` | "This fifth book in the Bhārata, containing many narratives," |
| `Line 1155: उद्योगपर्व निर्दिष्टं सन्धिविग्रहसंश्रितम् ||१५१||` | "Is designated as the Udyoga Parva [Effort Book], dealing with peace negotiations and conflict. ||151||" |
| `Line 1156: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1157: अध्यायाः सङ्ख्यया त्वत्र षडशीतिशतं स्मृतम् |` | "The number of chapters herein is remembered to be one hundred and eighty-six," |
| `Line 1158: श्लोकानां षट्सहस्राणि तावन्त्येव शतानि च ||१५२||` | "And six thousand verses, as well as the same number of hundreds [6,600 verses]. ||152||" |
| `Line 1159: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1160: श्लोकाश्च नवतिः प्रोक्तास्तथैवाष्टौ महात्मना |` | "And ninety-eight verses were composed by the great-souled," |
| `Line 1161: व्यासेनोदारमतिना पर्वण्यस्मिंस्तपोधनाः ||१५३||` | "Vyāsa of noble intellect in this book, O wealth of austerities [ascetics]. ||153||" |
| `Line 1162: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1163: अत ऊर्ध्वं विचित्रार्थं भीष्मपर्व प्रचक्षते |` | "After this, they speak of the Bhīṣma Parva [Bhishma Book], with its diverse contents," |
| `Line 1164: जम्बूखण्डविनिर्माणं यत्रोक्तं सञ्जयेन ह ||१५४||` | "Where the formation of Jambū-khaṇḍa [continent division] is described by Sañjaya. ||154||" |
| `Line 1165: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1166: यत्र युद्धमभूद्घोरं दशाहान्यतिदारुणम् |` | "Where there was a terrible battle, extremely fierce for ten days," |
| `Line 1167: यत्र यौधिष्ठिरं सैन्यं विषादमगमत्परम् ||१५५||` | "Where Yudhiṣṭhira's army fell into extreme despair. ||155||" |
| `Line 1168: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1169: कश्मलं यत्र पार्थस्य वासुदेवो महामतिः |` | "Where Vāsudeva [Krishna] of great wisdom dispelled the dejection," |
| `Line 1170: मोहजं नाशयामास हेतुभिर्मोक्षदर्शनैः ||१५६||` | "Born of delusion of Pārtha [Arjuna], with reasons showing the path to liberation. ||156||" |
| `Line 1171: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1172: शिखण्डिनं पुरस्कृत्य यत्र पार्थो महाधनुः |` | "Where Pārtha [Arjuna] of the mighty bow, placing Śikhaṇḍin in front," |
| `Line 1173: विनिघ्नन्निशितैर्बाणै रथाद्भीष्ममपातयत् ||१५७||` | "Striking with sharp arrows, made Bhīṣma fall from his chariot. ||157||" |
| `Line 1174: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1175: षष्ठमेतन्महापर्व भारते परिकीर्तितम् |` | "This sixth great book in the Bhārata is thus celebrated." |

| `Line 1179: श्लोकाश्च चतुराशीतिः पर्वण्यस्मिन्प्रकीर्तिताः ||१५९||` | "And eighty-four verses are proclaimed in this Parvan [book section]. ||159||" |

| `Line 1181: व्यासेन वेदविदुषा सङ्ख्याता भीष्मपर्वणि ||१५९||` | "Counted by Vyāsa [sage-compiler], the knower of Vedas, in the Bhīṣma-parvan [Bhishma book]. ||159||" |
| `Line 1182: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1183: द्रोणपर्व ततश्चित्रं बहुवृत्तान्तमुच्यते |` | "Then the Droṇa-parvan [Drona book], wondrous and containing many episodes, is described," |
| `Line 1184: यत्र संशप्तकाः पार्थमपनिन्यू रणाजिरात् ||१६०||` | "Where the Saṃśaptakas [oath-bound warriors] drew Pārtha [Arjuna] away from the battlefield. ||160||" |
| `Line 1185: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1186: भगदत्तो महाराजो यत्र शक्रसमो युधि |` | "Where the great king Bhagadatta, equal to Śakra [Indra] in battle," |
| `Line 1187: सुप्रतीकेन नागेन सह शस्तः किरीटिना ||१६१||` | "Along with his elephant Supratīka, was slain by Kirīṭin [Arjuna]. ||161||" |
| `Line 1188: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1189: यत्राभिमन्युं बहवो जघ्नुर्लोकमहारथाः |` | "Where many great warriors of the world slew Abhimanyu," |
| `Line 1190: जयद्रथमुखा बालं शूरमप्राप्तयौवनम् ||१६२||` | "Led by Jayadratha, the brave youth who had not yet reached full maturity. ||162||" |
| `Line 1191: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1192: हतेऽभिमन्यौ क्रुद्धेन यत्र पार्थेन संयुगे |` | "Where, after Abhimanyu was slain, by the enraged Pārtha [Arjuna] in battle," |
| `Line 1193: अक्षौहिणीः सप्त हत्वा हतो राजा जयद्रथः ||१६३||` | "After slaying seven Akṣauhiṇīs [army units], King Jayadratha was killed. ||163||" |
| `Line 1194: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1195: संशप्तकावशेषं च कृतं निःशेषमाहवे ||१६३||` | "And the remnants of the Saṃśaptakas [oath-bound warriors] were completely destroyed in battle. ||163||" |
| `Line 1196: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1197: अलम्बुसः श्रुतायुश्च जलसन्धश्च वीर्यवान् |` | "Alambusa, Śrutāyus, and the mighty Jalasandha," |
| `Line 1198: सौमदत्तिर्विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः ||१६४||` | "Saumadatti [Bhūriśravas], Virāṭa, and the great warrior Drupada, ||164||" |
| `Line 1199: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1200: घटोत्कचादयश्चान्ये निहता द्रोणपर्वणि ||१६४||` | "Ghaṭotkaca and others were slain in the Droṇa-parvan [Drona book]. ||164||" |
translations: | `Line 1176: अध्यायानां शतं प्रोक्तं सप्तदश तथापरे ||१५८||` | "One hundred chapters are declared, and seventeen more. ||158||" |
| `Line 1177: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1178: पञ्च श्लोकसहस्राणि सङ्ख्ययाष्टौ शतानि च |` | "Five thousand verses, and by count, eight hundred," |
| `Line 1179: श्लोकाश्च चतुराशीतिः पर्वण्यस्मिन्प्रकीर्तिताः ||१५९||` | "And eighty-four verses are proclaimed in this Parvan [book section]. ||159||" |
| `Line 1180: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1181: व्यासेन वेदविदुषा सङ्ख्याता भीष्मपर्वणि ||१५९||` | "Counted by Vyāsa [sage-compiler], the knower of Vedas, in the Bhīṣma-parvan [Bhishma book]. ||159||" |
| `Line 1182: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1183: द्रोणपर्व ततश्चित्रं बहुवृत्तान्तमुच्यते |` | "Then the Droṇa-parvan [Drona book], wondrous and containing many episodes, is described," |
| `Line 1184: यत्र संशप्तकाः पार्थमपनिन्यू रणाजिरात् ||१६०||` | "Where the Saṃśaptakas [oath-bound warriors] drew Pārtha [Arjuna] away from the battlefield. ||160||" |
| `Line 1185: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1186: भगदत्तो महाराजो यत्र शक्रसमो युधि |` | "Where the great king Bhagadatta, equal to Śakra [Indra] in battle," |
| `Line 1187: सुप्रतीकेन नागेन सह शस्तः किरीटिना ||१६१||` | "Along with his elephant Supratīka, was slain by Kirīṭin [Arjuna]. ||161||" |
| `Line 1188: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1189: यत्राभिमन्युं बहवो जघ्नुर्लोकमहारथाः |` | "Where many great warriors of the world slew Abhimanyu," |
| `Line 1190: जयद्रथमुखा बालं शूरमप्राप्तयौवनम् ||१६२||` | "Led by Jayadratha, the brave youth who had not yet reached full maturity. ||162||" |
| `Line 1191: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1192: हतेऽभिमन्यौ क्रुद्धेन यत्र पार्थेन संयुगे |` | "Where, after Abhimanyu was slain, by the enraged Pārtha [Arjuna] in battle," |
| `Line 1193: अक्षौहिणीः सप्त हत्वा हतो राजा जयद्रथः ||१६३||` | "After slaying seven Akṣauhiṇīs [army units], King Jayadratha was killed. ||163||" |
| `Line 1194: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1195: संशप्तकावशेषं च कृतं निःशेषमाहवे ||१६३||` | "And the remnants of the Saṃśaptakas [oath-bound warriors] were completely destroyed in battle. ||163||" |
| `Line 1196: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1197: अलम्बुसः श्रुतायुश्च जलसन्धश्च वीर्यवान् |` | "Alambusa, Śrutāyus, and the mighty Jalasandha," |
| `Line 1198: सौमदत्तिर्विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः ||१६४||` | "Saumadatti [Bhūriśravas], Virāṭa, and the great warrior Drupada, ||164||" |
| `Line 1199: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1200: घटोत्कचादयश्चान्ये निहता द्रोणपर्वणि ||१६४||` | "Ghaṭotkaca and others were slain in the Droṇa-parvan [Drona book]. ||164||" |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1201: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1202: अश्वत्थामापि चात्रैव द्रोणे युधि निपातिते |` | "And here, when Drona was slain in battle," |
| `Line 1203: अस्त्रं प्रादुश्चकारोग्रं नारायणममर्षितः ||१६५||` | "Ashvatthama, enraged, unleashed the terrible Narayana [Vishnu's] weapon. ||165||" |
| `Line 1204: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1205: सप्तमं भारते पर्व महदेतदुदाहृतम् |` | "This is declared as the seventh great book in the Bharata [Mahabharata]," |
| `Line 1206: अत्र ते पृथिवीपालाः प्रायशो निधनं गताः ||१६६||` | "Wherein those rulers of the earth mostly met their death. ||166||" |
| `Line 1207: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1208: द्रोणपर्वणि ये शूरा निर्दिष्टाः पुरुषर्षभाः ||१६६||` | "Those heroes, the bulls among men, who are mentioned in the Drona Parva [book of Drona]. ||166||" |
| `Line 1209: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1210: अध्यायानां शतं प्रोक्तमध्यायाः सप्ततिस्तथा |` | "One hundred and seventy chapters are said to be," |
| `Line 1211: अष्टौ श्लोकसहस्राणि तथा नव शतानि च ||१६७||` | "Eight thousand and nine hundred verses. ||167||" |
| `Line 1212: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1213: श्लोका नव तथैवात्र सङ्ख्यातास्तत्त्वदर्शिना |` | "And nine verses are counted here by the truth-seer [sage]," |
| `Line 1214: पाराशर्येण मुनिना सञ्चिन्त्य द्रोणपर्वणि ||१६८||` | "By the sage Parasharyeya [Vyasa], after careful consideration, in the Drona Parva. ||168||" |
| `Line 1215: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1216: अतः परं कर्णपर्व प्रोच्यते परमाद्भुतम् |` | "After this, the Karna Parva [book of Karna], which is most wonderful, is described," |
| `Line 1217: सारथ्ये विनियोगश्च मद्रराजस्य धीमतः ||१६९||` | "And the appointment of the wise king of Madra [Shalya] as charioteer. ||169||" |
| `Line 1218: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1219: आख्यातं यत्र पौराणं त्रिपुरस्य निपातनम् ||१६९||` | "Where the ancient story of the destruction of Tripura [demon city] is narrated. ||169||" |
| `Line 1220: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1221: प्रयाणे परुषश्चात्र संवादः कर्णशल्ययोः |` | "And here, the harsh dialogue between Karna and Shalya during the march," |
| `Line 1222: हंसकाकीयमाख्यानमत्रैवाक्षेपसंहितम् ||१७०||` | "The tale of the swan and crow is also included here with criticisms. ||170||" |
| `Line 1223: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1224: अन्योन्यं प्रति च क्रोधो युधिष्ठिरकिरीटिनोः |` | "And the anger between Yudhishthira and Kiritina [Arjuna] toward each other," |
| `Line 1225: द्वैरथे यत्र पार्थेन हतः कर्णो महारथः ||१७१||` | "Where in single combat, Karna the great chariot-warrior was slain by Partha [Arjuna]. ||171||" |
translations: | `Line 1201: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1202: अश्वत्थामापि चात्रैव द्रोणे युधि निपातिते |` | "And here, when Drona was slain in battle," |
| `Line 1203: अस्त्रं प्रादुश्चकारोग्रं नारायणममर्षितः ||१६५||` | "Ashvatthama, enraged, unleashed the terrible Narayana [Vishnu's] weapon. ||165||" |

| `Line 1211: अष्टौ श्लोकसहस्राणि तथा नव शतानि च ||१६७||` | "Eight thousand and nine hundred verses. ||167||" |

| `Line 1213: श्लोका नव तथैवात्र सङ्ख्यातास्तत्त्वदर्शिना |` | "And nine verses are counted here by the truth-seer [sage]," |

| `Line 1216: अतः परं कर्णपर्व प्रोच्यते परमाद्भुतम् |` | "After this, the Karna Parva [book of Karna], which is most wonderful, is described," |

| `Line 1221: प्रयाणे परुषश्चात्र संवादः कर्णशल्ययोः |` | "And here, the harsh dialogue between Karna and Shalya during the march," |
| `Line 1222: हंसकाकीयमाख्यानमत्रैवाक्षेपसंहितम् ||१७०||` | "The tale of the swan and crow is also included here with criticisms. ||170||" |
| `Line 1223: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1224: अन्योन्यं प्रति च क्रोधो युधिष्ठिरकिरीटिनोः |` | "And the anger between Yudhishthira and Kiritina [Arjuna] toward each other," |
| `Line 1225: द्वैरथे यत्र पार्थेन हतः कर्णो महारथः ||१७१||` | "Where in single combat, Karna the great chariot-warrior was slain by Partha [Arjuna]. ||171||" |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1226: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1227: अष्टमं पर्व निर्दिष्टमेतद्भारतचिन्तकैः |` | "This eighth parva [book section] is designated by the scholars of the Bharata," |
| `Line 1228: एकोनसप्ततिः प्रोक्ता अध्यायाः कर्णपर्वणि ||१७२||` | "Sixty-nine chapters are said to be in the Karna-parva [Karna's book]. ||172||" |
| `Line 1229: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1230: चत्वार्येव सहस्राणि नव श्लोकशतानि च ||१७२||` | "Four thousand and nine hundred verses [in total]. ||172||" |
| `Line 1231: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1232: अतः परं विचित्रार्थं शल्यपर्व प्रकीर्तितम् |` | "After this comes the Shalya-parva [Shalya's book], celebrated for its diverse contents," |
| `Line 1233: हतप्रवीरे सैन्ये तु नेता मद्रेश्वरोऽभवत् ||१७३||` | "When the chief warriors were slain, the king of Madra [Shalya] became the leader. ||173||" |
| `Line 1234: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1235: वृत्तानि रथयुद्धानि कीर्त्यन्ते यत्र भागशः |` | "Where chariot battles that occurred are described in various sections," |
| `Line 1236: विनाशः कुरुमुख्यानां शल्यपर्वणि कीर्त्यते ||१७४||` | "The destruction of the foremost Kurus is narrated in the Shalya-parva. ||174||" |
| `Line 1237: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1238: शल्यस्य निधनं चात्र धर्मराजान्महारथात् |` | "And herein is the death of Shalya at the hands of Dharmaraja [Yudhishthira], the great chariot-warrior," |
| `Line 1239: गदायुद्धं तु तुमुलमत्रैव परिकीर्तितम् ||१७५||` | "And the tumultuous mace battle is also described here. ||175||" |
| `Line 1240: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1241: सरस्वत्याश्च तीर्थानां पुण्यता परिकीर्तिता ||१७५||` | "The sanctity of the pilgrimage sites of Sarasvati [river goddess] is also celebrated. ||175||" |
| `Line 1242: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1243: नवमं पर्व निर्दिष्टमेतदद्भुतमर्थवत् |` | "This ninth parva is designated as wonderful and meaningful," |
| `Line 1244: एकोनषष्टिरध्यायास्तत्र सङ्ख्याविशारदैः ||१७६||` | "Fifty-nine chapters are counted there by those skilled in enumeration. ||176||" |
| `Line 1245: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1246: सङ्ख्याता बहुवृत्तान्ताः श्लोकाग्रं चात्र शस्यते |` | "Many narratives are counted, and the total number of verses here is declared to be," |
| `Line 1247: त्रीणि श्लोकसहस्राणि द्वे शते विंशतिस्तथा ||१७७||` | "Three thousand, two hundred and twenty verses. ||177||" |
| `Line 1248: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1249: मुनिना सम्प्रणीतानि कौरवाणां यशोभृताम् ||१७७||` | "Composed by the sage [Vyasa], about the glory-bearing Kauravas. ||177||" |
| `Line 1250: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 1245: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1246: सङ्ख्याता बहुवृत्तान्ताः श्लोकाग्रं चात्र शस्यते |` | "Many narratives are counted, and the total number of verses here is declared to be," |
| `Line 1247: त्रीणि श्लोकसहस्राणि द्वे शते विंशतिस्तथा ||१७७||` | "Three thousand, two hundred and twenty verses. ||177||" |
| `Line 1248: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1249: मुनिना सम्प्रणीतानि कौरवाणां यशोभृताम् ||१७७||` | "Composed by the sage [Vyasa], about the glory-bearing Kauravas. ||177||" |
| `Line 1250: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1251: अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि सौप्तिकं पर्व दारुणम् |` | "Hereafter, I shall narrate the terrible Sauptika Parva [Sleeping Warriors chapter]," |
| `Line 1252: भग्नोरुं यत्र राजानं दुर्योधनममर्षणम् ||१७८||` | "Where the impatient king Duryodhana with broken thighs [was found]. ||178||" |
| `Line 1253: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1254: व्यपयातेषु पार्थेषु त्रयस्तेऽभ्याययू रथाः |` | "After the Parthas [Pandavas] had departed, those three warriors approached in chariots," |
| `Line 1255: कृतवर्मा कृपो द्रौणिः सायाह्ने रुधिरोक्षिताः ||१७९||` | "Kritavarma, Kripa, and Droni [Ashvatthama], blood-spattered, in the evening. ||179||" |
| `Line 1256: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1257: प्रतिजज्ञे दृढक्रोधो द्रौणिर्यत्र महारथः |` | "Where the great warrior Droni [Ashvatthama], firmly enraged, vowed," |
| `Line 1258: अहत्वा सर्वपाञ्चालान्धृष्टद्युम्नपुरोगमान् ||१८०||` | "Not without slaying all the Panchalas led by Dhrishtadyumna, ||180||" |
| `Line 1259: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1260: पाण्डवांश्च सहामात्यान्न विमोक्ष्यामि दंशनम् ||१८०||` | "And the Pandavas with their ministers, 'I shall not release my armor.' ||180||" |
| `Line 1261: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1262: प्रसुप्तान्निशि विश्वस्तान्यत्र ते पुरुषर्षभाः |` | "Where those bull among men [great warriors]," |
| `Line 1263: पाञ्चालान्सपरीवाराञ्जघ्नुर्द्रौणिपुरोगमाः ||१८१||` | "Slaughtered the sleeping, unsuspecting Panchalas with their attendants at night, led by Droni [Ashvatthama]. ||181||" |
| `Line 1264: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1265: यत्रामुच्यन्त पार्थास्ते पञ्च कृष्णबलाश्रयात् |` | "Where those five Parthas [Pandavas] were saved through Krishna's protection," |
| `Line 1266: सात्यकिश्च महेष्वासः शेषाश्च निधनं गताः ||१८२||` | "While Satyaki, the great archer, and the rest met their death. ||182||" |
| `Line 1267: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1268: द्रौपदी पुत्रशोकार्ता पितृभ्रातृवधार्दिता |` | "Where Draupadi, afflicted with grief for her sons, distressed by the slaughter of her father and brothers," |
| `Line 1269: कृतानशनसङ्कल्पा यत्र भर्तृनुपाविशत् ||१८३||` | "Having resolved to fast unto death, approached her husbands. ||183||" |
| `Line 1270: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1271: द्रौपदीवचनाद्यत्र भीमो भीमपराक्रमः |` | "Where, at Draupadi's words, Bhima of terrible prowess," |
| `Line 1272: अन्वधावत सङ्क्रुद्धो भारद्वाजं गुरोः सुतम् ||१८४||` | "Pursued in great anger Bharadvaja's son [Ashvatthama], the son of his guru. ||184||" |
| `Line 1273: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1274: भीमसेनभयाद्यत्र दैवेनाभिप्रचोदितः |` | "Where, out of fear of Bhimasena and impelled by fate," |
| `Line 1275: अपाण्डवायेति रुषा द्रौणिरस्त्रमवासृजत् ||१८५||` | "Droni [Ashvatthama] in anger released his weapon with the intent 'for the destruction of the Pandavas.' ||185||" |
translations: | `Line 1251: अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि सौप्तिकं पर्व दारुणम् |` | "Hereafter, I shall narrate the terrible Sauptika Parva [Sleeping Warriors chapter]," |
| `Line 1252: भग्नोरुं यत्र राजानं दुर्योधनममर्षणम् ||१७८||` | "Where the impatient king Duryodhana with broken thighs [was found]. ||178||" |

| `Line 1254: व्यपयातेषु पार्थेषु त्रयस्तेऽभ्याययू रथाः |` | "After the Parthas [Pandavas] had departed, those three warriors approached in chariots," |
| `Line 1255: कृतवर्मा कृपो द्रौणिः सायाह्ने रुधिरोक्षिताः ||१७९||` | "Kritavarma, Kripa, and Droni [Ashvatthama], blood-spattered, in the evening. ||179||" |
| `Line 1256: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1257: प्रतिजज्ञे दृढक्रोधो द्रौणिर्यत्र महारथः |` | "Where the great warrior Droni [Ashvatthama], firmly enraged, vowed," |
| `Line 1258: अहत्वा सर्वपाञ्चालान्धृष्टद्युम्नपुरोगमान् ||१८०||` | "Not without slaying all the Panchalas led by Dhrishtadyumna, ||180||" |
| `Line 1259: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1260: पाण्डवांश्च सहामात्यान्न विमोक्ष्यामि दंशनम् ||१८०||` | "And the Pandavas with their ministers, 'I shall not release my armor.' ||180||" |
| `Line 1261: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1262: प्रसुप्तान्निशि विश्वस्तान्यत्र ते पुरुषर्षभाः |` | "Where those bull among men [great warriors]," |
| `Line 1263: पाञ्चालान्सपरीवाराञ्जघ्नुर्द्रौणिपुरोगमाः ||१८१||` | "Slaughtered the sleeping, unsuspecting Panchalas with their attendants at night, led by Droni [Ashvatthama]. ||181||" |
| `Line 1264: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1265: यत्रामुच्यन्त पार्थास्ते पञ्च कृष्णबलाश्रयात् |` | "Where those five Parthas [Pandavas] were saved through Krishna's protection," |
| `Line 1266: सात्यकिश्च महेष्वासः शेषाश्च निधनं गताः ||१८२||` | "While Satyaki, the great archer, and the rest met their death. ||182||" |
| `Line 1267: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1268: द्रौपदी पुत्रशोकार्ता पितृभ्रातृवधार्दिता |` | "Where Draupadi, afflicted with grief for her sons, distressed by the slaughter of her father and brothers," |
| `Line 1269: कृतानशनसङ्कल्पा यत्र भर्तृनुपाविशत् ||१८३||` | "Having resolved to fast unto death, approached her husbands. ||183||" |
| `Line 1270: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1271: द्रौपदीवचनाद्यत्र भीमो भीमपराक्रमः |` | "Where, at Draupadi's words, Bhima of terrible prowess," |
| `Line 1272: अन्वधावत सङ्क्रुद्धो भारद्वाजं गुरोः सुतम् ||१८४||` | "Pursued in great anger Bharadvaja's son [Ashvatthama], the son of his guru. ||184||" |
| `Line 1273: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1274: भीमसेनभयाद्यत्र दैवेनाभिप्रचोदितः |` | "Where, out of fear of Bhimasena and impelled by fate," |
| `Line 1275: अपाण्डवायेति रुषा द्रौणिरस्त्रमवासृजत् ||१८५||` | "Droni [Ashvatthama] in anger released his weapon with the intent 'for the destruction of the Pandavas.' ||185||" |

| `Line 126: यदिदं दृश्यते किञ्चिद्भूतं स्थावरजङ्गमम् |` | "Whatever is seen here, any being, immovable or movable," |
| `Line 127: पुनः सङ्क्षिप्यते सर्वं जगत्प्राप्ते युगक्षये ||३६||` | "All is dissolved again, the entire world, when the end of the yuga [cosmic age] arrives. ||36||" |
| `Line 128: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 129: यथर्तावृतुलिङ्गानि नानारूपाणि पर्यये |` | "Just as the characteristics of seasons, of various forms, in their cycle," |
| `Line 130: दृश्यन्ते तानि तान्येव तथा भावा युगादिषु ||३७||` | "Are seen as the very same ones repeatedly, so are the states of existence at the beginning of each yuga [cosmic age]. ||37||" |
| `Line 131: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 132: एवमेतदनाद्यन्तं भूतसंहारकारकम् |` | "Thus this, without beginning or end, causing the dissolution of beings," |
| `Line 133: अनादिनिधनं लोके चक्रं सम्परिवर्तते ||३८||` | "The wheel [of time] without beginning or end revolves in the world. ||38||" |
| `Line 134: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 135: त्रयस्त्रिंशत्सहस्राणि त्रयस्त्रिंशच्छतानि च |` | "Thirty-three thousand, thirty-three hundred, and" |
| `Line 136: त्रयस्त्रिंशच्च देवानां सृष्टिः सङ्क्षेपलक्षणा ||३९||` | "Thirty-three gods - this is the creation in brief description. ||39||" |
| `Line 137: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 138: दिवस्पुत्रो बृहद्भानुश्चक्षुरात्मा विभावसुः |` | "The son of heaven, Brihadbhānu, Chakshuratma, Vibhāvasu [sun deity]," |
| `Line 139: सविता च ऋचीकोऽर्को भानुराशावहो रविः ||४०||` | "Savitā, Ṛchīka, Arka, Bhānu, Āśāvaha, Ravi [all solar deities]. ||40||" |
| `Line 140: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 141: पुत्रा विवस्वतः सर्वे मह्यस्तेषां तथावरः |` | "All are sons of Vivasvat [sun god], and Mahya is the youngest among them," |
| `Line 142: देवभ्राट्तनयस्तस्य तस्मात्सुभ्राडिति स्मृतः ||४१||` | "Devabhrāṭ's son was his, therefore he is known as Subhrāḍ. ||41||" |
| `Line 143: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 144: सुभ्राजस्तु त्रयः पुत्राः प्रजावन्तो बहुश्रुताः |` | "Subhrāja had three sons, prolific and highly learned," |
| `Line 145: दशज्योतिः शतज्योतिः सहस्रज्योतिरात्मवान् ||४२||` | "Daśajyoti, Śatajyoti, and the noble Sahasrajyoti. ||42||" |
| `Line 146: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 147: दश पुत्रसहस्राणि दशज्योतेर्महात्मनः |` | "Ten thousand sons were born to the great-souled Daśajyoti," |
| `Line 148: ततो दशगुणाश्चान्ये शतज्योतेरिहात्मजाः ||४३||` | "And ten times that number were the sons of Śatajyoti here. ||43||" |
| `Line 149: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 150: भूयस्ततो दशगुणाः सहस्रज्योतिषः सुताः |` | "And ten times more than that were the sons of Sahasrajyoti," |
translations: | `Line 126: यदिदं दृश्यते किञ्चिद्भूतं स्थावरजङ्गमम् |` | "Whatever is seen here, any being, immovable or movable," |
| `Line 127: पुनः सङ्क्षिप्यते सर्वं जगत्प्राप्ते युगक्षये ||३६||` | "All is dissolved again, the entire world, when the end of the yuga [cosmic age] arrives. ||36||" |
| `Line 128: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 129: यथर्तावृतुलिङ्गानि नानारूपाणि पर्यये |` | "Just as the characteristics of seasons, of various forms, in their cycle," |
| `Line 130: दृश्यन्ते तानि तान्येव तथा भावा युगादिषु ||३७||` | "Are seen as the very same ones repeatedly, so are the states of existence at the beginning of each yuga [cosmic age]. ||37||" |
| `Line 131: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 132: एवमेतदनाद्यन्तं भूतसंहारकारकम् |` | "Thus this, without beginning or end, causing the dissolution of beings," |
| `Line 133: अनादिनिधनं लोके चक्रं सम्परिवर्तते ||३८||` | "The wheel [of time] without beginning or end revolves in the world. ||38||" |
| `Line 134: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 135: त्रयस्त्रिंशत्सहस्राणि त्रयस्त्रिंशच्छतानि च |` | "Thirty-three thousand, thirty-three hundred, and" |
| `Line 136: त्रयस्त्रिंशच्च देवानां सृष्टिः सङ्क्षेपलक्षणा ||३९||` | "Thirty-three gods - this is the creation in brief description. ||39||" |
| `Line 137: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 138: दिवस्पुत्रो बृहद्भानुश्चक्षुरात्मा विभावसुः |` | "The son of heaven, Brihadbhānu, Chakshuratma, Vibhāvasu [sun deity]," |
| `Line 139: सविता च ऋचीकोऽर्को भानुराशावहो रविः ||४०||` | "Savitā, Ṛchīka, Arka, Bhānu, Āśāvaha, Ravi [all solar deities]. ||40||" |
| `Line 140: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 141: पुत्रा विवस्वतः सर्वे मह्यस्तेषां तथावरः |` | "All are sons of Vivasvat [sun god], and Mahya is the youngest among them," |
| `Line 142: देवभ्राट्तनयस्तस्य तस्मात्सुभ्राडिति स्मृतः ||४१||` | "Devabhrāṭ's son was his, therefore he is known as Subhrāḍ. ||41||" |
| `Line 143: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 144: सुभ्राजस्तु त्रयः पुत्राः प्रजावन्तो बहुश्रुताः |` | "Subhrāja had three sons, prolific and highly learned," |
| `Line 145: दशज्योतिः शतज्योतिः सहस्रज्योतिरात्मवान् ||४२||` | "Daśajyoti, Śatajyoti, and the noble Sahasrajyoti. ||42||" |
| `Line 146: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 147: दश पुत्रसहस्राणि दशज्योतेर्महात्मनः |` | "Ten thousand sons were born to the great-souled Daśajyoti," |
| `Line 148: ततो दशगुणाश्चान्ये शतज्योतेरिहात्मजाः ||४३||` | "And ten times that number were the sons of Śatajyoti here. ||43||" |
| `Line 149: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 150: भूयस्ततो दशगुणाः सहस्रज्योतिषः सुताः |` | "And ten times more than that were the sons of Sahasrajyoti," |

| `Line 1276: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1277: मैवमित्यब्रवीत्कृष्णः शमयंस्तस्य तद्वचः |` | "Krishna spoke, 'Not so,' pacifying his words," |
| `Line 1278: यत्रास्त्रमस्त्रेण च तच्छमयामास फाल्गुनः ||१८६||` | "Where Phalguna [Arjuna] neutralized that weapon with another weapon. ||186||" |
| `Line 1279: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1280: द्रौणिद्वैपायनादीनां शापाश्चान्योन्यकारिताः |` | "The curses exchanged between Droni [Ashvatthama], Dvaipayana [Vyasa] and others," |
| `Line 1281: तोयकर्मणि सर्वेषां राज्ञामुदकदानिके ||१८७||` | "During the water ritual, the offering of water to all the kings. ||187||" |
| `Line 1282: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1283: गूढोत्पन्नस्य चाख्यानं कर्णस्य पृथयात्मनः |` | "And the account of the secretly born Karna, the son of Pritha [Kunti]," |
| `Line 1284: सुतस्यैतदिह प्रोक्तं दशमं पर्व सौप्तिकम् ||१८८||` | "This is declared here as the tenth Parva [book section], the Sauptika [sleeping warriors]. ||188||" |
| `Line 1285: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1286: अष्टादशास्मिन्नध्यायाः पर्वण्युक्ता महात्मना |` | "Eighteen chapters in this Parva have been narrated by the great soul," |
| `Line 1287: श्लोकाग्रमत्र कथितं शतान्यष्टौ तथैव च ||१८९||` | "The number of verses stated here are eight hundred as well. ||189||" |
| `Line 1288: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1289: श्लोकाश्च सप्ततिः प्रोक्ता यथावदभिसङ्ख्यया |` | "And seventy verses are declared according to the proper count," |
| `Line 1290: सौप्तिकैषीकसम्बन्धे पर्वण्यमितबुद्धिना ||१९०||` | "In the Parva related to Sauptika and Aishika [arrow section], by the one of boundless intellect. ||190||" |
| `Line 1291: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1292: अत ऊर्ध्वमिदं प्राहुः स्त्रीपर्व करुणोदयम् |` | "After this, they call the Stri Parva [women's book], the rise of compassion," |
| `Line 1293: विलापो वीरपत्नीनां यत्रातिकरुणः स्मृतः ||१९१||` | "Where the extremely sorrowful lamentations of the heroes' wives are remembered. ||191||" |
| `Line 1294: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1295: क्रोधावेशः प्रसादश्च गान्धारीधृतराष्ट्रयोः ||१९१||` | "The anger and the eventual calm of Gandhari and Dhritarashtra. ||191||" |
| `Line 1296: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1297: यत्र तान्क्षत्रियाञ्शूरान्दिष्टान्ताननिवर्तिनः |` | "Where those brave Kshatriyas [warrior class], who met their destined end without turning back," |
| `Line 1298: पुत्रान्भ्रातृन्पितृंश्चैव ददृशुर्निहतान्रणे ||१९२||` | "Sons, brothers, and fathers they saw slain in battle. ||192||" |
| `Line 1299: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1300: यत्र राजा महाप्राज्ञः सर्वधर्मभृतां वरः |` | "Where the king of great wisdom, the best among all upholders of dharma [righteousness]," |
translations: | `Line 1276: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1277: मैवमित्यब्रवीत्कृष्णः शमयंस्तस्य तद्वचः |` | "Krishna spoke, 'Not so,' pacifying his words," |
| `Line 1278: यत्रास्त्रमस्त्रेण च तच्छमयामास फाल्गुनः ||१८६||` | "Where Phalguna [Arjuna] neutralized that weapon with another weapon. ||186||" |
| `Line 1279: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1280: द्रौणिद्वैपायनादीनां शापाश्चान्योन्यकारिताः |` | "The curses exchanged between Droni [Ashvatthama], Dvaipayana [Vyasa] and others," |
| `Line 1281: तोयकर्मणि सर्वेषां राज्ञामुदकदानिके ||१८७||` | "During the water ritual, the offering of water to all the kings. ||187||" |
| `Line 1282: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1283: गूढोत्पन्नस्य चाख्यानं कर्णस्य पृथयात्मनः |` | "And the account of the secretly born Karna, the son of Pritha [Kunti]," |
| `Line 1284: सुतस्यैतदिह प्रोक्तं दशमं पर्व सौप्तिकम् ||१८८||` | "This is declared here as the tenth Parva [book section], the Sauptika [sleeping warriors]. ||188||" |
| `Line 1285: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1286: अष्टादशास्मिन्नध्यायाः पर्वण्युक्ता महात्मना |` | "Eighteen chapters in this Parva have been narrated by the great soul," |
| `Line 1287: श्लोकाग्रमत्र कथितं शतान्यष्टौ तथैव च ||१८९||` | "The number of verses stated here are eight hundred as well. ||189||" |
| `Line 1288: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1289: श्लोकाश्च सप्ततिः प्रोक्ता यथावदभिसङ्ख्यया |` | "And seventy verses are declared according to the proper count," |
| `Line 1290: सौप्तिकैषीकसम्बन्धे पर्वण्यमितबुद्धिना ||१९०||` | "In the Parva related to Sauptika and Aishika [arrow section], by the one of boundless intellect. ||190||" |
| `Line 1291: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1292: अत ऊर्ध्वमिदं प्राहुः स्त्रीपर्व करुणोदयम् |` | "After this, they call the Stri Parva [women's book], the rise of compassion," |
| `Line 1293: विलापो वीरपत्नीनां यत्रातिकरुणः स्मृतः ||१९१||` | "Where the extremely sorrowful lamentations of the heroes' wives are remembered. ||191||" |
| `Line 1294: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1295: क्रोधावेशः प्रसादश्च गान्धारीधृतराष्ट्रयोः ||१९१||` | "The anger and the eventual calm of Gandhari and Dhritarashtra. ||191||" |
| `Line 1296: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1297: यत्र तान्क्षत्रियाञ्शूरान्दिष्टान्ताननिवर्तिनः |` | "Where those brave Kshatriyas [warrior class], who met their destined end without turning back," |
| `Line 1298: पुत्रान्भ्रातृन्पितृंश्चैव ददृशुर्निहतान्रणे ||१९२||` | "Sons, brothers, and fathers they saw slain in battle. ||192||" |
| `Line 1299: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1300: यत्र राजा महाप्राज्ञः सर्वधर्मभृतां वरः |` | "Where the king of great wisdom, the best among all upholders of dharma [righteousness]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1301: राज्ञां तानि शरीराणि दाहयामास शास्त्रतः ||१९३||` | "He caused the bodies of those kings to be cremated according to the scriptures. ||193||" |
| `Line 1302: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1303: एतदेकादशं प्रोक्तं पर्वातिकरुणं महत् |` | "This has been declared as the eleventh Parva [section], extremely sorrowful and great." |
| `Line 1304: सप्तविंशतिरध्यायाः पर्वण्यस्मिन्नुदाहृताः ||१९४||` | "Twenty-seven chapters are enumerated in this Parva [section]. ||194||" |
| `Line 1305: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1306: श्लोकाः सप्तशतं चात्र पञ्चसप्ततिरुच्यते |` | "Seven hundred and seventy-five verses are said to be here," |
| `Line 1307: सङ्ख्यया भारताख्यानं कर्त्रा ह्यत्र महात्मना ||१९५||` | "By count in the Bharata narrative, composed here by the great-souled author. ||195||" |
| `Line 1308: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1309: प्रणीतं सज्जनमनोवैक्लव्याश्रुप्रवर्तकम् ||१९५||` | "Composed to bring forth tears of distress in the minds of good people. ||195||" |
| `Line 1310: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1311: अतः परं शान्तिपर्व द्वादशं बुद्धिवर्धनम् |` | "After this comes the Shanti Parva [Peace section], the twelfth, which increases wisdom," |
| `Line 1312: यत्र निर्वेदमापन्नो धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः ||१९६||` | "Where Dharmaraja [righteous king] Yudhishthira fell into despondency. ||196||" |
| `Line 1313: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1314: घातयित्वा पितृन्भ्रातृन्पुत्रान्सम्बन्धिबान्धवान् ||१९६||` | "After causing the slaughter of fathers, brothers, sons, relatives and kinsmen. ||196||" |
| `Line 1315: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1316: शान्तिपर्वणि धर्माश्च व्याख्याताः शरतल्पिकाः |` | "In the Shanti Parva [Peace section], the duties are explained to the one lying on the arrow-bed [Bhishma]," |
| `Line 1317: राजभिर्वेदितव्या ये सम्यङ्नयबुभुत्सुभिः ||१९७||` | "Which should be known by kings who properly desire to understand statecraft. ||197||" |
| `Line 1318: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1319: आपद्धर्माश्च तत्रैव कालहेतुप्रदर्शकाः |` | "And there also are the duties for times of distress, showing the causes of time [circumstances]," |
| `Line 1320: यान्बुद्ध्वा पुरुषः सम्यक्सर्वज्ञत्वमवाप्नुयात् ||१९८||` | "Understanding which, a person may properly attain omniscience. ||198||" |
| `Line 1321: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1322: मोक्षधर्माश्च कथिता विचित्रा बहुविस्तराः ||१९८||` | "And the duties relating to liberation are narrated, varied and extensive. ||198||" |
| `Line 1323: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1324: द्वादशं पर्व निर्दिष्टमेतत्प्राज्ञजनप्रियम् |` | "This twelfth Parva [section] is designated as dear to wise people," |
| `Line 1325: पर्वण्यत्र परिज्ञेयमध्यायानां शतत्रयम् ||१९९||` | "In this Parva [section], three hundred chapters are to be known. ||199||" |
translations: | `Line 1301: राज्ञां तानि शरीराणि दाहयामास शास्त्रतः ||१९३||` | "He caused the bodies of those kings to be cremated according to the scriptures. ||193||" |
| `Line 1302: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1303: एतदेकादशं प्रोक्तं पर्वातिकरुणं महत् |` | "This has been declared as the eleventh Parva [section], extremely sorrowful and great." |
| `Line 1304: सप्तविंशतिरध्यायाः पर्वण्यस्मिन्नुदाहृताः ||१९४||` | "Twenty-seven chapters are enumerated in this Parva [section]. ||194||" |

| `Line 1307: सङ्ख्यया भारताख्यानं कर्त्रा ह्यत्र महात्मना ||१९५||` | "By count in the Bharata narrative, composed here by the great-souled author. ||195||" |
| `Line 1308: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1309: प्रणीतं सज्जनमनोवैक्लव्याश्रुप्रवर्तकम् ||१९५||` | "Composed to bring forth tears of distress in the minds of good people. ||195||" |
| `Line 1310: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1311: अतः परं शान्तिपर्व द्वादशं बुद्धिवर्धनम् |` | "After this comes the Shanti Parva [Peace section], the twelfth, which increases wisdom," |
| `Line 1312: यत्र निर्वेदमापन्नो धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः ||१९६||` | "Where Dharmaraja [righteous king] Yudhishthira fell into despondency. ||196||" |
| `Line 1313: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1314: घातयित्वा पितृन्भ्रातृन्पुत्रान्सम्बन्धिबान्धवान् ||१९६||` | "After causing the slaughter of fathers, brothers, sons, relatives and kinsmen. ||196||" |
| `Line 1315: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1316: शान्तिपर्वणि धर्माश्च व्याख्याताः शरतल्पिकाः |` | "In the Shanti Parva [Peace section], the duties are explained to the one lying on the arrow-bed [Bhishma]," |
| `Line 1317: राजभिर्वेदितव्या ये सम्यङ्नयबुभुत्सुभिः ||१९७||` | "Which should be known by kings who properly desire to understand statecraft. ||197||" |
| `Line 1318: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1319: आपद्धर्माश्च तत्रैव कालहेतुप्रदर्शकाः |` | "And there also are the duties for times of distress, showing the causes of time [circumstances]," |
| `Line 1320: यान्बुद्ध्वा पुरुषः सम्यक्सर्वज्ञत्वमवाप्नुयात् ||१९८||` | "Understanding which, a person may properly attain omniscience. ||198||" |
| `Line 1321: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1322: मोक्षधर्माश्च कथिता विचित्रा बहुविस्तराः ||१९८||` | "And the duties relating to liberation are narrated, varied and extensive. ||198||" |
| `Line 1323: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1324: द्वादशं पर्व निर्दिष्टमेतत्प्राज्ञजनप्रियम् |` | "This twelfth Parva [section] is designated as dear to wise people," |
| `Line 1325: पर्वण्यत्र परिज्ञेयमध्यायानां शतत्रयम् ||१९९||` | "In this Parva [section], three hundred chapters are to be known. ||199||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1326:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1327: त्रिंशच्चैव तथाध्याया नव चैव तपोधनाः ||१९९||` | "Thirty-nine chapters, O ascetics [wealth in penance] ॥199॥" |
| `Line 1328:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1329: श्लोकानां तु सहस्राणि कीर्तितानि चतुर्दश |` | "Fourteen thousand verses are declared," |
| `Line 1330: पञ्च चैव शतान्याहुः पञ्चविंशतिसङ्ख्यया ||२००||` | "And five hundred and twenty-five verses they proclaim ॥200॥" |
| `Line 1331:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1332: अत ऊर्ध्वं तु विज्ञेयमानुशासनमुत्तमम् |` | "After this should be known the excellent Anushasana [Instruction section]," |
| `Line 1333: यत्र प्रकृतिमापन्नः श्रुत्वा धर्मविनिश्चयम् ||२०१||` | "Where, having regained his natural state after hearing the definitive discourse on dharma [righteousness] ॥201॥" |
| `Line 1334:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1335: भीष्माद्भागीरथीपुत्रात्कुरुराजो युधिष्ठिरः ||२०१||` | "From Bhishma, son of Ganga [Bhagirathi's son], did King Yudhishthira of the Kurus ॥201॥" |
| `Line 1336:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1337: व्यवहारोऽत्र कार्त्स्न्येन धर्मार्थीयो निदर्शितः |` | "Herein is completely illustrated the conduct pertaining to dharma and artha [righteousness and prosperity]," |
| `Line 1338: विविधानां च दानानां फलयोगाः पृथग्विधाः ||२०२||` | "And the various fruits and connections of different kinds of charity ॥202॥" |
| `Line 1339:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1340: तथा पात्रविशेषाश्च दानानां च परो विधिः |` | "Also the special recipients and the supreme method of giving charity," |
| `Line 1341: आचारविधियोगश्च सत्यस्य च परा गतिः ||२०३||` | "And the connection with rules of conduct, and the supreme goal of truth ॥203॥" |
| `Line 1342:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1343: एतत्सुबहुवृत्तान्तमुत्तमं चानुशासनम् |` | "This Anushasana [Instruction section] contains many narratives and is excellent," |
| `Line 1344: भीष्मस्यात्रैव सम्प्राप्तिः स्वर्गस्य परिकीर्तिता ||२०४||` | "Herein is also described Bhishma's attainment of heaven [svarga] ॥204॥" |
| `Line 1345:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1346: एतत्त्रयोदशं पर्व धर्मनिश्चयकारकम् |` | "This is the thirteenth Parva [section], which establishes the certainty of dharma [righteousness]," |
| `Line 1347: अध्यायानां शतं चात्र षट्चत्वारिंशदेव च ||२०५||` | "And here are one hundred and forty-six chapters ॥205॥" |
| `Line 1348:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1349: श्लोकानां तु सहस्राणि षट्सप्तैव शतानि च ||२०५||` | "And six thousand and seven hundred verses ॥205॥" |
| `Line 1350:` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1351: ततोऽश्वमेधिकं नाम पर्व प्रोक्तं चतुर्दशम् |` | "Then the fourteenth Parva [section] called Ashvamedha [Horse Sacrifice] is declared," |
| `Line 1352: तत्संवर्तमरुत्तीयं यत्राख्यानमनुत्तमम् ||२०६||` | "Where the excellent narrative of Samvarta and Marutta is told ॥206॥" |
| `Line 1353:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1354: सुवर्णकोशसम्प्राप्तिर्जन्म चोक्तं परिक्षितः |` | "The acquisition of the gold treasury and the birth of Parikshit [Abhimanyu's son] are narrated," |
| `Line 1355: दग्धस्यास्त्राग्निना पूर्वं कृष्णात्सञ्जीवनं पुनः ||२०७||` | "Who was previously burnt by the weapon-fire and then revived by Krishna ॥207॥" |
| `Line 1356:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1357: चर्यायां हयमुत्सृष्टं पाण्डवस्यानुगच्छतः |` | "The horse released for the ritual, followed by the Pandava [Arjuna]," |
| `Line 1358: तत्र तत्र च युद्धानि राजपुत्रैरमर्षणैः ||२०८||` | "And battles here and there with wrathful princes ॥208॥" |
| `Line 1359:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1360: चित्राङ्गदायाः पुत्रेण पुत्रिकाया धनञ्जयः |` | "Dhananjaya [Arjuna] with the son of Chitrangada [Manipur princess], his putrika-putra [son of daughter]," |
| `Line 1361: सङ्ग्रामे बभ्रुवाहेन संशयं चात्र दर्शितः ||२०९||` | "Is shown in a perilous situation in battle with Babhruvahana ॥209॥" |
| `Line 1362:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1363: अश्वमेधे महायज्ञे नकुलाख्यानमेव च ||२०९||` | "And also the story of Nakula in the great sacrifice of Ashvamedha ॥209॥" |
| `Line 1364:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1365: इत्याश्वमेधिकं पर्व प्रोक्तमेतन्महाद्भुतम् |` | "Thus is described this most wonderful Ashvamedha Parva," |
| `Line 1366: अत्राध्यायशतं त्रिंशत्त्रयोऽध्यायाश्च शब्दिताः ||२१०||` | "Here one hundred and thirty-three chapters are enumerated ॥210॥" |
| `Line 1367:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1368: त्रीणि श्लोकसहस्राणि तावन्त्येव शतानि च |` | "Three thousand verses and as many hundreds," |
| `Line 1369: विंशतिश्च तथा श्लोकाः सङ्ख्यातास्तत्त्वदर्शिना ||२११||` | "And twenty verses are counted by the knower of truth [Vyasa] ॥211॥" |
| `Line 1370:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1371: तत आश्रमवासाक्यं पर्व पञ्चदशं स्मृतम् |` | "Then the fifteenth Parva called Ashramavasa [Forest Dwelling] is remembered," |
| `Line 1372: यत्र राज्यं परित्यज्य गान्धारीसहितो नृपः ||२१२||` | "Where, abandoning the kingdom, the king [Dhritarashtra] with Gandhari ॥212॥" |
| `Line 1373:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1374: धृतराष्ट्राश्रमपदं विदुरश्च जगाम ह ||२१२||` | "And Vidura went to Dhritarashtra's hermitage ॥212॥" |
| `Line 1375:` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 1351: ततोऽश्वमेधिकं नाम पर्व प्रोक्तं चतुर्दशम् |` | "Then the fourteenth Parva [section] called Ashvamedha [Horse Sacrifice] is declared," |
| `Line 1352: तत्संवर्तमरुत्तीयं यत्राख्यानमनुत्तमम् ||२०६||` | "Where the excellent narrative of Samvarta and Marutta is told ॥206॥" |
| `Line 1353:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1354: सुवर्णकोशसम्प्राप्तिर्जन्म चोक्तं परिक्षितः |` | "The acquisition of the gold treasury and the birth of Parikshit [Abhimanyu's son] are narrated," |
| `Line 1355: दग्धस्यास्त्राग्निना पूर्वं कृष्णात्सञ्जीवनं पुनः ||२०७||` | "Who was previously burnt by the weapon-fire and then revived by Krishna ॥207॥" |
| `Line 1356:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1357: चर्यायां हयमुत्सृष्टं पाण्डवस्यानुगच्छतः |` | "The horse released for the ritual, followed by the Pandava [Arjuna]," |
| `Line 1358: तत्र तत्र च युद्धानि राजपुत्रैरमर्षणैः ||२०८||` | "And battles here and there with wrathful princes ॥208॥" |
| `Line 1359:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1360: चित्राङ्गदायाः पुत्रेण पुत्रिकाया धनञ्जयः |` | "Dhananjaya [Arjuna] with the son of Chitrangada [Manipur princess], his putrika-putra [son of daughter]," |
| `Line 1361: सङ्ग्रामे बभ्रुवाहेन संशयं चात्र दर्शितः ||२०९||` | "Is shown in a perilous situation in battle with Babhruvahana ॥209॥" |
| `Line 1362:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1363: अश्वमेधे महायज्ञे नकुलाख्यानमेव च ||२०९||` | "And also the story of Nakula in the great sacrifice of Ashvamedha ॥209॥" |
| `Line 1364:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1365: इत्याश्वमेधिकं पर्व प्रोक्तमेतन्महाद्भुतम् |` | "Thus is described this most wonderful Ashvamedha Parva," |
| `Line 1366: अत्राध्यायशतं त्रिंशत्त्रयोऽध्यायाश्च शब्दिताः ||२१०||` | "Here one hundred and thirty-three chapters are enumerated ॥210॥" |
| `Line 1367:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1368: त्रीणि श्लोकसहस्राणि तावन्त्येव शतानि च |` | "Three thousand verses and as many hundreds," |

| `Line 1370:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1371: तत आश्रमवासाक्यं पर्व पञ्चदशं स्मृतम् |` | "Then the fifteenth Parva called Ashramavasa [Forest Dwelling] is remembered," |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1376: यं दृष्ट्वा प्रस्थितं साध्वी पृथाप्यनुययौ तदा |` | "Seeing him departing, the virtuous Pritha [Kunti] also followed then" |
| `Line 1377: पुत्रराज्यं परित्यज्य गुरुशुश्रूषणे रता ||२१३||` | "Abandoning her sons' kingdom, devoted to serving the elders [Dhritarashtra and Gandhari] ॥213॥" |
| `Line 1378:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1379: यत्र राजा हतान्पुत्रान्पौत्रानन्यांश्च पार्थिवान् |` | "Where the king [Dhritarashtra] saw his slain sons, grandsons, and other rulers" |
| `Line 1380: लोकान्तरगतान्वीरानपश्यत्पुनरागतान् ||२१४||` | "Those heroes who had gone to the other world, returned again [in vision] ॥214॥" |
| `Line 1381:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1382: ऋषेः प्रसादात्कृष्णस्य दृष्ट्वाश्चर्यमनुत्तमम् |` | "By the grace of the sage [Vyasa] and Krishna, having seen that supreme wonder" |
| `Line 1383: त्यक्त्वा शोकं सदारश्च सिद्धिं परमिकां गतः ||२१५||` | "Abandoning grief, he with his wife attained the highest perfection [spiritual liberation] ॥215॥" |
| `Line 1384:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1385: यत्र धर्मं समाश्रित्य विदुरः सुगतिं गतः |` | "Where Vidura, taking refuge in dharma [righteousness], attained a good destination [liberation]" |
| `Line 1386: सञ्जयश्च महामात्रो विद्वान्गावल्गणिर्वशी ||२१६||` | "And Sanjaya, the great minister, the wise son of Gavalgana, the self-controlled one ॥216॥" |
| `Line 1387:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1388: ददर्श नारदं यत्र धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः |` | "Where Dharmaraja [righteous king] Yudhishthira saw Narada" |
| `Line 1389: नारदाच्चैव शुश्राव वृष्णीनां कदनं महत् ||२१७||` | "And from Narada heard of the great destruction of the Vrishnis [Krishna's clan] ॥217॥" |
| `Line 1390:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1391: एतदाश्रमवासाख्यं पूर्वोक्तं सुमहाद्भुतम् |` | "This is the previously mentioned, very wonderful Ashramavasa [forest dwelling] Parva" |
| `Line 1392: द्विचत्वारिंशदध्यायाः पर्वैतदभिसङ्ख्यया ||२१८||` | "This section consists of forty-two chapters by count ॥218॥" |
| `Line 1393:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1394: सहस्रमेकं श्लोकानां पञ्च श्लोकशतानि च |` | "One thousand verses and five hundred verses" |
| `Line 1395: षडेव च तथा श्लोकाः सङ्ख्यातास्तत्त्वदर्शिना ||२१९||` | "And six verses have been counted by the knower of truth [Vyasa] ॥219॥" |
| `Line 1396:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1397: अतः परं निबोधेदं मौसलं पर्व दारुणम् |` | "After this, understand the terrible Mausala [club] Parva" |
| `Line 1398: यत्र ते पुरुषव्याघ्राः शस्त्रस्पर्शसहा युधि ||२२०||` | "Where those tiger-like men [Yadavas], who could withstand the touch of weapons in battle ॥220॥" |
| `Line 1399:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1400: ब्रह्मदण्डविनिष्पिष्टाः समीपे लवणाम्भसः ||२२०||` | "Were crushed by Brahma's rod [curse] near the salt waters [sea] ॥220॥" |
