completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1401:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1402: आपाने पानगलिता दैवेनाभिप्रचोदिताः |` | "Intoxicated at a drinking party, impelled by fate [divine force]," |
| `Line 1403: एरकारूपिभिर्वज्रैर्निजघ्नुरितरेतरम् ||२२१||` | "They slew one another with clubs [vajras] made from eraka grass ॥221॥" |
| `Line 1404:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1405: यत्र सर्वक्षयं कृत्वा तावुभौ रामकेशवौ |` | "Where, after the destruction of all, both Rama and Keshava [Krishna]," |
| `Line 1406: नातिचक्रमतुः कालं प्राप्तं सर्वहरं समम् ||२२२||` | "Did not transgress the appointed time, the universal destroyer [death] that comes to all equally ॥222॥" |
| `Line 1407:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1408: यत्रार्जुनो द्वारवतीमेत्य वृष्णिविनाकृताम् |` | "Where Arjuna, coming to Dwaraka [Krishna's city] bereft of the Vrishnis [Krishna's clan]," |
| `Line 1409: दृष्ट्वा विषादमगमत्परां चार्तिं नरर्षभः ||२२३||` | "Seeing it, fell into despair and extreme grief, that bull among men [heroic person] ॥223॥" |
| `Line 1410:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1411: स सत्कृत्य यदुश्रेष्ठं मातुलं शौरिमात्मनः |` | "He, having performed the last rites for the best of the Yadus [Krishna's clan], his maternal uncle Shauri [Krishna]," |
| `Line 1412: ददर्श यदुवीराणामापाने वैशसं महत् ||२२४||` | "Witnessed the great slaughter of the Yadu heroes at the drinking party ॥224॥" |
| `Line 1413:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1414: शरीरं वासुदेवस्य रामस्य च महात्मनः |` | "The body of Vasudeva [Krishna] and of the great-souled Rama [Balarama]," |
| `Line 1415: संस्कारं लम्भयामास वृष्णीनां च प्रधानतः ||२२५||` | "He ensured the funeral rites, especially for the foremost of the Vrishnis ॥225॥" |
| `Line 1416:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1417: स वृद्धबालमादाय द्वारवत्यास्ततो जनम् |` | "Taking the old and young people from Dwaraka," |
| `Line 1418: ददर्शापदि कष्टायां गाण्डीवस्य पराभवम् ||२२६||` | "He witnessed in that terrible calamity the failure of Gandiva [Arjuna's bow] ॥226॥" |
| `Line 1419:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1420: सर्वेषां चैव दिव्यानामस्त्राणामप्रसन्नताम् |` | "And the ineffectiveness of all divine weapons," |
| `Line 1421: नाशं वृष्णिकलत्राणां प्रभावानामनित्यताम् ||२२७||` | "The destruction of the Vrishni women, and the impermanence of powers ॥227॥" |
| `Line 1422:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1423: दृष्ट्वा निर्वेदमापन्नो व्यासवाक्यप्रचोदितः |` | "Seeing this, he became despondent and, prompted by Vyasa's words," |
| `Line 1424: धर्मराजं समासाद्य संन्यासं समरोचयेत् ||२२८||` | "Approaching Dharmaraja [Yudhishthira], he recommended renunciation ॥228॥" |
| `Line 1425:` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 1427: अध्यायाष्टौ समाख्याताः श्लोकानां च शतत्रयम् ||२२९||` | "Eight chapters are enumerated and three hundred verses ॥229॥" |
| `Line 1428:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1429: महाप्रस्थानिकं तस्मादूर्ध्वं सप्तदशं स्मृतम् |` | "After that, the seventeenth is known as Mahaprasthanika [Great Departure section]," |
| `Line 1430: यत्र राज्यं परित्यज्य पाण्डवाः पुरुषर्षभाः ||२३०||` | "Where, abandoning their kingdom, the Pandavas, those bulls among men [eminent heroes] ॥230॥" |
| `Line 1431:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1432: द्रौपद्या सहिता देव्या सिद्धिं परमिकां गताः ||२३०||` | "Together with the divine Draupadi, attained the supreme perfection [final liberation] ॥230॥" |
| `Line 1433:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1434: अत्राध्यायास्त्रयः प्रोक्ताः श्लोकानां च शतं तथा |` | "Here three chapters are declared, and likewise one hundred verses," |
| `Line 1435: विंशतिश्च तथा श्लोकाः सङ्ख्यातास्तत्त्वदर्शिना ||२३१||` | "And twenty verses are counted by the knower of truth [reality-seer] ॥231॥" |
| `Line 1436:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1437: स्वर्गपर्व ततो ज्ञेयं दिव्यं यत्तदमानुषम् |` | "Then should be known the Svarga Parva [Heaven section], which is divine and superhuman," |
| `Line 1438: अध्यायाः पञ्च सङ्ख्याताः पर्वैतदभिसङ्ख्यया ||२३२||` | "Five chapters are enumerated in this section by count ॥232॥" |
| `Line 1439:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1440: श्लोकानां द्वे शते चैव प्रसङ्ख्याते तपोधनाः ||२३२||` | "And two hundred verses are counted, O ascetics [wealth in penance] ॥232॥" |
| `Line 1441:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1442: अष्टादशैवमेतानि पर्वाण्युक्तान्यशेषतः |` | "Thus these eighteen sections have been described completely," |
| `Line 1443: खिलेषु हरिवंशश्च भविष्यच्च प्रकीर्तितम् ||२३३||` | "Among the supplements, the Harivamsha [Hari's lineage] and the Bhavishya [Future events] are proclaimed ॥233॥" |
| `Line 1444:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1445: एतदखिलमाख्यातं भारतं पर्वसङ्ग्रहात् |` | "This entire Bharata has been narrated in the compilation of sections," |
| `Line 1446: अष्टादश समाजग्मुरक्षौहिण्यो युयुत्सया ||२३४||` | "Eighteen akshauhinis [army units] came together with desire to fight ॥234॥" |
| `Line 1447:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1448: तन्महद्दारुणं युद्धमहान्यष्टादशाभवत् ||२३४||` | "That great terrible war lasted for eighteen days ॥234॥" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1451: न चाख्यानमिदं विद्यान्नैव स स्याद्विचक्षणः ||२३५||` | "One who does not know this narrative cannot be considered wise [discerning person] ॥235॥" |
| `Line 1452:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1453: श्रुत्वा त्विदमुपाख्यानं श्राव्यमन्यन्न रोचते |` | "After hearing this narrative, no other worthy story pleases," |
| `Line 1454: पुंस्कोकिलरुतं श्रुत्वा रूक्षा ध्वाङ्क्षस्य वागिव ||२३६||` | "Just as after hearing the male cuckoo's song, the harsh voice of a crow is displeasing ॥236॥" |
| `Line 1455:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1456: इतिहासोत्तमादस्माज्जायन्ते कविबुद्धयः |` | "From this supreme history [itihasa] arise the intellects of poets," |
| `Line 1457: पञ्चभ्य इव भूतेभ्यो लोकसंविधयस्त्रयः ||२३७||` | "Just as from the five elements arise the three worlds [lokas] ॥237॥" |
| `Line 1458:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1459: अस्याख्यानस्य विषये पुराणं वर्तते द्विजाः |` | "O twice-born ones [brahmins], all Puranas [ancient texts] exist within the scope of this narrative," |
| `Line 1460: अन्तरिक्षस्य विषये प्रजा इव चतुर्विधाः ||२३८||` | "Just as the four kinds of beings exist within the realm of the sky ॥238॥" |
| `Line 1461:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1462: क्रियागुणानां सर्वेषामिदमाख्यानमाश्रयः |` | "This narrative is the foundation of all actions and qualities," |
| `Line 1463: इन्द्रियाणां समस्तानां चित्रा इव मनःक्रियाः ||२३९||` | "Just as the mind's activities are the basis for all the senses ॥239॥" |
| `Line 1464:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1465: अनाश्रित्यैतदाख्यानं कथा भुवि न विद्यते |` | "Without relying on this narrative, no story exists on earth," |
| `Line 1466: आहारमनपाश्रित्य शरीरस्येव धारणम् ||२४०||` | "Just as there is no sustenance of the body without food ॥240॥" |
| `Line 1467:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1468: इदं सर्वैः कविवरैराख्यानमुपजीव्यते |` | "This narrative is the source of livelihood for all excellent poets," |
| `Line 1469: उदयप्रेप्सुभिर्भृत्यैरभिजात इवेश्वरः ||२४१||` | "Just as a noble lord is relied upon by servants seeking prosperity ॥241॥" |
| `Line 1470:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1471: द्वैपायनौष्ठपुटनिःसृतमप्रमेयं; पुण्यं पवित्रमथ पापहरं शिवं च |` | "Immeasurable, meritorious, pure, sin-destroying, and auspicious is that which emerged from the lips of Dvaipayana [Vyasa];" |
| `Line 1472: यो भारतं समधिगच्छति वाच्यमानं; किं तस्य पुष्करजलैरभिषेचनेन ||२४२||` | "For one who comprehends the Bharata when it is recited, what need is there for ablution with the waters of Pushkara [sacred lake]? ॥242॥" |
| `Line 1473:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1474: आख्यानं तदिदमनुत्तमं महार्थं; विन्यस्तं महदिह पर्वसङ्ग्रहेण |` | "This unsurpassed narrative of great meaning is arranged here in a collection of major sections [parvas];" |
| `Line 1475: श्रुत्वादौ भवति नृणां सुखावगाहं; विस्तीर्णं लवणजलं यथा प्लवेन ||२४३||` | "At first hearing it becomes easily accessible to men, just as the vast salt ocean becomes navigable with a boat ॥243॥" |

| `Line 1486: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard sage] said:" |

| `Line 1489: जनमेजयः पारिक्षितः सह भ्रातृभिः कुरुक्षेत्रे दीर्घसत्रमुपास्ते |` | "Janamejaya, son of Parikshit, was performing a long sacrifice [dirgha-satra] at Kurukshetra [sacred field] with his brothers." |
| `Line 1490: तस्य भ्रातरस्त्रयः श्रुतसेन उग्रसेनो भीमसेन इति | ००१ |` | "His three brothers were Shrutasena, Ugrasena, and Bhimasena. |001|" |
| `Line 1491: तेषु तत्सत्रमुपासीनेषु तत्र श्वाभ्यागच्छत्सारमेयः |` | "While they were engaged in that sacrifice, a dog [offspring of Sarama] came there." |
| `Line 1492: स जनमेजयस्य भ्रातृभिरभिहतो रोरूयमाणो मातुः समीपमुपागच्छत् | ००२ |` | "Beaten by Janamejaya's brothers, it went whimpering to its mother. |002|" |
| `Line 1493: तं माता रोरूयमाणमुवाच |` | "The mother said to it as it was whimpering:" |
| `Line 1494: किं रोदिषि |` | "Why are you crying?" |
| `Line 1495: केनास्यभिहत इति | ००३ |` | "By whom have you been beaten? |003|" |
| `Line 1496: स एवमुक्तो मातरं प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, it replied to its mother:" |
| `Line 1497: जनमेजयस्य भ्रातृभिरभिहतोऽस्मीति | ००४ |` | "I have been beaten by Janamejaya's brothers. |004|" |
| `Line 1498: तं माता प्रत्युवाच |` | "The mother replied to it:" |
| `Line 1499: व्यक्तं त्वया तत्रापराद्धं येनास्यभिहत इति | ००५ |` | "Clearly you must have committed some offense there, for which you were beaten. |005|" |
| `Line 1500: स तां पुनरुवाच |` | "It said to her again:" |

| `Line 1497: जनमेजयस्य भ्रातृभिरभिहतोऽस्मीति | ००४ |` | "I have been beaten by Janamejaya's brothers. |004|" |
| `Line 1498: तं माता प्रत्युवाच |` | "The mother replied to it:" |
| `Line 1499: व्यक्तं त्वया तत्रापराद्धं येनास्यभिहत इति | ००५ |` | "Clearly you must have committed some offense there, for which you were beaten. |005|" |
| `Line 1500: स तां पुनरुवाच |` | "It said to her again:" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1501: नापराध्यामि किञ्चित् |` | "I have not committed any offense." |
| `Line 1502: नावेक्षे हवींषि नावलिह इति | ००६ |` | "I neither looked at the sacrificial offerings nor licked them. |006|" |
| `Line 1503: तच्छ्रुत्वा तस्य माता सरमा पुत्रशोकार्ता तत्सत्रमुपागच्छद्यत्र स जनमेजयः सह भ्रातृभिर्दीर्घसत्रमुपास्ते | ००७ |` | "Hearing this, his mother Sarama [divine hound], distressed by her son's pain, went to that sacrifice where Janamejaya was performing the long sacrifice with his brothers. |007|" |
| `Line 1504: स तया क्रुद्धया तत्रोक्तः |` | "He was addressed there by her in anger:" |
| `Line 1505: अयं मे पुत्रो न किञ्चिदपराध्यति |` | "This son of mine has committed no offense." |
| `Line 1506: किमर्थमभिहत इति |` | "Why was he beaten?" |
| `Line 1507: यस्माच्चायमभिहतोऽनपकारी तस्माददृष्टं त्वां भयमागमिष्यतीति | ००८ |` | "Since he was beaten though innocent, therefore an unforeseen danger shall come upon you. |008|" |
| `Line 1508: स जनमेजय एवमुक्तो देवशुन्या सरमया दृढं सम्भ्रान्तो विषण्णश्चासीत् | ००९ |` | "Janamejaya, thus addressed by Sarama [divine hound], became deeply disturbed and dejected. |009|" |
| `Line 1509: स तस्मिन्सत्रे समाप्ते हास्तिनपुरं प्रत्येत्य पुरोहितमनुरूपमन्विच्छमानः परं यत्नमकरोद्यो मे पापकृत्यां शमयेदिति | ०१० |` | "After completing that sacrifice, he returned to Hastinapura [elephant city] and made great efforts to find a suitable priest who could absolve him of his sinful deed. |010|" |
| `Line 1510: स कदाचिन्मृगयां यातः पारिक्षितो जनमेजयः कस्मिंश्चित्स्वविषयोद्देशे आश्रममपश्यत् | ०११ |` | "Once, while hunting, Janamejaya, son of Parikshit, saw a hermitage in some region of his kingdom. |011|" |
| `Line 1511: तत्र कश्चिदृषिरासां चक्रे श्रुतश्रवा नाम |` | "There a certain sage named Shrutashrava was residing." |
| `Line 1512: तस्याभिमतः पुत्र आस्ते सोमश्रवा नाम | ०१२ |` | "His beloved son named Somashrava was staying there. |012|" |
| `Line 1513: तस्य तं पुत्रमभिगम्य जनमेजयः पारिक्षितः पौरोहित्याय वव्रे | ०१३ |` | "Approaching that son, Janamejaya, son of Parikshit, requested him to become his priest. |013|" |
| `Line 1514: स नमस्कृत्य तमृषिमुवाच |` | "He, bowing to that sage, said:" |
| `Line 1515: भगवन्नयं तव पुत्रो मम पुरोहितोऽस्त्विति | ०१४ |` | "Venerable one, may this son of yours become my priest. |014|" |
| `Line 1516: स एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, he replied:" |
| `Line 1517: भो जनमेजय पुत्रोऽयं मम सर्प्यां जातः |` | "O Janamejaya, this son of mine was born of a serpent woman [sarpi]." |
| `Line 1518: महातपस्वी स्वाध्यायसम्पन्नो मत्तपोवीर्यसम्भृतो मच्छुक्रं पीतवत्यास्तस्याः कुक्षौ संवृद्धः |` | "He is of great austerity, accomplished in self-study, conceived through my ascetic power, grown in the womb of her who drank my seed." |
| `Line 1519: समर्थोऽयं भवतः सर्वाः पापकृत्याः शमयितुमन्तरेण महादेवकृत्याम् |` | "He is capable of absolving all your sinful deeds, except those against Mahadeva [Shiva]." |
| `Line 1520: अस्य त्वेकमुपांशुव्रतम् |` | "But he has one silent vow:" |
| `Line 1521: यदेनं कश्चिद्ब्राह्मणः कञ्चिदर्थमभियाचेत्तं तस्मै दद्यादयम् |` | "If any Brahmin should ask him for anything, he must give it to him." |
| `Line 1522: यद्येतदुत्सहसे ततो नयस्वैनमिति | ०१५ |` | "If you can endure this, then take him. |015|" |
| `Line 1523: तेनैवमुत्को जनमेजयस्तं प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, Janamejaya replied to him:" |
| `Line 1524: भगवंस्तथा भविष्यतीति | ०१६ |` | "Venerable one, so be it. |016|" |
| `Line 1525: स तं पुरोहितमुपादायोपावृत्तो भ्रातृनुवाच |` | "Taking that priest with him and returning, he said to his brothers:" |
translations: | `Line 1501: नापराध्यामि किञ्चित् |` | "I have not committed any offense." |

| `Line 1508: स जनमेजय एवमुक्तो देवशुन्या सरमया दृढं सम्भ्रान्तो विषण्णश्चासीत् | ००९ |` | "Janamejaya, thus addressed by Sarama [divine hound], became deeply disturbed and dejected. |009|" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 151: तेभ्योऽयं कुरुवंशश्च यदूनां भरतस्य च ||४४||` | "From them arose this lineage of the Kurus, of the Yadus [Krishna's clan], and of Bharata [ancient king]. ||44||" |
| `Line 152: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 153: ययातीक्ष्वाकुवंशश्च राजर्षीणां च सर्वशः |` | "And the lineages of Yayāti [legendary king] and Ikṣvāku [solar dynasty founder], and of all the royal sages [rājarṣis] completely," |
| `Line 154: सम्भूता बहवो वंशा भूतसर्गाः सविस्तराः ||४५||` | "Many lineages arose, and the detailed creation of beings. ||45||" |
| `Line 155: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 156: भूतस्थानानि सर्वाणि रहस्यं त्रिविधं च यत् |` | "All the abodes of beings, and the threefold mysteries [esoteric knowledge]," |
| `Line 157: वेदयोगं सविज्ञानं धर्मोऽर्थः काम एव च ||४६||` | "The application of Vedas with special knowledge, and dharma [righteousness], artha [wealth], and kāma [pleasure] as well. ||46||" |
| `Line 158: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 159: धर्मकामार्थशास्त्राणि शास्त्राणि विविधानि च |` | "The treatises on dharma, kāma, and artha, and various other treatises," |
| `Line 160: लोकयात्राविधानं च सम्भूतं दृष्टवानृषिः ||४७||` | "And the rules for worldly conduct, the sage saw all these manifested. ||47||" |
| `Line 161: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 162: इतिहासाः सवैयाख्या विविधाः श्रुतयोऽपि च |` | "Histories with their explanations, various sacred texts [śrutis] as well," |
| `Line 163: इह सर्वमनुक्रान्तमुक्तं ग्रन्थस्य लक्षणम् ||४८||` | "Here everything is enumerated, thus the characteristics of this work are described. ||48||" |
| `Line 164: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 165: विस्तीर्यैतन्महज्ज्ञानमृषिः सङ्क्षेपमब्रवीत् |` | "Having expanded this great knowledge, the sage spoke it in condensed form," |
| `Line 166: इष्टं हि विदुषां लोके समासव्यासधारणम् ||४९||` | "For in the world of the learned, the grasp of both concise and elaborate forms is desired. ||49||" |
| `Line 167: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 168: मन्वादि भारतं केचिदास्तीकादि तथापरे |` | "Some study the Bharata beginning with Manu [first man], others beginning with Āstīka [serpent sacrifice story]," |
| `Line 169: तथोपरिचराद्यन्ये विप्राः सम्यगधीयते ||५०||` | "And other Brahmins study it properly beginning with Uparicara [King Vasu]. ||50||" |
| `Line 170: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 171: विविधं संहिताज्ञानं दीपयन्ति मनीषिणः |` | "The wise illuminate the diverse knowledge of the Saṃhitās [collections]," |
| `Line 172: व्याख्यातुं कुशलाः केचिद्ग्रन्थं धारयितुं परे ||५१||` | "Some are skilled in explaining, others in memorizing the text. ||51||" |
| `Line 173: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 174: तपसा ब्रह्मचर्येण व्यस्य वेदं सनातनम् |` | "Having divided the eternal Veda through austerity and celibacy," |
| `Line 175: इतिहासमिमं चक्रे पुण्यं सत्यवतीसुतः ||५२||` | "The son of Satyavatī [Vyāsa] created this sacred history. ||52||" |

| `Line 152: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 153: ययातीक्ष्वाकुवंशश्च राजर्षीणां च सर्वशः |` | "And the lineages of Yayāti [legendary king] and Ikṣvāku [solar dynasty founder], and of all the royal sages [rājarṣis] completely," |
| `Line 154: सम्भूता बहवो वंशा भूतसर्गाः सविस्तराः ||४५||` | "Many lineages arose, and the detailed creation of beings. ||45||" |
| `Line 155: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 156: भूतस्थानानि सर्वाणि रहस्यं त्रिविधं च यत् |` | "All the abodes of beings, and the threefold mysteries [esoteric knowledge]," |
| `Line 157: वेदयोगं सविज्ञानं धर्मोऽर्थः काम एव च ||४६||` | "The application of Vedas with special knowledge, and dharma [righteousness], artha [wealth], and kāma [pleasure] as well. ||46||" |
| `Line 158: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 159: धर्मकामार्थशास्त्राणि शास्त्राणि विविधानि च |` | "The treatises on dharma, kāma, and artha, and various other treatises," |
| `Line 160: लोकयात्राविधानं च सम्भूतं दृष्टवानृषिः ||४७||` | "And the rules for worldly conduct, the sage saw all these manifested. ||47||" |
| `Line 161: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 162: इतिहासाः सवैयाख्या विविधाः श्रुतयोऽपि च |` | "Histories with their explanations, various sacred texts [śrutis] as well," |

| `Line 172: व्याख्यातुं कुशलाः केचिद्ग्रन्थं धारयितुं परे ||५१||` | "Some are skilled in explaining, others in memorizing the text. ||51||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1526: मयायं वृत उपाध्यायः |` | "This teacher has been chosen by me." |
| `Line 1527: यदयं ब्रूयात्तत्कार्यमविचारयद्भिरिति | ०१७ |` | "Whatever he says should be done by you without questioning. |017|" |
| `Line 1528: तेनैवमुक्ता भ्रातरस्तस्य तथा चक्रुः |` | "Thus instructed by him, his brothers did accordingly." |
| `Line 1529: स तथा भ्रातृन्संदिश्य तक्षशिलां प्रत्यभिप्रतस्थे |` | "Having thus instructed his brothers, he departed for Takshashila [ancient learning center]." |
| `Line 1530: तं च देशं वशे स्थापयामास | ०१८ |` | "And he brought that region under his control. |018|" |
| `Line 1531: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे कश्चिदृषिर्धौम्यो नामायोदः |` | "During this time, there was a sage named Dhaumya Ayoda [revered teacher]." |
| `Line 1532: तस्य शिष्यास्त्रयो बभूवुरुपमन्युरारुणिर्वेदश्चेति | ०१९ |` | "He had three disciples: Upamanyu, Aruni, and Veda. |019|" |
| `Line 1533: स एकं शिष्यमारुणिं पाञ्चाल्यं प्रेषयामास |` | "He sent one disciple, Aruni of Panchala [region name], saying:" |
| `Line 1534: गच्छ केदारखण्डं बधानेति | ०२० |` | "Go and repair the breach in the field [kedara-khanda]. |020|" |
| `Line 1535: स उपाध्यायेन संदिष्ट आरुणिः पाञ्चाल्यस्तत्र गत्वा तत्केदारखण्डं बद्धुं नाशक्नोत् | ०२१ |` | "Instructed by his teacher, Aruni of Panchala went there but was unable to repair that breach in the field. |021|" |
| `Line 1536: स क्लिश्यमानोऽपश्यदुपायम् |` | "Struggling, he saw a solution." |
| `Line 1537: भवत्वेवं करिष्यामीति | ०२२ |` | "Let it be so, I will do this," he thought. |022|" |
| `Line 1538: स तत्र संविवेश केदारखण्डे |` | "He lay down in the breach of the field." |
| `Line 1539: शयाने तस्मिंस्तदुदकं तस्थौ | ०२३ |` | "As he lay there, the water stopped flowing. |023|" |
| `Line 1540: ततः कदाचिदुपाध्याय आयोदो धौम्यः शिष्यानपृच्छत् |` | "Then, after some time, the teacher Dhaumya Ayoda asked his disciples:" |
| `Line 1541: क्व आरुणिः पाञ्चाल्यो गत इति | ०२४ |` | "Where has Aruni of Panchala gone? |024|" |
| `Line 1542: ते प्रत्यूचुः |` | "They replied:" |
| `Line 1543: भगवतैव प्रेषितो गच्छ केदारखण्डं बधानेति | ०२५ |` | "He was sent by your reverence yourself, saying 'Go and repair the breach in the field.' |025|" |
| `Line 1544: स एवमुक्तस्ताञ्शिष्यान्प्रत्युवाच |` | "Having heard this, he said to those disciples:" |
| `Line 1545: तस्मात्सर्वे तत्र गच्छामो यत्र स इति | ०२६ |` | "Therefore, let us all go where he is. |026|" |
| `Line 1546: स तत्र गत्वा तस्याह्वानाय शब्दं चकार |` | "Having gone there, he called out to him:" |
| `Line 1547: भो आरुणे पाञ्चाल्य क्वासि |` | "O Aruni of Panchala, where are you?" |
| `Line 1548: वत्सैहीति | ०२७ |` | "Come here, my child! |027|" |
| `Line 1549: स तच्छ्रुत्वा आरुणिरुपाध्यायवाक्यं तस्मात्केदारखण्डात्सहसोत्थाय तमुपाध्यायमुपतस्थे |` | "Hearing those words of his teacher, Aruni suddenly rose up from that breach in the field and approached his teacher." |
| `Line 1550: प्रोवाच चैनम् |` | "And he said to him:" |
translations: | `Line 1526: मयायं वृत उपाध्यायः |` | "This teacher has been chosen by me." |
| `Line 1527: यदयं ब्रूयात्तत्कार्यमविचारयद्भिरिति | ०१७ |` | "Whatever he says should be done by you without questioning. |017|" |
| `Line 1528: तेनैवमुक्ता भ्रातरस्तस्य तथा चक्रुः |` | "Thus instructed by him, his brothers did accordingly." |
| `Line 1529: स तथा भ्रातृन्संदिश्य तक्षशिलां प्रत्यभिप्रतस्थे |` | "Having thus instructed his brothers, he departed for Takshashila [ancient learning center]." |
| `Line 1530: तं च देशं वशे स्थापयामास | ०१८ |` | "And he brought that region under his control. |018|" |
| `Line 1531: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे कश्चिदृषिर्धौम्यो नामायोदः |` | "During this time, there was a sage named Dhaumya Ayoda [revered teacher]." |
| `Line 1532: तस्य शिष्यास्त्रयो बभूवुरुपमन्युरारुणिर्वेदश्चेति | ०१९ |` | "He had three disciples: Upamanyu, Aruni, and Veda. |019|" |
| `Line 1533: स एकं शिष्यमारुणिं पाञ्चाल्यं प्रेषयामास |` | "He sent one disciple, Aruni of Panchala [region name], saying:" |
| `Line 1534: गच्छ केदारखण्डं बधानेति | ०२० |` | "Go and repair the breach in the field [kedara-khanda]. |020|" |

| `Line 1535: स उपाध्यायेन संदिष्ट आरुणिः पाञ्चाल्यस्तत्र गत्वा तत्केदारखण्डं बद्धुं नाशक्नोत् | ०२१ |` | "Instructed by his teacher, Aruni of Panchala went there but was unable to repair that breach in the field. |021|" |
| `Line 1536: स क्लिश्यमानोऽपश्यदुपायम् |` | "Struggling, he saw a solution." |
| `Line 1537: भवत्वेवं करिष्यामीति | ०२२ |` | "Let it be so, I will do this," he thought. |022|" |
| `Line 1538: स तत्र संविवेश केदारखण्डे |` | "He lay down in the breach of the field." |
| `Line 1539: शयाने तस्मिंस्तदुदकं तस्थौ | ०२३ |` | "As he lay there, the water stopped flowing. |023|" |
| `Line 1540: ततः कदाचिदुपाध्याय आयोदो धौम्यः शिष्यानपृच्छत् |` | "Then, after some time, the teacher Dhaumya Ayoda asked his disciples:" |
| `Line 1541: क्व आरुणिः पाञ्चाल्यो गत इति | ०२४ |` | "Where has Aruni of Panchala gone? |024|" |
| `Line 1542: ते प्रत्यूचुः |` | "They replied:" |
| `Line 1543: भगवतैव प्रेषितो गच्छ केदारखण्डं बधानेति | ०२५ |` | "He was sent by your reverence yourself, saying 'Go and repair the breach in the field.' |025|" |
| `Line 1544: स एवमुक्तस्ताञ्शिष्यान्प्रत्युवाच |` | "Having heard this, he said to those disciples:" |
| `Line 1545: तस्मात्सर्वे तत्र गच्छामो यत्र स इति | ०२६ |` | "Therefore, let us all go where he is. |026|" |
| `Line 1546: स तत्र गत्वा तस्याह्वानाय शब्दं चकार |` | "Having gone there, he called out to him:" |
| `Line 1547: भो आरुणे पाञ्चाल्य क्वासि |` | "O Aruni of Panchala, where are you?" |
| `Line 1548: वत्सैहीति | ०२७ |` | "Come here, my child! |027|" |

| `Line 1549: स तच्छ्रुत्वा आरुणिरुपाध्यायवाक्यं तस्मात्केदारखण्डात्सहसोत्थाय तमुपाध्यायमुपतस्थे |` | "Hearing those words of his teacher, Aruni suddenly rose up from that breach in the field and approached his teacher." |
| `Line 1550: प्रोवाच चैनम् |` | "And he said to him:" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1551: अयमस्म्यत्र केदारखण्डे निःसरमाणमुदकमवारणीयं संरोद्धुं संविष्टो भगवच्छब्दं श्रुत्वैव सहसा विदार्य केदारखण्डं भवन्तमुपस्थितः |` | "Here I am, seated in this field section to stop the unstoppable flowing water, when upon hearing the venerable word, I suddenly broke through the field embankment and came before you." |
| `Line 1552: तदभिवादये भगवन्तम् |` | "Therefore, I pay my respects to you, venerable one." |
| `Line 1553: आज्ञापयतु भवान् |` | "Please command me, sir." |
| `Line 1554: किं करवाणीति | ०२८ |` | "What shall I do? |028|" |
| `Line 1555: तमुपाध्यायोऽब्रवीत् |` | "The teacher [upādhyāya] said to him:" |
| `Line 1556: यस्माद्भवान्केदारखण्डमवदार्योत्थितस्तस्माद्भवानुद्दालक एव नाम्ना भविष्यतीति | ०२९ |` | "Since you have risen by breaking through the field embankment, therefore you shall be known by the name Uddālaka [one who breaks through]. |029|" |
| `Line 1557: स उपाध्यायेनानुगृहीतः |` | "He was blessed by the teacher:" |
| `Line 1558: यस्मात्त्वया मद्वचोऽनुष्ठितं तस्माच्छ्रेयोऽवाप्स्यसीति |` | "Since you have followed my instruction, therefore you shall attain excellence." |
| `Line 1559: सर्वे च ते वेदाः प्रतिभास्यन्ति सर्वाणि च धर्मशास्त्राणीति | ०३० |` | "And all the Vedas [sacred texts] and all the treatises on dharma [righteousness] will become clear to you. |030|" |
| `Line 1560: स एवमुक्त उपाध्यायेनेष्टं देशं जगाम | ०३१ |` | "Having been thus addressed by the teacher, he went to his desired place. |031|" |
| `Line 1561: अथापरः शिष्यस्तस्यैवायोदस्य धौम्यस्योपमन्युर्नाम | ०३२ |` | "Now, another student of that same Āyoda Dhaumya was named Upamanyu. |032|" |
| `Line 1562: तमुपाध्यायः प्रेषयामास |` | "The teacher sent him:" |
| `Line 1563: वत्सोपमन्यो गा रक्षस्वेति | ०३३ |` | "Child Upamanyu, tend the cows. |033|" |
| `Line 1564: स उपाध्यायवचनादरक्षद्गाः |` | "Following the teacher's instruction, he tended the cows." |
| `Line 1565: स चाहनि गा रक्षित्वा दिवसक्षयेऽभ्यागम्योपाध्यायस्याग्रतः स्थित्वा नमश्चक्रे | ०३४ |` | "And after tending the cows during the day, at sunset he returned, stood before his teacher, and paid his respects. |034|" |
| `Line 1566: तमुपाध्यायः पीवानमपश्यत् |` | "The teacher saw that he was well-nourished." |
| `Line 1567: उवाच चैनम् |` | "And said to him:" |
| `Line 1568: वत्सोपमन्यो केन वृत्तिं कल्पयसि |` | "Child Upamanyu, how do you sustain yourself?" |
| `Line 1569: पीवानसि दृढमिति | ०३५ |` | "You are certainly well-nourished. |035|" |
| `Line 1570: स उपाध्यायं प्रत्युवाच |` | "He replied to the teacher:" |
| `Line 1571: भैक्षेण वृत्तिं कल्पयामीति | ०३६ |` | "I sustain myself by begging for alms. |036|" |
| `Line 1572: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1573: ममानिवेद्य भैक्षं नोपयोक्तव्यमिति | ०३७ |` | "The alms should not be consumed without first offering them to me. |037|" |
| `Line 1574: स तथेत्युक्त्वा पुनररक्षद्गाः |` | "Having said 'so be it,' he again tended the cows." |
| `Line 1575: रक्षित्वा चागम्य तथैवोपाध्यायस्याग्रतः स्थित्वा नमश्चक्रे | ०३८ |` | "And after tending them and returning, he stood before his teacher in the same way and paid his respects. |038|" |
translations: | `Line 1551: अयमस्म्यत्र केदारखण्डे निःसरमाणमुदकमवारणीयं संरोद्धुं संविष्टो भगवच्छब्दं श्रुत्वैव सहसा विदार्य केदारखण्डं भवन्तमुपस्थितः |` | "Here I am, seated in this field section to stop the unstoppable flowing water, when upon hearing the venerable word, I suddenly broke through the field embankment and came before you." |
| `Line 1552: तदभिवादये भगवन्तम् |` | "Therefore, I pay my respects to you, venerable one." |
| `Line 1553: आज्ञापयतु भवान् |` | "Please command me, sir." |
| `Line 1554: किं करवाणीति | ०२८ |` | "What shall I do? |028|" |
| `Line 1555: तमुपाध्यायोऽब्रवीत् |` | "The teacher [upādhyāya] said to him:" |

| `Line 1556: यस्माद्भवान्केदारखण्डमवदार्योत्थितस्तस्माद्भवानुद्दालक एव नाम्ना भविष्यतीति | ०२९ |` | "Since you have risen by breaking through the field embankment, therefore you shall be known by the name Uddālaka [one who breaks through]. |029|" |
| `Line 1557: स उपाध्यायेनानुगृहीतः |` | "He was blessed by the teacher:" |
| `Line 1558: यस्मात्त्वया मद्वचोऽनुष्ठितं तस्माच्छ्रेयोऽवाप्स्यसीति |` | "Since you have followed my instruction, therefore you shall attain excellence." |

| `Line 1559: सर्वे च ते वेदाः प्रतिभास्यन्ति सर्वाणि च धर्मशास्त्राणीति | ०३० |` | "And all the Vedas [sacred texts] and all the treatises on dharma [righteousness] will become clear to you. |030|" |
| `Line 1560: स एवमुक्त उपाध्यायेनेष्टं देशं जगाम | ०३१ |` | "Having been thus addressed by the teacher, he went to his desired place. |031|" |
| `Line 1561: अथापरः शिष्यस्तस्यैवायोदस्य धौम्यस्योपमन्युर्नाम | ०३२ |` | "Now, another student of that same Āyoda Dhaumya was named Upamanyu. |032|" |
| `Line 1562: तमुपाध्यायः प्रेषयामास |` | "The teacher sent him:" |
| `Line 1563: वत्सोपमन्यो गा रक्षस्वेति | ०३३ |` | "Child Upamanyu, tend the cows. |033|" |
| `Line 1564: स उपाध्यायवचनादरक्षद्गाः |` | "Following the teacher's instruction, he tended the cows." |

| `Line 1565: स चाहनि गा रक्षित्वा दिवसक्षयेऽभ्यागम्योपाध्यायस्याग्रतः स्थित्वा नमश्चक्रे | ०३४ |` | "And after tending the cows during the day, at sunset he returned, stood before his teacher, and paid his respects. |034|" |
| `Line 1566: तमुपाध्यायः पीवानमपश्यत् |` | "The teacher saw that he was well-nourished." |
| `Line 1567: उवाच चैनम् |` | "And said to him:" |
| `Line 1568: वत्सोपमन्यो केन वृत्तिं कल्पयसि |` | "Child Upamanyu, how do you sustain yourself?" |
| `Line 1569: पीवानसि दृढमिति | ०३५ |` | "You are certainly well-nourished. |035|" |
| `Line 1570: स उपाध्यायं प्रत्युवाच |` | "He replied to the teacher:" |
| `Line 1571: भैक्षेण वृत्तिं कल्पयामीति | ०३६ |` | "I sustain myself by begging for alms. |036|" |
| `Line 1572: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1573: ममानिवेद्य भैक्षं नोपयोक्तव्यमिति | ०३७ |` | "The alms should not be consumed without first offering them to me. |037|" |
| `Line 1574: स तथेत्युक्त्वा पुनररक्षद्गाः |` | "Having said 'so be it,' he again tended the cows." |
| `Line 1575: रक्षित्वा चागम्य तथैवोपाध्यायस्याग्रतः स्थित्वा नमश्चक्रे | ०३८ |` | "And after tending them and returning, he stood before his teacher in the same way and paid his respects. |038|" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1576: तमुपाध्यायस्तथापि पीवानमेव दृष्ट्वोवाच |` | "The teacher, seeing him still plump, said:" |
| `Line 1577: वत्सोपमन्यो सर्वमशेषतस्ते भैक्षं गृह्णामि |` | "Dear Upamanyu, I take all your alms without exception." |
| `Line 1578: केनेदानीं वृत्तिं कल्पयसीति | ०३९ |` | "How are you now sustaining yourself? |039|" |
| `Line 1579: स एवमुक्त उपाध्यायेन प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed by the teacher, he replied:" |
| `Line 1580: भगवते निवेद्य पूर्वमपरं चरामि |` | "After offering the first portion to you, venerable one, I go for a second round of alms." |
| `Line 1581: तेन वृत्तिं कल्पयामीति | ०४० |` | "By that means I sustain myself. |040|" |
| `Line 1582: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1583: नैषा न्याय्या गुरुवृत्तिः |` | "This is not proper conduct toward a guru [teacher]." |
| `Line 1584: अन्येषामपि वृत्त्युपरोधं करोष्येवं वर्तमानः |` | "By acting this way, you are also obstructing the livelihood of others." |
| `Line 1585: लुब्धोऽसीति | ०४१ |` | "You are greedy. |041|" |
| `Line 1586: स तथेत्युक्त्वा गा अरक्षत् |` | "Saying 'so be it,' he tended the cows." |
| `Line 1587: रक्षित्वा च पुनरुपाध्यायगृहमागम्योपाध्यायस्याग्रतः स्थित्वा नमश्चक्रे | ०४२ |` | "After tending them, he returned to the teacher's house, stood before the teacher, and paid his respects. |042|" |
| `Line 1588: तमुपाध्यायस्तथापि पीवानमेव दृष्ट्वा पुनरुवाच |` | "The teacher, seeing him still plump, said again:" |
| `Line 1589: अहं ते सर्वं भैक्षं गृह्णामि न चान्यच्चरसि |` | "I take all your alms, and you do not go for a second round." |
| `Line 1590: पीवानसि |` | "Yet you are plump." |
| `Line 1591: केन वृत्तिं कल्पयसीति | ०४३ |` | "How are you sustaining yourself? |043|" |
| `Line 1592: स उपाध्यायं प्रत्युवाच |` | "He replied to the teacher:" |
| `Line 1593: भो एतासां गवां पयसा वृत्तिं कल्पयामीति | ०४४ |` | "Sir, I sustain myself with the milk of these cows. |044|" |
| `Line 1594: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1595: नैतन्न्याय्यं पय उपयोक्तुं भवतो मयाननुज्ञातमिति | ०४५ |` | "It is not proper for you to consume milk without my permission. |045|" |
| `Line 1596: स तथेति प्रतिज्ञाय गा रक्षित्वा पुनरुपाध्यायगृहानेत्य गुरोरग्रतः स्थित्वा नमश्चक्रे | ०४६ |` | "Promising 'so be it,' he tended the cows, then returned to the teacher's house, stood before the guru, and paid his respects. |046|" |
| `Line 1597: तमुपाध्यायः पीवानमेवापश्यत् |` | "The teacher saw that he was still plump." |
| `Line 1598: उवाच चैनम् |` | "And he said to him:" |
| `Line 1599: भैक्षं नाश्नासि न चान्यच्चरसि |` | "You do not eat alms, nor do you go for a second round." |
| `Line 1600: पयो न पिबसि |` | "You do not drink milk." |
translations: | `Line 1576: तमुपाध्यायस्तथापि पीवानमेव दृष्ट्वोवाच |` | "The teacher, seeing him still plump, said:" |
| `Line 1577: वत्सोपमन्यो सर्वमशेषतस्ते भैक्षं गृह्णामि |` | "Dear Upamanyu, I take all your alms without exception." |
| `Line 1578: केनेदानीं वृत्तिं कल्पयसीति | ०३९ |` | "How are you now sustaining yourself? |039|" |
| `Line 1579: स एवमुक्त उपाध्यायेन प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed by the teacher, he replied:" |
| `Line 1580: भगवते निवेद्य पूर्वमपरं चरामि |` | "After offering the first portion to you, venerable one, I go for a second round of alms." |
| `Line 1581: तेन वृत्तिं कल्पयामीति | ०४० |` | "By that means I sustain myself. |040|" |
| `Line 1582: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1583: नैषा न्याय्या गुरुवृत्तिः |` | "This is not proper conduct toward a guru [teacher]." |
| `Line 1584: अन्येषामपि वृत्त्युपरोधं करोष्येवं वर्तमानः |` | "By acting this way, you are also obstructing the livelihood of others." |
| `Line 1585: लुब्धोऽसीति | ०४१ |` | "You are greedy. |041|" |
| `Line 1586: स तथेत्युक्त्वा गा अरक्षत् |` | "Saying 'so be it,' he tended the cows." |

| `Line 1587: रक्षित्वा च पुनरुपाध्यायगृहमागम्योपाध्यायस्याग्रतः स्थित्वा नमश्चक्रे | ०४२ |` | "After tending them, he returned to the teacher's house, stood before the teacher, and paid his respects. |042|" |
| `Line 1588: तमुपाध्यायस्तथापि पीवानमेव दृष्ट्वा पुनरुवाच |` | "The teacher, seeing him still plump, said again:" |
| `Line 1589: अहं ते सर्वं भैक्षं गृह्णामि न चान्यच्चरसि |` | "I take all your alms, and you do not go for a second round." |
| `Line 1590: पीवानसि |` | "Yet you are plump." |
| `Line 1591: केन वृत्तिं कल्पयसीति | ०४३ |` | "How are you sustaining yourself? |043|" |
| `Line 1592: स उपाध्यायं प्रत्युवाच |` | "He replied to the teacher:" |
| `Line 1593: भो एतासां गवां पयसा वृत्तिं कल्पयामीति | ०४४ |` | "Sir, I sustain myself with the milk of these cows. |044|" |
| `Line 1594: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1595: नैतन्न्याय्यं पय उपयोक्तुं भवतो मयाननुज्ञातमिति | ०४५ |` | "It is not proper for you to consume milk without my permission. |045|" |

| `Line 1596: स तथेति प्रतिज्ञाय गा रक्षित्वा पुनरुपाध्यायगृहानेत्य गुरोरग्रतः स्थित्वा नमश्चक्रे | ०४६ |` | "Promising 'so be it,' he tended the cows, then returned to the teacher's house, stood before the guru, and paid his respects. |046|" |
| `Line 1597: तमुपाध्यायः पीवानमेवापश्यत् |` | "The teacher saw that he was still plump." |
| `Line 1598: उवाच चैनम् |` | "And he said to him:" |
| `Line 1599: भैक्षं नाश्नासि न चान्यच्चरसि |` | "You do not eat alms, nor do you go for a second round." |
| `Line 1600: पयो न पिबसि |` | "You do not drink milk." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1601: पीवानसि |` | "You are fat [well-fed]." |
| `Line 1602: केन वृत्तिं कल्पयसीति | ०४७ |` | "How do you sustain yourself [earn livelihood]? |047|" |
| `Line 1603: स एवमुक्त उपाध्यायं प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, he replied to his teacher:" |
| `Line 1604: भोः फेनं पिबामि यमिमे वत्सा मातृणां स्तनं पिबन्त उद्गिरन्तीति | ०४८ |` | "Sir, I drink the foam which these calves spit out while drinking milk from their mothers' udders. |048|" |
| `Line 1605: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1606: एते त्वदनुकम्पया गुणवन्तो वत्साः प्रभूततरं फेनमुद्गिरन्ति |` | "These virtuous calves, out of compassion for you, are spitting out more foam." |
| `Line 1607: तदेवमपि वत्सानां वृत्त्युपरोधं करोष्येवं वर्तमानः |` | "Even so, by acting this way, you are obstructing the livelihood of the calves." |
| `Line 1608: फेनमपि भवान्न पातुमर्हतीति | ०४९ |` | "You should not even drink the foam. |049|" |
| `Line 1609: स तथेति प्रतिज्ञाय निराहारस्ता गा अरक्षत् |` | "Having promised 'so be it,' he tended the cows without taking any food." |
| `Line 1610: तथा प्रतिषिद्धो भैक्षं नाश्नाति न चान्यच्चरति |` | "Thus prohibited, he neither ate alms nor did anything else." |
| `Line 1611: पयो न पिबति |` | "He did not drink milk." |
| `Line 1612: फेनं नोपयुङ्क्ते | ०५० |` | "He did not consume the foam. |050|" |
| `Line 1613: स कदाचिदरण्ये क्षुधार्तोऽर्कपत्राण्यभक्षयत् | ०५१ |` | "Once, tormented by hunger in the forest, he ate the leaves of the arka plant [milkweed]. |051|" |
| `Line 1614: स तैरर्कपत्रैर्भक्षितैः क्षारकटूष्णविपाकिभिश्चक्षुष्युपहतोऽन्धोऽभवत् |` | "By eating those arka leaves, which have caustic, pungent, and hot properties, his eyes were damaged and he became blind." |
| `Line 1615: सोऽन्धोऽपि चङ्क्रम्यमाणः कूपेऽपतत् | ०५२ |` | "Though blind, while wandering about, he fell into a well. |052|" |
| `Line 1616: अथ तस्मिन्ननागच्छत्युपाध्यायः शिष्यानवोचत् |` | "Then, when he did not return, the teacher said to his disciples:" |
| `Line 1617: मयोपमन्युः सर्वतः प्रतिषिद्धः |` | "Upamanyu has been prohibited by me from all sources of food." |
| `Line 1618: स नियतं कुपितः |` | "He must certainly be angry." |
| `Line 1619: ततो नागच्छति चिरगतश्चेति | ०५३ |` | "That is why he has not returned and has been gone so long. |053|" |
| `Line 1620: स एवमुक्त्वा गत्वारण्यमुपमन्योराह्वानं चक्रे |` | "Having said this, he went to the forest and called out for Upamanyu:" |
| `Line 1621: भो उपमन्यो क्वासि |` | "O Upamanyu, where are you?" |
| `Line 1622: वत्सैहीति | ०५४ |` | "Come here, my child! |054|" |
| `Line 1623: स तदाह्वानमुपाध्यायाच्छ्रुत्वा प्रत्युवाचोच्चैः |` | "Hearing that call from his teacher, he replied loudly:" |
| `Line 1624: अयमस्मि भो उपाध्याय कूपे पतित इति | ०५५ |` | "Here I am, O teacher, fallen into a well! |055|" |
| `Line 1625: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
translations: | `Line 1601: पीवानसि |` | "You are fat [well-fed]." |
| `Line 1602: केन वृत्तिं कल्पयसीति | ०४७ |` | "How do you sustain yourself [earn livelihood]? |047|" |

| `Line 1604: भोः फेनं पिबामि यमिमे वत्सा मातृणां स्तनं पिबन्त उद्गिरन्तीति | ०४८ |` | "Sir, I drink the foam which these calves spit out while drinking milk from their mothers' udders. |048|" |
| `Line 1605: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1606: एते त्वदनुकम्पया गुणवन्तो वत्साः प्रभूततरं फेनमुद्गिरन्ति |` | "These virtuous calves, out of compassion for you, are spitting out more foam." |
| `Line 1607: तदेवमपि वत्सानां वृत्त्युपरोधं करोष्येवं वर्तमानः |` | "Even so, by acting this way, you are obstructing the livelihood of the calves." |
| `Line 1608: फेनमपि भवान्न पातुमर्हतीति | ०४९ |` | "You should not even drink the foam. |049|" |
| `Line 1609: स तथेति प्रतिज्ञाय निराहारस्ता गा अरक्षत् |` | "Having promised 'so be it,' he tended the cows without taking any food." |
| `Line 1610: तथा प्रतिषिद्धो भैक्षं नाश्नाति न चान्यच्चरति |` | "Thus prohibited, he neither ate alms nor did anything else." |
| `Line 1611: पयो न पिबति |` | "He did not drink milk." |
| `Line 1612: फेनं नोपयुङ्क्ते | ०५० |` | "He did not consume the foam. |050|" |
| `Line 1613: स कदाचिदरण्ये क्षुधार्तोऽर्कपत्राण्यभक्षयत् | ०५१ |` | "Once, tormented by hunger in the forest, he ate the leaves of the arka plant [milkweed]. |051|" |

| `Line 1614: स तैरर्कपत्रैर्भक्षितैः क्षारकटूष्णविपाकिभिश्चक्षुष्युपहतोऽन्धोऽभवत् |` | "By eating those arka leaves, which have caustic, pungent, and hot properties, his eyes were damaged and he became blind." |
| `Line 1615: सोऽन्धोऽपि चङ्क्रम्यमाणः कूपेऽपतत् | ०५२ |` | "Though blind, while wandering about, he fell into a well. |052|" |
| `Line 1616: अथ तस्मिन्ननागच्छत्युपाध्यायः शिष्यानवोचत् |` | "Then, when he did not return, the teacher said to his disciples:" |
| `Line 1617: मयोपमन्युः सर्वतः प्रतिषिद्धः |` | "Upamanyu has been prohibited by me from all sources of food." |
| `Line 1618: स नियतं कुपितः |` | "He must certainly be angry." |
| `Line 1619: ततो नागच्छति चिरगतश्चेति | ०५३ |` | "That is why he has not returned and has been gone so long. |053|" |
| `Line 1620: स एवमुक्त्वा गत्वारण्यमुपमन्योराह्वानं चक्रे |` | "Having said this, he went to the forest and called out for Upamanyu:" |
| `Line 1621: भो उपमन्यो क्वासि |` | "O Upamanyu, where are you?" |
| `Line 1622: वत्सैहीति | ०५४ |` | "Come here, my child! |054|" |
| `Line 1623: स तदाह्वानमुपाध्यायाच्छ्रुत्वा प्रत्युवाचोच्चैः |` | "Hearing that call from his teacher, he replied loudly:" |
| `Line 1624: अयमस्मि भो उपाध्याय कूपे पतित इति | ०५५ |` | "Here I am, O teacher, fallen into a well! |055|" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1626: कथमसि कूपे पतित इति | ०५६ |` | "How did you fall into the well? |056|" |
| `Line 1627: स तं प्रत्युवाच |` | "He replied to him:" |
| `Line 1628: अर्कपत्राणि भक्षयित्वान्धीभूतोऽस्मि |` | "Having eaten arka [milkweed] leaves, I became blind." |
| `Line 1629: अतः कूपे पतित इति | ०५७ |` | "That is why I fell into the well. |057|" |
| `Line 1630: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1631: अश्विनौ स्तुहि |` | "Praise the Ashvins [divine physician twins]." |
| `Line 1632: तौ त्वां चक्षुष्मन्तं करिष्यतो देवभिषजाविति | ०५८ |` | "Those divine physicians will restore your eyesight. |058|" |
| `Line 1633: स एवमुक्त उपाध्यायेन स्तोतुं प्रचक्रमे देवावश्विनौ वाग्भिरृग्भिः | ०५९ |` | "Thus instructed by the teacher, he began to praise the divine Ashvins with words and Rig Vedic verses. |059|" |
| `Line 1634: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1635: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1636: प्र पूर्वगौ पूर्वजौ चित्रभानू; गिरा वा शंसामि तपनावनन्तौ |` | "I praise with my voice the foremost ones, the first-born, of brilliant light; the radiant ones, the boundless ones." |
| `Line 1637: दिव्यौ सुपर्णौ विरजौ विमाना; वधिक्षियन्तौ भुवनानि विश्वा ||६०||` | "The two divine, well-winged, stainless, immeasurable ones, who rule over all the worlds. ||60||" |
| `Line 1638: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1639: हिरण्मयौ शकुनी साम्परायौ; नासत्यदस्रौ सुनसौ वैजयन्तौ |` | "The two golden birds, companions in the journey; the truthful and miraculous ones, with beautiful noses, victorious." |
| `Line 1640: शुक्रं वयन्तौ तरसा सुवेमा; वभि व्ययन्तावसितं विवस्वत् ||६१||` | "Weaving brightness with speed, with excellent work; dispelling the darkness of the sun. ||61||" |
| `Line 1641: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1642: ग्रस्तां सुपर्णस्य बलेन वर्तिका; ममुञ्चतामश्विनौ सौभगाय |` | "The quail [bird] seized by the might of the eagle; the Ashvins released it for good fortune." |
| `Line 1643: तावत्सुवृत्तावनमन्त मायया; सत्तमा गा अरुणा उदावहन् ||६२||` | "Those two excellent ones bowed with their power; the most excellent reddish cows they brought forth. ||62||" |
| `Line 1644: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1645: षष्टिश्च गावस्त्रिशताश्च धेनव; एकं वत्सं सुवते तं दुहन्ति |` | "Three hundred and sixty cows give birth to one calf and they all milk it." |
| `Line 1646: नानागोष्ठा विहिता एकदोहना; स्तावश्विनौ दुहतो घर्ममुक्थ्यम् ||६३||` | "Though in different cow-pens, they yield milk at once; those Ashvins milk the praiseworthy ghee [clarified butter]. ||63||" |
| `Line 1647: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1648: एकां नाभिं सप्तशता अराः श्रिताः; प्रधिष्वन्या विंशतिरर्पिता अराः |` | "Seven hundred spokes are fixed in one hub; in another rim, twenty spokes are fixed." |
| `Line 1649: अनेमि चक्रं परिवर्ततेऽजरं; मायाश्विनौ समनक्ति चर्षणी ||६४||` | "The rimless wheel revolves without aging; the power of the Ashvins unites the people. ||64||" |
| `Line 1650: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 1626: कथमसि कूपे पतित इति | ०५६ |` | "How did you fall into the well? |056|" |

| `Line 1647: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1648: एकां नाभिं सप्तशता अराः श्रिताः; प्रधिष्वन्या विंशतिरर्पिता अराः |` | "Seven hundred spokes are fixed in one hub; in another rim, twenty spokes are fixed." |
| `Line 1649: अनेमि चक्रं परिवर्ततेऽजरं; मायाश्विनौ समनक्ति चर्षणी ||६४||` | "The rimless wheel revolves without aging; the power of the Ashvins unites the people. ||64||" |
| `Line 1650: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1651: एकं चक्रं वर्तते द्वादशारं प्रधि; षण्णाभिमेकाक्षममृतस्य धारणम् |` | "One wheel revolves with twelve spokes, six naves, and one axle, holding immortality [eternal essence]." |
| `Line 1652: यस्मिन्देवा अधि विश्वे विषक्ता; स्तावश्विनौ मुञ्चतो मा विषीदतम् ||६५||` | "Upon which all the gods are fixed; O Ashvins [divine twins], release me, let me not perish. ||65||" |
| `Line 1653: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1654: अश्विनाविन्द्रममृतं वृत्तभूयौ; तिरोधत्तामश्विनौ दासपत्नी |` | "The Ashvins, having become the immortal Indra [king of gods], concealed themselves; the Ashvins, masters of the Dāsa [servant class]." |
| `Line 1655: भित्त्वा गिरिमश्विनौ गामुदाचरन्तौ; तद्वृष्टमह्ना प्रथिता वलस्य ||६६||` | "Breaking through the mountain, the Ashvins brought forth the cow [or speech]; that rain by day is renowned as Vala's [demon's]. ||66||" |
| `Line 1656: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1657: युवां दिशो जनयथो दशाग्रे; समानं मूर्ध्नि रथया वियन्ति |` | "You two create the ten directions at the beginning; they spread out equally from the head in chariots." |
| `Line 1658: तासां यातमृषयोऽनुप्रयान्ति; देवा मनुष्याः क्षितिमाचरन्ति ||६७||` | "The sages follow their path; gods and humans traverse the earth. ||67||" |
| `Line 1659: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1660: युवां वर्णान्विकुरुथो विश्वरूपां; स्तेऽधिक्षियन्ति भुवनानि विश्वा |` | "You two create colors of universal forms; they pervade all the worlds." |
| `Line 1661: ते भानवोऽप्यनुसृताश्चरन्ति; देवा मनुष्याः क्षितिमाचरन्ति ||६८||` | "Those rays, being followed, move about; gods and humans traverse the earth. ||68||" |
| `Line 1662: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1663: तौ नासत्यावश्विनावामहे वां; स्रजं च यां बिभृथः पुष्करस्य |` | "We invoke you two, the Nāsatyas [truthful ones], the Ashvins, and the garland of the lotus that you both wear." |
| `Line 1664: तौ नासत्यावमृतावृतावृधा; वृते देवास्तत्प्रपदेन सूते ||६९||` | "Those two Nāsatyas, immortal, truth-increasing; the gods are enclosed by that forefoot in creation. ||69||" |
| `Line 1665: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1666: मुखेन गर्भं लभतां युवानौ; गतासुरेतत्प्रपदेन सूते |` | "May the young ones receive the embryo through the mouth; when life has departed, it gives birth through that forefoot." |
| `Line 1667: सद्यो जातो मातरमत्ति गर्भ; स्तावश्विनौ मुञ्चथो जीवसे गाः ||७०||` | "As soon as born, the embryo consumes its mother; O Ashvins, release the cows [or rays] for life. ||70||" |
| `Line 1668: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1669: एवं तेनाभिष्टुतावश्विनावाजग्मतुः |` | "Thus praised by him, the Ashvins arrived." |
| `Line 1670: आहतुश्चैनम् |` | "And they said to him:" |
| `Line 1671: प्रीतौ स्वः |` | "We are pleased with you." |
| `Line 1672: एष तेऽपूपः |` | "Here is a cake for you." |
| `Line 1673: अशानैनमिति | ०७१ |` | "Eat it. |071|" |
| `Line 1674: स एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Being thus addressed, he replied:" |
| `Line 1675: नानृतमूचतुर्भवन्तौ |` | "You two have not spoken untruth." |

| `Line 1652: यस्मिन्देवा अधि विश्वे विषक्ता; स्तावश्विनौ मुञ्चतो मा विषीदतम् ||६५||` | "Upon which all the gods are fixed; O Ashvins [divine twins], release me, let me not perish. ||65||" |
| `Line 1653: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 1655: भित्त्वा गिरिमश्विनौ गामुदाचरन्तौ; तद्वृष्टमह्ना प्रथिता वलस्य ||६६||` | "Breaking through the mountain, the Ashvins brought forth the cow [or speech]; that rain by day is renowned as Vala's [demon's]. ||66||" |
| `Line 1656: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1657: युवां दिशो जनयथो दशाग्रे; समानं मूर्ध्नि रथया वियन्ति |` | "You two create the ten directions at the beginning; they spread out equally from the head in chariots." |
| `Line 1658: तासां यातमृषयोऽनुप्रयान्ति; देवा मनुष्याः क्षितिमाचरन्ति ||६७||` | "The sages follow their path; gods and humans traverse the earth. ||67||" |
| `Line 1659: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1660: युवां वर्णान्विकुरुथो विश्वरूपां; स्तेऽधिक्षियन्ति भुवनानि विश्वा |` | "You two create colors of universal forms; they pervade all the worlds." |
| `Line 1661: ते भानवोऽप्यनुसृताश्चरन्ति; देवा मनुष्याः क्षितिमाचरन्ति ||६८||` | "Those rays, being followed, move about; gods and humans traverse the earth. ||68||" |
| `Line 1662: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1663: तौ नासत्यावश्विनावामहे वां; स्रजं च यां बिभृथः पुष्करस्य |` | "We invoke you two, the Nāsatyas [truthful ones], the Ashvins, and the garland of the lotus that you both wear." |
| `Line 1664: तौ नासत्यावमृतावृतावृधा; वृते देवास्तत्प्रपदेन सूते ||६९||` | "Those two Nāsatyas, immortal, truth-increasing; the gods are enclosed by that forefoot in creation. ||69||" |
| `Line 1665: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1666: मुखेन गर्भं लभतां युवानौ; गतासुरेतत्प्रपदेन सूते |` | "May the young ones receive the embryo through the mouth; when life has departed, it gives birth through that forefoot." |
| `Line 1667: सद्यो जातो मातरमत्ति गर्भ; स्तावश्विनौ मुञ्चथो जीवसे गाः ||७०||` | "As soon as born, the embryo consumes its mother; O Ashvins, release the cows [or rays] for life. ||70||" |
| `Line 1668: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1669: एवं तेनाभिष्टुतावश्विनावाजग्मतुः |` | "Thus praised by him, the Ashvins arrived." |
| `Line 1670: आहतुश्चैनम् |` | "And they said to him:" |
| `Line 1671: प्रीतौ स्वः |` | "We are pleased with you." |
| `Line 1672: एष तेऽपूपः |` | "Here is a cake for you." |
| `Line 1674: स एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Being thus addressed, he replied:" |
| `Line 1675: नानृतमूचतुर्भवन्तौ |` | "You two have not spoken untruth." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1676: न त्वहमेतमपूपमुपयोक्तुमुत्सहे अनिवेद्य गुरव इति | ०७२ |` | "But I cannot bring myself to eat this cake without informing my teacher. |072|" |
| `Line 1677: ततस्तमश्विनावूचतुः |` | "Then the Ashvins [divine twin physicians] said to him:" |
| `Line 1678: आवाभ्यां पुरस्ताद्भवत उपाध्यायेनैवमेवाभिष्टुताभ्यामपूपः प्रीताभ्यां दत्तः |` | "Previously, your teacher himself offered a cake to us when we were pleased by his praises." |
| `Line 1679: उपयुक्तश्च स तेनानिवेद्य गुरवे |` | "And he consumed it without informing his own teacher." |
| `Line 1680: त्वमपि तथैव कुरुष्व यथा कृतमुपाध्यायेनेति | ०७३ |` | "You should also do just as your teacher did. |073|" |
| `Line 1681: स एवमुक्तः पुनरेव प्रत्युवाचैतौ |` | "Having been thus addressed, he again replied to them:" |
| `Line 1682: प्रत्यनुनये भवन्तावश्विनौ |` | "I beg your pardon, O Ashvins." |
| `Line 1683: नोत्सहेऽहमनिवेद्योपाध्यायायोपयोक्तुमिति | ०७४ |` | "I cannot bring myself to consume this without informing my teacher. |074|" |
| `Line 1684: तमश्विनावाहतुः |` | "The Ashvins said to him:" |
| `Line 1685: प्रीतौ स्वस्तवानया गुरुवृत्त्या |` | "We are pleased with your praise and this devotion to your teacher." |
| `Line 1686: उपाध्यायस्य ते कार्ष्णायसा दन्ताः |` | "Your teacher's teeth are of iron." |
| `Line 1687: भवतो हिरण्मया भविष्यन्ति |` | "Yours shall become golden." |
| `Line 1688: चक्षुष्मांश्च भविष्यसि |` | "And you shall regain your sight." |
| `Line 1689: श्रेयश्चावाप्स्यसीति | ०७५ |` | "And you shall attain prosperity. |075|" |
| `Line 1690: स एवमुक्तोऽश्विभ्यां लब्धचक्षुरुपाध्यायसकाशमागम्योपाध्यायमभिवाद्याचचक्षे |` | "Thus addressed by the Ashvins, having regained his sight, he went to his teacher, greeted him, and told him everything." |
| `Line 1691: स चास्य प्रीतिमानभूत् | ०७६ |` | "And the teacher was pleased with him. |076|" |
| `Line 1692: आह चैनम् |` | "And he said to him:" |
| `Line 1693: यथाश्विनावाहतुस्तथा त्वं श्रेयोऽवाप्स्यसीति |` | "As the Ashvins have said, so shall you attain prosperity." |
| `Line 1694: सर्वे च ते वेदाः प्रतिभास्यन्तीति | ०७७ |` | "And all the Vedas [sacred texts] shall become clear to you. |077|" |
| `Line 1695: एषा तस्यापि परीक्षोपमन्योः | ०७८ |` | "This was the test of Upamanyu as well. |078|" |
| `Line 1696: अथापरः शिष्यस्तस्यैवायोदस्य धौम्यस्य वेदो नाम | ०७९ |` | "Now, another disciple of that same Ayoda Dhaumya was named Veda. |079|" |
| `Line 1697: तमुपाध्यायः संदिदेश |` | "The teacher instructed him:" |
| `Line 1698: वत्स वेद इहास्यताम् |` | "Dear Veda, stay here." |
| `Line 1699: भवता मद्गृहे कञ्चित्कालं शुश्रूषमाणेन भवितव्यम् |` | "You must serve in my house for some time." |
| `Line 1700: श्रेयस्ते भविष्यतीति | ०८० |` | "It will be beneficial for you. |080|" |
translations: | `Line 1676: न त्वहमेतमपूपमुपयोक्तुमुत्सहे अनिवेद्य गुरव इति | ०७२ |` | "But I cannot bring myself to eat this cake without informing my teacher. |072|" |

| `Line 1694: सर्वे च ते वेदाः प्रतिभास्यन्तीति | ०७७ |` | "And all the Vedas [sacred texts] shall become clear to you. |077|" |

| `Line 1696: अथापरः शिष्यस्तस्यैवायोदस्य धौम्यस्य वेदो नाम | ०७९ |` | "Now, another disciple of that same Ayoda Dhaumya was named Veda. |079|" |
| `Line 1697: तमुपाध्यायः संदिदेश |` | "The teacher instructed him:" |

| `Line 1700: श्रेयस्ते भविष्यतीति | ०८० |` | "It will be beneficial for you. |080|" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1701: स तथेत्युक्त्वा गुरुकुले दीर्घकालं गुरुशुश्रूषणपरोऽवसत् |` | "Having said 'so be it,' he lived in the teacher's household for a long time, devoted to serving his guru." |
| `Line 1702: गौरिव नित्यं गुरुषु धूर्षु नियुज्यमानः शीतोष्णक्षुत्तृष्णादुःखसहः सर्वत्राप्रतिकूलः | ०८१ |` | "Like an ox, constantly engaged in heavy tasks by his teachers, enduring the suffering of cold, heat, hunger and thirst, never being contrary in any situation. |081|" |
| `Line 1703: तस्य महता कालेन गुरुः परितोषं जगाम |` | "After a long time, his teacher became completely satisfied with him." |
| `Line 1704: तत्परितोषाच्च श्रेयः सर्वज्ञतां चावाप |` | "And from that satisfaction, he attained excellence and omniscience." |
| `Line 1705: एषा तस्यापि परीक्षा वेदस्य | ०८२ |` | "This was also his test by Veda [sage/teacher]. |082|" |
| `Line 1706: स उपाध्यायेनानुज्ञातः समावृत्तस्तस्माद्गुरुकुलवासाद्गृहाश्रमं प्रत्यपद्यत |` | "Having been permitted by his teacher, he completed his education and departed from the teacher's residence to enter the householder stage [gṛhastha āśrama]." |
| `Line 1707: तस्यापि स्वगृहे वसतस्त्रयः शिष्या बभूवुः | ०८३ |` | "While living in his own house, he too had three disciples. |083|" |
| `Line 1708: स शिष्यान्न किञ्चिदुवाच |` | "He did not say anything to his disciples." |
| `Line 1709: कर्म वा क्रियतां गुरुशुश्रूषा वेति |` | "Neither 'perform this work' nor 'serve the teacher.'" |
| `Line 1710: दुःखाभिज्ञो हि गुरुकुलवासस्य शिष्यान्परिक्लेशेन योजयितुं नेयेष | ०८४ |` | "For having known the hardships of living in a teacher's household, he did not wish to subject his disciples to such suffering. |084|" |
| `Line 1711: अथ कस्यचित्कालस्य वेदं ब्राह्मणं जनमेजयः पौष्यश्च क्षत्रियावुपेत्योपाध्यायं वरयां चक्रतुः | ०८५ |` | "Then after some time, Janamejaya and Paushya, two Kshatriyas [warrior class], approached Veda the Brahmin and chose him as their teacher. |085|" |
| `Line 1712: स कदाचिद्याज्यकार्येणाभिप्रस्थित उत्तङ्कं नाम शिष्यं नियोजयामास |` | "Once, when departing for a sacrificial ceremony, he instructed his disciple named Uttanka:" |
| `Line 1713: भो उत्तङ्क यत्किञ्चिदस्मद्गृहे परिहीयते तदिच्छाम्यहमपरिहीणं भवता क्रियमाणमिति | ०८६ |` | "O Uttanka, whatever needs to be maintained in our house, I wish that you would keep it all in good order. |086|" |
| `Line 1714: स एवं प्रतिसमादिश्योत्तङ्कं वेदः प्रवासं जगाम | ०८७ |` | "Having given these instructions to Uttanka, Veda went away on his journey. |087|" |
| `Line 1715: अथोत्तङ्को गुरुशुश्रूषुर्गुरुनियोगमनुतिष्ठमानस्तत्र गुरुकुले वसति स्म | ०८८ |` | "Then Uttanka, eager to serve his teacher and following his instructions, continued to live in the teacher's household. |088|" |
| `Line 1716: स वसंस्तत्रोपाध्यायस्त्रीभिः सहिताभिराहूयोक्तः |` | "While living there, he was called and told by the teacher's wives together:" |
| `Line 1717: उपाध्यायिनी ते ऋतुमती |` | "Your teacher's wife is in her fertile period [menstruating]." |
| `Line 1718: उपाध्यायश्च प्रोषितः |` | "And the teacher is away from home." |
| `Line 1719: अस्या यथायमृतुर्वन्ध्यो न भवति तथा क्रियताम् |` | "Act in such a way that her fertile period does not go in vain." |
| `Line 1720: एतद्विषीदतीति | ०८९ |` | "She is distressed about this. |089|" |
| `Line 1721: स एवमुक्तस्ताः स्त्रियः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Having been told this, he replied to those women:" |
| `Line 1722: न मया स्त्रीणां वचनादिदमकार्यं कार्यम् |` | "I should not do this improper act at the word of women." |
| `Line 1723: न ह्यहमुपाध्यायेन संदिष्टः |` | "For I have not been instructed by my teacher to do this." |
| `Line 1724: अकार्यमपि त्वया कार्यमिति | ०९० |` | "That even improper acts should be done by me. |090|" |
| `Line 1725: तस्य पुनरुपाध्यायः कालान्तरेण गृहानुपजगाम तस्मात्प्रवासात् |` | "After some time, his teacher returned home from that journey." |
translations: | `Line 1701: स तथेत्युक्त्वा गुरुकुले दीर्घकालं गुरुशुश्रूषणपरोऽवसत् |` | "Having said 'so be it,' he lived in the teacher's household for a long time, devoted to serving his guru." |

| `Line 1702: गौरिव नित्यं गुरुषु धूर्षु नियुज्यमानः शीतोष्णक्षुत्तृष्णादुःखसहः सर्वत्राप्रतिकूलः | ०८१ |` | "Like an ox, constantly engaged in heavy tasks by his teachers, enduring the suffering of cold, heat, hunger and thirst, never being contrary in any situation. |081|" |
| `Line 1703: तस्य महता कालेन गुरुः परितोषं जगाम |` | "After a long time, his teacher became completely satisfied with him." |
| `Line 1704: तत्परितोषाच्च श्रेयः सर्वज्ञतां चावाप |` | "And from that satisfaction, he attained excellence and omniscience." |
| `Line 1705: एषा तस्यापि परीक्षा वेदस्य | ०८२ |` | "This was also his test by Veda [sage/teacher]. |082|" |

| `Line 1706: स उपाध्यायेनानुज्ञातः समावृत्तस्तस्माद्गुरुकुलवासाद्गृहाश्रमं प्रत्यपद्यत |` | "Having been permitted by his teacher, he completed his education and departed from the teacher's residence to enter the householder stage [gṛhastha āśrama]." |
| `Line 1707: तस्यापि स्वगृहे वसतस्त्रयः शिष्या बभूवुः | ०८३ |` | "While living in his own house, he too had three disciples. |083|" |
| `Line 1708: स शिष्यान्न किञ्चिदुवाच |` | "He did not say anything to his disciples." |
| `Line 1709: कर्म वा क्रियतां गुरुशुश्रूषा वेति |` | "Neither 'perform this work' nor 'serve the teacher.'" |

| `Line 1710: दुःखाभिज्ञो हि गुरुकुलवासस्य शिष्यान्परिक्लेशेन योजयितुं नेयेष | ०८४ |` | "For having known the hardships of living in a teacher's household, he did not wish to subject his disciples to such suffering. |084|" |

| `Line 1711: अथ कस्यचित्कालस्य वेदं ब्राह्मणं जनमेजयः पौष्यश्च क्षत्रियावुपेत्योपाध्यायं वरयां चक्रतुः | ०८५ |` | "Then after some time, Janamejaya and Paushya, two Kshatriyas [warrior class], approached Veda the Brahmin and chose him as their teacher. |085|" |
| `Line 1712: स कदाचिद्याज्यकार्येणाभिप्रस्थित उत्तङ्कं नाम शिष्यं नियोजयामास |` | "Once, when departing for a sacrificial ceremony, he instructed his disciple named Uttanka:" |

| `Line 1713: भो उत्तङ्क यत्किञ्चिदस्मद्गृहे परिहीयते तदिच्छाम्यहमपरिहीणं भवता क्रियमाणमिति | ०८६ |` | "O Uttanka, whatever needs to be maintained in our house, I wish that you would keep it all in good order. |086|" |
| `Line 1714: स एवं प्रतिसमादिश्योत्तङ्कं वेदः प्रवासं जगाम | ०८७ |` | "Having given these instructions to Uttanka, Veda went away on his journey. |087|" |

| `Line 1715: अथोत्तङ्को गुरुशुश्रूषुर्गुरुनियोगमनुतिष्ठमानस्तत्र गुरुकुले वसति स्म | ०८८ |` | "Then Uttanka, eager to serve his teacher and following his instructions, continued to live in the teacher's household. |088|" |
| `Line 1716: स वसंस्तत्रोपाध्यायस्त्रीभिः सहिताभिराहूयोक्तः |` | "While living there, he was called and told by the teacher's wives together:" |
| `Line 1717: उपाध्यायिनी ते ऋतुमती |` | "Your teacher's wife is in her fertile period [menstruating]." |
| `Line 1718: उपाध्यायश्च प्रोषितः |` | "And the teacher is away from home." |
| `Line 1719: अस्या यथायमृतुर्वन्ध्यो न भवति तथा क्रियताम् |` | "Act in such a way that her fertile period does not go in vain." |
| `Line 1720: एतद्विषीदतीति | ०८९ |` | "She is distressed about this. |089|" |
| `Line 1721: स एवमुक्तस्ताः स्त्रियः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Having been told this, he replied to those women:" |
| `Line 1722: न मया स्त्रीणां वचनादिदमकार्यं कार्यम् |` | "I should not do this improper act at the word of women." |
| `Line 1723: न ह्यहमुपाध्यायेन संदिष्टः |` | "For I have not been instructed by my teacher to do this." |
| `Line 1724: अकार्यमपि त्वया कार्यमिति | ०९० |` | "That even improper acts should be done by me. |090|" |
| `Line 1725: तस्य पुनरुपाध्यायः कालान्तरेण गृहानुपजगाम तस्मात्प्रवासात् |` | "After some time, his teacher returned home from that journey." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1726: स तद्वृत्तं तस्याशेषमुपलभ्य प्रीतिमानभूत् | ०९१ |` | "Having learned the entire account of his conduct, he became pleased. |091|" |
| `Line 1727: उवाच चैनम् |` | "And he said to him:" |
| `Line 1728: वत्सोत्तङ्क किं ते प्रियं करवाणीति |` | "My child Uttanka, what may I do for you that would be pleasing?" |
| `Line 1729: धर्मतो हि शुश्रूषितोऽस्मि भवता |` | "Indeed, you have served me according to dharma [righteous duty]." |
| `Line 1730: तेन प्रीतिः परस्परेण नौ संवृद्धा |` | "Through this, affection between us has grown." |
| `Line 1731: तदनुजाने भवन्तम् |` | "Therefore, I give you permission [to depart]." |
| `Line 1732: सर्वामेव सिद्धिं प्राप्स्यसि |` | "You will attain complete success." |
| `Line 1733: गम्यतामिति | ०९२ |` | "You may go. |092|" |
| `Line 1734: स एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, he replied:" |
| `Line 1735: किं ते प्रियं करवाणीति |` | "What may I do that would please you?" |
| `Line 1736: एवं ह्याहुः | ०९३ |` | "For thus they say: |093|" |
| `Line 1737: यश्चाधर्मेण विब्रूयाद्यश्चाधर्मेण पृच्छति | ०९४ |` | "He who speaks unrighteously and he who questions unrighteously, |094|" |
| `Line 1738: तयोरन्यतरः प्रैति विद्वेषं चाधिगच्छति |` | "One of them perishes and incurs hatred." |
| `Line 1739: सोऽहमनुज्ञातो भवता इच्छामीष्टं ते गुर्वर्थमुपहर्तुमिति | ०९५ |` | "Having been permitted by you, I wish to bring you a desired guru-dakshina [teacher's gift]. |095|" |
| `Line 1740: तेनैवमुक्त उपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, the teacher replied:" |
| `Line 1741: वत्सोत्तङ्क उष्यतां तावदिति | ०९६ |` | "Child Uttanka, stay for now. |096|" |
| `Line 1742: स कदाचित्तमुपाध्यायमाहोत्तङ्कः |` | "Once Uttanka said to his teacher:" |
| `Line 1743: आज्ञापयतु भवान् |` | "May you command me." |
| `Line 1744: किं ते प्रियमुपहरामि गुर्वर्थमिति | ०९७ |` | "What pleasing thing shall I bring you as guru-dakshina [teacher's fee]? |097|" |
| `Line 1745: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1746: वत्सोत्तङ्क बहुशो मां चोदयसि गुर्वर्थमुपहरेयमिति |` | "Child Uttanka, you repeatedly urge me saying 'I should bring something as guru-dakshina.'" |
| `Line 1747: तद्गच्छ |` | "Therefore, go." |
| `Line 1748: एनां प्रविश्योपाध्यायिनीं पृच्छ किमुपहरामीति |` | "Go to my wife [teacher's wife] and ask her, 'What should I bring?'" |
| `Line 1749: एषा यद्ब्रवीति तदुपहरस्वेति | ०९८ |` | "Whatever she says, bring that. |098|" |
| `Line 1750: स एवमुक्त उपाध्यायेनोपाध्यायिनीमपृच्छत् |` | "Thus instructed by his teacher, he asked the teacher's wife:" |
translations: | `Line 1726: स तद्वृत्तं तस्याशेषमुपलभ्य प्रीतिमानभूत् | ०९१ |` | "Having learned the entire account of his conduct, he became pleased. |091|" |
| `Line 1727: उवाच चैनम् |` | "And he said to him:" |
| `Line 1728: वत्सोत्तङ्क किं ते प्रियं करवाणीति |` | "My child Uttanka, what may I do for you that would be pleasing?" |
| `Line 1729: धर्मतो हि शुश्रूषितोऽस्मि भवता |` | "Indeed, you have served me according to dharma [righteous duty]." |
| `Line 1730: तेन प्रीतिः परस्परेण नौ संवृद्धा |` | "Through this, affection between us has grown." |
| `Line 1731: तदनुजाने भवन्तम् |` | "Therefore, I give you permission [to depart]." |
| `Line 1732: सर्वामेव सिद्धिं प्राप्स्यसि |` | "You will attain complete success." |
| `Line 1733: गम्यतामिति | ०९२ |` | "You may go. |092|" |
| `Line 1734: स एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, he replied:" |
| `Line 1735: किं ते प्रियं करवाणीति |` | "What may I do that would please you?" |
| `Line 1736: एवं ह्याहुः | ०९३ |` | "For thus they say: |093|" |
| `Line 1737: यश्चाधर्मेण विब्रूयाद्यश्चाधर्मेण पृच्छति | ०९४ |` | "He who speaks unrighteously and he who questions unrighteously, |094|" |
| `Line 1738: तयोरन्यतरः प्रैति विद्वेषं चाधिगच्छति |` | "One of them perishes and incurs hatred." |
| `Line 1739: सोऽहमनुज्ञातो भवता इच्छामीष्टं ते गुर्वर्थमुपहर्तुमिति | ०९५ |` | "Having been permitted by you, I wish to bring you a desired guru-dakshina [teacher's gift]. |095|" |
| `Line 1740: तेनैवमुक्त उपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, the teacher replied:" |
| `Line 1741: वत्सोत्तङ्क उष्यतां तावदिति | ०९६ |` | "Child Uttanka, stay for now. |096|" |
| `Line 1742: स कदाचित्तमुपाध्यायमाहोत्तङ्कः |` | "Once Uttanka said to his teacher:" |
| `Line 1743: आज्ञापयतु भवान् |` | "May you command me." |
| `Line 1744: किं ते प्रियमुपहरामि गुर्वर्थमिति | ०९७ |` | "What pleasing thing shall I bring you as guru-dakshina [teacher's fee]? |097|" |
| `Line 1745: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1746: वत्सोत्तङ्क बहुशो मां चोदयसि गुर्वर्थमुपहरेयमिति |` | "Child Uttanka, you repeatedly urge me saying 'I should bring something as guru-dakshina.'" |
| `Line 1747: तद्गच्छ |` | "Therefore, go." |
| `Line 1748: एनां प्रविश्योपाध्यायिनीं पृच्छ किमुपहरामीति |` | "Go to my wife [teacher's wife] and ask her, 'What should I bring?'" |
| `Line 1749: एषा यद्ब्रवीति तदुपहरस्वेति | ०९८ |` | "Whatever she says, bring that. |098|" |
| `Line 1750: स एवमुक्त उपाध्यायेनोपाध्यायिनीमपृच्छत् |` | "Thus instructed by his teacher, he asked the teacher's wife:" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1751: भवत्युपाध्यायेनास्म्यनुज्ञातो गृहं गन्तुम् |` | "I have been permitted by your honorable teacher to go home." |
| `Line 1752: तदिच्छामीष्टं ते गुर्वर्थमुपहृत्यानृणो गन्तुम् |` | "Therefore, I wish to bring a suitable gift for the teacher and depart free from debt." |
| `Line 1753: तदाज्ञापयतु भवती |` | "So please instruct me, respected lady [teacher's wife]." |
| `Line 1754: किमुपहरामि गुर्वर्थमिति | ०९९ |` | "What should I bring as a gift for the teacher? |099|" |
| `Line 1755: सैवमुक्तोपाध्यायिन्युत्तङ्कं प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, the teacher's wife replied to Uttanka:" |
| `Line 1756: गच्छ पौष्यं राजानम् |` | "Go to King Paushya." |
| `Line 1757: भिक्षस्व तस्य क्षत्रियया पिनद्धे कुण्डले |` | "Request the earrings worn by his queen [Kshatriya woman]." |
| `Line 1758: ते आनयस्व |` | "Bring those here." |
| `Line 1759: इतश्चतुर्थेऽहनि पुण्यकं भविता |` | "Four days from now there will be an auspicious ceremony [punyaka]." |
| `Line 1760: ताभ्यामाबद्धाभ्यां ब्राह्मणान्परिवेष्टुमिच्छामि |` | "I wish to serve the Brahmins while wearing those earrings." |
| `Line 1761: शोभमाना यथा ताभ्यां कुण्डलाभ्यां तस्मिन्नहनि सम्पादयस्व |` | "Ensure that I am adorned with those earrings on that day." |
| `Line 1762: श्रेयो हि ते स्यात्क्षणं कुर्वत इति | १०० |` | "It will be auspicious for you if you accomplish this task. |100|" |
| `Line 1763: स एवमुक्त उपाध्यायिन्या प्रातिष्ठतोत्तङ्कः |` | "Thus instructed by the teacher's wife, Uttanka set forth." |
| `Line 1764: स पथि गच्छन्नपश्यदृषभमतिप्रमाणं तमधिरूढं च पुरुषमतिप्रमाणमेव | १०१ |` | "While going along the path, he saw an enormous bull and a man of enormous size mounted on it. |101|" |
| `Line 1765: स पुरुष उत्तङ्कमभ्यभाषत |` | "That man addressed Uttanka:" |
| `Line 1766: उत्तङ्कैतत्पुरीषमस्य ऋषभस्य भक्षयस्वेति | १०२ |` | "Uttanka, eat this dung of this bull. |102|" |
| `Line 1767: स एवमुक्तो नैच्छत् | १०३ |` | "Thus addressed, he refused. |103|" |
| `Line 1768: तमाह पुरुषो भूयः |` | "The man spoke to him again:" |
| `Line 1769: भक्षयस्वोत्तङ्क |` | "Eat it, Uttanka." |
| `Line 1770: मा विचारय |` | "Do not hesitate." |
| `Line 1771: उपाध्यायेनापि ते भक्षितं पूर्वमिति | १०४ |` | "Your teacher also ate it before. |104|" |
| `Line 1772: स एवमुक्तो बाढमित्युक्त्वा तदा तदृषभस्य पुरीषं मूत्रं च भक्षयित्वोत्तङ्कः प्रतस्थे यत्र स क्षत्रियः पौष्यः | १०५ |` | "Thus addressed, saying 'Very well,' Uttanka then ate the dung and urine of that bull and proceeded to where King Paushya was. |105|" |
| `Line 1773: तमुपेत्यापश्यदुत्तङ्क आसीनम् |` | "Approaching, Uttanka saw him seated." |
| `Line 1774: स तमुपेत्याशीर्भिरभिनन्द्योवाच |` | "He approached him, greeted him with blessings, and said:" |
| `Line 1775: अर्थी भवन्तमुपगतोऽस्मीति | १०६ |` | "I have come to you as a petitioner. |106|" |
translations: | `Line 1751: भवत्युपाध्यायेनास्म्यनुज्ञातो गृहं गन्तुम् |` | "I have been permitted by your honorable teacher to go home." |
| `Line 1752: तदिच्छामीष्टं ते गुर्वर्थमुपहृत्यानृणो गन्तुम् |` | "Therefore, I wish to bring a suitable gift for the teacher and depart free from debt." |
| `Line 1753: तदाज्ञापयतु भवती |` | "So please instruct me, respected lady [teacher's wife]." |
| `Line 1754: किमुपहरामि गुर्वर्थमिति | ०९९ |` | "What should I bring as a gift for the teacher? |099|" |
| `Line 1755: सैवमुक्तोपाध्यायिन्युत्तङ्कं प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, the teacher's wife replied to Uttanka:" |
| `Line 1756: गच्छ पौष्यं राजानम् |` | "Go to King Paushya." |
| `Line 1757: भिक्षस्व तस्य क्षत्रियया पिनद्धे कुण्डले |` | "Request the earrings worn by his queen [Kshatriya woman]." |
| `Line 1758: ते आनयस्व |` | "Bring those here." |
| `Line 1759: इतश्चतुर्थेऽहनि पुण्यकं भविता |` | "Four days from now there will be an auspicious ceremony [punyaka]." |
| `Line 1760: ताभ्यामाबद्धाभ्यां ब्राह्मणान्परिवेष्टुमिच्छामि |` | "I wish to serve the Brahmins while wearing those earrings." |
| `Line 1761: शोभमाना यथा ताभ्यां कुण्डलाभ्यां तस्मिन्नहनि सम्पादयस्व |` | "Ensure that I am adorned with those earrings on that day." |
| `Line 1762: श्रेयो हि ते स्यात्क्षणं कुर्वत इति | १०० |` | "It will be auspicious for you if you accomplish this task. |100|" |
| `Line 1763: स एवमुक्त उपाध्यायिन्या प्रातिष्ठतोत्तङ्कः |` | "Thus instructed by the teacher's wife, Uttanka set forth." |
| `Line 1764: स पथि गच्छन्नपश्यदृषभमतिप्रमाणं तमधिरूढं च पुरुषमतिप्रमाणमेव | १०१ |` | "While going along the path, he saw an enormous bull and a man of enormous size mounted on it. |101|" |
| `Line 1765: स पुरुष उत्तङ्कमभ्यभाषत |` | "That man addressed Uttanka:" |
| `Line 1766: उत्तङ्कैतत्पुरीषमस्य ऋषभस्य भक्षयस्वेति | १०२ |` | "Uttanka, eat this dung of this bull. |102|" |
| `Line 1767: स एवमुक्तो नैच्छत् | १०३ |` | "Thus addressed, he refused. |103|" |
| `Line 1768: तमाह पुरुषो भूयः |` | "The man spoke to him again:" |
| `Line 1769: भक्षयस्वोत्तङ्क |` | "Eat it, Uttanka." |
| `Line 1770: मा विचारय |` | "Do not hesitate." |
| `Line 1771: उपाध्यायेनापि ते भक्षितं पूर्वमिति | १०४ |` | "Your teacher also ate it before. |104|" |

| `Line 1772: स एवमुक्तो बाढमित्युक्त्वा तदा तदृषभस्य पुरीषं मूत्रं च भक्षयित्वोत्तङ्कः प्रतस्थे यत्र स क्षत्रियः पौष्यः | १०५ |` | "Thus addressed, saying 'Very well,' Uttanka then ate the dung and urine of that bull and proceeded to where King Paushya was. |105|" |
| `Line 1773: तमुपेत्यापश्यदुत्तङ्क आसीनम् |` | "Approaching, Uttanka saw him seated." |
| `Line 1774: स तमुपेत्याशीर्भिरभिनन्द्योवाच |` | "He approached him, greeted him with blessings, and said:" |
| `Line 1775: अर्थी भवन्तमुपगतोऽस्मीति | १०६ |` | "I have come to you as a petitioner. |106|" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 176: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 177: पराशरात्मजो विद्वान्ब्रह्मर्षिः संशितव्रतः |` | "The learned son of Parāśara, a brahmarṣi [sage of highest order], of firm vows," |
| `Line 178: मातुर्नियोगाद्धर्मात्मा गाङ्गेयस्य च धीमतः ||५३||` | "By the command of his mother and of the wise Gāṅgeya [son of Gaṅgā], that righteous soul. ||53||" |
| `Line 179: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 180: क्षेत्रे विचित्रवीर्यस्य कृष्णद्वैपायनः पुरा |` | "In the field [wife] of Vicitravīrya, Kṛṣṇa Dvaipāyana [Vyāsa] formerly," |
| `Line 181: त्रीनग्नीनिव कौरव्याञ्जनयामास वीर्यवान् ||५४||` | "Like three sacred fires, begot the Kauravya princes, that powerful sage. ||54||" |
| `Line 182: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 183: उत्पाद्य धृतराष्ट्रं च पाण्डुं विदुरमेव च |` | "Having begotten Dhṛtarāṣṭra, Pāṇḍu, and Vidura," |
| `Line 184: जगाम तपसे धीमान्पुनरेवाश्रमं प्रति ||५५||` | "The wise one went again to his hermitage for performing austerities. ||55||" |
| `Line 185: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 186: तेषु जातेषु वृद्धेषु गतेषु परमां गतिम् |` | "When they were born, had grown up, and had attained the supreme state [death]," |
| `Line 187: अब्रवीद्भारतं लोके मानुषेऽस्मिन्महानृषिः ||५६||` | "The great sage narrated the Bhārata in this world of humans. ||56||" |
| `Line 188: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 189: जनमेजयेन पृष्टः सन्ब्राह्मणैश्च सहस्रशः |` | "Being asked by Janamejaya and by thousands of Brāhmaṇas [priests]," |
| `Line 190: शशास शिष्यमासीनं वैशम्पायनमन्तिके ||५७||` | "He instructed his disciple Vaiśampāyana who was seated nearby. ||57||" |
| `Line 191: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 192: स सदस्यैः सहासीनः श्रावयामास भारतम् |` | "He, seated with the assembly members, recited the Bhārata," |
| `Line 193: कर्मान्तरेषु यज्ञस्य चोद्यमानः पुनः पुनः ||५८||` | "Being repeatedly requested during the intervals of the sacrifice. ||58||" |
| `Line 194: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 195: विस्तरं कुरुवंशस्य गान्धार्या धर्मशीलताम् |` | "The detailed account of the Kuru lineage, the righteousness of Gāndhārī [Dhritarashtra's wife]," |
| `Line 196: क्षत्तुः प्रज्ञां धृतिं कुन्त्याः सम्यग्द्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् ||५९||` | "The wisdom of Kṣattṛ [Vidura] and the steadfastness of Kuntī—Dvaipāyana narrated all this properly. ||59||" |
| `Line 197: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 198: वासुदेवस्य माहात्म्यं पाण्डवानां च सत्यताम् |` | "The greatness of Vāsudeva [Krishna] and the truthfulness of the Pāṇḍavas," |
| `Line 199: दुर्वृत्तं धार्तराष्ट्राणामुक्तवान्भगवानृषिः ||६०||` | "The evil conduct of the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra—the venerable sage narrated. ||60||" |
| `Line 200: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 176: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 178: मातुर्नियोगाद्धर्मात्मा गाङ्गेयस्य च धीमतः ||५३||` | "By the command of his mother and of the wise Gāṅgeya [son of Gaṅgā], that righteous soul. ||53||" |
| `Line 179: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 180: क्षेत्रे विचित्रवीर्यस्य कृष्णद्वैपायनः पुरा |` | "In the field [wife] of Vicitravīrya, Kṛṣṇa Dvaipāyana [Vyāsa] formerly," |
| `Line 181: त्रीनग्नीनिव कौरव्याञ्जनयामास वीर्यवान् ||५४||` | "Like three sacred fires, begot the Kauravya princes, that powerful sage. ||54||" |
| `Line 182: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 184: जगाम तपसे धीमान्पुनरेवाश्रमं प्रति ||५५||` | "The wise one went again to his hermitage for performing austerities. ||55||" |
| `Line 185: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 186: तेषु जातेषु वृद्धेषु गतेषु परमां गतिम् |` | "When they were born, had grown up, and had attained the supreme state [death]," |
| `Line 187: अब्रवीद्भारतं लोके मानुषेऽस्मिन्महानृषिः ||५६||` | "The great sage narrated the Bhārata in this world of humans. ||56||" |
| `Line 188: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 189: जनमेजयेन पृष्टः सन्ब्राह्मणैश्च सहस्रशः |` | "Being asked by Janamejaya and by thousands of Brāhmaṇas [priests]," |
| `Line 190: शशास शिष्यमासीनं वैशम्पायनमन्तिके ||५७||` | "He instructed his disciple Vaiśampāyana who was seated nearby. ||57||" |
| `Line 191: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 192: स सदस्यैः सहासीनः श्रावयामास भारतम् |` | "He, seated with the assembly members, recited the Bhārata," |
| `Line 193: कर्मान्तरेषु यज्ञस्य चोद्यमानः पुनः पुनः ||५८||` | "Being repeatedly requested during the intervals of the sacrifice. ||58||" |

| `Line 195: विस्तरं कुरुवंशस्य गान्धार्या धर्मशीलताम् |` | "The detailed account of the Kuru lineage, the righteousness of Gāndhārī [Dhritarashtra's wife]," |
| `Line 196: क्षत्तुः प्रज्ञां धृतिं कुन्त्याः सम्यग्द्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् ||५९||` | "The wisdom of Kṣattṛ [Vidura] and the steadfastness of Kuntī—Dvaipāyana narrated all this properly. ||59||" |
| `Line 197: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 198: वासुदेवस्य माहात्म्यं पाण्डवानां च सत्यताम् |` | "The greatness of Vāsudeva [Krishna] and the truthfulness of the Pāṇḍavas," |
| `Line 199: दुर्वृत्तं धार्तराष्ट्राणामुक्तवान्भगवानृषिः ||६०||` | "The evil conduct of the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra—the venerable sage narrated. ||60||" |
