|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1776: स एनमभिवाद्योवाच |` | "He greeted him respectfully and said:" |
| `Line 1777: भगवन्पौष्यः खल्वहम् |` | "Venerable sir, I am Paushya [a king]." |
| `Line 1778: किं करवाणीति | १०७ |` | "What can I do for you? |107|" |
| `Line 1779: तमुवाचोत्तङ्कः |` | "Uttanka said to him:" |
| `Line 1780: गुर्वर्थे कुण्डलाभ्यामर्थ्यागतोऽस्मीति ये ते क्षत्रियया पिनद्धे कुण्डले ते भवान्दातुमर्हतीति | १०८ |` | "I have come to request the earrings for my teacher's sake. Those earrings worn by your queen [kshatriya wife], you should give them to me. |108|" |
| `Line 1781: तं पौष्यः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Paushya replied to him:" |
| `Line 1782: प्रविश्यान्तःपुरं क्षत्रिया याच्यतामिति | १०९ |` | "Enter the inner chambers and ask the queen yourself. |109|" |
| `Line 1783: स तेनैवमुक्तः प्रविश्यान्तःपुरं क्षत्रियां नापश्यत् | ११० |` | "Having been thus instructed by him, he entered the inner chambers but did not see the queen. |110|" |
| `Line 1784: स पौष्यं पुनरुवाच |` | "He said again to Paushya:" |
| `Line 1785: न युक्तं भवता वयमनृतेनोपचरितुम् |` | "It is not proper for you to deceive us with falsehood." |
| `Line 1786: न हि ते क्षत्रियान्तःपुरे संनिहिता |` | "Your queen is not present in the inner chambers." |
| `Line 1787: नैनां पश्यामीति | १११ |` | "I do not see her. |111|" |
| `Line 1788: स एवमुक्तः पौष्यस्तं प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, Paushya replied to him:" |
| `Line 1789: सम्प्रति भवानुच्छिष्टः |` | "At present you are impure [with food remnants]." |
| `Line 1790: स्मर तावत् |` | "Think about it for a moment." |
| `Line 1791: न हि सा क्षत्रिया उच्छिष्टेनाशुचिना वा शक्या द्रष्टुम् |` | "Indeed, the queen cannot be seen by someone who is impure or has food remnants." |
| `Line 1792: पतिव्रतात्वादेषा नाशुचेर्दर्शनमुपैतीति | ११२ |` | "Because of her devotion to her husband, she does not appear before one who is impure. |112|" |
| `Line 1793: अथैवमुक्त उत्तङ्कः स्मृत्वोवाच |` | "Then, thus addressed, Uttanka remembered and said:" |
| `Line 1794: अस्ति खलु मयोच्छिष्टेनोपस्पृष्टं शीघ्रं गच्छता चेति | ११३ |` | "Indeed, I did touch food remnants while hurrying here. |113|" |
| `Line 1795: तं पौष्यः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Paushya said to him:" |
| `Line 1796: एतत्तदेवं हि |` | "That is indeed so." |
| `Line 1797: न गच्छतोपस्पृष्टं भवति न स्थितेनेति | ११४ |` | "One should not touch food remnants while walking or standing. |114|" |
| `Line 1798: अथोत्तङ्कस्तथेत्युक्त्वा प्राङ्मुख उपविश्य सुप्रक्षालितपाणिपादवदनोऽशब्दाभिर् हृदयङ्गमाभिरद्भिरुपस्पृश्य त्रिः पीत्वा द्विः परिमृज्य खान्यद्भिरुपस्पृश्यान्तःपुरं प्रविश्य तां क्षत्रियामपश्यत् | ११५ |` | "Then Uttanka, saying 'So be it,' sat facing east, thoroughly washed his hands, feet, and face, sipped water silently that was pleasing to the heart, drank thrice, wiped twice, touched the bodily apertures with water, and entering the inner chambers, he saw the queen. |115|" |
| `Line 1799: सा च दृष्ट्वैवोत्तङ्कमभ्युत्थायाभिवाद्योवाच |` | "And she, upon seeing Uttanka, rose up, greeted him respectfully and said:" |
| `Line 1800: स्वागतं ते भगवन् |` | "Welcome to you, venerable sir." |

| `Line 1798: अथोत्तङ्कस्तथेत्युक्त्वा प्राङ्मुख उपविश्य सुप्रक्षालितपाणिपादवदनोऽशब्दाभिर् हृदयङ्गमाभिरद्भिरुपस्पृश्य त्रिः पीत्वा द्विः परिमृज्य खान्यद्भिरुपस्पृश्यान्तःपुरं प्रविश्य तां क्षत्रियामपश्यत् | ११५ |` | "Then Uttanka, saying 'So be it,' sat facing east, thoroughly washed his hands, feet, and face, sipped water silently that was pleasing to the heart, drank thrice, wiped twice, touched the bodily apertures with water, and entering the inner chambers, he saw the queen. |115|" |

| `Line 1801: आज्ञापय किं करवाणीति | ११६ |` | "Command me, what shall I do? |116|" |
| `Line 1802: स तामुवाच |` | "He said to her:" |
| `Line 1803: एते कुण्डले गुर्वर्थं मे भिक्षिते दातुमर्हसीति | ११७ |` | "You should give me these earrings which I am begging for my teacher's sake. |117|" |
| `Line 1804: सा प्रीता तेन तस्य सद्भावेन पात्रमयमनतिक्रमणीयश्चेति मत्वा ते कुण्डले अवमुच्यास्मै प्रायच्छत् | ११८ |` | "She, pleased with his sincerity and thinking 'he is a worthy recipient who should not be refused,' removed those earrings and gave them to him. |118|" |
| `Line 1805: आह चैनम् |` | "And she said to him:" |
| `Line 1806: एते कुण्डले तक्षको नागराजः प्रार्थयति |` | "Takshaka, the serpent king [naga ruler], desires these earrings." |
| `Line 1807: अप्रमत्तो नेतुमर्हसीति | ११९ |` | "You should carry them vigilantly. |119|" |
| `Line 1808: स एवमुक्तस्तां क्षत्रियां प्रत्युवाच |` | "Having been thus addressed, he replied to that Kshatriya woman [warrior class]:" |
| `Line 1809: भवति सुनिर्वृता भव |` | "Lady, be at ease." |
| `Line 1810: न मां शक्तस्तक्षको नागराजो धर्षयितुमिति | १२० |` | "Takshaka, the serpent king, is not capable of assailing me. |120|" |
| `Line 1811: स एवमुक्त्वा तां क्षत्रियामामन्त्र्य पौष्यसकाशमागच्छत् | १२१ |` | "Having spoken thus and taking leave of that Kshatriya woman, he went to Paushya. |121|" |
| `Line 1812: स तं दृष्ट्वोवाच |` | "Seeing him, he said:" |
| `Line 1813: भोः पौष्य प्रीतोऽस्मीति | १२२ |` | "O Paushya, I am pleased. |122|" |
| `Line 1814: तं पौष्यः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Paushya replied to him:" |
| `Line 1815: भगवंश्चिरस्य पात्रमासाद्यते |` | "Venerable sir, after a long time a worthy recipient has arrived." |
| `Line 1816: भवांश्च गुणवानतिथिः |` | "And you are a virtuous guest." |
| `Line 1817: तत्करिष्ये श्राद्धम् |` | "Therefore, I will perform a Shraddha [ancestral rite]." |
| `Line 1818: क्षणः क्रियतामिति | १२३ |` | "Please wait a moment. |123|" |
| `Line 1819: तमुत्तङ्कः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Uttanka replied to him:" |
| `Line 1820: कृतक्षण एवास्मि |` | "I have already waited enough." |
| `Line 1821: शीघ्रमिच्छामि यथोपपन्नमन्नमुपहृतं भवतेति | १२४ |` | "I wish that whatever food is readily available be quickly brought to me. |124|" |
| `Line 1822: स तथेत्युक्त्वा यथोपपन्नेनान्नेनैनं भोजयामास | १२५ |` | "Having said 'so be it,' he fed him with whatever food was available. |125|" |
| `Line 1823: अथोत्तङ्कः शीतमन्नं सकेशं दृष्ट्वा अशुच्येतदिति मत्वा पौष्यमुवाच |` | "Then Uttanka, seeing the food was cold and had hair in it, thinking 'this is impure,' said to Paushya:" |
| `Line 1824: यस्मान्मे अशुच्यन्नं ददासि तस्मदन्धो भविष्यसीति | १२६ |` | "Since you give me impure food, you shall become blind. |126|" |
| `Line 1825: तं पौष्यः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Paushya replied to him:" |
translations: | `Line 1801: आज्ञापय किं करवाणीति | ११६ |` | "Command me, what shall I do? |116|" |

| `Line 1804: सा प्रीता तेन तस्य सद्भावेन पात्रमयमनतिक्रमणीयश्चेति मत्वा ते कुण्डले अवमुच्यास्मै प्रायच्छत् | ११८ |` | "She, pleased with his sincerity and thinking 'he is a worthy recipient who should not be refused,' removed those earrings and gave them to him. |118|" |

| `Line 1807: अप्रमत्तो नेतुमर्हसीति | ११९ |` | "You should carry them vigilantly. |119|" |
| `Line 1808: स एवमुक्तस्तां क्षत्रियां प्रत्युवाच |` | "Having been thus addressed, he replied to that Kshatriya woman [warrior class]:" |
| `Line 1809: भवति सुनिर्वृता भव |` | "Lady, be at ease." |
| `Line 1810: न मां शक्तस्तक्षको नागराजो धर्षयितुमिति | १२० |` | "Takshaka, the serpent king, is not capable of assailing me. |120|" |
| `Line 1811: स एवमुक्त्वा तां क्षत्रियामामन्त्र्य पौष्यसकाशमागच्छत् | १२१ |` | "Having spoken thus and taking leave of that Kshatriya woman, he went to Paushya. |121|" |
| `Line 1812: स तं दृष्ट्वोवाच |` | "Seeing him, he said:" |
| `Line 1813: भोः पौष्य प्रीतोऽस्मीति | १२२ |` | "O Paushya, I am pleased. |122|" |
| `Line 1814: तं पौष्यः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Paushya replied to him:" |
| `Line 1815: भगवंश्चिरस्य पात्रमासाद्यते |` | "Venerable sir, after a long time a worthy recipient has arrived." |
| `Line 1816: भवांश्च गुणवानतिथिः |` | "And you are a virtuous guest." |
| `Line 1817: तत्करिष्ये श्राद्धम् |` | "Therefore, I will perform a Shraddha [ancestral rite]." |
| `Line 1818: क्षणः क्रियतामिति | १२३ |` | "Please wait a moment. |123|" |
| `Line 1819: तमुत्तङ्कः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Uttanka replied to him:" |
| `Line 1820: कृतक्षण एवास्मि |` | "I have already waited enough." |
| `Line 1821: शीघ्रमिच्छामि यथोपपन्नमन्नमुपहृतं भवतेति | १२४ |` | "I wish that whatever food is readily available be quickly brought to me. |124|" |
| `Line 1822: स तथेत्युक्त्वा यथोपपन्नेनान्नेनैनं भोजयामास | १२५ |` | "Having said 'so be it,' he fed him with whatever food was available. |125|" |
| `Line 1823: अथोत्तङ्कः शीतमन्नं सकेशं दृष्ट्वा अशुच्येतदिति मत्वा पौष्यमुवाच |` | "Then Uttanka, seeing the food was cold and had hair in it, thinking 'this is impure,' said to Paushya:" |
| `Line 1824: यस्मान्मे अशुच्यन्नं ददासि तस्मदन्धो भविष्यसीति | १२६ |` | "Since you give me impure food, you shall become blind. |126|" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1826: यस्मात्त्वमप्यदुष्टमन्नं दूषयसि तस्मादनपत्यो भविष्यसीति | १२७ |` | "Since you too defame food that is not defiled, therefore you shall be childless. |127|" |
| `Line 1827: सोऽथ पौष्यस्तस्याशुचिभावमन्नस्यागमयामास | १२८ |` | "Then Paushya [the teacher] verified the impurity of that food. |128|" |
| `Line 1828: अथ तदन्नं मुक्तकेश्या स्त्रियोपहृतं सकेशमशुचि मत्वोत्तङ्कं प्रसादयामास |` | "Then, realizing that the food brought by a woman with loose hair contained hair and was impure, he appeased Uttanka." |
| `Line 1829: भगवन्नज्ञानादेतदन्नं सकेशमुपहृतं शीतं च |` | "Venerable sir, through ignorance this food was brought with hair in it and cold." |
| `Line 1830: तत्क्षामये भवन्तम् |` | "For that I beg your pardon." |
| `Line 1831: न भवेयमन्ध इति | १२९ |` | "May I not become blind. |129|" |
| `Line 1832: तमुत्तङ्कः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Uttanka replied to him:" |
| `Line 1833: न मृषा ब्रवीमि |` | "I do not speak falsely." |
| `Line 1834: भूत्वा त्वमन्धो नचिरादनन्धो भविष्यसीति |` | "You will become blind, but before long you will regain your sight." |
| `Line 1835: ममापि शापो न भवेद्भवता दत्त इति | १३० |` | "And may the curse given by you to me not take effect. |130|" |
| `Line 1836: तं पौष्यः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Paushya replied to him:" |
| `Line 1837: नाहं शक्तः शापं प्रत्यादातुम् |` | "I am not able to take back the curse." |
| `Line 1838: न हि मे मन्युरद्याप्युपशमं गच्छति |` | "For my anger has not yet subsided." |
| `Line 1839: किं चैतद्भवता न ज्ञायते यथा | १३१ |` | "And do you not know this, that: |131|" |
| `Line 1840: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1841: नावनीतं हृदयं ब्राह्मणस्य; वाचि क्षुरो निहितस्तीक्ष्णधारः |` | "The heart of a Brahmin is like butter, but a sharp-edged razor is placed in his speech." |
| `Line 1842: विपरीतमेतदुभयं क्षत्रियस्य; वाङ्नावनीती हृदयं तीक्ष्णधारम् ||१३२||` | "For a Kshatriya [warrior class], both these are reversed: his speech is like butter, but his heart has a sharp edge. ||132||" |
| `Line 1843: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1844: इति |` | "Thus." |
| `Line 1845: तदेवं गते न शक्तोऽहं तीक्ष्णहृदयत्वात्तं शापमन्यथा कर्तुम् |` | "This being so, I am unable, due to my sharp-heartedness, to alter that curse." |
| `Line 1846: गम्यतामिति | १३३ |` | "You may go. |133|" |
| `Line 1847: तमुत्तङ्कः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Uttanka replied to him:" |
| `Line 1848: भवताहमन्नस्याशुचिभावमागमय्य प्रत्यनुनीतः |` | "After verifying the impurity of the food, you have apologized to me." |
| `Line 1849: प्राक्च तेऽभिहितम् |` | "And previously you said to me:" |
| `Line 1850: यस्माददुष्टमन्नं दूषयसि तस्मादनपत्यो भविष्यसीति |` | "'Since you defame food that is not defiled, therefore you shall be childless.'" |

| `Line 1827: सोऽथ पौष्यस्तस्याशुचिभावमन्नस्यागमयामास | १२८ |` | "Then Paushya [the teacher] verified the impurity of that food. |128|" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1851: दुष्टे चान्ने नैष मम शापो भविष्यतीति | १३४ |` | "And if the food is spoiled, this curse of mine will not take effect. |134|" |
| `Line 1852: साधयामस्तावदित्युक्त्वा प्रातिष्ठतोत्तङ्कस्ते कुण्डले गृहीत्वा | १३५ |` | "Having said, 'I will accomplish this,' Uttanka departed, taking those earrings. |135|" |
| `Line 1853: सोऽपश्यत्पथि नग्नं श्रमणमागच्छन्तं मुहुर्मुहुर्दृश्यमानमदृश्यमानं च |` | "On the way, he saw a naked ascetic [śramaṇa] approaching, who was repeatedly appearing and disappearing." |
| `Line 1854: अथोत्तङ्कस्ते कुण्डले भूमौ निक्षिप्योदकार्थं प्रचक्रमे | १३६ |` | "Then Uttanka, placing those earrings on the ground, proceeded to get water. |136|" |
| `Line 1855: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे स श्रमणस्त्वरमाण उपसृत्य ते कुण्डले गृहीत्वा प्राद्रवत् |` | "Meanwhile, that ascetic, approaching hurriedly, took those earrings and ran away." |
| `Line 1856: तमुत्तङ्कोऽभिसृत्य जग्राह |` | "Uttanka, rushing after him, seized him." |
| `Line 1857: स तद्रूपं विहाय तक्षकरूपं कृत्वा सहसा धरण्यां विवृतं महाबिलं विवेश | १३७ |` | "He, abandoning that form and taking the form of Takshaka [serpent king], suddenly entered a large hole that opened in the earth. |137|" |
| `Line 1858: प्रविश्य च नागलोकं स्वभवनमगच्छत् |` | "And having entered the realm of serpents [nāga-loka], he went to his own abode." |
| `Line 1859: तमुत्तङ्कोऽन्वाविवेश तेनैव बिलेन |` | "Uttanka followed him through that very hole." |
| `Line 1860: प्रविश्य च नागानस्तुवदेभिः श्लोकैः | १३८ |` | "And having entered, he praised the serpents with these verses: |138|" |
| `Line 1861:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1862: य ऐरावतराजानः सर्पाः समितिशोभनाः |` | "Those serpent kings of Airāvata lineage [noble serpent race], who are splendid in assemblies," |
| `Line 1863: वर्षन्त इव जीमूताः सविद्युत्पवनेरिताः ||१३९||` | "Are like rain clouds driven by wind with lightning. ||139||" |
| `Line 1864:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1865: सुरूपाश्च विरूपाश्च तथा कल्माषकुण्डलाः |` | "Both beautiful and misshapen, as well as those with spotted coils," |
| `Line 1866: आदित्यवन्नाकपृष्ठे रेजुरैरावतोद्भवाः ||१४०||` | "The descendants of Airāvata shine in the vault of heaven like the sun. ||140||" |
| `Line 1867:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1868: बहूनि नागवर्त्मानि गङ्गायास्तीर उत्तरे |` | "Many are the paths of serpents on the northern bank of the Ganges [sacred river]," |
| `Line 1869: इच्छेत्कोऽर्कांशुसेनायां चर्तुमैरावतं विना ||१४१||` | "Who would wish to move in the army of the sun's rays without Airāvata? ||141||" |
| `Line 1870:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1871: शतान्यशीतिरष्टौ च सहस्राणि च विंशतिः |` | "Eighty-eight hundreds and twenty thousand," |
| `Line 1872: सर्पाणां प्रग्रहा यान्ति धृतराष्ट्रो यदेजति ||१४२||` | "Serpents move as attendants when Dhritarashtra [serpent king] stirs. ||142||" |
| `Line 1873:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1874: ये चैनमुपसर्पन्ति ये च दूरं परं गताः |` | "Those who approach him and those who have gone far away," |
| `Line 1875: अहमैरावतज्येष्ठभ्रातृभ्योऽकरवं नमः ||१४३||` | "I offer salutations to the elder brothers of Airāvata. ||143||" |
translations: | `Line 1851: दुष्टे चान्ने नैष मम शापो भविष्यतीति | १३४ |` | "And if the food is spoiled, this curse of mine will not take effect. |134|" |
| `Line 1852: साधयामस्तावदित्युक्त्वा प्रातिष्ठतोत्तङ्कस्ते कुण्डले गृहीत्वा | १३५ |` | "Having said, 'I will accomplish this,' Uttanka departed, taking those earrings. |135|" |
| `Line 1853: सोऽपश्यत्पथि नग्नं श्रमणमागच्छन्तं मुहुर्मुहुर्दृश्यमानमदृश्यमानं च |` | "On the way, he saw a naked ascetic [śramaṇa] approaching, who was repeatedly appearing and disappearing." |
| `Line 1854: अथोत्तङ्कस्ते कुण्डले भूमौ निक्षिप्योदकार्थं प्रचक्रमे | १३६ |` | "Then Uttanka, placing those earrings on the ground, proceeded to get water. |136|" |
| `Line 1855: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे स श्रमणस्त्वरमाण उपसृत्य ते कुण्डले गृहीत्वा प्राद्रवत् |` | "Meanwhile, that ascetic, approaching hurriedly, took those earrings and ran away." |
| `Line 1856: तमुत्तङ्कोऽभिसृत्य जग्राह |` | "Uttanka, rushing after him, seized him." |

| `Line 1857: स तद्रूपं विहाय तक्षकरूपं कृत्वा सहसा धरण्यां विवृतं महाबिलं विवेश | १३७ |` | "He, abandoning that form and taking the form of Takshaka [serpent king], suddenly entered a large hole that opened in the earth. |137|" |
| `Line 1858: प्रविश्य च नागलोकं स्वभवनमगच्छत् |` | "And having entered the realm of serpents [nāga-loka], he went to his own abode." |
| `Line 1859: तमुत्तङ्कोऽन्वाविवेश तेनैव बिलेन |` | "Uttanka followed him through that very hole." |
| `Line 1860: प्रविश्य च नागानस्तुवदेभिः श्लोकैः | १३८ |` | "And having entered, he praised the serpents with these verses: |138|" |
| `Line 1861:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1862: य ऐरावतराजानः सर्पाः समितिशोभनाः |` | "Those serpent kings of Airāvata lineage [noble serpent race], who are splendid in assemblies," |
| `Line 1863: वर्षन्त इव जीमूताः सविद्युत्पवनेरिताः ||१३९||` | "Are like rain clouds driven by wind with lightning. ||139||" |
| `Line 1864:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1865: सुरूपाश्च विरूपाश्च तथा कल्माषकुण्डलाः |` | "Both beautiful and misshapen, as well as those with spotted coils," |
| `Line 1866: आदित्यवन्नाकपृष्ठे रेजुरैरावतोद्भवाः ||१४०||` | "The descendants of Airāvata shine in the vault of heaven like the sun. ||140||" |
| `Line 1867:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1868: बहूनि नागवर्त्मानि गङ्गायास्तीर उत्तरे |` | "Many are the paths of serpents on the northern bank of the Ganges [sacred river]," |
| `Line 1869: इच्छेत्कोऽर्कांशुसेनायां चर्तुमैरावतं विना ||१४१||` | "Who would wish to move in the army of the sun's rays without Airāvata? ||141||" |
| `Line 1870:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1871: शतान्यशीतिरष्टौ च सहस्राणि च विंशतिः |` | "Eighty-eight hundreds and twenty thousand," |
| `Line 1872: सर्पाणां प्रग्रहा यान्ति धृतराष्ट्रो यदेजति ||१४२||` | "Serpents move as attendants when Dhritarashtra [serpent king] stirs. ||142||" |
| `Line 1873:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1874: ये चैनमुपसर्पन्ति ये च दूरं परं गताः |` | "Those who approach him and those who have gone far away," |
| `Line 1875: अहमैरावतज्येष्ठभ्रातृभ्योऽकरवं नमः ||१४३||` | "I offer salutations to the elder brothers of Airāvata. ||143||" |

| `Line 1876: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1877: यस्य वासः कुरुक्षेत्रे खाण्डवे चाभवत्सदा |` | "Whose dwelling was always in Kurukshetra [sacred battlefield] and in Khandava [forest region]," |
| `Line 1878: तं काद्रवेयमस्तौषं कुण्डलार्थाय तक्षकम् ||१४४||` | "I praised that Kadraveya [son of Kadru] Takshaka for the sake of the earrings. ||144||" |
| `Line 1879: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1880: तक्षकश्चाश्वसेनश्च नित्यं सहचरावुभौ |` | "Both Takshaka and Ashvasena [snake king's son], always companions together," |
| `Line 1881: कुरुक्षेत्रे निवसतां नदीमिक्षुमतीमनु ||१४५||` | "Dwelling in Kurukshetra along the river Ikshumati [sugarcane river]. ||145||" |
| `Line 1882: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1883: जघन्यजस्तक्षकस्य श्रुतसेनेति यः श्रुतः |` | "The younger-born of Takshaka, who is known as Shrutasena [famed army]," |
| `Line 1884: अवसद्यो महद्द्युम्नि प्रार्थयन्नागमुख्यताम् ||१४६||` | "Who dwelled in Mahaddyumni [great splendor], aspiring for leadership among the nagas [serpents]. ||146||" |
| `Line 1885: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1886: करवाणि सदा चाहं नमस्तस्मै महात्मने ||१४६||` | "I always offer salutations to that great soul. ||146||" |
| `Line 1887: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1888: एवं स्तुवन्नपि नागान्यदा ते कुण्डले नालभदथापश्यत्स्त्रियौ तन्त्रे अधिरोप्य पटं वयन्त्यौ | १४७ |` | "Even while praising the nagas thus, when he did not obtain those earrings, he then saw two women weaving cloth on a loom. |147|" |
| `Line 1889: तस्मिंश्च तन्त्रे कृष्णाः सिताश्च तन्तवः |` | "And on that loom were black and white threads," |
| `Line 1890: चक्रं चापश्यत्षड्भिः कुमारैः परिवर्त्यमानम् |` | "And he saw a wheel being rotated by six youths," |
| `Line 1891: पुरुषं चापश्यद्दर्शनीयम् | १४८ |` | "And he saw a handsome man. |148|" |
| `Line 1892: स तान्सर्वांस्तुष्टाव एभिर्मन्त्रवादश्लोकैः | १४९ |` | "He praised them all with these mantra-verses: |149|" |
| `Line 1893: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1894: त्रीण्यर्पितान्यत्र शतानि मध्ये; षष्टिश्च नित्यं चरति ध्रुवेऽस्मिन् |` | "Three hundred are fixed here in the middle; and sixty constantly move in this fixed (wheel)," |
| `Line 1895: चक्रे चतुर्विंशतिपर्वयोगे; षड्यत्कुमाराः परिवर्तयन्ति ||१५०||` | "In this wheel with twenty-four divisions, which six youths rotate. ||150||" |
| `Line 1896: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1897: तन्त्रं चेदं विश्वरूपं युवत्यौ; वयतस्तन्तून्सततं वर्तयन्त्यौ |` | "And these two young women weave this universal-formed loom, constantly turning the threads," |
| `Line 1898: कृष्णान्सितांश्चैव विवर्तयन्त्यौ; भूतान्यजस्रं भुवनानि चैव ||१५१||` | "Weaving the black and white threads, (representing) beings and worlds continuously. ||151||" |
| `Line 1899: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1900: वज्रस्य भर्ता भुवनस्य गोप्ता; वृत्रस्य हन्ता नमुचेर्निहन्ता |` | "The wielder of the thunderbolt [Indra], the protector of the world, the slayer of Vritra [demon], the destroyer of Namuchi [demon]," |

| `Line 1879: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 1883: जघन्यजस्तक्षकस्य श्रुतसेनेति यः श्रुतः |` | "The younger-born of Takshaka, who is known as Shrutasena [famed army]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1901: कृष्णे वसानो वसने महात्मा; सत्यानृते यो विविनक्ति लोके ||१५२||` | "The great soul who wears dark garments, who distinguishes between truth and falsehood in the world. ||152||" |
| `Line 1902: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1903: यो वाजिनं गर्भमपां पुराणं; वैश्वानरं वाहनमभ्युपेतः |` | "Who has approached the ancient horse-embryo of the waters, Vaishvanara [universal fire] as his vehicle." |
| `Line 1904: नमः सदास्मै जगदीश्वराय; लोकत्रयेशाय पुरंदराय ||१५३||` | "Salutations always to him, the lord of the universe, the ruler of the three worlds, the destroyer of cities [Indra]. ||153||" |
| `Line 1905: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1906: ततः स एनं पुरुषः प्राह |` | "Then that person said to him:" |
| `Line 1907: प्रीतोऽस्मि तेऽहमनेन स्तोत्रेण |` | "I am pleased with you by this hymn of praise." |
| `Line 1908: किं ते प्रियं करवाणीति | १५४ |` | "What favor shall I do for you? |154|" |
| `Line 1909: स तमुवाच |` | "He said to him:" |
| `Line 1910: नागा मे वशमीयुरिति | १५५ |` | "Let the Nagas [serpent beings] come under my control. |155|" |
| `Line 1911: स एनं पुरुषः पुनरुवाच |` | "That person said to him again:" |
| `Line 1912: एतमश्वमपाने धमस्वेति | १५६ |` | "Blow on this horse in its rear end. |156|" |
| `Line 1913: स तमश्वमपानेऽधमत् |` | "He blew on that horse in its rear end." |
| `Line 1914: अथाश्वाद्धम्यमानात्सर्वस्रोतोभ्यः सधूमा अर्चिषोऽग्नेर्निष्पेतुः | १५७ |` | "Then from the horse being blown upon, smoky flames of fire shot forth from all its openings. |157|" |
| `Line 1915: ताभिर्नागलोको धूपितः | १५८ |` | "By those flames, the world of the Nagas was fumigated. |158|" |
| `Line 1916: अथ ससम्भ्रमस्तक्षकोऽग्नितेजोभयविषण्णस्ते कुण्डले गृहीत्वा सहसा स्वभवनान्निष्क्रम्योत्तङ्कमुवाच |` | "Then Takshaka [serpent king], agitated and distressed by the fear of the fire's power, suddenly took those earrings and coming out of his abode, said to Uttanka:" |
| `Line 1917: एते कुण्डले प्रतिगृह्णातु भवानिति | १५९ |` | "Let your honor accept these earrings. |159|" |
| `Line 1918: स ते प्रतिजग्राहोत्तङ्कः |` | "Uttanka accepted those earrings." |
| `Line 1919: कुण्डले प्रतिगृह्याचिन्तयत् |` | "Having received the earrings, he thought:" |
| `Line 1920: अद्य तत्पुण्यकमुपाध्यायिन्याः |` | "Today is that auspicious day of my teacher's wife." |
| `Line 1921: दूरं चाहमभ्यागतः |` | "And I have come from afar." |
| `Line 1922: कथं नु खलु सम्भावयेयमिति | १६० |` | "How indeed shall I reach there in time? |160|" |
| `Line 1923: तत एनं चिन्तयानमेव स पुरुष उवाच |` | "Then as he was thinking thus, that person said to him:" |
| `Line 1924: उत्तङ्क एनमश्वमधिरोह |` | "Uttanka, mount this horse." |
| `Line 1925: एष त्वां क्षणादेवोपाध्यायकुलं प्रापयिष्यतीति | १६१ |` | "This will take you to your teacher's house in an instant. |161|" |
translations: | `Line 1901: कृष्णे वसानो वसने महात्मा; सत्यानृते यो विविनक्ति लोके ||१५२||` | "The great soul who wears dark garments, who distinguishes between truth and falsehood in the world. ||152||" |
| `Line 1902: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1903: यो वाजिनं गर्भमपां पुराणं; वैश्वानरं वाहनमभ्युपेतः |` | "Who has approached the ancient horse-embryo of the waters, Vaishvanara [universal fire] as his vehicle." |

| `Line 1918: स ते प्रतिजग्राहोत्तङ्कः |` | "Uttanka accepted those earrings." |
| `Line 1919: कुण्डले प्रतिगृह्याचिन्तयत् |` | "Having received the earrings, he thought:" |
| `Line 1920: अद्य तत्पुण्यकमुपाध्यायिन्याः |` | "Today is that auspicious day of my teacher's wife." |
| `Line 1921: दूरं चाहमभ्यागतः |` | "And I have come from afar." |
| `Line 1922: कथं नु खलु सम्भावयेयमिति | १६० |` | "How indeed shall I reach there in time? |160|" |
| `Line 1923: तत एनं चिन्तयानमेव स पुरुष उवाच |` | "Then as he was thinking thus, that person said to him:" |
| `Line 1924: उत्तङ्क एनमश्वमधिरोह |` | "Uttanka, mount this horse." |
| `Line 1925: एष त्वां क्षणादेवोपाध्यायकुलं प्रापयिष्यतीति | १६१ |` | "This will take you to your teacher's house in an instant. |161|" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1926: स तथेत्युक्त्वा तमश्वमधिरुह्य प्रत्याजगामोपाध्यायकुलम् |` | "He, saying 'So be it,' mounted that horse and returned to his teacher's house." |
| `Line 1927: उपाध्यायिनी च स्नाता केशानावपयन्त्युपविष्टोत्तङ्को नागच्छतीति शापायास्य मनो दधे | १६२ |` | "And the teacher's wife, having bathed and sitting down to dry her hair, set her mind to curse him, thinking 'Uttanka is not coming.' |162|" |
| `Line 1928: अथोत्तङ्कः प्रविश्य उपाध्यायिनीमभ्यवादयत् |` | "Then Uttanka entered and greeted the teacher's wife." |
| `Line 1929: ते चास्यै कुण्डले प्रायच्छत् | १६३ |` | "And he presented the earrings to her. |163|" |
| `Line 1930: सा चैनं प्रत्युवाच |` | "And she replied to him:" |
| `Line 1931: उत्तङ्क देशे कालेऽभ्यागतः |` | "Uttanka, you have arrived at the right place and time." |
| `Line 1932: स्वागतं ते वत्स |` | "Welcome to you, my child." |
| `Line 1933: मनागसि मया न शप्तः |` | "You were almost cursed by me." |
| `Line 1934: श्रेयस्तवोपस्थितम् |` | "Good fortune has come to you." |
| `Line 1935: सिद्धिमाप्नुहीति | १६४ |` | "May you attain success. |164|" |
| `Line 1936: अथोत्तङ्क उपाध्यायमभ्यवादयत् |` | "Then Uttanka greeted his teacher." |
| `Line 1937: तमुपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "The teacher replied to him:" |
| `Line 1938: वत्सोत्तङ्क स्वागतं ते |` | "Child Uttanka, welcome to you." |
| `Line 1939: किं चिरं कृतमिति | १६५ |` | "Why have you taken so long? |165|" |
| `Line 1940: तमुत्तङ्क उपाध्यायं प्रत्युवाच |` | "Uttanka replied to his teacher:" |
| `Line 1941: भोस्तक्षकेण नागराजेन विघ्नः कृतोऽस्मिन्कर्मणि |` | "Sir, Takshaka [serpent king] created an obstacle in this task." |
| `Line 1942: तेनास्मि नागलोकं नीतः | १६६ |` | "By him I was taken to the serpent world [Naga-loka]. |166|" |
| `Line 1943: तत्र च मया दृष्टे स्त्रियौ तन्त्रेऽधिरोप्य पटं वयन्त्यौ |` | "And there I saw two women weaving a cloth on a loom." |
| `Line 1944: तस्मिंश्च तन्त्रे कृष्णाः सिताश्च तन्तवः |` | "And in that loom were black and white threads." |
| `Line 1945: किं तत् | १६७ |` | "What was that? |167|" |
| `Line 1946: तत्र च मया चक्रं दृष्टं द्वादशारम् |` | "And there I saw a wheel with twelve spokes." |
| `Line 1947: षट्चैनं कुमाराः परिवर्तयन्ति |` | "And six youths were turning it." |
| `Line 1948: तदपि किम् | १६८ |` | "What was that also? |168|" |
| `Line 1949: पुरुषश्चापि मया दृष्टः |` | "And I also saw a man." |
| `Line 1950: स पुनः कः | १६९ |` | "Who was he? |169|" |
translations: | `Line 1926: स तथेत्युक्त्वा तमश्वमधिरुह्य प्रत्याजगामोपाध्यायकुलम् |` | "He, saying 'So be it,' mounted that horse and returned to his teacher's house." |

| `Line 1939: किं चिरं कृतमिति | १६५ |` | "Why have you taken so long? |165|" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1951: अश्वश्चातिप्रमाणयुक्तः |` | "And the horse was of extraordinary size." |
| `Line 1952: स चापि कः | १७० |` | "And who was he? |170|" |
| `Line 1953: पथि गच्छता मया ऋषभो दृष्टः |` | "While traveling on the road, I saw a bull." |
| `Line 1954: तं च पुरुषोऽधिरूढः |` | "And a man was mounted upon it." |
| `Line 1955: तेनास्मि सोपचारमुक्तः |` | "By him I was addressed with courtesy." |
| `Line 1956: उत्तङ्कास्य ऋषभस्य पुरीषं भक्षय |` | "'Uttanka, eat the dung of this bull.'" |
| `Line 1957: उपाध्यायेनापि ते भक्षितमिति |` | "'Your teacher has also eaten it.'" |
| `Line 1958: ततस्तद्वचनान्मया तदृषभस्य पुरीषमुपयुक्तम् |` | "Then, following his words, I consumed the dung of that bull." |
| `Line 1959: तदिच्छामि भवतोपदिष्टं किं तदिति | १७१ |` | "I wish to know what was that which you have explained. |171|" |
| `Line 1960: तेनैवमुक्त उपाध्यायः प्रत्युवाच |` | "Thus addressed, the teacher replied:" |
| `Line 1961: ये ते स्त्रियौ धाता विधाता च |` | "Those two women were Dhata and Vidhata [creator deities]." |
| `Line 1962: ये च ते कृष्णाः सिताश्च तन्तवस्ते रात्र्यहनी | १७२ |` | "And those black and white threads were night and day. |172|" |
| `Line 1963: यदपि तच्चक्रं द्वादशारं षट्कुमाराः परिवर्तयन्ति ते ऋतवः षट्संवत्सरश्चक्रम् |` | "That wheel with twelve spokes which six youths rotate is the year-cycle with six seasons." |
| `Line 1964: यः पुरुषः स पर्जन्यः |` | "The man was Parjanya [rain deity]." |
| `Line 1965: योऽश्वः सोऽग्निः | १७३ |` | "The horse was Agni [fire deity]. |173|" |
| `Line 1966: य ऋषभस्त्वया पथि गच्छता दृष्टः स ऐरावतो नागराजः |` | "The bull you saw while traveling on the road was Airavata, the king of elephants." |
| `Line 1967: यश्चैनमधिरूढः स इन्द्रः |` | "And he who was mounted on it was Indra [king of gods]." |
| `Line 1968: यदपि ते पुरीषं भक्षितं तस्य ऋषभस्य तदमृतम् | १७४ |` | "And the dung of that bull which you ate was amrita [nectar of immortality]. |174|" |
| `Line 1969: तेन खल्वसि न व्यापन्नस्तस्मिन्नागभवने |` | "It was because of that you were not destroyed in the abode of the nagas [serpents]." |
| `Line 1970: स चापि मम सखा इन्द्रः | १७५ |` | "And that Indra is my friend. |175|" |
| `Line 1971: तदनुग्रहात्कुण्डले गृहीत्वा पुनरभ्यागतोऽसि |` | "By his grace, having retrieved the earrings, you have returned again." |
| `Line 1972: तत्सौम्य गम्यताम् |` | "Therefore, gentle one, you may go." |
| `Line 1973: अनुजाने भवन्तम् |` | "I give you permission." |
| `Line 1974: श्रेयोऽवाप्स्यसीति | १७६ |` | "You will attain prosperity. |176|" |
| `Line 1975: स उपाध्यायेनानुज्ञात उत्तङ्कः क्रुद्धस्तक्षकस्य प्रतिचिकीर्षमाणो हास्तिनपुरं प्रतस्थे | १७७ |` | "Having been dismissed by his teacher, Uttanka, angry and desiring to take revenge on Takshaka [serpent king], set out for Hastinapura [capital city]. |177|" |

| `Line 1975: स उपाध्यायेनानुज्ञात उत्तङ्कः क्रुद्धस्तक्षकस्य प्रतिचिकीर्षमाणो हास्तिनपुरं प्रतस्थे | १७७ |` | "Having been dismissed by his teacher, Uttanka, angry and desiring to take revenge on Takshaka [serpent king], set out for Hastinapura [capital city]. |177|" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 1976:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1977: स हास्तिनपुरं प्राप्य नचिराद्द्विजसत्तमः |` | "That foremost of twice-born [brahmin sage], having reached Hastinapura [Kuru capital] before long," |
| `Line 1978: समागच्छत राजानमुत्तङ्को जनमेजयम् ||१७८||` | "Uttanka approached King Janamejaya. ||178||" |
| `Line 1979:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1980: पुरा तक्षशिलातस्तं निवृत्तमपराजितम् |` | "Having returned undefeated from Takshashila [northern city]," |
| `Line 1981: सम्यग्विजयिनं दृष्ट्वा समन्तान्मन्त्रिभिर्वृतम् ||१७९||` | "Seeing him as a complete victor, surrounded on all sides by ministers. ||179||" |
| `Line 1982:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1983: तस्मै जयाशिषः पूर्वं यथान्यायं प्रयुज्य सः |` | "Having first properly offered him blessings of victory according to custom," |
| `Line 1984: उवाचैनं वचः काले शब्दसम्पन्नया गिरा ||१८०||` | "He addressed him at the appropriate time with eloquent speech. ||180||" |
| `Line 1985:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1986: अन्यस्मिन्करणीये त्वं कार्ये पार्थिवसत्तम |` | "In another matter that should be done, O best of kings [pārthiva-sattama]," |
| `Line 1987: बाल्यादिवान्यदेव त्वं कुरुषे नृपसत्तम ||१८१||` | "You seem to be doing something else, as if from childishness, O best of rulers. ||181||" |
| `Line 1988:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1989: एवमुक्तस्तु विप्रेण स राजा प्रत्युवाच ह |` | "Thus addressed by the brahmin [vipra], that king replied," |
| `Line 1990: जनमेजयः प्रसन्नात्मा सम्यक्सम्पूज्य तं मुनिम् ||१८२||` | "Janamejaya, with a pleased heart, having properly honored that sage. ||182||" |
| `Line 1991:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1992: आसां प्रजानां परिपालनेन; स्वं क्षत्रधर्मं परिपालयामि |` | "By protecting these subjects, I am fulfilling my Kshatriya duty [warrior code];" |
| `Line 1993: प्रब्रूहि वा किं क्रियतां द्विजेन्द्र; शुश्रूषुरस्म्यद्य वचस्त्वदीयम् ||१८३||` | "Tell me what should be done, O best of twice-born; today I am eager to hear your words. ||183||" |
| `Line 1994:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1995: स एवमुक्तस्तु नृपोत्तमेन; द्विजोत्तमः पुण्यकृतां वरिष्ठः |` | "Thus addressed by the best of kings, the best of twice-born, foremost among the virtuous," |
| `Line 1996: उवाच राजानमदीनसत्त्वं; स्वमेव कार्यं नृपतेश्च यत्तत् ||१८४||` | "Spoke to the king of undaunted courage about what was indeed the king's own duty. ||184||" |
| `Line 1997:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1998: तक्षकेण नरेन्द्रेन्द्र येन ते हिंसितः पिता |` | "O lord of lords [supreme king], by Takshaka [serpent king] who killed your father," |
| `Line 1999: तस्मै प्रतिकुरुष्व त्वं पन्नगाय दुरात्मने ||१८५||` | "Take revenge on that evil-minded serpent [pannaga]. ||185||" |
| `Line 2000:` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 1978: समागच्छत राजानमुत्तङ्को जनमेजयम् ||१७८||` | "Uttanka approached King Janamejaya. ||178||" |

| `Line 1980: पुरा तक्षशिलातस्तं निवृत्तमपराजितम् |` | "Having returned undefeated from Takshashila [northern city]," |
| `Line 1981: सम्यग्विजयिनं दृष्ट्वा समन्तान्मन्त्रिभिर्वृतम् ||१७९||` | "Seeing him as a complete victor, surrounded on all sides by ministers. ||179||" |
| `Line 1982:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1983: तस्मै जयाशिषः पूर्वं यथान्यायं प्रयुज्य सः |` | "Having first properly offered him blessings of victory according to custom," |
| `Line 1984: उवाचैनं वचः काले शब्दसम्पन्नया गिरा ||१८०||` | "He addressed him at the appropriate time with eloquent speech. ||180||" |
| `Line 1985:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1986: अन्यस्मिन्करणीये त्वं कार्ये पार्थिवसत्तम |` | "In another matter that should be done, O best of kings [pārthiva-sattama]," |
| `Line 1987: बाल्यादिवान्यदेव त्वं कुरुषे नृपसत्तम ||१८१||` | "You seem to be doing something else, as if from childishness, O best of rulers. ||181||" |
| `Line 1988:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1989: एवमुक्तस्तु विप्रेण स राजा प्रत्युवाच ह |` | "Thus addressed by the brahmin [vipra], that king replied," |
| `Line 1990: जनमेजयः प्रसन्नात्मा सम्यक्सम्पूज्य तं मुनिम् ||१८२||` | "Janamejaya, with a pleased heart, having properly honored that sage. ||182||" |
| `Line 1991:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1992: आसां प्रजानां परिपालनेन; स्वं क्षत्रधर्मं परिपालयामि |` | "By protecting these subjects, I am fulfilling my Kshatriya duty [warrior code];" |
| `Line 1993: प्रब्रूहि वा किं क्रियतां द्विजेन्द्र; शुश्रूषुरस्म्यद्य वचस्त्वदीयम् ||१८३||` | "Tell me what should be done, O best of twice-born; today I am eager to hear your words. ||183||" |
| `Line 1994:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1995: स एवमुक्तस्तु नृपोत्तमेन; द्विजोत्तमः पुण्यकृतां वरिष्ठः |` | "Thus addressed by the best of kings, the best of twice-born, foremost among the virtuous," |
| `Line 1996: उवाच राजानमदीनसत्त्वं; स्वमेव कार्यं नृपतेश्च यत्तत् ||१८४||` | "Spoke to the king of undaunted courage about what was indeed the king's own duty. ||184||" |
| `Line 1997:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 1998: तक्षकेण नरेन्द्रेन्द्र येन ते हिंसितः पिता |` | "O lord of lords [supreme king], by Takshaka [serpent king] who killed your father," |
| `Line 1999: तस्मै प्रतिकुरुष्व त्वं पन्नगाय दुरात्मने ||१८५||` | "Take revenge on that evil-minded serpent [pannaga]. ||185||" |
| `Line 2000:` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 2: ||१ महाभारते आदिपर्वम् ||` | "The First Book [Ādi Parva] of the Mahābhārata" |
| `Line 3:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5: अनुक्रमणीपर्व` | "The Chapter of Contents [Index section]" |
| `Line 6: १` | "1" |
| `Line 7:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 8:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 9: नारायणं नमस्कृत्य नरं चैव नरोत्तमम् |` | "Having bowed to Nārāyaṇa [Supreme deity] and also to Nara [divine sage], the best among men," |
| `Line 10: देवीं सरस्वतीं चैव ततो जयमुदीरयेत् ||०||` | "And to the goddess Sarasvatī [learning deity], then one should recite the Jaya [Victory epic]." |
| `Line 11:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 12: लोमहर्षणपुत्र उग्रश्रवाः सूतः पौराणिको नैमिषारण्ये शौनकस्य कुलपतेर्द्वादशवार्षिके सत्रे | ००१ |` | "Ugraśravās [fierce-eared], the son of Lomaharṣaṇa, a sūta [bard-chronicler], a reciter of ancient tales, came to the twelve-year sacrificial session of Śaunaka, the family head, in the Naimiṣa forest." |
| `Line 13:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 14: समासीनानभ्यगच्छद्ब्रह्मर्षीन्संशितव्रतान् |` | "He approached the Brahmarṣis [Brahmin sages] of strict vows who were seated together," |
| `Line 15: विनयावनतो भूत्वा कदाचित्सूतनन्दनः ||२||` | "The son of the sūta [bard], having bowed with humility, at one time." |
| `Line 16:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 17: तमाश्रममनुप्राप्तं नैमिषारण्यवासिनः |` | "The dwellers of the Naimiṣa forest [sacred grove], upon his arrival at the hermitage," |
| `Line 18: चित्राः श्रोतुं कथास्तत्र परिवव्रुस्तपस्विनः ||३||` | "The ascetics surrounded him there to hear wonderful stories." |
| `Line 19:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 20: अभिवाद्य मुनींस्तांस्तु सर्वानेव कृताञ्जलिः |` | "Having saluted all those sages with folded hands," |
| `Line 21: अपृच्छत्स तपोवृद्धिं सद्भिश्चैवाभिनन्दितः ||४||` | "He inquired about the progress of their austerities, and was welcomed by the virtuous ones." |
| `Line 22:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 23: अथ तेषूपविष्टेषु सर्वेष्वेव तपस्विषु |` | "Then, when all those ascetics were seated," |
| `Line 24: निर्दिष्टमासनं भेजे विनयाल्लोमहर्षणिः ||५||` | "The son of Lomaharṣaṇa [sūta] humbly took the seat assigned to him." |
| `Line 25:` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2001: कार्यकालं च मन्येऽहं विधिदृष्टस्य कर्मणः |` | "I believe the time has come for the action ordained by fate." |
| `Line 2002: तद्गच्छापचितिं राजन्पितुस्तस्य महात्मनः ||१८६||` | "Therefore, O king, go and perform the atonement for your noble-souled father. |186|" |
| `Line 2003: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2004: तेन ह्यनपराधी स दष्टो दुष्टान्तरात्मना |` | "For he, though innocent, was bitten by that evil-minded one." |
| `Line 2005: पञ्चत्वमगमद्राजा वज्राहत इव द्रुमः ||१८७||` | "The king met his death [five elements], like a tree struck by lightning. |187|" |
| `Line 2006: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2007: बलदर्पसमुत्सिक्तस्तक्षकः पन्नगाधमः |` | "Takshaka, the vilest of serpents, intoxicated with pride of strength," |
| `Line 2008: अकार्यं कृतवान्पापो योऽदशत्पितरं तव ||१८८||` | "That sinful one committed a wrongful deed when he bit your father. |188|" |
| `Line 2009: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2010: राजर्षिवंशगोप्तारममरप्रतिमं नृपम् |` | "The protector of the royal-sage lineage, the king who was like an immortal," |
| `Line 2011: जघान काश्यपं चैव न्यवर्तयत पापकृत् ||१८९||` | "That evil-doer killed him and also turned back Kashyapa [sage]. |189|" |
| `Line 2012: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2013: दग्धुमर्हसि तं पापं ज्वलिते हव्यवाहने |` | "You should burn that sinner in the blazing fire [oblation-carrier]," |
| `Line 2014: सर्पसत्रे महाराज त्वयि तद्धि विधीयते ||१९०||` | "In a serpent sacrifice [sarpa-satra], O great king, for this is ordained for you. |190|" |
| `Line 2015: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2016: एवं पितुश्चापचितिं गतवांस्त्वं भविष्यसि |` | "Thus you will have performed the atonement for your father," |
| `Line 2017: मम प्रियं च सुमहत्कृतं राजन्भविष्यति ||१९१||` | "And a great favor will have been done to me, O king. |191|" |
| `Line 2018: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2019: कर्मणः पृथिवीपाल मम येन दुरात्मना |` | "O protector of the earth, by that evil soul," |
| `Line 2020: विघ्नः कृतो महाराज गुर्वर्थं चरतोऽनघ ||१९२||` | "An obstacle was created for me, O great king, while I was performing a task for my teacher, O sinless one. |192|" |
| `Line 2021: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2022: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु नृपतिस्तक्षकस्य चुकोप ह |` | "Hearing this, the king became angry at Takshaka." |
| `Line 2023: उत्तङ्कवाक्यहविषा दीप्तोऽग्निर्हविषा यथा ||१९३||` | "Inflamed by Uttanka's words as fire is kindled by oblations. |193|" |
| `Line 2024: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2025: अपृच्छच्च तदा राजा मन्त्रिणः स्वान्सुदुःखितः |` | "Then the deeply grieved king questioned his ministers," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 201: चतुर्विंशतिसाहस्रीं चक्रे भारतसंहिताम् |` | "He composed the Bhārata Saṃhitā [epic compilation] of twenty-four thousand verses," |
| `Line 202: उपाख्यानैर्विना तावद्भारतं प्रोच्यते बुधैः ||६१||` | "Without the sub-narratives, that much is called Bhārata by the wise. ||61||" |
| `Line 203: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 204: ततोऽध्यर्धशतं भूयः सङ्क्षेपं कृतवानृषिः |` | "Then the sage further composed a summary of one hundred and fifty," |
| `Line 205: अनुक्रमणिमध्यायं वृत्तान्तानां सपर्वणाम् ||६२||` | "An index chapter of the contents along with the Parvas [sections]. ||62||" |
| `Line 206: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 207: इदं द्वैपायनः पूर्वं पुत्रमध्यापयच्छुकम् |` | "This was first taught by Dvaipāyana [Vyāsa] to his son Śuka," |
| `Line 208: ततोऽन्येभ्योऽनुरूपेभ्यः शिष्येभ्यः प्रददौ प्रभुः ||६३||` | "Then the master gave it to other suitable disciples. ||63||" |
| `Line 209: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 210: नारदोऽश्रावयद्देवानसितो देवलः पितृन् |` | "Nārada recited it to the gods, Asita Devala to the ancestors," |
| `Line 211: गन्धर्वयक्षरक्षांसि श्रावयामास वै शुकः ||६४||` | "And Śuka indeed recited it to the Gandharvas [celestial musicians], Yakṣas [wealth spirits], and Rākṣasas [demons]. ||64||" |
| `Line 212: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 213: दुर्योधनो मन्युमयो महाद्रुमः; स्कन्धः कर्णः शकुनिस्तस्य शाखाः |` | "Duryodhana is a great tree made of anger; Karṇa is its trunk, Śakuni its branches," |
| `Line 214: दुःशासनः पुष्पफले समृद्धे; मूलं राजा धृतराष्ट्रोऽमनीषी ||६५||` | "Duḥśāsana its abundant flowers and fruits; the unwise king Dhṛtarāṣṭra is its root. ||65||" |
| `Line 215: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 216: युधिष्ठिरो धर्ममयो महाद्रुमः; स्कन्धोऽर्जुनो भीमसेनोऽस्य शाखाः |` | "Yudhiṣṭhira is a great tree made of dharma [righteousness]; Arjuna is its trunk, Bhīmasena its branches," |
| `Line 217: माद्रीसुतौ पुष्पफले समृद्धे; मूलं कृष्णो ब्रह्म च ब्राह्मणाश्च ||६६||` | "The sons of Mādrī [Nakula and Sahadeva] are its abundant flowers and fruits; Kṛṣṇa, Brahman, and the Brāhmaṇas are its roots. ||66||" |
| `Line 218: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 219: पाण्डुर्जित्वा बहून्देशान्युधा विक्रमणेन च |` | "Pāṇḍu, having conquered many lands through battle and valor," |
| `Line 220: अरण्ये मृगयाशीलो न्यवसत्सजनस्तदा ||६७||` | "Then lived in the forest with his people, devoted to hunting. ||67||" |
| `Line 221: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 222: मृगव्यवायनिधने कृच्छ्रां प्राप स आपदम् |` | "He met with a terrible calamity due to intercourse while in the form of a deer [during hunting]," |
| `Line 223: जन्मप्रभृति पार्थानां तत्राचारविधिक्रमः ||६८||` | "From the birth of the Pārthas [sons of Pṛthā/Kuntī], there is the sequence of their conduct and rules. ||68||" |
| `Line 224: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 225: मात्रोरभ्युपपत्तिश्च धर्मोपनिषदं प्रति |` | "And the approach of their mothers regarding the secret doctrine of dharma [divine conception]," |
translations: | `Line 201: चतुर्विंशतिसाहस्रीं चक्रे भारतसंहिताम् |` | "He composed the Bhārata Saṃhitā [epic compilation] of twenty-four thousand verses," |
| `Line 202: उपाख्यानैर्विना तावद्भारतं प्रोच्यते बुधैः ||६१||` | "Without the sub-narratives, that much is called Bhārata by the wise. ||61||" |
| `Line 203: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 204: ततोऽध्यर्धशतं भूयः सङ्क्षेपं कृतवानृषिः |` | "Then the sage further composed a summary of one hundred and fifty," |
| `Line 205: अनुक्रमणिमध्यायं वृत्तान्तानां सपर्वणाम् ||६२||` | "An index chapter of the contents along with the Parvas [sections]. ||62||" |
| `Line 206: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 207: इदं द्वैपायनः पूर्वं पुत्रमध्यापयच्छुकम् |` | "This was first taught by Dvaipāyana [Vyāsa] to his son Śuka," |
| `Line 208: ततोऽन्येभ्योऽनुरूपेभ्यः शिष्येभ्यः प्रददौ प्रभुः ||६३||` | "Then the master gave it to other suitable disciples. ||63||" |
| `Line 209: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 210: नारदोऽश्रावयद्देवानसितो देवलः पितृन् |` | "Nārada recited it to the gods, Asita Devala to the ancestors," |
| `Line 211: गन्धर्वयक्षरक्षांसि श्रावयामास वै शुकः ||६४||` | "And Śuka indeed recited it to the Gandharvas [celestial musicians], Yakṣas [wealth spirits], and Rākṣasas [demons]. ||64||" |
| `Line 212: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 213: दुर्योधनो मन्युमयो महाद्रुमः; स्कन्धः कर्णः शकुनिस्तस्य शाखाः |` | "Duryodhana is a great tree made of anger; Karṇa is its trunk, Śakuni its branches," |
| `Line 214: दुःशासनः पुष्पफले समृद्धे; मूलं राजा धृतराष्ट्रोऽमनीषी ||६५||` | "Duḥśāsana its abundant flowers and fruits; the unwise king Dhṛtarāṣṭra is its root. ||65||" |
| `Line 215: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 216: युधिष्ठिरो धर्ममयो महाद्रुमः; स्कन्धोऽर्जुनो भीमसेनोऽस्य शाखाः |` | "Yudhiṣṭhira is a great tree made of dharma [righteousness]; Arjuna is its trunk, Bhīmasena its branches," |

| `Line 217: माद्रीसुतौ पुष्पफले समृद्धे; मूलं कृष्णो ब्रह्म च ब्राह्मणाश्च ||६६||` | "The sons of Mādrī [Nakula and Sahadeva] are its abundant flowers and fruits; Kṛṣṇa, Brahman, and the Brāhmaṇas are its roots. ||66||" |
| `Line 218: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 219: पाण्डुर्जित्वा बहून्देशान्युधा विक्रमणेन च |` | "Pāṇḍu, having conquered many lands through battle and valor," |
| `Line 220: अरण्ये मृगयाशीलो न्यवसत्सजनस्तदा ||६७||` | "Then lived in the forest with his people, devoted to hunting. ||67||" |
| `Line 221: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 222: मृगव्यवायनिधने कृच्छ्रां प्राप स आपदम् |` | "He met with a terrible calamity due to intercourse while in the form of a deer [during hunting]," |
| `Line 223: जन्मप्रभृति पार्थानां तत्राचारविधिक्रमः ||६८||` | "From the birth of the Pārthas [sons of Pṛthā/Kuntī], there is the sequence of their conduct and rules. ||68||" |
| `Line 224: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 225: मात्रोरभ्युपपत्तिश्च धर्मोपनिषदं प्रति |` | "And the approach of their mothers regarding the secret doctrine of dharma [divine conception]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2026: उत्तङ्कस्यैव सांनिध्ये पितुः स्वर्गगतिं प्रति ||१९४||` | "In Uttanka's very presence, regarding his father's journey to heaven. ||194||" |
| `Line 2027: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2028: तदैव हि स राजेन्द्रो दुःखशोकाप्लुतोऽभवत् |` | "Indeed, at that very moment, that king [raja-indra] became overwhelmed with grief and sorrow." |
| `Line 2029: यदैव पितरं वृत्तमुत्तङ्कादशृणोत्तदा ||१९५||` | "When he heard from Uttanka about what had happened to his father. ||195||" |
| `Line 2030: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2031: पौलोमपर्व` | "Pauloma Parva [Section about Puloma]" |
| `Line 2032: ४` | "4" |
| `Line 2033: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2034: लोमहर्षणपुत्र उग्रश्रवाः सूतः पौराणिको नैमिषारण्ये शौनकस्य कुलपतेर्द्वादशवार्षिके सत्रे ऋषीनभ्यागतानुपतस्थे | ००१ |` | "Ugrashravas, the son of Lomaharshana, a suta [bard/storyteller] and expert in Puranas, approached the sages who had arrived at the twelve-year sacrificial session of Shaunaka, the kulapati [head of school], in the Naimisha forest. |001|" |
| `Line 2035: पौराणिकः पुराणे कृतश्रमः स तान्कृताञ्जलिरुवाच |` | "That Pauranika [Purana expert], well-versed in the Puranas, with folded hands addressed them:" |
| `Line 2036: किं भवन्तः श्रोतुमिच्छन्ति |` | "What do you honorable ones wish to hear?" |
| `Line 2037: किमहं ब्रुवाणीति | ००२ |` | "What shall I narrate? |002|" |
| `Line 2038: तमृषय ऊचुः |` | "The sages said to him:" |
| `Line 2039: परमं लोमहर्षणे प्रक्ष्यामस्त्वां वक्ष्यसि च नः शुश्रूषतां कथायोगम् |` | "O son of Lomaharshana, we shall ask you the highest (knowledge), and you shall tell us, who are eager to listen, the proper sequence of stories." |
| `Line 2040: तद्भगवांस्तु तावच्छौनकोऽग्निशरणमध्यास्ते | ००३ |` | "But for now, the venerable Shaunaka is seated at the fire sanctuary [agni-sharana]. |003|" |
| `Line 2041: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2042: योऽसौ दिव्याः कथा वेद देवतासुरसङ्कथाः |` | "He who knows divine stories, tales of gods and asuras [demons]," |
| `Line 2043: मनुष्योरगगन्धर्वकथा वेद च सर्वशः ||४||` | "And knows completely the stories of humans, nagas [serpents], and gandharvas [celestial musicians]. ||4||" |
| `Line 2044: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2045: स चाप्यस्मिन्मखे सौते विद्वान्कुलपतिर्द्विजः |` | "And in this sacrifice, O Suta, he is the learned kulapati [head of school], a twice-born [dvija]," |
| `Line 2046: दक्षो धृतव्रतो धीमाञ्शास्त्रे चारण्यके गुरुः ||५||` | "Skilled, steadfast in vows, wise, and a master in the scriptures and Aranyakas [forest texts]. ||5||" |
| `Line 2047: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2048: सत्यवादी शमपरस्तपस्वी नियतव्रतः |` | "Truthful, devoted to tranquility, ascetic, firm in his vows," |
| `Line 2049: सर्वेषामेव नो मान्यः स तावत्प्रतिपाल्यताम् ||६||` | "Respected by all of us—let us wait for him for now. ||6||" |
| `Line 2050: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2026: उत्तङ्कस्यैव सांनिध्ये पितुः स्वर्गगतिं प्रति ||१९४||` | "In Uttanka's very presence, regarding his father's journey to heaven. ||194||" |
| `Line 2027: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2028: तदैव हि स राजेन्द्रो दुःखशोकाप्लुतोऽभवत् |` | "Indeed, at that very moment, that king [raja-indra] became overwhelmed with grief and sorrow." |
| `Line 2029: यदैव पितरं वृत्तमुत्तङ्कादशृणोत्तदा ||१९५||` | "When he heard from Uttanka about what had happened to his father. ||195||" |
| `Line 2030: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2031: पौलोमपर्व` | "Pauloma Parva [Section about Puloma]" |
| `Line 2033: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 2034: लोमहर्षणपुत्र उग्रश्रवाः सूतः पौराणिको नैमिषारण्ये शौनकस्य कुलपतेर्द्वादशवार्षिके सत्रे ऋषीनभ्यागतानुपतस्थे | ००१ |` | "Ugrashravas, the son of Lomaharshana, a suta [bard/storyteller] and expert in Puranas, approached the sages who had arrived at the twelve-year sacrificial session of Shaunaka, the kulapati [head of school], in the Naimisha forest. |001|" |
| `Line 2035: पौराणिकः पुराणे कृतश्रमः स तान्कृताञ्जलिरुवाच |` | "That Pauranika [Purana expert], well-versed in the Puranas, with folded hands addressed them:" |
| `Line 2036: किं भवन्तः श्रोतुमिच्छन्ति |` | "What do you honorable ones wish to hear?" |
| `Line 2037: किमहं ब्रुवाणीति | ००२ |` | "What shall I narrate? |002|" |
| `Line 2038: तमृषय ऊचुः |` | "The sages said to him:" |

| `Line 2039: परमं लोमहर्षणे प्रक्ष्यामस्त्वां वक्ष्यसि च नः शुश्रूषतां कथायोगम् |` | "O son of Lomaharshana, we shall ask you the highest (knowledge), and you shall tell us, who are eager to listen, the proper sequence of stories." |
| `Line 2040: तद्भगवांस्तु तावच्छौनकोऽग्निशरणमध्यास्ते | ००३ |` | "But for now, the venerable Shaunaka is seated at the fire sanctuary [agni-sharana]. |003|" |
| `Line 2041: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2042: योऽसौ दिव्याः कथा वेद देवतासुरसङ्कथाः |` | "He who knows divine stories, tales of gods and asuras [demons]," |
| `Line 2043: मनुष्योरगगन्धर्वकथा वेद च सर्वशः ||४||` | "And knows completely the stories of humans, nagas [serpents], and gandharvas [celestial musicians]. ||4||" |
| `Line 2044: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2045: स चाप्यस्मिन्मखे सौते विद्वान्कुलपतिर्द्विजः |` | "And in this sacrifice, O Suta, he is the learned kulapati [head of school], a twice-born [dvija]," |
| `Line 2046: दक्षो धृतव्रतो धीमाञ्शास्त्रे चारण्यके गुरुः ||५||` | "Skilled, steadfast in vows, wise, and a master in the scriptures and Aranyakas [forest texts]. ||5||" |
| `Line 2047: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2048: सत्यवादी शमपरस्तपस्वी नियतव्रतः |` | "Truthful, devoted to tranquility, ascetic, firm in his vows," |
| `Line 2049: सर्वेषामेव नो मान्यः स तावत्प्रतिपाल्यताम् ||६||` | "Respected by all of us—let us wait for him for now. ||6||" |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2051: तस्मिन्नध्यासति गुरावासनं परमार्चितम् |` | "When the guru sits on the highly honored seat," |
| `Line 2052: ततो वक्ष्यसि यत्त्वां स प्रक्ष्यति द्विजसत्तमः ||७||` | "Then you shall speak what that best of twice-born [brahmin sage] asks you. ||7||" |
| `Line 2053: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2054: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2055: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2056: एवमस्तु गुरौ तस्मिन्नुपविष्टे महात्मनि |` | "Let it be so. When that great-souled guru was seated," |
| `Line 2057: तेन पृष्टः कथाः पुण्या वक्ष्यामि विविधाश्रयाः ||८||` | "Being asked by him, I shall narrate sacred stories of various kinds. ||8||" |
| `Line 2058: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2059: सोऽथ विप्रर्षभः कार्यं कृत्वा सर्वं यथाक्रमम् |` | "Then that bull among brahmins [eminent sage], having performed all duties in proper sequence," |
| `Line 2060: देवान्वाग्भिः पितृनद्भिस्तर्पयित्वाजगाम ह ||९||` | "Having satisfied the gods with words and the ancestors with water, he arrived. ||9||" |
| `Line 2061: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2062: यत्र ब्रह्मर्षयः सिद्धास्त आसीना यतव्रताः |` | "Where the brahmarshis [brahmin sages], the siddhas [perfected beings], and those of controlled vows were seated," |
| `Line 2063: यज्ञायतनमाश्रित्य सूतपुत्रपुरःसराः ||१०||` | "Taking refuge in the sacrificial hall, with the son of Suta leading them. ||10||" |
| `Line 2064: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2065: ऋत्विक्ष्वथ सदस्येषु स वै गृहपतिस्ततः |` | "Then, when the priests and the assembly members were seated, that householder [sacrifice patron]," |
| `Line 2066: उपविष्टेषूपविष्टः शौनकोऽथाब्रवीदिदम् ||११||` | "Having seated himself among those seated, Shaunaka [sage] then spoke this. ||11||" |
| `Line 2067: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2068: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2069: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2070: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2071: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 2052: ततो वक्ष्यसि यत्त्वां स प्रक्ष्यति द्विजसत्तमः ||७||` | "Then you shall speak what that best of twice-born [brahmin sage] asks you. ||7||" |

| `Line 2056: एवमस्तु गुरौ तस्मिन्नुपविष्टे महात्मनि |` | "Let it be so. When that great-souled guru was seated," |
| `Line 2057: तेन पृष्टः कथाः पुण्या वक्ष्यामि विविधाश्रयाः ||८||` | "Being asked by him, I shall narrate sacred stories of various kinds. ||8||" |

| `Line 2059: सोऽथ विप्रर्षभः कार्यं कृत्वा सर्वं यथाक्रमम् |` | "Then that bull among brahmins [eminent sage], having performed all duties in proper sequence," |
| `Line 2060: देवान्वाग्भिः पितृनद्भिस्तर्पयित्वाजगाम ह ||९||` | "Having satisfied the gods with words and the ancestors with water, he arrived. ||9||" |

| `Line 2062: यत्र ब्रह्मर्षयः सिद्धास्त आसीना यतव्रताः |` | "Where the brahmarshis [brahmin sages], the siddhas [perfected beings], and those of controlled vows were seated," |
| `Line 2063: यज्ञायतनमाश्रित्य सूतपुत्रपुरःसराः ||१०||` | "Taking refuge in the sacrificial hall, with the son of Suta leading them. ||10||" |

| `Line 2065: ऋत्विक्ष्वथ सदस्येषु स वै गृहपतिस्ततः |` | "Then, when the priests and the assembly members were seated, that householder [sacrifice patron]," |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2076: शौनक उवाच॥` | "Shaunaka said:" |
| `Line 2077: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2078: पुराणमखिलं तात पिता तेऽधीतवान्पुरा |` | "O dear one, your father had formerly studied the entire Purana [ancient text]." |
| `Line 2079: कच्चित्त्वमपि तत्सर्वमधीषे लोमहर्षणे ॥१॥` | "O Lomaharshana [son of Suta], have you also studied all of it? ||1||" |
| `Line 2080: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2081: पुराणे हि कथा दिव्या आदिवंशाश्च धीमताम् |` | "For in the Purana are divine stories and the original lineages of the wise." |
| `Line 2082: कथ्यन्ते ताः पुरास्माभिः श्रुताः पूर्वं पितुस्तव ॥२॥` | "Those were previously heard by us from your father. ||2||" |
| `Line 2083: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2084: तत्र वंशमहं पूर्वं श्रोतुमिच्छामि भार्गवम् |` | "Among those, I first wish to hear about the lineage of Bhargava [descendants of Bhrigu]." |
| `Line 2085: कथयस्व कथामेतां कल्याः स्म श्रवणे तव ॥३॥` | "Narrate this story; we are eager to listen to you. ||3||" |
| `Line 2086: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2087: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2088: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2089: यदधीतं पुरा सम्यग्द्विजश्रेष्ठ महात्मभिः |` | "O best of the twice-born [Brahmins], what was properly studied before by the great souls," |
| `Line 2090: वैशम्पायनविप्राद्यैस्तैश्चापि कथितं पुरा ॥४॥` | "By Vaishampayana and other learned Brahmins, and what was narrated by them before, ||4||" |
| `Line 2091: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2092: यदधीतं च पित्रा मे सम्यक्चैव ततो मया |` | "And what was properly studied by my father and then by me," |
| `Line 2093: तत्तावच्छृणु यो देवैः सेन्द्रैः साग्निमरुद्गणैः ॥५॥` | "Listen to that much about the one who by the gods, along with Indra [king of gods], Agni [fire deity], and the Maruts [storm deities], ||5||" |
| `Line 2094: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2095: पूजितः प्रवरो वंशो भृगूणां भृगुनन्दन ॥५॥` | "Was honored—the excellent lineage of the Bhrigus, O descendant of Bhrigu. ||5||" |
| `Line 2096: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2097: इमं वंशमहं ब्रह्मन्भार्गवं ते महामुने |` | "O Brahmin, O great sage, I shall narrate to you this lineage of the Bhargavas [Bhrigu's descendants]," |
| `Line 2098: निगदामि कथायुक्तं पुराणाश्रयसंयुतम् ॥६॥` | "Along with its stories, supported by the Puranas [ancient texts]. ||6||" |
| `Line 2099: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2100: भृगोः सुदयितः पुत्रश्च्यवनो नाम भार्गवः |` | "The beloved son of Bhrigu was named Chyavana, a descendant of Bhrigu." |
translations: | `Line 2076: शौनक उवाच॥` | "Shaunaka said:" |
| `Line 2077: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2078: पुराणमखिलं तात पिता तेऽधीतवान्पुरा |` | "O dear one, your father had formerly studied the entire Purana [ancient text]." |
| `Line 2079: कच्चित्त्वमपि तत्सर्वमधीषे लोमहर्षणे ॥१॥` | "O Lomaharshana [son of Suta], have you also studied all of it? ||1||" |
| `Line 2080: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2081: पुराणे हि कथा दिव्या आदिवंशाश्च धीमताम् |` | "For in the Purana are divine stories and the original lineages of the wise." |
| `Line 2082: कथ्यन्ते ताः पुरास्माभिः श्रुताः पूर्वं पितुस्तव ॥२॥` | "Those were previously heard by us from your father. ||2||" |
| `Line 2083: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2084: तत्र वंशमहं पूर्वं श्रोतुमिच्छामि भार्गवम् |` | "Among those, I first wish to hear about the lineage of Bhargava [descendants of Bhrigu]." |
| `Line 2085: कथयस्व कथामेतां कल्याः स्म श्रवणे तव ॥३॥` | "Narrate this story; we are eager to listen to you. ||3||" |
| `Line 2086: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2087: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2088: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2089: यदधीतं पुरा सम्यग्द्विजश्रेष्ठ महात्मभिः |` | "O best of the twice-born [Brahmins], what was properly studied before by the great souls," |
| `Line 2090: वैशम्पायनविप्राद्यैस्तैश्चापि कथितं पुरा ॥४॥` | "By Vaishampayana and other learned Brahmins, and what was narrated by them before, ||4||" |
| `Line 2091: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2092: यदधीतं च पित्रा मे सम्यक्चैव ततो मया |` | "And what was properly studied by my father and then by me," |

| `Line 2093: तत्तावच्छृणु यो देवैः सेन्द्रैः साग्निमरुद्गणैः ॥५॥` | "Listen to that much about the one who by the gods, along with Indra [king of gods], Agni [fire deity], and the Maruts [storm deities], ||5||" |
| `Line 2094: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2095: पूजितः प्रवरो वंशो भृगूणां भृगुनन्दन ॥५॥` | "Was honored—the excellent lineage of the Bhrigus, O descendant of Bhrigu. ||5||" |
| `Line 2096: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2097: इमं वंशमहं ब्रह्मन्भार्गवं ते महामुने |` | "O Brahmin, O great sage, I shall narrate to you this lineage of the Bhargavas [Bhrigu's descendants]," |
| `Line 2098: निगदामि कथायुक्तं पुराणाश्रयसंयुतम् ॥६॥` | "Along with its stories, supported by the Puranas [ancient texts]. ||6||" |
| `Line 2099: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2100: भृगोः सुदयितः पुत्रश्च्यवनो नाम भार्गवः |` | "The beloved son of Bhrigu was named Chyavana, a descendant of Bhrigu." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2101: च्यवनस्यापि दायादः प्रमतिर्नाम धार्मिकः ||७||` | "Chyavana's descendant was the righteous one named Pramati. ||7||" |
| `Line 2102:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2103: प्रमतेरप्यभूत्पुत्रो घृताच्यां रुरुरित्युत ||७||` | "And Pramati's son, born of Ghritachi [celestial nymph], was named Ruru. ||7||" |
| `Line 2104:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2105: रुरोरपि सुतो जज्ञे शुनको वेदपारगः |` | "Ruru's son was born as Shunaka, master of the Vedas [scripture expert]," |
| `Line 2106: प्रमद्वरायां धर्मात्मा तव पूर्वपितामहात् ||८||` | "Born to Pramadvara, righteous one, from your great-grandfather. ||8||" |
| `Line 2107:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2108: तपस्वी च यशस्वी च श्रुतवान्ब्रह्मवित्तमः |` | "He was austere, famous, learned, and the foremost knower of Brahman [absolute reality]," |
| `Line 2109: धर्मिष्ठः सत्यवादी च नियतो नियतेन्द्रियः ||९||` | "Most righteous, truthful, disciplined, and with controlled senses. ||9||" |
| `Line 2110:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2111: शौनक उवाच||` | "Shaunaka said:" |
| `Line 2112:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2113: सूतपुत्र यथा तस्य भार्गवस्य महात्मनः |` | "O son of Suta [bard caste], how that great-souled descendant of Bhrigu [Bhargava]" |
| `Line 2114: च्यवनत्वं परिख्यातं तन्ममाचक्ष्व पृच्छतः ||१०||` | "Came to be known as Chyavana, tell this to me who asks. ||10||" |
| `Line 2115:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2116: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta said:" |
| `Line 2117:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2118: भृगोः सुदयिता भार्या पुलोमेत्यभिविश्रुता |` | "Bhrigu's beloved wife was well-known as Puloma," |
| `Line 2119: तस्यां गर्भः समभवद्भृगोर्वीर्यसमुद्भवः ||११||` | "In her a fetus was conceived, born of Bhrigu's virility. ||11||" |
| `Line 2120:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2121: तस्मिन्गर्भे सम्भृतेऽथ पुलोमायां भृगूद्वह |` | "When that fetus was developing in Puloma, O carrier of Bhrigu's lineage," |
| `Line 2122: समये समशीलिन्यां धर्मपत्न्यां यशस्विनः ||१२||` | "At that time, in his virtuous and lawful wife of the illustrious one. ||12||" |
| `Line 2123:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2124: अभिषेकाय निष्क्रान्ते भृगौ धर्मभृतां वरे |` | "When Bhrigu, the best among the upholders of dharma, went out for his ritual bath [abhisheka]," |
| `Line 2125: आश्रमं तस्य रक्षोऽथ पुलोमाभ्याजगाम ह ||१३||` | "A demon [raksha] then came to his hermitage, approaching Puloma. ||13||" |
translations: | `Line 2101: च्यवनस्यापि दायादः प्रमतिर्नाम धार्मिकः ||७||` | "Chyavana's descendant was the righteous one named Pramati. ||7||" |
| `Line 2102:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2103: प्रमतेरप्यभूत्पुत्रो घृताच्यां रुरुरित्युत ||७||` | "And Pramati's son, born of Ghritachi [celestial nymph], was named Ruru. ||7||" |
| `Line 2104:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2105: रुरोरपि सुतो जज्ञे शुनको वेदपारगः |` | "Ruru's son was born as Shunaka, master of the Vedas [scripture expert]," |
| `Line 2106: प्रमद्वरायां धर्मात्मा तव पूर्वपितामहात् ||८||` | "Born to Pramadvara, righteous one, from your great-grandfather. ||8||" |

| `Line 2114: च्यवनत्वं परिख्यातं तन्ममाचक्ष्व पृच्छतः ||१०||` | "Came to be known as Chyavana, tell this to me who asks. ||10||" |

| `Line 2118: भृगोः सुदयिता भार्या पुलोमेत्यभिविश्रुता |` | "Bhrigu's beloved wife was well-known as Puloma," |

| `Line 2121: तस्मिन्गर्भे सम्भृतेऽथ पुलोमायां भृगूद्वह |` | "When that fetus was developing in Puloma, O carrier of Bhrigu's lineage," |
| `Line 2122: समये समशीलिन्यां धर्मपत्न्यां यशस्विनः ||१२||` | "At that time, in his virtuous and lawful wife of the illustrious one. ||12||" |
| `Line 2123:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2124: अभिषेकाय निष्क्रान्ते भृगौ धर्मभृतां वरे |` | "When Bhrigu, the best among the upholders of dharma, went out for his ritual bath [abhisheka]," |
| `Line 2125: आश्रमं तस्य रक्षोऽथ पुलोमाभ्याजगाम ह ||१३||` | "A demon [raksha] then came to his hermitage, approaching Puloma. ||13||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2126: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2127: तं प्रविश्याश्रमं दृष्ट्वा भृगोर्भार्यामनिन्दिताम् |` | "Having entered that hermitage, seeing Bhrigu's blameless wife," |
| `Line 2128: हृच्छयेन समाविष्टो विचेताः समपद्यत ||१४||` | "He became possessed by desire and lost his senses. ||14||" |
| `Line 2129: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2130: अभ्यागतं तु तद्रक्षः पुलोमा चारुदर्शना |` | "But Puloma [Bhrigu's wife], beautiful to behold, welcomed that rakshasa [demon] who had arrived," |
| `Line 2131: न्यमन्त्रयत वन्येन फलमूलादिना तदा ||१५||` | "And invited him with forest fruits, roots and other such things. ||15||" |
| `Line 2132: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2133: तां तु रक्षस्ततो ब्रह्मन्हृच्छयेनाभिपीडितम् |` | "Then that rakshasa, O Brahmin, tormented by desire," |
| `Line 2134: दृष्ट्वा हृष्टमभूत्तत्र जिहीर्षुस्तामनिन्दिताम् ||१६||` | "Became excited there, wishing to abduct that blameless woman. ||16||" |
| `Line 2135: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2136: अथाग्निशरणेऽपश्यज्ज्वलितं जातवेदसम् |` | "Then, in the fire sanctuary, he saw the blazing Jatavedas [fire deity]," |
| `Line 2137: तमपृच्छत्ततो रक्षः पावकं ज्वलितं तदा ||१७||` | "Then the rakshasa questioned the blazing Pavaka [fire god]. ||17||" |
| `Line 2138: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2139: शंस मे कस्य भार्येयमग्ने पृष्ट ऋतेन वै |` | "Tell me truthfully, O Agni [fire god], when asked, whose wife is this?" |
| `Line 2140: सत्यस्त्वमसि सत्यं मे वद पावक पृच्छते ||१८||` | "You are truthful, so speak the truth to me who asks, O Pavaka [fire god]. ||18||" |
| `Line 2141: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2142: मया हीयं पूर्ववृता भार्यार्थे वरवर्णिनी |` | "This fair-complexioned woman was previously chosen by me as a wife," |
| `Line 2143: पश्चात्त्विमां पिता प्रादाद्भृगवेऽनृतकारिणे ||१९||` | "But afterwards her father gave her to Bhrigu, acting falsely. ||19||" |
| `Line 2144: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2145: सेयं यदि वरारोहा भृगोर्भार्या रहोगता |` | "If this beautiful woman is indeed Bhrigu's wife, now alone," |
| `Line 2146: तथा सत्यं समाख्याहि जिहीर्षाम्याश्रमादिमाम् ||२०||` | "Then tell me the truth, for I wish to take her away from this hermitage. ||20||" |
| `Line 2147: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2148: मन्युर्हि हृदयं मेऽद्य प्रदहन्निव तिष्ठति |` | "For anger burns in my heart today," |
| `Line 2149: मत्पुर्वभार्यां यदिमां भृगुः प्राप सुमध्यमाम् ||२१||` | "That Bhrigu has obtained this slender-waisted woman who was first promised to me. ||21||" |
| `Line 2150: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2151: तद्रक्ष एवमामन्त्र्य ज्वलितं जातवेदसम् |` | "That rakshasa [demon], having thus addressed the blazing Jatavedas [Agni/fire god]," |
| `Line 2152: शङ्कमानो भृगोर्भार्यां पुनः पुनरपृच्छत ||२२||` | "Suspecting (the identity of) Bhrigu's wife, asked again and again. ||22||" |
| `Line 2153: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2154: त्वमग्ने सर्वभूतानामन्तश्चरसि नित्यदा |` | "You, O Agni [fire god], always move within all beings," |
| `Line 2155: साक्षिवत्पुण्यपापेषु सत्यं ब्रूहि कवे वचः ||२३||` | "As a witness to virtuous and sinful deeds, speak the truth, O sage [wise one], speak the words. ||23||" |
| `Line 2156: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2157: मत्पूर्वभार्यापहृता भृगुणानृतकारिणा |` | "My former wife was taken away by Bhrigu, the untruthful one," |
| `Line 2158: सेयं यदि तथा मे त्वं सत्यमाख्यातुमर्हसि ||२४||` | "If this is she, then you should tell me the truth. ||24||" |
| `Line 2159: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2160: श्रुत्वा त्वत्तो भृगोर्भार्यां हरिष्याम्यहमाश्रमात् |` | "Having heard from you that she is Bhrigu's wife, I will take her away from the ashram [hermitage]," |
| `Line 2161: जातवेदः पश्यतस्ते वद सत्यां गिरं मम ||२५||` | "O Jatavedas [fire god], before your very eyes, speak the truth to my words. ||25||" |
| `Line 2162: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2163: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सप्तार्चिर्दुःखितो भृशम् |` | "Having heard those words of his, Saptarchi [seven-flamed fire] became greatly distressed," |
| `Line 2164: भीतोऽनृताच्च शापाच्च भृगोरित्यब्रवीच्छनैः ||२६||` | "Afraid of both untruth and the curse of Bhrigu, he spoke thus slowly. ||26||" |
| `Line 2165: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2166: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2167: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2168: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2169: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2170: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2171: ६` | "6" |
| `Line 2172: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2173: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2174: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2175: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2151: तद्रक्ष एवमामन्त्र्य ज्वलितं जातवेदसम् |` | "That rakshasa [demon], having thus addressed the blazing Jatavedas [Agni/fire god]," |
| `Line 2152: शङ्कमानो भृगोर्भार्यां पुनः पुनरपृच्छत ||२२||` | "Suspecting (the identity of) Bhrigu's wife, asked again and again. ||22||" |
| `Line 2153: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2154: त्वमग्ने सर्वभूतानामन्तश्चरसि नित्यदा |` | "You, O Agni [fire god], always move within all beings," |
| `Line 2155: साक्षिवत्पुण्यपापेषु सत्यं ब्रूहि कवे वचः ||२३||` | "As a witness to virtuous and sinful deeds, speak the truth, O sage [wise one], speak the words. ||23||" |
| `Line 2156: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2157: मत्पूर्वभार्यापहृता भृगुणानृतकारिणा |` | "My former wife was taken away by Bhrigu, the untruthful one," |
| `Line 2158: सेयं यदि तथा मे त्वं सत्यमाख्यातुमर्हसि ||२४||` | "If this is she, then you should tell me the truth. ||24||" |
| `Line 2159: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2160: श्रुत्वा त्वत्तो भृगोर्भार्यां हरिष्याम्यहमाश्रमात् |` | "Having heard from you that she is Bhrigu's wife, I will take her away from the ashram [hermitage]," |
| `Line 2161: जातवेदः पश्यतस्ते वद सत्यां गिरं मम ||२५||` | "O Jatavedas [fire god], before your very eyes, speak the truth to my words. ||25||" |
| `Line 2162: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2163: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सप्तार्चिर्दुःखितो भृशम् |` | "Having heard those words of his, Saptarchi [seven-flamed fire] became greatly distressed," |
| `Line 2164: भीतोऽनृताच्च शापाच्च भृगोरित्यब्रवीच्छनैः ||२६||` | "Afraid of both untruth and the curse of Bhrigu, he spoke thus slowly. ||26||" |
| `Line 2165: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2166: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2167: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2168: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2169: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2170: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2172: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2173: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2174: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2176: अग्नेरथ वचः श्रुत्वा तद्रक्षः प्रजहार ताम् |` | "Having heard the words of Agni [fire god], that rakshasa [demon] seized her," |
| `Line 2177: ब्रह्मन्वराहरूपेण मनोमारुतरंहसा ||१||` | "O Brahmin, in the form of a boar, with the speed of mind and wind. ||1||" |
| `Line 2178: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2179: ततः स गर्भो निवसन्कुक्षौ भृगुकुलोद्वह |` | "Then that embryo, residing in her womb, O upholder of Bhrigu's lineage," |
| `Line 2180: रोषान्मातुश्च्युतः कुक्षेश्च्यवनस्तेन सोऽभवत् ||२||` | "Fell from the mother's womb due to her fear, and thus he became known as Chyavana [the fallen]. ||2||" |
| `Line 2181: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2182: तं दृष्ट्वा मातुरुदराच्च्युतमादित्यवर्चसम् |` | "Seeing him fallen from the mother's womb, radiant like the sun," |
| `Line 2183: तद्रक्षो भस्मसाद्भूतं पपात परिमुच्य ताम् ||३||` | "That rakshasa was reduced to ashes and fell, releasing her. ||3||" |
| `Line 2184: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2185: सा तमादाय सुश्रोणी ससार भृगुनन्दनम् |` | "She, with beautiful hips, taking him, the son of Bhrigu," |
| `Line 2186: च्यवनं भार्गवं ब्रह्मन्पुलोमा दुःखमूर्च्छिता ||४||` | "Chyavana of Bhrigu's lineage, O Brahmin, Puloma [wife of Bhrigu] proceeded, overcome with grief. ||4||" |
| `Line 2187: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2188: तां ददर्श स्वयं ब्रह्मा सर्वलोकपितामहः |` | "Brahma himself, the grandfather of all worlds, saw her," |
| `Line 2189: रुदतीं बाष्पपूर्णाक्षीं भृगोर्भार्यामनिन्दिताम् ||५||` | "Weeping, with eyes full of tears, the blameless wife of Bhrigu. ||5||" |
| `Line 2190: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2191: सान्त्वयामास भगवान्वधूं ब्रह्मा पितामहः ||५||` | "The lord Brahma, the grandfather, consoled the bride. ||5||" |
| `Line 2192: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2193: अश्रुबिन्दूद्भवा तस्याः प्रावर्तत महानदी |` | "From her teardrops flowed a great river," |
| `Line 2194: अनुवर्तती सृतिं तस्या भृगोः पत्न्या यशस्विनः ||६||` | "Following the path of her, the wife of the illustrious Bhrigu. ||6||" |
| `Line 2195: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2196: तस्या मार्गं सृतवतीं दृष्ट्वा तु सरितं तदा |` | "Seeing that river flowing along her path then," |
| `Line 2197: नाम तस्यास्तदा नद्याश्चक्रे लोकपितामहः ||७||` | "The grandfather of the worlds then gave a name to that river. ||7||" |
| `Line 2198: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2199: वधूसरेति भगवांश्च्यवनस्याश्रमं प्रति ||७||` | "Vadhusara [bride's flow], said the lord, (as she went) toward Chyavana's hermitage. ||7||" |
| `Line 2200: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2176: अग्नेरथ वचः श्रुत्वा तद्रक्षः प्रजहार ताम् |` | "Having heard the words of Agni [fire god], that rakshasa [demon] seized her," |
| `Line 2177: ब्रह्मन्वराहरूपेण मनोमारुतरंहसा ||१||` | "O Brahmin, in the form of a boar, with the speed of mind and wind. ||1||" |
| `Line 2178: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2179: ततः स गर्भो निवसन्कुक्षौ भृगुकुलोद्वह |` | "Then that embryo, residing in her womb, O upholder of Bhrigu's lineage," |
| `Line 2180: रोषान्मातुश्च्युतः कुक्षेश्च्यवनस्तेन सोऽभवत् ||२||` | "Fell from the mother's womb due to her fear, and thus he became known as Chyavana [the fallen]. ||2||" |
| `Line 2181: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2182: तं दृष्ट्वा मातुरुदराच्च्युतमादित्यवर्चसम् |` | "Seeing him fallen from the mother's womb, radiant like the sun," |
| `Line 2183: तद्रक्षो भस्मसाद्भूतं पपात परिमुच्य ताम् ||३||` | "That rakshasa was reduced to ashes and fell, releasing her. ||3||" |
| `Line 2184: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2185: सा तमादाय सुश्रोणी ससार भृगुनन्दनम् |` | "She, with beautiful hips, taking him, the son of Bhrigu," |
| `Line 2186: च्यवनं भार्गवं ब्रह्मन्पुलोमा दुःखमूर्च्छिता ||४||` | "Chyavana of Bhrigu's lineage, O Brahmin, Puloma [wife of Bhrigu] proceeded, overcome with grief. ||4||" |
| `Line 2187: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2188: तां ददर्श स्वयं ब्रह्मा सर्वलोकपितामहः |` | "Brahma himself, the grandfather of all worlds, saw her," |
| `Line 2189: रुदतीं बाष्पपूर्णाक्षीं भृगोर्भार्यामनिन्दिताम् ||५||` | "Weeping, with eyes full of tears, the blameless wife of Bhrigu. ||5||" |
| `Line 2190: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2191: सान्त्वयामास भगवान्वधूं ब्रह्मा पितामहः ||५||` | "The lord Brahma, the grandfather, consoled the bride. ||5||" |
| `Line 2192: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2193: अश्रुबिन्दूद्भवा तस्याः प्रावर्तत महानदी |` | "From her teardrops flowed a great river," |
| `Line 2194: अनुवर्तती सृतिं तस्या भृगोः पत्न्या यशस्विनः ||६||` | "Following the path of her, the wife of the illustrious Bhrigu. ||6||" |
| `Line 2195: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2196: तस्या मार्गं सृतवतीं दृष्ट्वा तु सरितं तदा |` | "Seeing that river flowing along her path then," |
| `Line 2197: नाम तस्यास्तदा नद्याश्चक्रे लोकपितामहः ||७||` | "The grandfather of the worlds then gave a name to that river. ||7||" |
| `Line 2198: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2199: वधूसरेति भगवांश्च्यवनस्याश्रमं प्रति ||७||` | "Vadhusara [bride's flow], said the lord, (as she went) toward Chyavana's hermitage. ||7||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2201: स एवं च्यवनो जज्ञे भृगोः पुत्रः प्रतापवान् |` | "Thus was born Chyavana, the mighty son of Bhrigu." |
| `Line 2202: तं ददर्श पिता तत्र च्यवनं तां च भामिनीम् ॥८॥` | "There, the father saw Chyavana and that beautiful woman [Puloma]. ||8||" |
| `Line 2203: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2204: स पुलोमां ततो भार्यां पप्रच्छ कुपितो भृगुः |` | "Then the enraged Bhrigu asked his wife Puloma:" |
| `Line 2205: केनासि रक्षसे तस्मै कथितेह जिहीर्षवे ॥९॥` | "By whom were you revealed to that demon who wished to abduct you here? ||9||" |
| `Line 2206: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2207: न हि त्वां वेद तद्रक्षो मद्भार्यां चारुहासिनीम् ॥९॥` | "For that demon could not have known you, my sweet-smiling wife, on his own. ||9||" |
| `Line 2208: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2209: तत्त्वमाख्याहि तं ह्यद्य शप्तुमिच्छाम्यहं रुषा |` | "Therefore, tell me who it was, for I wish to curse him today in my anger." |
| `Line 2210: बिभेति को न शापान्मे कस्य चायं व्यतिक्रमः ॥१०॥` | "Who does not fear my curses, and whose transgression is this? ||10||" |
| `Line 2211: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2212: पुलोमोवाच॥` | "Puloma said:" |
| `Line 2213: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2214: अग्निना भगवंस्तस्मै रक्षसेऽहं निवेदिता |` | "O lord, I was revealed to that demon by Agni [fire deity]." |
| `Line 2215: ततो मामनयद्रक्षः क्रोशन्तीं कुररीमिव ॥११॥` | "Then the demon carried me away as I cried out like an osprey. ||11||" |
| `Line 2216: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2217: साहं तव सुतस्यास्य तेजसा परिमोक्षिता |` | "I was freed by the power of this son of yours," |
| `Line 2218: भस्मीभूतं च तद्रक्षो मामुत्सृज्य पपात वै ॥१२॥` | "And that demon, releasing me, fell down reduced to ashes. ||12||" |
| `Line 2219: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2220: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2221: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2222: इति श्रुत्वा पुलोमाया भृगुः परममन्युमान् |` | "Having heard this from Puloma, Bhrigu, filled with extreme anger," |
| `Line 2223: शशापाग्निमभिक्रुद्धः सर्वभक्षो भविष्यसि ॥१३॥` | "Cursed Agni in great wrath: 'You shall become the consumer of everything!' ||13||" |
| `Line 2224: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2225: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 2202: तं ददर्श पिता तत्र च्यवनं तां च भामिनीम् ॥८॥` | "There, the father saw Chyavana and that beautiful woman [Puloma]. ||8||" |

| `Line 2230: ७` | "7" |
