| `Line 2232:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2233: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta said:" |
| `Line 2234:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2235: शप्तस्तु भृगुणा वह्निः क्रुद्धो वाक्यमथाब्रवीत् |` | "When cursed by Bhrigu, Agni [fire deity], angered, then spoke these words:" |
| `Line 2236: किमिदं साहसं ब्रह्मन्कृतवानसि साम्प्रतम् ||१||` | "What is this rash act, O Brahmin, that you have committed now? ||1||" |
| `Line 2237:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2238: धर्मे प्रयतमानस्य सत्यं च वदतः समम् |` | "While I was striving to uphold dharma [righteousness] and speaking the truth equally," |
| `Line 2239: पृष्टो यदब्रुवं सत्यं व्यभिचारोऽत्र को मम ||२||` | "When asked, I spoke the truth - what transgression is there in this on my part? ||2||" |
| `Line 2240:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2241: पृष्टो हि साक्षी यः साक्ष्यं जानमानोऽन्यथा वदेत् |` | "Indeed, a witness who, when questioned, knowingly gives false testimony," |
| `Line 2242: स पूर्वानात्मनः सप्त कुले हन्यात्तथा परान् ||३||` | "He destroys seven generations before him in his family and seven after. ||3||" |
| `Line 2243:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2244: यश्च कार्यार्थतत्त्वज्ञो जानमानो न भाषते |` | "And he who knows the truth of a matter but does not speak it," |
| `Line 2245: सोऽपि तेनैव पापेन लिप्यते नात्र संशयः ||४||` | "He too is tainted by that same sin - there is no doubt in this. ||4||" |
| `Line 2246:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2247: शक्तोऽहमपि शप्तुं त्वां मान्यास्तु ब्राह्मणा मम |` | "I too am capable of cursing you, but Brahmins are worthy of my respect," |
| `Line 2248: जानतोऽपि च ते व्यक्तं कथयिष्ये निबोध तत् ||५||` | "And though you know it, I shall clearly explain it to you - listen to that. ||5||" |
| `Line 2249:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2250: योगेन बहुधात्मानं कृत्वा तिष्ठामि मूर्तिषु |` | "Through yoga [divine power], I manifest myself in many forms and exist in various embodiments," |

| `Line 2235: शप्तस्तु भृगुणा वह्निः क्रुद्धो वाक्यमथाब्रवीत् |` | "When cursed by Bhrigu, Agni [fire deity], angered, then spoke these words:" |
| `Line 2236: किमिदं साहसं ब्रह्मन्कृतवानसि साम्प्रतम् ||१||` | "What is this rash act, O Brahmin, that you have committed now? ||1||" |

| `Line 2239: पृष्टो यदब्रुवं सत्यं व्यभिचारोऽत्र को मम ||२||` | "When asked, I spoke the truth - what transgression is there in this on my part? ||2||" |
| `Line 2240:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2241: पृष्टो हि साक्षी यः साक्ष्यं जानमानोऽन्यथा वदेत् |` | "Indeed, a witness who, when questioned, knowingly gives false testimony," |
| `Line 2242: स पूर्वानात्मनः सप्त कुले हन्यात्तथा परान् ||३||` | "He destroys seven generations before him in his family and seven after. ||3||" |
| `Line 2243:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2244: यश्च कार्यार्थतत्त्वज्ञो जानमानो न भाषते |` | "And he who knows the truth of a matter but does not speak it," |
| `Line 2245: सोऽपि तेनैव पापेन लिप्यते नात्र संशयः ||४||` | "He too is tainted by that same sin - there is no doubt in this. ||4||" |
| `Line 2246:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2247: शक्तोऽहमपि शप्तुं त्वां मान्यास्तु ब्राह्मणा मम |` | "I too am capable of cursing you, but Brahmins are worthy of my respect," |
| `Line 2248: जानतोऽपि च ते व्यक्तं कथयिष्ये निबोध तत् ||५||` | "And though you know it, I shall clearly explain it to you - listen to that. ||5||" |
| `Line 2249:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2250: योगेन बहुधात्मानं कृत्वा तिष्ठामि मूर्तिषु |` | "Through yoga [divine power], I manifest myself in many forms and exist in various embodiments," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2251: अग्निहोत्रेषु सत्रेषु क्रियास्वथ मखेषु च ||६||` | "In Agnihotra [fire sacrifices], satras [long rituals], other rites, and makhas [ceremonial sacrifices]. ||6||" |
| `Line 2252: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2253: वेदोक्तेन विधानेन मयि यद्धूयते हविः |` | "When oblations are offered into me according to Vedic injunctions," |
| `Line 2254: देवताः पितरश्चैव तेन तृप्ता भवन्ति वै ||७||` | "The deities and the ancestors indeed become satisfied by that. ||7||" |
| `Line 2255: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2256: आपो देवगणाः सर्वे आपः पितृगणास्तथा |` | "All hosts of gods are waters, and likewise the hosts of ancestors are waters," |
| `Line 2257: दर्शश्च पौर्णमासश्च देवानां पितृभिः सह ||८||` | "The new moon (Darsha) and full moon (Paurnamasa) sacrifices are for gods along with ancestors. ||8||" |
| `Line 2258: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2259: देवताः पितरस्तस्मात्पितरश्चापि देवताः |` | "Therefore, the deities are ancestors and the ancestors are also deities," |
| `Line 2260: एकीभूताश्च पूज्यन्ते पृथक्त्वेन च पर्वसु ||९||` | "They are worshipped as unified and also separately during sacred occasions. ||9||" |
| `Line 2261: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2262: देवताः पितरश्चैव जुह्वते मयि यत्सदा |` | "The deities and ancestors always offer oblations through me," |
| `Line 2263: त्रिदशानां पितृणां च मुखमेवमहं स्मृतः ||१०||` | "Thus I am considered the mouth of the thirty gods [Tridasha] and the ancestors. ||10||" |
| `Line 2264: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2265: अमावास्यां च पितरः पौर्णमास्यां च देवताः |` | "On the new moon day the ancestors, and on the full moon day the deities," |
| `Line 2266: मन्मुखेनैव हूयन्ते भुञ्जते च हुतं हविः ||११||` | "Are invoked through my mouth alone, and they consume the offered oblations. ||11||" |
| `Line 2267: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2268: सर्वभक्षः कथं तेषां भविष्यामि मुखं त्वहम् ||११||` | "How shall I, becoming an eater of everything, remain their mouth? ||11||" |
| `Line 2269: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2270: चिन्तयित्वा ततो वह्निश्चक्रे संहारमात्मनः |` | "Having thought thus, Vahni [fire god] then withdrew himself," |
| `Line 2271: द्विजानामग्निहोत्रेषु यज्ञसत्रक्रियासु च ||१२||` | "From the Agnihotra rituals of the twice-born [Brahmins] and from sacrificial ceremonies. ||12||" |
| `Line 2272: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2273: निरोङ्कारवषट्काराः स्वधास्वाहाविवर्जिताः |` | "Deprived of Om, Vashat [ritual exclamations], Svadha and Svaha [sacred utterances]," |
| `Line 2274: विनाग्निना प्रजाः सर्वास्तत आसन्सुदुःखिताः ||१३||` | "Without fire, all creatures thereafter became extremely miserable. ||13||" |
| `Line 2275: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2251: अग्निहोत्रेषु सत्रेषु क्रियास्वथ मखेषु च ||६||` | "In Agnihotra [fire sacrifices], satras [long rituals], other rites, and makhas [ceremonial sacrifices]. ||6||" |
| `Line 2252: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2253: वेदोक्तेन विधानेन मयि यद्धूयते हविः |` | "When oblations are offered into me according to Vedic injunctions," |
| `Line 2254: देवताः पितरश्चैव तेन तृप्ता भवन्ति वै ||७||` | "The deities and the ancestors indeed become satisfied by that. ||7||" |
| `Line 2255: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2256: आपो देवगणाः सर्वे आपः पितृगणास्तथा |` | "All hosts of gods are waters, and likewise the hosts of ancestors are waters," |
| `Line 2257: दर्शश्च पौर्णमासश्च देवानां पितृभिः सह ||८||` | "The new moon (Darsha) and full moon (Paurnamasa) sacrifices are for gods along with ancestors. ||8||" |
| `Line 2258: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2259: देवताः पितरस्तस्मात्पितरश्चापि देवताः |` | "Therefore, the deities are ancestors and the ancestors are also deities," |
| `Line 2260: एकीभूताश्च पूज्यन्ते पृथक्त्वेन च पर्वसु ||९||` | "They are worshipped as unified and also separately during sacred occasions. ||9||" |
| `Line 2261: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2262: देवताः पितरश्चैव जुह्वते मयि यत्सदा |` | "The deities and ancestors always offer oblations through me," |
| `Line 2263: त्रिदशानां पितृणां च मुखमेवमहं स्मृतः ||१०||` | "Thus I am considered the mouth of the thirty gods [Tridasha] and the ancestors. ||10||" |
| `Line 2264: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2265: अमावास्यां च पितरः पौर्णमास्यां च देवताः |` | "On the new moon day the ancestors, and on the full moon day the deities," |
| `Line 2266: मन्मुखेनैव हूयन्ते भुञ्जते च हुतं हविः ||११||` | "Are invoked through my mouth alone, and they consume the offered oblations. ||11||" |
| `Line 2267: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2268: सर्वभक्षः कथं तेषां भविष्यामि मुखं त्वहम् ||११||` | "How shall I, becoming an eater of everything, remain their mouth? ||11||" |
| `Line 2269: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2270: चिन्तयित्वा ततो वह्निश्चक्रे संहारमात्मनः |` | "Having thought thus, Vahni [fire god] then withdrew himself," |
| `Line 2271: द्विजानामग्निहोत्रेषु यज्ञसत्रक्रियासु च ||१२||` | "From the Agnihotra rituals of the twice-born [Brahmins] and from sacrificial ceremonies. ||12||" |
| `Line 2272: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2273: निरोङ्कारवषट्काराः स्वधास्वाहाविवर्जिताः |` | "Deprived of Om, Vashat [ritual exclamations], Svadha and Svaha [sacred utterances]," |
| `Line 2274: विनाग्निना प्रजाः सर्वास्तत आसन्सुदुःखिताः ||१३||` | "Without fire, all creatures thereafter became extremely miserable. ||13||" |
| `Line 2275: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 226: धर्मस्य वायोः शक्रस्य देवयोश्च तथाश्विनोः ||६९||` | "Of Dharma [righteousness deity], Vayu [wind god], Shakra [Indra], and also of the two Ashvins [divine twins]. ||69||" |
| `Line 227: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 228: तापसैः सह संवृद्धा मातृभ्यां परिरक्षिताः |` | "They grew up with ascetics, protected by their mothers," |
| `Line 229: मेध्यारण्येषु पुण्येषु महतामाश्रमेषु च ||७०||` | "In sacred forests and in the great hermitages of sages. ||70||" |
| `Line 230: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 231: ऋषिभिश्च तदानीता धार्तराष्ट्रान्प्रति स्वयम् |` | "And then the sages themselves brought them to the sons of Dhritarashtra," |
| `Line 232: शिशवश्चाभिरूपाश्च जटिला ब्रह्मचारिणः ||७१||` | "The children, handsome, with matted hair, practicing celibacy [brahmacharya]. ||71||" |
| `Line 233: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 234: पुत्राश्च भ्रातरश्चेमे शिष्याश्च सुहृदश्च वः |` | "These are your sons, brothers, disciples, and friends," |
| `Line 235: पाण्डवा एत इत्युक्त्वा मुनयोऽन्तर्हितास्ततः ||७२||` | "These are the Pandavas," saying thus, the sages disappeared from there. ||72||" |
| `Line 236: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 237: तांस्तैर्निवेदितान्दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवान्कौरवास्तदा |` | "Seeing those Pandavas thus introduced, the Kauravas then," |
| `Line 238: शिष्टाश्च वर्णाः पौरा ये ते हर्षाच्चुक्रुशुर्भृशम् ||७३||` | "And the noble classes and citizens who were there, cried out loudly with joy. ||73||" |
| `Line 239: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 240: आहुः केचिन्न तस्यैते तस्यैत इति चापरे |` | "Some said, 'These are not his,' while others said, 'These are indeed his,'" |
| `Line 241: यदा चिरमृतः पाण्डुः कथं तस्येति चापरे ||७४||` | "And others said, 'Since Pandu died long ago, how can they be his?' ||74||" |
| `Line 242: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 243: स्वागतं सर्वथा दिष्ट्या पाण्डोः पश्याम सन्ततिम् |` | "'Welcome in every way! By good fortune we see the progeny of Pandu!'" |
| `Line 244: उच्यतां स्वागतमिति वाचोऽश्रूयन्त सर्वशः ||७५||` | "Voices saying 'Welcome!' were heard from all sides. ||75||" |
| `Line 245: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 246: तस्मिन्नुपरते शब्दे दिशः सर्वा विनादयन् |` | "When that sound subsided, resounding in all directions," |
| `Line 247: अन्तर्हितानां भूतानां निस्वनस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ||७६||` | "There arose a tumultuous sound of invisible beings. ||76||" |
| `Line 248: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 249: पुष्पवृष्टिः शुभा गन्धाः शङ्खदुन्दुभिनिस्वनाः |` | "A shower of flowers, auspicious fragrances, sounds of conches and drums," |
| `Line 250: आसन्प्रवेशे पार्थानां तदद्भुतमिवाभवत् ||७७||` | "Occurred at the entrance of the Parthas [sons of Pritha], and it was like a miracle. ||77||" |
translations: | `Line 226: धर्मस्य वायोः शक्रस्य देवयोश्च तथाश्विनोः ||६९||` | "Of Dharma [righteousness deity], Vayu [wind god], Shakra [Indra], and also of the two Ashvins [divine twins]. ||69||" |
| `Line 227: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 228: तापसैः सह संवृद्धा मातृभ्यां परिरक्षिताः |` | "They grew up with ascetics, protected by their mothers," |
| `Line 229: मेध्यारण्येषु पुण्येषु महतामाश्रमेषु च ||७०||` | "In sacred forests and in the great hermitages of sages. ||70||" |
| `Line 230: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 231: ऋषिभिश्च तदानीता धार्तराष्ट्रान्प्रति स्वयम् |` | "And then the sages themselves brought them to the sons of Dhritarashtra," |
| `Line 232: शिशवश्चाभिरूपाश्च जटिला ब्रह्मचारिणः ||७१||` | "The children, handsome, with matted hair, practicing celibacy [brahmacharya]. ||71||" |
| `Line 233: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 234: पुत्राश्च भ्रातरश्चेमे शिष्याश्च सुहृदश्च वः |` | "These are your sons, brothers, disciples, and friends," |
| `Line 235: पाण्डवा एत इत्युक्त्वा मुनयोऽन्तर्हितास्ततः ||७२||` | "These are the Pandavas," saying thus, the sages disappeared from there. ||72||" |
| `Line 236: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 237: तांस्तैर्निवेदितान्दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवान्कौरवास्तदा |` | "Seeing those Pandavas thus introduced, the Kauravas then," |
| `Line 238: शिष्टाश्च वर्णाः पौरा ये ते हर्षाच्चुक्रुशुर्भृशम् ||७३||` | "And the noble classes and citizens who were there, cried out loudly with joy. ||73||" |
| `Line 239: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 240: आहुः केचिन्न तस्यैते तस्यैत इति चापरे |` | "Some said, 'These are not his,' while others said, 'These are indeed his,'" |
| `Line 241: यदा चिरमृतः पाण्डुः कथं तस्येति चापरे ||७४||` | "And others said, 'Since Pandu died long ago, how can they be his?' ||74||" |
| `Line 242: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 243: स्वागतं सर्वथा दिष्ट्या पाण्डोः पश्याम सन्ततिम् |` | "'Welcome in every way! By good fortune we see the progeny of Pandu!'" |
| `Line 244: उच्यतां स्वागतमिति वाचोऽश्रूयन्त सर्वशः ||७५||` | "Voices saying 'Welcome!' were heard from all sides. ||75||" |
| `Line 245: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 246: तस्मिन्नुपरते शब्दे दिशः सर्वा विनादयन् |` | "When that sound subsided, resounding in all directions," |
| `Line 247: अन्तर्हितानां भूतानां निस्वनस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ||७६||` | "There arose a tumultuous sound of invisible beings. ||76||" |
| `Line 248: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 249: पुष्पवृष्टिः शुभा गन्धाः शङ्खदुन्दुभिनिस्वनाः |` | "A shower of flowers, auspicious fragrances, sounds of conches and drums," |
| `Line 250: आसन्प्रवेशे पार्थानां तदद्भुतमिवाभवत् ||७७||` | "Occurred at the entrance of the Parthas [sons of Pritha], and it was like a miracle. ||77||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2276: अथर्षयः समुद्विग्ना देवान्गत्वाब्रुवन्वचः |` | "Then the rishis [sages], greatly alarmed, went to the devas [gods] and spoke these words:" |
| `Line 2277: अग्निनाशात्क्रियाभ्रंशाद्भ्रान्ता लोकास्त्रयोऽनघाः ||१४||` | "Due to Agni's [fire god's] disappearance and the cessation of rituals, the three worlds are confused, O sinless ones. ||14||" |
| `Line 2278: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2279: विधध्वमत्र यत्कार्यं न स्यात्कालात्ययो यथा ||१४||` | "Please ordain what should be done in this matter so that there is no delay beyond the proper time. ||14||" |
| `Line 2280: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2281: अथर्षयश्च देवाश्च ब्रह्माणमुपगम्य तु |` | "Then the rishis [sages] and devas [gods], approaching Brahma [creator deity]," |
| `Line 2282: अग्नेरावेदयञ्शापं क्रियासंहारमेव च ||१५||` | "Informed him about Agni's [fire god's] curse and the cessation of rituals. ||15||" |
| `Line 2283: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2284: भृगुणा वै महाभाग शप्तोऽग्निः कारणान्तरे |` | "O greatly fortunate one, Agni [fire god] was cursed by Bhrigu [sage] for a particular reason," |
| `Line 2285: कथं देवमुखो भूत्वा यज्ञभागाग्रभुक्तथा ||१६||` | "How can he, being the mouth of the gods and the foremost consumer of sacrificial offerings, ||16||" |
| `Line 2286: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2287: हुतभुक्सर्वलोकेषु सर्वभक्षत्वमेष्यति ||१६||` | "The fire [oblation-eater] in all worlds, come to consume everything? ||16||" |
| `Line 2288: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2289: श्रुत्वा तु तद्वचस्तेषामग्निमाहूय लोककृत् |` | "Having heard their words, the Creator [world-maker] summoned Agni [fire god]," |
| `Line 2290: उवाच वचनं श्लक्ष्णं भूतभावनमव्ययम् ||१७||` | "And spoke gentle words that were nurturing to beings and imperishable. ||17||" |
| `Line 2291: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2292: लोकानामिह सर्वेषां त्वं कर्ता चान्त एव च |` | "You are both the creator and the end of all these worlds," |
| `Line 2293: त्वं धारयसि लोकांस्त्रीन्क्रियाणां च प्रवर्तकः ||१८||` | "You sustain the three worlds and are the initiator of all rituals. ||18||" |
| `Line 2294: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2295: स तथा कुरु लोकेश नोच्छिद्येरन्क्रिया यथा ||१८||` | "Therefore, O Lord of worlds, act in such a way that the rituals are not destroyed. ||18||" |
| `Line 2296: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2297: कस्मादेवं विमूढस्त्वमीश्वरः सन्हुताशनः |` | "Why are you so confused, being the lord, O consumer of oblations [fire god]?" |
| `Line 2298: त्वं पवित्रं यदा लोके सर्वभूतगतश्च ह ||१९||` | "When you are the purifier in the world and present in all beings, ||19||" |
| `Line 2299: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2300: न त्वं सर्वशरीरेण सर्वभक्षत्वमेष्यसि |` | "You shall not consume everything with your entire body." |
translations: | `Line 2276: अथर्षयः समुद्विग्ना देवान्गत्वाब्रुवन्वचः |` | "Then the rishis [sages], greatly alarmed, went to the devas [gods] and spoke these words:" |

| `Line 2277: अग्निनाशात्क्रियाभ्रंशाद्भ्रान्ता लोकास्त्रयोऽनघाः ||१४||` | "Due to Agni's [fire god's] disappearance and the cessation of rituals, the three worlds are confused, O sinless ones. ||14||" |
| `Line 2278: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2279: विधध्वमत्र यत्कार्यं न स्यात्कालात्ययो यथा ||१४||` | "Please ordain what should be done in this matter so that there is no delay beyond the proper time. ||14||" |
| `Line 2280: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2281: अथर्षयश्च देवाश्च ब्रह्माणमुपगम्य तु |` | "Then the rishis [sages] and devas [gods], approaching Brahma [creator deity]," |
| `Line 2282: अग्नेरावेदयञ्शापं क्रियासंहारमेव च ||१५||` | "Informed him about Agni's [fire god's] curse and the cessation of rituals. ||15||" |
| `Line 2283: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2284: भृगुणा वै महाभाग शप्तोऽग्निः कारणान्तरे |` | "O greatly fortunate one, Agni [fire god] was cursed by Bhrigu [sage] for a particular reason," |
| `Line 2285: कथं देवमुखो भूत्वा यज्ञभागाग्रभुक्तथा ||१६||` | "How can he, being the mouth of the gods and the foremost consumer of sacrificial offerings, ||16||" |
| `Line 2286: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2287: हुतभुक्सर्वलोकेषु सर्वभक्षत्वमेष्यति ||१६||` | "The fire [oblation-eater] in all worlds, come to consume everything? ||16||" |
| `Line 2288: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2289: श्रुत्वा तु तद्वचस्तेषामग्निमाहूय लोककृत् |` | "Having heard their words, the Creator [world-maker] summoned Agni [fire god]," |
| `Line 2290: उवाच वचनं श्लक्ष्णं भूतभावनमव्ययम् ||१७||` | "And spoke gentle words that were nurturing to beings and imperishable. ||17||" |
| `Line 2291: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2292: लोकानामिह सर्वेषां त्वं कर्ता चान्त एव च |` | "You are both the creator and the end of all these worlds," |
| `Line 2293: त्वं धारयसि लोकांस्त्रीन्क्रियाणां च प्रवर्तकः ||१८||` | "You sustain the three worlds and are the initiator of all rituals. ||18||" |
| `Line 2294: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2295: स तथा कुरु लोकेश नोच्छिद्येरन्क्रिया यथा ||१८||` | "Therefore, O Lord of worlds, act in such a way that the rituals are not destroyed. ||18||" |
| `Line 2296: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2297: कस्मादेवं विमूढस्त्वमीश्वरः सन्हुताशनः |` | "Why are you so confused, being the lord, O consumer of oblations [fire god]?" |
| `Line 2298: त्वं पवित्रं यदा लोके सर्वभूतगतश्च ह ||१९||` | "When you are the purifier in the world and present in all beings, ||19||" |
| `Line 2299: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2300: न त्वं सर्वशरीरेण सर्वभक्षत्वमेष्यसि |` | "You shall not consume everything with your entire body." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2301: उपादानेऽर्चिषो यास्ते सर्वं धक्ष्यन्ति ताः शिखिन् ॥२०॥` | "When kindled, your flames shall consume everything, O Fire [Agni]. ||20||" |
| `Line 2302: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2303: यथा सूर्यांशुभिः स्पृष्टं सर्वं शुचि विभाव्यते |` | "Just as everything touched by the sun's rays is considered pure," |
| `Line 2304: तथा त्वदर्चिर्निर्दग्धं सर्वं शुचि भविष्यति ॥२१॥` | "So too shall everything burnt by your flames become pure. ||21||" |
| `Line 2305: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2306: तदग्ने त्वं महत्तेजः स्वप्रभावाद्विनिर्गतम् |` | "Therefore, O Agni, with your great splendor emanating from your own power," |
| `Line 2307: स्वतेजसैव तं शापं कुरु सत्यमृषेर्विभो ॥२२॥` | "Make the sage's curse come true through your own brilliance, O mighty one. ||22||" |
| `Line 2308: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2309: देवानां चात्मनो भागं गृहाण त्वं मुखे हुतम् ॥२२॥` | "And receive in your mouth the portion offered to the gods and yourself. ||22||" |
| `Line 2310: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2311: एवमस्त्विति तं वह्निः प्रत्युवाच पितामहम् |` | "So be it," replied the fire [Agni] to Pitamaha [Brahma]," |
| `Line 2312: जगाम शासनं कर्तुं देवस्य परमेष्ठिनः ॥२३॥` | "And went to carry out the command of the supreme deity [Parameshthina]. ||23||" |
| `Line 2313: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2314: देवर्षयश्च मुदितास्ततो जग्मुर्यथागतम् |` | "Then the divine sages [devarshis], delighted, departed as they had come," |
| `Line 2315: ऋषयश्च यथापूर्वं क्रियाः सर्वाः प्रचक्रिरे ॥२४॥` | "And the sages resumed performing all their rituals as before. ||24||" |
| `Line 2316: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2317: दिवि देवा मुमुदिरे भूतसङ्घाश्च लौकिकाः |` | "The gods rejoiced in heaven, as did the hosts of worldly beings," |
| `Line 2318: अग्निश्च परमां प्रीतिमवाप हतकल्मषः ॥२५॥` | "And Agni, freed from sin [kalmasha], attained supreme satisfaction. ||25||" |
| `Line 2319: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2320: एवमेष पुरावृत्त इतिहासोऽग्निशापजः |` | "Thus is this ancient tale about the curse of Agni," |
| `Line 2321: पुलोमस्य विनाशश्च च्यवनस्य च सम्भवः ॥२६॥` | "The destruction of Puloma and the birth of Chyavana. ||26||" |
| `Line 2322: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2323: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2324: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2325: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2301: उपादानेऽर्चिषो यास्ते सर्वं धक्ष्यन्ति ताः शिखिन् ॥२०॥` | "When kindled, your flames shall consume everything, O Fire [Agni]. ||20||" |

| `Line 2303: यथा सूर्यांशुभिः स्पृष्टं सर्वं शुचि विभाव्यते |` | "Just as everything touched by the sun's rays is considered pure," |
| `Line 2304: तथा त्वदर्चिर्निर्दग्धं सर्वं शुचि भविष्यति ॥२१॥` | "So too shall everything burnt by your flames become pure. ||21||" |

| `Line 2307: स्वतेजसैव तं शापं कुरु सत्यमृषेर्विभो ॥२२॥` | "Make the sage's curse come true through your own brilliance, O mighty one. ||22||" |

| `Line 2310: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2311: एवमस्त्विति तं वह्निः प्रत्युवाच पितामहम् |` | "So be it," replied the fire [Agni] to Pitamaha [Brahma]," |

| `Line 2314: देवर्षयश्च मुदितास्ततो जग्मुर्यथागतम् |` | "Then the divine sages [devarshis], delighted, departed as they had come," |
| `Line 2315: ऋषयश्च यथापूर्वं क्रियाः सर्वाः प्रचक्रिरे ॥२४॥` | "And the sages resumed performing all their rituals as before. ||24||" |
| `Line 2316: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2317: दिवि देवा मुमुदिरे भूतसङ्घाश्च लौकिकाः |` | "The gods rejoiced in heaven, as did the hosts of worldly beings," |
| `Line 2318: अग्निश्च परमां प्रीतिमवाप हतकल्मषः ॥२५॥` | "And Agni, freed from sin [kalmasha], attained supreme satisfaction. ||25||" |
| `Line 2319: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2320: एवमेष पुरावृत्त इतिहासोऽग्निशापजः |` | "Thus is this ancient tale about the curse of Agni," |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2326: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2327: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2328: ८` | "8 [chapter number]" |
| `Line 2329: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2330: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2331: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2332: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2333: स चापि च्यवनो ब्रह्मन्भार्गवोऽजनयत्सुतम् |` | "And that Chyavana, O Brahmin [priest/sage], the descendant of Bhrigu, begot a son" |
| `Line 2334: सुकन्यायां महात्मानं प्रमतिं दीप्ततेजसम् ॥१॥` | "with Sukanya, a noble soul named Pramati, of brilliant splendor. ||1||" |
| `Line 2335: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2336: प्रमतिस्तु रुरुं नाम घृताच्यां समजीजनत् |` | "And Pramati begot a son named Ruru with Ghritachi [celestial nymph]," |
| `Line 2337: रुरुः प्रमद्वरायां तु शुनकं समजीजनत् ॥२॥` | "And Ruru begot Shunaka with Pramadvara. ||2||" |
| `Line 2338: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2339: तस्य ब्रह्मन्रुरोः सर्वं चरितं भूरितेजसः |` | "O Brahmin, I shall now narrate in detail the entire story of that Ruru of great splendor," |
| `Line 2340: विस्तरेण प्रवक्ष्यामि तच्छृणु त्वमशेषतः ॥३॥` | "Listen to it completely without omission. ||3||" |
| `Line 2341: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2342: ऋषिरासीन्महान्पूर्वं तपोविद्यासमन्वितः |` | "There was once a great sage endowed with austerity and knowledge," |
| `Line 2343: स्थूलकेश इति ख्यातः सर्वभूतहिते रतः ॥४॥` | "Known as Sthulakesha [thick-haired sage], devoted to the welfare of all beings. ||4||" |
| `Line 2344: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2345: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु मेनकायां प्रजज्ञिवान् |` | "At this very time, Menaka [celestial nymph] gave birth to a child," |
| `Line 2346: गन्धर्वराजो विप्रर्षे विश्वावसुरिति श्रुतः ॥५॥` | "Fathered by the king of Gandharvas [celestial musicians], O sage, known as Vishvavasu. ||5||" |
| `Line 2347: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2348: अथाप्सरा मेनका सा तं गर्भं भृगुनन्दन |` | "Then that Apsara [celestial nymph] Menaka, O descendant of Bhrigu," |
| `Line 2349: उत्ससर्ज यथाकालं स्थूलकेशाश्रमं प्रति ॥६॥` | "Abandoned that child in due time near the hermitage of Sthulakesha. ||6||" |
| `Line 2350: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2326: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2327: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 2329: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2330: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2331: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |

| `Line 2342: ऋषिरासीन्महान्पूर्वं तपोविद्यासमन्वितः |` | "There was once a great sage endowed with austerity and knowledge," |

| `Line 2350: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2351: उत्सृज्य चैव तं गर्भं नद्यास्तीरे जगाम ह |` | "And having abandoned that child on the riverbank, she went away," |
| `Line 2352: कन्याममरगर्भाभां ज्वलन्तीमिव च श्रिया ||७||` | "A girl radiant like the child of immortals, shining as if with divine splendor. ||7||" |
| `Line 2353:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2354: तां ददर्श समुत्सृष्टां नदीतीरे महानृषिः |` | "The great sage saw her abandoned on the riverbank," |
| `Line 2355: स्थूलकेशः स तेजस्वी विजने बन्धुवर्जिताम् ||८||` | "Sthulakesha [thick-haired sage], that radiant one, saw her in a desolate place, bereft of relatives. ||8||" |
| `Line 2356:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2357: स तां दृष्ट्वा तदा कन्यां स्थूलकेशो द्विजोत्तमः |` | "Upon seeing that girl, Sthulakesha, the foremost among twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 2358: जग्राहाथ मुनिश्रेष्ठः कृपाविष्टः पुपोष च ||९||` | "The excellent sage, filled with compassion, took her and nurtured her. ||9||" |
| `Line 2359:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2360: ववृधे सा वरारोहा तस्याश्रमपदे शुभा ||९||` | "That beautiful maiden with lovely hips grew up in his auspicious hermitage. ||9||" |
| `Line 2361:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2362: प्रमदाभ्यो वरा सा तु सर्वरूपगुणान्विता |` | "She was the most excellent among women, endowed with all beauty and virtues," |
| `Line 2363: ततः प्रमद्वरेत्यस्या नाम चक्रे महानृषिः ||१०||` | "Therefore, the great sage named her Pramadvara [supremely intoxicating]. ||10||" |
| `Line 2364:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2365: तामाश्रमपदे तस्य रुरुर्दृष्ट्वा प्रमद्वराम् |` | "Seeing that Pramadvara in his hermitage, Ruru [sage's name]," |
| `Line 2366: बभूव किल धर्मात्मा मदनानुगतात्मवान् ||११||` | "That righteous soul indeed became possessed by love. ||11||" |
| `Line 2367:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2368: पितरं सखिभिः सोऽथ वाचयामास भार्गवः |` | "Then that descendant of Bhrigu [Bhargava] had his father approached through friends," |
| `Line 2369: प्रमतिश्चाभ्ययाच्छ्रुत्वा स्थूलकेशं यशस्विनम् ||१२||` | "And Pramati, having heard, requested the illustrious Sthulakesha. ||12||" |
| `Line 2370:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2371: ततः प्रादात्पिता कन्यां रुरवे तां प्रमद्वराम् |` | "Then the father gave that maiden Pramadvara to Ruru," |
| `Line 2372: विवाहं स्थापयित्वाग्रे नक्षत्रे भगदैवते ||१३||` | "Having fixed the wedding at the auspicious time under the Uttara Phalguni [Bhaga's constellation]. ||13||" |
| `Line 2373:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2374: ततः कतिपयाहस्य विवाहे समुपस्थिते |` | "Then, when a few days remained before the wedding," |
| `Line 2375: सखीभिः क्रीडती सार्धं सा कन्या वरवर्णिनी ||१४||` | "That fair-complexioned maiden, while playing with her friends, ||14||" |
translations: | `Line 2351: उत्सृज्य चैव तं गर्भं नद्यास्तीरे जगाम ह |` | "And having abandoned that child on the riverbank, she went away," |
| `Line 2352: कन्याममरगर्भाभां ज्वलन्तीमिव च श्रिया ||७||` | "A girl radiant like the child of immortals, shining as if with divine splendor. ||7||" |
| `Line 2353:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2354: तां ददर्श समुत्सृष्टां नदीतीरे महानृषिः |` | "The great sage saw her abandoned on the riverbank," |
| `Line 2355: स्थूलकेशः स तेजस्वी विजने बन्धुवर्जिताम् ||८||` | "Sthulakesha [thick-haired sage], that radiant one, saw her in a desolate place, bereft of relatives. ||8||" |
| `Line 2356:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2357: स तां दृष्ट्वा तदा कन्यां स्थूलकेशो द्विजोत्तमः |` | "Upon seeing that girl, Sthulakesha, the foremost among twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 2358: जग्राहाथ मुनिश्रेष्ठः कृपाविष्टः पुपोष च ||९||` | "The excellent sage, filled with compassion, took her and nurtured her. ||9||" |
| `Line 2359:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2360: ववृधे सा वरारोहा तस्याश्रमपदे शुभा ||९||` | "That beautiful maiden with lovely hips grew up in his auspicious hermitage. ||9||" |
| `Line 2361:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2362: प्रमदाभ्यो वरा सा तु सर्वरूपगुणान्विता |` | "She was the most excellent among women, endowed with all beauty and virtues," |
| `Line 2363: ततः प्रमद्वरेत्यस्या नाम चक्रे महानृषिः ||१०||` | "Therefore, the great sage named her Pramadvara [supremely intoxicating]. ||10||" |
| `Line 2364:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2365: तामाश्रमपदे तस्य रुरुर्दृष्ट्वा प्रमद्वराम् |` | "Seeing that Pramadvara in his hermitage, Ruru [sage's name]," |
| `Line 2366: बभूव किल धर्मात्मा मदनानुगतात्मवान् ||११||` | "That righteous soul indeed became possessed by love. ||11||" |
| `Line 2367:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2368: पितरं सखिभिः सोऽथ वाचयामास भार्गवः |` | "Then that descendant of Bhrigu [Bhargava] had his father approached through friends," |
| `Line 2369: प्रमतिश्चाभ्ययाच्छ्रुत्वा स्थूलकेशं यशस्विनम् ||१२||` | "And Pramati, having heard, requested the illustrious Sthulakesha. ||12||" |
| `Line 2370:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2371: ततः प्रादात्पिता कन्यां रुरवे तां प्रमद्वराम् |` | "Then the father gave that maiden Pramadvara to Ruru," |
| `Line 2372: विवाहं स्थापयित्वाग्रे नक्षत्रे भगदैवते ||१३||` | "Having fixed the wedding at the auspicious time under the Uttara Phalguni [Bhaga's constellation]. ||13||" |
| `Line 2373:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2374: ततः कतिपयाहस्य विवाहे समुपस्थिते |` | "Then, when a few days remained before the wedding," |
| `Line 2375: सखीभिः क्रीडती सार्धं सा कन्या वरवर्णिनी ||१४||` | "That fair-complexioned maiden, while playing with her friends, ||14||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2376: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2377: नापश्यत प्रसुप्तं वै भुजगं तिर्यगायतम् |` | "She did not see the sleeping serpent [bhujaga] lying across (her path)," |
| `Line 2378: पदा चैनं समाक्रामन्मुमूर्षुः कालचोदिता ||१५||` | "And stepped on it with her foot, destined to die, impelled by fate [kala]. ||15||" |
| `Line 2379: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2380: स तस्याः सम्प्रमत्तायाश्चोदितः कालधर्मणा |` | "That serpent, provoked by her carelessness and driven by the law of death [kala-dharma]," |
| `Line 2381: विषोपलिप्तान्दशनान्भृशमङ्गे न्यपातयत् ||१६||` | "Plunged its venom-coated fangs deeply into her body. ||16||" |
| `Line 2382: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2383: सा दष्टा सहसा भूमौ पतिता गतचेतना |` | "Suddenly bitten, she fell to the ground unconscious," |
| `Line 2384: व्यसुरप्रेक्षणीयापि प्रेक्षणीयतमाकृतिः ||१७||` | "Though lifeless, her form remained most beautiful to behold. ||17||" |
| `Line 2385: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2386: प्रसुप्तेवाभवच्चापि भुवि सर्पविषार्दिता |` | "Afflicted by the serpent's poison, she lay on the ground as if asleep," |
| `Line 2387: भूयो मनोहरतरा बभूव तनुमध्यमा ||१८||` | "The slender-waisted one [tanu-madhyama] became even more enchanting in death. ||18||" |
| `Line 2388: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2389: ददर्श तां पिता चैव ते चैवान्ये तपस्विनः |` | "Her father and those other ascetics [tapasvinah] saw her," |
| `Line 2390: विचेष्टमानां पतितां भूतले पद्मवर्चसम् ||१९||` | "Fallen on the ground, writhing, with a lotus-like radiance [padma-varchasam]. ||19||" |
| `Line 2391: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2392: ततः सर्वे द्विजवराः समाजग्मुः कृपान्विताः |` | "Then all those excellent twice-born [dvija-varah] gathered, filled with compassion," |
| `Line 2393: स्वस्त्यात्रेयो महाजानुः कुशिकः शङ्खमेखलः ||२०||` | "Svastyatreya, Mahajanu, Kushika, Shankhamekala, ||20||" |
| `Line 2394: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2395: भारद्वाजः कौणकुत्स आर्ष्टिषेणोऽथ गौतमः |` | "Bharadvaja, Kaunakutsa, Arshtishena, and Gautama," |
| `Line 2396: प्रमतिः सह पुत्रेण तथान्ये वनवासिनः ||२१||` | "Pramati with his son, and other forest-dwellers [vana-vasinah]. ||21||" |
| `Line 2397: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2398: तां ते कन्यां व्यसुं दृष्ट्वा भुजगस्य विषार्दिताम् |` | "Seeing that maiden lifeless, afflicted by the serpent's poison," |
| `Line 2399: रुरुदुः कृपयाविष्टा रुरुस्त्वार्तो बहिर्ययौ ||२२||` | "They wept, overcome with compassion, while Ruru, grief-stricken, went outside. ||22||" |
| `Line 2400: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 2399: रुरुदुः कृपयाविष्टा रुरुस्त्वार्तो बहिर्ययौ ||२२||` | "They wept, overcome with compassion, while Ruru, grief-stricken, went outside. ||22||" |

| `Line 2401: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2402: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2403: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2404: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2405: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2406: ९` | "9" [Chapter or section number] |
| `Line 2407: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2408: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2409: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2410: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2411: तेषु तत्रोपविष्टेषु ब्राह्मणेषु समन्ततः |` | "When all those brahmanas [priests] were seated there all around," |
| `Line 2412: रुरुश्चुक्रोश गहनं वनं गत्वा सुदुःखितः ||१||` | "Ruru [sage's name], extremely distressed, went to the dense forest and cried out. ||1||" |
| `Line 2413: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2414: शोकेनाभिहतः सोऽथ विलपन्करुणं बहु |` | "Struck by grief, he then lamented piteously many times," |
| `Line 2415: अब्रवीद्वचनं शोचन्प्रियां चिन्त्य प्रमद्वराम् ||२||` | "And spoke these words in sorrow, thinking of his beloved Pramadvara [his wife]. ||2||" |
| `Line 2416: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2417: शेते सा भुवि तन्वङ्गी मम शोकविवर्धिनी |` | "She lies on the ground, that slender-limbed one, increasing my sorrow," |
| `Line 2418: बान्धवानां च सर्वेषां किं नु दुःखमतः परम् ||३||` | "For all relatives, what sorrow could be greater than this? ||3||" |
| `Line 2419: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2420: यदि दत्तं तपस्तप्तं गुरवो वा मया यदि |` | "If I have given charity, performed austerities, or if I have properly served my teachers," |
| `Line 2421: सम्यगाराधितास्तेन सञ्जीवतु मम प्रिया ||४||` | "By the merit of these acts, may my beloved come back to life. ||4||" |
| `Line 2422: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2423: यथा जन्मप्रभृति वै यतात्माहं धृतव्रतः |` | "As from birth I have been self-controlled and steadfast in my vows," |
| `Line 2424: प्रमद्वरा तथाद्यैव समुत्तिष्ठतु भामिनी ||५||` | "So may Pramadvara, that radiant lady, rise up this very day. ||5||" |
| `Line 2425: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2426: देवदूत उवाच॥` | "The divine messenger [Devaduta] said:" |
| `Line 2427: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2428: अभिधत्से ह यद्वाचा रुरो दुःखेन तन्मृषा |` | "O Ruru, what you speak with sorrow is in vain," |
| `Line 2429: न तु मर्त्यस्य धर्मात्मन्नायुरस्ति गतायुषः ॥६॥` | "O righteous one [Dharmatman], a mortal whose life-span has ended cannot regain life. ||6||" |
| `Line 2430: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2431: गतायुरेषा कृपणा गन्धर्वाप्सरसोः सुता |` | "This poor girl, daughter of a Gandharva and an Apsara, has exhausted her life-span," |
| `Line 2432: तस्माच्छोके मनस्तात मा कृथास्त्वं कथञ्चन ॥७॥` | "Therefore, dear one [Tata], do not grieve in your mind in any way. ||7||" |
| `Line 2433: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2434: उपायश्चात्र विहितः पूर्वं देवैर्महात्मभिः |` | "However, a remedy has been ordained by the great-souled gods [Mahatma]," |
| `Line 2435: तं यदीच्छसि कर्तुं त्वं प्राप्स्यसीमां प्रमद्वराम् ॥८॥` | "If you wish to perform it, you shall regain this Pramadvara. ||8||" |
| `Line 2436: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2437: रुरुरुवाच॥` | "Ruru said:" |
| `Line 2438: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2439: क उपायः कृतो देवैर्ब्रूहि तत्त्वेन खेचर |` | "What remedy has been ordained by the gods? Tell me truthfully, O sky-traveler [Khechara]," |
| `Line 2440: करिष्ये तं तथा श्रुत्वा त्रातुमर्हति मां भवान् ॥९॥` | "Having heard it, I shall perform it accordingly. You ought to save me. ||9||" |
| `Line 2441: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2442: देवदूत उवाच॥` | "The divine messenger said:" |
| `Line 2443: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2444: आयुषोऽर्धं प्रयच्छस्व कन्यायै भृगुनन्दन |` | "Give half of your life-span to the maiden, O descendant of Bhrigu [Bhrigunandana]," |
| `Line 2445: एवमुत्थास्यति रुरो तव भार्या प्रमद्वरा ॥१०॥` | "Thus, O Ruru, your wife Pramadvara will rise again. ||10||" |
| `Line 2446: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2447: रुरुरुवाच॥` | "Ruru said:" |
| `Line 2448: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2449: आयुषोऽर्धं प्रयच्छामि कन्यायै खेचरोत्तम |` | "I give half of my life-span to the maiden, O best of sky-travelers [Khecharottama]," |
| `Line 2450: शृङ्गाररूपाभरणा उत्तिष्ठतु मम प्रिया ॥११॥` | "Let my beloved rise again, adorned with beautiful ornaments. ||11||" |
translations: | `Line 2426: देवदूत उवाच॥` | "The divine messenger [Devaduta] said:" |
| `Line 2427: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2428: अभिधत्से ह यद्वाचा रुरो दुःखेन तन्मृषा |` | "O Ruru, what you speak with sorrow is in vain," |
| `Line 2429: न तु मर्त्यस्य धर्मात्मन्नायुरस्ति गतायुषः ॥६॥` | "O righteous one [Dharmatman], a mortal whose life-span has ended cannot regain life. ||6||" |
| `Line 2430: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2431: गतायुरेषा कृपणा गन्धर्वाप्सरसोः सुता |` | "This poor girl, daughter of a Gandharva and an Apsara, has exhausted her life-span," |
| `Line 2432: तस्माच्छोके मनस्तात मा कृथास्त्वं कथञ्चन ॥७॥` | "Therefore, dear one [Tata], do not grieve in your mind in any way. ||7||" |
| `Line 2433: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2434: उपायश्चात्र विहितः पूर्वं देवैर्महात्मभिः |` | "However, a remedy has been ordained by the great-souled gods [Mahatma]," |
| `Line 2435: तं यदीच्छसि कर्तुं त्वं प्राप्स्यसीमां प्रमद्वराम् ॥८॥` | "If you wish to perform it, you shall regain this Pramadvara. ||8||" |
| `Line 2436: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2437: रुरुरुवाच॥` | "Ruru said:" |
| `Line 2438: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2439: क उपायः कृतो देवैर्ब्रूहि तत्त्वेन खेचर |` | "What remedy has been ordained by the gods? Tell me truthfully, O sky-traveler [Khechara]," |
| `Line 2440: करिष्ये तं तथा श्रुत्वा त्रातुमर्हति मां भवान् ॥९॥` | "Having heard it, I shall perform it accordingly. You ought to save me. ||9||" |
| `Line 2441: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2442: देवदूत उवाच॥` | "The divine messenger said:" |
| `Line 2443: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2444: आयुषोऽर्धं प्रयच्छस्व कन्यायै भृगुनन्दन |` | "Give half of your life-span to the maiden, O descendant of Bhrigu [Bhrigunandana]," |
| `Line 2445: एवमुत्थास्यति रुरो तव भार्या प्रमद्वरा ॥१०॥` | "Thus, O Ruru, your wife Pramadvara will rise again. ||10||" |
| `Line 2446: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2447: रुरुरुवाच॥` | "Ruru said:" |
| `Line 2448: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2449: आयुषोऽर्धं प्रयच्छामि कन्यायै खेचरोत्तम |` | "I give half of my life-span to the maiden, O best of sky-travelers [Khecharottama]," |
| `Line 2450: शृङ्गाररूपाभरणा उत्तिष्ठतु मम प्रिया ॥११॥` | "Let my beloved rise again, adorned with beautiful ornaments. ||11||" |

| `Line 2452: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2453: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2454: ततो गन्धर्वराजश्च देवदूतश्च सत्तमौ |` | "Then the king of Gandharvas [celestial musicians] and the divine messenger [Yama's emissary], both excellent beings," |
| `Line 2455: धर्मराजमुपेत्येदं वचनं प्रत्यभाषताम् ॥१२॥` | "Approached Dharmaraja [lord of justice/Yama] and spoke these words. ||12||" |
| `Line 2456: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2457: धर्मराजायुषोऽर्धेन रुरोर्भार्या प्रमद्वरा |` | "O Dharmaraja, let Pramadvara, Ruru's wife, with half of Ruru's lifespan," |
| `Line 2458: समुत्तिष्ठतु कल्याणी मृतैव यदि मन्यसे ॥१३॥` | "Rise up again, auspicious one, though dead, if you deem it proper. ||13||" |
| `Line 2459: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2460: धर्मराज उवाच॥` | "Dharmaraja [Yama] said:" |
| `Line 2461: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2462: प्रमद्वरा रुरोर्भार्या देवदूत यदीच्छसि |` | "If you wish, O divine messenger, let Pramadvara, Ruru's wife," |
| `Line 2463: उत्तिष्ठत्वायुषोऽर्धेन रुरोरेव समन्विता ॥१४॥` | "Rise up, endowed with half of Ruru's lifespan. ||14||" |
| `Line 2464: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2465: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2466: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2467: एवमुक्ते ततः कन्या सोदतिष्ठत्प्रमद्वरा |` | "When this was said, then the maiden Pramadvara rose up," |
| `Line 2468: रुरोस्तस्यायुषोऽर्धेन सुप्तेव वरवर्णिनी ॥१५॥` | "With half of Ruru's lifespan, as if from sleep, that fair-complexioned one. ||15||" |
| `Line 2469: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2470: एतद्दृष्टं भविष्ये हि रुरोरुत्तमतेजसः |` | "This was foreseen in the future for Ruru of excellent splendor," |
| `Line 2471: आयुषोऽतिप्रवृद्धस्य भार्यार्थेऽर्धं ह्रसत्विति ॥१६॥` | "That half of his greatly extended lifespan would be diminished for his wife's sake. ||16||" |
| `Line 2472: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2473: तत इष्टेऽहनि तयोः पितरौ चक्रतुर्मुदा |` | "Then, on an auspicious day, their parents joyfully performed," |
| `Line 2474: विवाहं तौ च रेमाते परस्परहितैषिणौ ॥१७॥` | "Their wedding, and the two enjoyed themselves, seeking each other's welfare. ||17||" |
| `Line 2475: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 2476: स लब्ध्वा दुर्लभां भार्यां पद्मकिञ्जल्कसप्रभाम् |` | "Having obtained his rare wife, who had the radiance of lotus stamens," |
| `Line 2477: व्रतं चक्रे विनाशाय जिह्मगानां धृतव्रतः ||१८||` | "The resolute one made a vow to destroy all serpents [jihmaga]. ||18||" |
| `Line 2478:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2479: स दृष्ट्वा जिह्मगान्सर्वांस्तीव्रकोपसमन्वितः |` | "Seeing any serpent, filled with intense anger," |
| `Line 2480: अभिहन्ति यथासन्नं गृह्य प्रहरणं सदा ||१९||` | "He would always strike it when encountered, seizing a weapon. ||19||" |
| `Line 2481:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2482: स कदाचिद्वनं विप्रो रुरुरभ्यागमन्महत् |` | "Once that Brahmin [vipra] Ruru entered a great forest," |
| `Line 2483: शयानं तत्र चापश्यड्डुण्डुभं वयसान्वितम् ||२०||` | "And there he saw a Dundubha [non-venomous snake] lying, advanced in age. ||20||" |
| `Line 2484:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2485: तत उद्यम्य दण्डं स कालदण्डोपमं तदा |` | "Then, raising a staff resembling the rod of Death [Kaladanda]," |
| `Line 2486: अभ्यघ्नद्रुषितो विप्रस्तमुवाचाथ डुण्डुभः ||२१||` | "The enraged Brahmin struck at it, whereupon the Dundubha spoke to him: ||21||" |
| `Line 2487:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2488: नापराध्यामि ते किञ्चिदहमद्य तपोधन |` | "I have done you no wrong today, O wealth of austerities [tapodana]," |
| `Line 2489: संरम्भात्तत्किमर्थं मामभिहंसि रुषान्वितः ||२२||` | "Why then do you strike me in haste, filled with anger? ||22||" |
| `Line 2490:` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 2501: मम प्राणसमा भार्या दष्टासीद्भुजगेन ह |` | "My wife, who was dear to me as life itself, was bitten by a serpent." |
| `Line 2502: तत्र मे समयो घोर आत्मनोरग वै कृतः ||१||` | "At that time, I made a terrible vow to myself regarding serpents. ||1||" |
| `Line 2503: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2504: हन्यां सदैव भुजगं यं यं पश्येयमित्युत |` | "That I would always kill any serpent that I might see," |
| `Line 2505: ततोऽहं त्वां जिघांसामि जीवितेन विमोक्ष्यसे ||२||` | "Therefore I wish to kill you, and you shall be released from your life. ||2||" |
| `Line 2506: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2507: डुण्डुभ उवाच||` | "Dundubha [snake-sage] said:" |
| `Line 2508: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2509: अन्ये ते भुजगा विप्र ये दशन्तीह मानवान् |` | "O brahmin [twice-born], those are different serpents who bite humans here," |
| `Line 2510: डुण्डुभानहिगन्धेन न त्वं हिंसितुमर्हसि ||३||` | "You should not kill Dundubhas who merely have the scent of snakes. ||3||" |
| `Line 2511: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2512: एकानर्थान्पृथगर्थानेकदुःखान्पृथक्सुखान् |` | "We have different purposes, different goals, different sorrows, and different pleasures," |
| `Line 2513: डुण्डुभान्धर्मविद्भूत्वा न त्वं हिंसितुमर्हसि ||४||` | "Being knowledgeable in dharma [righteousness], you should not kill Dundubhas. ||4||" |
| `Line 2514: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2515: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2516: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2517: इति श्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य भुजगस्य रुरुस्तदा |` | "Having heard these words of that serpent, Ruru then," |
| `Line 2518: नावधीद्भयसंविग्न ऋषिं मत्वाथ डुण्डुभम् ||५||` | "Did not kill him, being struck with awe, thinking the Dundubha to be a sage. ||5||" |
| `Line 2519: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2520: उवाच चैनं भगवान्रुरुः संशमयन्निव |` | "And the venerable Ruru spoke to him, as if calming him," |
| `Line 2521: कामया भुजग ब्रूहि कोऽसीमां विक्रियां गतः ||६||` | "Please tell me, O serpent, who are you that has undergone this transformation? ||6||" |
| `Line 2522: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2523: डुण्डुभ उवाच||` | "Dundubha [snake-sage] said:" |
| `Line 2524: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2525: अहं पुरा रुरो नाम्ना ऋषिरासं सहस्रपात् |` | "I was formerly a sage named Ruru, the thousand-footed [powerful sage]," |

| `Line 252: तत्प्रीत्या चैव सर्वेषां पौराणां हर्षसम्भवः |` | "And from that affection arose the joy of all the citizens," |
| `Line 253: शब्द आसीन्महांस्तत्र दिवस्पृक्कीर्तिवर्धनः ||७८||` | "There was a great sound there, reaching the heavens, enhancing their fame. ||78||" |
| `Line 254: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 255: तेऽप्यधीत्याखिलान्वेदाञ्शास्त्राणि विविधानि च |` | "Having studied all the Vedas and various śāstras [sacred texts]," |
| `Line 256: न्यवसन्पाण्डवास्तत्र पूजिता अकुतोभयाः ||७९||` | "The Pāṇḍavas lived there, honored and fearless. ||79||" |
| `Line 257: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 258: युधिष्ठिरस्य शौचेन प्रीताः प्रकृतयोऽभवन् |` | "The subjects were pleased with Yudhiṣṭhira's purity," |
| `Line 259: धृत्या च भीमसेनस्य विक्रमेणार्जुनस्य च ||८०||` | "With Bhīmasena's steadfastness and Arjuna's valor. ||80||" |
| `Line 260: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 261: गुरुशुश्रूषया कुन्त्या यमयोर्विनयेन च |` | "With Kuntī's service to elders and the twins' [Nakula-Sahadeva] humility," |
| `Line 262: तुतोष लोकः सकलस्तेषां शौर्यगुणेन च ||८१||` | "The entire world was satisfied with their heroic qualities. ||81||" |
| `Line 263: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 264: समवाये ततो राज्ञां कन्यां भर्तृस्वयंवराम् |` | "Then, in an assembly of kings, at a bride's self-choice ceremony [svayaṃvara]," |
| `Line 265: प्राप्तवानर्जुनः कृष्णां कृत्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् ||८२||` | "Arjuna won Kṛṣṇā [Draupadī], having performed an extremely difficult feat. ||82||" |
| `Line 266: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 267: ततः प्रभृति लोकेऽस्मिन्पूज्यः सर्वधनुष्मताम् |` | "From then on, in this world, he was revered among all archers," |
| `Line 268: आदित्य इव दुष्प्रेक्ष्यः समरेष्वपि चाभवत् ||८३||` | "And became difficult to look at in battles, like the sun [Āditya]. ||83||" |
| `Line 269: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 270: स सर्वान्पार्थिवाञ्जित्वा सर्वांश्च महतो गणान् |` | "Having conquered all the kings and all the great hosts," |
| `Line 271: आजहारार्जुनो राज्ञे राजसूयं महाक्रतुम् ||८४||` | "Arjuna brought for the king the Rājasūya, the great sacrifice [royal consecration]. ||84||" |
| `Line 272: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 273: अन्नवान्दक्षिणावांश्च सर्वैः समुदितो गुणैः |` | "Abundant with food and gifts, endowed with all excellent qualities," |
| `Line 274: युधिष्ठिरेण सम्प्राप्तो राजसूयो महाक्रतुः ||८५||` | "The great Rājasūya sacrifice was performed by Yudhiṣṭhira. ||85||" |
| `Line 275: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 251: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 252: तत्प्रीत्या चैव सर्वेषां पौराणां हर्षसम्भवः |` | "And from that affection arose the joy of all the citizens," |
| `Line 253: शब्द आसीन्महांस्तत्र दिवस्पृक्कीर्तिवर्धनः ||७८||` | "There was a great sound there, reaching the heavens, enhancing their fame. ||78||" |
| `Line 254: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 255: तेऽप्यधीत्याखिलान्वेदाञ्शास्त्राणि विविधानि च |` | "Having studied all the Vedas and various śāstras [sacred texts]," |
| `Line 256: न्यवसन्पाण्डवास्तत्र पूजिता अकुतोभयाः ||७९||` | "The Pāṇḍavas lived there, honored and fearless. ||79||" |
| `Line 257: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 258: युधिष्ठिरस्य शौचेन प्रीताः प्रकृतयोऽभवन् |` | "The subjects were pleased with Yudhiṣṭhira's purity," |
| `Line 259: धृत्या च भीमसेनस्य विक्रमेणार्जुनस्य च ||८०||` | "With Bhīmasena's steadfastness and Arjuna's valor. ||80||" |
| `Line 260: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 261: गुरुशुश्रूषया कुन्त्या यमयोर्विनयेन च |` | "With Kuntī's service to elders and the twins' [Nakula-Sahadeva] humility," |
| `Line 262: तुतोष लोकः सकलस्तेषां शौर्यगुणेन च ||८१||` | "The entire world was satisfied with their heroic qualities. ||81||" |
| `Line 263: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 264: समवाये ततो राज्ञां कन्यां भर्तृस्वयंवराम् |` | "Then, in an assembly of kings, at a bride's self-choice ceremony [svayaṃvara]," |
| `Line 265: प्राप्तवानर्जुनः कृष्णां कृत्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् ||८२||` | "Arjuna won Kṛṣṇā [Draupadī], having performed an extremely difficult feat. ||82||" |
| `Line 266: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 267: ततः प्रभृति लोकेऽस्मिन्पूज्यः सर्वधनुष्मताम् |` | "From then on, in this world, he was revered among all archers," |
| `Line 268: आदित्य इव दुष्प्रेक्ष्यः समरेष्वपि चाभवत् ||८३||` | "And became difficult to look at in battles, like the sun [Āditya]. ||83||" |
| `Line 269: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 270: स सर्वान्पार्थिवाञ्जित्वा सर्वांश्च महतो गणान् |` | "Having conquered all the kings and all the great hosts," |
| `Line 271: आजहारार्जुनो राज्ञे राजसूयं महाक्रतुम् ||८४||` | "Arjuna brought for the king the Rājasūya, the great sacrifice [royal consecration]. ||84||" |
| `Line 272: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 273: अन्नवान्दक्षिणावांश्च सर्वैः समुदितो गुणैः |` | "Abundant with food and gifts, endowed with all excellent qualities," |
| `Line 274: युधिष्ठिरेण सम्प्राप्तो राजसूयो महाक्रतुः ||८५||` | "The great Rājasūya sacrifice was performed by Yudhiṣṭhira. ||85||" |
| `Line 275: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2526: सोऽहं शापेन विप्रस्य भुजगत्वमुपागतः ||७||` | "Thus I, by the curse of a brahmin [twice-born sage], have attained the state of a serpent. ||7||" |
| `Line 2527: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2528: रुरुरुवाच||` | "Ruru said:" |
| `Line 2529: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2530: किमर्थं शप्तवान्क्रुद्धो द्विजस्त्वां भुजगोत्तम |` | "For what reason did the angry twice-born [brahmin] curse you, O best of serpents?" |
| `Line 2531: कियन्तं चैव कालं ते वपुरेतद्भविष्यति ||८||` | "And for how long will you have this body? ||8||" |
| `Line 2532: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2533: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2534: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2535: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2536: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2537: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2538: ११` | "11" [Chapter or section number] |
| `Line 2539: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2540: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2541: डुण्डुभ उवाच||` | "Dundubha [serpent's name] said:" |
| `Line 2542: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2543: सखा बभूव मे पूर्वं खगमो नाम वै द्विजः |` | "I formerly had a friend, a twice-born [brahmin] named Khagama," |
| `Line 2544: भृशं संशितवाक्तात तपोबलसमन्वितः ||१||` | "Who was extremely precise in speech and endowed with the power of austerities. ||1||" |
| `Line 2545: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2546: स मया क्रीडता बाल्ये कृत्वा तार्णमथोरगम् |` | "While playing in my childhood, I made a snake of grass," |
| `Line 2547: अग्निहोत्रे प्रसक्तः सन्भीषितः प्रमुमोह वै ||२||` | "And frightened him while he was engaged in the Agnihotra [fire ritual], causing him to faint. ||2||" |
| `Line 2548: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2549: लब्ध्वा च स पुनः सञ्ज्ञां मामुवाच तपोधनः |` | "And when he regained consciousness, that ascetic [wealth of austerities] said to me," |
| `Line 2550: निर्दहन्निव कोपेन सत्यवाक्संशितव्रतः ||३||` | "As if burning with anger, that truthful speaker of firm vows: ||3||" |
translations: | `Line 2526: सोऽहं शापेन विप्रस्य भुजगत्वमुपागतः ||७||` | "Thus I, by the curse of a brahmin [twice-born sage], have attained the state of a serpent. ||7||" |
| `Line 2527: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2528: रुरुरुवाच||` | "Ruru said:" |
| `Line 2529: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2530: किमर्थं शप्तवान्क्रुद्धो द्विजस्त्वां भुजगोत्तम |` | "For what reason did the angry twice-born [brahmin] curse you, O best of serpents?" |
| `Line 2531: कियन्तं चैव कालं ते वपुरेतद्भविष्यति ||८||` | "And for how long will you have this body? ||8||" |
| `Line 2532: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2533: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2534: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2535: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2536: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2537: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2538: ११` | "11" [Chapter or section number] |
| `Line 2539: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2540: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2541: डुण्डुभ उवाच||` | "Dundubha [serpent's name] said:" |
| `Line 2542: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2543: सखा बभूव मे पूर्वं खगमो नाम वै द्विजः |` | "I formerly had a friend, a twice-born [brahmin] named Khagama," |
| `Line 2544: भृशं संशितवाक्तात तपोबलसमन्वितः ||१||` | "Who was extremely precise in speech and endowed with the power of austerities. ||1||" |
| `Line 2545: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2546: स मया क्रीडता बाल्ये कृत्वा तार्णमथोरगम् |` | "While playing in my childhood, I made a snake of grass," |
| `Line 2547: अग्निहोत्रे प्रसक्तः सन्भीषितः प्रमुमोह वै ||२||` | "And frightened him while he was engaged in the Agnihotra [fire ritual], causing him to faint. ||2||" |
| `Line 2548: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2549: लब्ध्वा च स पुनः सञ्ज्ञां मामुवाच तपोधनः |` | "And when he regained consciousness, that ascetic [wealth of austerities] said to me," |
| `Line 2550: निर्दहन्निव कोपेन सत्यवाक्संशितव्रतः ||३||` | "As if burning with anger, that truthful speaker of firm vows: ||3||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2551: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2552: यथावीर्यस्त्वया सर्पः कृतोऽयं मद्बिभीषया |` | "As you have created this snake with power to frighten me," |
| `Line 2553: तथावीर्यो भुजङ्गस्त्वं मम कोपाद्भविष्यसि ||४||` | "So shall you become a serpent [bhujanga] with similar power due to my anger. ||4||" |
| `Line 2554: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2555: तस्याहं तपसो वीर्यं जानमानस्तपोधन |` | "Knowing the power of his austerities, O ascetic [tapodhan]," |
| `Line 2556: भृशमुद्विग्नहृदयस्तमवोचं वनौकसम् ||५||` | "With an extremely anxious heart, I addressed that forest-dweller [vanaukasa]. ||5||" |
| `Line 2557: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2558: प्रयतः सम्भ्रमाच्चैव प्राञ्जलिः प्रणतः स्थितः |` | "Standing with folded hands [pranjali], bowing down in agitation," |
| `Line 2559: सखेति हसतेदं ते नर्मार्थं वै कृतं मया ||६||` | "'Friend,' I said, 'this was done by me merely in jest [narmartha], laughing.' ||6||" |
| `Line 2560: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2561: क्षन्तुमर्हसि मे ब्रह्मञ्शापोऽयं विनिवर्त्यताम् |` | "'You ought to forgive me, O Brahmin [brahman], may this curse be withdrawn,'" |
| `Line 2562: सोऽथ मामब्रवीद्दृष्ट्वा भृशमुद्विग्नचेतसम् ||७||` | "Then he, seeing me extremely distressed in mind, said to me: ||7||" |
| `Line 2563: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2564: मुहुरुष्णं विनिःश्वस्य सुसम्भ्रान्तस्तपोधनः |` | "Sighing deeply and repeatedly, the greatly agitated ascetic [tapodhanah]," |
| `Line 2565: नानृतं वै मया प्रोक्तं भवितेदं कथञ्चन ||८||` | "'What I have spoken cannot become untrue in any way. ||8||'" |
| `Line 2566: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2567: यत्तु वक्ष्यामि ते वाक्यं शृणु तन्मे धृतव्रत |` | "'But listen to these words that I will speak to you, O steadfast in vows [dhritavrata]," |
| `Line 2568: श्रुत्वा च हृदि ते वाक्यमिदमस्तु तपोधन ||९||` | "'Having heard them, may these words remain in your heart, O ascetic [tapodhan]. ||9||'" |
| `Line 2569: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2570: उत्पत्स्यति रुरुर्नाम प्रमतेरात्मजः शुचिः |` | "'There will be born one named Ruru, the pure son of Pramati [Pramati's son]," |
| `Line 2571: तं दृष्ट्वा शापमोक्षस्ते भविता नचिरादिव ||१०||` | "'Upon seeing him, your release from the curse will happen without delay. ||10||'" |
| `Line 2572: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2573: स त्वं रुरुरिति ख्यातः प्रमतेरात्मजः शुचिः |` | "'You are that Ruru, renowned as the pure son of Pramati," |
| `Line 2574: स्वरूपं प्रतिलभ्याहमद्य वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् ||११||` | "'Having regained my true form, I shall now tell you what is beneficial for you. ||11||'" |
| `Line 2575: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2551: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 2553: तथावीर्यो भुजङ्गस्त्वं मम कोपाद्भविष्यसि ||४||` | "So shall you become a serpent [bhujanga] with similar power due to my anger. ||4||" |

| `Line 2571: तं दृष्ट्वा शापमोक्षस्ते भविता नचिरादिव ||१०||` | "'Upon seeing him, your release from the curse will happen without delay. ||10||'" |

| `Line 2573: स त्वं रुरुरिति ख्यातः प्रमतेरात्मजः शुचिः |` | "'You are that Ruru, renowned as the pure son of Pramati," |
| `Line 2574: स्वरूपं प्रतिलभ्याहमद्य वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् ||११||` | "'Having regained my true form, I shall now tell you what is beneficial for you. ||11||'" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2576: अहिंसा परमो धर्मः सर्वप्राणभृतां स्मृतः |` | "Non-violence is the highest dharma [righteous duty], remembered for all living beings." |
| `Line 2577: तस्मात्प्राणभृतः सर्वान्न हिंस्याद्ब्राह्मणः क्वचित् ॥१२॥` | "Therefore, a Brahmin [priestly class] should never harm any living beings anywhere. ||12||" |
| `Line 2578: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2579: ब्राह्मणः सौम्य एवेह जायतेति परा श्रुतिः |` | "A Brahmin is born gentle in this world - thus declares the supreme scripture [Vedas]," |
| `Line 2580: वेदवेदाङ्गवित्तात सर्वभूताभयप्रदः ॥१३॥` | "O dear one, knower of Vedas and Vedangas [auxiliary texts], bestower of fearlessness to all beings. ||13||" |
| `Line 2581: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2582: अहिंसा सत्यवचनं क्षमा चेति विनिश्चितम् |` | "Non-violence, truthful speech, and forgiveness - these are established" |
| `Line 2583: ब्राह्मणस्य परो धर्मो वेदानां धरणादपि ॥१४॥` | "As the highest dharma of a Brahmin, even more than upholding the Vedas. ||14||" |
| `Line 2584: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2585: क्षत्रियस्य तु यो धर्मः स नेहेष्यति वै तव |` | "But the dharma of a Kshatriya [warrior class] is not suitable for you," |
| `Line 2586: दण्डधारणमुग्रत्वं प्रजानां परिपालनम् ॥१५॥` | "Wielding punishment, fierceness, and protection of subjects. ||15||" |
| `Line 2587: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2588: तदिदं क्षत्रियस्यासीत्कर्म वै शृणु मे रुरो |` | "Listen to me, Ruru, about this duty that belonged to a Kshatriya," |
| `Line 2589: जनमेजयस्य धर्मात्मन्सर्पाणां हिंसनं पुरा ॥१६॥` | "O righteous one, about Janamejaya's destruction of serpents in ancient times. ||16||" |
| `Line 2590: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2591: परित्राणं च भीतानां सर्पाणां ब्राह्मणादपि |` | "And the rescue of the frightened serpents by a Brahmin," |
| `Line 2592: तपोवीर्यबलोपेताद्वेदवेदाङ्गपारगात् ॥१७॥` | "Endowed with the power of austerity and strength, who had mastered the Vedas and Vedangas. ||17||" |
| `Line 2593: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2594: आस्तीकाद्द्विजमुख्याद्वै सर्पसत्रे द्विजोत्तम ॥१७॥` | "From Astika [sage's name], the foremost of the twice-born, at the serpent sacrifice, O best of Brahmins. ||17||" |
| `Line 2595: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2596: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2597: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2598: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2599: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2600: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 2576: अहिंसा परमो धर्मः सर्वप्राणभृतां स्मृतः |` | "Non-violence is the highest dharma [righteous duty], remembered for all living beings." |
| `Line 2577: तस्मात्प्राणभृतः सर्वान्न हिंस्याद्ब्राह्मणः क्वचित् ॥१२॥` | "Therefore, a Brahmin [priestly class] should never harm any living beings anywhere. ||12||" |
| `Line 2578: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2579: ब्राह्मणः सौम्य एवेह जायतेति परा श्रुतिः |` | "A Brahmin is born gentle in this world - thus declares the supreme scripture [Vedas]," |
| `Line 2580: वेदवेदाङ्गवित्तात सर्वभूताभयप्रदः ॥१३॥` | "O dear one, knower of Vedas and Vedangas [auxiliary texts], bestower of fearlessness to all beings. ||13||" |
| `Line 2581: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2582: अहिंसा सत्यवचनं क्षमा चेति विनिश्चितम् |` | "Non-violence, truthful speech, and forgiveness - these are established" |
| `Line 2583: ब्राह्मणस्य परो धर्मो वेदानां धरणादपि ॥१४॥` | "As the highest dharma of a Brahmin, even more than upholding the Vedas. ||14||" |
| `Line 2584: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2585: क्षत्रियस्य तु यो धर्मः स नेहेष्यति वै तव |` | "But the dharma of a Kshatriya [warrior class] is not suitable for you," |
| `Line 2586: दण्डधारणमुग्रत्वं प्रजानां परिपालनम् ॥१५॥` | "Wielding punishment, fierceness, and protection of subjects. ||15||" |
| `Line 2587: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2588: तदिदं क्षत्रियस्यासीत्कर्म वै शृणु मे रुरो |` | "Listen to me, Ruru, about this duty that belonged to a Kshatriya," |
| `Line 2589: जनमेजयस्य धर्मात्मन्सर्पाणां हिंसनं पुरा ॥१६॥` | "O righteous one, about Janamejaya's destruction of serpents in ancient times. ||16||" |
| `Line 2590: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2591: परित्राणं च भीतानां सर्पाणां ब्राह्मणादपि |` | "And the rescue of the frightened serpents by a Brahmin," |
| `Line 2592: तपोवीर्यबलोपेताद्वेदवेदाङ्गपारगात् ॥१७॥` | "Endowed with the power of austerity and strength, who had mastered the Vedas and Vedangas. ||17||" |

| `Line 2601: १२` | "12" |
| `Line 2602:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2603:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2604: रुरुरुवाच॥` | "Ruru said:" |
| `Line 2605:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2606: कथं हिंसितवान्सर्पान्क्षत्रियो जनमेजयः |` | "How did the Kshatriya [warrior-king] Janamejaya destroy the serpents?" |
| `Line 2607: सर्पा वा हिंसितास्तात किमर्थं द्विजसत्तम ॥१॥` | "And why, O father [term of respect], O best of twice-born [Brahmin], were the serpents destroyed? ||1||" |
| `Line 2608:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2609: किमर्थं मोक्षिताश्चैव पन्नगास्तेन शंस मे |` | "And why were the serpents [pannaga] released by him? Tell me," |
| `Line 2610: आस्तीकेन तदाचक्ष्व श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यशेषतः ॥२॥` | "Narrate to me about Astika; I wish to hear it completely. ||2||" |
| `Line 2611:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2612: ऋषिरुवाच॥` | "The sage said:" |
| `Line 2613:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2614: श्रोष्यसि त्वं रुरो सर्वमास्तीकचरितं महत् |` | "You shall hear, O Ruru, the entire great story of Astika," |
| `Line 2615: ब्राह्मणानां कथयतामित्युक्त्वान्तरधीयत ॥३॥` | "As told by the Brahmins." Having said this, he disappeared. ||3||" |
| `Line 2616:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2617: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2618:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2619: रुरुश्चापि वनं सर्वं पर्यधावत्समन्ततः |` | "And Ruru ran throughout the entire forest in all directions," |
| `Line 2620: तमृषिं द्रष्टुमन्विच्छन्संश्रान्तो न्यपतद्भुवि ॥४॥` | "Seeking to see that sage, and exhausted, he fell to the ground. ||4||" |
| `Line 2621:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2622: लब्धसञ्ज्ञो रुरुश्चायात्तच्चाचख्यौ पितुस्तदा |` | "Having regained consciousness, Ruru went and told everything to his father then," |
| `Line 2623: पिता चास्य तदाख्यानं पृष्टः सर्वं न्यवेदयत् ॥५॥` | "And his father, when asked, narrated the entire story. ||5||" |
| `Line 2624:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2625:` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 2630: आस्तीकपर्व` | "Āstīka Parva [Astika chapter]" |
| `Line 2631: १३` | "13" |
| `Line 2632: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2633: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2634: शौनक उवाच||` | "Shaunaka [sage-listener] said:" |
| `Line 2635: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2636: किमर्थं राजशार्दूलः स राजा जनमेजयः |` | "For what purpose did that tiger among kings [mighty ruler], King Janamejaya," |
| `Line 2637: सर्पसत्रेण सर्पाणां गतोऽन्तं तद्वदस्व मे ||१||` | "Seek to destroy the serpents through the snake sacrifice? Tell me about that. ||1||" |
| `Line 2638: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2639: आस्तीकश्च द्विजश्रेष्ठः किमर्थं जपतां वरः |` | "And for what reason did Āstīka, the foremost of twice-born [brahmin], the best among chanters," |
| `Line 2640: मोक्षयामास भुजगान्दीप्तात्तस्माद्धुताशनात् ||२||` | "Free the serpents from that blazing fire [sacrificial flame]? ||2||" |
| `Line 2641: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2642: कस्य पुत्रः स राजासीत्सर्पसत्रं य आहरत् |` | "Whose son was that king who performed the snake sacrifice," |
| `Line 2643: स च द्विजातिप्रवरः कस्य पुत्रो वदस्व मे ||३||` | "And that foremost of twice-born [brahmin], whose son was he? Tell me. ||3||" |
| `Line 2644: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2645: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2646: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2647: महदाख्यानमास्तीकं यत्रैतत्प्रोच्यते द्विज |` | "This great narrative of Āstīka wherein this is told, O twice-born [brahmin]," |
| `Line 2648: सर्वमेतदशेषेण शृणु मे वदतां वर ||४||` | "Listen to all of this completely from me, O best among speakers. ||4||" |
| `Line 2649: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2650: शौनक उवाच||` | "Shaunaka [sage-listener] said:" |

| `Line 2651: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2652: श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यशेषेण कथामेतां मनोरमाम् |` | "I wish to hear completely this delightful story," |
| `Line 2653: आस्तीकस्य पुराणस्य ब्राह्मणस्य यशस्विनः ||५||` | "Of Āstīka, the ancient brahmin [twice-born sage] of great fame. ||5||" |
| `Line 2654: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2655: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard sage] said:" |
| `Line 2656: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2657: इतिहासमिमं वृद्धाः पुराणं परिचक्षते |` | "The elders [venerable sages] describe this history as an ancient tale [purāṇa]," |
| `Line 2658: कृष्णद्वैपायनप्रोक्तं नैमिषारण्यवासिनः ||६||` | "Narrated by Kṛṣṇa Dvaipāyana [Vyāsa], to the dwellers of Naimiṣāraṇya [sacred forest]. ||6||" |
| `Line 2659: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2660: पूर्वं प्रचोदितः सूतः पिता मे लोमहर्षणः |` | "Formerly, my father Lomaharṣaṇa, the sūta [bard sage]," |
| `Line 2661: शिष्यो व्यासस्य मेधावी ब्राह्मणैरिदमुक्तवान् ||७||` | "The intelligent disciple of Vyāsa, narrated this to the brahmins. ||7||" |
| `Line 2662: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2663: तस्मादहमुपश्रुत्य प्रवक्ष्यामि यथातथम् |` | "Therefore, having heard it from him, I shall narrate it exactly as it is," |
| `Line 2664: इदमास्तीकमाख्यानं तुभ्यं शौनक पृच्छते ||८||` | "This tale of Āstīka to you, O Śaunaka, who has asked. ||8||" |
| `Line 2665: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2666: आस्तीकस्य पिता ह्यासीत्प्रजापतिसमः प्रभुः |` | "Āstīka's father was a lord equal to Prajāpati [creator deity]," |
| `Line 2667: ब्रह्मचारी यताहारस्तपस्युग्रे रतः सदा ||९||` | "A celibate [brahmacharī] with controlled diet, always engaged in severe austerities. ||9||" |
| `Line 2668: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2669: जरत्कारुरिति ख्यात ऊर्ध्वरेता महानृषिः |` | "He was known as Jaratkāru, the great sage who preserved his vital fluid [celibate]," |
| `Line 2670: यायावराणां धर्मज्ञः प्रवरः संशितव्रतः ||१०||` | "Foremost among the wandering ascetics [yāyāvaras], knower of dharma, of firm vows. ||10||" |
| `Line 2671: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2672: अटमानः कदाचित्स स्वान्ददर्श पितामहान् |` | "Once while wandering, he saw his own forefathers [ancestors]," |
| `Line 2673: लम्बमानान्महागर्ते पादैरूर्ध्वैरधोमुखान् ||११||` | "Hanging in a great pit, with feet upward and faces downward. ||11||" |
| `Line 2674: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2675: तानब्रवीत्स दृष्ट्वैव जरत्कारुः पितामहान् |` | "Upon seeing them, Jaratkāru addressed those forefathers [ancestors]:" |

| `Line 2653: आस्तीकस्य पुराणस्य ब्राह्मणस्य यशस्विनः ||५||` | "Of Āstīka, the ancient brahmin [twice-born sage] of great fame. ||5||" |

| `Line 2657: इतिहासमिमं वृद्धाः पुराणं परिचक्षते |` | "The elders [venerable sages] describe this history as an ancient tale [purāṇa]," |
