| `Line 2659: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2660: पूर्वं प्रचोदितः सूतः पिता मे लोमहर्षणः |` | "Formerly, my father Lomaharṣaṇa, the sūta [bard sage]," |
| `Line 2661: शिष्यो व्यासस्य मेधावी ब्राह्मणैरिदमुक्तवान् ||७||` | "The intelligent disciple of Vyāsa, narrated this to the brahmins. ||7||" |
| `Line 2662: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2663: तस्मादहमुपश्रुत्य प्रवक्ष्यामि यथातथम् |` | "Therefore, having heard it from him, I shall narrate it exactly as it is," |
| `Line 2664: इदमास्तीकमाख्यानं तुभ्यं शौनक पृच्छते ||८||` | "This tale of Āstīka to you, O Śaunaka, who has asked. ||8||" |
| `Line 2665: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2666: आस्तीकस्य पिता ह्यासीत्प्रजापतिसमः प्रभुः |` | "Āstīka's father was a lord equal to Prajāpati [creator deity]," |
| `Line 2667: ब्रह्मचारी यताहारस्तपस्युग्रे रतः सदा ||९||` | "A celibate [brahmacharī] with controlled diet, always engaged in severe austerities. ||9||" |
| `Line 2668: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2669: जरत्कारुरिति ख्यात ऊर्ध्वरेता महानृषिः |` | "He was known as Jaratkāru, the great sage who preserved his vital fluid [celibate]," |
| `Line 2670: यायावराणां धर्मज्ञः प्रवरः संशितव्रतः ||१०||` | "Foremost among the wandering ascetics [yāyāvaras], knower of dharma, of firm vows. ||10||" |
| `Line 2671: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2672: अटमानः कदाचित्स स्वान्ददर्श पितामहान् |` | "Once while wandering, he saw his own forefathers [ancestors]," |
| `Line 2673: लम्बमानान्महागर्ते पादैरूर्ध्वैरधोमुखान् ||११||` | "Hanging in a great pit, with feet upward and faces downward. ||11||" |
| `Line 2674: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2675: तानब्रवीत्स दृष्ट्वैव जरत्कारुः पितामहान् |` | "Upon seeing them, Jaratkāru addressed those forefathers [ancestors]:" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2676: के भवन्तोऽवलम्बन्ते गर्तेऽस्मिन्वा अधोमुखाः ||१२||` | "Who are you hanging in this pit with faces downward? ||12||" |
| `Line 2677: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2678: वीरणस्तम्बके लग्नाः सर्वतः परिभक्षिते |` | "Clinging to a reed-grass clump that is gnawed all around" |
| `Line 2679: मूषकेन निगूढेन गर्तेऽस्मिन्नित्यवासिना ||१३||` | "By a hidden mouse that permanently dwells in this pit. ||13||" |
| `Line 2680: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2681: पितर ऊचुः||` | "The ancestors [pitrs] said:" |
| `Line 2682: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2683: यायावरा नाम वयमृषयः संशितव्रताः |` | "We are sages called Yayavaras [wandering ascetics], of strict vows," |
| `Line 2684: सन्तानप्रक्षयाद्ब्रह्मन्नधो गच्छाम मेदिनीम् ||१४||` | "Due to the extinction of our lineage, O Brahmin, we are descending to the earth. ||14||" |
| `Line 2685: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2686: अस्माकं सन्ततिस्त्वेको जरत्कारुरिति श्रुतः |` | "Our sole descendant is known as Jaratkaru," |
| `Line 2687: मन्दभाग्योऽल्पभाग्यानां तप एव समास्थितः ||१५||` | "Unfortunate one of the unfortunate, devoted only to austerities. ||15||" |
| `Line 2688: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2689: न स पुत्राञ्जनयितुं दारान्मूढश्चिकीर्षति |` | "That foolish one does not wish to take a wife to produce sons," |
| `Line 2690: तेन लम्बामहे गर्ते सन्तानप्रक्षयादिह ||१६||` | "Therefore we hang in this pit due to the extinction of our lineage. ||16||" |
| `Line 2691: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2692: अनाथास्तेन नाथेन यथा दुष्कृतिनस्तथा |` | "We are like orphans with that protector, just like evildoers," |
| `Line 2693: कस्त्वं बन्धुरिवास्माकमनुशोचसि सत्तम ||१७||` | "Who are you who grieves for us like a relative, O excellent one? ||17||" |
| `Line 2694: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2695: ज्ञातुमिच्छामहे ब्रह्मन्को भवानिह धिष्ठितः |` | "We wish to know, O Brahmin, who you are standing here," |
| `Line 2696: किमर्थं चैव नः शोच्याननुकम्पितुमर्हसि ||१८||` | "And why do you deserve to show compassion to us who are pitiable? ||18||" |
| `Line 2697: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2698: जरत्कारुरुवाच||` | "Jaratkaru said:" |
| `Line 2699: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2700: मम पूर्वे भवन्तो वै पितरः सपितामहाः |` | "You are indeed my ancestors [forefathers] along with my grandfathers," |
translations: | `Line 2676: के भवन्तोऽवलम्बन्ते गर्तेऽस्मिन्वा अधोमुखाः ||१२||` | "Who are you hanging in this pit with faces downward? ||12||" |
| `Line 2677: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2678: वीरणस्तम्बके लग्नाः सर्वतः परिभक्षिते |` | "Clinging to a reed-grass clump that is gnawed all around" |
| `Line 2679: मूषकेन निगूढेन गर्तेऽस्मिन्नित्यवासिना ||१३||` | "By a hidden mouse that permanently dwells in this pit. ||13||" |
| `Line 2680: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2681: पितर ऊचुः||` | "The ancestors [pitrs] said:" |
| `Line 2682: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2683: यायावरा नाम वयमृषयः संशितव्रताः |` | "We are sages called Yayavaras [wandering ascetics], of strict vows," |
| `Line 2684: सन्तानप्रक्षयाद्ब्रह्मन्नधो गच्छाम मेदिनीम् ||१४||` | "Due to the extinction of our lineage, O Brahmin, we are descending to the earth. ||14||" |
| `Line 2685: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2686: अस्माकं सन्ततिस्त्वेको जरत्कारुरिति श्रुतः |` | "Our sole descendant is known as Jaratkaru," |
| `Line 2687: मन्दभाग्योऽल्पभाग्यानां तप एव समास्थितः ||१५||` | "Unfortunate one of the unfortunate, devoted only to austerities. ||15||" |
| `Line 2688: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2689: न स पुत्राञ्जनयितुं दारान्मूढश्चिकीर्षति |` | "That foolish one does not wish to take a wife to produce sons," |
| `Line 2690: तेन लम्बामहे गर्ते सन्तानप्रक्षयादिह ||१६||` | "Therefore we hang in this pit due to the extinction of our lineage. ||16||" |
| `Line 2691: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2692: अनाथास्तेन नाथेन यथा दुष्कृतिनस्तथा |` | "We are like orphans with that protector, just like evildoers," |
| `Line 2693: कस्त्वं बन्धुरिवास्माकमनुशोचसि सत्तम ||१७||` | "Who are you who grieves for us like a relative, O excellent one? ||17||" |
| `Line 2694: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2695: ज्ञातुमिच्छामहे ब्रह्मन्को भवानिह धिष्ठितः |` | "We wish to know, O Brahmin, who you are standing here," |
| `Line 2696: किमर्थं चैव नः शोच्याननुकम्पितुमर्हसि ||१८||` | "And why do you deserve to show compassion to us who are pitiable? ||18||" |
| `Line 2697: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2698: जरत्कारुरुवाच||` | "Jaratkaru said:" |
| `Line 2699: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2700: मम पूर्वे भवन्तो वै पितरः सपितामहाः |` | "You are indeed my ancestors [forefathers] along with my grandfathers," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 26: सुखासीनं ततस्तं तु विश्रान्तमुपलक्ष्य च |` | "Then, observing him seated comfortably and rested," |
| `Line 27: अथापृच्छदृषिस्तत्र कश्चित्प्रस्तावयन्कथाः ||६||` | "A certain sage there asked him, initiating conversations. ||6||" |
| `Line 28: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 29: कुत आगम्यते सौते क्व चायं विहृतस्त्वया |` | "From where do you come, O Sūta [bard/narrator], and where have you spent your time," |
| `Line 30: कालः कमलपत्राक्ष शंसैतत्पृच्छतो मम ||७||` | "O lotus-eyed one, tell this to me who asks. ||7||" |
| `Line 31: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 32: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 33: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 34: जनमेजयस्य राजर्षेः सर्पसत्रे महात्मनः |` | "At the snake sacrifice of Janamejaya, the royal sage [rājarṣi] of great soul," |
| `Line 35: समीपे पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य सम्यक्पारिक्षितस्य च ||८||` | "In the presence of that lord of the earth, the worthy son of Parikshit. ||8||" |
| `Line 36: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 37: कृष्णद्वैपायनप्रोक्ताः सुपुण्या विविधाः कथाः |` | "Various most sacred stories narrated by Krishna Dvaipāyana [Vyāsa]," |
| `Line 38: कथिताश्चापि विधिवद्या वैशम्पायनेन वै ||९||` | "Were properly recited by Vaiśampāyana indeed. ||9||" |
| `Line 39: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 40: श्रुत्वाहं ता विचित्रार्था महाभारतसंश्रिताः |` | "Having heard those stories of wonderful meanings contained in the Mahābhārata," |
| `Line 41: बहूनि सम्परिक्रम्य तीर्थान्यायतनानि च ||१०||` | "And having visited many holy places [tīrthas] and temples, ||10||" |
| `Line 42: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 43: समन्तपञ्चकं नाम पुण्यं द्विजनिषेवितम् |` | "I went to that sacred place called Samantapañcaka [five lakes region], frequented by the twice-born [Brahmins]," |
| `Line 44: गतवानस्मि तं देशं युद्धं यत्राभवत्पुरा ||११||` | "That region where the battle took place long ago, ||11||" |
| `Line 45: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 46: पाण्डवानां कुरूणां च सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम् ||११||` | "Between the Pāṇḍavas, the Kurus, and all the rulers of the earth. ||11||" |
| `Line 47: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 48: दिदृक्षुरागतस्तस्मात्समीपं भवतामिह |` | "Desiring to see you, I have come here from that place to your presence," |
| `Line 49: आयुष्मन्तः सर्व एव ब्रह्मभूता हि मे मताः ||१२||` | "Long-lived ones, all of you are indeed regarded by me as embodiments of Brahman [divine knowledge]. ||12||" |
| `Line 50: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 26: सुखासीनं ततस्तं तु विश्रान्तमुपलक्ष्य च |` | "Then, observing him seated comfortably and rested," |
| `Line 27: अथापृच्छदृषिस्तत्र कश्चित्प्रस्तावयन्कथाः ||६||` | "A certain sage there asked him, initiating conversations. ||6||" |
| `Line 28: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 29: कुत आगम्यते सौते क्व चायं विहृतस्त्वया |` | "From where do you come, O Sūta [bard/narrator], and where have you spent your time," |
| `Line 30: कालः कमलपत्राक्ष शंसैतत्पृच्छतो मम ||७||` | "O lotus-eyed one, tell this to me who asks. ||7||" |
| `Line 31: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 32: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 33: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 34: जनमेजयस्य राजर्षेः सर्पसत्रे महात्मनः |` | "At the snake sacrifice of Janamejaya, the royal sage [rājarṣi] of great soul," |
| `Line 35: समीपे पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य सम्यक्पारिक्षितस्य च ||८||` | "In the presence of that lord of the earth, the worthy son of Parikshit. ||8||" |
| `Line 36: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 37: कृष्णद्वैपायनप्रोक्ताः सुपुण्या विविधाः कथाः |` | "Various most sacred stories narrated by Krishna Dvaipāyana [Vyāsa]," |
| `Line 38: कथिताश्चापि विधिवद्या वैशम्पायनेन वै ||९||` | "Were properly recited by Vaiśampāyana indeed. ||9||" |
| `Line 39: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 40: श्रुत्वाहं ता विचित्रार्था महाभारतसंश्रिताः |` | "Having heard those stories of wonderful meanings contained in the Mahābhārata," |
| `Line 41: बहूनि सम्परिक्रम्य तीर्थान्यायतनानि च ||१०||` | "And having visited many holy places [tīrthas] and temples, ||10||" |
| `Line 42: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 43: समन्तपञ्चकं नाम पुण्यं द्विजनिषेवितम् |` | "I went to that sacred place called Samantapañcaka [five lakes region], frequented by the twice-born [Brahmins]," |
| `Line 44: गतवानस्मि तं देशं युद्धं यत्राभवत्पुरा ||११||` | "That region where the battle took place long ago, ||11||" |
| `Line 45: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 46: पाण्डवानां कुरूणां च सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम् ||११||` | "Between the Pāṇḍavas, the Kurus, and all the rulers of the earth. ||11||" |
| `Line 47: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 48: दिदृक्षुरागतस्तस्मात्समीपं भवतामिह |` | "Desiring to see you, I have come here from that place to your presence," |
| `Line 49: आयुष्मन्तः सर्व एव ब्रह्मभूता हि मे मताः ||१२||` | "Long-lived ones, all of you are indeed regarded by me as embodiments of Brahman [divine knowledge]. ||12||" |
| `Line 50: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2701: ब्रूत किं करवाण्यद्य जरत्कारुरहं स्वयम् ||१९||` | "Tell me what I should do now, I myself am Jaratkaru. ||19||" |
| `Line 2702:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2703: पितर ऊचुः||` | "The ancestors [pitrs] said:" |
| `Line 2704:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2705: यतस्व यत्नवांस्तात सन्तानाय कुलस्य नः |` | "Strive diligently, dear son, for the continuation of our lineage," |
| `Line 2706: आत्मनोऽर्थेऽस्मदर्थे च धर्म इत्येव चाभिभो ||२०||` | "For your own sake and for our sake, this is indeed dharma [righteous duty], O illustrious one. ||20||" |
| `Line 2707:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2708: न हि धर्मफलैस्तात न तपोभिः सुसञ्चितैः |` | "Not by the fruits of dharma, dear son, nor by well-accumulated austerities," |
| `Line 2709: तां गतिं प्राप्नुवन्तीह पुत्रिणो यां व्रजन्ति ह ||२१||` | "Can one attain in this world the state which those with sons achieve. ||21||" |
| `Line 2710:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2711: तद्दारग्रहणे यत्नं सन्तत्यां च मनः कुरु |` | "Therefore, make an effort to take a wife and set your mind on progeny," |
| `Line 2712: पुत्रकास्मन्नियोगात्त्वमेतन्नः परमं हितम् ||२२||` | "O son, by our command, this is our highest welfare. ||22||" |
| `Line 2713:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2714: जरत्कारुरुवाच||` | "Jaratkaru said:" |
| `Line 2715:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2716: न दारान्वै करिष्यामि सदा मे भावितं मनः |` | "I shall not take a wife - this has always been my resolved mind," |
| `Line 2717: भवतां तु हितार्थाय करिष्ये दारसङ्ग्रहम् ||२३||` | "But for your welfare, I shall take a wife. ||23||" |
| `Line 2718:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2719: समयेन च कर्ताहमनेन विधिपूर्वकम् |` | "And I shall do so with this condition, according to proper procedure," |
| `Line 2720: तथा यद्युपलप्स्यामि करिष्ये नान्यथा त्वहम् ||२४||` | "Only if I find such a one shall I do it, not otherwise. ||24||" |
| `Line 2721:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2722: सनाम्नी या भवित्री मे दित्सिता चैव बन्धुभिः |` | "She who will be of the same name as mine and is offered by her relatives," |
| `Line 2723: भैक्षवत्तामहं कन्यामुपयंस्ये विधानतः ||२५||` | "Such a maiden, given as alms, I shall marry according to the proper rites. ||25||" |
| `Line 2724:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2725: दरिद्राय हि मे भार्यां को दास्यति विशेषतः |` | "For who would give a wife to a poor man like me, especially," |
translations: | `Line 2701: ब्रूत किं करवाण्यद्य जरत्कारुरहं स्वयम् ||१९||` | "Tell me what I should do now, I myself am Jaratkaru. ||19||" |
| `Line 2702:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2703: पितर ऊचुः||` | "The ancestors [pitrs] said:" |
| `Line 2704:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2705: यतस्व यत्नवांस्तात सन्तानाय कुलस्य नः |` | "Strive diligently, dear son, for the continuation of our lineage," |
| `Line 2706: आत्मनोऽर्थेऽस्मदर्थे च धर्म इत्येव चाभिभो ||२०||` | "For your own sake and for our sake, this is indeed dharma [righteous duty], O illustrious one. ||20||" |
| `Line 2707:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2708: न हि धर्मफलैस्तात न तपोभिः सुसञ्चितैः |` | "Not by the fruits of dharma, dear son, nor by well-accumulated austerities," |
| `Line 2709: तां गतिं प्राप्नुवन्तीह पुत्रिणो यां व्रजन्ति ह ||२१||` | "Can one attain in this world the state which those with sons achieve. ||21||" |
| `Line 2710:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2711: तद्दारग्रहणे यत्नं सन्तत्यां च मनः कुरु |` | "Therefore, make an effort to take a wife and set your mind on progeny," |
| `Line 2712: पुत्रकास्मन्नियोगात्त्वमेतन्नः परमं हितम् ||२२||` | "O son, by our command, this is our highest welfare. ||22||" |
| `Line 2713:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2714: जरत्कारुरुवाच||` | "Jaratkaru said:" |
| `Line 2715:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2716: न दारान्वै करिष्यामि सदा मे भावितं मनः |` | "I shall not take a wife - this has always been my resolved mind," |
| `Line 2717: भवतां तु हितार्थाय करिष्ये दारसङ्ग्रहम् ||२३||` | "But for your welfare, I shall take a wife. ||23||" |
| `Line 2718:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2719: समयेन च कर्ताहमनेन विधिपूर्वकम् |` | "And I shall do so with this condition, according to proper procedure," |
| `Line 2720: तथा यद्युपलप्स्यामि करिष्ये नान्यथा त्वहम् ||२४||` | "Only if I find such a one shall I do it, not otherwise. ||24||" |
| `Line 2721:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2722: सनाम्नी या भवित्री मे दित्सिता चैव बन्धुभिः |` | "She who will be of the same name as mine and is offered by her relatives," |
| `Line 2723: भैक्षवत्तामहं कन्यामुपयंस्ये विधानतः ||२५||` | "Such a maiden, given as alms, I shall marry according to the proper rites. ||25||" |
| `Line 2724:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2725: दरिद्राय हि मे भार्यां को दास्यति विशेषतः |` | "For who would give a wife to a poor man like me, especially," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2726: प्रतिग्रहीष्ये भिक्षां तु यदि कश्चित्प्रदास्यति ॥२६॥` | "I will accept alms [as bride] if someone offers them. ||26||" |
| `Line 2727:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2728: एवं दारक्रियाहेतोः प्रयतिष्ये पितामहाः |` | "Thus, O grandfathers [ancestors], I will strive for the purpose of marriage," |
| `Line 2729: अनेन विधिना शश्वन्न करिष्येऽहमन्यथा ॥२७॥` | "In this manner always, and I shall not do otherwise. ||27||" |
| `Line 2730:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2731: तत्र चोत्पत्स्यते जन्तुर्भवतां तारणाय वै |` | "And there a being will be born for your deliverance indeed," |
| `Line 2732: शाश्वतं स्थानमासाद्य मोदन्तां पितरो मम ॥२८॥` | "May my ancestors rejoice having attained the eternal abode. ||28||" |
| `Line 2733:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2734: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2735:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2736: ततो निवेशाय तदा स विप्रः संशितव्रतः |` | "Then, for the purpose of settlement, that Brahmin [vipra] of firm vows," |
| `Line 2737: महीं चचार दारार्थी न च दारानविन्दत ॥२९॥` | "Wandered the earth seeking a wife, but did not find a wife. ||29||" |
| `Line 2738:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2739: स कदाचिद्वनं गत्वा विप्रः पितृवचः स्मरन् |` | "Once, having gone to the forest, that Brahmin, remembering his father's words," |
| `Line 2740: चुक्रोश कन्याभिक्षार्थी तिस्रो वाचः शनैरिव ॥३०॥` | "Called out three times slowly, begging for a maiden as alms. ||30||" |
| `Line 2741:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2742: तं वासुकिः प्रत्यगृह्णादुद्यम्य भगिनीं तदा |` | "Then Vasuki [serpent king] approached him, offering his sister," |
| `Line 2743: न स तां प्रतिजग्राह न सनाम्नीति चिन्तयन् ॥३१॥` | "But he did not accept her, thinking, 'She is not of the same name.' ||31||" |
| `Line 2744:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2745: सनाम्नीमुद्यतां भार्यां गृह्णीयामिति तस्य हि |` | "For his mind was fixed on the idea, 'I shall accept a wife who has the same name as mine,'" |
| `Line 2746: मनो निविष्टमभवज्जरत्कारोर्महात्मनः ॥३२॥` | "Such was the mind of the great-souled Jaratkaru. ||32||" |
| `Line 2747:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2748: तमुवाच महाप्राज्ञो जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "The highly wise Jaratkaru of great austerity said to him," |
| `Line 2749: किंनाम्नी भगिनीयं ते ब्रूहि सत्यं भुजङ्गम ॥३३॥` | "What is the name of this sister of yours? Speak the truth, O serpent [bhujangama]. ||33||" |
| `Line 2750:` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2726: प्रतिग्रहीष्ये भिक्षां तु यदि कश्चित्प्रदास्यति ॥२६॥` | "I will accept alms [as bride] if someone offers them. ||26||" |
| `Line 2727:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2728: एवं दारक्रियाहेतोः प्रयतिष्ये पितामहाः |` | "Thus, O grandfathers [ancestors], I will strive for the purpose of marriage," |
| `Line 2729: अनेन विधिना शश्वन्न करिष्येऽहमन्यथा ॥२७॥` | "In this manner always, and I shall not do otherwise. ||27||" |
| `Line 2730:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2731: तत्र चोत्पत्स्यते जन्तुर्भवतां तारणाय वै |` | "And there a being will be born for your deliverance indeed," |
| `Line 2732: शाश्वतं स्थानमासाद्य मोदन्तां पितरो मम ॥२८॥` | "May my ancestors rejoice having attained the eternal abode. ||28||" |
| `Line 2733:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2734: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2735:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2736: ततो निवेशाय तदा स विप्रः संशितव्रतः |` | "Then, for the purpose of settlement, that Brahmin [vipra] of firm vows," |
| `Line 2737: महीं चचार दारार्थी न च दारानविन्दत ॥२९॥` | "Wandered the earth seeking a wife, but did not find a wife. ||29||" |
| `Line 2738:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2739: स कदाचिद्वनं गत्वा विप्रः पितृवचः स्मरन् |` | "Once, having gone to the forest, that Brahmin, remembering his father's words," |
| `Line 2740: चुक्रोश कन्याभिक्षार्थी तिस्रो वाचः शनैरिव ॥३०॥` | "Called out three times slowly, begging for a maiden as alms. ||30||" |
| `Line 2741:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2742: तं वासुकिः प्रत्यगृह्णादुद्यम्य भगिनीं तदा |` | "Then Vasuki [serpent king] approached him, offering his sister," |
| `Line 2743: न स तां प्रतिजग्राह न सनाम्नीति चिन्तयन् ॥३१॥` | "But he did not accept her, thinking, 'She is not of the same name.' ||31||" |
| `Line 2744:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2745: सनाम्नीमुद्यतां भार्यां गृह्णीयामिति तस्य हि |` | "For his mind was fixed on the idea, 'I shall accept a wife who has the same name as mine,'" |
| `Line 2746: मनो निविष्टमभवज्जरत्कारोर्महात्मनः ॥३२॥` | "Such was the mind of the great-souled Jaratkaru. ||32||" |
| `Line 2747:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2748: तमुवाच महाप्राज्ञो जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "The highly wise Jaratkaru of great austerity said to him," |
| `Line 2749: किंनाम्नी भगिनीयं ते ब्रूहि सत्यं भुजङ्गम ॥३३॥` | "What is the name of this sister of yours? Speak the truth, O serpent [bhujangama]. ||33||" |
| `Line 2750:` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2751: वासुकिरुवाच॥` | "Vāsuki [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 2752: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2753: जरत्कारो जरत्कारुः स्वसेयमनुजा मम |` | "O Jaratkāru, this Jaratkāru is my younger sister," |
| `Line 2754: त्वदर्थं रक्षिता पूर्वं प्रतीच्छेमां द्विजोत्तम ॥३४॥` | "Kept safe earlier for you; accept her, O best of the twice-born [brahmin]. ||34||" |
| `Line 2755: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2756: सूत उवाच॥` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2757: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2758: मात्रा हि भुजगाः शप्ताः पूर्वं ब्रह्मविदां वर |` | "For the serpents were previously cursed by their mother, O best of the knowers of Brahman [spiritual scholars]," |
| `Line 2759: जनमेजयस्य वो यज्ञे धक्ष्यत्यनिलसारथिः ॥३५॥` | "Saying, 'The fire [wind-charioteer] will consume you in Janamejaya's sacrifice.' ||35||" |
| `Line 2760: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2761: तस्य शापस्य शान्त्यर्थं प्रददौ पन्नगोत्तमः |` | "For the pacification of that curse, the best of serpents [Vāsuki] gave" |
| `Line 2762: स्वसारमृषये तस्मै सुव्रताय तपस्विने ॥३६॥` | "His sister to that sage, who was of good vows and austere. ||36||" |
| `Line 2763: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2764: स च तां प्रतिजग्राह विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा |` | "And he accepted her through the ceremony prescribed by the scriptures," |
| `Line 2765: आस्तीको नाम पुत्रश्च तस्यां जज्ञे महात्मनः ॥३७॥` | "And a son named Āstīka was born to that great soul through her. ||37||" |
| `Line 2766: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2767: तपस्वी च महात्मा च वेदवेदाङ्गपारगः |` | "He was austere and noble-souled, master of the Vedas and Vedāṅgas [auxiliary texts]," |
| `Line 2768: समः सर्वस्य लोकस्य पितृमातृभयापहः ॥३८॥` | "Equal toward all beings, and one who removed the fear of his fathers and mother. ||38||" |
| `Line 2769: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2770: अथ कालस्य महतः पाण्डवेयो नराधिपः |` | "Then after a long time, the Pāṇḍava descendant [Kuru king], the ruler of men," |
| `Line 2771: आजहार महायज्ञं सर्पसत्रमिति श्रुतिः ॥३९॥` | "Performed the great sacrifice known as the Sarpa-satra [serpent sacrifice], so it is heard. ||39||" |
| `Line 2772: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2773: तस्मिन्प्रवृत्ते सत्रे तु सर्पाणामन्तकाय वै |` | "When that sacrifice, meant for the destruction of the serpents, was in progress," |
| `Line 2774: मोचयामास तं शापमास्तीकः सुमहायशाः ॥४०॥` | "Āstīka, of great fame, freed them from that curse. ||40||" |
| `Line 2775: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2751: वासुकिरुवाच॥` | "Vāsuki [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 2752: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2753: जरत्कारो जरत्कारुः स्वसेयमनुजा मम |` | "O Jaratkāru, this Jaratkāru is my younger sister," |
| `Line 2754: त्वदर्थं रक्षिता पूर्वं प्रतीच्छेमां द्विजोत्तम ॥३४॥` | "Kept safe earlier for you; accept her, O best of the twice-born [brahmin]. ||34||" |
| `Line 2755: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2756: सूत उवाच॥` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2757: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2758: मात्रा हि भुजगाः शप्ताः पूर्वं ब्रह्मविदां वर |` | "For the serpents were previously cursed by their mother, O best of the knowers of Brahman [spiritual scholars]," |
| `Line 2759: जनमेजयस्य वो यज्ञे धक्ष्यत्यनिलसारथिः ॥३५॥` | "Saying, 'The fire [wind-charioteer] will consume you in Janamejaya's sacrifice.' ||35||" |
| `Line 2760: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2761: तस्य शापस्य शान्त्यर्थं प्रददौ पन्नगोत्तमः |` | "For the pacification of that curse, the best of serpents [Vāsuki] gave" |
| `Line 2762: स्वसारमृषये तस्मै सुव्रताय तपस्विने ॥३६॥` | "His sister to that sage, who was of good vows and austere. ||36||" |
| `Line 2763: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2764: स च तां प्रतिजग्राह विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा |` | "And he accepted her through the ceremony prescribed by the scriptures," |
| `Line 2765: आस्तीको नाम पुत्रश्च तस्यां जज्ञे महात्मनः ॥३७॥` | "And a son named Āstīka was born to that great soul through her. ||37||" |
| `Line 2766: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2767: तपस्वी च महात्मा च वेदवेदाङ्गपारगः |` | "He was austere and noble-souled, master of the Vedas and Vedāṅgas [auxiliary texts]," |
| `Line 2768: समः सर्वस्य लोकस्य पितृमातृभयापहः ॥३८॥` | "Equal toward all beings, and one who removed the fear of his fathers and mother. ||38||" |
| `Line 2769: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2770: अथ कालस्य महतः पाण्डवेयो नराधिपः |` | "Then after a long time, the Pāṇḍava descendant [Kuru king], the ruler of men," |
| `Line 2771: आजहार महायज्ञं सर्पसत्रमिति श्रुतिः ॥३९॥` | "Performed the great sacrifice known as the Sarpa-satra [serpent sacrifice], so it is heard. ||39||" |
| `Line 2772: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2773: तस्मिन्प्रवृत्ते सत्रे तु सर्पाणामन्तकाय वै |` | "When that sacrifice, meant for the destruction of the serpents, was in progress," |
| `Line 2774: मोचयामास तं शापमास्तीकः सुमहायशाः ॥४०॥` | "Āstīka, of great fame, freed them from that curse. ||40||" |
| `Line 2775: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 276: सुनयाद्वासुदेवस्य भीमार्जुनबलेन च |` | "Through the wise policy of Vāsudeva [Krishna] and by the strength of Bhīma and Arjuna," |
| `Line 277: घातयित्वा जरासन्धं चैद्यं च बलगर्वितम् ||८६||` | "Having caused the slaying of Jarāsandha and Chaidya [Shishupala] who was proud of his strength. ||86||" |
| `Line 278: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 279: दुर्योधनमुपागच्छन्नर्हणानि ततस्ततः |` | "Tributes came to Duryodhana from here and there," |
| `Line 280: मणिकाञ्चनरत्नानि गोहस्त्यश्वधनानि च ||८७||` | "Jewels, gold, gems, and wealth in the form of cows, elephants, and horses. ||87||" |
| `Line 281: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 282: समृद्धां तां तथा दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवानां तदा श्रियम् |` | "Seeing thus the abundant prosperity of the Pāṇḍavas at that time," |
| `Line 283: ईर्ष्यासमुत्थः सुमहांस्तस्य मन्युरजायत ||८८||` | "Great anger born of envy arose in him. ||88||" |
| `Line 284: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 285: विमानप्रतिमां चापि मयेन सुकृतां सभाम् |` | "And seeing the assembly hall resembling a celestial palace, beautifully constructed by Maya [demon architect]," |
| `Line 286: पाण्डवानामुपहृतां स दृष्ट्वा पर्यतप्यत ||८९||` | "Presented to the Pāṇḍavas, he was consumed with grief. ||89||" |
| `Line 287: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 288: यत्रावहसितश्चासीत्प्रस्कन्दन्निव सम्भ्रमात् |` | "Where he had been laughed at when he fell in confusion," |
| `Line 289: प्रत्यक्षं वासुदेवस्य भीमेनानभिजातवत् ||९०||` | "In the presence of Vāsudeva [Krishna], by Bhīma, as if he were of low birth. ||90||" |
| `Line 290: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 291: स भोगान्विविधान्भुञ्जन्रत्नानि विविधानि च |` | "He, though enjoying various pleasures and diverse jewels," |
| `Line 292: कथितो धृतराष्ट्रस्य विवर्णो हरिणः कृशः ||९१||` | "Was described to Dhṛtarāṣṭra as pale, agitated, and emaciated. ||91||" |
| `Line 293: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 294: अन्वजानात्ततो द्यूतं धृतराष्ट्रः सुतप्रियः |` | "Then Dhṛtarāṣṭra, loving his son, approved of the gambling match," |
| `Line 295: तच्छ्रुत्वा वासुदेवस्य कोपः समभवन्महान् ||९२||` | "Hearing of this, great was the anger of Vāsudeva [Krishna]. ||92||" |
| `Line 296: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 297: नातिप्रीतमनाश्चासीद्विवादांश्चान्वमोदत |` | "He [Dhritarashtra] was not very pleased at heart, yet he approved of the disputes," |
| `Line 298: द्यूतादीननयान्घोरान्प्रवृद्धांश्चाप्युपैक्षत ||९३||` | "And overlooked the terrible injustices beginning with the gambling match that had grown out of control. ||93||" |
| `Line 299: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 300: निरस्य विदुरं द्रोणं भीष्मं शारद्वतं कृपम् |` | "Rejecting Vidura, Droṇa, Bhīṣma, Śāradvata [Kripa's father], and Kṛpa," |
translations: | `Line 276: सुनयाद्वासुदेवस्य भीमार्जुनबलेन च |` | "Through the wise policy of Vāsudeva [Krishna] and by the strength of Bhīma and Arjuna," |
| `Line 277: घातयित्वा जरासन्धं चैद्यं च बलगर्वितम् ||८६||` | "Having caused the slaying of Jarāsandha and Chaidya [Shishupala] who was proud of his strength. ||86||" |
| `Line 278: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 279: दुर्योधनमुपागच्छन्नर्हणानि ततस्ततः |` | "Tributes came to Duryodhana from here and there," |
| `Line 280: मणिकाञ्चनरत्नानि गोहस्त्यश्वधनानि च ||८७||` | "Jewels, gold, gems, and wealth in the form of cows, elephants, and horses. ||87||" |
| `Line 281: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 282: समृद्धां तां तथा दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवानां तदा श्रियम् |` | "Seeing thus the abundant prosperity of the Pāṇḍavas at that time," |
| `Line 283: ईर्ष्यासमुत्थः सुमहांस्तस्य मन्युरजायत ||८८||` | "Great anger born of envy arose in him. ||88||" |
| `Line 284: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 285: विमानप्रतिमां चापि मयेन सुकृतां सभाम् |` | "And seeing the assembly hall resembling a celestial palace, beautifully constructed by Maya [demon architect]," |
| `Line 286: पाण्डवानामुपहृतां स दृष्ट्वा पर्यतप्यत ||८९||` | "Presented to the Pāṇḍavas, he was consumed with grief. ||89||" |
| `Line 287: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 288: यत्रावहसितश्चासीत्प्रस्कन्दन्निव सम्भ्रमात् |` | "Where he had been laughed at when he fell in confusion," |
| `Line 289: प्रत्यक्षं वासुदेवस्य भीमेनानभिजातवत् ||९०||` | "In the presence of Vāsudeva [Krishna], by Bhīma, as if he were of low birth. ||90||" |
| `Line 290: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 291: स भोगान्विविधान्भुञ्जन्रत्नानि विविधानि च |` | "He, though enjoying various pleasures and diverse jewels," |
| `Line 292: कथितो धृतराष्ट्रस्य विवर्णो हरिणः कृशः ||९१||` | "Was described to Dhṛtarāṣṭra as pale, agitated, and emaciated. ||91||" |
| `Line 293: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 294: अन्वजानात्ततो द्यूतं धृतराष्ट्रः सुतप्रियः |` | "Then Dhṛtarāṣṭra, loving his son, approved of the gambling match," |
| `Line 295: तच्छ्रुत्वा वासुदेवस्य कोपः समभवन्महान् ||९२||` | "Hearing of this, great was the anger of Vāsudeva [Krishna]. ||92||" |
| `Line 296: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 297: नातिप्रीतमनाश्चासीद्विवादांश्चान्वमोदत |` | "He [Dhritarashtra] was not very pleased at heart, yet he approved of the disputes," |
| `Line 298: द्यूतादीननयान्घोरान्प्रवृद्धांश्चाप्युपैक्षत ||९३||` | "And overlooked the terrible injustices beginning with the gambling match that had grown out of control. ||93||" |
| `Line 299: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 300: निरस्य विदुरं द्रोणं भीष्मं शारद्वतं कृपम् |` | "Rejecting Vidura, Droṇa, Bhīṣma, Śāradvata [Kripa's father], and Kṛpa," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2776: नागांश्च मातुलांश्चैव तथा चान्यान्स बान्धवान् |` | "And the Nāgas [serpent beings] who were his maternal uncles, as well as other relatives," |
| `Line 2777: पितृंश्च तारयामास सन्तत्या तपसा तथा ||४१||` | "And his forefathers [ancestors] he delivered through progeny and through austerities as well. ||41||" |
| `Line 2778: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2779: व्रतैश्च विविधैर्ब्रह्मन्स्वाध्यायैश्चानृणोऽभवत् ||४१||` | "Through various vows, O Brahmin [twice-born sage], and through Vedic study, he became free from debt. ||41||" |
| `Line 2780: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2781: देवांश्च तर्पयामास यज्ञैर्विविधदक्षिणैः |` | "He satisfied the gods through sacrifices with various gifts [dakṣiṇā]," |
| `Line 2782: ऋषींश्च ब्रह्मचर्येण सन्तत्या च पितामहान् ||४२||` | "The sages through celibacy, and his ancestors through progeny. ||42||" |
| `Line 2783: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2784: अपहृत्य गुरुं भारं पितृणां संशितव्रतः |` | "Having removed the heavy burden of his forefathers, firm in his vows," |
| `Line 2785: जरत्कारुर्गतः स्वर्गं सहितः स्वैः पितामहैः ||४३||` | "Jaratkāru went to heaven together with his ancestors. ||43||" |
| `Line 2786: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2787: आस्तीकं च सुतं प्राप्य धर्मं चानुत्तमं मुनिः |` | "Having obtained a son in Āstīka and having fulfilled the highest dharma [righteousness], the sage," |
| `Line 2788: जरत्कारुः सुमहता कालेन स्वर्गमीयिवान् ||४४||` | "Jaratkāru, after a very long time, ascended to heaven. ||44||" |
| `Line 2789: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2790: एतदाख्यानमास्तीकं यथावत्कीर्तितं मया |` | "This story of Āstīka has been properly narrated by me," |
| `Line 2791: प्रब्रूहि भृगुशार्दूल किं भूयः कथ्यतामिति ||४५||` | "Tell me, O tiger among the Bhṛgus [eminent sage], what more should be narrated? ||45||" |
| `Line 2792: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2793: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2794: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2795: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2796: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2797: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2798: १४` | "14" |
| `Line 2799: ` | [Blank line] |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2801: शौनक उवाच॥` | "Shaunaka [sage, narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2802: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2803: सौते कथय तामेतां विस्तरेण कथां पुनः |` | "O Sauti [bard, narrator], tell that story again in detail," |
| `Line 2804: आस्तीकस्य कवेः साधोः शुश्रूषा परमा हि नः ॥१॥` | "For we have the greatest desire to hear about the virtuous sage Astika. ||1||" |
| `Line 2805: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2806: मधुरं कथ्यते सौम्य श्लक्ष्णाक्षरपदं त्वया |` | "You narrate sweetly, O gentle one, with smooth syllables and words," |
| `Line 2807: प्रीयामहे भृशं तात पितेवेदं प्रभाषसे ॥२॥` | "We are greatly pleased, dear one, as you speak like a father. ||2||" |
| `Line 2808: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2809: अस्मच्छुश्रूषणे नित्यं पिता हि निरतस्तव |` | "Your father was always engaged in serving us," |
| `Line 2810: आचष्टैतद्यथाख्यानं पिता ते त्वं तथा वद ॥३॥` | "As your father narrated this story, so you should tell it. ||3||" |
| `Line 2811: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2812: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard, narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2813: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2814: आयुष्यमिदमाख्यानमास्तीकं कथयामि ते |` | "I will narrate to you this life-giving story of Astika," |
| `Line 2815: यथा श्रुतं कथयतः सकाशाद्वै पितुर्मया ॥४॥` | "Just as I heard it from my father when he was telling it. ||4||" |
| `Line 2816: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2817: पुरा देवयुगे ब्रह्मन्प्रजापतिसुते शुभे |` | "Long ago in the divine age, O Brahmin, there were two auspicious daughters of Prajapati [creator deity]," |
| `Line 2818: आस्तां भगिन्यौ रूपेण समुपेतेऽद्भुतेऽनघे ॥५॥` | "There were two sisters endowed with wonderful, flawless beauty. ||5||" |
| `Line 2819: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2820: ते भार्ये कश्यपस्यास्तां कद्रूश्च विनता च ह |` | "They were the wives of Kashyapa [sage, progenitor]: Kadru and Vinata," |
| `Line 2821: प्रादात्ताभ्यां वरं प्रीतः प्रजापतिसमः पतिः ॥६॥` | "Their husband, equal to Prajapati, pleased, granted them a boon. ||6||" |
| `Line 2822: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2823: कश्यपो धर्मपत्नीभ्यां मुदा परमया युतः ॥६॥` | "Kashyapa, filled with supreme joy, to his righteous wives ||6||" |
| `Line 2824: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 2825: वरातिसर्गं श्रुत्वैव कश्यपादुत्तमं च ते |` | "Having heard the excellent granting of boons from Kashyapa, they" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2826: हर्षादप्रतिमां प्रीतिं प्रापतुः स्म वरस्त्रियौ ||७||` | "The two excellent women experienced incomparable joy and delight. ||7||" |
| `Line 2827:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2828: वव्रे कद्रूः सुतान्नागान्सहस्रं तुल्यतेजसः |` | "Kadru chose a thousand serpent sons of equal splendor," |
| `Line 2829: द्वौ पुत्रौ विनता वव्रे कद्रूपुत्राधिकौ बले ||८||` | "While Vinata chose two sons superior in strength to Kadru's offspring. ||8||" |
| `Line 2830:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2831: ओजसा तेजसा चैव विक्रमेणाधिकौ सुतौ ||८||` | "Sons superior in vigor, brilliance, and prowess. ||8||" |
| `Line 2832:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2833: तस्यै भर्ता वरं प्रादादध्यर्धं पुत्रमीप्सितम् |` | "Her husband granted her the desired boon of one and a half sons," |
| `Line 2834: एवमस्त्विति तं चाह कश्यपं विनता तदा ||९||` | "And Vinata then said to Kashyapa, 'So be it.' ||9||" |
| `Line 2835:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2836: कृतकृत्या तु विनता लब्ध्वा वीर्याधिकौ सुतौ |` | "Vinata, having accomplished her purpose by obtaining two sons of superior strength," |
| `Line 2837: कद्रूश्च लब्ध्वा पुत्राणां सहस्रं तुल्यतेजसाम् ||१०||` | "And Kadru, having obtained a thousand sons of equal splendor, ||10||" |
| `Line 2838:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2839: धार्यौ प्रयत्नतो गर्भावित्युक्त्वा स महातपाः |` | "After saying, 'Carefully nurture your pregnancies,' that great ascetic [Kashyapa]," |
| `Line 2840: ते भार्ये वरसंहृष्टे कश्यपो वनमाविशत् ||११||` | "Kashyapa departed for the forest, leaving his two wives delighted with their boons. ||11||" |
| `Line 2841:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2842: कालेन महता कद्रूरण्डानां दशतीर्दश |` | "After a long time, Kadru laid ten hundred eggs," |
| `Line 2843: जनयामास विप्रेन्द्र द्वे अण्डे विनता तदा ||१२||` | "While Vinata, O best of brahmins [vipra-indra], produced two eggs then. ||12||" |
| `Line 2844:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2845: तयोरण्डानि निदधुः प्रहृष्टाः परिचारिकाः |` | "The delighted attendants placed their eggs," |
| `Line 2846: सोपस्वेदेषु भाण्डेषु पञ्च वर्षशतानि च ||१३||` | "In warm vessels for five hundred years. ||13||" |
| `Line 2847:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2848: ततः पञ्चशते काले कद्रूपुत्रा विनिःसृताः |` | "Then, after five hundred years had passed, Kadru's sons emerged," |
| `Line 2849: अण्डाभ्यां विनतायास्तु मिथुनं न व्यदृश्यत ||१४||` | "But from Vinata's two eggs, no pair was yet seen. ||14||" |
| `Line 2850:` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2826: हर्षादप्रतिमां प्रीतिं प्रापतुः स्म वरस्त्रियौ ||७||` | "The two excellent women experienced incomparable joy and delight. ||7||" |
| `Line 2827:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2828: वव्रे कद्रूः सुतान्नागान्सहस्रं तुल्यतेजसः |` | "Kadru chose a thousand serpent sons of equal splendor," |
| `Line 2829: द्वौ पुत्रौ विनता वव्रे कद्रूपुत्राधिकौ बले ||८||` | "While Vinata chose two sons superior in strength to Kadru's offspring. ||8||" |
| `Line 2830:` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 2834: एवमस्त्विति तं चाह कश्यपं विनता तदा ||९||` | "And Vinata then said to Kashyapa, 'So be it.' ||9||" |

| `Line 2841:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2842: कालेन महता कद्रूरण्डानां दशतीर्दश |` | "After a long time, Kadru laid ten hundred eggs," |
| `Line 2843: जनयामास विप्रेन्द्र द्वे अण्डे विनता तदा ||१२||` | "While Vinata, O best of brahmins [vipra-indra], produced two eggs then. ||12||" |
| `Line 2844:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2845: तयोरण्डानि निदधुः प्रहृष्टाः परिचारिकाः |` | "The delighted attendants placed their eggs," |
| `Line 2846: सोपस्वेदेषु भाण्डेषु पञ्च वर्षशतानि च ||१३||` | "In warm vessels for five hundred years. ||13||" |
| `Line 2847:` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2848: ततः पञ्चशते काले कद्रूपुत्रा विनिःसृताः |` | "Then, after five hundred years had passed, Kadru's sons emerged," |
| `Line 2849: अण्डाभ्यां विनतायास्तु मिथुनं न व्यदृश्यत ||१४||` | "But from Vinata's two eggs, no pair was yet seen. ||14||" |
| `Line 2850:` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2851: ततः पुत्रार्थिणी देवी व्रीडिता सा तपस्विनी |` | "Then that goddess [Vinatā], desiring a son, being ashamed, that ascetic woman," |
| `Line 2852: अण्डं बिभेद विनता तत्र पुत्रमदृक्षत ||१५||` | "Vinatā broke open the egg and there beheld her son. ||15||" |
| `Line 2853: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2854: पूर्वार्धकायसम्पन्नमितरेणाप्रकाशता |` | "He was complete in the upper half of his body, but the lower part was undeveloped," |
| `Line 2855: स पुत्रो रोषसम्पन्नः शशापैनामिति श्रुतिः ||१६||` | "That son, filled with anger, cursed her, thus it is heard. ||16||" |
| `Line 2856: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2857: योऽहमेवं कृतो मातस्त्वया लोभपरीतया |` | "Since I have been made thus by you, mother, overcome with impatience," |
| `Line 2858: शरीरेणासमग्रोऽद्य तस्माद्दासी भविष्यसि ||१७||` | "With an incomplete body today, therefore you shall become a slave. ||17||" |
| `Line 2859: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2860: पञ्च वर्षशतान्यस्या यया विस्पर्धसे सह |` | "For five hundred years to her with whom you compete," |
| `Line 2861: एष च त्वां सुतो मातर्दास्यत्वान्मोक्षयिष्यति ||१८||` | "And this son [Garuḍa], mother, will free you from slavery. ||18||" |
| `Line 2862: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2863: यद्येनमपि मातस्त्वं मामिवाण्डविभेदनात् |` | "If you, mother, do not make him also, like me, through breaking his egg," |
| `Line 2864: न करिष्यस्यदेहं वा व्यङ्गं वापि तपस्विनम् ||१९||` | "Either incomplete in body or deformed, O ascetic one. ||19||" |
| `Line 2865: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2866: प्रतिपालयितव्यस्ते जन्मकालोऽस्य धीरया |` | "You must wait patiently for his time of birth," |
| `Line 2867: विशिष्टबलमीप्सन्त्या पञ्चवर्षशतात्परः ||२०||` | "Desiring superior strength for him, after five hundred years. ||20||" |
| `Line 2868: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2869: एवं शप्त्वा ततः पुत्रो विनतामन्तरिक्षगः |` | "Having thus cursed Vinatā, then that son, the sky-traveler," |
| `Line 2870: अरुणो दृश्यते ब्रह्मन्प्रभातसमये सदा ||२१||` | "Aruṇa [dawn deity] is seen, O Brahmin, always at the time of dawn. ||21||" |
| `Line 2871: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2872: गरुडोऽपि यथाकालं जज्ञे पन्नगसूदनः |` | "Garuḍa [divine eagle] too was born at the proper time, the destroyer of serpents," |
| `Line 2873: स जातमात्रो विनतां परित्यज्य खमाविशत् ||२२||` | "He, as soon as born, leaving Vinatā, entered the sky. ||22||" |
| `Line 2874: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2875: आदास्यन्नात्मनो भोज्यमन्नं विहितमस्य यत् |` | "To take for himself the food that was ordained for him," |

| `Line 2876: विधात्रा भृगुशार्दूल क्षुधितस्य बुभुक्षतः ||२३||` | "By the Creator [Brahma], O tiger among the Bhrigus [sage], for one who is hungry and starving. ||23||" |
| `Line 2877: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2878: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2879: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2880: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2881: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2882: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2883: १५` | "15" [chapter number] |
| `Line 2884: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2885: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2886: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2887: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2888: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु भगिन्यौ ते तपोधन |` | "At this very time, O wealth of austerities [sage], those two sisters" |
| `Line 2889: अपश्यतां समायान्तमुच्चैःश्रवसमन्तिकात् ||१||` | "Saw Uccaiḥśravas [divine horse] approaching from nearby. ||1||" |
| `Line 2890: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2891: यं तं देवगणाः सर्वे हृष्टरूपा अपूजयन् |` | "Whom all the hosts of gods, in delighted form, worshipped," |
| `Line 2892: मथ्यमानेऽमृते जातमश्वरत्नमनुत्तमम् ||२||` | "Born when the nectar [amrita] was being churned, the unsurpassed jewel among horses. ||2||" |
| `Line 2893: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2894: महौघबलमश्वानामुत्तमं जवतां वरम् |` | "Of immense strength among horses, the best among the swift ones," |
| `Line 2895: श्रीमन्तमजरं दिव्यं सर्वलक्षणलक्षितम् ||३||` | "Splendid, ageless, divine, marked with all auspicious signs. ||3||" |
| `Line 2896: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2897: शौनक उवाच||` | "Śaunaka [sage-listener] said:" |
| `Line 2898: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2899: कथं तदमृतं देवैर्मथितं क्व च शंस मे |` | "How was that nectar churned by the gods, and where? Tell me," |
| `Line 2900: यत्र जज्ञे महावीर्यः सोऽश्वराजो महाद्युतिः ||४||` | "Where was born that mighty one, that king of horses of great splendor. ||4||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2901: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2902: सूत उवाच॥` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2903: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2904: ज्वलन्तमचलं मेरुं तेजोराशिमनुत्तमम् |` | "The blazing, immovable Mount Meru [cosmic mountain], an unsurpassed mass of splendor," |
| `Line 2905: आक्षिपन्तं प्रभां भानोः स्वशृङ्गैः काञ्चनोज्ज्वलैः ॥५॥` | "Outshining the radiance of the sun with its golden-brilliant peaks. ||5||" |
| `Line 2906: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2907: काञ्चनाभरणं चित्रं देवगन्धर्वसेवितम् |` | "Adorned with golden ornaments, marvelous, frequented by gods and gandharvas [celestial musicians]," |
| `Line 2908: अप्रमेयमनाधृष्यमधर्मबहुलैर्जनैः ॥६॥` | "Immeasurable, unapproachable by people abundant in unrighteousness. ||6||" |
| `Line 2909: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2910: व्यालैराचरितं घोरैर्दिव्यौषधिविदीपितम् |` | "Inhabited by fearsome serpents, illuminated by divine herbs," |
| `Line 2911: नाकमावृत्य तिष्ठन्तमुच्छ्रयेण महागिरिम् ॥७॥` | "The great mountain standing, covering heaven with its height. ||7||" |
| `Line 2912: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2913: अगम्यं मनसाप्यन्यैर्नदीवृक्षसमन्वितम् |` | "Inaccessible even in thought to others, filled with rivers and trees," |
| `Line 2914: नानापतगसङ्घैश्च नादितं सुमनोहरैः ॥८॥` | "And resounding with flocks of various enchanting birds. ||8||" |
| `Line 2915: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2916: तस्य पृष्ठमुपारुह्य बहुरत्नाचितं शुभम् |` | "Having ascended to its summit, abundant with many jewels, auspicious," |
| `Line 2917: अनन्तकल्पमुद्विद्धं सुराः सर्वे महौजसः ॥९॥` | "Lofty as if eternal, all the mighty gods [suras]. ||9||" |
| `Line 2918: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2919: ते मन्त्रयितुमारब्धास्तत्रासीना दिवौकसः |` | "Those heaven-dwellers, seated there, began to deliberate," |
| `Line 2920: अमृतार्थे समागम्य तपोनियमसंस्थिताः ॥१०॥` | "Having assembled for the purpose of amṛta [nectar of immortality], established in austerities and observances. ||10||" |
| `Line 2921: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2922: तत्र नारायणो देवो ब्रह्माणमिदमब्रवीत् |` | "There, the god Nārāyaṇa [Vishnu] spoke this to Brahmā [creator deity]," |
| `Line 2923: चिन्तयत्सु सुरेष्वेवं मन्त्रयत्सु च सर्वशः ॥११॥` | "While the gods were thus pondering and deliberating in every way. ||11||" |
| `Line 2924: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2925: देवैरसुरसङ्घैश्च मथ्यतां कलशोदधिः |` | "Let the ocean of milk be churned by the gods and hosts of asuras [demons]," |

| `Line 2926: भविष्यत्यमृतं तत्र मथ्यमाने महोदधौ ||१२||` | "There will be amṛta [immortality nectar] when the great ocean is churned. ||12||" |
| `Line 2927: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2928: सर्वौषधीः समावाप्य सर्वरत्नानि चैव हि |` | "Having gathered all herbs and indeed all jewels," |
| `Line 2929: मन्थध्वमुदधिं देवा वेत्स्यध्वममृतं ततः ||१३||` | "Churn the ocean, O gods, and you shall obtain the amṛta [immortality nectar] from it. ||13||" |
| `Line 2930: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2931: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2932: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 2939: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 2940: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2941: ततोऽभ्रशिखराकारैर्गिरिशृङ्गैरलङ्कृतम् |` | "Then, adorned with mountain peaks resembling the summits of clouds," |
| `Line 2942: मन्दरं पर्वतवरं लताजालसमावृतम् ||१||` | "Mandara, the excellent mountain, covered with a network of creepers. ||1||" |
| `Line 2943: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2944: नानाविहगसङ्घुष्टं नानादंष्ट्रिसमाकुलम् |` | "Resounding with various birds, teeming with various fanged creatures [wild animals]," |
| `Line 2945: किंनरैरप्सरोभिश्च देवैरपि च सेवितम् ||२||` | "Frequented by Kinnaras [half-human beings], Apsaras [celestial nymphs], and also by gods. ||2||" |
| `Line 2946: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2947: एकादश सहस्राणि योजनानां समुच्छ्रितम् |` | "Eleven thousand yojanas [ancient measure] in height," |
| `Line 2948: अधो भूमेः सहस्रेषु तावत्स्वेव प्रतिष्ठितम् ||३||` | "And established just as many thousands (of yojanas) below the earth. ||3||" |
| `Line 2949: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2950: तमुद्धर्तुं न शक्ता वै सर्वे देवगणास्तदा |` | "All the hosts of gods were then unable to uproot it [the mountain]," |

| `Line 2927: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2928: सर्वौषधीः समावाप्य सर्वरत्नानि चैव हि |` | "Having gathered all herbs and indeed all jewels," |
| `Line 2929: मन्थध्वमुदधिं देवा वेत्स्यध्वममृतं ततः ||१३||` | "Churn the ocean, O gods, and you shall obtain the amṛta [immortality nectar] from it. ||13||" |

| `Line 2942: मन्दरं पर्वतवरं लताजालसमावृतम् ||१||` | "Mandara, the excellent mountain, covered with a network of creepers. ||1||" |

| `Line 2948: अधो भूमेः सहस्रेषु तावत्स्वेव प्रतिष्ठितम् ||३||` | "And established just as many thousands (of yojanas) below the earth. ||3||" |

| `Line 2950: तमुद्धर्तुं न शक्ता वै सर्वे देवगणास्तदा |` | "All the hosts of gods were then unable to uproot it [the mountain]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2951: विष्णुमासीनमभ्येत्य ब्रह्माणं चेदमब्रुवन् ||४||` | "Approaching Vishnu [preserver deity] who was seated, and Brahma [creator deity], they said this. ||4||" |
| `Line 2952: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2953: भवन्तावत्र कुरुतां बुद्धिं नैःश्रेयसीं पराम् |` | "May both of you devise here the highest wisdom for ultimate good," |
| `Line 2954: मन्दरोद्धरणे यत्नः क्रियतां च हिताय नः ||५||` | "And let efforts be made to lift Mount Mandara [churning mountain] for our benefit. ||5||" |
| `Line 2955: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2956: तथेति चाब्रवीद्विष्णुर्ब्रह्मणा सह भार्गव |` | "So be it," said Vishnu along with Brahma, O descendant of Bhrigu [sage]," |
| `Line 2957: ततोऽनन्तः समुत्थाय ब्रह्मणा परिचोदितः ||६||` | "Then Ananta [cosmic serpent] arose, urged by Brahma. ||6||" |
| `Line 2958: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2959: नारायणेन चाप्युक्तस्तस्मिन्कर्मणि वीर्यवान् ||६||` | "And instructed by Narayana [Vishnu] too, the mighty one, for that task. ||6||" |
| `Line 2960: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2961: अथ पर्वतराजानं तमनन्तो महाबलः |` | "Then Ananta of great strength," |
| `Line 2962: उज्जहार बलाद्ब्रह्मन्सवनं सवनौकसम् ||७||` | "Forcibly lifted that king of mountains, O Brahmin, along with its forests and forest-dwellers. ||7||" |
| `Line 2963: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2964: ततस्तेन सुराः सार्धं समुद्रमुपतस्थिरे |` | "Then with it, the gods approached the ocean," |
| `Line 2965: तमूचुरमृतार्थाय निर्मथिष्यामहे जलम् ||८||` | "And said to him, 'For the sake of amrita [nectar], we will churn your waters.' ||8||" |
| `Line 2966: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2967: अपाम्पतिरथोवाच ममाप्यंशो भवेत्ततः |` | "Then the lord of waters [ocean] said, 'Let there be a share for me also," |
| `Line 2968: सोढास्मि विपुलं मर्दं मन्दरभ्रमणादिति ||९||` | "For I will endure the immense churning from the rotation of Mandara.' ||9||" |
| `Line 2969: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2970: ऊचुश्च कूर्मराजानमकूपारं सुरासुराः |` | "And the gods and asuras [demons] said to Akupara, the king of turtles [cosmic turtle]," |
| `Line 2971: गिरेरधिष्ठानमस्य भवान्भवितुमर्हति ||१०||` | "'You should become the foundation of this mountain.' ||10||" |
| `Line 2972: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2973: कूर्मेण तु तथेत्युक्त्वा पृष्ठमस्य समर्पितम् |` | "The turtle, saying 'So be it,' offered his back," |
| `Line 2974: तस्य शैलस्य चाग्रं वै यन्त्रेणेन्द्रोऽभ्यपीडयत् ||११||` | "And Indra [king of gods] with a machine pressed down the top of that mountain. ||11||" |
| `Line 2975: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 2951: विष्णुमासीनमभ्येत्य ब्रह्माणं चेदमब्रुवन् ||४||` | "Approaching Vishnu [preserver deity] who was seated, and Brahma [creator deity], they said this. ||4||" |
| `Line 2952: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2953: भवन्तावत्र कुरुतां बुद्धिं नैःश्रेयसीं पराम् |` | "May both of you devise here the highest wisdom for ultimate good," |
| `Line 2954: मन्दरोद्धरणे यत्नः क्रियतां च हिताय नः ||५||` | "And let efforts be made to lift Mount Mandara [churning mountain] for our benefit. ||5||" |
| `Line 2955: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2956: तथेति चाब्रवीद्विष्णुर्ब्रह्मणा सह भार्गव |` | "So be it," said Vishnu along with Brahma, O descendant of Bhrigu [sage]," |
| `Line 2957: ततोऽनन्तः समुत्थाय ब्रह्मणा परिचोदितः ||६||` | "Then Ananta [cosmic serpent] arose, urged by Brahma. ||6||" |
| `Line 2958: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2959: नारायणेन चाप्युक्तस्तस्मिन्कर्मणि वीर्यवान् ||६||` | "And instructed by Narayana [Vishnu] too, the mighty one, for that task. ||6||" |
| `Line 2960: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2961: अथ पर्वतराजानं तमनन्तो महाबलः |` | "Then Ananta of great strength," |
| `Line 2962: उज्जहार बलाद्ब्रह्मन्सवनं सवनौकसम् ||७||` | "Forcibly lifted that king of mountains, O Brahmin, along with its forests and forest-dwellers. ||7||" |
| `Line 2963: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2964: ततस्तेन सुराः सार्धं समुद्रमुपतस्थिरे |` | "Then with it, the gods approached the ocean," |
| `Line 2965: तमूचुरमृतार्थाय निर्मथिष्यामहे जलम् ||८||` | "And said to him, 'For the sake of amrita [nectar], we will churn your waters.' ||8||" |
| `Line 2966: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2967: अपाम्पतिरथोवाच ममाप्यंशो भवेत्ततः |` | "Then the lord of waters [ocean] said, 'Let there be a share for me also," |
| `Line 2968: सोढास्मि विपुलं मर्दं मन्दरभ्रमणादिति ||९||` | "For I will endure the immense churning from the rotation of Mandara.' ||9||" |

| `Line 2970: ऊचुश्च कूर्मराजानमकूपारं सुरासुराः |` | "And the gods and asuras [demons] said to Akupara, the king of turtles [cosmic turtle]," |
| `Line 2971: गिरेरधिष्ठानमस्य भवान्भवितुमर्हति ||१०||` | "'You should become the foundation of this mountain.' ||10||" |
| `Line 2972: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2973: कूर्मेण तु तथेत्युक्त्वा पृष्ठमस्य समर्पितम् |` | "The turtle, saying 'So be it,' offered his back," |
| `Line 2974: तस्य शैलस्य चाग्रं वै यन्त्रेणेन्द्रोऽभ्यपीडयत् ||११||` | "And Indra [king of gods] with a machine pressed down the top of that mountain. ||11||" |
| `Line 2975: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 2976: मन्थानं मन्दरं कृत्वा तथा नेत्रं च वासुकिम् |` | "Making Mount Mandara [cosmic mountain] the churning rod and Vāsuki [serpent king] the rope," |
| `Line 2977: देवा मथितुमारब्धाः समुद्रं निधिमम्भसाम् ||१२||` | "The gods began to churn the ocean, the repository of waters. ||12||" |
| `Line 2978: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2979: अमृतार्थिनस्ततो ब्रह्मन्सहिता दैत्यदानवाः ||१२||` | "Then, O Brahmin [sage], the Daityas and Dānavas [demon classes] joined together, seeking the nectar [amrita]. ||12||" |
| `Line 2980: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2981: एकमन्तमुपाश्लिष्टा नागराज्ञो महासुराः |` | "The great Asuras [demons] grasped one end of the serpent king," |
| `Line 2982: विबुधाः सहिताः सर्वे यतः पुच्छं ततः स्थिताः ||१३||` | "While all the gods together positioned themselves at the tail end. ||13||" |
| `Line 2983: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2984: अनन्तो भगवान्देवो यतः नारायणस्ततः |` | "Where Lord Nārāyaṇa [Vishnu] was, there was Ananta [cosmic serpent]," |
| `Line 2985: शिर उद्यम्य नागस्य पुनः पुनरवाक्षिपत् ||१४||` | "Who, raising the serpent's head, pulled it down again and again. ||14||" |
| `Line 2986: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2987: वासुकेरथ नागस्य सहसाक्षिप्यतः सुरैः |` | "As the gods suddenly pulled the serpent Vāsuki," |
| `Line 2988: सधूमाः सार्चिषो वाता निष्पेतुरसकृन्मुखात् ||१५||` | "Smoky, fiery breaths repeatedly issued from his mouth. ||15||" |
| `Line 2989: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2990: ते धूमसङ्घाः सम्भूता मेघसङ्घाः सविद्युतः |` | "Those masses of smoke transformed into clouds with lightning," |
| `Line 2991: अभ्यवर्षन्सुरगणाञ्श्रमसन्तापकर्शितान् ||१६||` | "And rained upon the hosts of gods who were exhausted by fatigue and heat. ||16||" |
| `Line 2992: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2993: तस्माच्च गिरिकूटाग्रात्प्रच्युताः पुष्पवृष्टयः |` | "From the peak of that mountain, showers of flowers fell," |
| `Line 2994: सुरासुरगणान्माल्यैः सर्वतः समवाकिरन् ||१७||` | "Covering the hosts of gods and Asuras with garlands from all sides. ||17||" |
| `Line 2995: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2996: बभूवात्र महाघोषो महामेघरवोपमः |` | "There arose a great sound resembling the rumbling of mighty clouds," |
| `Line 2997: उदधेर्मथ्यमानस्य मन्दरेण सुरासुरैः ||१८||` | "As the ocean was being churned by Mount Mandara by the gods and Asuras. ||18||" |
| `Line 2998: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 2999: तत्र नानाजलचरा विनिष्पिष्टा महाद्रिणा |` | "There, various aquatic creatures, crushed by the great mountain," |
| `Line 3000: विलयं समुपाजग्मुः शतशो लवणाम्भसि ||१९||` | "Met their destruction by the hundreds in the salty waters. ||19||" |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3001: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3002: वारुणानि च भूतानि विविधानि महीधरः |` | "And the mountain [Mandara] destroyed various aquatic creatures [of Varuna]" |
| `Line 3003: पातालतलवासीनि विलयं समुपानयत् ||२०||` | "And those dwelling in the depths of Patala [netherworld] were brought to destruction. ||20||" |
| `Line 3004: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3005: तस्मिंश्च भ्राम्यमाणेऽद्रौ सङ्घृष्यन्तः परस्परम् |` | "And as that mountain was being rotated, rubbing against each other," |
| `Line 3006: न्यपतन्पतगोपेताः पर्वताग्रान्महाद्रुमाः ||२१||` | "Great trees with birds fell from the mountain peaks. ||21||" |
| `Line 3007: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3008: तेषां सङ्घर्षजश्चाग्निरर्चिर्भिः प्रज्वलन्मुहुः |` | "And the fire born from their friction, repeatedly blazing with flames," |
| `Line 3009: विद्युद्भिरिव नीलाभ्रमावृणोन्मन्दरं गिरिम् ||२२||` | "Enveloped Mount Mandara like lightning in dark clouds. ||22||" |
| `Line 3010: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3011: ददाह कुञ्जरांश्चैव सिंहांश्चैव विनिःसृतान् |` | "It burned the elephants and lions that had fled," |
| `Line 3012: विगतासूनि सर्वाणि सत्त्वानि विविधानि च ||२३||` | "And various other creatures were deprived of their lives. ||23||" |
| `Line 3013: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3014: तमग्निममरश्रेष्ठः प्रदहन्तं ततस्ततः |` | "That fire which was burning everywhere, the best of immortals [Indra]" |
| `Line 3015: वारिणा मेघजेनेन्द्रः शमयामास सर्वतः ||२४||` | "Indra extinguished completely with water produced from clouds. ||24||" |
| `Line 3016: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3017: ततो नानाविधास्तत्र सुस्रुवुः सागराम्भसि |` | "Then various kinds flowed there into the ocean waters," |
| `Line 3018: महाद्रुमाणां निर्यासा बहवश्चौषधीरसाः ||२५||` | "The sap of great trees and many juices of medicinal herbs. ||25||" |
| `Line 3019: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3020: तेषाममृतवीर्याणां रसानां पयसैव च |` | "From these juices with immortal potency and with the milk [of ocean]," |
| `Line 3021: अमरत्वं सुरा जग्मुः काञ्चनस्य च निःस्रवात् ||२६||` | "The gods attained immortality, and from the flow of gold. ||26||" |
| `Line 3022: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3023: अथ तस्य समुद्रस्य तज्जातमुदकं पयः |` | "Then the water of that ocean became milk," |
| `Line 3024: रसोत्तमैर्विमिश्रं च ततः क्षीरादभूद्घृतम् ||२७||` | "Mixed with the finest essences, and from that milk arose ghee [clarified butter]. ||27||" |
| `Line 3025: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 3001: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3002: वारुणानि च भूतानि विविधानि महीधरः |` | "And the mountain [Mandara] destroyed various aquatic creatures [of Varuna]" |
| `Line 3003: पातालतलवासीनि विलयं समुपानयत् ||२०||` | "And those dwelling in the depths of Patala [netherworld] were brought to destruction. ||20||" |
| `Line 3004: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3005: तस्मिंश्च भ्राम्यमाणेऽद्रौ सङ्घृष्यन्तः परस्परम् |` | "And as that mountain was being rotated, rubbing against each other," |
| `Line 3006: न्यपतन्पतगोपेताः पर्वताग्रान्महाद्रुमाः ||२१||` | "Great trees with birds fell from the mountain peaks. ||21||" |
| `Line 3007: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3009: विद्युद्भिरिव नीलाभ्रमावृणोन्मन्दरं गिरिम् ||२२||` | "Enveloped Mount Mandara like lightning in dark clouds. ||22||" |
| `Line 3010: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3011: ददाह कुञ्जरांश्चैव सिंहांश्चैव विनिःसृतान् |` | "It burned the elephants and lions that had fled," |
| `Line 3012: विगतासूनि सर्वाणि सत्त्वानि विविधानि च ||२३||` | "And various other creatures were deprived of their lives. ||23||" |
| `Line 3013: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3014: तमग्निममरश्रेष्ठः प्रदहन्तं ततस्ततः |` | "That fire which was burning everywhere, the best of immortals [Indra]" |
| `Line 3015: वारिणा मेघजेनेन्द्रः शमयामास सर्वतः ||२४||` | "Indra extinguished completely with water produced from clouds. ||24||" |
| `Line 3016: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3017: ततो नानाविधास्तत्र सुस्रुवुः सागराम्भसि |` | "Then various kinds flowed there into the ocean waters," |
| `Line 3018: महाद्रुमाणां निर्यासा बहवश्चौषधीरसाः ||२५||` | "The sap of great trees and many juices of medicinal herbs. ||25||" |
| `Line 3019: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3020: तेषाममृतवीर्याणां रसानां पयसैव च |` | "From these juices with immortal potency and with the milk [of ocean]," |
| `Line 3021: अमरत्वं सुरा जग्मुः काञ्चनस्य च निःस्रवात् ||२६||` | "The gods attained immortality, and from the flow of gold. ||26||" |
| `Line 3022: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3023: अथ तस्य समुद्रस्य तज्जातमुदकं पयः |` | "Then the water of that ocean became milk," |
| `Line 3024: रसोत्तमैर्विमिश्रं च ततः क्षीरादभूद्घृतम् ||२७||` | "Mixed with the finest essences, and from that milk arose ghee [clarified butter]. ||27||" |

| `Line 301: विग्रहे तुमुले तस्मिन्नहन्क्षत्रं परस्परम् ||९४||` | "In that tumultuous battle, the warriors [kṣatriyas] slew one another. ||94||" |
| `Line 302: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 303: जयत्सु पाण्डुपुत्रेषु श्रुत्वा सुमहदप्रियम् |` | "When the sons of Pandu were victorious, having heard this greatly unpleasant news," |
| `Line 304: दुर्योधनमतं ज्ञात्वा कर्णस्य शकुनेस्तथा ||९५||` | "And knowing the intentions of Duryodhana, Karna, and Shakuni as well, ||95||" |
| `Line 305: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 306: धृतराष्ट्रश्चिरं ध्यात्वा सञ्जयं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ||९५||` | "Dhritarashtra, after reflecting for a long time, spoke these words to Sanjaya. ||95||" |
| `Line 307: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 308: शृणु सञ्जय मे सर्वं न मेऽसूयितुमर्हसि |` | "Listen, Sanjaya, to all I say, and you should not find fault with me," |
| `Line 309: श्रुतवानसि मेधावी बुद्धिमान्प्राज्ञसंमतः ||९६||` | "You are learned, intelligent, and esteemed by the wise. ||96||" |
| `Line 310: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 311: न विग्रहे मम मतिर्न च प्रीये कुरुक्षये |` | "My mind is not inclined toward conflict, nor do I delight in the destruction of the Kurus," |
| `Line 312: न मे विशेषः पुत्रेषु स्वेषु पाण्डुसुतेषु च ||९७||` | "I have no preference between my own sons and the sons of Pandu. ||97||" |
| `Line 313: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 314: वृद्धं मामभ्यसूयन्ति पुत्रा मन्युपरायणाः |` | "My sons, devoted to anger, find fault with me, an old man," |
| `Line 315: अहं त्वचक्षुः कार्पण्यात्पुत्रप्रीत्या सहामि तत् ||९८||` | "But being blind, out of weakness and love for my sons, I endure it. ||98||" |
| `Line 316: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 317: मुह्यन्तं चानुमुह्यामि दुर्योधनमचेतनम् ||९८||` | "And I follow in delusion my deluded and senseless Duryodhana. ||98||" |
| `Line 318: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 319: राजसूये श्रियं दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवस्य महौजसः |` | "Having seen the prosperity of the mighty Pandava at the Rajasuya [royal sacrifice]," |
| `Line 320: तच्चावहसनं प्राप्य सभारोहणदर्शने ||९९||` | "And having experienced humiliation at the sight of the assembly hall, ||99||" |
| `Line 321: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 322: अमर्षितः स्वयं जेतुमशक्तः पाण्डवान्रणे |` | "Filled with intolerance, yet himself unable to defeat the Pandavas in battle," |
| `Line 323: निरुत्साहश्च सम्प्राप्तुं श्रियमक्षत्रियो यथा ||१००||` | "And lacking the energy to attain prosperity, like one who is not a kshatriya [warrior], ||100||" |
| `Line 324: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 325: गान्धारराजसहितश्छद्मद्यूतममन्त्रयत् ||१००||` | "Together with the king of Gandhara [Shakuni], he plotted the fraudulent game of dice. ||100||" |
translations: | `Line 301: विग्रहे तुमुले तस्मिन्नहन्क्षत्रं परस्परम् ||९४||` | "In that tumultuous battle, the warriors [kṣatriyas] slew one another. ||94||" |
| `Line 302: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 303: जयत्सु पाण्डुपुत्रेषु श्रुत्वा सुमहदप्रियम् |` | "When the sons of Pandu were victorious, having heard this greatly unpleasant news," |
| `Line 304: दुर्योधनमतं ज्ञात्वा कर्णस्य शकुनेस्तथा ||९५||` | "And knowing the intentions of Duryodhana, Karna, and Shakuni as well, ||95||" |
| `Line 305: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 306: धृतराष्ट्रश्चिरं ध्यात्वा सञ्जयं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ||९५||` | "Dhritarashtra, after reflecting for a long time, spoke these words to Sanjaya. ||95||" |
| `Line 307: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 308: शृणु सञ्जय मे सर्वं न मेऽसूयितुमर्हसि |` | "Listen, Sanjaya, to all I say, and you should not find fault with me," |
| `Line 309: श्रुतवानसि मेधावी बुद्धिमान्प्राज्ञसंमतः ||९६||` | "You are learned, intelligent, and esteemed by the wise. ||96||" |
| `Line 310: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 311: न विग्रहे मम मतिर्न च प्रीये कुरुक्षये |` | "My mind is not inclined toward conflict, nor do I delight in the destruction of the Kurus," |
| `Line 312: न मे विशेषः पुत्रेषु स्वेषु पाण्डुसुतेषु च ||९७||` | "I have no preference between my own sons and the sons of Pandu. ||97||" |
| `Line 313: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 314: वृद्धं मामभ्यसूयन्ति पुत्रा मन्युपरायणाः |` | "My sons, devoted to anger, find fault with me, an old man," |
| `Line 315: अहं त्वचक्षुः कार्पण्यात्पुत्रप्रीत्या सहामि तत् ||९८||` | "But being blind, out of weakness and love for my sons, I endure it. ||98||" |

| `Line 319: राजसूये श्रियं दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवस्य महौजसः |` | "Having seen the prosperity of the mighty Pandava at the Rajasuya [royal sacrifice]," |

| `Line 321: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 322: अमर्षितः स्वयं जेतुमशक्तः पाण्डवान्रणे |` | "Filled with intolerance, yet himself unable to defeat the Pandavas in battle," |
| `Line 323: निरुत्साहश्च सम्प्राप्तुं श्रियमक्षत्रियो यथा ||१००||` | "And lacking the energy to attain prosperity, like one who is not a kshatriya [warrior], ||100||" |

| `Line 325: गान्धारराजसहितश्छद्मद्यूतममन्त्रयत् ||१००||` | "Together with the king of Gandhara [Shakuni], he plotted the fraudulent game of dice. ||100||" |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3026: ततो ब्रह्माणमासीनं देवा वरदमब्रुवन् |` | "Then the gods addressed Brahmā [creator deity] who was seated, the bestower of boons:" |
| `Line 3027: श्रान्ताः स्म सुभृशं ब्रह्मन्नोद्भवत्यमृतं च तत् ||२८||` | "We are extremely exhausted, O Brahman, and that amṛta [immortality nectar] does not arise. ||28||" |
| `Line 3028: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3029: ऋते नारायणं देवं दैत्या नागोत्तमास्तथा |` | "Except for the god Nārāyaṇa [Vishnu], the daityas [demons] and the foremost nāgas [serpents] as well," |
| `Line 3030: चिरारब्धमिदं चापि सागरस्यापि मन्थनम् ||२९||` | "And this churning of the ocean has been going on for a long time. ||29||" |
| `Line 3031: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3032: ततो नारायणं देवं ब्रह्मा वचनमब्रवीत् |` | "Then Brahmā spoke these words to the god Nārāyaṇa [Vishnu]:" |
| `Line 3033: विधत्स्वैषां बलं विष्णो भवानत्र परायणम् ||३०||` | "Grant them strength, O Viṣṇu, you are the ultimate refuge here. ||30||" |
| `Line 3034: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3035: विष्णुरुवाच||` | "Viṣṇu [preserver deity] said:" |
| `Line 3036: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3037: बलं ददामि सर्वेषां कर्मैतद्ये समास्थिताः |` | "I give strength to all who are engaged in this task." |
| `Line 3038: क्षोभ्यतां कलशः सर्वैर्मन्दरः परिवर्त्यताम् ||३१||` | "Let the ocean be churned by all, let Mandara [churning mountain] be rotated. ||31||" |
| `Line 3039: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3040: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3041: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3042: नारायणवचः श्रुत्वा बलिनस्ते महोदधेः |` | "Hearing Nārāyaṇa's words, those mighty ones of the great ocean," |
| `Line 3043: तत्पयः सहिता भूयश्चक्रिरे भृशमाकुलम् ||३२||` | "Together, they again made its waters extremely agitated. ||32||" |
| `Line 3044: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3045: ततः शतसहस्रांशुः समान इव सागरात् |` | "Then, like the thousand-rayed one [sun], from the ocean," |
| `Line 3046: प्रसन्नभाः समुत्पन्नः सोमः शीतांशुरुज्ज्वलः ||३३||` | "Arose the serene-rayed Soma [moon], the cool-rayed one, brilliant. ||33||" |
| `Line 3047: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3048: श्रीरनन्तरमुत्पन्ना घृतात्पाण्डुरवासिनी |` | "Śrī [goddess of fortune] arose next, clad in white, from the ghee [clarified butter]," |
| `Line 3049: सुरा देवी समुत्पन्ना तुरगः पाण्डुरस्तथा ||३४||` | "The goddess Surā [wine deity] arose, and likewise the white horse [Uccaiḥśravas]. ||34||" |
| `Line 3050: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 3026: ततो ब्रह्माणमासीनं देवा वरदमब्रुवन् |` | "Then the gods addressed Brahmā [creator deity] who was seated, the bestower of boons:" |
| `Line 3027: श्रान्ताः स्म सुभृशं ब्रह्मन्नोद्भवत्यमृतं च तत् ||२८||` | "We are extremely exhausted, O Brahman, and that amṛta [immortality nectar] does not arise. ||28||" |

| `Line 3048: श्रीरनन्तरमुत्पन्ना घृतात्पाण्डुरवासिनी |` | "Śrī [goddess of fortune] arose next, clad in white, from the ghee [clarified butter]," |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3051: कौस्तुभश्च मणिर्दिव्य उत्पन्नोऽमृतसम्भवः |` | "And the divine Kaustubha [celestial gem] arose, born from the churning for amṛta [immortality nectar]," |
| `Line 3052: मरीचिविकचः श्रीमान्नारायण उरोगतः ||३५||` | "Radiant with light rays, the glorious gem adorned the chest of Nārāyaṇa [Vishnu]. ||35||" |
| `Line 3053: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3054: श्रीः सुरा चैव सोमश्च तुरगश्च मनोजवः |` | "Śrī [goddess of fortune], Surā [goddess of wine], Soma [moon god], and the swift-minded horse [Uccaiḥśravas]," |
| `Line 3055: यतो देवास्ततो जग्मुरादित्यपथमाश्रिताः ||३६||` | "Went in the same direction as the gods, taking refuge in the path of Āditya [sun]. ||36||" |
| `Line 3056: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3057: धन्वन्तरिस्ततो देवो वपुष्मानुदतिष्ठत |` | "Then arose the handsome god Dhanvantari [divine physician]," |
| `Line 3058: श्वेतं कमण्डलुं बिभ्रदमृतं यत्र तिष्ठति ||३७||` | "Holding a white kamaṇḍalu [water vessel] in which the amṛta [immortality nectar] was contained. ||37||" |
| `Line 3059: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3060: एतदत्यद्भुतं दृष्ट्वा दानवानां समुत्थितः |` | "Seeing this great wonder, there arose among the Dānavas [demons]," |
| `Line 3061: अमृतार्थे महान्नादो ममेदमिति जल्पताम् ||३८||` | "A great clamor for the amṛta [immortality nectar], as they shouted, 'This is mine!' ||38||" |
| `Line 3062: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3063: ततो नारायणो मायामास्थितो मोहिनीं प्रभुः |` | "Then Nārāyaṇa [Vishnu], the lord, resorted to māyā [divine illusion] in the form of Mohinī [enchantress]," |
| `Line 3064: स्त्रीरूपमद्भुतं कृत्वा दानवानभिसंश्रितः ||३९||` | "Taking a wondrous female form, he approached the Dānavas [demons]. ||39||" |
| `Line 3065: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3066: ततस्तदमृतं तस्यै ददुस्ते मूढचेतसः |` | "Then those bewildered-minded ones gave the amṛta [immortality nectar] to her," |
| `Line 3067: स्त्रियै दानवदैतेयाः सर्वे तद्गतमानसाः ||४०||` | "All the Dānava-Daityas [demon clans], their minds captivated by that woman. ||40||" |
| `Line 3068: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3069: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3070: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3076: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3077: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3078: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3079: अथावरणमुख्यानि नानाप्रहरणानि च |` | "Then, taking up their principal shields and various weapons," |
| `Line 3080: प्रगृह्याभ्यद्रवन्देवान्सहिता दैत्यदानवाः ||१||` | "The united Daityas and Danavas [demon clans] rushed against the gods. ||1||" |
| `Line 3081: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3082: ततस्तदमृतं देवो विष्णुरादाय वीर्यवान् |` | "Then the mighty god Vishnu [preserver deity], taking that amrita [immortality nectar]," |
| `Line 3083: जहार दानवेन्द्रेभ्यो नरेण सहितः प्रभुः ||२||` | "The lord, accompanied by Nara [divine sage], stole it away from the Danava lords. ||2||" |
| `Line 3084: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3085: ततो देवगणाः सर्वे पपुस्तदमृतं तदा |` | "Then all the hosts of gods drank that amrita," |
| `Line 3086: विष्णोः सकाशात्सम्प्राप्य सम्भ्रमे तुमुले सति ||३||` | "Having received it from Vishnu, while there was tumultuous confusion. ||3||" |
| `Line 3087: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3088: ततः पिबत्सु तत्कालं देवेष्वमृतमीप्सितम् |` | "Then, while the gods were drinking that desired amrita at that time," |
| `Line 3089: राहुर्विबुधरूपेण दानवः प्रापिबत्तदा ||४||` | "Rahu [eclipse demon], a Danava in the form of a god, also drank it then. ||4||" |
| `Line 3090: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3091: तस्य कण्ठमनुप्राप्ते दानवस्यामृते तदा |` | "When the amrita had reached the throat of that Danava," |
| `Line 3092: आख्यातं चन्द्रसूर्याभ्यां सुराणां हितकाम्यया ||५||` | "It was reported by the Sun and Moon [celestial bodies], out of desire for the gods' welfare. ||5||" |
| `Line 3093: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3094: ततो भगवता तस्य शिरश्छिन्नमलङ्कृतम् |` | "Then the Lord cut off his adorned head," |
| `Line 3095: चक्रायुधेन चक्रेण पिबतोऽमृतमोजसा ||६||` | "With his discus weapon, as he was forcefully drinking the amrita. ||6||" |
| `Line 3096: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3097: तच्छैलशृङ्गप्रतिमं दानवस्य शिरो महत् |` | "That great head of the Danava, resembling a mountain peak," |
| `Line 3098: चक्रेणोत्कृत्तमपतच्चालयद्वसुधातलम् ||७||` | "Severed by the discus, fell down and shook the surface of the earth. ||7||" |
| `Line 3099: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3100: ततो वैरविनिर्बन्धः कृतो राहुमुखेन वै |` | "Then a perpetual enmity was established by Rahu's head [severed head]," |

| `Line 3100: ततो वैरविनिर्बन्धः कृतो राहुमुखेन वै |` | "Then a perpetual enmity was established by Rahu's head [severed head]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3101: शाश्वतश्चन्द्रसूर्याभ्यां ग्रसत्यद्यापि चैव तौ ||८||` | "Eternal [Rahu], even today, continues to devour both the moon and sun. ||8||" |
| `Line 3102: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3103: विहाय भगवांश्चापि स्त्रीरूपमतुलं हरिः |` | "And the Lord Hari [Vishnu] abandoned his incomparable female form," |
| `Line 3104: नानाप्रहरणैर्भीमैर्दानवान्समकम्पयत् ||९||` | "And made the demons tremble with various terrifying weapons. ||9||" |
| `Line 3105: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3106: ततः प्रवृत्तः सङ्ग्रामः समीपे लवणाम्भसः |` | "Then commenced a battle near the salt waters [ocean]," |
| `Line 3107: सुराणामसुराणां च सर्वघोरतरो महान् ||१०||` | "A great and most terrible conflict between the gods and demons. ||10||" |
| `Line 3108: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3109: प्रासाः सुविपुलास्तीक्ष्णा न्यपतन्त सहस्रशः |` | "Thousands of large, sharp javelins [prasas] fell," |
| `Line 3110: तोमराश्च सुतीक्ष्णाग्राः शस्त्राणि विविधानि च ||११||` | "And lances [tomaras] with very sharp points, and various other weapons. ||11||" |
| `Line 3111: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3112: ततोऽसुराश्चक्रभिन्ना वमन्तो रुधिरं बहु |` | "Then the demons, pierced by the discus [chakra], vomiting much blood," |
| `Line 3113: असिशक्तिगदारुग्णा निपेतुर्धरणीतले ||१२||` | "Broken by swords, spears, and maces, fell upon the earth. ||12||" |
| `Line 3114: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3115: छिन्नानि पट्टिशैश्चापि शिरांसि युधि दारुणे |` | "Heads severed by spears [pattishas] in the terrible battle," |
| `Line 3116: तप्तकाञ्चनजालानि निपेतुरनिशं तदा ||१३||` | "Adorned with heated golden ornaments, fell continuously then. ||13||" |
| `Line 3117: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3118: रुधिरेणावलिप्ताङ्गा निहताश्च महासुराः |` | "And the great demons, their bodies smeared with blood, slain," |
| `Line 3119: अद्रीणामिव कूटानि धातुरक्तानि शेरते ||१४||` | "Lay like mountain peaks reddened with mineral deposits. ||14||" |
| `Line 3120: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3121: हाहाकारः समभवत्तत्र तत्र सहस्रशः |` | "Cries of distress arose here and there by the thousands," |
| `Line 3122: अन्योन्यं छिन्दतां शस्त्रैरादित्ये लोहितायति ||१५||` | "As they cut each other with weapons while the sun [Aditya] turned red. ||15||" |
| `Line 3123: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3124: परिघैश्चायसैः पीतैः संनिकर्षे च मुष्टिभिः |` | "With iron clubs [parighas] gleaming yellow, and in close combat with fists," |
| `Line 3125: निघ्नतां समरेऽन्योन्यं शब्दो दिवमिवास्पृशत् ||१६||` | "The sound of them striking each other in battle seemed to touch the heavens. ||16||" |

| `Line 3126: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3127: छिन्धि भिन्धि प्रधावध्वं पातयाभिसरेति च |` | "Cut, split, charge forward, strike down, attack! - such" |
| `Line 3128: व्यश्रूयन्त महाघोराः शब्दास्तत्र समन्ततः ||१७||` | "Terrifying shouts were heard there from all directions. ||17||" |
| `Line 3129: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3130: एवं सुतुमुले युद्धे वर्तमाने भयावहे |` | "While this tumultuous and frightening battle was raging," |
| `Line 3131: नरनारायणौ देवौ समाजग्मतुराहवम् ||१८||` | "The divine Nara and Narayana [sage-deities] arrived at the battlefield. ||18||" |
| `Line 3132: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3133: तत्र दिव्यं धनुर्दृष्ट्वा नरस्य भगवानपि |` | "There, seeing the divine bow of Nara, the Lord [Vishnu] himself" |
| `Line 3134: चिन्तयामास वै चक्रं विष्णुर्दानवसूदनम् ||१९||` | "Vishnu, the destroyer of demons, thought of his discus [chakra]. ||19||" |
| `Line 3135: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3136: ततोऽम्बराच्चिन्तितमात्रमागतं; महाप्रभं चक्रममित्रतापनम् |` | "Then, merely by thinking of it, from the sky came the brilliant discus, the tormentor of enemies," |
| `Line 3137: विभावसोस्तुल्यमकुण्ठमण्डलं; सुदर्शनं भीममजय्यमुत्तमम् ||२०||` | "Equal to fire in brilliance, with unblunted rim, the Sudarshana [divine discus], fearsome, invincible, supreme. ||20||" |
| `Line 3138: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3139: तदागतं ज्वलितहुताशनप्रभं; भयङ्करं करिकरबाहुरच्युतः |` | "That arrived, blazing like sacrificial fire, terrifying; Achyuta [Vishnu], with arms like elephant trunks," |
| `Line 3140: मुमोच वै चपलमुदग्रवेगव; न्महाप्रभं परनगरावदारणम् ||२१||` | "Released the swift, tremendously forceful, brilliantly shining, destroyer of enemy cities. ||21||" |
| `Line 3141: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3142: तदन्तकज्वलनसमानवर्चसं; पुनः पुनर्न्यपतत वेगवत्तदा |` | "That discus, with splendor equal to the fire of destruction, fell again and again with great speed," |
| `Line 3143: विदारयद्दितिदनुजान्सहस्रशः; करेरितं पुरुषवरेण संयुगे ||२२||` | "Tearing apart thousands of Diti's and Danu's sons [demons], hurled by the hand of the Supreme Person in battle. ||22||" |
| `Line 3144: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3145: दहत्क्वचिज्ज्वलन इवावलेलिह; त्प्रसह्य तानसुरगणान्न्यकृन्तत |` | "Sometimes burning like fire, licking up, forcibly cutting down those hosts of asuras," |
| `Line 3146: प्रवेरितं वियति मुहुः क्षितौ तदा; पपौ रणे रुधिरमथो पिशाचवत् ||२३||` | "Propelled repeatedly through the sky and earth, it then drank blood in battle like a pishacha [flesh-eating demon]. ||23||" |
| `Line 3147: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3148: अथासुरा गिरिभिरदीनचेतसो; मुहुर्मुहुः सुरगणमर्दयंस्तदा |` | "Then the undaunted asuras, with mountains, repeatedly crushed the hosts of gods," |
| `Line 3149: महाबला विगलितमेघवर्चसः; सहस्रशो गगनमभिप्रपद्य ह ||२४||` | "The mighty ones, with splendor like dispersed clouds, thousands of them, ascending to the sky indeed. ||24||" |
| `Line 3150: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3137: विभावसोस्तुल्यमकुण्ठमण्डलं; सुदर्शनं भीममजय्यमुत्तमम् ||२०||` | "Equal to fire in brilliance, with unblunted rim, the Sudarshana [divine discus], fearsome, invincible, supreme. ||20||" |

| `Line 3139: तदागतं ज्वलितहुताशनप्रभं; भयङ्करं करिकरबाहुरच्युतः |` | "That arrived, blazing like sacrificial fire, terrifying; Achyuta [Vishnu], with arms like elephant trunks," |
| `Line 3140: मुमोच वै चपलमुदग्रवेगव; न्महाप्रभं परनगरावदारणम् ||२१||` | "Released the swift, tremendously forceful, brilliantly shining, destroyer of enemy cities. ||21||" |
