| `Line 3142: तदन्तकज्वलनसमानवर्चसं; पुनः पुनर्न्यपतत वेगवत्तदा |` | "That discus, with splendor equal to the fire of destruction, fell again and again with great speed," |
| `Line 3143: विदारयद्दितिदनुजान्सहस्रशः; करेरितं पुरुषवरेण संयुगे ||२२||` | "Tearing apart thousands of Diti's and Danu's sons [demons], hurled by the hand of the Supreme Person in battle. ||22||" |

| `Line 3145: दहत्क्वचिज्ज्वलन इवावलेलिह; त्प्रसह्य तानसुरगणान्न्यकृन्तत |` | "Sometimes burning like fire, licking up, forcibly cutting down those hosts of asuras," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3151: अथाम्बराद्भयजननाः प्रपेदिरे; सपादपा बहुविधमेघरूपिणः |` | "Then from the sky, fear-inducing, many-formed clouds with trees fell down;" |
| `Line 3152: महाद्रयः प्रविगलिताग्रसानवः; परस्परं द्रुतमभिहत्य सस्वनाः ||२५||` | "Great mountains with their peaks and summits crumbling, quickly struck against each other with loud noise. ||25||" |
| `Line 3153: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3154: ततो मही प्रविचलिता सकानना; महाद्रिपाताभिहता समन्ततः |` | "Then the earth with its forests trembled, struck all around by the falling of great mountains;" |
| `Line 3155: परस्परं भृशमभिगर्जतां मुहू; रणाजिरे भृशमभिसम्प्रवर्तिते ||२६||` | "As they repeatedly roared fiercely at each other, while the battlefield intensely raged on. ||26||" |
| `Line 3156: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3157: नरस्ततो वरकनकाग्रभूषणै; र्महेषुभिर्गगनपथं समावृणोत् |` | "Then Nara [Arjuna] covered the path of the sky with great arrows adorned with excellent golden tips;" |
| `Line 3158: विदारयन्गिरिशिखराणि पत्रिभि; र्महाभयेऽसुरगणविग्रहे तदा ||२७||` | "Splitting mountain peaks with feathered arrows, during that great terrifying battle with the hosts of asuras [demons]. ||27||" |
| `Line 3159: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3160: ततो महीं लवणजलं च सागरं; महासुराः प्रविविशुरर्दिताः सुरैः |` | "Then the great asuras [demons], tormented by the gods, entered the earth, the salt waters, and the ocean;" |
| `Line 3161: वियद्गतं ज्वलितहुताशनप्रभं; सुदर्शनं परिकुपितं निशाम्य च ||२८||` | "Having seen the Sudarśana [divine discus] in the sky, blazing with the radiance of fire, greatly enraged. ||28||" |
| `Line 3162: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3163: ततः सुरैर्विजयमवाप्य मन्दरः; स्वमेव देशं गमितः सुपूजितः |` | "Then, after the gods had achieved victory, Mandara [churning mountain], well-honored, was returned to its own place;" |
| `Line 3164: विनाद्य खं दिवमपि चैव सर्वश; स्ततो गताः सलिलधरा यथागतम् ||२९||` | "After resounding through the sky and heaven in all directions, then the clouds returned to where they had come from. ||29||" |
| `Line 3165: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3166: ततोऽमृतं सुनिहितमेव चक्रिरे; सुराः परां मुदमभिगम्य पुष्कलाम् |` | "Then the gods, having attained abundant supreme joy, secured the amṛta [immortality nectar];" |
| `Line 3167: ददौ च तं निधिममृतस्य रक्षितुं; किरीटिने बलभिदथामरैः सह ||३०||` | "And Balabhid [Indra] along with the immortals entrusted that treasure of amṛta to Kirīṭin [Arjuna, crown-wearer] to protect. ||30||" |
| `Line 3168: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3169: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3170: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3171: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3172: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3173: ` | [Blank line] |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3176: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3177: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3178: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3179: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातममृतं मथितं यथा |` | "All this has been told to you about how the amṛta [immortality nectar] was churned," |
| `Line 3180: यत्र सोऽश्वः समुत्पन्नः श्रीमानतुलविक्रमः ||१||` | "During which that magnificent horse of incomparable prowess was produced. ||1||" |
| `Line 3181: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3182: यं निशाम्य तदा कद्रूर्विनतामिदमब्रवीत् |` | "Upon seeing that horse, Kadrū [serpent mother] then said this to Vinatā [bird mother]:" |
| `Line 3183: उच्चैःश्रवा नु किंवर्णो भद्रे जानीहि माचिरम् ||२||` | "What color is Uccaiḥśravas [divine horse]? Good lady, tell me without delay. ||2||" |
| `Line 3184: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3185: विनतोवाच||` | "Vinatā [bird mother] said:" |
| `Line 3186: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3187: श्वेत एवाश्वराजोऽयं किं वा त्वं मन्यसे शुभे |` | "This king of horses is indeed white. What do you think, auspicious one?" |
| `Line 3188: ब्रूहि वर्णं त्वमप्यस्य ततोऽत्र विपणावहे ||३||` | "Tell me what color you think it is, and then let us wager on it. ||3||" |
| `Line 3189: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3190: कद्रूरुवाच||` | "Kadrū [serpent mother] said:" |
| `Line 3191: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3192: कृष्णवालमहं मन्ये हयमेनं शुचिस्मिते |` | "I think this horse has a black tail, O pure-smiling one." |
| `Line 3193: एहि सार्धं मया दीव्य दासीभावाय भामिनि ||४||` | "Come, bet with me for servitude, O beautiful lady. ||4||" |
| `Line 3194: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3195: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3196: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3197: एवं ते समयं कृत्वा दासीभावाय वै मिथः |` | "Having thus made an agreement between themselves for servitude," |
| `Line 3198: जग्मतुः स्वगृहानेव श्वो द्रक्ष्याव इति स्म ह ||५||` | "They both went to their homes, saying, 'We shall see tomorrow.' ||5||" |
| `Line 3199: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3200: ततः पुत्रसहस्रं तु कद्रूर्जिह्मं चिकीर्षती |` | "Then Kadrū [serpent mother], wishing to act deceitfully, commanded her thousand sons," |

| `Line 3196: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3197: एवं ते समयं कृत्वा दासीभावाय वै मिथः |` | "Having thus made an agreement between themselves for servitude," |
| `Line 3198: जग्मतुः स्वगृहानेव श्वो द्रक्ष्याव इति स्म ह ||५||` | "They both went to their homes, saying, 'We shall see tomorrow.' ||5||" |
| `Line 3199: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3200: ततः पुत्रसहस्रं तु कद्रूर्जिह्मं चिकीर्षती |` | "Then Kadrū [serpent mother], wishing to act deceitfully, commanded her thousand sons," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3201: आज्ञापयामास तदा वाला भूत्वाञ्जनप्रभाः ||६||` | "She commanded them then to become dark-colored [like collyrium] serpents. ||6||" |
| `Line 3202: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3203: आविशध्वं हयं क्षिप्रं दासी न स्यामहं यथा |` | "Enter the horse quickly so that I may not become a slave," |
| `Line 3204: तद्वाक्यं नान्वपद्यन्त ताञ्शशाप भुजङ्गमान् ||७||` | "They did not comply with her words, so she cursed those serpents [snake offspring]. ||7||" |
| `Line 3205: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3206: सर्पसत्रे वर्तमाने पावको वः प्रधक्ष्यति |` | "During the serpent sacrifice [sarpasatra], the fire [Pavaka] will consume you," |
| `Line 3207: जनमेजयस्य राजर्षेः पाण्डवेयस्य धीमतः ||८||` | "At the ceremony of the wise royal sage Janamejaya, descendant of the Pandavas. ||8||" |
| `Line 3208: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3209: शापमेनं तु शुश्राव स्वयमेव पितामहः |` | "The Grandfather [Brahma] himself heard this curse," |
| `Line 3210: अतिक्रूरं समुद्दिष्टं कद्र्वा दैवादतीव हि ||९||` | "Extremely cruel, pronounced by Kadru, indeed by fate's design. ||9||" |
| `Line 3211: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3212: सार्धं देवगणैः सर्वैर्वाचं तामन्वमोदत |` | "Together with all the hosts of gods, he approved that pronouncement," |
| `Line 3213: बहुत्वं प्रेक्ष्य सर्पाणां प्रजानां हितकाम्यया ||१०||` | "Considering the multitude of serpents, for the welfare of the people. ||10||" |
| `Line 3214: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3215: तिग्मवीर्यविषा ह्येते दन्दशूका महाबलाः |` | "For these biters [snakes] are of potent venom and great strength," |
| `Line 3216: तेषां तीक्ष्णविषत्वाद्धि प्रजानां च हिताय वै ||११||` | "Due to their deadly poison, and for the welfare of the people indeed, ||11||" |
| `Line 3217: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3218: प्रादाद्विषहणीं विद्यां काश्यपाय महात्मने ||११||` | "He bestowed the knowledge of counteracting poison to the great-souled Kashyapa. ||11||" |
| `Line 3219: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3220: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3221: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3222: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3223: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3226: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3227: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3228: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3229: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3230: ततो रजन्यां व्युष्टायां प्रभात उदिते रवौ |` | "Then, when the night had passed and the sun [Ravi] had risen at dawn," |
| `Line 3231: कद्रूश्च विनता चैव भगिन्यौ ते तपोधन ||१||` | "Kadru and Vinata, those two sisters, O wealth of austerities [addressing the listener], ||1||" |
| `Line 3232: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3233: अमर्षिते सुसंरब्धे दास्ये कृतपणे तदा |` | "Enraged and highly agitated, having wagered servitude," |
| `Line 3234: जग्मतुस्तुरगं द्रष्टुमुच्छैःश्रवसमन्तिकात् ||२||` | "Went to see the horse Uchchaihshravas [celestial steed] from nearby. ||2||" |
| `Line 3235: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3236: ददृशाते तदा तत्र समुद्रं निधिमम्भसाम् |` | "Then they both saw there the ocean, the repository of waters," |
| `Line 3237: तिमिङ्गिलझषाकीर्णं मकरैरावृतं तथा ||३||` | "Filled with timingilas [whale-eaters], fish, and likewise covered with makaras [sea monsters]. ||3||" |
| `Line 3238: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3239: सत्त्वैश्च बहुसाहस्रैर्नानारूपैः समावृतम् |` | "Teeming with many thousands of creatures of various forms," |
| `Line 3240: उग्रैर्नित्यमनाधृष्यं कूर्मग्राहसमाकुलम् ||४||` | "Fierce, ever unapproachable, crowded with turtles and crocodiles. ||4||" |
| `Line 3241: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3242: आकरं सर्वरत्नानामालयं वरुणस्य च |` | "The source of all jewels and the abode of Varuna [ocean deity]," |
| `Line 3243: नागानामालयं रम्यमुत्तमं सरितां पतिम् ||५||` | "The beautiful dwelling of serpents [nagas], the supreme lord of rivers. ||5||" |
| `Line 3244: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3245: पातालज्वलनावासमसुराणां च बन्धनम् |` | "The home of the submarine fire [Vadavagni] and the prison of the demons [asuras]," |
| `Line 3246: भयङ्करं च सत्त्वानां पयसां निधिमर्णवम् ||६||` | "Terrifying to creatures, the ocean, the repository of waters. ||6||" |
| `Line 3247: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3248: शुभं दिव्यममर्त्यानाममृतस्याकरं परम् |` | "Auspicious, divine, belonging to immortals, the supreme source of nectar [amrita]," |
| `Line 3249: अप्रमेयमचिन्त्यं च सुपुण्यजलमद्भुतम् ||७||` | "Immeasurable, inconceivable, with most sacred waters, wondrous. ||7||" |
| `Line 3250: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3251: घोरं जलचरारावरौद्रं भैरवनिस्वनम् |` | "Terrible with the fierce roars of aquatic creatures, with fearsome sounds," |
| `Line 3252: गम्भीरावर्तकलिलं सर्वभूतभयङ्करम् ||८||` | "Filled with deep whirlpools, causing fear to all beings. ||8||" |
| `Line 3253: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3254: वेलादोलानिलचलं क्षोभोद्वेगसमुत्थितम् |` | "Moving with winds that swing the shoreline, arising with agitation and turbulence," |
| `Line 3255: वीचीहस्तैः प्रचलितैर्नृत्यन्तमिव सर्वशः ||९||` | "Seemingly dancing everywhere with the moving hands of waves. ||9||" |
| `Line 3256: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3257: चन्द्रवृद्धिक्षयवशादुद्वृत्तोर्मिदुरासदम् |` | "With swollen waves difficult to approach due to the moon's waxing and waning," |
| `Line 3258: पाञ्चजन्यस्य जननं रत्नाकरमनुत्तमम् ||१०||` | "The birthplace of Pāñcajanya [Vishnu's conch], the unsurpassed treasury of jewels. ||10||" |
| `Line 3259: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3260: गां विन्दता भगवता गोविन्देनामितौजसा |` | "Stirred internally by the Lord Govinda [earth-finder] of immeasurable power," |
| `Line 3261: वराहरूपिणा चान्तर्विक्षोभितजलाविलम् ||११||` | "Who in the form of a boar [Varaha] made its waters turbid. ||11||" |
| `Line 3262: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3263: ब्रह्मर्षिणा च तपता वर्षाणां शतमत्रिणा |` | "And by the Brahmarishi [divine sage] Atri who performed austerities for a hundred years," |
| `Line 3264: अनासादितगाधं च पातालतलमव्ययम् ||१२||` | "With its unfathomable depths and imperishable netherworld floor. ||12||" |
| `Line 3265: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3266: अध्यात्मयोगनिद्रां च पद्मनाभस्य सेवतः |` | "Serving as the bed for the spiritual yoga-sleep of Padmanābha [lotus-naveled Vishnu]," |
| `Line 3267: युगादिकालशयनं विष्णोरमिततेजसः ||१३||` | "The resting place at the beginning of each age for Vishnu of immeasurable splendor. ||13||" |
| `Line 3268: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3269: वडवामुखदीप्ताग्नेस्तोयहव्यप्रदं शुभम् |` | "Auspiciously offering water oblations to the blazing fire of Vaḍavāmukha [submarine fire]," |
| `Line 3270: अगाधपारं विस्तीर्णमप्रमेयं सरित्पतिम् ||१४||` | "The lord of rivers, with unfathomable shores, vast and immeasurable. ||14||" |
| `Line 3271: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3272: महानदीभिर्बह्वीभिः स्पर्धयेव सहस्रशः |` | "As if being approached in rivalry by thousands of great rivers," |
| `Line 3273: अभिसार्यमाणमनिशं ददृशाते महार्णवम् ||१५||` | "They both beheld the great ocean being continuously approached. ||15||" |
| `Line 3274: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3275: गम्भीरं तिमिमकरोग्रसङ्कुलं तं; गर्जन्तं जलचररावरौद्रनादैः |` | "Deep, teeming with fierce whales and sea monsters, roaring with the terrible sounds of aquatic creatures;" |

| `Line 326: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 327: तत्र यद्यद्यथा ज्ञातं मया सञ्जय तच्छृणु |` | "Listen, Sanjaya, to what I have known there, in whatever way I have known it." |
| `Line 328: श्रुत्वा हि मम वाक्यानि बुद्ध्या युक्तानि तत्त्वतः ||१०१||` | "For having heard my words, which are endowed with wisdom and truth. ||101||" |
| `Line 329: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 330: ततो ज्ञास्यसि मां सौते प्रज्ञाचक्षुषमित्युत ||१०१||` | "Then you will know me, O charioteer's son [Sanjaya], as one who sees with the eye of wisdom. ||101||" |
| `Line 331: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 332: यदाश्रौषं धनुरायम्य चित्रं; विद्धं लक्ष्यं पातितं वै पृथिव्याम् |` | "When I heard that, drawing the marvelous bow, the target was pierced and made to fall on the earth," |
| `Line 333: कृष्णां हृतां पश्यतां सर्वराज्ञां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१०२||` | "And Krishnā [Draupadi] was dragged away in the sight of all kings; then, Sanjaya, I did not hope for victory. ||102||" |
| `Line 334: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 335: यदाश्रौषं द्वारकायां सुभद्रां; प्रसह्योढां माधवीमर्जुनेन |` | "When I heard that Subhadrā, the daughter of Mādhava [Krishna's family], was forcibly carried away from Dvārakā by Arjuna," |
| `Line 336: इन्द्रप्रस्थं वृष्णिवीरौ च यातौ; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१०३||` | "And that the two Vrishni heroes [Krishna and Balarama] went to Indraprastha; then, Sanjaya, I did not hope for victory. ||103||" |
| `Line 337: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 338: यदाश्रौषं देवराजं प्रवृष्टं; शरैर्दिव्यैर्वारितं चार्जुनेन |` | "When I heard that the king of gods [Indra] showering (arrows) was repelled by Arjuna with divine arrows," |
| `Line 339: अग्निं तथा तर्पितं खाण्डवे च; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१०४||` | "And that the fire god was satisfied in the Khāṇḍava forest; then, Sanjaya, I did not hope for victory. ||104||" |
| `Line 340: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 341: यदाश्रौषं हृतराज्यं युधिष्ठिरं; पराजितं सौबलेनाक्षवत्याम् |` | "When I heard that Yudhishthira was deprived of his kingdom, defeated by Soubala [Shakuni] in the game of dice," |
| `Line 342: अन्वागतं भ्रातृभिरप्रमेयै; स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१०५||` | "And was followed by his immeasurable brothers; then, Sanjaya, I did not hope for victory. ||105||" |
| `Line 343: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 344: यदाश्रौषं द्रौपदीमश्रुकण्ठीं; सभां नीतां दुःखितामेकवस्त्राम् |` | "When I heard that Draupadi, with tears in her throat, was brought to the assembly hall, distressed, wearing only a single garment," |
| `Line 345: रजस्वलां नाथवतीमनाथव; त्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१०६||` | "In her monthly period, though having protectors, yet treated as if without protection; then, Sanjaya, I did not hope for victory. ||106||" |
| `Line 346: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 347: यदाश्रौषं विविधास्तात चेष्टा; धर्मात्मनां प्रस्थितानां वनाय |` | "When I heard, O dear one, of the various efforts of those righteous souls departing for the forest," |
| `Line 348: ज्येष्ठप्रीत्या क्लिश्यतां पाण्डवानां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१०७||` | "Of the Pāṇḍavas suffering out of devotion to their eldest brother; then, Sanjaya, I did not hope for victory. ||107||" |
| `Line 349: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 350: यदाश्रौषं स्नातकानां सहस्रै; रन्वागतं धर्मराजं वनस्थम् |` | "When I heard that Dharmarāja [Yudhishthira], dwelling in the forest, was followed by thousands of graduate students [Snātakas]," |
translations: | `Line 326: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 327: तत्र यद्यद्यथा ज्ञातं मया सञ्जय तच्छृणु |` | "Listen, Sanjaya, to what I have known there, in whatever way I have known it." |
| `Line 328: श्रुत्वा हि मम वाक्यानि बुद्ध्या युक्तानि तत्त्वतः ||१०१||` | "For having heard my words, which are endowed with wisdom and truth. ||101||" |
| `Line 329: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3276: विस्तीर्णं ददृशतुरम्बरप्रकाशं; तेऽगाधं निधिमुरुमम्भसामनन्तम् ||१६||` | "They both beheld it vast and sky-bright; that boundless, immense repository of endless waters. ||16||" |
| `Line 3277: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3278: इत्येवं झषमकरोर्मिसङ्कुलं तं; गम्भीरं विकसितमम्बरप्रकाशम् |` | "Thus, that ocean teeming with fish, sea monsters and waves; deep and expansive with sky-like radiance," |
| `Line 3279: पातालज्वलनशिखाविदीपितं तं; पश्यन्त्यौ द्रुतमभिपेततुस्तदानीम् ||१७||` | "Illuminated by the flames of the pātāla [netherworld] fire; seeing it, they both swiftly flew toward it then. ||17||" |
| `Line 3280: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3281: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3282: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3283: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3284: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3285: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3286: २०` | "20" |
| `Line 3287: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3288: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3289: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3290: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3291: तं समुद्रमतिक्रम्य कद्रूर्विनतया सह |` | "Having crossed that ocean, Kadrū [serpent mother] along with Vinatā [bird mother]," |
| `Line 3292: न्यपतत्तुरगाभ्याशे नचिरादिव शीघ्रगा ||१||` | "Descended near the horse very quickly, as if in no time at all, swift as they were. ||1||" |
| `Line 3293: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3294: निशाम्य च बहून्वालान्कृष्णान्पुच्छं समाश्रितान् |` | "And seeing many black hairs attached to the tail," |
| `Line 3295: विनतां विषण्णवदनां कद्रूर्दास्ये न्ययोजयत् ||२||` | "Kadrū made the dejected-faced Vinatā enter into servitude. ||2||" |
| `Line 3296: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3297: ततः सा विनता तस्मिन्पणितेन पराजिता |` | "Then Vinatā, defeated in that wager," |
| `Line 3298: अभवद्दुःखसन्तप्ता दासीभावं समास्थिता ||३||` | "Became afflicted with sorrow, having entered the state of servitude. ||3||" |
| `Line 3299: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3300: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे चैव गरुडः काल आगते |` | "And at this time, when the moment arrived, Garuḍa [divine eagle]" |

| `Line 3279: पातालज्वलनशिखाविदीपितं तं; पश्यन्त्यौ द्रुतमभिपेततुस्तदानीम् ||१७||` | "Illuminated by the flames of the pātāla [netherworld] fire; seeing it, they both swiftly flew toward it then. ||17||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3301: विना मात्रा महातेजा विदार्याण्डमजायत ||४||` | "Without his mother, the mighty one [Garuḍa] was born, breaking open the egg. ||4||" |
| `Line 3302: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3303: अग्निराशिरिवोद्भासन्समिद्धोऽतिभयङ्करः |` | "Shining like a mass of fire, blazing and terrifying," |
| `Line 3304: प्रवृद्धः सहसा पक्षी महाकायो नभोगतः ||५||` | "The bird suddenly grew enormous, with a massive body, soaring in the sky. ||5||" |
| `Line 3305: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3306: तं दृष्ट्वा शरणं जग्मुः प्रजाः सर्वा विभावसुम् |` | "Seeing him, all creatures sought refuge with Vibhāvasu [fire deity]," |
| `Line 3307: प्रणिपत्याब्रुवंश्चैनमासीनं विश्वरूपिणम् ||६||` | "And bowing down, they addressed him who was seated in his universal form. ||6||" |
| `Line 3308: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3309: अग्ने मा त्वं प्रवर्धिष्ठाः कच्चिन्नो न दिधक्षसि |` | "O Agni [fire god], do not grow so large! Do you not wish to burn us?" |
| `Line 3310: असौ हि राशिः सुमहान्समिद्धस्तव सर्पति ||७||` | "For that great blazing mass of yours is spreading. ||7||" |
| `Line 3311: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3312: अग्निरुवाच||` | "Agni [fire god] said:" |
| `Line 3313: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3314: नैतदेवं यथा यूयं मन्यध्वमसुरार्दनाः |` | "It is not as you think, O tormentors of asuras [demons]," |
| `Line 3315: गरुडो बलवानेष मम तुल्यः स्वतेजसा ||८||` | "This is the mighty Garuḍa [divine bird], equal to me in his splendor. ||8||" |
| `Line 3316: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3317: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3318: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3319: एवमुक्तास्ततो गत्वा गरुडं वाग्भिरस्तुवन् |` | "Thus addressed, they then went and praised Garuḍa with words," |
| `Line 3320: अदूरादभ्युपेत्यैनं देवाः सर्षिगणास्तदा ||९||` | "Approaching him from nearby, the gods along with the groups of sages. ||9||" |
| `Line 3321: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3322: त्वमृषिस्त्वं महाभागस्त्वं देवः पतगेश्वरः |` | "You are a sage, you are most fortunate, you are a god, the lord of birds," |
| `Line 3323: त्वं प्रभुस्तपनप्रख्यस्त्वं नस्त्राणमनुत्तमम् ||१०||` | "You are the master, radiant like the sun, you are our supreme protector. ||10||" |
| `Line 3324: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3325: बलोर्मिमान्साधुरदीनसत्त्वः; समृद्धिमान्दुष्प्रसहस्त्वमेव |` | "You are full of surging strength, virtuous, of undaunted spirit; prosperous and invincible you alone are," |

| `Line 3318: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3319: एवमुक्तास्ततो गत्वा गरुडं वाग्भिरस्तुवन् |` | "Thus addressed, they then went and praised Garuḍa with words," |
| `Line 3320: अदूरादभ्युपेत्यैनं देवाः सर्षिगणास्तदा ||९||` | "Approaching him from nearby, the gods along with the groups of sages. ||9||" |
| `Line 3321: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3322: त्वमृषिस्त्वं महाभागस्त्वं देवः पतगेश्वरः |` | "You are a sage, you are most fortunate, you are a god, the lord of birds," |
| `Line 3323: त्वं प्रभुस्तपनप्रख्यस्त्वं नस्त्राणमनुत्तमम् ||१०||` | "You are the master, radiant like the sun, you are our supreme protector. ||10||" |
| `Line 3324: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3325: बलोर्मिमान्साधुरदीनसत्त्वः; समृद्धिमान्दुष्प्रसहस्त्वमेव |` | "You are full of surging strength, virtuous, of undaunted spirit; prosperous and invincible you alone are," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3326: तपः श्रुतं सर्वमहीनकीर्ते; अनागतं चोपगतं च सर्वम् ||११||` | "Your austerity, learning, and unfailing fame; all that is yet to come and all that has already come to pass. ||11||" |
| `Line 3327: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3328: त्वमुत्तमः सर्वमिदं चराचरं; गभस्तिभिर्भानुरिवावभाससे |` | "You are supreme, illuminating all this world of moving and unmoving beings with your rays, like the sun [Bhanu]," |
| `Line 3329: समाक्षिपन्भानुमतः प्रभां मुहु; स्त्वमन्तकः सर्वमिदं ध्रुवाध्रुवम् ||१२||` | "Repeatedly eclipsing the radiance of the sun, you are the destroyer [Antaka] of all this, both permanent and impermanent. ||12||" |
| `Line 3330: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3331: दिवाकरः परिकुपितो यथा दहे; त्प्रजास्तथा दहसि हुताशनप्रभ |` | "As the sun [Divakara] when enraged burns the creatures, so do you burn them, O you who shine like fire [Hutashana]," |
| `Line 3332: भयङ्करः प्रलय इवाग्निरुत्थितो; विनाशयन्युगपरिवर्तनान्तकृत् ||१३||` | "Terrifying like the fire risen at dissolution [pralaya], destroying, bringing an end to the cycle of ages. ||13||" |
| `Line 3333: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3334: खगेश्वरं शरणमुपस्थिता वयं; महौजसं वितिमिरमभ्रगोचरम् |` | "We have come seeking refuge in the lord of birds [Khageshvara], of great splendor, dispeller of darkness, moving through the clouds," |
| `Line 3335: महाबलं गरुडमुपेत्य खेचरं; परावरं वरदमजय्यविक्रमम् ||१४||` | "Having approached the mighty Garuda, the sky-traveler, knower of high and low, bestower of boons, of unconquerable prowess. ||14||" |
| `Line 3336: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3337: एवं स्तुतः सुपर्णस्तु देवैः सर्षिगणैस्तदा |` | "Thus praised, Suparna [Garuda] by the gods along with the groups of sages then," |
| `Line 3338: तेजसः प्रतिसंहारमात्मनः स चकार ह ||१५||` | "Withdrew his own radiance indeed. ||15||" |
| `Line 3339: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3340: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3341: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3342: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3343: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3344: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3345: २१` | "21" |
| `Line 3346: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3347: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3348: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3349: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3350: ततः कामगमः पक्षी महावीर्यो महाबलः |` | "Then that bird [Garuda] who could fly at will, of great valor and mighty strength," |
translations: | `Line 3326: तपः श्रुतं सर्वमहीनकीर्ते; अनागतं चोपगतं च सर्वम् ||११||` | "Your austerity, learning, and unfailing fame; all that is yet to come and all that has already come to pass. ||11||" |
| `Line 3327: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3329: समाक्षिपन्भानुमतः प्रभां मुहु; स्त्वमन्तकः सर्वमिदं ध्रुवाध्रुवम् ||१२||` | "Repeatedly eclipsing the radiance of the sun, you are the destroyer [Antaka] of all this, both permanent and impermanent. ||12||" |
| `Line 3330: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3331: दिवाकरः परिकुपितो यथा दहे; त्प्रजास्तथा दहसि हुताशनप्रभ |` | "As the sun [Divakara] when enraged burns the creatures, so do you burn them, O you who shine like fire [Hutashana]," |

| `Line 3332: भयङ्करः प्रलय इवाग्निरुत्थितो; विनाशयन्युगपरिवर्तनान्तकृत् ||१३||` | "Terrifying like the fire risen at dissolution [pralaya], destroying, bringing an end to the cycle of ages. ||13||" |

| `Line 3350: ततः कामगमः पक्षी महावीर्यो महाबलः |` | "Then that bird [Garuda] who could fly at will, of great valor and mighty strength," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3351: मातुरन्तिकमागच्छत्परं तीरं महोदधेः ||१||` | "He came to his mother on the far shore of the great ocean. ||1||" |
| `Line 3352: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3353: यत्र सा विनता तस्मिन्पणितेन पराजिता |` | "Where that Vinatā [bird mother], defeated in that wager," |
| `Line 3354: अतीव दुःखसन्तप्ता दासीभावमुपागता ||२||` | "Extremely afflicted with sorrow, had entered into the state of servitude. ||2||" |
| `Line 3355: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3356: ततः कदाचिद्विनतां प्रवणां पुत्रसंनिधौ |` | "Then once, when Vinatā was humbly present in her son's company," |
| `Line 3357: काल आहूय वचनं कद्रूरिदमभाषत ||३||` | "Kadrū [serpent mother], calling at the right time, spoke these words: ||3||" |
| `Line 3358: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3359: नागानामालयं भद्रे सुरम्यं रमणीयकम् |` | "To the beautiful abode of the nāgas [serpents], delightful and charming," |
| `Line 3360: समुद्रकुक्षावेकान्ते तत्र मां विनते वह ||४||` | "In a secluded place in the ocean's depths, there carry me, O Vinatā. ||4||" |
| `Line 3361: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3362: ततः सुपर्णमाता तामवहत्सर्पमातरम् |` | "Then the mother of Suparṇa [Garuḍa] carried that mother of serpents," |
| `Line 3363: पन्नगान्गरुडश्चापि मातुर्वचनचोदितः ||५||` | "And Garuḍa too carried the serpents, urged by his mother's words. ||5||" |
| `Line 3364: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3365: स सूर्यस्याभितो याति वैनतेयो विहङ्गमः |` | "That Vainateya [son of Vinatā], the bird, traveled close to the sun," |
| `Line 3366: सूर्यरश्मिपरीताश्च मूर्च्छिताः पन्नगाभवन् ||६||` | "And the serpents, surrounded by the sun's rays, became unconscious. ||6||" |
| `Line 3367: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3368: तदवस्थान्सुतान्दृष्ट्वा कद्रूः शक्रमथास्तुवत् ||६||` | "Seeing her sons in that condition, Kadrū then praised Śakra [Indra]. ||6||" |
| `Line 3369: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3370: नमस्ते देवदेवेश नमस्ते बलसूदन |` | "Salutations to you, lord of lords of gods, salutations to you, destroyer of Bala [demon]," |
| `Line 3371: नमुचिघ्न नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्राक्ष शचीपते ||७||` | "Slayer of Namuci [demon], salutations be to you, thousand-eyed one, lord of Śacī [Indra's wife]. ||7||" |
| `Line 3372: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3373: सर्पाणां सूर्यतप्तानां वारिणा त्वं प्लवो भव |` | "For these serpents scorched by the sun, be you a rain-shower with water," |
| `Line 3374: त्वमेव परमं त्राणमस्माकममरोत्तम ||८||` | "You alone are our supreme protection, O best of immortals. ||8||" |
| `Line 3375: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 3351: मातुरन्तिकमागच्छत्परं तीरं महोदधेः ||१||` | "He came to his mother on the far shore of the great ocean. ||1||" |
| `Line 3352: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3353: यत्र सा विनता तस्मिन्पणितेन पराजिता |` | "Where that Vinatā [bird mother], defeated in that wager," |
| `Line 3354: अतीव दुःखसन्तप्ता दासीभावमुपागता ||२||` | "Extremely afflicted with sorrow, had entered into the state of servitude. ||2||" |
| `Line 3355: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3356: ततः कदाचिद्विनतां प्रवणां पुत्रसंनिधौ |` | "Then once, when Vinatā was humbly present in her son's company," |
| `Line 3357: काल आहूय वचनं कद्रूरिदमभाषत ||३||` | "Kadrū [serpent mother], calling at the right time, spoke these words: ||3||" |
| `Line 3358: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3360: समुद्रकुक्षावेकान्ते तत्र मां विनते वह ||४||` | "In a secluded place in the ocean's depths, there carry me, O Vinatā. ||4||" |
| `Line 3361: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3362: ततः सुपर्णमाता तामवहत्सर्पमातरम् |` | "Then the mother of Suparṇa [Garuḍa] carried that mother of serpents," |
| `Line 3363: पन्नगान्गरुडश्चापि मातुर्वचनचोदितः ||५||` | "And Garuḍa too carried the serpents, urged by his mother's words. ||5||" |

| `Line 3365: स सूर्यस्याभितो याति वैनतेयो विहङ्गमः |` | "That Vainateya [son of Vinatā], the bird, traveled close to the sun," |
| `Line 3366: सूर्यरश्मिपरीताश्च मूर्च्छिताः पन्नगाभवन् ||६||` | "And the serpents, surrounded by the sun's rays, became unconscious. ||6||" |
| `Line 3367: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3368: तदवस्थान्सुतान्दृष्ट्वा कद्रूः शक्रमथास्तुवत् ||६||` | "Seeing her sons in that condition, Kadrū then praised Śakra [Indra]. ||6||" |
| `Line 3369: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3370: नमस्ते देवदेवेश नमस्ते बलसूदन |` | "Salutations to you, lord of lords of gods, salutations to you, destroyer of Bala [demon]," |
| `Line 3371: नमुचिघ्न नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्राक्ष शचीपते ||७||` | "Slayer of Namuci [demon], salutations be to you, thousand-eyed one, lord of Śacī [Indra's wife]. ||7||" |
| `Line 3372: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3373: सर्पाणां सूर्यतप्तानां वारिणा त्वं प्लवो भव |` | "For these serpents scorched by the sun, be you a rain-shower with water," |
| `Line 3374: त्वमेव परमं त्राणमस्माकममरोत्तम ||८||` | "You alone are our supreme protection, O best of immortals. ||8||" |
| `Line 3375: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3376: ईशो ह्यसि पयः स्रष्टुं त्वमनल्पं पुरंदर |` | "You are the lord capable of creating abundant waters, O Purandara [city-destroyer, Indra]," |
| `Line 3377: त्वमेव मेघस्त्वं वायुस्त्वमग्निर्वैद्युतोऽम्बरे ||९||` | "You alone are the cloud, you are the wind, you are the lightning fire in the sky. ||9||" |
| `Line 3378: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3379: त्वमभ्रघनविक्षेप्ता त्वामेवाहुः पुनर्घनम् |` | "You are the disperser of dense clouds, and they call you again the cloud itself," |
| `Line 3380: त्वं वज्रमतुलं घोरं घोषवांस्त्वं बलाहकः ||१०||` | "You are the incomparable terrible thunderbolt, you are the thundering rain cloud. ||10||" |
| `Line 3381: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3382: स्रष्टा त्वमेव लोकानां संहर्ता चापराजितः |` | "You alone are the creator of worlds and the unconquered destroyer," |
| `Line 3383: त्वं ज्योतिः सर्वभूतानां त्वमादित्यो विभावसुः ||११||` | "You are the light of all beings, you are Āditya [sun deity], the radiant one. ||11||" |
| `Line 3384: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3385: त्वं महद्भूतमाश्चर्यं त्वं राजा त्वं सुरोत्तमः |` | "You are the great wondrous being, you are the king, you are the foremost among gods," |
| `Line 3386: त्वं विष्णुस्त्वं सहस्राक्षस्त्वं देवस्त्वं परायणम् ||१२||` | "You are Viṣṇu [preserver deity], you are Sahasrākṣa [thousand-eyed one], you are the god, you are the supreme refuge. ||12||" |
| `Line 3387: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3388: त्वं सर्वममृतं देव त्वं सोमः परमार्चितः |` | "You are all immortality, O god, you are Soma [moon deity], the highly worshipped," |
| `Line 3389: त्वं मुहूर्तस्तिथिश्च त्वं लवस्त्वं वै पुनः क्षणः ||१३||` | "You are the muhūrta [time unit], the tithi [lunar day], you are the lava [time fraction], and indeed you are the kṣaṇa [moment]. ||13||" |
| `Line 3390: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3391: शुक्लस्त्वं बहुलश्चैव कला काष्ठा त्रुटिस्तथा |` | "You are the bright fortnight and the dark fortnight, the kalā [time unit], kāṣṭhā [time unit], and truṭi [time unit] as well," |
| `Line 3392: संवत्सरर्तवो मासा रजन्यश्च दिनानि च ||१४||` | "The years, seasons, months, nights, and days too. ||14||" |
| `Line 3393: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3394: त्वमुत्तमा सगिरिवना वसुन्धरा; सभास्करं वितिमिरमम्बरं तथा |` | "You are the excellent earth with its mountains and forests; and likewise the sky with its sun, free from darkness," |
| `Line 3395: महोदधिः सतिमितिमिङ्गिलस्तथा; महोर्मिमान्बहुमकरो झषालयः ||१५||` | "The great ocean with its timitimiṅgila [sea monsters], with mighty waves, many makaras [sea creatures], the abode of fish. ||15||" |
| `Line 3396: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3397: महद्यशस्त्वमिति सदाभिपूज्यसे; मनीषिभिर्मुदितमना महर्षिभिः |` | "You are of great fame, thus you are always worshipped by the wise and joyful-minded great sages," |
| `Line 3398: अभिष्टुतः पिबसि च सोममध्वरे; वषट्कृतान्यपि च हवींषि भूतये ||१६||` | "Being praised, you drink Soma [ritual drink] at the sacrifice, and also the oblations offered with the Vaṣaṭ [ritual exclamation] for prosperity. ||16||" |
| `Line 3399: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3400: त्वं विप्रैः सततमिहेज्यसे फलार्थं; वेदाङ्गेष्वतुलबलौघ गीयसे च |` | "You are constantly worshipped here by the brahmins for rewards; and you, of incomparable strength, are celebrated in the Vedāṅgas [auxiliary texts of Vedas]," |
translations: | `Line 3376: ईशो ह्यसि पयः स्रष्टुं त्वमनल्पं पुरंदर |` | "You are the lord capable of creating abundant waters, O Purandara [city-destroyer, Indra]," |
| `Line 3377: त्वमेव मेघस्त्वं वायुस्त्वमग्निर्वैद्युतोऽम्बरे ||९||` | "You alone are the cloud, you are the wind, you are the lightning fire in the sky. ||9||" |
| `Line 3378: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3379: त्वमभ्रघनविक्षेप्ता त्वामेवाहुः पुनर्घनम् |` | "You are the disperser of dense clouds, and they call you again the cloud itself," |
| `Line 3380: त्वं वज्रमतुलं घोरं घोषवांस्त्वं बलाहकः ||१०||` | "You are the incomparable terrible thunderbolt, you are the thundering rain cloud. ||10||" |
| `Line 3381: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3382: स्रष्टा त्वमेव लोकानां संहर्ता चापराजितः |` | "You alone are the creator of worlds and the unconquered destroyer," |
| `Line 3383: त्वं ज्योतिः सर्वभूतानां त्वमादित्यो विभावसुः ||११||` | "You are the light of all beings, you are Āditya [sun deity], the radiant one. ||11||" |
| `Line 3384: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3385: त्वं महद्भूतमाश्चर्यं त्वं राजा त्वं सुरोत्तमः |` | "You are the great wondrous being, you are the king, you are the foremost among gods," |

| `Line 3386: त्वं विष्णुस्त्वं सहस्राक्षस्त्वं देवस्त्वं परायणम् ||१२||` | "You are Viṣṇu [preserver deity], you are Sahasrākṣa [thousand-eyed one], you are the god, you are the supreme refuge. ||12||" |
| `Line 3387: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3388: त्वं सर्वममृतं देव त्वं सोमः परमार्चितः |` | "You are all immortality, O god, you are Soma [moon deity], the highly worshipped," |

| `Line 3389: त्वं मुहूर्तस्तिथिश्च त्वं लवस्त्वं वै पुनः क्षणः ||१३||` | "You are the muhūrta [time unit], the tithi [lunar day], you are the lava [time fraction], and indeed you are the kṣaṇa [moment]. ||13||" |
| `Line 3390: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3391: शुक्लस्त्वं बहुलश्चैव कला काष्ठा त्रुटिस्तथा |` | "You are the bright fortnight and the dark fortnight, the kalā [time unit], kāṣṭhā [time unit], and truṭi [time unit] as well," |
| `Line 3392: संवत्सरर्तवो मासा रजन्यश्च दिनानि च ||१४||` | "The years, seasons, months, nights, and days too. ||14||" |
| `Line 3393: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3394: त्वमुत्तमा सगिरिवना वसुन्धरा; सभास्करं वितिमिरमम्बरं तथा |` | "You are the excellent earth with its mountains and forests; and likewise the sky with its sun, free from darkness," |

| `Line 3395: महोदधिः सतिमितिमिङ्गिलस्तथा; महोर्मिमान्बहुमकरो झषालयः ||१५||` | "The great ocean with its timitimiṅgila [sea monsters], with mighty waves, many makaras [sea creatures], the abode of fish. ||15||" |
| `Line 3396: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3397: महद्यशस्त्वमिति सदाभिपूज्यसे; मनीषिभिर्मुदितमना महर्षिभिः |` | "You are of great fame, thus you are always worshipped by the wise and joyful-minded great sages," |

| `Line 3398: अभिष्टुतः पिबसि च सोममध्वरे; वषट्कृतान्यपि च हवींषि भूतये ||१६||` | "Being praised, you drink Soma [ritual drink] at the sacrifice, and also the oblations offered with the Vaṣaṭ [ritual exclamation] for prosperity. ||16||" |
| `Line 3399: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3400: त्वं विप्रैः सततमिहेज्यसे फलार्थं; वेदाङ्गेष्वतुलबलौघ गीयसे च |` | "You are constantly worshipped here by the brahmins for rewards; and you, of incomparable strength, are celebrated in the Vedāṅgas [auxiliary texts of Vedas]," |

| `Line 3413: एवं स्तुतस्तदा कद्र्वा भगवान्हरिवाहनः |` | "Thus praised by Kadrū [serpent mother], the divine one who carries Hari [Viṣṇu]," |
| `Line 3414: नीलजीमूतसङ्घातैर्व्योम सर्वं समावृणोत् ||१||` | "Covered the entire sky with masses of dark clouds. ||1||" |
| `Line 3415: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3416: ते मेघा मुमुचुस्तोयं प्रभूतं विद्युदुज्ज्वलाः |` | "Those clouds, brilliant with lightning, released abundant water," |
| `Line 3417: परस्परमिवात्यर्थं गर्जन्तः सततं दिवि ||२||` | "Thundering excessively, as if at one another, continuously in the sky. ||2||" |
| `Line 3418: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3419: सङ्घातितमिवाकाशं जलदैः सुमहाद्भुतैः |` | "The sky seemed compressed by those most wonderful clouds," |
| `Line 3420: सृजद्भिरतुलं तोयमजस्रं सुमहारवैः ||३||` | "Which poured incomparable water incessantly with tremendous sounds. ||3||" |
| `Line 3421: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3422: सम्प्रनृत्तमिवाकाशं धारोर्मिभिरनेकशः |` | "The sky seemed to dance with the numerous waves of raindrops," |
| `Line 3423: मेघस्तनितनिर्घोषमम्बरं समपद्यत ||४||` | "The firmament became filled with the roaring thunder of clouds. ||4||" |
| `Line 3424: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3437: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3438: सुपर्णेनोह्यमानास्ते जग्मुस्तं देशमाशु वै |` | "Carried by Suparṇa [Garuḍa], they quickly reached that place," |
| `Line 3439: सागराम्बुपरिक्षिप्तं पक्षिसङ्घनिनादितम् ||१||` | "Surrounded by ocean waters, resonating with flocks of birds. ||1||" |
| `Line 3440: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3441: विचित्रफलपुष्पाभिर्वनराजिभिरावृतम् |` | "Covered with rows of forests filled with various fruits and flowers," |
| `Line 3442: भवनैरावृतं रम्यैस्तथा पद्माकरैरपि ||२||` | "Surrounded by beautiful dwellings and also lotus ponds. ||2||" |
| `Line 3443: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3444: प्रसन्नसलिलैश्चापि ह्रदैश्चित्रैर्विभूषितम् |` | "Adorned with clear-watered and wonderful lakes," |
| `Line 3445: दिव्यगन्धवहैः पुण्यैर्मारुतैरुपवीजितम् ||३||` | "Fanned by sacred breezes carrying divine fragrances. ||3||" |
| `Line 3446: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3447: उपजिघ्रद्भिराकाशं वृक्षैर्मलयजैरपि |` | "With sandalwood [malayaja] trees that seemed to perfume the sky," |
| `Line 3448: शोभितं पुष्पवर्षाणि मुञ्चद्भिर्मारुतोद्धुतैः ||४||` | "Beautified by trees releasing showers of flowers stirred by the wind. ||4||" |
| `Line 3449: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3451: मनःसंहर्षणं पुण्यं गन्धर्वाप्सरसां प्रियम् ||५||` | "Delighting to the mind, sacred, beloved by Gandharvas [celestial musicians] and Apsaras [heavenly nymphs]. ||5||" |
| `Line 3452: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3453: नानापक्षिरुतं रम्यं कद्रूपुत्रप्रहर्षणम् ||५||` | "Charming with the songs of various birds, bringing joy to the sons of Kadru [serpents]. ||5||" |
| `Line 3454: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3455: तत्ते वनं समासाद्य विजह्रुः पन्नगा मुदा |` | "Having reached that forest, the serpents [pannagas] roamed about with joy," |
| `Line 3456: अब्रुवंश्च महावीर्यं सुपर्णं पतगोत्तमम् ||६||` | "And they spoke to the mighty Suparna [Garuda], the foremost among birds. ||6||" |
| `Line 3457: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3458: वहास्मानपरं द्वीपं सुरम्यं विपुलोदकम् |` | "Carry us to another island, beautiful and with abundant waters," |
| `Line 3459: त्वं हि देशान्बहून्रम्यान्पतन्पश्यसि खेचर ||७||` | "For you, O sky-traveler [Khechara], flying, see many beautiful lands. ||7||" |
| `Line 3460: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3461: स विचिन्त्याब्रवीत्पक्षी मातरं विनतां तदा |` | "After reflecting, the bird then spoke to his mother Vinata," |
| `Line 3462: किं कारणं मया मातः कर्तव्यं सर्पभाषितम् ||८||` | "Why, mother, should I do what the serpents have asked? ||8||" |
| `Line 3463: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3464: विनतोवाच||` | "Vinata said:" |
| `Line 3465: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3466: दासीभूतास्म्यनार्याया भगिन्याः पतगोत्तम |` | "I have become a slave to my ignoble sister, O best of birds [Patagottama]," |
| `Line 3467: पणं वितथमास्थाय सर्पैरुपधिना कृतम् ||९||` | "Having accepted a false wager that was deceitfully arranged by the serpents. ||9||" |
| `Line 3468: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3469: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3470: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3471: तस्मिंस्तु कथिते मात्रा कारणे गगनेचरः |` | "When that reason was explained by his mother, the sky-traveler [Gaganechara]," |
| `Line 3472: उवाच वचनं सर्पांस्तेन दुःखेन दुःखितः ||१०||` | "Spoke these words to the serpents, pained by her sorrow. ||10||" |
| `Line 3473: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3474: किमाहृत्य विदित्वा वा किं वा कृत्वेह पौरुषम् |` | "By bringing what, or knowing what, or by performing what heroic deed here," |
| `Line 3475: दास्याद्वो विप्रमुच्येयं सत्यं शंसत लेलिहाः ||११||` | "Might I free you from slavery? Tell me truly, O tongue-flickering ones [serpents]. ||11||" |

| `Line 3482: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3483: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3484: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3485: २४` | "24" |
| `Line 3486: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3487: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3488: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3489: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3490: इत्युक्तो गरुडः सर्पैस्ततो मातरमब्रवीत् |` | "Thus addressed by the serpents, Garuḍa [divine eagle] then said to his mother," |
| `Line 3491: गच्छाम्यमृतमाहर्तुं भक्ष्यमिच्छामि वेदितुम् ||१||` | "I will go to bring the amṛta [immortality nectar], but I wish to know what food I may eat. ||1||" |
| `Line 3492: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3493: विनतोवाच||` | "Vinatā [Garuḍa's mother] said:" |
| `Line 3494: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3495: समुद्रकुक्षावेकान्ते निषादालयमुत्तमम् |` | "In a secluded place in the ocean's belly is an excellent dwelling of Niṣādas [tribal hunters]," |
| `Line 3496: सहस्राणामनेकानां तान्भुक्त्वामृतमानय ||२||` | "Eat those many thousands (of Niṣādas) and bring the amṛta [immortality nectar]. ||2||" |
| `Line 3497: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3498: न तु ते ब्राह्मणं हन्तुं कार्या बुद्धिः कथञ्चन |` | "But you must never entertain the thought of killing a Brāhmaṇa [priest-scholar]," |
| `Line 3499: अवध्यः सर्वभूतानां ब्राह्मणो ह्यनलोपमः ||३||` | "For a Brāhmaṇa is inviolable to all beings, indeed comparable to fire [agni]. ||3||" |
| `Line 3500: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 3476: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3477: श्रुत्वा तमब्रुवन्सर्पा आहरामृतमोजसा |` | "Hearing him, the serpents said, 'Bring the amṛta [immortality nectar] by your prowess," |
| `Line 3478: ततो दास्याद्विप्रमोक्षो भविता तव खेचर ||१२||` | "Then, upon giving it, there will be release from servitude for you, O sky-traveler [Garuḍa].' ||12||" |
| `Line 3479: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3480: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3481: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3482: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3483: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3484: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3486: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3487: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3488: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3489: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3490: इत्युक्तो गरुडः सर्पैस्ततो मातरमब्रवीत् |` | "Thus addressed by the serpents, Garuḍa [divine eagle] then said to his mother," |
| `Line 3491: गच्छाम्यमृतमाहर्तुं भक्ष्यमिच्छामि वेदितुम् ||१||` | "I will go to bring the amṛta [immortality nectar], but I wish to know what food I may eat. ||1||" |
| `Line 3492: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3493: विनतोवाच||` | "Vinatā [Garuḍa's mother] said:" |
| `Line 3494: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3495: समुद्रकुक्षावेकान्ते निषादालयमुत्तमम् |` | "In a secluded place in the ocean's belly is an excellent dwelling of Niṣādas [tribal hunters]," |
| `Line 3496: सहस्राणामनेकानां तान्भुक्त्वामृतमानय ||२||` | "Eat those many thousands (of Niṣādas) and bring the amṛta [immortality nectar]. ||2||" |
| `Line 3497: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3498: न तु ते ब्राह्मणं हन्तुं कार्या बुद्धिः कथञ्चन |` | "But you must never entertain the thought of killing a Brāhmaṇa [priest-scholar]," |
| `Line 3499: अवध्यः सर्वभूतानां ब्राह्मणो ह्यनलोपमः ||३||` | "For a Brāhmaṇa is inviolable to all beings, indeed comparable to fire [agni]. ||3||" |
| `Line 3500: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3501: अग्निरर्को विषं शस्त्रं विप्रो भवति कोपितः |` | "Fire, the sun, poison, weapons—a brāhmaṇa [twice-born priest] becomes these when angered." |
| `Line 3502: भूतानामग्रभुग्विप्रो वर्णश्रेष्ठः पिता गुरुः ||४||` | "The brāhmaṇa eats before all beings, is foremost among castes, and is like a father and teacher. ||4||" |
| `Line 3503: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3504: गरुड उवाच||` | "Garuḍa [divine eagle] said:" |
| `Line 3505: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3506: यथाहमभिजानीयां ब्राह्मणं लक्षणैः शुभैः |` | "How might I recognize a brāhmaṇa by his auspicious characteristics?" |
| `Line 3507: तन्मे कारणतो मातः पृच्छतो वक्तुमर्हसि ||५||` | "O Mother, you should tell me the reasons when I ask. ||5||" |
| `Line 3508: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3509: विनतोवाच||` | "Vinatā [Garuḍa's mother] said:" |
| `Line 3510: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3511: यस्ते कण्ठमनुप्राप्तो निगीर्णं बडिशं यथा |` | "He who, having reached your throat, would be like a swallowed hook," |
| `Line 3512: दहेदङ्गारवत्पुत्र तं विद्याद्बाह्मणर्षभम् ||६||` | "Burning like a coal, my son—know him to be a foremost brāhmaṇa. ||6||" |
| `Line 3513: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3514: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3515: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3516: प्रोवाच चैनं विनता पुत्रहार्दादिदं वचः |` | "Vinatā spoke these words to him out of affection for her son," |
| `Line 3517: जानन्त्यप्यतुलं वीर्यमाशीर्वादसमन्वितम् ||७||` | "Though knowing his matchless strength, she accompanied it with a blessing. ||7||" |
| `Line 3518: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3519: पक्षौ ते मारुतः पातु चन्द्रः पृष्ठं तु पुत्रक |` | "May the wind protect your wings, and the moon your back, my son," |
| `Line 3520: शिरस्तु पातु ते वह्निर्भास्करः सर्वमेव तु ||८||` | "May fire protect your head, and the sun protect your entire being. ||8||" |
| `Line 3521: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3522: अहं च ते सदा पुत्र शान्तिस्वस्तिपरायणा |` | "And I, my son, always devoted to your peace and well-being," |
| `Line 3523: अरिष्टं व्रज पन्थानं वत्स कार्यार्थसिद्धये ||९||` | "Go on a safe path, my child, for the accomplishment of your task. ||9||" |
| `Line 3524: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3525: ततः स मातुर्वचनं निशम्य; वितत्य पक्षौ नभ उत्पपात |` | "Then, having heard his mother's words, he spread his wings and flew up into the sky." |
translations: | `Line 3501: अग्निरर्को विषं शस्त्रं विप्रो भवति कोपितः |` | "Fire, the sun, poison, weapons—a brāhmaṇa [twice-born priest] becomes these when angered." |
| `Line 3502: भूतानामग्रभुग्विप्रो वर्णश्रेष्ठः पिता गुरुः ||४||` | "The brāhmaṇa eats before all beings, is foremost among castes, and is like a father and teacher. ||4||" |
| `Line 3503: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3504: गरुड उवाच||` | "Garuḍa [divine eagle] said:" |
| `Line 3505: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3506: यथाहमभिजानीयां ब्राह्मणं लक्षणैः शुभैः |` | "How might I recognize a brāhmaṇa by his auspicious characteristics?" |
| `Line 3507: तन्मे कारणतो मातः पृच्छतो वक्तुमर्हसि ||५||` | "O Mother, you should tell me the reasons when I ask. ||5||" |
| `Line 3508: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3509: विनतोवाच||` | "Vinatā [Garuḍa's mother] said:" |
| `Line 3510: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3511: यस्ते कण्ठमनुप्राप्तो निगीर्णं बडिशं यथा |` | "He who, having reached your throat, would be like a swallowed hook," |
| `Line 3512: दहेदङ्गारवत्पुत्र तं विद्याद्बाह्मणर्षभम् ||६||` | "Burning like a coal, my son—know him to be a foremost brāhmaṇa. ||6||" |
| `Line 3513: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3514: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3515: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3516: प्रोवाच चैनं विनता पुत्रहार्दादिदं वचः |` | "Vinatā spoke these words to him out of affection for her son," |
| `Line 3517: जानन्त्यप्यतुलं वीर्यमाशीर्वादसमन्वितम् ||७||` | "Though knowing his matchless strength, she accompanied it with a blessing. ||7||" |
| `Line 3518: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3519: पक्षौ ते मारुतः पातु चन्द्रः पृष्ठं तु पुत्रक |` | "May the wind protect your wings, and the moon your back, my son," |
| `Line 3520: शिरस्तु पातु ते वह्निर्भास्करः सर्वमेव तु ||८||` | "May fire protect your head, and the sun protect your entire being. ||8||" |
| `Line 3521: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3522: अहं च ते सदा पुत्र शान्तिस्वस्तिपरायणा |` | "And I, my son, always devoted to your peace and well-being," |
| `Line 3523: अरिष्टं व्रज पन्थानं वत्स कार्यार्थसिद्धये ||९||` | "Go on a safe path, my child, for the accomplishment of your task. ||9||" |
| `Line 3524: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3525: ततः स मातुर्वचनं निशम्य; वितत्य पक्षौ नभ उत्पपात |` | "Then, having heard his mother's words, he spread his wings and flew up into the sky." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 351: भिक्षाभुजां ब्राह्मणानां महात्मनां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१०८||` | "Of the alms-eating Brahmins, the great souls; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||108||" |
| `Line 352: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 353: यदाश्रौषमर्जुनो देवदेवं; किरातरूपं त्र्यम्बकं तोष्य युद्धे |` | "When I heard that Arjuna had pleased the God of gods, Tryambaka [three-eyed Shiva] in the form of a Kirata [hunter], in battle," |
| `Line 354: अवाप तत्पाशुपतं महास्त्रं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१०९||` | "And obtained that mighty Pashupata [Shiva's weapon] weapon; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||109||" |
| `Line 355: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 356: यदाश्रौषं त्रिदिवस्थं धनञ्जयं; शक्रात्साक्षाद्दिव्यमस्त्रं यथावत् |` | "When I heard that Dhananjaya [Arjuna] was in heaven [Tridiva], properly learning divine weapons directly from Shakra [Indra]," |
| `Line 357: अधीयानं शंसितं सत्यसन्धं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११०||` | "He who is praised, truthful and steadfast in his vows; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||110||" |
| `Line 358: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 359: यदाश्रौषं वैश्रवणेन सार्धं; समागतं भीममन्यांश्च पार्थान् |` | "When I heard that Bhima and the other Parthas [Pandavas] had met with Vaishravana [Kubera]," |
| `Line 360: तस्मिन्देशे मानुषाणामगम्ये; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१११||` | "In that region inaccessible to humans; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||111||" |
| `Line 361: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 362: यदाश्रौषं घोषयात्रागतानां; बन्धं गन्धर्वैर्मोक्षणं चार्जुनेन |` | "When I heard of the capture of those who had gone on the Ghoshayatra [cattle expedition], by the Gandharvas, and their release by Arjuna," |
| `Line 363: स्वेषां सुतानां कर्णबुद्धौ रतानां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११२||` | "Of my sons who relied on Karna's wisdom; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||112||" |
| `Line 364: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 365: यदाश्रौषं यक्षरूपेण धर्मं; समागतं धर्मराजेन सूत |` | "When I heard that Dharma [Yama] in the form of a Yaksha [supernatural being] had met with Dharmaraja [Yudhishthira], O charioteer," |
| `Line 366: प्रश्नानुक्तान्विब्रुवन्तं च सम्य; क्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११३||` | "And that he correctly answered all the questions asked; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||113||" |
| `Line 367: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 368: यदाश्रौषं मामकानां वरिष्ठा; न्धनञ्जयेनैकरथेन भग्नान् |` | "When I heard that the best of my warriors were defeated by Dhananjaya [Arjuna] alone in his chariot," |
| `Line 369: विराटराष्ट्रे वसता महात्मना; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११४||` | "By that great soul residing in the kingdom of Virata; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||114||" |
| `Line 370: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 371: यदाश्रौषं सत्कृतां मत्स्यराज्ञा; सुतां दत्तामुत्तरामर्जुनाय |` | "When I heard that the honored daughter of the Matsya king, Uttara, was given to Arjuna," |
| `Line 372: तां चार्जुनः प्रत्यगृह्णात्सुतार्थे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११५||` | "And that Arjuna accepted her for his son's sake; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||115||" |
| `Line 373: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 374: यदाश्रौषं निर्जितस्याधनस्य; प्रव्राजितस्य स्वजनात्प्रच्युतस्य |` | "When I heard that Yudhishthira, who was defeated, made penniless, exiled, and separated from his kinsmen," |
| `Line 375: अक्षौहिणीः सप्त युधिष्ठिरस्य; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११६||` | "Had seven akshauhinis [large army divisions] at his command; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||116||" |
translations: | `Line 351: भिक्षाभुजां ब्राह्मणानां महात्मनां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१०८||` | "Of the alms-eating Brahmins, the great souls; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||108||" |
| `Line 352: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 354: अवाप तत्पाशुपतं महास्त्रं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१०९||` | "And obtained that mighty Pashupata [Shiva's weapon] weapon; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||109||" |

| `Line 372: तां चार्जुनः प्रत्यगृह्णात्सुतार्थे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११५||` | "And that Arjuna accepted her for his son's sake; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||115||" |
| `Line 373: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 374: यदाश्रौषं निर्जितस्याधनस्य; प्रव्राजितस्य स्वजनात्प्रच्युतस्य |` | "When I heard that Yudhishthira, who was defeated, made penniless, exiled, and separated from his kinsmen," |
| `Line 375: अक्षौहिणीः सप्त युधिष्ठिरस्य; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११६||` | "Had seven akshauhinis [large army divisions] at his command; then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||116||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3526: ततो निषादान्बलवानुपागम; द्बुभुक्षितः काल इवान्तको महान् ||१०||` | "Then the mighty one approached the Niṣādas [tribal hunters], hungry like the great Antaka [death god] at the time of dissolution. ||10||" |
| `Line 3527: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3528: स तान्निषादानुपसंहरंस्तदा; रजः समुद्धूय नभःस्पृशं महत् |` | "He then gathered those Niṣādas, raising a great dust cloud touching the sky," |
| `Line 3529: समुद्रकुक्षौ च विशोषयन्पयः; समीपगान्भूमिधरान्विचालयन् ||११||` | "Drying up the waters in the ocean's belly and shaking the nearby mountains. ||11||" |
| `Line 3530: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3531: ततः स चक्रे महदाननं तदा; निषादमार्गं प्रतिरुध्य पक्षिराट् |` | "Then the king of birds [Garuḍa] made a great opening of his mouth, blocking the path of the Niṣādas," |
| `Line 3532: ततो निषादास्त्वरिताः प्रवव्रजु; र्यतो मुखं तस्य भुजङ्गभोजिनः ||१२||` | "Then the Niṣādas hurriedly rushed toward the mouth of that serpent-eater. ||12||" |
| `Line 3533: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3534: तदाननं विवृतमतिप्रमाणव; त्समभ्ययुर्गगनमिवार्दिताः खगाः |` | "They entered that wide-open mouth of immense proportion, like distressed birds entering the sky," |
| `Line 3535: सहस्रशः पवनरजोभ्रमोहिता; महानिलप्रचलितपादपे वने ||१३||` | "By thousands, confused by the wind-blown dust, in a forest where trees were shaken by the great wind. ||13||" |
| `Line 3536: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3537: ततः खगो वदनममित्रतापनः; समाहरत्परिचपलो महाबलः |` | "Then the bird [Garuḍa], tormentor of enemies, very swift and mighty, closed his mouth," |
| `Line 3538: निषूदयन्बहुविधमत्स्यभक्षिणो; बुभुक्षितो गगनचरेश्वरस्तदा ||१४||` | "Destroying those various fish-eaters, as the hungry lord of sky-travelers [Garuḍa] then did. ||14||" |
| `Line 3539: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3540: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3541: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3542: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3543: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3544: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3545: २५` | "25 [chapter number]" |
| `Line 3546: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3547: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3548: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3549: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3550: तस्य कण्ठमनुप्राप्तो ब्राह्मणः सह भार्यया |` | "A Brāhmaṇa [priest] with his wife reached his throat," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3551: दहन्दीप्त इवाङ्गारस्तमुवाचान्तरिक्षगः ||१||` | "Burning brightly like a coal, the sky-traveler [Garuḍa] said to him: ||1||" |
| `Line 3552: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3553: द्विजोत्तम विनिर्गच्छ तूर्णमास्यादपावृतात् |` | "O best of twice-born [Brahmin], quickly exit from this opened mouth." |
| `Line 3554: न हि मे ब्राह्मणो वध्यः पापेष्वपि रतः सदा ||२||` | "For a Brahmin is not to be killed by me, even if he is always engaged in sins. ||2||" |
| `Line 3555: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3556: ब्रुवाणमेवं गरुडं ब्राह्मणः समभाषत |` | "To Garuḍa speaking thus, the Brahmin replied:" |
| `Line 3557: निषादी मम भार्येयं निर्गच्छतु मया सह ||३||` | "This Niṣādī [tribal woman] is my wife; let her come out with me. ||3||" |
| `Line 3558: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3559: गरुड उवाच||` | "Garuḍa said:" |
| `Line 3560: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3561: एतामपि निषादीं त्वं परिगृह्याशु निष्पत |` | "Taking this Niṣādī woman also, quickly come out." |
| `Line 3562: तूर्णं सम्भावयात्मानमजीर्णं मम तेजसा ||४||` | "Quickly save yourself undigested from my fiery energy. ||4||" |
| `Line 3563: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3564: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3565: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3566: ततः स विप्रो निष्क्रान्तो निषादीसहितस्तदा |` | "Then that Brahmin came out together with the Niṣādī woman." |
| `Line 3567: वर्धयित्वा च गरुडमिष्टं देशं जगाम ह ||५||` | "And after blessing Garuḍa, he went to his desired place. ||5||" |
| `Line 3568: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3569: सहभार्ये विनिष्क्रान्ते तस्मिन्विप्रे स पक्षिराट् |` | "When that Brahmin had exited with his wife, the king of birds [Garuḍa]" |
| `Line 3570: वितत्य पक्षावाकाशमुत्पपात मनोजवः ||६||` | "Spread his wings to the sky and flew up with the speed of mind. ||6||" |
| `Line 3571: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3572: ततोऽपश्यत्स पितरं पृष्टश्चाख्यातवान्पितुः |` | "Then he saw his father and, being asked, told his father:" |
| `Line 3573: अहं हि सर्पैः प्रहितः सोममाहर्तुमुद्यतः ||७||` | "I have been sent by the serpents and am prepared to bring the Soma [divine elixir]. ||7||" |
| `Line 3574: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3575: मातुर्दास्यविमोक्षार्थमाहरिष्ये तमद्य वै ||७||` | "To free my mother from servitude, I shall bring it today indeed. ||7||" |
translations: | `Line 3551: दहन्दीप्त इवाङ्गारस्तमुवाचान्तरिक्षगः ||१||` | "Burning brightly like a coal, the sky-traveler [Garuḍa] said to him: ||1||" |
| `Line 3552: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3553: द्विजोत्तम विनिर्गच्छ तूर्णमास्यादपावृतात् |` | "O best of twice-born [Brahmin], quickly exit from this opened mouth." |
| `Line 3554: न हि मे ब्राह्मणो वध्यः पापेष्वपि रतः सदा ||२||` | "For a Brahmin is not to be killed by me, even if he is always engaged in sins. ||2||" |
| `Line 3555: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3556: ब्रुवाणमेवं गरुडं ब्राह्मणः समभाषत |` | "To Garuḍa speaking thus, the Brahmin replied:" |
| `Line 3557: निषादी मम भार्येयं निर्गच्छतु मया सह ||३||` | "This Niṣādī [tribal woman] is my wife; let her come out with me. ||3||" |
| `Line 3558: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3559: गरुड उवाच||` | "Garuḍa said:" |
| `Line 3560: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3561: एतामपि निषादीं त्वं परिगृह्याशु निष्पत |` | "Taking this Niṣādī woman also, quickly come out." |
| `Line 3562: तूर्णं सम्भावयात्मानमजीर्णं मम तेजसा ||४||` | "Quickly save yourself undigested from my fiery energy. ||4||" |

| `Line 3564: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3565: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3566: ततः स विप्रो निष्क्रान्तो निषादीसहितस्तदा |` | "Then that Brahmin came out together with the Niṣādī woman." |

| `Line 3570: वितत्य पक्षावाकाशमुत्पपात मनोजवः ||६||` | "Spread his wings to the sky and flew up with the speed of mind. ||6||" |
| `Line 3571: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3572: ततोऽपश्यत्स पितरं पृष्टश्चाख्यातवान्पितुः |` | "Then he saw his father and, being asked, told his father:" |
| `Line 3573: अहं हि सर्पैः प्रहितः सोममाहर्तुमुद्यतः ||७||` | "I have been sent by the serpents and am prepared to bring the Soma [divine elixir]. ||7||" |
| `Line 3574: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3575: मातुर्दास्यविमोक्षार्थमाहरिष्ये तमद्य वै ||७||` | "To free my mother from servitude, I shall bring it today indeed. ||7||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3576: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3577: मात्रा चास्मि समादिष्टो निषादान्भक्षयेति वै |` | "And I was instructed by my mother to devour the Nishadas [tribal people]," |
| `Line 3578: न च मे तृप्तिरभवद्भक्षयित्वा सहस्रशः ||८||` | "But I did not feel satisfied even after devouring thousands of them. ||8||" |
| `Line 3579: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3580: तस्माद्भोक्तव्यमपरं भगवन्प्रदिशस्व मे |` | "Therefore, O Lord [Bhagavan], direct me to something else I should eat," |
| `Line 3581: यद्भुक्त्वामृतमाहर्तुं समर्थः स्यामहं प्रभो ||९||` | "By eating which I might become capable of bringing back the amrita [nectar of immortality], O Master. ||9||" |
| `Line 3582: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3583: कश्यप उवाच||` | "Kashyapa said:" |
| `Line 3584: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3585: आसीद्विभावसुर्नाम महर्षिः कोपनो भृशम् |` | "There was a great sage [maharshi] named Vibhavasu, extremely prone to anger," |
| `Line 3586: भ्राता तस्यानुजश्चासीत्सुप्रतीको महातपाः ||१०||` | "And he had a younger brother named Supratika, of great austerity [mahatapas]. ||10||" |
| `Line 3587: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3588: स नेच्छति धनं भ्रात्रा सहैकस्थं महामुनिः |` | "That great sage [mahamuni] did not wish to keep his wealth together with his brother," |
| `Line 3589: विभागं कीर्तयत्येव सुप्रतीकोऽथ नित्यशः ||११||` | "And Supratika constantly spoke about division (of property). ||11||" |
| `Line 3590: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3591: अथाब्रवीच्च तं भ्राता सुप्रतीकं विभावसुः |` | "Then his brother Vibhavasu said to Supratika," |
| `Line 3592: विभागं बहवो मोहात्कर्तुमिच्छन्ति नित्यदा ||१२||` | "Many, out of delusion, always desire to make divisions. ||12||" |
| `Line 3593: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3594: ततो विभक्ता अन्योन्यं नाद्रियन्तेऽर्थमोहिताः ||१२||` | "Then, once divided, they disregard each other, deluded by wealth. ||12||" |
| `Line 3595: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3596: ततः स्वार्थपरान्मूढान्पृथग्भूतान्स्वकैर्धनैः |` | "Then, those who are selfish fools, separated with their own wealth," |
| `Line 3597: विदित्वा भेदयन्त्येतानमित्रा मित्ररूपिणः ||१३||` | "Are divided by enemies disguised as friends who recognize their vulnerability. ||13||" |
| `Line 3598: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3599: विदित्वा चापरे भिन्नानन्तरेषु पतन्त्यथ |` | "And others, knowing them to be divided, attack them in their weakness," |
| `Line 3600: भिन्नानामतुलो नाशः क्षिप्रमेव प्रवर्तते ||१४||` | "For those who are divided, unparalleled destruction quickly follows. ||14||" |
translations: | `Line 3576: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3578: न च मे तृप्तिरभवद्भक्षयित्वा सहस्रशः ||८||` | "But I did not feel satisfied even after devouring thousands of them. ||8||" |
| `Line 3579: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3581: यद्भुक्त्वामृतमाहर्तुं समर्थः स्यामहं प्रभो ||९||` | "By eating which I might become capable of bringing back the amrita [nectar of immortality], O Master. ||9||" |

| `Line 3598: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3599: विदित्वा चापरे भिन्नानन्तरेषु पतन्त्यथ |` | "And others, knowing them to be divided, attack them in their weakness," |
| `Line 3600: भिन्नानामतुलो नाशः क्षिप्रमेव प्रवर्तते ||१४||` | "For those who are divided, unparalleled destruction quickly follows. ||14||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3601: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3602: तस्माच्चैव विभागार्थं न प्रशंसन्ति पण्डिताः |` | "Therefore, for the sake of division (of wealth), the learned ones [paṇḍitas] do not praise" |
| `Line 3603: गुरुशास्त्रे निबद्धानामन्योन्यमभिशङ्किनाम् ||१५||` | "those who, though bound by the teacher's precepts [guru-śāstra], are suspicious of one another. ||15||" |
| `Line 3604: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3605: नियन्तुं न हि शक्यस्त्वं भेदतो धनमिच्छसि |` | "You cannot be restrained and desire wealth through division," |
| `Line 3606: यस्मात्तस्मात्सुप्रतीक हस्तित्वं समवाप्स्यसि ||१६||` | "Therefore, O Supratīka, you shall attain the state of an elephant. ||16||" |
| `Line 3607: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3608: शप्तस्त्वेवं सुप्रतीको विभावसुमथाब्रवीत् |` | "Being thus cursed, Supratīka then said to Vibhāvasu [fire-like one]," |
| `Line 3609: त्वमप्यन्तर्जलचरः कच्छपः सम्भविष्यसि ||१७||` | "You too shall become a turtle [kacchapa] dwelling in water. ||17||" |
| `Line 3610: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3611: एवमन्योन्यशापात्तौ सुप्रतीकविभावसू |` | "Thus, due to mutual curses, Supratīka and Vibhāvasu," |
| `Line 3612: गजकच्छपतां प्राप्तावर्थार्थं मूढचेतसौ ||१८||` | "Became an elephant and a turtle, their minds deluded by desire for wealth. ||18||" |
| `Line 3613: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3614: रोषदोषानुषङ्गेण तिर्यग्योनिगतावपि |` | "Due to the attachment to the fault of anger, even though born in animal wombs," |
| `Line 3615: परस्परद्वेषरतौ प्रमाणबलदर्पितौ ||१९||` | "They remained engaged in mutual hatred, proud of their immense strength. ||19||" |
| `Line 3616: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3617: सरस्यस्मिन्महाकायौ पूर्ववैरानुसारिणौ |` | "In this lake, these two massive creatures, following their previous enmity," |
| `Line 3618: तयोरेकतरः श्रीमान्समुपैति महागजः ||२०||` | "One of them, the magnificent great elephant, approaches. ||20||" |
| `Line 3619: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3620: तस्य बृंहितशब्देन कूर्मोऽप्यन्तर्जलेशयः |` | "By the trumpeting sound of that (elephant), the turtle [kūrma] dwelling in the water," |
| `Line 3621: उत्थितोऽसौ महाकायः कृत्स्नं सङ्क्षोभयन्सरः ||२१||` | "That huge-bodied one rose up, agitating the entire lake. ||21||" |
| `Line 3622: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3623: तं दृष्ट्वावेष्टितकरः पतत्येष गजो जलम् |` | "Seeing him, this elephant with its trunk coiled plunges into the water," |
| `Line 3624: दन्तहस्ताग्रलाङ्गूलपादवेगेन वीर्यवान् ||२२||` | "The powerful one, with the force of its tusks, trunk, tail, and feet. ||22||" |
| `Line 3625: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3626: तं विक्षोभयमाणं तु सरो बहुझषाकुलम् |` | "As he was agitating that lake teeming with many fish," |
| `Line 3627: कूर्मोऽप्यभ्युद्यतशिरा युद्धायाभ्येति वीर्यवान् ||२३||` | "The powerful turtle also approached for battle with its head raised. ||23||" |
| `Line 3628: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3629: षडुच्छ्रितो योजनानि गजस्तद्द्विगुणायतः |` | "The elephant was six yojanas [ancient measure] in height and twice that in length," |
| `Line 3630: कूर्मस्त्रियोजनोत्सेधो दशयोजनमण्डलः ||२४||` | "The turtle was three yojanas in height with a shell ten yojanas in circumference. ||24||" |
| `Line 3631: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3632: तावेतौ युद्धसंमत्तौ परस्परजयैषिणौ |` | "These two, mad for battle and each desiring victory over the other," |
| `Line 3633: उपयुज्याशु कर्मेदं साधयेप्सितमात्मनः ||२५||` | "Use them quickly and accomplish your desired task. ||25||" |
| `Line 3634: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3635: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3636: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3637: स तच्छ्रुत्वा पितुर्वाक्यं भीमवेगोऽन्तरिक्षगः |` | "Having heard his father's words, the terribly swift sky-traveler," |
| `Line 3638: नखेन गजमेकेन कूर्ममेकेन चाक्षिपत् ||२६||` | "Seized the elephant with one talon and the turtle with another. ||26||" |
| `Line 3639: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3640: समुत्पपात चाकाशं तत उच्चैर्विहङ्गमः |` | "Then the bird soared high into the sky," |
| `Line 3641: सोऽलम्बतीर्थमासाद्य देववृक्षानुपागमत् ||२७||` | "And reaching Alambatīrtha [sacred place], he approached the divine trees. ||27||" |
| `Line 3642: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3643: ते भीताः समकम्पन्त तस्य पक्षानिलाहताः |` | "Those trees trembled in fear, struck by the wind from his wings," |
| `Line 3644: न नो भञ्ज्यादिति तदा दिव्याः कनकशाखिनः ||२८||` | "The divine golden-branched trees thought, 'May he not break us.' ||28||" |
| `Line 3645: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3646: प्रचलाङ्गान्स तान्दृष्ट्वा मनोरथफलाङ्कुरान् |` | "Seeing them trembling, with fruits that fulfill all desires," |
| `Line 3647: अन्यानतुलरूपाङ्गानुपचक्राम खेचरः ||२९||` | "The sky-traveler approached other trees of incomparable form. ||29||" |
| `Line 3648: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3649: काञ्चनै राजतैश्चैव फलैर्वैडूर्यशाखिनः |` | "Trees with golden and silver fruits, with branches of lapis lazuli," |
| `Line 3650: सागराम्बुपरिक्षिप्तान्भ्राजमानान्महाद्रुमान् ||३०||` | "Great trees surrounded by ocean waters, shining brilliantly. ||30||" |

| `Line 3651: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3652: तमुवाच खगश्रेष्ठं तत्र रोहिणपादपः |` | "There, the Rohiṇa tree [red-wood tree] spoke to that foremost of birds [Garuḍa]," |
| `Line 3653: अतिप्रवृद्धः सुमहानापतन्तं मनोजवम् ||३१||` | "The exceedingly tall and massive tree, to him who was descending with the speed of mind. ||31||" |
| `Line 3654: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3655: यैषा मम महाशाखा शतयोजनमायता |` | "This great branch of mine, extending a hundred yojanas [distance measure]," |
| `Line 3656: एतामास्थाय शाखां त्वं खादेमौ गजकच्छपौ ||३२||` | "Perch upon this branch and eat these two, the elephant and the tortoise. ||32||" |
| `Line 3657: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3658: ततो द्रुमं पतगसहस्रसेवितं; महीधरप्रतिमवपुः प्रकम्पयन् |` | "Then, shaking that tree frequented by thousands of birds, with a body resembling a mountain," |
| `Line 3659: खगोत्तमो द्रुतमभिपत्य वेगवा; न्बभञ्ज तामविरलपत्रसंवृताम् ||३३||` | "The foremost of birds [Garuḍa], swiftly swooping down with great speed, broke that branch thickly covered with leaves. ||33||" |
| `Line 3660: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 3671: स्पृष्टमात्रा तु पद्भ्यां सा गरुडेन बलीयसा |` | "Merely touched by the feet of the mighty Garuḍa," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3676: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3677: स तद्विनाशसन्त्रासादनुपत्य खगाधिपः |` | "The lord of birds [Garuḍa], fearing their destruction, flew after them," |
| `Line 3678: शाखामास्येन जग्राह तेषामेवान्ववेक्षया ||३||` | "And caught a branch in his mouth, keeping them in his sight. ||3||" |
| `Line 3679: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3680: शनैः पर्यपतत्पक्षी पर्वतान्प्रविशातयन् ||३||` | "The bird flew slowly, splitting mountains as he passed. ||3||" |
| `Line 3681: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3682: एवं सोऽभ्यपतद्देशान्बहून्सगजकच्छपः |` | "Thus he flew over many lands, carrying the elephant and tortoise," |
| `Line 3683: दयार्थं वालखिल्यानां न च स्थानमविन्दत ||४||` | "Out of compassion for the Vālakhilyas [thumb-sized sages], but could not find a place. ||4||" |
| `Line 3684: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3685: स गत्वा पर्वतश्रेष्ठं गन्धमादनमव्ययम् |` | "Going to the foremost mountain, the imperishable Gandhamādana [fragrant mountain]," |
| `Line 3686: ददर्श कश्यपं तत्र पितरं तपसि स्थितम् ||५||` | "He saw Kaśyapa there, his father, established in austerity. ||5||" |
| `Line 3687: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3688: ददर्श तं पिता चापि दिव्यरूपं विहङ्गमम् |` | "And his father also saw him, the divine-formed bird," |
| `Line 3689: तेजोवीर्यबलोपेतं मनोमारुतरंहसम् ||६||` | "Endowed with splendor, vigor and strength, swift as mind and wind. ||6||" |
| `Line 3690: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3691: शैलशृङ्गप्रतीकाशं ब्रह्मदण्डमिवोद्यतम् |` | "Resembling a mountain peak, like the upraised staff of Brahma [creator god]," |
| `Line 3692: अचिन्त्यमनभिज्ञेयं सर्वभूतभयङ्करम् ||७||` | "Inconceivable, unknowable, terrifying to all beings. ||7||" |
| `Line 3693: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3694: मायावीर्यधरं साक्षादग्निमिद्धमिवोद्यतम् |` | "Possessing magical power, like a blazing fire risen up," |
| `Line 3695: अप्रधृष्यमजेयं च देवदानवराक्षसैः ||८||` | "Unapproachable and unconquerable by gods, demons and rākṣasas [man-eaters]. ||8||" |
| `Line 3696: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3697: भेत्तारं गिरिशृङ्गाणां नदीजलविशोषणम् |` | "Splitter of mountain peaks, dryer of river waters," |
| `Line 3698: लोकसंलोडनं घोरं कृतान्तसमदर्शनम् ||९||` | "Terrible churner of worlds, appearing like Death [Kṛtānta] himself. ||9||" |
| `Line 3699: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3700: तमागतमभिप्रेक्ष्य भगवान्कश्यपस्तदा |` | "Seeing him arrived thus, the venerable Kaśyapa then" |
translations: | `Line 3676: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3677: स तद्विनाशसन्त्रासादनुपत्य खगाधिपः |` | "The lord of birds [Garuḍa], fearing their destruction, flew after them," |
| `Line 3678: शाखामास्येन जग्राह तेषामेवान्ववेक्षया ||३||` | "And caught a branch in his mouth, keeping them in his sight. ||3||" |
| `Line 3679: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3680: शनैः पर्यपतत्पक्षी पर्वतान्प्रविशातयन् ||३||` | "The bird flew slowly, splitting mountains as he passed. ||3||" |
| `Line 3681: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3682: एवं सोऽभ्यपतद्देशान्बहून्सगजकच्छपः |` | "Thus he flew over many lands, carrying the elephant and tortoise," |
| `Line 3683: दयार्थं वालखिल्यानां न च स्थानमविन्दत ||४||` | "Out of compassion for the Vālakhilyas [thumb-sized sages], but could not find a place. ||4||" |
| `Line 3684: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3685: स गत्वा पर्वतश्रेष्ठं गन्धमादनमव्ययम् |` | "Going to the foremost mountain, the imperishable Gandhamādana [fragrant mountain]," |
| `Line 3686: ददर्श कश्यपं तत्र पितरं तपसि स्थितम् ||५||` | "He saw Kaśyapa there, his father, established in austerity. ||5||" |
| `Line 3687: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3688: ददर्श तं पिता चापि दिव्यरूपं विहङ्गमम् |` | "And his father also saw him, the divine-formed bird," |
| `Line 3689: तेजोवीर्यबलोपेतं मनोमारुतरंहसम् ||६||` | "Endowed with splendor, vigor and strength, swift as mind and wind. ||6||" |
| `Line 3690: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3691: शैलशृङ्गप्रतीकाशं ब्रह्मदण्डमिवोद्यतम् |` | "Resembling a mountain peak, like the upraised staff of Brahma [creator god]," |
| `Line 3692: अचिन्त्यमनभिज्ञेयं सर्वभूतभयङ्करम् ||७||` | "Inconceivable, unknowable, terrifying to all beings. ||7||" |
| `Line 3693: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3694: मायावीर्यधरं साक्षादग्निमिद्धमिवोद्यतम् |` | "Possessing magical power, like a blazing fire risen up," |
| `Line 3695: अप्रधृष्यमजेयं च देवदानवराक्षसैः ||८||` | "Unapproachable and unconquerable by gods, demons and rākṣasas [man-eaters]. ||8||" |

| `Line 3697: भेत्तारं गिरिशृङ्गाणां नदीजलविशोषणम् |` | "Splitter of mountain peaks, dryer of river waters," |
| `Line 3698: लोकसंलोडनं घोरं कृतान्तसमदर्शनम् ||९||` | "Terrible churner of worlds, appearing like Death [Kṛtānta] himself. ||9||" |
