| `Line 3700: तमागतमभिप्रेक्ष्य भगवान्कश्यपस्तदा |` | "Seeing him arrived thus, the venerable Kaśyapa then" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3701: विदित्वा चास्य सङ्कल्पमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ||१०||` | "Knowing his resolve, (Kashyapa) spoke these words. ||10||" |
| `Line 3702: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3703: पुत्र मा साहसं कार्षीर्मा सद्यो लप्स्यसे व्यथाम् |` | "Son, do not act rashly, lest you immediately experience pain," |
| `Line 3704: मा त्वा दहेयुः सङ्क्रुद्धा वालखिल्या मरीचिपाः ||११||` | "Let not the angry Valakhilyas [thumb-sized sages], the descendants of Marichi, burn you. ||11||" |
| `Line 3705: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3706: प्रसादयामास स तान्कश्यपः पुत्रकारणात् |` | "Kashyapa then appeased them for the sake of his son," |
| `Line 3707: वालखिल्यांस्तपःसिद्धानिदमुद्दिश्य कारणम् ||१२||` | "Those Valakhilyas perfected through austerities [tapas-siddhas], explaining this reason: ||12||" |
| `Line 3708: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3709: प्रजाहितार्थमारम्भो गरुडस्य तपोधनाः |` | "O wealthy in austerities [tapodhanās], Garuda's undertaking is for the welfare of beings," |
| `Line 3710: चिकीर्षति महत्कर्म तदनुज्ञातुमर्हथ ||१३||` | "He wishes to perform a great deed, please grant him permission. ||13||" |
| `Line 3711: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3712: एवमुक्ता भगवता मुनयस्ते समभ्ययुः |` | "Thus addressed by the venerable one [Bhagavata], those sages departed," |
| `Line 3713: मुक्त्वा शाखां गिरिं पुण्यं हिमवन्तं तपोर्थिनः ||१४||` | "Leaving the branch, they went to the sacred mountain Himavat [Himalayas], seeking austerities. ||14||" |
| `Line 3714: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3715: ततस्तेष्वपयातेषु पितरं विनतात्मजः |` | "Then, after they had departed, the son of Vinata [Garuda]," |
| `Line 3716: शाखाव्याक्षिप्तवदनः पर्यपृच्छत कश्यपम् ||१५||` | "With his mouth still holding the branch, asked Kashyapa: ||15||" |
| `Line 3717: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3718: भगवन्क्व विमुञ्चामि तरुशाखामिमामहम् |` | "Lord, where should I release this tree branch?" |
| `Line 3719: वर्जितं ब्राह्मणैर्देशमाख्यातु भगवान्मम ||१६||` | "Let the venerable one tell me of a place uninhabited by Brahmanas [priests]. ||16||" |
| `Line 3720: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3721: ततो निष्पुरुषं शैलं हिमसंरुद्धकन्दरम् |` | "Then Kashyapa told him of a mountain uninhabited by humans, with snow-blocked caverns," |
| `Line 3722: अगम्यं मनसाप्यन्यैस्तस्याचख्यौ स कश्यपः ||१७||` | "Inaccessible even in thought to others, which Kashyapa described to him. ||17||" |
| `Line 3723: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3724: तं पर्वतमहाकुक्षिमाविश्य मनसा खगः |` | "The bird [Garuda] mentally envisioned that great mountain hollow," |
| `Line 3725: जवेनाभ्यपतत्तार्क्ष्यः सशाखागजकच्छपः ||१८||` | "And Tarkshya [Garuda] swiftly flew there with the branch, elephant, and tortoise. ||18||" |
translations: | `Line 3701: विदित्वा चास्य सङ्कल्पमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ||१०||` | "Knowing his resolve, (Kashyapa) spoke these words. ||10||" |
| `Line 3702: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3703: पुत्र मा साहसं कार्षीर्मा सद्यो लप्स्यसे व्यथाम् |` | "Son, do not act rashly, lest you immediately experience pain," |
| `Line 3704: मा त्वा दहेयुः सङ्क्रुद्धा वालखिल्या मरीचिपाः ||११||` | "Let not the angry Valakhilyas [thumb-sized sages], the descendants of Marichi, burn you. ||11||" |
| `Line 3705: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3706: प्रसादयामास स तान्कश्यपः पुत्रकारणात् |` | "Kashyapa then appeased them for the sake of his son," |
| `Line 3707: वालखिल्यांस्तपःसिद्धानिदमुद्दिश्य कारणम् ||१२||` | "Those Valakhilyas perfected through austerities [tapas-siddhas], explaining this reason: ||12||" |
| `Line 3708: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3709: प्रजाहितार्थमारम्भो गरुडस्य तपोधनाः |` | "O wealthy in austerities [tapodhanās], Garuda's undertaking is for the welfare of beings," |
| `Line 3710: चिकीर्षति महत्कर्म तदनुज्ञातुमर्हथ ||१३||` | "He wishes to perform a great deed, please grant him permission. ||13||" |
| `Line 3711: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3712: एवमुक्ता भगवता मुनयस्ते समभ्ययुः |` | "Thus addressed by the venerable one [Bhagavata], those sages departed," |
| `Line 3713: मुक्त्वा शाखां गिरिं पुण्यं हिमवन्तं तपोर्थिनः ||१४||` | "Leaving the branch, they went to the sacred mountain Himavat [Himalayas], seeking austerities. ||14||" |
| `Line 3714: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3715: ततस्तेष्वपयातेषु पितरं विनतात्मजः |` | "Then, after they had departed, the son of Vinata [Garuda]," |
| `Line 3716: शाखाव्याक्षिप्तवदनः पर्यपृच्छत कश्यपम् ||१५||` | "With his mouth still holding the branch, asked Kashyapa: ||15||" |
| `Line 3717: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3718: भगवन्क्व विमुञ्चामि तरुशाखामिमामहम् |` | "Lord, where should I release this tree branch?" |
| `Line 3719: वर्जितं ब्राह्मणैर्देशमाख्यातु भगवान्मम ||१६||` | "Let the venerable one tell me of a place uninhabited by Brahmanas [priests]. ||16||" |
| `Line 3720: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3721: ततो निष्पुरुषं शैलं हिमसंरुद्धकन्दरम् |` | "Then Kashyapa told him of a mountain uninhabited by humans, with snow-blocked caverns," |
| `Line 3722: अगम्यं मनसाप्यन्यैस्तस्याचख्यौ स कश्यपः ||१७||` | "Inaccessible even in thought to others, which Kashyapa described to him. ||17||" |
| `Line 3723: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3724: तं पर्वतमहाकुक्षिमाविश्य मनसा खगः |` | "The bird [Garuda] mentally envisioned that great mountain hollow," |
| `Line 3725: जवेनाभ्यपतत्तार्क्ष्यः सशाखागजकच्छपः ||१८||` | "And Tarkshya [Garuda] swiftly flew there with the branch, elephant, and tortoise. ||18||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3726: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3727: न तां वध्रः परिणहेच्छतचर्मा महानणुः |` | "Neither a strap, nor a large or small being with a hundred hides could encircle" |
| `Line 3728: शाखिनो महतीं शाखां यां प्रगृह्य ययौ खगः ||१९||` | "that great branch of the tree which the bird [khaga] grasped and carried away. ||19||" |
| `Line 3729: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3730: ततः स शतसाहस्रं योजनान्तरमागतः |` | "Then he, having traveled a distance of one hundred thousand yojanas [distance measure]," |
| `Line 3731: कालेन नातिमहता गरुडः पततां वरः ||२०||` | "in not too great a time, Garuḍa, the best among flying creatures. ||20||" |
| `Line 3732: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3733: स तं गत्वा क्षणेनैव पर्वतं वचनात्पितुः |` | "Having reached that mountain in an instant, as per his father's instruction," |
| `Line 3734: अमुञ्चन्महतीं शाखां सस्वनां तत्र खेचरः ||२१||` | "The sky-traveler [khechara] released that great branch there with a loud sound. ||21||" |
| `Line 3735: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3736: पक्षानिलहतश्चास्य प्राकम्पत स शैलराट् |` | "Struck by the wind from his wings, that king of mountains [shaila-rāṭ] trembled," |
| `Line 3737: मुमोच पुष्पवर्षं च समागलितपादपः ||२२||` | "And with trees shaken, it released a shower of flowers. ||22||" |
| `Line 3738: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3739: शृङ्गाणि च व्यशीर्यन्त गिरेस्तस्य समन्ततः |` | "And the peaks of that mountain crumbled all around," |
| `Line 3740: मणिकाञ्चनचित्राणि शोभयन्ति महागिरिम् ||२३||` | "Adorned with jewels and gold, they beautified the great mountain. ||23||" |
| `Line 3741: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3742: शाखिनो बहवश्चापि शाखयाभिहतास्तया |` | "And many trees struck by that branch," |
| `Line 3743: काञ्चनैः कुसुमैर्भान्ति विद्युत्वन्त इवाम्बुदाः ||२४||` | "Shone with golden flowers like lightning-filled clouds. ||24||" |
| `Line 3744: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3745: ते हेमविकचा भूयो युक्ताः पर्वतधातुभिः |` | "Those trees with golden blossoms, further mixed with mountain minerals," |
| `Line 3746: व्यराजञ्शाखिनस्तत्र सूर्यांशुप्रतिरञ्जिताः ||२५||` | "Shone there, illuminated by the rays of the sun. ||25||" |
| `Line 3747: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3748: ततस्तस्य गिरेः शृङ्गमास्थाय स खगोत्तमः |` | "Then, perching on a peak of that mountain, that best of birds [khagottama]," |
| `Line 3749: भक्षयामास गरुडस्तावुभौ गजकच्छपौ ||२६||` | "Garuḍa devoured both the elephant and the turtle. ||26||" |
| `Line 3750: ` | [Blank line] |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3751: ततः पर्वतकूटाग्रादुत्पपात मनोजवः |` | "Then, swift as thought, he flew up from the mountain peak," |
| `Line 3752: प्रावर्तन्ताथ देवानामुत्पाता भयवेदिनः ||२७||` | "And then portents foreboding danger began to appear among the gods. ||27||" |
| `Line 3753: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3754: इन्द्रस्य वज्रं दयितं प्रजज्वाल व्यथान्वितम् |` | "Indra's [king of gods] beloved vajra [thunderbolt] blazed forth in agitation," |
| `Line 3755: सधूमा चापतत्सार्चिर्दिवोल्का नभसश्च्युता ||२८||` | "And a meteor fell from the sky with smoke and flames. ||28||" |
| `Line 3756: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3757: तथा वसूनां रुद्राणामादित्यानां च सर्वशः |` | "Likewise, among all the Vasus [wealth deities], Rudras [storm deities], and Ādityas [solar deities]," |
| `Line 3758: साध्यानां मरुतां चैव ये चान्ये देवतागणाः ||२९||` | "The Sādhyas [celestial beings], Maruts [wind gods], and all other groups of deities, ||29||" |
| `Line 3759: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3760: स्वं स्वं प्रहरणं तेषां परस्परमुपाद्रवत् ||२९||` | "Their respective weapons rushed against one another. ||29||" |
| `Line 3761: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3762: अभूतपूर्वं सङ्ग्रामे तदा देवासुरेऽपि च |` | "Unprecedented even in the battles between gods and demons," |
| `Line 3763: ववुर्वाताः सनिर्घाताः पेतुरुल्काः समन्ततः ||३०||` | "Winds blew with thunderclaps, and meteors fell from all directions. ||30||" |
| `Line 3764: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3765: निरभ्रमपि चाकाशं प्रजगर्ज महास्वनम् |` | "Though cloudless, the sky thundered with a mighty sound," |
| `Line 3766: देवानामपि यो देवः सोऽप्यवर्षदसृक्तदा ||३१||` | "And even the god of gods [Indra] rained blood at that time. ||31||" |
| `Line 3767: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3768: मम्लुर्माल्यानि देवानां शेमुस्तेजांसि चैव हि |` | "The garlands of the gods withered and their splendors dimmed," |
| `Line 3769: उत्पातमेघा रौद्राश्च ववर्षुः शोणितं बहु ||३२||` | "And ominous, terrible clouds rained much blood. ||32||" |
| `Line 3770: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3771: रजांसि मुकुटान्येषामुत्थितानि व्यधर्षयन् ||३२||` | "Rising dust defiled their crowns. ||32||" |
| `Line 3772: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3773: ततस्त्राससमुद्विग्नः सह देवैः शतक्रतुः |` | "Then Śatakratu [Indra, performer of hundred sacrifices], alarmed and agitated along with the gods," |
| `Line 3774: उत्पातान्दारुणान्पश्यन्नित्युवाच बृहस्पतिम् ||३३||` | "Seeing these terrible portents, spoke thus to Bṛhaspati [preceptor of gods]. ||33||" |
| `Line 3775: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 3751: ततः पर्वतकूटाग्रादुत्पपात मनोजवः |` | "Then, swift as thought, he flew up from the mountain peak," |

| `Line 3758: साध्यानां मरुतां चैव ये चान्ये देवतागणाः ||२९||` | "The Sādhyas [celestial beings], Maruts [wind gods], and all other groups of deities, ||29||" |

| `Line 3761: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3762: अभूतपूर्वं सङ्ग्रामे तदा देवासुरेऽपि च |` | "Unprecedented even in the battles between gods and demons," |
| `Line 3763: ववुर्वाताः सनिर्घाताः पेतुरुल्काः समन्ततः ||३०||` | "Winds blew with thunderclaps, and meteors fell from all directions. ||30||" |

| `Line 3765: निरभ्रमपि चाकाशं प्रजगर्ज महास्वनम् |` | "Though cloudless, the sky thundered with a mighty sound," |
| `Line 3766: देवानामपि यो देवः सोऽप्यवर्षदसृक्तदा ||३१||` | "And even the god of gods [Indra] rained blood at that time. ||31||" |
| `Line 3767: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3768: मम्लुर्माल्यानि देवानां शेमुस्तेजांसि चैव हि |` | "The garlands of the gods withered and their splendors dimmed," |
| `Line 3769: उत्पातमेघा रौद्राश्च ववर्षुः शोणितं बहु ||३२||` | "And ominous, terrible clouds rained much blood. ||32||" |

| `Line 3771: रजांसि मुकुटान्येषामुत्थितानि व्यधर्षयन् ||३२||` | "Rising dust defiled their crowns. ||32||" |

| `Line 3773: ततस्त्राससमुद्विग्नः सह देवैः शतक्रतुः |` | "Then Śatakratu [Indra, performer of hundred sacrifices], alarmed and agitated along with the gods," |
| `Line 3774: उत्पातान्दारुणान्पश्यन्नित्युवाच बृहस्पतिम् ||३३||` | "Seeing these terrible portents, spoke thus to Bṛhaspati [preceptor of gods]. ||33||" |

| `Line 376: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 377: यदाश्रौषं नरनारायणौ तौ; कृष्णार्जुनौ वदतो नारदस्य |` | "When I heard from Narada's words that those two, Nara-Narayana [ancient sages], were Krishna and Arjuna," |
| `Line 378: अहं द्रष्टा ब्रह्मलोके सदेति; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११७||` | "That I would always see them in Brahmaloka [celestial realm], then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||117||" |
| `Line 379: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 380: यदाश्रौषं माधवं वासुदेवं; सर्वात्मना पाण्डवार्थे निविष्टम् |` | "When I heard that Madhava [Krishna], Vasudeva, was wholly devoted to the Pandavas' cause," |
| `Line 381: यस्येमां गां विक्रममेकमाहु; स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११८||` | "He whose single stride is said to cover this earth, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||118||" |
| `Line 382: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 383: यदाश्रौषं कर्णदुर्योधनाभ्यां; बुद्धिं कृतां निग्रहे केशवस्य |` | "When I heard that Karna and Duryodhana had formed a plan to capture Keshava [Krishna]," |
| `Line 384: तं चात्मानं बहुधा दर्शयानं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११९||` | "And that he revealed himself in multiple forms, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||119||" |
| `Line 385: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 386: यदाश्रौषं वासुदेवे प्रयाते; रथस्यैकामग्रतस्तिष्ठमानाम् |` | "When I heard that as Vasudeva [Krishna] departed, Pritha [Kunti] stood alone before his chariot," |
| `Line 387: आर्तां पृथां सान्त्वितां केशवेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२०||` | "Distressed Pritha was consoled by Keshava, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||120||" |
| `Line 388: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 389: यदाश्रौषं मन्त्रिणं वासुदेवं; तथा भीष्मं शान्तनवं च तेषाम् |` | "When I heard that Vasudeva was their counselor, and that Bhishma, son of Shantanu, was with them," |
| `Line 390: भारद्वाजं चाशिषोऽनुब्रुवाणं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२१||` | "And that Bharadvaja [Drona] pronounced blessings upon them, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||121||" |
| `Line 391: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 392: यदाश्रौषं कर्ण उवाच भीष्मं; नाहं योत्स्ये युध्यमाने त्वयीति |` | "When I heard that Karna said to Bhishma, 'I will not fight while you are fighting,'" |
| `Line 393: हित्वा सेनामपचक्राम चैव; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२२||` | "And that he left the army and departed, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||122||" |
| `Line 394: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 395: यदाश्रौषं वासुदेवार्जुनौ तौ; तथा धनुर्गाण्डिवमप्रमेयम् |` | "When I heard that those two, Vasudeva and Arjuna, along with the immeasurable Gandiva bow [divine weapon]," |
| `Line 396: त्रीण्युग्रवीर्याणि समागतानि; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२३||` | "These three of terrible prowess had come together, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||123||" |
| `Line 397: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 398: यदाश्रौषं कश्मलेनाभिपन्ने; रथोपस्थे सीदमानेऽर्जुने वै |` | "When I heard that Arjuna, overcome with dejection, was sinking down in his chariot," |
| `Line 399: कृष्णं लोकान्दर्शयानं शरीरे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२४||` | "And Krishna revealed all the worlds within his body, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||124||" |
| `Line 400: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 376: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 377: यदाश्रौषं नरनारायणौ तौ; कृष्णार्जुनौ वदतो नारदस्य |` | "When I heard from Narada's words that those two, Nara-Narayana [ancient sages], were Krishna and Arjuna," |
| `Line 378: अहं द्रष्टा ब्रह्मलोके सदेति; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११७||` | "That I would always see them in Brahmaloka [celestial realm], then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||117||" |
| `Line 379: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 381: यस्येमां गां विक्रममेकमाहु; स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११८||` | "He whose single stride is said to cover this earth, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||118||" |
| `Line 382: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 383: यदाश्रौषं कर्णदुर्योधनाभ्यां; बुद्धिं कृतां निग्रहे केशवस्य |` | "When I heard that Karna and Duryodhana had formed a plan to capture Keshava [Krishna]," |
| `Line 384: तं चात्मानं बहुधा दर्शयानं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||११९||` | "And that he revealed himself in multiple forms, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||119||" |
| `Line 385: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 386: यदाश्रौषं वासुदेवे प्रयाते; रथस्यैकामग्रतस्तिष्ठमानाम् |` | "When I heard that as Vasudeva [Krishna] departed, Pritha [Kunti] stood alone before his chariot," |
| `Line 387: आर्तां पृथां सान्त्वितां केशवेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२०||` | "Distressed Pritha was consoled by Keshava, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||120||" |
| `Line 388: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 389: यदाश्रौषं मन्त्रिणं वासुदेवं; तथा भीष्मं शान्तनवं च तेषाम् |` | "When I heard that Vasudeva was their counselor, and that Bhishma, son of Shantanu, was with them," |
| `Line 390: भारद्वाजं चाशिषोऽनुब्रुवाणं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२१||` | "And that Bharadvaja [Drona] pronounced blessings upon them, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||121||" |
| `Line 391: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 392: यदाश्रौषं कर्ण उवाच भीष्मं; नाहं योत्स्ये युध्यमाने त्वयीति |` | "When I heard that Karna said to Bhishma, 'I will not fight while you are fighting,'" |
| `Line 393: हित्वा सेनामपचक्राम चैव; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२२||` | "And that he left the army and departed, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||122||" |
| `Line 394: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 395: यदाश्रौषं वासुदेवार्जुनौ तौ; तथा धनुर्गाण्डिवमप्रमेयम् |` | "When I heard that those two, Vasudeva and Arjuna, along with the immeasurable Gandiva bow [divine weapon]," |
| `Line 396: त्रीण्युग्रवीर्याणि समागतानि; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२३||` | "These three of terrible prowess had come together, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||123||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3776: किमर्थं भगवन्घोरा महोत्पाताः समुत्थिताः |` | "For what reason, O Lord, have these terrible portents [bad omens] arisen?" |
| `Line 3777: न च शत्रुं प्रपश्यामि युधि यो नः प्रधर्षयेत् ||३४||` | "I do not see any enemy who could challenge us in battle. ||34||" |
| `Line 3778: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3779: बृहस्पतिरुवाच||` | "Bṛhaspati [preceptor of gods] said:" |
| `Line 3780: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3781: तवापराधाद्देवेन्द्र प्रमादाच्च शतक्रतो |` | "Due to your offense, O Indra [king of gods], and due to your negligence, O Śatakratu [hundred-sacrificer]," |
| `Line 3782: तपसा वालखिल्यानां भूतमुत्पन्नमद्भुतम् ||३५||` | "By the austerities of the Vālakhilyas [thumb-sized sages], a wonderful being has been born. ||35||" |
| `Line 3783: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3784: कश्यपस्य मुनेः पुत्रो विनतायाश्च खेचरः |` | "A son of sage Kaśyapa and Vinatā, a sky-traveler [bird]," |
| `Line 3785: हर्तुं सोममनुप्राप्तो बलवान्कामरूपवान् ||३६||` | "Has arrived to steal the Soma [divine nectar], powerful and able to assume any form at will. ||36||" |
| `Line 3786: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3787: समर्थो बलिनां श्रेष्ठो हर्तुं सोमं विहङ्गमः |` | "This bird, foremost among the strong, is capable of stealing the Soma," |
| `Line 3788: सर्वं सम्भावयाम्यस्मिन्नसाध्यमपि साधयेत् ||३७||` | "I believe he can accomplish anything, even what is impossible. ||37||" |
| `Line 3789: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3790: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3791: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3792: श्रुत्वैतद्वचनं शक्रः प्रोवाचामृतरक्षिणः |` | "Hearing these words, Śakra [Indra] spoke to the guardians of the amṛta [immortality nectar]:" |
| `Line 3793: महावीर्यबलः पक्षी हर्तुं सोममिहोद्यतः ||३८||` | "A bird of great power and strength has set out to steal the Soma here. ||38||" |
| `Line 3794: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3795: युष्मान्सम्बोधयाम्येष यथा स न हरेद्बलात् |` | "I alert you all so that he may not take it away by force." |
| `Line 3796: अतुलं हि बलं तस्य बृहस्पतिरुवाच मे ||३९||` | "For Bṛhaspati has told me his strength is unmatched. ||39||" |
| `Line 3797: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3798: तच्छ्रुत्वा विबुधा वाक्यं विस्मिता यत्नमास्थिताः |` | "Hearing those words, the gods [wise ones], astonished, made efforts," |
| `Line 3799: परिवार्यामृतं तस्थुर्वज्री चेन्द्रः शतक्रतुः ||४०||` | "And surrounded the amṛta, along with the wielder of the thunderbolt, Indra, the performer of a hundred sacrifices. ||40||" |
| `Line 3800: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 3776: किमर्थं भगवन्घोरा महोत्पाताः समुत्थिताः |` | "For what reason, O Lord, have these terrible portents [bad omens] arisen?" |
| `Line 3777: न च शत्रुं प्रपश्यामि युधि यो नः प्रधर्षयेत् ||३४||` | "I do not see any enemy who could challenge us in battle. ||34||" |
| `Line 3778: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3779: बृहस्पतिरुवाच||` | "Bṛhaspati [preceptor of gods] said:" |
| `Line 3780: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3781: तवापराधाद्देवेन्द्र प्रमादाच्च शतक्रतो |` | "Due to your offense, O Indra [king of gods], and due to your negligence, O Śatakratu [hundred-sacrificer]," |
| `Line 3782: तपसा वालखिल्यानां भूतमुत्पन्नमद्भुतम् ||३५||` | "By the austerities of the Vālakhilyas [thumb-sized sages], a wonderful being has been born. ||35||" |
| `Line 3783: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3784: कश्यपस्य मुनेः पुत्रो विनतायाश्च खेचरः |` | "A son of sage Kaśyapa and Vinatā, a sky-traveler [bird]," |
| `Line 3785: हर्तुं सोममनुप्राप्तो बलवान्कामरूपवान् ||३६||` | "Has arrived to steal the Soma [divine nectar], powerful and able to assume any form at will. ||36||" |
| `Line 3786: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3787: समर्थो बलिनां श्रेष्ठो हर्तुं सोमं विहङ्गमः |` | "This bird, foremost among the strong, is capable of stealing the Soma," |
| `Line 3788: सर्वं सम्भावयाम्यस्मिन्नसाध्यमपि साधयेत् ||३७||` | "I believe he can accomplish anything, even what is impossible. ||37||" |
| `Line 3789: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3790: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3791: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3792: श्रुत्वैतद्वचनं शक्रः प्रोवाचामृतरक्षिणः |` | "Hearing these words, Śakra [Indra] spoke to the guardians of the amṛta [immortality nectar]:" |
| `Line 3793: महावीर्यबलः पक्षी हर्तुं सोममिहोद्यतः ||३८||` | "A bird of great power and strength has set out to steal the Soma here. ||38||" |
| `Line 3794: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3795: युष्मान्सम्बोधयाम्येष यथा स न हरेद्बलात् |` | "I alert you all so that he may not take it away by force." |
| `Line 3796: अतुलं हि बलं तस्य बृहस्पतिरुवाच मे ||३९||` | "For Bṛhaspati has told me his strength is unmatched. ||39||" |
| `Line 3797: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3798: तच्छ्रुत्वा विबुधा वाक्यं विस्मिता यत्नमास्थिताः |` | "Hearing those words, the gods [wise ones], astonished, made efforts," |
| `Line 3799: परिवार्यामृतं तस्थुर्वज्री चेन्द्रः शतक्रतुः ||४०||` | "And surrounded the amṛta, along with the wielder of the thunderbolt, Indra, the performer of a hundred sacrifices. ||40||" |
| `Line 3800: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3801: धारयन्तो महार्हाणि कवचानि मनस्विनः |` | "Wearing magnificent armor, those high-minded ones," |
| `Line 3802: काञ्चनानि विचित्राणि वैडूर्यविकृतानि च ||४१||` | "Made of gold, variegated, and adorned with cat's eye gems. ||41||" |
| `Line 3803: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3804: विविधानि च शस्त्राणि घोररूपाण्यनेकशः |` | "And various weapons, terrible in form, of many kinds," |
| `Line 3805: शिततीक्ष्णाग्रधाराणि समुद्यम्य सहस्रशः ||४२||` | "With sharp, keen-edged blades, raised up by the thousands. ||42||" |
| `Line 3806: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3807: सविस्फुलिङ्गज्वालानि सधूमानि च सर्वशः |` | "Emitting sparks and flames, and smoke on all sides," |
| `Line 3808: चक्राणि परिघांश्चैव त्रिशूलानि परश्वधान् ||४३||` | "Discuses [chakras], iron clubs, tridents, and battle-axes. ||43||" |
| `Line 3809: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3810: शक्तीश्च विविधास्तीक्ष्णाः करवालांश्च निर्मलान् |` | "Various sharp spears [śaktis] and gleaming swords," |
| `Line 3811: स्वदेहरूपाण्यादाय गदाश्चोग्रप्रदर्शनाः ||४४||` | "Taking forms suited to their bodies, and fierce-looking maces. ||44||" |
| `Line 3812: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3813: तैः शस्त्रैर्भानुमद्भिस्ते दिव्याभरणभूषिताः |` | "With those radiant weapons, adorned with divine ornaments," |
| `Line 3814: भानुमन्तः सुरगणास्तस्थुर्विगतकल्मषाः ||४५||` | "The radiant hosts of gods stood, free from impurity. ||45||" |
| `Line 3815: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3816: अनुपमबलवीर्यतेजसो; धृतमनसः परिरक्षणेऽमृतस्य |` | "Of incomparable strength, valor and splendor; with minds fixed on protecting the amṛta [nectar of immortality]," |
| `Line 3817: असुरपुरविदारणाः सुरा; ज्वलनसमिद्धवपुःप्रकाशिनः ||४६||` | "The gods, destroyers of demon cities, their bodies blazing like kindled fire. ||46||" |
| `Line 3818: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3819: इति समरवरं सुरास्थितं; परिघसहस्रशतैः समाकुलम् |` | "Thus the gods stood ready for excellent battle, crowded with hundreds of thousands of iron clubs," |
| `Line 3820: विगलितमिव चाम्बरान्तरे; तपनमरीचिविभासितं बभौ ||४७||` | "Appearing as if melting in the sky, shining with the rays of the sun. ||47||" |
| `Line 3821: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3822: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3823: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3824: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3825: ` | [Blank line] |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3826: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3827: २७` | "27" |
| `Line 3828: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3829: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3830: शौनक उवाच||` | "Shaunaka said:" |
| `Line 3831: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3832: कोऽपराधो महेन्द्रस्य कः प्रमादश्च सूतज |` | "What was the offense of Mahendra [great Indra], and what was his negligence, O son of Suta?" |
| `Line 3833: तपसा वालखिल्यानां सम्भूतो गरुडः कथम् ||१||` | "How was Garuda born from the austerities of the Valakhilyas [thumb-sized sages]? ||1||" |
| `Line 3834: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3835: कश्यपस्य द्विजातेश्च कथं वै पक्षिराट्सुतः |` | "And how did the king of birds become the son of Kashyapa, the lord of the twice-born [dvijatesha]?" |
| `Line 3836: अधृष्यः सर्वभूतानामवध्यश्चाभवत्कथम् ||२||` | "How did he become invincible and unkillable by all beings? ||2||" |
| `Line 3837: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3838: कथं च कामचारी स कामवीर्यश्च खेचरः |` | "And how did he become free to roam at will, with strength at will, this sky-traveler [khecara]?" |
| `Line 3839: एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं पुराणे यदि पठ्यते ||३||` | "This I wish to hear, if it is recited in the Purana [ancient text]. ||3||" |
| `Line 3840: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3841: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta said:" |
| `Line 3842: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3843: विषयोऽयं पुराणस्य यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि |` | "This subject about which you question me is indeed part of the Purana," |
| `Line 3844: शृणु मे वदतः सर्वमेतत्सङ्क्षेपतो द्विज ||४||` | "Listen as I tell you everything in brief, O twice-born [dvija]. ||4||" |
| `Line 3845: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3846: यजतः पुत्रकामस्य कश्यपस्य प्रजापतेः |` | "When Kashyapa, the lord of creatures [Prajapati], was performing a sacrifice desiring a son," |
| `Line 3847: साहाय्यमृषयो देवा गन्धर्वाश्च ददुः किल ||५||` | "The sages, gods, and Gandharvas [celestial musicians] indeed gave their assistance. ||5||" |
| `Line 3848: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3849: तत्रेध्मानयने शक्रो नियुक्तः कश्यपेन ह |` | "There, Shakra [Indra] was appointed by Kashyapa to bring the sacrificial firewood," |
| `Line 3850: मुनयो वालखिल्याश्च ये चान्ये देवतागणाः ||६||` | "As were the sages, the Valakhilyas, and other groups of deities. ||6||" |
translations: | `Line 3826: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3828: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3831: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3832: कोऽपराधो महेन्द्रस्य कः प्रमादश्च सूतज |` | "What was the offense of Mahendra [great Indra], and what was his negligence, O son of Suta?" |
| `Line 3833: तपसा वालखिल्यानां सम्भूतो गरुडः कथम् ||१||` | "How was Garuda born from the austerities of the Valakhilyas [thumb-sized sages]? ||1||" |

| `Line 3836: अधृष्यः सर्वभूतानामवध्यश्चाभवत्कथम् ||२||` | "How did he become invincible and unkillable by all beings? ||2||" |
| `Line 3837: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 3839: एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं पुराणे यदि पठ्यते ||३||` | "This I wish to hear, if it is recited in the Purana [ancient text]. ||3||" |

| `Line 3844: शृणु मे वदतः सर्वमेतत्सङ्क्षेपतो द्विज ||४||` | "Listen as I tell you everything in brief, O twice-born [dvija]. ||4||" |
| `Line 3845: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3846: यजतः पुत्रकामस्य कश्यपस्य प्रजापतेः |` | "When Kashyapa, the lord of creatures [Prajapati], was performing a sacrifice desiring a son," |
| `Line 3847: साहाय्यमृषयो देवा गन्धर्वाश्च ददुः किल ||५||` | "The sages, gods, and Gandharvas [celestial musicians] indeed gave their assistance. ||5||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3851: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3852: शक्रस्तु वीर्यसदृशमिध्मभारं गिरिप्रभम् |` | "Śakra [Indra], however, lifted a mountain-like load of firewood befitting his strength," |
| `Line 3853: समुद्यम्यानयामास नातिकृच्छ्रादिव प्रभुः ||७||` | "The lord carried it without much difficulty, as it seemed. ||7||" |
| `Line 3854: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3855: अथापश्यदृषीन्ह्रस्वानङ्गुष्ठोदरपर्वणः |` | "Then he saw tiny sages [rishis] with joints the size of a thumb," |
| `Line 3856: पलाशवृन्तिकामेकां सहितान्वहतः पथि ||८||` | "Carrying together a single palāśa leaf-stalk on the path. ||8||" |
| `Line 3857: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3858: प्रलीनान्स्वेष्विवाङ्गेषु निराहारांस्तपोधनान् |` | "These ascetics [tapodhanān], who seemed withdrawn into their own bodies, were fasting," |
| `Line 3859: क्लिश्यमानान्मन्दबलान्गोष्पदे सम्प्लुतोदके ||९||` | "Struggling with little strength, in water collected in a cow's footprint. ||9||" |
| `Line 3860: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3861: तांश्च सर्वान्स्मयाविष्टो वीर्योन्मत्तः पुरंदरः |` | "And Purandara [Indra], filled with pride and intoxicated with his own strength," |
| `Line 3862: अवहस्यात्यगाच्छीघ्रं लङ्घयित्वावमन्य च ||१०||` | "Laughed at them all, quickly passed by, leaping over them with contempt. ||10||" |
| `Line 3863: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3864: तेऽथ रोषसमाविष्टाः सुभृशं जातमन्यवः |` | "Then they, filled with intense anger and greatly enraged," |
| `Line 3865: आरेभिरे महत्कर्म तदा शक्रभयङ्करम् ||११||` | "Began a great ritual then, terrifying to Śakra [Indra]. ||11||" |
| `Line 3866: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3867: जुहुवुस्ते सुतपसो विधिवज्जातवेदसम् |` | "Those great ascetics offered oblations to Jātavedas [fire deity] according to proper ritual," |
| `Line 3868: मन्त्रैरुच्चावचैर्विप्रा येन कामेन तच्छृणु ||१२||` | "With various mantras, O Vipra [learned one], listen to what purpose they did this. ||12||" |
| `Line 3869: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3870: कामवीर्यः कामगमो देवराजभयप्रदः |` | "One with desired strength, moving at will, causing fear to the king of gods," |
| `Line 3871: इन्द्रोऽन्यः सर्वदेवानां भवेदिति यतव्रताः ||१३||` | "May there be another Indra of all the gods—thus (prayed) the ascetics of controlled vows. ||13||" |
| `Line 3872: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3873: इन्द्राच्छतगुणः शौर्ये वीर्ये चैव मनोजवः |` | "A hundred times greater than Indra in valor and strength, and swift as thought," |
| `Line 3874: तपसो नः फलेनाद्य दारुणः सम्भवत्विति ||१४||` | "By the fruit of our austerities, may a formidable one be born today—thus (they prayed). ||14||" |
| `Line 3875: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 3851: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3852: शक्रस्तु वीर्यसदृशमिध्मभारं गिरिप्रभम् |` | "Śakra [Indra], however, lifted a mountain-like load of firewood befitting his strength," |
| `Line 3853: समुद्यम्यानयामास नातिकृच्छ्रादिव प्रभुः ||७||` | "The lord carried it without much difficulty, as it seemed. ||7||" |
| `Line 3854: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3855: अथापश्यदृषीन्ह्रस्वानङ्गुष्ठोदरपर्वणः |` | "Then he saw tiny sages [rishis] with joints the size of a thumb," |
| `Line 3856: पलाशवृन्तिकामेकां सहितान्वहतः पथि ||८||` | "Carrying together a single palāśa leaf-stalk on the path. ||8||" |

| `Line 3858: प्रलीनान्स्वेष्विवाङ्गेषु निराहारांस्तपोधनान् |` | "These ascetics [tapodhanān], who seemed withdrawn into their own bodies, were fasting," |
| `Line 3859: क्लिश्यमानान्मन्दबलान्गोष्पदे सम्प्लुतोदके ||९||` | "Struggling with little strength, in water collected in a cow's footprint. ||9||" |
| `Line 3860: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3861: तांश्च सर्वान्स्मयाविष्टो वीर्योन्मत्तः पुरंदरः |` | "And Purandara [Indra], filled with pride and intoxicated with his own strength," |
| `Line 3862: अवहस्यात्यगाच्छीघ्रं लङ्घयित्वावमन्य च ||१०||` | "Laughed at them all, quickly passed by, leaping over them with contempt. ||10||" |
| `Line 3863: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3864: तेऽथ रोषसमाविष्टाः सुभृशं जातमन्यवः |` | "Then they, filled with intense anger and greatly enraged," |
| `Line 3865: आरेभिरे महत्कर्म तदा शक्रभयङ्करम् ||११||` | "Began a great ritual then, terrifying to Śakra [Indra]. ||11||" |
| `Line 3866: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3867: जुहुवुस्ते सुतपसो विधिवज्जातवेदसम् |` | "Those great ascetics offered oblations to Jātavedas [fire deity] according to proper ritual," |
| `Line 3868: मन्त्रैरुच्चावचैर्विप्रा येन कामेन तच्छृणु ||१२||` | "With various mantras, O Vipra [learned one], listen to what purpose they did this. ||12||" |
| `Line 3869: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3870: कामवीर्यः कामगमो देवराजभयप्रदः |` | "One with desired strength, moving at will, causing fear to the king of gods," |
| `Line 3871: इन्द्रोऽन्यः सर्वदेवानां भवेदिति यतव्रताः ||१३||` | "May there be another Indra of all the gods—thus (prayed) the ascetics of controlled vows. ||13||" |
| `Line 3872: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3873: इन्द्राच्छतगुणः शौर्ये वीर्ये चैव मनोजवः |` | "A hundred times greater than Indra in valor and strength, and swift as thought," |
| `Line 3874: तपसो नः फलेनाद्य दारुणः सम्भवत्विति ||१४||` | "By the fruit of our austerities, may a formidable one be born today—thus (they prayed). ||14||" |
| `Line 3875: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3876: तद्बुद्ध्वा भृशसन्तप्तो देवराजः शतक्रतुः |` | "Understanding this, Śatakratu [hundred-sacrifice performer], the king of gods, became deeply distressed," |
| `Line 3877: जगाम शरणं तत्र कश्यपं संशितव्रतम् ||१५||` | "And went there for refuge to Kaśyapa [sage progenitor] of steadfast vows. ||15||" |
| `Line 3878: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3879: तच्छ्रुत्वा देवराजस्य कश्यपोऽथ प्रजापतिः |` | "Hearing this from the king of gods, Kaśyapa, the Prajāpati [lord of creatures]," |
| `Line 3880: वालखिल्यानुपागम्य कर्मसिद्धिमपृच्छत ||१६||` | "Approached the Vālakhilyas [thumb-sized sages] and asked about the success of their undertaking. ||16||" |
| `Line 3881: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3882: एवमस्त्विति तं चापि प्रत्यूचुः सत्यवादिनः |` | "And those truth-speakers replied to him, 'So be it,'" |
| `Line 3883: तान्कश्यप उवाचेदं सान्त्वपूर्वं प्रजापतिः ||१७||` | "Then Kaśyapa, the Prajāpati, spoke these conciliatory words to them: ||17||" |
| `Line 3884: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3885: अयमिन्द्रस्त्रिभुवने नियोगाद्ब्रह्मणः कृतः |` | "This Indra was appointed in the three worlds by the command of Brahmā [creator god]," |
| `Line 3886: इन्द्रार्थं च भवन्तोऽपि यत्नवन्तस्तपोधनाः ||१८||` | "And you too, rich in austerities, have striven for the sake of an Indra. ||18||" |
| `Line 3887: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3888: न मिथ्या ब्रह्मणो वाक्यं कर्तुमर्हथ सत्तमाः |` | "O excellent ones, you should not render Brahmā's word false," |
| `Line 3889: भवतां च न मिथ्यायं सङ्कल्पो मे चिकीर्षितः ||१९||` | "Nor do I wish to make your resolution fruitless. ||19||" |
| `Line 3890: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3891: भवत्वेष पतत्रीणामिन्द्रोऽतिबलसत्त्ववान् |` | "Let there be this exceedingly powerful and mighty Indra of the winged creatures," |
| `Line 3892: प्रसादः क्रियतां चैव देवराजस्य याचतः ||२०||` | "And let grace be shown to the king of gods who now beseeches you. ||20||" |
| `Line 3893: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3894: एवमुक्ताः कश्यपेन वालखिल्यास्तपोधनाः |` | "Thus addressed by Kaśyapa, the Vālakhilyas, rich in austerities," |
| `Line 3895: प्रत्यूचुरभिसम्पूज्य मुनिश्रेष्ठं प्रजापतिम् ||२१||` | "Replied, after duly honoring the foremost of sages, the Prajāpati: ||21||" |
| `Line 3896: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3897: इन्द्रार्थोऽयं समारम्भः सर्वेषां नः प्रजापते |` | "O Prajāpati, this undertaking of all of us was for the sake of an Indra," |
| `Line 3898: अपत्यार्थं समारम्भो भवतश्चायमीप्सितः ||२२||` | "And this undertaking of yours is desired for the sake of offspring. ||22||" |
| `Line 3899: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3900: तदिदं सफलं कर्म त्वया वै प्रतिगृह्यताम् |` | "Therefore, let this fruitful work be accepted by you." |
translations: | `Line 3876: तद्बुद्ध्वा भृशसन्तप्तो देवराजः शतक्रतुः |` | "Understanding this, Śatakratu [hundred-sacrifice performer], the king of gods, became deeply distressed," |
| `Line 3877: जगाम शरणं तत्र कश्यपं संशितव्रतम् ||१५||` | "And went there for refuge to Kaśyapa [sage progenitor] of steadfast vows. ||15||" |
| `Line 3878: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3879: तच्छ्रुत्वा देवराजस्य कश्यपोऽथ प्रजापतिः |` | "Hearing this from the king of gods, Kaśyapa, the Prajāpati [lord of creatures]," |
| `Line 3880: वालखिल्यानुपागम्य कर्मसिद्धिमपृच्छत ||१६||` | "Approached the Vālakhilyas [thumb-sized sages] and asked about the success of their undertaking. ||16||" |
| `Line 3881: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3882: एवमस्त्विति तं चापि प्रत्यूचुः सत्यवादिनः |` | "And those truth-speakers replied to him, 'So be it,'" |
| `Line 3883: तान्कश्यप उवाचेदं सान्त्वपूर्वं प्रजापतिः ||१७||` | "Then Kaśyapa, the Prajāpati, spoke these conciliatory words to them: ||17||" |
| `Line 3884: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3885: अयमिन्द्रस्त्रिभुवने नियोगाद्ब्रह्मणः कृतः |` | "This Indra was appointed in the three worlds by the command of Brahmā [creator god]," |
| `Line 3886: इन्द्रार्थं च भवन्तोऽपि यत्नवन्तस्तपोधनाः ||१८||` | "And you too, rich in austerities, have striven for the sake of an Indra. ||18||" |
| `Line 3887: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3888: न मिथ्या ब्रह्मणो वाक्यं कर्तुमर्हथ सत्तमाः |` | "O excellent ones, you should not render Brahmā's word false," |
| `Line 3889: भवतां च न मिथ्यायं सङ्कल्पो मे चिकीर्षितः ||१९||` | "Nor do I wish to make your resolution fruitless. ||19||" |
| `Line 3890: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3891: भवत्वेष पतत्रीणामिन्द्रोऽतिबलसत्त्ववान् |` | "Let there be this exceedingly powerful and mighty Indra of the winged creatures," |
| `Line 3892: प्रसादः क्रियतां चैव देवराजस्य याचतः ||२०||` | "And let grace be shown to the king of gods who now beseeches you. ||20||" |
| `Line 3893: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3894: एवमुक्ताः कश्यपेन वालखिल्यास्तपोधनाः |` | "Thus addressed by Kaśyapa, the Vālakhilyas, rich in austerities," |
| `Line 3895: प्रत्यूचुरभिसम्पूज्य मुनिश्रेष्ठं प्रजापतिम् ||२१||` | "Replied, after duly honoring the foremost of sages, the Prajāpati: ||21||" |
| `Line 3896: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3897: इन्द्रार्थोऽयं समारम्भः सर्वेषां नः प्रजापते |` | "O Prajāpati, this undertaking of all of us was for the sake of an Indra," |
| `Line 3898: अपत्यार्थं समारम्भो भवतश्चायमीप्सितः ||२२||` | "And this undertaking of yours is desired for the sake of offspring. ||22||" |
| `Line 3899: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3900: तदिदं सफलं कर्म त्वया वै प्रतिगृह्यताम् |` | "Therefore, let this fruitful work be accepted by you." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3901: तथा चैव विधत्स्वात्र यथा श्रेयोऽनुपश्यसि ||२३||` | "And arrange matters here as you see best for our welfare. ||23||" |
| `Line 3902: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3903: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु देवी दाक्षायणी शुभा |` | "At this very time, the auspicious goddess Dākṣāyaṇī [daughter of Dakṣa]," |
| `Line 3904: विनता नाम कल्याणी पुत्रकामा यशस्विनी ||२४||` | "Named Vinatā, virtuous, desiring sons, and illustrious, ||24||" |
| `Line 3905: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3906: तपस्तप्त्वा व्रतपरा स्नाता पुंसवने शुचिः |` | "Having performed austerities, devoted to vows, bathed in the puṃsavana [male-child ceremony], purified," |
| `Line 3907: उपचक्राम भर्तारं तामुवाचाथ कश्यपः ||२५||` | "Approached her husband, and then Kaśyapa said to her: ||25||" |
| `Line 3908: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3909: आरम्भः सफलो देवि भवितायं तवेप्सितः |` | "O goddess, this endeavor of yours will be successful as desired," |
| `Line 3910: जनयिष्यसि पुत्रौ द्वौ वीरौ त्रिभुवनेश्वरौ ||२६||` | "You will give birth to two heroic sons who will be lords of the three worlds. ||26||" |
| `Line 3911: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3912: तपसा वालखिल्यानां मम सङ्कल्पजौ तथा |` | "Born from the austerities of the Vālakhilyas [thumb-sized sages] and from my intention," |
| `Line 3913: भविष्यतो महाभागौ पुत्रौ ते लोकपूजितौ ||२७||` | "Your two sons will be greatly fortunate and worshipped by the worlds. ||27||" |
| `Line 3914: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3915: उवाच चैनां भगवान्मारीचः पुनरेव ह |` | "And the lord Mārīca [Kaśyapa] spoke to her again:" |
| `Line 3916: धार्यतामप्रमादेन गर्भोऽयं सुमहोदयः ||२८||` | "Bear this womb with great care, for it will bring tremendous prosperity. ||28||" |
| `Line 3917: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3918: एकः सर्वपतत्रीणामिन्द्रत्वं कारयिष्यति |` | "One will attain the position of Indra among all winged creatures," |
| `Line 3919: लोकसम्भावितो वीरः कामवीर्यो विहङ्गमः ||२९||` | "A hero respected by the worlds, a bird with strength according to his will. ||29||" |
| `Line 3920: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3921: शतक्रतुमथोवाच प्रीयमाणः प्रजापतिः |` | "Then the pleased Prajāpati [lord of creatures] said to Śatakratu [Indra]:" |
| `Line 3922: त्वत्सहायौ खगावेतौ भ्रातरौ ते भविष्यतः ||३०||` | "These two bird-brothers will be your allies. ||30||" |
| `Line 3923: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3924: नैताभ्यां भविता दोषः सकाशात्ते पुरंदर |` | "No harm will come to you from them, O Purandara [city-destroyer]," |
| `Line 3925: व्येतु ते शक्र सन्तापस्त्वमेवेन्द्रो भविष्यसि ||३१||` | "Let your anxiety depart, O Śakra [Indra], you alone will remain Indra. ||31||" |
translations: | `Line 3901: तथा चैव विधत्स्वात्र यथा श्रेयोऽनुपश्यसि ||२३||` | "And arrange matters here as you see best for our welfare. ||23||" |
| `Line 3902: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3903: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु देवी दाक्षायणी शुभा |` | "At this very time, the auspicious goddess Dākṣāyaṇī [daughter of Dakṣa]," |
| `Line 3904: विनता नाम कल्याणी पुत्रकामा यशस्विनी ||२४||` | "Named Vinatā, virtuous, desiring sons, and illustrious, ||24||" |
| `Line 3905: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3906: तपस्तप्त्वा व्रतपरा स्नाता पुंसवने शुचिः |` | "Having performed austerities, devoted to vows, bathed in the puṃsavana [male-child ceremony], purified," |
| `Line 3907: उपचक्राम भर्तारं तामुवाचाथ कश्यपः ||२५||` | "Approached her husband, and then Kaśyapa said to her: ||25||" |
| `Line 3908: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3909: आरम्भः सफलो देवि भवितायं तवेप्सितः |` | "O goddess, this endeavor of yours will be successful as desired," |
| `Line 3910: जनयिष्यसि पुत्रौ द्वौ वीरौ त्रिभुवनेश्वरौ ||२६||` | "You will give birth to two heroic sons who will be lords of the three worlds. ||26||" |
| `Line 3911: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3912: तपसा वालखिल्यानां मम सङ्कल्पजौ तथा |` | "Born from the austerities of the Vālakhilyas [thumb-sized sages] and from my intention," |
| `Line 3913: भविष्यतो महाभागौ पुत्रौ ते लोकपूजितौ ||२७||` | "Your two sons will be greatly fortunate and worshipped by the worlds. ||27||" |
| `Line 3914: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3915: उवाच चैनां भगवान्मारीचः पुनरेव ह |` | "And the lord Mārīca [Kaśyapa] spoke to her again:" |
| `Line 3916: धार्यतामप्रमादेन गर्भोऽयं सुमहोदयः ||२८||` | "Bear this womb with great care, for it will bring tremendous prosperity. ||28||" |
| `Line 3917: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3918: एकः सर्वपतत्रीणामिन्द्रत्वं कारयिष्यति |` | "One will attain the position of Indra among all winged creatures," |
| `Line 3919: लोकसम्भावितो वीरः कामवीर्यो विहङ्गमः ||२९||` | "A hero respected by the worlds, a bird with strength according to his will. ||29||" |
| `Line 3920: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3921: शतक्रतुमथोवाच प्रीयमाणः प्रजापतिः |` | "Then the pleased Prajāpati [lord of creatures] said to Śatakratu [Indra]:" |
| `Line 3922: त्वत्सहायौ खगावेतौ भ्रातरौ ते भविष्यतः ||३०||` | "These two bird-brothers will be your allies. ||30||" |
| `Line 3923: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3924: नैताभ्यां भविता दोषः सकाशात्ते पुरंदर |` | "No harm will come to you from them, O Purandara [city-destroyer]," |
| `Line 3925: व्येतु ते शक्र सन्तापस्त्वमेवेन्द्रो भविष्यसि ||३१||` | "Let your anxiety depart, O Śakra [Indra], you alone will remain Indra. ||31||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3926: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3927: न चाप्येवं त्वया भूयः क्षेप्तव्या ब्रह्मवादिनः |` | "And never again should you thus insult the Brahmavādins [Vedic scholars]," |
| `Line 3928: न चावमान्या दर्पात्ते वाग्विषा भृशकोपनाः ||३२||` | "Nor should you disrespect out of pride those whose words are venomous and easily angered. ||32||" |
| `Line 3929: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3930: एवमुक्तो जगामेन्द्रो निर्विशङ्कस्त्रिविष्टपम् |` | "Thus addressed, Indra [king of gods] went without fear to Triviṣṭapa [heaven]," |
| `Line 3931: विनता चापि सिद्धार्था बभूव मुदिता तदा ||३३||` | "And Vinatā too, having achieved her purpose, became joyful then. ||33||" |
| `Line 3932: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3933: जनयामास पुत्रौ द्वावरुणं गरुडं तथा |` | "She gave birth to two sons, Aruṇa and Garuḍa," |
| `Line 3934: अरुणस्तयोस्तु विकल आदित्यस्य पुरःसरः ||३४||` | "Of those two, Aruṇa was crippled and became the charioteer [forerunner] of Āditya [the sun]. ||34||" |
| `Line 3935: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3936: पतत्रीणां तु गरुड इन्द्रत्वेनाभ्यषिच्यत |` | "And Garuḍa was consecrated as the Indra [sovereign] of the winged creatures," |
| `Line 3937: तस्यैतत्कर्म सुमहच्छ्रूयतां भृगुनन्दन ||३५||` | "Listen to his great deed, O Bhṛgunandana [descendant of Bhṛgu]. ||35||" |
| `Line 3938: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3939: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3940: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3941: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3942: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3943: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3944: २८` | "28" |
| `Line 3945: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3946: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3947: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3948: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3949: ततस्तस्मिन्द्विजश्रेष्ठ समुदीर्णे तथाविधे |` | "Then, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin], when that situation arose thus," |
| `Line 3950: गरुत्मान्पक्षिराट्तूर्णं सम्प्राप्तो विबुधान्प्रति ||१||` | "Garutmān [Garuḍa], the king of birds, swiftly approached the gods. ||1||" |
translations: | `Line 3926: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3927: न चाप्येवं त्वया भूयः क्षेप्तव्या ब्रह्मवादिनः |` | "And never again should you thus insult the Brahmavādins [Vedic scholars]," |
| `Line 3928: न चावमान्या दर्पात्ते वाग्विषा भृशकोपनाः ||३२||` | "Nor should you disrespect out of pride those whose words are venomous and easily angered. ||32||" |
| `Line 3929: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3930: एवमुक्तो जगामेन्द्रो निर्विशङ्कस्त्रिविष्टपम् |` | "Thus addressed, Indra [king of gods] went without fear to Triviṣṭapa [heaven]," |
| `Line 3931: विनता चापि सिद्धार्था बभूव मुदिता तदा ||३३||` | "And Vinatā too, having achieved her purpose, became joyful then. ||33||" |
| `Line 3932: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3933: जनयामास पुत्रौ द्वावरुणं गरुडं तथा |` | "She gave birth to two sons, Aruṇa and Garuḍa," |
| `Line 3934: अरुणस्तयोस्तु विकल आदित्यस्य पुरःसरः ||३४||` | "Of those two, Aruṇa was crippled and became the charioteer [forerunner] of Āditya [the sun]. ||34||" |
| `Line 3935: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3936: पतत्रीणां तु गरुड इन्द्रत्वेनाभ्यषिच्यत |` | "And Garuḍa was consecrated as the Indra [sovereign] of the winged creatures," |
| `Line 3937: तस्यैतत्कर्म सुमहच्छ्रूयतां भृगुनन्दन ||३५||` | "Listen to his great deed, O Bhṛgunandana [descendant of Bhṛgu]. ||35||" |
| `Line 3938: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3939: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3940: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3941: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3942: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3943: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3945: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3946: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3947: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 3948: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3949: ततस्तस्मिन्द्विजश्रेष्ठ समुदीर्णे तथाविधे |` | "Then, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin], when that situation arose thus," |
| `Line 3950: गरुत्मान्पक्षिराट्तूर्णं सम्प्राप्तो विबुधान्प्रति ||१||` | "Garutmān [Garuḍa], the king of birds, swiftly approached the gods. ||1||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3951: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3952: तं दृष्ट्वातिबलं चैव प्राकम्पन्त समन्ततः |` | "Seeing him of extraordinary strength, they trembled all around," |
| `Line 3953: परस्परं च प्रत्यघ्नन्सर्वप्रहरणान्यपि ||२||` | "And all their weapons struck against each other. ||2||" |
| `Line 3954: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3955: तत्र चासीदमेयात्मा विद्युदग्निसमप्रभः |` | "There was one of immeasurable spirit, radiant like lightning and fire," |
| `Line 3956: भौवनः सुमहावीर्यः सोमस्य परिरक्षिता ||३||` | "Bhauvana [earth-born guardian], of great valor, the protector of Soma [moon/sacred drink]. ||3||" |
| `Line 3957: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3958: स तेन पतगेन्द्रेण पक्षतुण्डनखैः क्षतः |` | "He was wounded by that lord of birds [Garuda] with wings, beak, and talons," |
| `Line 3959: मुहूर्तमतुलं युद्धं कृत्वा विनिहतो युधि ||४||` | "And after fighting an incomparable battle for a moment, was slain in combat. ||4||" |
| `Line 3960: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3961: रजश्चोद्धूय सुमहत्पक्षवातेन खेचरः |` | "The sky-traveler [Garuda] raised a great cloud of dust with the wind of his wings," |
| `Line 3962: कृत्वा लोकान्निरालोकांस्तेन देवानवाकिरत् ||५||` | "Making the worlds lightless, he scattered the gods with it. ||5||" |
| `Line 3963: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3964: तेनावकीर्णा रजसा देवा मोहमुपागमन् |` | "Covered by that dust, the gods became confused," |
| `Line 3965: न चैनं ददृशुश्छन्ना रजसामृतरक्षिणः ||६||` | "And the guardians of amrita [immortality nectar], concealed by the dust, could not see him. ||6||" |
| `Line 3966: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3967: एवं संलोडयामास गरुडस्त्रिदिवालयम् |` | "Thus Garuda churned up the abode of the thirty gods [heaven]," |
| `Line 3968: पक्षतुण्डप्रहारैश्च देवान्स विददार ह ||७||` | "And with blows from his wings and beak, he tore apart the gods indeed. ||7||" |
| `Line 3969: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3970: ततो देवः सहस्राक्षस्तूर्णं वायुमचोदयत् |` | "Then the thousand-eyed god [Indra] quickly urged the wind," |
| `Line 3971: विक्षिपेमां रजोवृष्टिं तवैतत्कर्म मारुत ||८||` | "'Disperse this shower of dust, this is your task, O Wind [Maruta].' ||8||" |
| `Line 3972: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3973: अथ वायुरपोवाह तद्रजस्तरसा बली |` | "Then the mighty Wind swiftly carried away that dust," |
| `Line 3974: ततो वितिमिरे जाते देवाः शकुनिमार्दयन् ||९||` | "When the darkness was gone, the gods attacked the bird [Garuda]. ||9||" |
| `Line 3975: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 3951: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3952: तं दृष्ट्वातिबलं चैव प्राकम्पन्त समन्ततः |` | "Seeing him of extraordinary strength, they trembled all around," |
| `Line 3953: परस्परं च प्रत्यघ्नन्सर्वप्रहरणान्यपि ||२||` | "And all their weapons struck against each other. ||2||" |
| `Line 3954: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3955: तत्र चासीदमेयात्मा विद्युदग्निसमप्रभः |` | "There was one of immeasurable spirit, radiant like lightning and fire," |
| `Line 3956: भौवनः सुमहावीर्यः सोमस्य परिरक्षिता ||३||` | "Bhauvana [earth-born guardian], of great valor, the protector of Soma [moon/sacred drink]. ||3||" |
| `Line 3957: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3958: स तेन पतगेन्द्रेण पक्षतुण्डनखैः क्षतः |` | "He was wounded by that lord of birds [Garuda] with wings, beak, and talons," |
| `Line 3959: मुहूर्तमतुलं युद्धं कृत्वा विनिहतो युधि ||४||` | "And after fighting an incomparable battle for a moment, was slain in combat. ||4||" |
| `Line 3960: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3961: रजश्चोद्धूय सुमहत्पक्षवातेन खेचरः |` | "The sky-traveler [Garuda] raised a great cloud of dust with the wind of his wings," |
| `Line 3962: कृत्वा लोकान्निरालोकांस्तेन देवानवाकिरत् ||५||` | "Making the worlds lightless, he scattered the gods with it. ||5||" |
| `Line 3963: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3964: तेनावकीर्णा रजसा देवा मोहमुपागमन् |` | "Covered by that dust, the gods became confused," |
| `Line 3965: न चैनं ददृशुश्छन्ना रजसामृतरक्षिणः ||६||` | "And the guardians of amrita [immortality nectar], concealed by the dust, could not see him. ||6||" |
| `Line 3966: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3967: एवं संलोडयामास गरुडस्त्रिदिवालयम् |` | "Thus Garuda churned up the abode of the thirty gods [heaven]," |
| `Line 3968: पक्षतुण्डप्रहारैश्च देवान्स विददार ह ||७||` | "And with blows from his wings and beak, he tore apart the gods indeed. ||7||" |
| `Line 3969: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3970: ततो देवः सहस्राक्षस्तूर्णं वायुमचोदयत् |` | "Then the thousand-eyed god [Indra] quickly urged the wind," |
| `Line 3971: विक्षिपेमां रजोवृष्टिं तवैतत्कर्म मारुत ||८||` | "'Disperse this shower of dust, this is your task, O Wind [Maruta].' ||8||" |
| `Line 3972: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 3973: अथ वायुरपोवाह तद्रजस्तरसा बली |` | "Then the mighty Wind swiftly carried away that dust," |
| `Line 3974: ततो वितिमिरे जाते देवाः शकुनिमार्दयन् ||९||` | "When the darkness was gone, the gods attacked the bird [Garuda]. ||9||" |
| `Line 3975: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 3976: ननाद चोच्चैर्बलवान्महामेघरवः खगः |` | "The mighty bird [Garuḍa], with a sound like great thunder, roared loudly," |
| `Line 3977: वध्यमानः सुरगणैः सर्वभूतानि भीषयन् ||१०||` | "While being attacked by hosts of gods, terrifying all beings. ||10||" |
| `Line 3978: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3979: उत्पपात महावीर्यः पक्षिराट्परवीरहा ||१०||` | "The immensely powerful king of birds [Garuḍa], slayer of enemy heroes, soared upward. ||10||" |
| `Line 3980: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3981: तमुत्पत्यान्तरिक्षस्थं देवानामुपरि स्थितम् |` | "As he flew up into the sky, positioned above the gods," |
| `Line 3982: वर्मिणो विबुधाः सर्वे नानाशस्त्रैरवाकिरन् ||११||` | "All the armored immortals [gods] showered him with various weapons. ||11||" |
| `Line 3983: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3984: पट्टिशैः परिघैः शूलैर्गदाभिश्च सवासवाः |` | "With spears, iron clubs, tridents, and maces, the gods including Vāsava [Indra]," |
| `Line 3985: क्षुरान्तैर्ज्वलितैश्चापि चक्रैरादित्यरूपिभिः ||१२||` | "With razor-edged weapons, flaming discs shining like the sun. ||12||" |
| `Line 3986: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3987: नानाशस्त्रविसर्गैश्च वध्यमानः समन्ततः |` | "Though attacked from all sides with discharges of various weapons," |
| `Line 3988: कुर्वन्सुतुमुलं युद्धं पक्षिराण्न व्यकम्पत ||१३||` | "The king of birds, waging a fierce battle, did not waver. ||13||" |
| `Line 3989: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3990: विनर्दन्निव चाकाशे वैनतेयः प्रतापवान् |` | "Roaring in the sky, the mighty Vainateya [son of Vinatā, Garuḍa]," |
| `Line 3991: पक्षाभ्यामुरसा चैव समन्ताद्व्याक्षिपत्सुरान् ||१४||` | "Scattered the gods in all directions with his wings and chest. ||14||" |
| `Line 3992: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3993: ते विक्षिप्तास्ततो देवाः प्रजग्मुर्गरुडार्दिताः |` | "Those gods, thus scattered and afflicted by Garuḍa, fled," |
| `Line 3994: नखतुण्डक्षताश्चैव सुस्रुवुः शोणितं बहु ||१५||` | "Wounded by his claws and beak, they bled profusely. ||15||" |
| `Line 3995: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3996: साध्याः प्राचीं सगन्धर्वा वसवो दक्षिणां दिशम् |` | "The Sādhyas [celestial beings] with the Gandharvas fled to the east, the Vasus to the south," |
| `Line 3997: प्रजग्मुः सहिता रुद्रैः पतगेन्द्रप्रधर्षिताः ||१६||` | "They fled together with the Rudras, all harassed by the lord of birds. ||16||" |
| `Line 3998: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3999: दिशं प्रतीचीमादित्या नासत्या उत्तरां दिशम् |` | "The Ādityas fled to the west, the Nāsatyas [Aśvins] to the north," |
| `Line 4000: मुहुर्मुहुः प्रेक्षमाणा युध्यमाना महौजसम् ||१७||` | "Repeatedly looking back while fighting the mighty one [Garuḍa]. ||17||" |
translations: | `Line 3976: ननाद चोच्चैर्बलवान्महामेघरवः खगः |` | "The mighty bird [Garuḍa], with a sound like great thunder, roared loudly," |
| `Line 3977: वध्यमानः सुरगणैः सर्वभूतानि भीषयन् ||१०||` | "While being attacked by hosts of gods, terrifying all beings. ||10||" |
| `Line 3978: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3979: उत्पपात महावीर्यः पक्षिराट्परवीरहा ||१०||` | "The immensely powerful king of birds [Garuḍa], slayer of enemy heroes, soared upward. ||10||" |
| `Line 3980: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3981: तमुत्पत्यान्तरिक्षस्थं देवानामुपरि स्थितम् |` | "As he flew up into the sky, positioned above the gods," |
| `Line 3982: वर्मिणो विबुधाः सर्वे नानाशस्त्रैरवाकिरन् ||११||` | "All the armored immortals [gods] showered him with various weapons. ||11||" |
| `Line 3983: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3984: पट्टिशैः परिघैः शूलैर्गदाभिश्च सवासवाः |` | "With spears, iron clubs, tridents, and maces, the gods including Vāsava [Indra]," |
| `Line 3985: क्षुरान्तैर्ज्वलितैश्चापि चक्रैरादित्यरूपिभिः ||१२||` | "With razor-edged weapons, flaming discs shining like the sun. ||12||" |
| `Line 3986: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3987: नानाशस्त्रविसर्गैश्च वध्यमानः समन्ततः |` | "Though attacked from all sides with discharges of various weapons," |
| `Line 3988: कुर्वन्सुतुमुलं युद्धं पक्षिराण्न व्यकम्पत ||१३||` | "The king of birds, waging a fierce battle, did not waver. ||13||" |
| `Line 3989: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3990: विनर्दन्निव चाकाशे वैनतेयः प्रतापवान् |` | "Roaring in the sky, the mighty Vainateya [son of Vinatā, Garuḍa]," |
| `Line 3991: पक्षाभ्यामुरसा चैव समन्ताद्व्याक्षिपत्सुरान् ||१४||` | "Scattered the gods in all directions with his wings and chest. ||14||" |
| `Line 3992: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3993: ते विक्षिप्तास्ततो देवाः प्रजग्मुर्गरुडार्दिताः |` | "Those gods, thus scattered and afflicted by Garuḍa, fled," |
| `Line 3994: नखतुण्डक्षताश्चैव सुस्रुवुः शोणितं बहु ||१५||` | "Wounded by his claws and beak, they bled profusely. ||15||" |
| `Line 3995: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3996: साध्याः प्राचीं सगन्धर्वा वसवो दक्षिणां दिशम् |` | "The Sādhyas [celestial beings] with the Gandharvas fled to the east, the Vasus to the south," |
| `Line 3997: प्रजग्मुः सहिता रुद्रैः पतगेन्द्रप्रधर्षिताः ||१६||` | "They fled together with the Rudras, all harassed by the lord of birds. ||16||" |
| `Line 3998: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 3999: दिशं प्रतीचीमादित्या नासत्या उत्तरां दिशम् |` | "The Ādityas fled to the west, the Nāsatyas [Aśvins] to the north," |
| `Line 4000: मुहुर्मुहुः प्रेक्षमाणा युध्यमाना महौजसम् ||१७||` | "Repeatedly looking back while fighting the mighty one [Garuḍa]. ||17||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4001: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4002: अश्वक्रन्देन वीरेण रेणुकेन च पक्षिणा |` | "With the heroic Aśvakranda [horse-neigher], the bird Reṇuka [dust-maker]," |
| `Line 4003: क्रथनेन च शूरेण तपनेन च खेचरः ||१८||` | "And with the valiant Krathana [roarer] and the sky-traveler Tapana [scorcher]. ||18||" |
| `Line 4004: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4005: उलूकश्वसनाभ्यां च निमेषेण च पक्षिणा |` | "With Ulūka [owl] and Śvasana [wind-like], and with the bird Nimeṣa [blink]," |
| `Line 4006: प्ररुजेन च संयुद्धं चकार प्रलिहेन च ||१९||` | "He fought with Praruja [destroyer] and Praliha [licker]. ||19||" |
| `Line 4007: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4008: तान्पक्षनखतुण्डाग्रैरभिनद्विनतासुतः |` | "The son of Vinatā [Garuḍa] tore them with the tips of his wings, claws, and beak," |
| `Line 4009: युगान्तकाले सङ्क्रुद्धः पिनाकीव महाबलः ||२०||` | "Like the mighty Pinākin [Śiva] enraged at the time of cosmic dissolution. ||20||" |
| `Line 4010: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4011: महावीर्या महोत्साहास्तेन ते बहुधा क्षताः |` | "Though of great valor and great enthusiasm, they were wounded in many ways by him," |
| `Line 4012: रेजुरभ्रघनप्रख्या रुधिरौघप्रवर्षिणः ||२१||` | "They shone like dense clouds, pouring forth streams of blood. ||21||" |
| `Line 4013: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4014: तान्कृत्वा पतगश्रेष्ठः सर्वानुत्क्रान्तजीवितान् |` | "Having deprived all of them of their lives, the foremost of birds [Garuḍa]," |
| `Line 4015: अतिक्रान्तोऽमृतस्यार्थे सर्वतोऽग्निमपश्यत ||२२||` | "Advancing for the sake of amṛta [nectar], saw fire on all sides. ||22||" |
| `Line 4016: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4017: आवृण्वानं महाज्वालमर्चिर्भिः सर्वतोऽम्बरम् |` | "Covering the sky on all sides with great flames and rays," |
| `Line 4018: दहन्तमिव तीक्ष्णांशुं घोरं वायुसमीरितम् ||२३||` | "Like the fierce, scorching sun, stirred by wind. ||23||" |
| `Line 4019: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4020: ततो नवत्या नवतीर्मुखानां; कृत्वा तरस्वी गरुडो महात्मा |` | "Then the mighty, great-souled Garuḍa, creating ninety times ninety mouths," |
| `Line 4021: नदीः समापीय मुखैस्ततस्तैः; सुशीघ्रमागम्य पुनर्जवेन ||२४||` | "Drank up rivers with those mouths, and swiftly returned with speed. ||24||" |
| `Line 4022: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4023: ज्वलन्तमग्निं तममित्रतापनः; समास्तरत्पत्ररथो नदीभिः |` | "The tormentor of enemies [Garuḍa], riding on wings, extinguished the blazing fire with those rivers," |
| `Line 4024: ततः प्रचक्रे वपुरन्यदल्पं; प्रवेष्टुकामोऽग्निमभिप्रशाम्य ||२५||` | "Then, having quenched the fire, he made his body small, desiring to enter. ||25||" |
| `Line 4025: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4001: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4002: अश्वक्रन्देन वीरेण रेणुकेन च पक्षिणा |` | "With the heroic Aśvakranda [horse-neigher], the bird Reṇuka [dust-maker]," |
| `Line 4003: क्रथनेन च शूरेण तपनेन च खेचरः ||१८||` | "And with the valiant Krathana [roarer] and the sky-traveler Tapana [scorcher]. ||18||" |
| `Line 4004: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4005: उलूकश्वसनाभ्यां च निमेषेण च पक्षिणा |` | "With Ulūka [owl] and Śvasana [wind-like], and with the bird Nimeṣa [blink]," |
| `Line 4006: प्ररुजेन च संयुद्धं चकार प्रलिहेन च ||१९||` | "He fought with Praruja [destroyer] and Praliha [licker]. ||19||" |
| `Line 4007: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4008: तान्पक्षनखतुण्डाग्रैरभिनद्विनतासुतः |` | "The son of Vinatā [Garuḍa] tore them with the tips of his wings, claws, and beak," |
| `Line 4009: युगान्तकाले सङ्क्रुद्धः पिनाकीव महाबलः ||२०||` | "Like the mighty Pinākin [Śiva] enraged at the time of cosmic dissolution. ||20||" |
| `Line 4010: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4011: महावीर्या महोत्साहास्तेन ते बहुधा क्षताः |` | "Though of great valor and great enthusiasm, they were wounded in many ways by him," |
| `Line 4012: रेजुरभ्रघनप्रख्या रुधिरौघप्रवर्षिणः ||२१||` | "They shone like dense clouds, pouring forth streams of blood. ||21||" |
| `Line 4013: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4014: तान्कृत्वा पतगश्रेष्ठः सर्वानुत्क्रान्तजीवितान् |` | "Having deprived all of them of their lives, the foremost of birds [Garuḍa]," |
| `Line 4015: अतिक्रान्तोऽमृतस्यार्थे सर्वतोऽग्निमपश्यत ||२२||` | "Advancing for the sake of amṛta [nectar], saw fire on all sides. ||22||" |
| `Line 4016: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4017: आवृण्वानं महाज्वालमर्चिर्भिः सर्वतोऽम्बरम् |` | "Covering the sky on all sides with great flames and rays," |
| `Line 4018: दहन्तमिव तीक्ष्णांशुं घोरं वायुसमीरितम् ||२३||` | "Like the fierce, scorching sun, stirred by wind. ||23||" |
| `Line 4019: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4020: ततो नवत्या नवतीर्मुखानां; कृत्वा तरस्वी गरुडो महात्मा |` | "Then the mighty, great-souled Garuḍa, creating ninety times ninety mouths," |
| `Line 4021: नदीः समापीय मुखैस्ततस्तैः; सुशीघ्रमागम्य पुनर्जवेन ||२४||` | "Drank up rivers with those mouths, and swiftly returned with speed. ||24||" |
| `Line 4022: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4023: ज्वलन्तमग्निं तममित्रतापनः; समास्तरत्पत्ररथो नदीभिः |` | "The tormentor of enemies [Garuḍa], riding on wings, extinguished the blazing fire with those rivers," |
| `Line 4024: ततः प्रचक्रे वपुरन्यदल्पं; प्रवेष्टुकामोऽग्निमभिप्रशाम्य ||२५||` | "Then, having quenched the fire, he made his body small, desiring to enter. ||25||" |
| `Line 4025: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 401: यदाश्रौषं भीष्मममित्रकर्शनं; निघ्नन्तमाजावयुतं रथानाम् |` | "When I heard that Bhishma, the tormentor of foes, was destroying ten thousand chariots in battle," |
| `Line 402: नैषां कश्चिद्वध्यते दृश्यरूप; स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२५||` | "Yet none of our visible warriors was being slain, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||125||" |
| `Line 403: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 404: यदाश्रौषं भीष्ममत्यन्तशूरं; हतं पार्थेनाहवेष्वप्रधृष्यम् |` | "When I heard that Bhishma, the extremely valiant one, unconquerable in battles, was slain by Partha [Arjuna]," |
| `Line 405: शिखण्डिनं पुरतः स्थापयित्वा; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२६||` | "After placing Shikhandi in front, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||126||" |
| `Line 406: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 407: यदाश्रौषं शरतल्पे शयानं; वृद्धं वीरं सादितं चित्रपुङ्खैः |` | "When I heard that the aged hero was lying on a bed of arrows, brought down by variegated-feathered shafts," |
| `Line 408: भीष्मं कृत्वा सोमकानल्पशेषां; स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२७||` | "And that Bhishma had reduced the Somakas [Pandava allies] to a small remnant, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||127||" |
| `Line 409: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 410: यदाश्रौषं शान्तनवे शयाने; पानीयार्थे चोदितेनार्जुनेन |` | "When I heard that while the son of Shantanu [Bhishma] was lying wounded, Arjuna, being urged for water," |
| `Line 411: भूमिं भित्त्वा तर्पितं तत्र भीष्मं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२८||` | "Pierced the earth and satisfied Bhishma's thirst there, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||128||" |
| `Line 412: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 413: यदाश्रौषं शुक्रसूर्यौ च युक्तौ; कौन्तेयानामनुलोमौ जयाय |` | "When I heard that Venus and the Sun were favorably positioned for the victory of the sons of Kunti [Pandavas]," |
| `Line 414: नित्यं चास्माञ्श्वापदा व्याभषन्त; स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२९||` | "And that wild beasts were constantly frightening us, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||129||" |
| `Line 415: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 416: यदा द्रोणो विविधानस्त्रमार्गा; न्विदर्शयन्समरे चित्रयोधी |` | "When Drona, displaying various paths of weapons in battle, fighting wonderfully," |
| `Line 417: न पाण्डवाञ्श्रेष्ठतमान्निहन्ति; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३०||` | "Could not slay the foremost of the Pandavas, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||130||" |
| `Line 418: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 419: यदाश्रौषं चास्मदीयान्महारथा; न्व्यवस्थितानर्जुनस्यान्तकाय |` | "When I heard that our great warriors, who had positioned themselves to kill Arjuna," |
| `Line 420: संशप्तकान्निहतानर्जुनेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३१||` | "The Samsaptakas [oath-bound warriors], were slain by Arjuna, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||131||" |
| `Line 421: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 422: यदाश्रौषं व्यूहमभेद्यमन्यै; र्भारद्वाजेनात्तशस्त्रेण गुप्तम् |` | "When I heard that the formation, impenetrable to others, protected by the armed son of Bharadvaja [Drona]," |
| `Line 423: भित्त्वा सौभद्रं वीरमेकं प्रविष्टं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३२||` | "Was penetrated by the heroic son of Subhadra [Abhimanyu] who entered alone, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||132||" |
| `Line 424: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 425: यदाभिमन्युं परिवार्य बालं; सर्वे हत्वा हृष्टरूपा बभूवुः |` | "When all our warriors, having surrounded the young Abhimanyu, slew him and became joyful," |
translations: | `Line 401: यदाश्रौषं भीष्मममित्रकर्शनं; निघ्नन्तमाजावयुतं रथानाम् |` | "When I heard that Bhishma, the tormentor of foes, was destroying ten thousand chariots in battle," |
| `Line 402: नैषां कश्चिद्वध्यते दृश्यरूप; स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२५||` | "Yet none of our visible warriors was being slain, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||125||" |
| `Line 403: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 406: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 411: भूमिं भित्त्वा तर्पितं तत्र भीष्मं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२८||` | "Pierced the earth and satisfied Bhishma's thirst there, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||128||" |

| `Line 414: नित्यं चास्माञ्श्वापदा व्याभषन्त; स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१२९||` | "And that wild beasts were constantly frightening us, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||129||" |
| `Line 415: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 417: न पाण्डवाञ्श्रेष्ठतमान्निहन्ति; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३०||` | "Could not slay the foremost of the Pandavas, then, O Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||130||" |

| `Line 4026: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4027: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4028: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4029: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4030: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4031: २९` | "29 [chapter number]" |
| `Line 4032: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4033: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4034: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4035: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4036: जाम्बूनदमयो भूत्वा मरीचिविकचोज्ज्वलः |` | "Becoming golden [jāmbūnada-gold] and radiant with gleaming rays," |
| `Line 4037: प्रविवेश बलात्पक्षी वारिवेग इवार्णवम् ||१||` | "The bird forcefully entered, like a torrent of water into the ocean. ||1||" |
| `Line 4038: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4039: स चक्रं क्षुरपर्यन्तमपश्यदमृतान्तिके |` | "Near the amṛta [immortality nectar], he saw a wheel with razor-sharp edges," |
| `Line 4040: परिभ्रमन्तमनिशं तीक्ष्णधारमयस्मयम् ||२||` | "Revolving continuously, with a keen iron edge. ||2||" |
| `Line 4041: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4042: ज्वलनार्कप्रभं घोरं छेदनं सोमहारिणाम् |` | "Terrible, with the brilliance of fire and sun, a cutter of Soma [nectar] thieves," |
| `Line 4043: घोररूपं तदत्यर्थं यन्त्रं देवैः सुनिर्मितम् ||३||` | "That exceedingly fearsome device was well-constructed by the gods. ||3||" |
| `Line 4044: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4045: तस्यान्तरं स दृष्ट्वैव पर्यवर्तत खेचरः |` | "Seeing the gap within it, the sky-traveler [bird] circled around," |
| `Line 4046: अरान्तरेणाभ्यपतत्सङ्क्षिप्याङ्गं क्षणेन ह ||४||` | "And in an instant, contracting his body, he darted between the spokes. ||4||" |
| `Line 4047: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4048: अधश्चक्रस्य चैवात्र दीप्तानलसमद्युती |` | "And below the wheel, with a brilliance like blazing fire," |
| `Line 4049: विद्युज्जिह्वौ महाघोरौ दीप्तास्यौ दीप्तलोचनौ ||५||` | "Were two terrifying beings with lightning-like tongues, blazing mouths, and glowing eyes. ||5||" |
| `Line 4050: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4051: चक्षुर्विषौ महावीर्यौ नित्यक्रुद्धौ तरस्विनौ |` | "He saw two serpent-lords with poison in their eyes, of great power, perpetually angry, and fierce," |
| `Line 4052: रक्षार्थमेवामृतस्य ददर्श भुजगोत्तमौ ||६||` | "The two excellent serpents [bhujagottamau] stationed there for the protection of the amṛta [nectar of immortality]. ||6||" |
| `Line 4053: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4054: सदा संरब्धनयनौ सदा चानिमिषेक्षणौ |` | "Always with enraged eyes and always with unblinking gaze," |
| `Line 4055: तयोरेकोऽपि यं पश्येत्स तूर्णं भस्मसाद्भवेत् ||७||` | "Whomever even one of them would look at would instantly be reduced to ashes. ||7||" |
| `Line 4056: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4057: तयोश्चक्षूंषि रजसा सुपर्णस्तूर्णमावृणोत् |` | "Suparṇa [Garuḍa] quickly covered their eyes with dust," |
| `Line 4058: अदृष्टरूपस्तौ चापि सर्वतः पर्यकालयत् ||८||` | "And while remaining invisible himself, he observed them from all sides. ||8||" |
| `Line 4059: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4060: तयोरङ्गे समाक्रम्य वैनतेयोऽन्तरिक्षगः |` | "Vainateya [son of Vinatā], the sky-traveler, attacking their bodies," |
| `Line 4061: आच्छिनत्तरसा मध्ये सोममभ्यद्रवत्ततः ||९||` | "Cut through between them swiftly and then rushed toward the Soma [amṛta]. ||9||" |
| `Line 4062: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4063: समुत्पाट्यामृतं तत्तु वैनतेयस्ततो बली |` | "Having snatched that amṛta, the mighty Vainateya [Garuḍa]," |
| `Line 4064: उत्पपात जवेनैव यन्त्रमुन्मथ्य वीर्यवान् ||१०||` | "Flew up with great speed, having destroyed the mechanism [protective device], the powerful one. ||10||" |
| `Line 4065: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4066: अपीत्वैवामृतं पक्षी परिगृह्याशु वीर्यवान् |` | "Without drinking the amṛta, the powerful bird, quickly seizing it," |
| `Line 4067: अगच्छदपरिश्रान्त आवार्यार्कप्रभां खगः ||११||` | "Departed untired, the bird [khaga] warding off the sun's radiance. ||11||" |
| `Line 4068: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4069: विष्णुना तु तदाकाशे वैनतेयः समेयिवान् |` | "Then in the sky, Vainateya [Garuḍa] encountered Viṣṇu [preserver deity]," |
| `Line 4070: तस्य नारायणस्तुष्टस्तेनालौल्येन कर्मणा ||१२||` | "Nārāyaṇa [Viṣṇu] was pleased with him for that steadfast deed. ||12||" |
| `Line 4071: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4072: तमुवाचाव्ययो देवो वरदोऽस्मीति खेचरम् |` | "The imperishable god said to the sky-traveler, 'I am ready to grant you a boon,'" |
| `Line 4073: स वव्रे तव तिष्ठेयमुपरीत्यन्तरिक्षगः ||१३||` | "He chose: 'May I remain above you,' said the sky-traveler. ||13||" |
| `Line 4074: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4075: उवाच चैनं भूयोऽपि नारायणमिदं वचः |` | "And he spoke these words again to Nārāyaṇa [Viṣṇu]:" |
translations: | `Line 4051: चक्षुर्विषौ महावीर्यौ नित्यक्रुद्धौ तरस्विनौ |` | "He saw two serpent-lords with poison in their eyes, of great power, perpetually angry, and fierce," |
| `Line 4052: रक्षार्थमेवामृतस्य ददर्श भुजगोत्तमौ ||६||` | "The two excellent serpents [bhujagottamau] stationed there for the protection of the amṛta [nectar of immortality]. ||6||" |
| `Line 4053: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4054: सदा संरब्धनयनौ सदा चानिमिषेक्षणौ |` | "Always with enraged eyes and always with unblinking gaze," |
| `Line 4055: तयोरेकोऽपि यं पश्येत्स तूर्णं भस्मसाद्भवेत् ||७||` | "Whomever even one of them would look at would instantly be reduced to ashes. ||7||" |
| `Line 4056: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4057: तयोश्चक्षूंषि रजसा सुपर्णस्तूर्णमावृणोत् |` | "Suparṇa [Garuḍa] quickly covered their eyes with dust," |
| `Line 4058: अदृष्टरूपस्तौ चापि सर्वतः पर्यकालयत् ||८||` | "And while remaining invisible himself, he observed them from all sides. ||8||" |
| `Line 4059: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4060: तयोरङ्गे समाक्रम्य वैनतेयोऽन्तरिक्षगः |` | "Vainateya [son of Vinatā], the sky-traveler, attacking their bodies," |
| `Line 4061: आच्छिनत्तरसा मध्ये सोममभ्यद्रवत्ततः ||९||` | "Cut through between them swiftly and then rushed toward the Soma [amṛta]. ||9||" |
| `Line 4062: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4063: समुत्पाट्यामृतं तत्तु वैनतेयस्ततो बली |` | "Having snatched that amṛta, the mighty Vainateya [Garuḍa]," |
| `Line 4064: उत्पपात जवेनैव यन्त्रमुन्मथ्य वीर्यवान् ||१०||` | "Flew up with great speed, having destroyed the mechanism [protective device], the powerful one. ||10||" |
| `Line 4065: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4066: अपीत्वैवामृतं पक्षी परिगृह्याशु वीर्यवान् |` | "Without drinking the amṛta, the powerful bird, quickly seizing it," |
| `Line 4067: अगच्छदपरिश्रान्त आवार्यार्कप्रभां खगः ||११||` | "Departed untired, the bird [khaga] warding off the sun's radiance. ||11||" |
| `Line 4068: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4069: विष्णुना तु तदाकाशे वैनतेयः समेयिवान् |` | "Then in the sky, Vainateya [Garuḍa] encountered Viṣṇu [preserver deity]," |
| `Line 4070: तस्य नारायणस्तुष्टस्तेनालौल्येन कर्मणा ||१२||` | "Nārāyaṇa [Viṣṇu] was pleased with him for that steadfast deed. ||12||" |
| `Line 4071: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4072: तमुवाचाव्ययो देवो वरदोऽस्मीति खेचरम् |` | "The imperishable god said to the sky-traveler, 'I am ready to grant you a boon,'" |
| `Line 4073: स वव्रे तव तिष्ठेयमुपरीत्यन्तरिक्षगः ||१३||` | "He chose: 'May I remain above you,' said the sky-traveler. ||13||" |

| `Line 4075: उवाच चैनं भूयोऽपि नारायणमिदं वचः |` | "And he spoke these words again to Nārāyaṇa [Viṣṇu]:" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4076: अजरश्चामरश्च स्याममृतेन विनाप्यहम् ||१४||` | "I shall be ageless and immortal even without amṛta [nectar of immortality]. ||14||" |
| `Line 4077: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4078: प्रतिगृह्य वरौ तौ च गरुडो विष्णुमब्रवीत् |` | "Having received those two boons, Garuḍa said to Viṣṇu [preserver deity]:" |
| `Line 4079: भवतेऽपि वरं दद्मि वृणीतां भगवानपि ||१५||` | "I also give a boon to you; may the Lord choose one as well. ||15||" |
| `Line 4080: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4081: तं वव्रे वाहनं कृष्णो गरुत्मन्तं महाबलम् |` | "Kṛṣṇa [Viṣṇu] chose him, the mighty Garutmān [Garuḍa], as his vehicle," |
| `Line 4082: ध्वजं च चक्रे भगवानुपरि स्थास्यसीति तम् ||१६||` | "And the Lord made him his emblem, saying, 'You shall remain above me.' ||16||" |
| `Line 4083: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4084: अनुपत्य खगं त्विन्द्रो वज्रेणाङ्गेऽभ्यताडयत् |` | "But Indra [king of gods], pursuing the bird, struck him on his body with the vajra [thunderbolt]," |
| `Line 4085: विहङ्गमं सुरामित्रं हरन्तममृतं बलात् ||१७||` | "The bird who was an enemy of the gods, forcibly carrying away the amṛta [nectar]. ||17||" |
| `Line 4086: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4087: तमुवाचेन्द्रमाक्रन्दे गरुडः पततां वरः |` | "Garuḍa, the best of birds, addressed Indra in his attack," |
| `Line 4088: प्रहसञ्श्लक्ष्णया वाचा तथा वज्रसमाहतः ||१८||` | "Laughing, with smooth speech, even though struck by the vajra [thunderbolt]: ||18||" |
| `Line 4089: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4090: ऋषेर्मानं करिष्यामि वज्रं यस्यास्थिसम्भवम् |` | "I shall honor the sage whose bones became the vajra [thunderbolt]," |
| `Line 4091: वज्रस्य च करिष्यामि तव चैव शतक्रतो ||१९||` | "And I shall honor the vajra [thunderbolt] and you too, O Śatakratu [Indra]. ||19||" |
| `Line 4092: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4093: एष पत्रं त्यजाम्येकं यस्यान्तं नोपलप्स्यसे |` | "I shall drop this one feather, the end of which you will not find," |
| `Line 4094: न हि वज्रनिपातेन रुजा मेऽस्ति कदाचन ||२०||` | "For the strike of the vajra [thunderbolt] causes me no pain whatsoever. ||20||" |
| `Line 4095: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4096: तत्र तं सर्वभूतानि विस्मितान्यब्रुवंस्तदा |` | "Then all beings, astonished, said to him," |
| `Line 4097: सुरूपं पत्रमालक्ष्य सुपर्णोऽयं भवत्विति ||२१||` | "Observing the beautiful feather: 'Let him be called Suparṇa [beautiful-winged].' ||21||" |
| `Line 4098: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4099: दृष्ट्वा तदद्भुतं चापि सहस्राक्षः पुरंदरः |` | "And seeing that wonder, Sahasrākṣa [thousand-eyed] Purandara [Indra]," |
| `Line 4100: खगो महदिदं भूतमिति मत्वाभ्यभाषत ||२२||` | "Thinking 'This bird is a great being,' spoke: ||22||" |
translations: | `Line 4076: अजरश्चामरश्च स्याममृतेन विनाप्यहम् ||१४||` | "I shall be ageless and immortal even without amṛta [nectar of immortality]. ||14||" |
| `Line 4077: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4078: प्रतिगृह्य वरौ तौ च गरुडो विष्णुमब्रवीत् |` | "Having received those two boons, Garuḍa said to Viṣṇu [preserver deity]:" |

| `Line 4099: दृष्ट्वा तदद्भुतं चापि सहस्राक्षः पुरंदरः |` | "And seeing that wonder, Sahasrākṣa [thousand-eyed] Purandara [Indra]," |
