|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4101: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4102: बलं विज्ञातुमिच्छामि यत्ते परमनुत्तमम् |` | "I wish to know your strength, which is supreme and unsurpassed," |
| `Line 4103: सख्यं चानन्तमिच्छामि त्वया सह खगोत्तम ||२३||` | "And I desire eternal friendship with you, O best of birds [Garuḍa]. ||23||" |
| `Line 4104: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4105: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4106: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4107: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4108: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4109: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4110: ३०` | "30" |
| `Line 4111: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4112: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4113: गरुड उवाच||` | "Garuḍa said:" |
| `Line 4114: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4115: सख्यं मेऽस्तु त्वया देव यथेच्छसि पुरंदर |` | "Let there be friendship between us, O god, as you wish, Purandara [Indra, destroyer of cities]," |
| `Line 4116: बलं तु मम जानीहि महच्चासह्यमेव च ||१||` | "But know my strength to be great and indeed irresistible. ||1||" |
| `Line 4117: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4118: कामं नैतत्प्रशंसन्ति सन्तः स्वबलसंस्तवम् |` | "Indeed, the virtuous do not approve of this—praising one's own strength," |
| `Line 4119: गुणसङ्कीर्तनं चापि स्वयमेव शतक्रतो ||२||` | "And also the proclamation of one's own qualities, O Śatakratu [Indra, performer of hundred sacrifices]. ||2||" |
| `Line 4120: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4121: सखेति कृत्वा तु सखे पृष्टो वक्ष्याम्यहं त्वया |` | "But considering you as a friend, O friend, being asked by you, I shall speak," |
| `Line 4122: न ह्यात्मस्तवसंयुक्तं वक्तव्यमनिमित्ततः ||३||` | "For one should not speak words of self-praise without cause. ||3||" |
| `Line 4123: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4124: सपर्वतवनामुर्वीं ससागरवनामिमाम् |` | "This earth with its mountains and forests, with its oceans and woods," |
| `Line 4125: पक्षनाड्यैकया शक्र त्वां चैवात्रावलम्बिनम् ||४||` | "With a single quill of my wing, O Śakra [Indra], I could carry it with you clinging to it. ||4||" |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4126: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4127: सर्वान्सम्पिण्डितान्वापि लोकान्सस्थाणुजङ्गमान् |` | "I could carry all the worlds combined, with their stationary and moving beings," |
| `Line 4128: वहेयमपरिश्रान्तो विद्धीदं मे महद्बलम् ||५||` | "I would carry them without fatigue - know this to be my great strength. ||5||" |
| `Line 4129: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4130: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4131: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4132: इत्युक्तवचनं वीरं किरीटी श्रीमतां वरः |` | "To the heroic one who spoke these words, Kirīṭī [Indra, crown-wearer], the best among the glorious," |
| `Line 4133: आह शौनक देवेन्द्रः सर्वभूतहितः प्रभुः ||६||` | "Said, O Śaunaka, the lord of gods, the master who is beneficial to all beings: ||6||" |
| `Line 4134: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4135: प्रतिगृह्यतामिदानीं मे सख्यमानन्त्यमुत्तमम् |` | "Accept now my eternal and supreme friendship," |
| `Line 4136: न कार्यं तव सोमेन मम सोमः प्रदीयताम् ||७||` | "You have no need for Soma [sacred elixir], let the Soma be given to me. ||7||" |
| `Line 4137: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4138: अस्मांस्ते हि प्रबाधेयुर्येभ्यो दद्याद्भवानिमम् ||७||` | "Those to whom you would give this would indeed trouble us. ||7||" |
| `Line 4139: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4140: गरुड उवाच||` | "Garuḍa [divine eagle] said:" |
| `Line 4141: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4142: किञ्चित्कारणमुद्दिश्य सोमोऽयं नीयते मया |` | "For a certain purpose this Soma is being carried by me," |
| `Line 4143: न दास्यामि समादातुं सोमं कस्मैचिदप्यहम् ||८||` | "I will not give the Soma to anyone to take away. ||8||" |
| `Line 4144: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4145: यत्रेमं तु सहस्राक्ष निक्षिपेयमहं स्वयम् |` | "But where I myself would place this, O Sahasrākṣa [thousand-eyed Indra]," |
| `Line 4146: त्वमादाय ततस्तूर्णं हरेथास्त्रिदशेश्वर ||९||` | "You may quickly take it from there, O lord of the Tridaśas [thirty gods]. ||9||" |
| `Line 4147: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4148: शक्र उवाच||` | "Śakra [Indra] said:" |
| `Line 4149: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4150: वाक्येनानेन तुष्टोऽहं यत्त्वयोक्तमिहाण्डज |` | "I am pleased with these words that you have spoken here, O Aṇḍaja [egg-born one]," |
translations: | `Line 4126: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4127: सर्वान्सम्पिण्डितान्वापि लोकान्सस्थाणुजङ्गमान् |` | "I could carry all the worlds combined, with their stationary and moving beings," |
| `Line 4128: वहेयमपरिश्रान्तो विद्धीदं मे महद्बलम् ||५||` | "I would carry them without fatigue - know this to be my great strength. ||5||" |
| `Line 4129: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4130: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4131: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4132: इत्युक्तवचनं वीरं किरीटी श्रीमतां वरः |` | "To the heroic one who spoke these words, Kirīṭī [Indra, crown-wearer], the best among the glorious," |
| `Line 4133: आह शौनक देवेन्द्रः सर्वभूतहितः प्रभुः ||६||` | "Said, O Śaunaka, the lord of gods, the master who is beneficial to all beings: ||6||" |
| `Line 4134: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4135: प्रतिगृह्यतामिदानीं मे सख्यमानन्त्यमुत्तमम् |` | "Accept now my eternal and supreme friendship," |
| `Line 4136: न कार्यं तव सोमेन मम सोमः प्रदीयताम् ||७||` | "You have no need for Soma [sacred elixir], let the Soma be given to me. ||7||" |
| `Line 4137: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4138: अस्मांस्ते हि प्रबाधेयुर्येभ्यो दद्याद्भवानिमम् ||७||` | "Those to whom you would give this would indeed trouble us. ||7||" |
| `Line 4139: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4140: गरुड उवाच||` | "Garuḍa [divine eagle] said:" |
| `Line 4141: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4142: किञ्चित्कारणमुद्दिश्य सोमोऽयं नीयते मया |` | "For a certain purpose this Soma is being carried by me," |
| `Line 4143: न दास्यामि समादातुं सोमं कस्मैचिदप्यहम् ||८||` | "I will not give the Soma to anyone to take away. ||8||" |
| `Line 4144: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4145: यत्रेमं तु सहस्राक्ष निक्षिपेयमहं स्वयम् |` | "But where I myself would place this, O Sahasrākṣa [thousand-eyed Indra]," |
| `Line 4146: त्वमादाय ततस्तूर्णं हरेथास्त्रिदशेश्वर ||९||` | "You may quickly take it from there, O lord of the Tridaśas [thirty gods]. ||9||" |
| `Line 4147: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4148: शक्र उवाच||` | "Śakra [Indra] said:" |
| `Line 4149: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4150: वाक्येनानेन तुष्टोऽहं यत्त्वयोक्तमिहाण्डज |` | "I am pleased with these words that you have spoken here, O Aṇḍaja [egg-born one]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4151: यदिच्छसि वरं मत्तस्तद्गृहाण खगोत्तम ||१०||` | "If you desire a boon from me, then take it, O best of birds [Garuḍa]. ||10||" |
| `Line 4152: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4153: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4154: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4155: इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचेदं कद्रूपुत्राननुस्मरन् |` | "Thus addressed, he replied this, remembering the sons of Kadrū [serpents]," |
| `Line 4156: स्मृत्वा चैवोपधिकृतं मातुर्दास्यनिमित्ततः ||११||` | "And recalling the deception that caused his mother's enslavement. ||11||" |
| `Line 4157: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4158: ईशोऽहमपि सर्वस्य करिष्यामि तु तेऽर्थिताम् |` | "Though I am lord of all, I will fulfill your request," |
| `Line 4159: भवेयुर्भुजगाः शक्र मम भक्ष्या महाबलाः ||१२||` | "Let the mighty serpents, O Śakra [Indra], become my food. ||12||" |
| `Line 4160: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4161: तथेत्युक्त्वान्वगच्छत्तं ततो दानवसूदनः |` | "Having said 'so be it,' the slayer of Dānavas [Indra] then followed him," |
| `Line 4162: हरिष्यामि विनिक्षिप्तं सोममित्यनुभाष्य तम् ||१३||` | "After telling him, 'I will take away the Soma [nectar] once it is set down.' ||13||" |
| `Line 4163: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4164: आजगाम ततस्तूर्णं सुपर्णो मातुरन्तिकम् |` | "Then Suparṇa [Garuḍa] swiftly came to his mother's presence," |
| `Line 4165: अथ सर्पानुवाचेदं सर्वान्परमहृष्टवत् ||१४||` | "And then spoke to all the serpents as if extremely delighted. ||14||" |
| `Line 4166: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4167: इदमानीतममृतं निक्षेप्स्यामि कुशेषु वः |` | "I have brought this amṛta [nectar of immortality] and will place it on kuśa grass for you," |
| `Line 4168: स्नाता मङ्गलसंयुक्तास्ततः प्राश्नीत पन्नगाः ||१५||` | "After bathing and performing auspicious rites, then partake of it, O serpents. ||15||" |
| `Line 4169: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4170: अदासी चैव मातेयमद्यप्रभृति चास्तु मे |` | "And let my mother be free from slavery from this day forward," |
| `Line 4171: यथोक्तं भवतामेतद्वचो मे प्रतिपादितम् ||१६||` | "As you had stated, your words have been fulfilled by me. ||16||" |
| `Line 4172: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4173: ततः स्नातुं गताः सर्पाः प्रत्युक्त्वा तं तथेत्युत |` | "Then the serpents went to bathe after replying to him, 'So be it,'" |
| `Line 4174: शक्रोऽप्यमृतमाक्षिप्य जगाम त्रिदिवं पुनः ||१७||` | "And Śakra [Indra], having snatched away the amṛta [nectar], returned to Tridiva [heaven] again. ||17||" |
| `Line 4175: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4151: यदिच्छसि वरं मत्तस्तद्गृहाण खगोत्तम ||१०||` | "If you desire a boon from me, then take it, O best of birds [Garuḍa]. ||10||" |
| `Line 4152: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4153: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4154: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4155: इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचेदं कद्रूपुत्राननुस्मरन् |` | "Thus addressed, he replied this, remembering the sons of Kadrū [serpents]," |
| `Line 4156: स्मृत्वा चैवोपधिकृतं मातुर्दास्यनिमित्ततः ||११||` | "And recalling the deception that caused his mother's enslavement. ||11||" |
| `Line 4157: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4158: ईशोऽहमपि सर्वस्य करिष्यामि तु तेऽर्थिताम् |` | "Though I am lord of all, I will fulfill your request," |
| `Line 4159: भवेयुर्भुजगाः शक्र मम भक्ष्या महाबलाः ||१२||` | "Let the mighty serpents, O Śakra [Indra], become my food. ||12||" |
| `Line 4160: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4161: तथेत्युक्त्वान्वगच्छत्तं ततो दानवसूदनः |` | "Having said 'so be it,' the slayer of Dānavas [Indra] then followed him," |

| `Line 4163: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4164: आजगाम ततस्तूर्णं सुपर्णो मातुरन्तिकम् |` | "Then Suparṇa [Garuḍa] swiftly came to his mother's presence," |
| `Line 4165: अथ सर्पानुवाचेदं सर्वान्परमहृष्टवत् ||१४||` | "And then spoke to all the serpents as if extremely delighted. ||14||" |

| `Line 4167: इदमानीतममृतं निक्षेप्स्यामि कुशेषु वः |` | "I have brought this amṛta [nectar of immortality] and will place it on kuśa grass for you," |
| `Line 4168: स्नाता मङ्गलसंयुक्तास्ततः प्राश्नीत पन्नगाः ||१५||` | "After bathing and performing auspicious rites, then partake of it, O serpents. ||15||" |

| `Line 4172: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4173: ततः स्नातुं गताः सर्पाः प्रत्युक्त्वा तं तथेत्युत |` | "Then the serpents went to bathe after replying to him, 'So be it,'" |
| `Line 4174: शक्रोऽप्यमृतमाक्षिप्य जगाम त्रिदिवं पुनः ||१७||` | "And Śakra [Indra], having snatched away the amṛta [nectar], returned to Tridiva [heaven] again. ||17||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4176: अथागतास्तमुद्देशं सर्पाः सोमार्थिनस्तदा |` | "Then the serpents, seeking the Soma [sacred elixir], arrived at that place," |
| `Line 4177: स्नाताश्च कृतजप्याश्च प्रहृष्टाः कृतमङ्गलाः ||१८||` | "Bathed, having performed their prayers, delighted, and having completed auspicious rites. ||18||" |
| `Line 4178: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4179: तद्विज्ञाय हृतं सर्पाः प्रतिमायाकृतं च तत् |` | "The serpents, realizing that it had been taken and replaced with an illusion," |
| `Line 4180: सोमस्थानमिदं चेति दर्भांस्ते लिलिहुस्तदा ||१९||` | "Thinking 'this is the place of Soma,' they licked the darbha grass [sacred grass] then. ||19||" |
| `Line 4181: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4182: ततो द्वैधीकृता जिह्वा सर्पाणां तेन कर्मणा |` | "Then by that action, the tongues of the serpents became split in two," |
| `Line 4183: अभवंश्चामृतस्पर्शाद्दर्भास्तेऽथ पवित्रिणः ||२०||` | "And from the touch of the amṛta [immortal nectar], those darbha grasses became purifiers. ||20||" |
| `Line 4184: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4185: ततः सुपर्णः परमप्रहृष्टवा; न्विहृत्य मात्रा सह तत्र कानने |` | "Then Suparṇa [Garuḍa], extremely delighted, having sported with his mother in that forest," |
| `Line 4186: भुजङ्गभक्षः परमार्चितः खगै; रहीनकीर्तिर्विनतामनन्दयत् ||२१||` | "The serpent-eater, highly honored by birds, with undying fame, brought joy to Vinatā. ||21||" |
| `Line 4187: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4188: इमां कथां यः शृणुयान्नरः सदा; पठेत वा द्विजजनमुख्यसंसदि |` | "The man who always listens to this story or recites it in an assembly headed by the twice-born [Brahmins]," |
| `Line 4189: असंशयं त्रिदिवमियात्स पुण्यभा; ङ्महात्मनः पतगपतेः प्रकीर्तनात् ||२२||` | "Without doubt goes to heaven, partaking of merit from glorifying the great-souled king of birds. ||22||" |
| `Line 4190: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4191: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4192: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4193: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4194: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4195: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4196: ३१` | "31" |
| `Line 4197: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4198: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4200: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4201: भुजङ्गमानां शापस्य मात्रा चैव सुतेन च |` | "The curse of the serpents by the mother and the son," |
| `Line 4202: विनतायास्त्वया प्रोक्तं कारणं सूतनन्दन ||१||` | "The cause of Vinatā's [Garuḍa's mother] situation has been explained by you, O Sūtanandana [son of Sūta]. ||1||" |
| `Line 4203: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4204: वरप्रदानं भर्त्रा च कद्रूविनतयोस्तथा |` | "The granting of boons by the husband to both Kadrū and Vinatā," |
| `Line 4205: नामनी चैव ते प्रोक्ते पक्षिणोर्वैनतेययोः ||२||` | "And you have mentioned the names of the two birds, sons of Vinatā [Garuḍa and Aruṇa]. ||2||" |
| `Line 4206: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4207: पन्नगानां तु नामानि न कीर्तयसि सूतज |` | "But you do not mention the names of the serpents, O son of Sūta," |
| `Line 4208: प्राधान्येनापि नामानि श्रोतुमिच्छामहे वयम् ||३||` | "We wish to hear the names, especially the prominent ones. ||3||" |
| `Line 4209: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4210: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4211: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4212: बहुत्वान्नामधेयानि भुजगानां तपोधन |` | "Due to their great number, the names of the serpents, O Tapodhana [ascetic]," |
| `Line 4213: न कीर्तयिष्ये सर्वेषां प्राधान्येन तु मे शृणु ||४||` | "I will not recite all of them, but listen to me as I name the principal ones. ||4||" |
| `Line 4214: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4215: शेषः प्रथमतो जातो वासुकिस्तदनन्तरम् |` | "Śeṣa [cosmic serpent] was born first, then Vāsuki [serpent king]," |
| `Line 4216: ऐरावतस्तक्षकश्च कर्कोटकधनञ्जयौ ||५||` | "Airāvata, Takṣaka, and Karkoṭaka and Dhanañjaya. ||5||" |
| `Line 4217: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4218: कालियो मणिनागश्च नागश्चापूरणस्तथा |` | "Kāliya [poisonous serpent], Maṇināga, and the serpent Āpūraṇa as well," |
| `Line 4219: नागस्तथा पिञ्जरक एलापत्रोऽथ वामनः ||६||` | "And the serpent Piñjaraka, Elāpatra, and Vāmana. ||6||" |
| `Line 4220: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4221: नीलानीलौ तथा नागौ कल्माषशबलौ तथा |` | "The serpents Nīla and Anīla, as well as Kalmāṣa and Śabala," |
| `Line 4222: आर्यकश्चादिकश्चैव नागश्च शलपोतकः ||७||` | "Āryaka and Ādika, and the serpent Śalapotaka. ||7||" |
| `Line 4223: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4224: सुमनोमुखो दधिमुखस्तथा विमलपिण्डकः |` | "Sumanomukha, Dadhimukha, and Vimalapiṇḍaka," |
| `Line 4225: आप्तः कोटनकश्चैव शङ्खो वालशिखस्तथा ||८||` | "Āpta, Koṭanaka, and Śaṅkha and Vālaśikha as well. ||8||" |
translations: | `Line 4201: भुजङ्गमानां शापस्य मात्रा चैव सुतेन च |` | "The curse of the serpents by the mother and the son," |
| `Line 4202: विनतायास्त्वया प्रोक्तं कारणं सूतनन्दन ||१||` | "The cause of Vinatā's [Garuḍa's mother] situation has been explained by you, O Sūtanandana [son of Sūta]. ||1||" |
| `Line 4203: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4204: वरप्रदानं भर्त्रा च कद्रूविनतयोस्तथा |` | "The granting of boons by the husband to both Kadrū and Vinatā," |
| `Line 4205: नामनी चैव ते प्रोक्ते पक्षिणोर्वैनतेययोः ||२||` | "And you have mentioned the names of the two birds, sons of Vinatā [Garuḍa and Aruṇa]. ||2||" |
| `Line 4206: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4207: पन्नगानां तु नामानि न कीर्तयसि सूतज |` | "But you do not mention the names of the serpents, O son of Sūta," |
| `Line 4208: प्राधान्येनापि नामानि श्रोतुमिच्छामहे वयम् ||३||` | "We wish to hear the names, especially the prominent ones. ||3||" |
| `Line 4209: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4210: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4211: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4212: बहुत्वान्नामधेयानि भुजगानां तपोधन |` | "Due to their great number, the names of the serpents, O Tapodhana [ascetic]," |
| `Line 4213: न कीर्तयिष्ये सर्वेषां प्राधान्येन तु मे शृणु ||४||` | "I will not recite all of them, but listen to me as I name the principal ones. ||4||" |
| `Line 4214: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4215: शेषः प्रथमतो जातो वासुकिस्तदनन्तरम् |` | "Śeṣa [cosmic serpent] was born first, then Vāsuki [serpent king]," |
| `Line 4216: ऐरावतस्तक्षकश्च कर्कोटकधनञ्जयौ ||५||` | "Airāvata, Takṣaka, and Karkoṭaka and Dhanañjaya. ||5||" |
| `Line 4217: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4218: कालियो मणिनागश्च नागश्चापूरणस्तथा |` | "Kāliya [poisonous serpent], Maṇināga, and the serpent Āpūraṇa as well," |
| `Line 4219: नागस्तथा पिञ्जरक एलापत्रोऽथ वामनः ||६||` | "And the serpent Piñjaraka, Elāpatra, and Vāmana. ||6||" |
| `Line 4220: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4221: नीलानीलौ तथा नागौ कल्माषशबलौ तथा |` | "The serpents Nīla and Anīla, as well as Kalmāṣa and Śabala," |
| `Line 4222: आर्यकश्चादिकश्चैव नागश्च शलपोतकः ||७||` | "Āryaka and Ādika, and the serpent Śalapotaka. ||7||" |
| `Line 4223: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4224: सुमनोमुखो दधिमुखस्तथा विमलपिण्डकः |` | "Sumanomukha, Dadhimukha, and Vimalapiṇḍaka," |
| `Line 4225: आप्तः कोटनकश्चैव शङ्खो वालशिखस्तथा ||८||` | "Āpta, Koṭanaka, and Śaṅkha and Vālaśikha as well. ||8||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4226: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4227: निष्ठ्यूनको हेमगुहो नहुषः पिङ्गलस्तथा |` | "Niṣṭhyūnaka, Hemaguha, Nahuṣa [ancient king], and Piṅgala," |
| `Line 4228: बाह्यकर्णो हस्तिपदस्तथा मुद्गरपिण्डकः ||९||` | "Bāhyakarṇa, Hastipada, and Mudgarapiṇḍaka. ||9||" |
| `Line 4229: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4230: कम्बलाश्वतरौ चापि नागः कालीयकस्तथा |` | "Kambala and Aśvatara, and also the serpent Kālīyaka [black serpent]," |
| `Line 4231: वृत्तसंवर्तकौ नागौ द्वौ च पद्माविति श्रुतौ ||१०||` | "The two serpents Vṛtta and Saṃvartaka, and the two known as Padma. ||10||" |
| `Line 4232: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4233: नागः शङ्खनकश्चैव तथा च स्फण्डकोऽपरः |` | "The serpent Śaṅkhanaka, and also another named Sphaṇḍaka," |
| `Line 4234: क्षेमकश्च महानागो नागः पिण्डारकस्तथा ||११||` | "And Kṣemaka the great serpent, and the serpent Piṇḍāraka. ||11||" |
| `Line 4235: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4236: करवीरः पुष्पदंष्ट्र एळको बिल्वपाण्डुकः |` | "Karavīra, Puṣpadaṃṣṭra, Eḷaka, Bilvapāṇḍuka," |
| `Line 4237: मूषकादः शङ्खशिराः पूर्णदंष्ट्रो हरिद्रकः ||१२||` | "Mūṣakāda, Śaṅkaśirāḥ, Pūrṇadaṃṣṭra, and Haridrakā. ||12||" |
| `Line 4238: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4239: अपराजितो ज्योतिकश्च पन्नगः श्रीवहस्तथा |` | "Aparājita [unconquered], Jyotika, the serpent Śrīvaha," |
| `Line 4240: कौरव्यो धृतराष्ट्रश्च पुष्करः शल्यकस्तथा ||१३||` | "Kauravya, Dhṛtarāṣṭra [blind king], Puṣkara, and Śalyaka. ||13||" |
| `Line 4241: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4242: विरजाश्च सुबाहुश्च शालिपिण्डश्च वीर्यवान् |` | "Virajā, Subāhu, and the mighty Śālipiṇḍa," |
| `Line 4243: हस्तिभद्रः पिठरको मुखरः कोणवासनः ||१४||` | "Hastibhadra, Piṭharaka, Mukhara, and Koṇavāsana. ||14||" |
| `Line 4244: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4245: कुञ्जरः कुररश्चैव तथा नागः प्रभाकरः |` | "Kuñjara, Kurara, and also the serpent Prabhākara [light-maker]," |
| `Line 4246: कुमुदः कुमुदाक्षश्च तित्तिरिर्हलिकस्तथा ||१५||` | "Kumuda, Kumudākṣa, Tittiri, and Halika. ||15||" |
| `Line 4247: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4248: कर्कराकर्करौ चोभौ कुण्डोदरमहोदरौ ||१५||` | "Both Karkara and Akarkara, and Kuṇḍodara and Mahodara. ||15||" |
| `Line 4249: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4250: एते प्राधान्यतो नागाः कीर्तिता द्विजसत्तम |` | "These are the principal serpents [nāgas] mentioned, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |
translations: | `Line 4226: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4227: निष्ठ्यूनको हेमगुहो नहुषः पिङ्गलस्तथा |` | "Niṣṭhyūnaka, Hemaguha, Nahuṣa [ancient king], and Piṅgala," |
| `Line 4228: बाह्यकर्णो हस्तिपदस्तथा मुद्गरपिण्डकः ||९||` | "Bāhyakarṇa, Hastipada, and Mudgarapiṇḍaka. ||9||" |
| `Line 4229: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4230: कम्बलाश्वतरौ चापि नागः कालीयकस्तथा |` | "Kambala and Aśvatara, and also the serpent Kālīyaka [black serpent]," |
| `Line 4231: वृत्तसंवर्तकौ नागौ द्वौ च पद्माविति श्रुतौ ||१०||` | "The two serpents Vṛtta and Saṃvartaka, and the two known as Padma. ||10||" |
| `Line 4232: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4233: नागः शङ्खनकश्चैव तथा च स्फण्डकोऽपरः |` | "The serpent Śaṅkhanaka, and also another named Sphaṇḍaka," |
| `Line 4234: क्षेमकश्च महानागो नागः पिण्डारकस्तथा ||११||` | "And Kṣemaka the great serpent, and the serpent Piṇḍāraka. ||11||" |
| `Line 4235: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4236: करवीरः पुष्पदंष्ट्र एळको बिल्वपाण्डुकः |` | "Karavīra, Puṣpadaṃṣṭra, Eḷaka, Bilvapāṇḍuka," |
| `Line 4237: मूषकादः शङ्खशिराः पूर्णदंष्ट्रो हरिद्रकः ||१२||` | "Mūṣakāda, Śaṅkaśirāḥ, Pūrṇadaṃṣṭra, and Haridrakā. ||12||" |
| `Line 4238: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4239: अपराजितो ज्योतिकश्च पन्नगः श्रीवहस्तथा |` | "Aparājita [unconquered], Jyotika, the serpent Śrīvaha," |
| `Line 4240: कौरव्यो धृतराष्ट्रश्च पुष्करः शल्यकस्तथा ||१३||` | "Kauravya, Dhṛtarāṣṭra [blind king], Puṣkara, and Śalyaka. ||13||" |
| `Line 4241: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4242: विरजाश्च सुबाहुश्च शालिपिण्डश्च वीर्यवान् |` | "Virajā, Subāhu, and the mighty Śālipiṇḍa," |
| `Line 4243: हस्तिभद्रः पिठरको मुखरः कोणवासनः ||१४||` | "Hastibhadra, Piṭharaka, Mukhara, and Koṇavāsana. ||14||" |
| `Line 4244: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4245: कुञ्जरः कुररश्चैव तथा नागः प्रभाकरः |` | "Kuñjara, Kurara, and also the serpent Prabhākara [light-maker]," |
| `Line 4246: कुमुदः कुमुदाक्षश्च तित्तिरिर्हलिकस्तथा ||१५||` | "Kumuda, Kumudākṣa, Tittiri, and Halika. ||15||" |
| `Line 4247: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4248: कर्कराकर्करौ चोभौ कुण्डोदरमहोदरौ ||१५||` | "Both Karkara and Akarkara, and Kuṇḍodara and Mahodara. ||15||" |
| `Line 4249: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4250: एते प्राधान्यतो नागाः कीर्तिता द्विजसत्तम |` | "These are the principal serpents [nāgas] mentioned, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4251: बहुत्वान्नामधेयानामितरे न प्रकीर्तिताः ||१६||` | "Due to the multitude of names, the others have not been enumerated. ||16||" |
| `Line 4252: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4253: एतेषां प्रसवो यश्च प्रसवस्य च सन्ततिः |` | "Their offspring and the progeny of that offspring," |
| `Line 4254: असङ्ख्येयेति मत्वा तान्न ब्रवीमि द्विजोत्तम ||१७||` | "Considering them to be innumerable, I do not describe them, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]. ||17||" |
| `Line 4255: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4256: बहूनीह सहस्राणि प्रयुतान्यर्बुदानि च |` | "Many thousands, millions, and hundreds of millions," |
| `Line 4257: अशक्यान्येव सङ्ख्यातुं भुजगानां तपोधन ||१८||` | "It is impossible to count the serpents, O wealth of austerities [ascetic sage]. ||18||" |
| `Line 4258: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4259: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4260: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4261: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4262: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4263: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4264: ३२` | "32" |
| `Line 4265: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4266: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4267: शौनक उवाच||` | "Śaunaka [sage, listener] said:" |
| `Line 4268: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4269: जाता वै भुजगास्तात वीर्यवन्तो दुरासदाः |` | "Born indeed were the serpents, dear one, powerful and unapproachable," |
| `Line 4270: शापं तं त्वथ विज्ञाय कृतवन्तो नु किं परम् ||१||` | "After knowing that curse, what else did they do? ||1||" |
| `Line 4271: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4272: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4273: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4274: तेषां तु भगवाञ्शेषस्त्यक्त्वा कद्रूं महायशाः |` | "Among them, the illustrious lord Śeṣa [cosmic serpent], abandoning Kadrū [serpent mother]," |
| `Line 4275: तपो विपुलमातस्थे वायुभक्षो यतव्रतः ||२||` | "Engaged in intense austerities, subsisting on air, with controlled vows. ||2||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 426: महारथाः पार्थमशक्नुवन्त; स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३३||` | "When the great warriors were unable to defeat Pārtha [Arjuna], then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||133||" |
| `Line 427: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 428: यदाश्रौषमभिमन्युं निहत्य; हर्षान्मूढान्क्रोशतो धार्तराष्ट्रान् |` | "When I heard the Dhārtarāṣṭras [Duryodhana's forces] shouting foolishly with joy after slaying Abhimanyu," |
| `Line 429: क्रोधं मुक्तं सैन्धवे चार्जुनेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३४||` | "And Arjuna's unleashed anger against Saindhava [Jayadratha], then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||134||" |
| `Line 430: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 431: यदाश्रौषं सैन्धवार्थे प्रतिज्ञां; प्रतिज्ञातां तद्वधायार्जुनेन |` | "When I heard the vow regarding Saindhava [Jayadratha], the pledge made by Arjuna for his slaying," |
| `Line 432: सत्यां निस्तीर्णां शत्रुमध्ये च तेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३५||` | "And that he fulfilled it truthfully in the midst of enemies, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||135||" |
| `Line 433: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 434: यदाश्रौषं श्रान्तहये धनञ्जये; मुक्त्वा हयान्पाययित्वोपवृत्तान् |` | "When I heard that Dhanañjaya [Arjuna], whose horses were tired, released them, gave them water, and returned," |
| `Line 435: पुनर्युक्त्वा वासुदेवं प्रयातं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३६||` | "And then, yoking them again, proceeded with Vāsudeva [Krishna], then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||136||" |
| `Line 436: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 437: यदाश्रौषं वाहनेष्वाश्वसत्सु; रथोपस्थे तिष्ठता गाण्डिवेन |` | "When I heard that while the horses were resting, standing in his chariot with Gāṇḍīva [Arjuna's bow]," |
| `Line 438: सर्वान्योधान्वारितानर्जुनेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३७||` | "Arjuna warded off all the warriors, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||137||" |
| `Line 439: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 440: यदाश्रौषं नागबलैर्दुरुत्सहं; द्रोणानीकं युयुधानं प्रमथ्य |` | "When I heard that Yuyudhāna [Sātyaki], having crushed Droṇa's formation that was formidable with elephant forces," |
| `Line 441: यातं वार्ष्णेयं यत्र तौ कृष्णपार्थौ; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३८||` | "That Vārṣṇeya [Sātyaki] went to where Krishna and Pārtha [Arjuna] were, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||138||" |
| `Line 442: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 443: यदाश्रौषं कर्णमासाद्य मुक्तं; वधाद्भीमं कुत्सयित्वा वचोभिः |` | "When I heard that Bhīma, having encountered Karṇa, was released from death after being insulted with words," |
| `Line 444: धनुष्कोट्या तुद्य कर्णेन वीरं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३९||` | "And that Karṇa struck the hero with the end of his bow, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||139||" |
| `Line 445: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 446: यदा द्रोणः कृतवर्मा कृपश्च; कर्णो द्रौणिर्मद्रराजश्च शूरः |` | "When Droṇa, Kṛtavarman, Kṛpa, Karṇa, Droṇi [Ashvatthāma], and the heroic king of Madra [Shalya]," |
| `Line 447: अमर्षयन्सैन्धवं वध्यमानं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४०||` | "Could not prevent Saindhava [Jayadratha] from being slain, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||140||" |
| `Line 448: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 449: यदाश्रौषं देवराजेन दत्तां; दिव्यां शक्तिं व्यंसितां माधवेन |` | "When I heard that the divine spear given by the king of gods [Indra] was thwarted by Mādhava [Krishna]," |
| `Line 450: घटोत्कचे राक्षसे घोररूपे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४१||` | "When aimed at the terrifying rākṣasa [demon] Ghaṭotkaca, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||141||" |
translations: | `Line 426: महारथाः पार्थमशक्नुवन्त; स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३३||` | "When the great warriors were unable to defeat Pārtha [Arjuna], then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||133||" |
| `Line 427: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 428: यदाश्रौषमभिमन्युं निहत्य; हर्षान्मूढान्क्रोशतो धार्तराष्ट्रान् |` | "When I heard the Dhārtarāṣṭras [Duryodhana's forces] shouting foolishly with joy after slaying Abhimanyu," |
| `Line 429: क्रोधं मुक्तं सैन्धवे चार्जुनेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३४||` | "And Arjuna's unleashed anger against Saindhava [Jayadratha], then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||134||" |
| `Line 430: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 431: यदाश्रौषं सैन्धवार्थे प्रतिज्ञां; प्रतिज्ञातां तद्वधायार्जुनेन |` | "When I heard the vow regarding Saindhava [Jayadratha], the pledge made by Arjuna for his slaying," |

| `Line 432: सत्यां निस्तीर्णां शत्रुमध्ये च तेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३५||` | "And that he fulfilled it truthfully in the midst of enemies, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||135||" |
| `Line 433: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 434: यदाश्रौषं श्रान्तहये धनञ्जये; मुक्त्वा हयान्पाययित्वोपवृत्तान् |` | "When I heard that Dhanañjaya [Arjuna], whose horses were tired, released them, gave them water, and returned," |
| `Line 435: पुनर्युक्त्वा वासुदेवं प्रयातं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३६||` | "And then, yoking them again, proceeded with Vāsudeva [Krishna], then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||136||" |
| `Line 436: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 437: यदाश्रौषं वाहनेष्वाश्वसत्सु; रथोपस्थे तिष्ठता गाण्डिवेन |` | "When I heard that while the horses were resting, standing in his chariot with Gāṇḍīva [Arjuna's bow]," |
| `Line 438: सर्वान्योधान्वारितानर्जुनेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३७||` | "Arjuna warded off all the warriors, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||137||" |
| `Line 439: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 440: यदाश्रौषं नागबलैर्दुरुत्सहं; द्रोणानीकं युयुधानं प्रमथ्य |` | "When I heard that Yuyudhāna [Sātyaki], having crushed Droṇa's formation that was formidable with elephant forces," |

| `Line 441: यातं वार्ष्णेयं यत्र तौ कृष्णपार्थौ; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३८||` | "That Vārṣṇeya [Sātyaki] went to where Krishna and Pārtha [Arjuna] were, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||138||" |
| `Line 442: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 443: यदाश्रौषं कर्णमासाद्य मुक्तं; वधाद्भीमं कुत्सयित्वा वचोभिः |` | "When I heard that Bhīma, having encountered Karṇa, was released from death after being insulted with words," |
| `Line 444: धनुष्कोट्या तुद्य कर्णेन वीरं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१३९||` | "And that Karṇa struck the hero with the end of his bow, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||139||" |
| `Line 445: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 446: यदा द्रोणः कृतवर्मा कृपश्च; कर्णो द्रौणिर्मद्रराजश्च शूरः |` | "When Droṇa, Kṛtavarman, Kṛpa, Karṇa, Droṇi [Ashvatthāma], and the heroic king of Madra [Shalya]," |
| `Line 447: अमर्षयन्सैन्धवं वध्यमानं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४०||` | "Could not prevent Saindhava [Jayadratha] from being slain, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||140||" |
| `Line 448: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 449: यदाश्रौषं देवराजेन दत्तां; दिव्यां शक्तिं व्यंसितां माधवेन |` | "When I heard that the divine spear given by the king of gods [Indra] was thwarted by Mādhava [Krishna]," |
| `Line 450: घटोत्कचे राक्षसे घोररूपे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४१||` | "When aimed at the terrifying rākṣasa [demon] Ghaṭotkaca, then, O Sañjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||141||" |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4276: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4277: गन्धमादनमासाद्य बदर्यां च तपोरतः |` | "Having reached Gandhamādana [fragrant mountain] and engaged in austerities at Badarī [sacred place]," |
| `Line 4278: गोकर्णे पुष्करारण्ये तथा हिमवतस्तटे ||३||` | "At Gokarṇa [cow's ear site], in Puṣkarāraṇya [lotus forest], and on the slopes of Himavat [Himalayas]. ||3||" |
| `Line 4279: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4280: तेषु तेषु च पुण्येषु तीर्थेष्वायतनेषु च |` | "In those various sacred tīrthas [pilgrimage sites] and temples," |
| `Line 4281: एकान्तशीली नियतः सततं विजितेन्द्रियः ||४||` | "Solitary in habit, disciplined, and always with conquered senses. ||4||" |
| `Line 4282: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4283: तप्यमानं तपो घोरं तं ददर्श पितामहः |` | "Pitāmaha [Brahmā] saw him performing terrible austerities," |
| `Line 4284: परिशुष्कमांसत्वक्स्नायुं जटाचीरधरं प्रभुम् ||५||` | "With dried-up flesh, skin and sinews, wearing matted locks and bark garments, the mighty one. ||5||" |
| `Line 4285: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4286: तमब्रवीत्सत्यधृतिं तप्यमानं पितामहः |` | "Pitāmaha [Brahmā] spoke to Satyadhṛti [Śeṣa, truth-steadfast] who was performing austerities," |
| `Line 4287: किमिदं कुरुषे शेष प्रजानां स्वस्ति वै कुरु ||६||` | "Why are you doing this, Śeṣa? Ensure the welfare of all creatures. ||6||" |
| `Line 4288: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4289: त्वं हि तीव्रेण तपसा प्रजास्तापयसेऽनघ |` | "With your intense austerities, you are causing distress to creatures, O sinless one," |
| `Line 4290: ब्रूहि कामं च मे शेष यत्ते हृदि चिरं स्थितम् ||७||` | "Tell me your desire, Śeṣa, that which has long resided in your heart. ||7||" |
| `Line 4291: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4292: शेष उवाच||` | "Śeṣa [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 4293: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4294: सोदर्या मम सर्वे हि भ्रातरो मन्दचेतसः |` | "All my brothers born of the same womb are dull-witted," |
| `Line 4295: सह तैर्नोत्सहे वस्तुं तद्भवाननुमन्यताम् ||८||` | "I cannot bear to live with them; may you approve of this. ||8||" |
| `Line 4296: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4297: अभ्यसूयन्ति सततं परस्परममित्रवत् |` | "They constantly envy each other like enemies," |
| `Line 4298: ततोऽहं तप आतिष्ठे नैतान्पश्येयमित्युत ||९||` | "Therefore I undertake these austerities so that I may not see them again. ||9||" |
| `Line 4299: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4300: न मर्षयन्ति सततं विनतां ससुतां च ते |` | "They constantly cannot tolerate Vinatā [Garuḍa's mother] and her son," |
translations: | `Line 4276: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4277: गन्धमादनमासाद्य बदर्यां च तपोरतः |` | "Having reached Gandhamādana [fragrant mountain] and engaged in austerities at Badarī [sacred place]," |
| `Line 4278: गोकर्णे पुष्करारण्ये तथा हिमवतस्तटे ||३||` | "At Gokarṇa [cow's ear site], in Puṣkarāraṇya [lotus forest], and on the slopes of Himavat [Himalayas]. ||3||" |
| `Line 4279: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4280: तेषु तेषु च पुण्येषु तीर्थेष्वायतनेषु च |` | "In those various sacred tīrthas [pilgrimage sites] and temples," |
| `Line 4281: एकान्तशीली नियतः सततं विजितेन्द्रियः ||४||` | "Solitary in habit, disciplined, and always with conquered senses. ||4||" |
| `Line 4282: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4283: तप्यमानं तपो घोरं तं ददर्श पितामहः |` | "Pitāmaha [Brahmā] saw him performing terrible austerities," |
| `Line 4284: परिशुष्कमांसत्वक्स्नायुं जटाचीरधरं प्रभुम् ||५||` | "With dried-up flesh, skin and sinews, wearing matted locks and bark garments, the mighty one. ||5||" |
| `Line 4285: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4286: तमब्रवीत्सत्यधृतिं तप्यमानं पितामहः |` | "Pitāmaha [Brahmā] spoke to Satyadhṛti [Śeṣa, truth-steadfast] who was performing austerities," |
| `Line 4287: किमिदं कुरुषे शेष प्रजानां स्वस्ति वै कुरु ||६||` | "Why are you doing this, Śeṣa? Ensure the welfare of all creatures. ||6||" |

| `Line 4298: ततोऽहं तप आतिष्ठे नैतान्पश्येयमित्युत ||९||` | "Therefore I undertake these austerities so that I may not see them again. ||9||" |

| `Line 4300: न मर्षयन्ति सततं विनतां ससुतां च ते |` | "They constantly cannot tolerate Vinatā [Garuḍa's mother] and her son," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4301: अस्माकं चापरो भ्राता वैनतेयः पितामह ||१०||` | "And we have another brother, Vainateya [son of Vinatā], O Pitāmaha [grandfather]. ||10||" |
| `Line 4302: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4303: तं च द्विषन्ति तेऽत्यर्थं स चापि सुमहाबलः |` | "They hate him exceedingly, and he too is of tremendous strength," |
| `Line 4304: वरप्रदानात्स पितुः कश्यपस्य महात्मनः ||११||` | "Due to the boon granted by our father, the great-souled Kaśyapa. ||11||" |
| `Line 4305: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4306: सोऽहं तपः समास्थाय मोक्ष्यामीदं कलेवरम् |` | "I, having undertaken austerities, will abandon this body," |
| `Line 4307: कथं मे प्रेत्यभावेऽपि न तैः स्यात्सह सङ्गमः ||१२||` | "How can I avoid association with them even after death? ||12||" |
| `Line 4308: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4309: ब्रह्मोवाच||` | "Brahmā [creator deity] said:" |
| `Line 4310: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4311: जानामि शेष सर्वेषां भ्रातृणां ते विचेष्टितम् |` | "I know, Śeṣa, the conduct of all your brothers," |
| `Line 4312: मातुश्चाप्यपराधाद्वै भ्रातृणां ते महद्भयम् ||१३||` | "And indeed due to your mother's offense, there is great fear from your brothers. ||13||" |
| `Line 4313: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4314: कृतोऽत्र परिहारश्च पूर्वमेव भुजङ्गम |` | "A remedy for this has already been made, O serpent," |
| `Line 4315: भ्रातृणां तव सर्वेषां न शोकं कर्तुमर्हसि ||१४||` | "You should not grieve about all your brothers. ||14||" |
| `Line 4316: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4317: वृणीष्व च वरं मत्तः शेष यत्तेऽभिकाङ्क्षितम् |` | "Choose a boon from me, Śeṣa, whatever you desire," |
| `Line 4318: दित्सामि हि वरं तेऽद्य प्रीतिर्मे परमा त्वयि ||१५||` | "For I wish to give you a boon today, as I am extremely pleased with you. ||15||" |
| `Line 4319: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4320: दिष्ट्या च बुद्धिर्धर्मे ते निविष्टा पन्नगोत्तम |` | "Fortunately, your mind is established in dharma [righteousness], O best of serpents," |
| `Line 4321: अतो भूयश्च ते बुद्धिर्धर्मे भवतु सुस्थिरा ||१६||` | "Therefore, may your mind be even more firmly established in dharma. ||16||" |
| `Line 4322: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4323: शेष उवाच||` | "Śeṣa [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 4324: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4325: एष एव वरो मेऽद्य काङ्क्षितः प्रपितामह |` | "This indeed is the boon I desire today, O Prapitāmaha [great grandfather]," |
translations: | `Line 4301: अस्माकं चापरो भ्राता वैनतेयः पितामह ||१०||` | "And we have another brother, Vainateya [son of Vinatā], O Pitāmaha [grandfather]. ||10||" |
| `Line 4302: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4303: तं च द्विषन्ति तेऽत्यर्थं स चापि सुमहाबलः |` | "They hate him exceedingly, and he too is of tremendous strength," |
| `Line 4304: वरप्रदानात्स पितुः कश्यपस्य महात्मनः ||११||` | "Due to the boon granted by our father, the great-souled Kaśyapa. ||11||" |
| `Line 4305: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4306: सोऽहं तपः समास्थाय मोक्ष्यामीदं कलेवरम् |` | "I, having undertaken austerities, will abandon this body," |
| `Line 4307: कथं मे प्रेत्यभावेऽपि न तैः स्यात्सह सङ्गमः ||१२||` | "How can I avoid association with them even after death? ||12||" |
| `Line 4308: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4309: ब्रह्मोवाच||` | "Brahmā [creator deity] said:" |
| `Line 4310: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4311: जानामि शेष सर्वेषां भ्रातृणां ते विचेष्टितम् |` | "I know, Śeṣa, the conduct of all your brothers," |
| `Line 4312: मातुश्चाप्यपराधाद्वै भ्रातृणां ते महद्भयम् ||१३||` | "And indeed due to your mother's offense, there is great fear from your brothers. ||13||" |
| `Line 4313: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4314: कृतोऽत्र परिहारश्च पूर्वमेव भुजङ्गम |` | "A remedy for this has already been made, O serpent," |
| `Line 4315: भ्रातृणां तव सर्वेषां न शोकं कर्तुमर्हसि ||१४||` | "You should not grieve about all your brothers. ||14||" |
| `Line 4316: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4317: वृणीष्व च वरं मत्तः शेष यत्तेऽभिकाङ्क्षितम् |` | "Choose a boon from me, Śeṣa, whatever you desire," |
| `Line 4318: दित्सामि हि वरं तेऽद्य प्रीतिर्मे परमा त्वयि ||१५||` | "For I wish to give you a boon today, as I am extremely pleased with you. ||15||" |
| `Line 4319: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4320: दिष्ट्या च बुद्धिर्धर्मे ते निविष्टा पन्नगोत्तम |` | "Fortunately, your mind is established in dharma [righteousness], O best of serpents," |
| `Line 4321: अतो भूयश्च ते बुद्धिर्धर्मे भवतु सुस्थिरा ||१६||` | "Therefore, may your mind be even more firmly established in dharma. ||16||" |
| `Line 4322: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4323: शेष उवाच||` | "Śeṣa [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 4324: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4325: एष एव वरो मेऽद्य काङ्क्षितः प्रपितामह |` | "This indeed is the boon I desire today, O Prapitāmaha [great grandfather]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4326: धर्मे मे रमतां बुद्धिः शमे तपसि चेश्वर ||१७||` | "May my mind delight in dharma [righteousness], in tranquility, and in austerity, O Lord. ||17||" |
| `Line 4327: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4328: ब्रह्मोवाच||` | "Brahmā [creator deity] said:" |
| `Line 4329: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4330: प्रीतोऽस्म्यनेन ते शेष दमेन प्रशमेन च |` | "I am pleased, O Śeṣa, with your self-control and tranquility," |
| `Line 4331: त्वया त्विदं वचः कार्यं मन्नियोगात्प्रजाहितम् ||१८||` | "But you must fulfill this command from me for the welfare of all creatures. ||18||" |
| `Line 4332: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4333: इमां महीं शैलवनोपपन्नां; ससागरां साकरपत्तनां च |` | "This earth, endowed with mountains and forests, with oceans, mines and cities," |
| `Line 4334: त्वं शेष सम्यक्चलितां यथाव; त्सङ्गृह्य तिष्ठस्व यथाचला स्यात् ||१९||` | "You, Śeṣa, should properly hold it when it moves, so that it becomes stable. ||19||" |
| `Line 4335: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4336: शेष उवाच||` | "Śeṣa [serpent deity] said:" |
| `Line 4337: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4338: यथाह देवो वरदः प्रजापति; र्महीपतिर्भूतपतिर्जगत्पतिः |` | "As commands the boon-giving god, Prajāpati [lord of creatures], lord of the earth, lord of beings, lord of the universe," |
| `Line 4339: तथा महीं धारयितास्मि निश्चलां; प्रयच्छ तां मे शिरसि प्रजापते ||२०||` | "So shall I hold the earth steady; place it upon my head, O Prajāpati. ||20||" |
| `Line 4340: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4341: ब्रह्मोवाच||` | "Brahmā said:" |
| `Line 4342: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4343: अधो महीं गच्छ भुजङ्गमोत्तम; स्वयं तवैषा विवरं प्रदास्यति |` | "Go beneath the earth, O best of serpents; it will itself create an opening for you," |
| `Line 4344: इमां धरां धारयता त्वया हि मे; महत्प्रियं शेष कृतं भविष्यति ||२१||` | "By supporting this earth, O Śeṣa, you will have done me a great favor. ||21||" |
| `Line 4345: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4346: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4347: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4348: तथेति कृत्वा विवरं प्रविश्य स; प्रभुर्भुवो भुजगवराग्रजः स्थितः |` | "Having said 'So be it,' he entered through the opening; the lord of the earth, the foremost of serpents, positioned himself," |
| `Line 4349: बिभर्ति देवीं शिरसा महीमिमां; समुद्रनेमिं परिगृह्य सर्वतः ||२२||` | "He bears this divine earth on his head, supporting it completely with its ocean boundaries. ||22||" |
| `Line 4350: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4326: धर्मे मे रमतां बुद्धिः शमे तपसि चेश्वर ||१७||` | "May my mind delight in dharma [righteousness], in tranquility, and in austerity, O Lord. ||17||" |
| `Line 4327: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4329: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4330: प्रीतोऽस्म्यनेन ते शेष दमेन प्रशमेन च |` | "I am pleased, O Śeṣa, with your self-control and tranquility," |

| `Line 4332: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4339: तथा महीं धारयितास्मि निश्चलां; प्रयच्छ तां मे शिरसि प्रजापते ||२०||` | "So shall I hold the earth steady; place it upon my head, O Prajāpati. ||20||" |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4351: ब्रह्मोवाच॥` | "Brahmā [creator deity] said:" |
| `Line 4352: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4353: शेषोऽसि नागोत्तम धर्मदेवो; महीमिमां धारयसे यदेकः |` | "You are Śeṣa, O best of Nāgas [serpent beings], the god of dharma [righteousness]; you alone support this earth," |
| `Line 4354: अनन्तभोगः परिगृह्य सर्वां; यथाहमेवं बलभिद्यथा वा ॥२३॥` | "With your infinite coils encompassing all of it; just as I do, or as Balabhid [Indra] does. ||23||" |
| `Line 4355: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4356: सूत उवाच॥` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4357: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4358: अधो भूमेर्वसत्येवं नागोऽनन्तः प्रतापवान् |` | "Thus below the earth dwells the mighty serpent Ananta [the endless one]," |
| `Line 4359: धारयन्वसुधामेकः शासनाद्ब्रह्मणो विभुः ॥२४॥` | "Supporting the earth alone, by the command of Brahmā, the all-pervading lord. ||24||" |
| `Line 4360: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4361: सुपर्णं च सखायं वै भगवानमरोत्तमः |` | "And the divine lord, foremost among immortals [Brahmā]," |
| `Line 4362: प्रादादनन्ताय तदा वैनतेयं पितामहः ॥२५॥` | "Gave Suparṇa [Garuḍa], the son of Vinatā, as a friend to Ananta then, did the Grandfather [Brahmā]. ||25||" |
| `Line 4363: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4364: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4365: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4366: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4367: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4368: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4369: ३३` | "33" |
| `Line 4370: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4371: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4372: सूत उवाच॥` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4373: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4374: मातुः सकाशात्तं शापं श्रुत्वा पन्नगसत्तमः |` | "Having heard that curse from his mother, the foremost of serpents," |
| `Line 4375: वासुकिश्चिन्तयामास शापोऽयं न भवेत्कथम् ॥१॥` | "Vāsuki pondered, 'How might this curse not come to pass?' ||1||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4376: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4377: ततः स मन्त्रयामास भ्रातृभिः सह सर्वशः |` | "Then he consulted thoroughly with his brothers," |
| `Line 4378: ऐरावतप्रभृतिभिर्ये स्म धर्मपरायणाः ||२||` | "With Airāvata [chief serpent] and others who were devoted to dharma [righteousness]. ||2||" |
| `Line 4379: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4380: वासुकिरुवाच||` | "Vāsuki [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 4381: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4382: अयं शापो यथोद्दिष्टो विदितं वस्तथानघाः |` | "This curse as proclaimed is known to you all, O sinless ones," |
| `Line 4383: तस्य शापस्य मोक्षार्थं मन्त्रयित्वा यतामहे ||३||` | "Let us consult together and strive for liberation from that curse. ||3||" |
| `Line 4384: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4385: सर्वेषामेव शापानां प्रतिघातो हि विद्यते |` | "For all curses indeed, there exists a counteraction," |
| `Line 4386: न तु मात्राभिशप्तानां मोक्षो विद्येत पन्नगाः ||४||` | "But for those cursed by a mother, O serpents, there may be no release. ||4||" |
| `Line 4387: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4388: अव्ययस्याप्रमेयस्य सत्यस्य च तथाग्रतः |` | "In the presence of the imperishable, immeasurable, and truthful one," |
| `Line 4389: शप्ता इत्येव मे श्रुत्वा जायते हृदि वेपथुः ||५||` | "Hearing that we are cursed, trembling arises in my heart. ||5||" |
| `Line 4390: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4391: नूनं सर्वविनाशोऽयमस्माकं समुदाहृतः |` | "Surely this complete destruction of ours has been pronounced," |
| `Line 4392: न ह्येनां सोऽव्ययो देवः शपन्तीं प्रत्यषेधयत् ||६||` | "For that imperishable god did not restrain her when she was cursing. ||6||" |
| `Line 4393: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4394: तस्मात्संमन्त्रयामोऽत्र भुजगानामनामयम् |` | "Therefore, let us consult here about the welfare of the serpents," |
| `Line 4395: यथा भवेत सर्वेषां मा नः कालोऽत्यगादयम् ||७||` | "So that it may be good for all, lest this time of doom overtake us. ||7||" |
| `Line 4396: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4397: अपि मन्त्रयमाणा हि हेतुं पश्याम मोक्षणे |` | "Perhaps by consulting, we may see a means for liberation," |
| `Line 4398: यथा नष्टं पुरा देवा गूढमग्निं गुहागतम् ||८||` | "Just as the gods once found the lost fire [Agni] hidden in a cave. ||8||" |
| `Line 4399: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4400: यथा स यज्ञो न भवेद्यथा वापि पराभवेत् |` | "So that the sacrifice may not take place, or that it may be defeated," |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4401: जनमेजयस्य सर्पाणां विनाशकरणाय हि ||९||` | "For the destruction of the serpents by Janamejaya [Pāṇḍava king]. ||9||" |
| `Line 4402: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4403: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4404: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4405: तथेत्युक्त्वा तु ते सर्वे काद्रवेयाः समागताः |` | "Having said 'so be it,' all those Kādraveyās [serpent sons of Kadrū] assembled together," |
| `Line 4406: समयं चक्रिरे तत्र मन्त्रबुद्धिविशारदाः ||१०||` | "And there they made a plan, being skilled in deliberation and counsel. ||10||" |
| `Line 4407: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4408: एके तत्राब्रुवन्नागा वयं भूत्वा द्विजर्षभाः |` | "Some serpents there said, 'We shall become Brāhmaṇas [twice-born bulls]," |
| `Line 4409: जनमेजयं तं भिक्षामो यज्ञस्ते न भवेदिति ||११||` | "And beg Janamejaya saying, 'May your sacrifice not take place.'" ||11||" |
| `Line 4410: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4411: अपरे त्वब्रुवन्नागास्तत्र पण्डितमानिनः |` | "But other serpents there, considering themselves learned, said," |
| `Line 4412: मन्त्रिणोऽस्य वयं सर्वे भविष्यामः सुसंमताः ||१२||` | "'We all shall become his highly respected counselors. ||12||" |
| `Line 4413: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4414: स नः प्रक्ष्यति सर्वेषु कार्येष्वर्थविनिश्चयम् |` | "'He will ask us for decisions on all matters of importance," |
| `Line 4415: तत्र बुद्धिं प्रवक्ष्यामो यथा यज्ञो निवर्तते ||१३||` | "'Then we shall give such advice that the sacrifice will be stopped. ||13||" |
| `Line 4416: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4417: स नो बहुमतान्राजा बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमतां वरः |` | "'The king, considering us highly esteemed and being the best among the wise," |
| `Line 4418: यज्ञार्थं प्रक्ष्यति व्यक्तं नेति वक्ष्यामहे वयम् ||१४||` | "'Will surely ask us about the sacrifice, and we shall say 'no.' ||14||" |
| `Line 4419: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4420: दर्शयन्तो बहून्दोषान्प्रेत्य चेह च दारुणान् |` | "'Showing many terrible faults both in the afterlife and here," |
| `Line 4421: हेतुभिः कारणैश्चैव यथा यज्ञो भवेन्न सः ||१५||` | "'With reasons and causes so that the sacrifice may not take place.' ||15||" |
| `Line 4422: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4423: अथवा य उपाध्यायः क्रतौ तस्मिन्भविष्यति |` | "'Or else, whoever will be the preceptor [teacher] in that sacrifice," |
| `Line 4424: सर्पसत्रविधानज्ञो राजकार्यहिते रतः ||१६||` | "'Knowledgeable in the rules of the serpent sacrifice and devoted to the king's welfare, ||16||" |
| `Line 4425: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4401: जनमेजयस्य सर्पाणां विनाशकरणाय हि ||९||` | "For the destruction of the serpents by Janamejaya [Pāṇḍava king]. ||9||" |
| `Line 4402: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4403: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4404: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4405: तथेत्युक्त्वा तु ते सर्वे काद्रवेयाः समागताः |` | "Having said 'so be it,' all those Kādraveyās [serpent sons of Kadrū] assembled together," |
| `Line 4406: समयं चक्रिरे तत्र मन्त्रबुद्धिविशारदाः ||१०||` | "And there they made a plan, being skilled in deliberation and counsel. ||10||" |
| `Line 4407: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4408: एके तत्राब्रुवन्नागा वयं भूत्वा द्विजर्षभाः |` | "Some serpents there said, 'We shall become Brāhmaṇas [twice-born bulls]," |
| `Line 4409: जनमेजयं तं भिक्षामो यज्ञस्ते न भवेदिति ||११||` | "And beg Janamejaya saying, 'May your sacrifice not take place.'" ||11||" |
| `Line 4410: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4411: अपरे त्वब्रुवन्नागास्तत्र पण्डितमानिनः |` | "But other serpents there, considering themselves learned, said," |
| `Line 4412: मन्त्रिणोऽस्य वयं सर्वे भविष्यामः सुसंमताः ||१२||` | "'We all shall become his highly respected counselors. ||12||" |
| `Line 4413: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4414: स नः प्रक्ष्यति सर्वेषु कार्येष्वर्थविनिश्चयम् |` | "'He will ask us for decisions on all matters of importance," |
| `Line 4415: तत्र बुद्धिं प्रवक्ष्यामो यथा यज्ञो निवर्तते ||१३||` | "'Then we shall give such advice that the sacrifice will be stopped. ||13||" |
| `Line 4416: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4417: स नो बहुमतान्राजा बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमतां वरः |` | "'The king, considering us highly esteemed and being the best among the wise," |
| `Line 4418: यज्ञार्थं प्रक्ष्यति व्यक्तं नेति वक्ष्यामहे वयम् ||१४||` | "'Will surely ask us about the sacrifice, and we shall say 'no.' ||14||" |
| `Line 4419: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4420: दर्शयन्तो बहून्दोषान्प्रेत्य चेह च दारुणान् |` | "'Showing many terrible faults both in the afterlife and here," |
| `Line 4421: हेतुभिः कारणैश्चैव यथा यज्ञो भवेन्न सः ||१५||` | "'With reasons and causes so that the sacrifice may not take place.' ||15||" |
| `Line 4422: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4423: अथवा य उपाध्यायः क्रतौ तस्मिन्भविष्यति |` | "'Or else, whoever will be the preceptor [teacher] in that sacrifice," |
| `Line 4424: सर्पसत्रविधानज्ञो राजकार्यहिते रतः ||१६||` | "'Knowledgeable in the rules of the serpent sacrifice and devoted to the king's welfare, ||16||" |
| `Line 4425: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4426: तं गत्वा दशतां कश्चिद्भुजगः स मरिष्यति |` | "Going there, some serpent will bite him and die," |
| `Line 4427: तस्मिन्हते यज्ञकरे क्रतुः स न भविष्यति ||१७||` | "With that sacrificer killed, the sacrifice will not take place. ||17||" |
| `Line 4428: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4429: ये चान्ये सर्पसत्रज्ञा भविष्यन्त्यस्य ऋत्विजः |` | "And those others who are knowledgeable in serpent-sacrifices who will be his priests [ṛtvij]," |
| `Line 4430: तांश्च सर्वान्दशिष्यामः कृतमेवं भविष्यति ||१८||` | "We shall bite all of them too, thus it will be accomplished. ||18||" |
| `Line 4431: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4432: तत्रापरेऽमन्त्रयन्त धर्मात्मानो भुजङ्गमाः |` | "Then other righteous serpents [bhujangama] counseled there," |
| `Line 4433: अबुद्धिरेषा युष्माकं ब्रह्महत्या न शोभना ||१९||` | "This is unwise of you; killing a Brahmin [brahmahatya] is not virtuous. ||19||" |
| `Line 4434: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4435: सम्यक्सद्धर्ममूला हि व्यसने शान्तिरुत्तमा |` | "Indeed, the highest peace in calamity is rooted in proper righteousness [dharma]," |
| `Line 4436: अधर्मोत्तरता नाम कृत्स्नं व्यापादयेज्जगत् ||२०||` | "Predominance of unrighteousness [adharma] would destroy the entire world. ||20||" |
| `Line 4437: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4438: अपरे त्वब्रुवन्नागाः समिद्धं जातवेदसम् |` | "But other serpents [nāga] said, 'The blazing fire [jātavedas]," |
| `Line 4439: वर्षैर्निर्वापयिष्यामो मेघा भूत्वा सविद्युतः ||२१||` | "We shall extinguish with rains, becoming clouds with lightning.' ||21||" |
| `Line 4440: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4441: स्रुग्भाण्डं निशि गत्वा वा अपरे भुजगोत्तमाः |` | "Or other excellent serpents [bhujagottama] said, 'Going at night to the sacrificial vessels [srugbhāṇḍa]," |
| `Line 4442: प्रमत्तानां हरन्त्वाशु विघ्न एवं भविष्यति ||२२||` | "Let them quickly steal them from the careless ones; thus there will be an obstacle.' ||22||" |
| `Line 4443: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4444: यज्ञे वा भुजगास्तस्मिञ्शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः |` | "Or at that sacrifice, let serpents by hundreds and thousands," |
| `Line 4445: जनं दशन्तु वै सर्वमेवं त्रासो भविष्यति ||२३||` | "Bite all the people; thus there will be terror. ||23||" |
| `Line 4446: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4447: अथवा संस्कृतं भोज्यं दूषयन्तु भुजङ्गमाः |` | "Or let the serpents contaminate the prepared food," |
| `Line 4448: स्वेन मूत्रपुरीषेण सर्वभोज्यविनाशिना ||२४||` | "With their urine and feces that destroy all food. ||24||" |
| `Line 4449: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4450: अपरे त्वब्रुवंस्तत्र ऋत्विजोऽस्य भवामहे |` | "But others said there, 'Let us become his priests [ṛtvij]," |
translations: | `Line 4426: तं गत्वा दशतां कश्चिद्भुजगः स मरिष्यति |` | "Going there, some serpent will bite him and die," |
| `Line 4427: तस्मिन्हते यज्ञकरे क्रतुः स न भविष्यति ||१७||` | "With that sacrificer killed, the sacrifice will not take place. ||17||" |
| `Line 4428: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4429: ये चान्ये सर्पसत्रज्ञा भविष्यन्त्यस्य ऋत्विजः |` | "And those others who are knowledgeable in serpent-sacrifices who will be his priests [ṛtvij]," |
| `Line 4430: तांश्च सर्वान्दशिष्यामः कृतमेवं भविष्यति ||१८||` | "We shall bite all of them too, thus it will be accomplished. ||18||" |
| `Line 4431: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4432: तत्रापरेऽमन्त्रयन्त धर्मात्मानो भुजङ्गमाः |` | "Then other righteous serpents [bhujangama] counseled there," |
| `Line 4433: अबुद्धिरेषा युष्माकं ब्रह्महत्या न शोभना ||१९||` | "This is unwise of you; killing a Brahmin [brahmahatya] is not virtuous. ||19||" |
| `Line 4434: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4435: सम्यक्सद्धर्ममूला हि व्यसने शान्तिरुत्तमा |` | "Indeed, the highest peace in calamity is rooted in proper righteousness [dharma]," |
| `Line 4436: अधर्मोत्तरता नाम कृत्स्नं व्यापादयेज्जगत् ||२०||` | "Predominance of unrighteousness [adharma] would destroy the entire world. ||20||" |
| `Line 4437: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4438: अपरे त्वब्रुवन्नागाः समिद्धं जातवेदसम् |` | "But other serpents [nāga] said, 'The blazing fire [jātavedas]," |
| `Line 4439: वर्षैर्निर्वापयिष्यामो मेघा भूत्वा सविद्युतः ||२१||` | "We shall extinguish with rains, becoming clouds with lightning.' ||21||" |
| `Line 4440: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4441: स्रुग्भाण्डं निशि गत्वा वा अपरे भुजगोत्तमाः |` | "Or other excellent serpents [bhujagottama] said, 'Going at night to the sacrificial vessels [srugbhāṇḍa]," |
| `Line 4442: प्रमत्तानां हरन्त्वाशु विघ्न एवं भविष्यति ||२२||` | "Let them quickly steal them from the careless ones; thus there will be an obstacle.' ||22||" |
| `Line 4443: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4444: यज्ञे वा भुजगास्तस्मिञ्शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः |` | "Or at that sacrifice, let serpents by hundreds and thousands," |
| `Line 4445: जनं दशन्तु वै सर्वमेवं त्रासो भविष्यति ||२३||` | "Bite all the people; thus there will be terror. ||23||" |
| `Line 4446: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4447: अथवा संस्कृतं भोज्यं दूषयन्तु भुजङ्गमाः |` | "Or let the serpents contaminate the prepared food," |
| `Line 4448: स्वेन मूत्रपुरीषेण सर्वभोज्यविनाशिना ||२४||` | "With their urine and feces that destroy all food. ||24||" |
| `Line 4449: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4450: अपरे त्वब्रुवंस्तत्र ऋत्विजोऽस्य भवामहे |` | "But others said there, 'Let us become his priests [ṛtvij]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4451: यज्ञविघ्नं करिष्यामो दीयतां दक्षिणा इति ||२५||` | "We will create an obstacle to the sacrifice; let the sacrificial fee be given, thus. ||25||" |
| `Line 4452: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4453: वश्यतां च गतोऽसौ नः करिष्यति यथेप्षितम् ||२५||` | "And having come under our control, he will do as we desire. ||25||" |
| `Line 4454: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4455: अपरे त्वब्रुवंस्तत्र जले प्रक्रीडितं नृपम् |` | "But others said there: 'Let us seize the king while he is sporting in water," |
| `Line 4456: गृहमानीय बध्नीमः क्रतुरेवं भवेन्न सः ||२६||` | "Bring him to our abode and bind him; thus the sacrifice will not take place.' ||26||" |
| `Line 4457: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4458: अपरे त्वब्रुवंस्तत्र नागाः सुकृतकारिणः |` | "But other serpents [nāgas], skilled in action, said there:" |
| `Line 4459: दशामैनं प्रगृह्याशु कृतमेवं भविष्यति ||२७||` | "'Let us quickly seize him by his garment's edge; thus it will be accomplished. ||27||" |
| `Line 4460: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4461: छिन्नं मूलमनर्थानां मृते तस्मिन्भविष्यति ||२७||` | "When he is dead, the root of our calamities will be cut off.' ||27||" |
| `Line 4462: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4463: एषा वै नैष्ठिकी बुद्धिः सर्वेषामेव संमता |` | "This indeed is the final decision approved by all," |
| `Line 4464: यथा वा मन्यसे राजंस्तत्क्षिप्रं संविधीयताम् ||२८||` | "Or as you think, O king [serpent king], let that be quickly arranged.' ||28||" |
| `Line 4465: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4466: इत्युक्त्वा समुदैक्षन्त वासुकिं पन्नगेश्वरम् |` | "Having spoken thus, they looked toward Vāsuki, the lord of serpents [pannageśvara]," |
| `Line 4467: वासुकिश्चापि सञ्चिन्त्य तानुवाच भुजङ्गमान् ||२९||` | "And Vāsuki, having reflected, said to those serpents [bhujangama]: ||29||" |
| `Line 4468: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4469: नैषा वो नैष्ठिकी बुद्धिर्मता कर्तुं भुजङ्गमाः |` | "'This final decision of yours is not acceptable to execute, O serpents [bhujangama]," |
| `Line 4470: सर्वेषामेव मे बुद्धिः पन्नगानां न रोचते ||३०||` | "My opinion does not please all the serpents [pannaga]. ||30||" |
| `Line 4471: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4472: किं त्वत्र संविधातव्यं भवतां यद्भवेद्धितम् |` | "However, what should be arranged here that would be beneficial for you?" |
| `Line 4473: अनेनाहं भृशं तप्ये गुणदोषौ मदाश्रयौ ||३१||` | "I am greatly tormented by this, as the merits and faults rest with me.' ||31||" |
| `Line 4474: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4475: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4451: यज्ञविघ्नं करिष्यामो दीयतां दक्षिणा इति ||२५||` | "We will create an obstacle to the sacrifice; let the sacrificial fee be given, thus. ||25||" |
| `Line 4452: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4453: वश्यतां च गतोऽसौ नः करिष्यति यथेप्षितम् ||२५||` | "And having come under our control, he will do as we desire. ||25||" |
| `Line 4454: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4455: अपरे त्वब्रुवंस्तत्र जले प्रक्रीडितं नृपम् |` | "But others said there: 'Let us seize the king while he is sporting in water," |
| `Line 4456: गृहमानीय बध्नीमः क्रतुरेवं भवेन्न सः ||२६||` | "Bring him to our abode and bind him; thus the sacrifice will not take place.' ||26||" |
| `Line 4457: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4458: अपरे त्वब्रुवंस्तत्र नागाः सुकृतकारिणः |` | "But other serpents [nāgas], skilled in action, said there:" |
| `Line 4459: दशामैनं प्रगृह्याशु कृतमेवं भविष्यति ||२७||` | "'Let us quickly seize him by his garment's edge; thus it will be accomplished. ||27||" |
| `Line 4460: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4461: छिन्नं मूलमनर्थानां मृते तस्मिन्भविष्यति ||२७||` | "When he is dead, the root of our calamities will be cut off.' ||27||" |
| `Line 4462: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4463: एषा वै नैष्ठिकी बुद्धिः सर्वेषामेव संमता |` | "This indeed is the final decision approved by all," |
| `Line 4464: यथा वा मन्यसे राजंस्तत्क्षिप्रं संविधीयताम् ||२८||` | "Or as you think, O king [serpent king], let that be quickly arranged.' ||28||" |
| `Line 4465: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4466: इत्युक्त्वा समुदैक्षन्त वासुकिं पन्नगेश्वरम् |` | "Having spoken thus, they looked toward Vāsuki, the lord of serpents [pannageśvara]," |
| `Line 4467: वासुकिश्चापि सञ्चिन्त्य तानुवाच भुजङ्गमान् ||२९||` | "And Vāsuki, having reflected, said to those serpents [bhujangama]: ||29||" |
| `Line 4468: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4469: नैषा वो नैष्ठिकी बुद्धिर्मता कर्तुं भुजङ्गमाः |` | "'This final decision of yours is not acceptable to execute, O serpents [bhujangama]," |
| `Line 4470: सर्वेषामेव मे बुद्धिः पन्नगानां न रोचते ||३०||` | "My opinion does not please all the serpents [pannaga]. ||30||" |
| `Line 4471: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4472: किं त्वत्र संविधातव्यं भवतां यद्भवेद्धितम् |` | "However, what should be arranged here that would be beneficial for you?" |
| `Line 4473: अनेनाहं भृशं तप्ये गुणदोषौ मदाश्रयौ ||३१||` | "I am greatly tormented by this, as the merits and faults rest with me.' ||31||" |
| `Line 4474: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4475: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4476: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4477: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4478: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4479: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4480: ३४` | "34" |
| `Line 4481: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4482: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4483: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4484: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4485: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तेषां सर्वेषामिति चेति च |` | "Having heard the words of all of them, thus and thus," |
| `Line 4486: वासुकेश्च वचः श्रुत्वा एलापत्रोऽब्रवीदिदम् ||१||` | "And having heard the words of Vāsuki [serpent king], Elāpatra [serpent sage] spoke this. ||1||" |
| `Line 4487: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4488: न स यज्ञो न भविता न स राजा तथाविधः |` | "That sacrifice will not happen, nor will that king be of such nature," |
| `Line 4489: जनमेजयः पाण्डवेयो यतोऽस्माकं महाभयम् ||२||` | "Janamejaya, the descendant of Pāṇḍu, from whom comes our great fear. ||2||" |
| `Line 4490: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4491: दैवेनोपहतो राजन्यो भवेदिह पूरुषः |` | "A person who is struck down by fate in this world, O king," |
| `Line 4492: स दैवमेवाश्रयते नान्यत्तत्र परायणम् ||३||` | "He takes refuge in fate alone, there is no other recourse there. ||3||" |
| `Line 4493: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4494: तदिदं दैवमस्माकं भयं पन्नगसत्तमाः |` | "This fear of ours is fated, O best of serpents [pannaga-sattamāḥ]," |
| `Line 4495: दैवमेवाश्रयामोऽत्र शृणुध्वं च वचो मम ||४||` | "Let us take refuge in fate alone here, and listen to my words. ||4||" |
| `Line 4496: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4497: अहं शापे समुत्सृष्टे समश्रौषं वचस्तदा |` | "When the curse was pronounced, I heard those words then," |
| `Line 4498: मातुरुत्सङ्गमारूढो भयात्पन्नगसत्तमाः ||५||` | "While sitting on my mother's lap, out of fear, O best of serpents. ||5||" |
| `Line 4499: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4500: देवानां पन्नगश्रेष्ठास्तीक्ष्णास्तीक्ष्णा इति प्रभो |` | "The gods (said), 'O best of serpents, fierce, fierce,' thus, O lord," |
translations: | `Line 4476: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4477: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4478: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4479: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4485: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तेषां सर्वेषामिति चेति च |` | "Having heard the words of all of them, thus and thus," |
| `Line 4486: वासुकेश्च वचः श्रुत्वा एलापत्रोऽब्रवीदिदम् ||१||` | "And having heard the words of Vāsuki [serpent king], Elāpatra [serpent sage] spoke this. ||1||" |
| `Line 4487: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4488: न स यज्ञो न भविता न स राजा तथाविधः |` | "That sacrifice will not happen, nor will that king be of such nature," |
| `Line 4489: जनमेजयः पाण्डवेयो यतोऽस्माकं महाभयम् ||२||` | "Janamejaya, the descendant of Pāṇḍu, from whom comes our great fear. ||2||" |
| `Line 4490: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4491: दैवेनोपहतो राजन्यो भवेदिह पूरुषः |` | "A person who is struck down by fate in this world, O king," |
| `Line 4492: स दैवमेवाश्रयते नान्यत्तत्र परायणम् ||३||` | "He takes refuge in fate alone, there is no other recourse there. ||3||" |
| `Line 4493: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4494: तदिदं दैवमस्माकं भयं पन्नगसत्तमाः |` | "This fear of ours is fated, O best of serpents [pannaga-sattamāḥ]," |
| `Line 4495: दैवमेवाश्रयामोऽत्र शृणुध्वं च वचो मम ||४||` | "Let us take refuge in fate alone here, and listen to my words. ||4||" |
| `Line 4496: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4497: अहं शापे समुत्सृष्टे समश्रौषं वचस्तदा |` | "When the curse was pronounced, I heard those words then," |

| `Line 4500: देवानां पन्नगश्रेष्ठास्तीक्ष्णास्तीक्ष्णा इति प्रभो |` | "The gods (said), 'O best of serpents, fierce, fierce,' thus, O lord," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4501: पितामहमुपागम्य दुःखार्तानां महाद्युते ||६||` | "Having approached Pitāmaha [Brahmā], O greatly radiant one, in their grief-stricken state. ||6||" |
| `Line 4502: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4503: देवा ऊचुः||` | "The gods said:" |
| `Line 4504: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4505: का हि लब्ध्वा प्रियान्पुत्राञ्शपेदेवं पितामह |` | "Who indeed, after obtaining beloved sons, would curse them thus, O Pitāmaha [Brahmā]," |
| `Line 4506: ऋते कद्रूं तीक्ष्णरूपां देवदेव तवाग्रतः ||७||` | "Except Kadrū of fierce nature, O God of gods, in your presence? ||7||" |
| `Line 4507: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4508: तथेति च वचस्तस्यास्त्वयाप्युक्तं पितामह |` | "And you also said 'so be it' to her words, O Pitāmaha [Brahmā]," |
| `Line 4509: एतदिच्छाम विज्ञातुं कारणं यन्न वारिता ||८||` | "We wish to know the reason why she was not stopped. ||8||" |
| `Line 4510: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4511: ब्रह्मोवाच||` | "Brahmā said:" |
| `Line 4512: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4513: बहवः पन्नगास्तीक्ष्णा भीमवीर्या विषोल्बणाः |` | "Many serpents are fierce, of terrible power, and excessive venom," |
| `Line 4514: प्रजानां हितकामोऽहं न निवारितवांस्तदा ||९||` | "Desiring the welfare of creatures, I did not prevent it then. ||9||" |
| `Line 4515: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4516: ये दन्दशूकाः क्षुद्राश्च पापचारा विषोल्बणाः |` | "Those serpents who are biters, vile, of evil conduct, with excessive venom," |
| `Line 4517: तेषां विनाशो भविता न तु ये धर्मचारिणः ||१०||` | "Their destruction will come about, but not of those who follow dharma [righteousness]. ||10||" |
| `Line 4518: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4519: यन्निमित्तं च भविता मोक्षस्तेषां महाभयात् |` | "And the cause by which there will be liberation for them from this great fear," |
| `Line 4520: पन्नगानां निबोधध्वं तस्मिन्काले तथागते ||११||` | "Of the serpents, understand this when that time comes. ||11||" |
| `Line 4521: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4522: यायावरकुले धीमान्भविष्यति महानृषिः |` | "In the Yāyāvara [wandering ascetic] family, there will be a wise great sage," |
| `Line 4523: जरत्कारुरिति ख्यातस्तेजस्वी नियतेन्द्रियः ||१२||` | "Known as Jaratkāru, radiant and with controlled senses. ||12||" |
| `Line 4524: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4525: तस्य पुत्रो जरत्कारोरुत्पत्स्यति महातपाः |` | "A son of that Jaratkāru will be born, of great austerity," |
translations: | `Line 4501: पितामहमुपागम्य दुःखार्तानां महाद्युते ||६||` | "Having approached Pitāmaha [Brahmā], O greatly radiant one, in their grief-stricken state. ||6||" |
| `Line 4502: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4503: देवा ऊचुः||` | "The gods said:" |
| `Line 4504: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4505: का हि लब्ध्वा प्रियान्पुत्राञ्शपेदेवं पितामह |` | "Who indeed, after obtaining beloved sons, would curse them thus, O Pitāmaha [Brahmā]," |
| `Line 4506: ऋते कद्रूं तीक्ष्णरूपां देवदेव तवाग्रतः ||७||` | "Except Kadrū of fierce nature, O God of gods, in your presence? ||7||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 451: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 452: यदाश्रौषं कर्णघटोत्कचाभ्यां; युद्धे मुक्तां सूतपुत्रेण शक्तिम् |` | "When I heard about the spear released by the son of a charioteer [Karna] in the battle between Karna and Ghatotkaca," |
| `Line 453: यया वध्यः समरे सव्यसाची; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४२||` | "By which the left-handed archer [Arjuna] was to be slain in battle, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||142||" |
| `Line 454: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 455: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणमाचार्यमेकं; धृष्टद्युम्नेनाभ्यतिक्रम्य धर्मम् |` | "When I heard that Drona, the teacher, alone was killed by Dhrishtadyumna, transgressing dharma [righteousness]," |
| `Line 456: रथोपस्थे प्रायगतं विशस्तं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४३||` | "Slain while seated in his chariot, having nearly given up his life, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||143||" |
| `Line 457: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 458: यदाश्रौषं द्रौणिना द्वैरथस्थं; माद्रीपुत्रं नकुलं लोकमध्ये |` | "When I heard that Nakula, son of Madri, standing in a chariot duel with Drona's son [Ashvatthama] before the world," |
| `Line 459: समं युद्धे पाण्डवं युध्यमानं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४४||` | "The Pandava fighting equally in battle, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||144||" |
| `Line 460: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 461: यदा द्रोणे निहते द्रोणपुत्रो; नारायणं दिव्यमस्त्रं विकुर्वन् |` | "When, after Drona was slain, his son [Ashvatthama] deployed the divine Narayana weapon [celestial missile]," |
| `Line 462: नैषामन्तं गतवान्पाण्डवानां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४५||` | "Yet could not bring about the end of the Pandavas, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||145||" |
| `Line 463: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 464: यदाश्रौषं कर्णमत्यन्तशूरं; हतं पार्थेनाहवेष्वप्रधृष्यम् |` | "When I heard that Karna, the extremely valiant, unconquerable in battles, was slain by Partha [Arjuna]," |
| `Line 465: तस्मिन्भ्रातृणां विग्रहे देवगुह्ये; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४६||` | "In that mysterious conflict of brothers ordained by gods, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||146||" |
| `Line 466: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 467: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणपुत्रं कृपं च; दुःशासनं कृतवर्माणमुग्रम् |` | "When I heard that Drona's son [Ashvatthama], Kripa, Duhshasana, and the fierce Kritavarman," |
| `Line 468: युधिष्ठिरं शून्यमधर्षयन्तं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४७||` | "Were unable to overcome Yudhishthira when he was alone, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||147||" |
| `Line 469: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 470: यदाश्रौषं निहतं मद्रराजं; रणे शूरं धर्मराजेन सूत |` | "When I heard that the king of Madra [Shalya], valiant in battle, was slain by Dharmaraja [Yudhishthira], O charioteer," |
| `Line 471: सदा सङ्ग्रामे स्पर्धते यः स कृष्णं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४८||` | "He who always rivaled Krishna in combat, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||148||" |
| `Line 472: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 473: यदाश्रौषं कलहद्यूतमूलं; मायाबलं सौबलं पाण्डवेन |` | "When I heard that Soubala [Shakuni], the root cause of the gambling dispute, powerful in illusion," |
| `Line 474: हतं सङ्ग्रामे सहदेवेन पापं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४९||` | "The sinful one, was slain in battle by Sahadeva, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||149||" |
| `Line 475: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 451: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 452: यदाश्रौषं कर्णघटोत्कचाभ्यां; युद्धे मुक्तां सूतपुत्रेण शक्तिम् |` | "When I heard about the spear released by the son of a charioteer [Karna] in the battle between Karna and Ghatotkaca," |

| `Line 459: समं युद्धे पाण्डवं युध्यमानं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४४||` | "The Pandava fighting equally in battle, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||144||" |
| `Line 460: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 461: यदा द्रोणे निहते द्रोणपुत्रो; नारायणं दिव्यमस्त्रं विकुर्वन् |` | "When, after Drona was slain, his son [Ashvatthama] deployed the divine Narayana weapon [celestial missile]," |
| `Line 462: नैषामन्तं गतवान्पाण्डवानां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४५||` | "Yet could not bring about the end of the Pandavas, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||145||" |
| `Line 463: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 464: यदाश्रौषं कर्णमत्यन्तशूरं; हतं पार्थेनाहवेष्वप्रधृष्यम् |` | "When I heard that Karna, the extremely valiant, unconquerable in battles, was slain by Partha [Arjuna]," |
| `Line 465: तस्मिन्भ्रातृणां विग्रहे देवगुह्ये; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४६||` | "In that mysterious conflict of brothers ordained by gods, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||146||" |
| `Line 466: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 467: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणपुत्रं कृपं च; दुःशासनं कृतवर्माणमुग्रम् |` | "When I heard that Drona's son [Ashvatthama], Kripa, Duhshasana, and the fierce Kritavarman," |
| `Line 468: युधिष्ठिरं शून्यमधर्षयन्तं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४७||` | "Were unable to overcome Yudhishthira when he was alone, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||147||" |
| `Line 469: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 470: यदाश्रौषं निहतं मद्रराजं; रणे शूरं धर्मराजेन सूत |` | "When I heard that the king of Madra [Shalya], valiant in battle, was slain by Dharmaraja [Yudhishthira], O charioteer," |
| `Line 471: सदा सङ्ग्रामे स्पर्धते यः स कृष्णं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४८||` | "He who always rivaled Krishna in combat, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||148||" |
| `Line 472: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 473: यदाश्रौषं कलहद्यूतमूलं; मायाबलं सौबलं पाण्डवेन |` | "When I heard that Soubala [Shakuni], the root cause of the gambling dispute, powerful in illusion," |
| `Line 474: हतं सङ्ग्रामे सहदेवेन पापं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१४९||` | "The sinful one, was slain in battle by Sahadeva, then, O Sanjaya, I despaired of victory. ||149||" |
| `Line 475: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4526: आस्तीको नाम यज्ञं स प्रतिषेत्स्यति तं तदा ||१३||` | "One named Āstīka will stop that sacrifice then. ||13||" |
| `Line 4527: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4528: तत्र मोक्ष्यन्ति भुजगा ये भविष्यन्ति धार्मिकाः ||१३||` | "There the serpents who will be righteous shall be freed. ||13||" |
| `Line 4529: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4530: देवा ऊचुः||` | "The gods said:" |
| `Line 4531: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4532: स मुनिप्रवरो देव जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "O god, that eminent sage Jaratkāru of great austerity," |
| `Line 4533: कस्यां पुत्रं महात्मानं जनयिष्यति वीर्यवान् ||१४||` | "In which woman will that powerful one beget a noble son? ||14||" |
| `Line 4534: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4535: ब्रह्मोवाच||` | "Brahmā [creator deity] said:" |
| `Line 4536: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4537: सनामायां सनामा स कन्यायां द्विजसत्तमः |` | "That foremost of twice-born [Brahmin], having the same name, in a maiden of the same name," |
| `Line 4538: अपत्यं वीर्यवान्देवा वीर्यवज्जनयिष्यति ||१५||` | "The powerful one will beget, O gods, a powerful offspring. ||15||" |
| `Line 4539: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4540: एलापत्र उवाच||` | "Elāpatra [serpent sage] said:" |
| `Line 4541: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4542: एवमस्त्विति तं देवाः पितामहमथाब्रुवन् |` | "The gods then said to Pitāmaha [Brahmā], 'Let it be so,'" |
| `Line 4543: उक्त्वा चैवं गता देवाः स च देवः पितामहः ||१६||` | "Having spoken thus, the gods departed, and so did the god Pitāmaha [Brahmā]. ||16||" |
| `Line 4544: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4545: सोऽहमेवं प्रपश्यामि वासुके भगिनीं तव |` | "Thus I foresee, O Vāsuki, that your sister," |
| `Line 4546: जरत्कारुरिति ख्यातां तां तस्मै प्रतिपादय ||१७||` | "Known as Jaratkāru, should be given by you to him. ||17||" |
| `Line 4547: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4548: भैक्षवद्भिक्षमाणाय नागानां भयशान्तये |` | "To him who begs like a mendicant, for the pacification of the serpents' fear," |
| `Line 4549: ऋषये सुव्रताय त्वमेष मोक्षः श्रुतो मया ||१८||` | "To the sage of good vows—this is the deliverance that I have heard. ||18||" |
| `Line 4550: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4526: आस्तीको नाम यज्ञं स प्रतिषेत्स्यति तं तदा ||१३||` | "One named Āstīka will stop that sacrifice then. ||13||" |
| `Line 4527: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4529: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4534: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4543: उक्त्वा चैवं गता देवाः स च देवः पितामहः ||१६||` | "Having spoken thus, the gods departed, and so did the god Pitāmaha [Brahmā]. ||16||" |
| `Line 4544: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4545: सोऽहमेवं प्रपश्यामि वासुके भगिनीं तव |` | "Thus I foresee, O Vāsuki, that your sister," |
| `Line 4546: जरत्कारुरिति ख्यातां तां तस्मै प्रतिपादय ||१७||` | "Known as Jaratkāru, should be given by you to him. ||17||" |
