| `Line 4556: ३५` | "35" |
| `Line 4557: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4558: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4559: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4560: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4561: एलापत्रस्य तु वचः श्रुत्वा नागा द्विजोत्तम |` | "Having heard the words of Elāpatra [serpent sage], O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 4562: सर्वे प्रहृष्टमनसः साधु साध्वित्यपूजयन् ||१||` | "All the Nāgas [serpents], with delighted minds, honored him saying 'well done, well done.' ||1||" |
| `Line 4563: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4564: ततः प्रभृति तां कन्यां वासुकिः पर्यरक्षत |` | "From then on, Vāsuki [serpent king] protected that maiden," |
| `Line 4565: जरत्कारुं स्वसारं वै परं हर्षमवाप च ||२||` | "His sister Jaratkāru, and experienced supreme joy. ||2||" |
| `Line 4566: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4567: ततो नातिमहान्कालः समतीत इवाभवत् |` | "Then, not a very long time seemed to have passed," |
| `Line 4568: अथ देवासुराः सर्वे ममन्थुर्वरुणालयम् ||३||` | "When all the Devas [gods] and Asuras [demons] churned Varuṇālaya [ocean]. ||3||" |
| `Line 4569: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4570: तत्र नेत्रमभून्नागो वासुकिर्बलिनां वरः |` | "There, Vāsuki, the best among the strong ones, became the rope [churning cord]," |
| `Line 4571: समाप्यैव च तत्कर्म पितामहमुपागमन् ||४||` | "And having completed that task, they approached Pitāmaha [Brahmā]. ||4||" |
| `Line 4572: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4573: देवा वासुकिना सार्धं पितामहमथाब्रुवन् |` | "The gods, together with Vāsuki, then said to Pitāmaha [Brahmā]," |
| `Line 4574: भगवञ्शापभीतोऽयं वासुकिस्तप्यते भृशम् ||५||` | "O Lord, this Vāsuki, afraid of the curse, is greatly tormented. ||5||" |
| `Line 4575: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4551: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4568: अथ देवासुराः सर्वे ममन्थुर्वरुणालयम् ||३||` | "When all the Devas [gods] and Asuras [demons] churned Varuṇālaya [ocean]. ||3||" |
| `Line 4569: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4570: तत्र नेत्रमभून्नागो वासुकिर्बलिनां वरः |` | "There, Vāsuki, the best among the strong ones, became the rope [churning cord]," |

| `Line 4576: तस्येदं मानसं शल्यं समुद्धर्तुं त्वमर्हसि |` | "You ought to remove this mental anguish [thorn] of his," |
| `Line 4577: जनन्याः शापजं देव ज्ञातीनां हितकाङ्क्षिणः ||६||` | "O god, which arose from his mother's curse, for he desires the welfare of his relatives. ||6||" |
| `Line 4578: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4579: हितो ह्ययं सदास्माकं प्रियकारी च नागराट् |` | "This king of serpents [Nāgarāṭ] is always beneficial to us and acts kindly," |
| `Line 4580: कुरु प्रसादं देवेश शमयास्य मनोज्वरम् ||७||` | "Grant your favor, O lord of gods, and calm his mental fever. ||7||" |
| `Line 4581: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4582: ब्रह्मोवाच||` | "Brahmā [creator deity] said:" |
| `Line 4583: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4584: मयैवैतद्वितीर्णं वै वचनं मनसामराः |` | "O gods, this promise was indeed given by me," |
| `Line 4585: एलापत्रेण नागेन यदस्याभिहितं पुरा ||८||` | "What was declared earlier by the serpent Elāpatra. ||8||" |
| `Line 4586: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4587: तत्करोत्वेष नागेन्द्रः प्राप्तकालं वचस्तथा |` | "Let this lord of serpents fulfill that promise when the time comes," |
| `Line 4588: विनशिष्यन्ति ये पापा न तु ये धर्मचारिणः ||९||` | "Those who are sinful will perish, but not those who follow dharma [righteousness]. ||9||" |
| `Line 4589: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4590: उत्पन्नः स जरत्कारुस्तपस्युग्रे रतो द्विजः |` | "That Jaratkarū, a twice-born [Brahmin] devoted to severe austerities, has been born," |
| `Line 4591: तस्यैष भगिनीं काले जरत्कारुं प्रयच्छतु ||१०||` | "Let him give his sister Jaratkarū to him at the proper time. ||10||" |
| `Line 4592: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4593: यदेलापत्रेण वचस्तदोक्तं भुजगेन ह |` | "What was said by the serpent Elāpatra," |
| `Line 4594: पन्नगानां हितं देवास्तत्तथा न तदन्यथा ||११||` | "O gods, is for the welfare of the serpents; it shall be so and not otherwise. ||11||" |
| `Line 4595: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4596: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4597: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4598: एतच्छ्रुत्वा स नागेन्द्रः पितामहवचस्तदा |` | "Having heard these words of Pitāmaha [Brahmā], that lord of serpents then," |
| `Line 4599: सर्पान्बहूञ्जरत्कारौ नित्ययुक्तान्समादधत् ||१२||` | "Appointed many serpents to constantly keep watch for Jaratkarū. ||12||" |
| `Line 4600: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4576: तस्येदं मानसं शल्यं समुद्धर्तुं त्वमर्हसि |` | "You ought to remove this mental anguish [thorn] of his," |

| `Line 4601: जरत्कारुर्यदा भार्यामिच्छेद्वरयितुं प्रभुः |` | "When the master Jaratkarū would wish to choose a wife," |
| `Line 4602: शीघ्रमेत्य ममाख्येयं तन्नः श्रेयो भविष्यति ||१३||` | "Coming quickly, he should inform me—that will be beneficial for us. ||13||" |

| `Line 4611: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4612: शौनक उवाच||` | "Śaunaka [sage, ritual expert] said:" |
| `Line 4613: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4614: जरत्कारुरिति प्रोक्तं यत्त्वया सूतनन्दन |` | "O Sūtanandana [son of Sūta], what you have mentioned about Jaratkarū," |
| `Line 4615: इच्छाम्येतदहं तस्य ऋषेः श्रोतुं महात्मनः ||१||` | "I wish to hear about that great-souled sage. ||1||" |
| `Line 4616: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4617: किं कारणं जरत्कारोर्नामैतत्प्रथितं भुवि |` | "What is the reason this name Jaratkarū became famous on earth?" |
| `Line 4618: जरत्कारुनिरुक्तं त्वं यथावद्वक्तुमर्हसि ||२||` | "You should properly explain the etymology of Jaratkarū. ||2||" |
| `Line 4619: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4620: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4621: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4622: जरेति क्षयमाहुर्वै दारुणं कारुसञ्ज्ञितम् |` | "Indeed, 'Jara' means decay, and 'kāru' is known as terrible," |
| `Line 4623: शरीरं कारु तस्यासीत्तत्स धीमाञ्शनैः शनैः ||३||` | "His body was 'kāru' [instrument], and that wise one gradually ||3||" |
| `Line 4624: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4625: क्षपयामास तीव्रेण तपसेत्यत उच्यते |` | "Wasted it away through intense austerities—hence he is called thus." |

| `Line 4602: शीघ्रमेत्य ममाख्येयं तन्नः श्रेयो भविष्यति ||१३||` | "Coming quickly, he should inform me—that will be beneficial for us. ||13||" |

| `Line 4618: जरत्कारुनिरुक्तं त्वं यथावद्वक्तुमर्हसि ||२||` | "You should properly explain the etymology of Jaratkarū. ||2||" |

| `Line 4622: जरेति क्षयमाहुर्वै दारुणं कारुसञ्ज्ञितम् |` | "Indeed, 'Jara' means decay, and 'kāru' is known as terrible," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4626: जरत्कारुरिति ब्रह्मन्वासुकेर्भगिनी तथा ||४||` | "Jaratkarū is her name, O Brahman [learned sage], and she is the sister of Vāsuki [serpent king]. ||4||" |
| `Line 4627: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4628: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा शौनकः प्राहसत्तदा |` | "Thus addressed, the righteous Śaunaka [sage] then smiled," |
| `Line 4629: उग्रश्रवसमामन्त्र्य उपपन्नमिति ब्रुवन् ||५||` | "Addressing Ugraśravas [Sūta's name], saying, 'This is appropriate.' ||5||" |
| `Line 4630: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4631: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4632: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4633: अथ कालस्य महतः स मुनिः संशितव्रतः |` | "Then, after a long time, that sage of strict vows," |
| `Line 4634: तपस्यभिरतो धीमान्न दारानभ्यकाङ्क्षत ||६||` | "The wise one, devoted to austerities, did not desire a wife. ||6||" |
| `Line 4635: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4636: स ऊर्ध्वरेतास्तपसि प्रसक्तः; स्वाध्यायवान्वीतभयक्लमः सन् |` | "He, practicing celibacy [semen retention], engaged in austerities, devoted to self-study, free from fear and fatigue," |
| `Line 4637: चचार सर्वां पृथिवीं महात्मा; न चापि दारान्मनसाप्यकाङ्क्षत् ||७||` | "The great soul wandered over the entire earth; and did not desire a wife even in his mind. ||7||" |
| `Line 4638: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4639: ततोऽपरस्मिन्सम्प्राप्ते काले कस्मिंश्चिदेव तु |` | "Then, at some later time," |
| `Line 4640: परिक्षिदिति विख्यातो राजा कौरववंशभृत् ||८||` | "A king named Parikṣit [encircler], renowned as the bearer of the Kuru lineage. ||8||" |
| `Line 4641: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4642: यथा पाण्डुर्महाबाहुर्धनुर्धरवरो भुवि |` | "Just as Pāṇḍu [pale one], the mighty-armed, the best archer on earth," |
| `Line 4643: बभूव मृगयाशीलः पुरास्य प्रपितामहः ||९||` | "Was fond of hunting, so was his great-grandfather before him. ||9||" |
| `Line 4644: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4645: मृगान्विध्यन्वराहांश्च तरक्षून्महिषांस्तथा |` | "Piercing deer, boars, hyenas, and buffaloes," |
| `Line 4646: अन्यांश्च विविधान्वन्यांश्चचार पृथिवीपतिः ||१०||` | "And various other wild animals, the lord of the earth roamed about. ||10||" |
| `Line 4647: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4648: स कदाचिन्मृगं विद्ध्वा बाणेन नतपर्वणा |` | "Once, having pierced a deer with an arrow of curved joints," |
| `Line 4649: पृष्ठतो धनुरादाय ससार गहने वने ||११||` | "Taking his bow, he pursued it from behind into the dense forest. ||11||" |
| `Line 4650: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4626: जरत्कारुरिति ब्रह्मन्वासुकेर्भगिनी तथा ||४||` | "Jaratkarū is her name, O Brahman [learned sage], and she is the sister of Vāsuki [serpent king]. ||4||" |
| `Line 4627: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4628: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा शौनकः प्राहसत्तदा |` | "Thus addressed, the righteous Śaunaka [sage] then smiled," |
| `Line 4629: उग्रश्रवसमामन्त्र्य उपपन्नमिति ब्रुवन् ||५||` | "Addressing Ugraśravas [Sūta's name], saying, 'This is appropriate.' ||5||" |
| `Line 4630: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4631: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4632: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4633: अथ कालस्य महतः स मुनिः संशितव्रतः |` | "Then, after a long time, that sage of strict vows," |
| `Line 4634: तपस्यभिरतो धीमान्न दारानभ्यकाङ्क्षत ||६||` | "The wise one, devoted to austerities, did not desire a wife. ||6||" |
| `Line 4635: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4636: स ऊर्ध्वरेतास्तपसि प्रसक्तः; स्वाध्यायवान्वीतभयक्लमः सन् |` | "He, practicing celibacy [semen retention], engaged in austerities, devoted to self-study, free from fear and fatigue," |
| `Line 4637: चचार सर्वां पृथिवीं महात्मा; न चापि दारान्मनसाप्यकाङ्क्षत् ||७||` | "The great soul wandered over the entire earth; and did not desire a wife even in his mind. ||7||" |
| `Line 4638: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4639: ततोऽपरस्मिन्सम्प्राप्ते काले कस्मिंश्चिदेव तु |` | "Then, at some later time," |
| `Line 4640: परिक्षिदिति विख्यातो राजा कौरववंशभृत् ||८||` | "A king named Parikṣit [encircler], renowned as the bearer of the Kuru lineage. ||8||" |
| `Line 4641: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4642: यथा पाण्डुर्महाबाहुर्धनुर्धरवरो भुवि |` | "Just as Pāṇḍu [pale one], the mighty-armed, the best archer on earth," |
| `Line 4643: बभूव मृगयाशीलः पुरास्य प्रपितामहः ||९||` | "Was fond of hunting, so was his great-grandfather before him. ||9||" |
| `Line 4644: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4645: मृगान्विध्यन्वराहांश्च तरक्षून्महिषांस्तथा |` | "Piercing deer, boars, hyenas, and buffaloes," |
| `Line 4646: अन्यांश्च विविधान्वन्यांश्चचार पृथिवीपतिः ||१०||` | "And various other wild animals, the lord of the earth roamed about. ||10||" |
| `Line 4647: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4648: स कदाचिन्मृगं विद्ध्वा बाणेन नतपर्वणा |` | "Once, having pierced a deer with an arrow of curved joints," |
| `Line 4649: पृष्ठतो धनुरादाय ससार गहने वने ||११||` | "Taking his bow, he pursued it from behind into the dense forest. ||11||" |
| `Line 4650: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4651: यथा हि भगवान्रुद्रो विद्ध्वा यज्ञमृगं दिवि |` | "Just as the venerable Rudra [Śiva], having pierced the sacrificial deer in heaven," |
| `Line 4652: अन्वगच्छद्धनुष्पाणिः पर्यन्वेषंस्ततस्ततः ||१२||` | "Followed it with bow in hand, searching here and there. ||12||" |
| `Line 4653: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4654: न हि तेन मृगो विद्धो जीवन्गच्छति वै वनम् |` | "For indeed, the deer pierced by him does not go living to the forest," |
| `Line 4655: पूर्वरूपं तु तन्नूनमासीत्स्वर्गगतिं प्रति ||१३||` | "But surely that was a foretoken regarding the path to heaven. ||13||" |
| `Line 4656: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4657: परिक्षितस्तस्य राज्ञो विद्धो यन्नष्टवान्मृगः ||१३||` | "For King Parikshit, the deer that was shot had disappeared. ||13||" |
| `Line 4658: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4659: दूरं चापहृतस्तेन मृगेण स महीपतिः |` | "And that ruler of the earth was led far away by that deer," |
| `Line 4660: परिश्रान्तः पिपासार्त आससाद मुनिं वने ||१४||` | "Exhausted and afflicted with thirst, he came upon a sage in the forest. ||14||" |
| `Line 4661: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4662: गवां प्रचारेष्वासीनं वत्सानां मुखनिःसृतम् |` | "The sage was sitting in the pastures of cows, drinking the foam," |
| `Line 4663: भूयिष्ठमुपयुञ्जानं फेनमापिबतां पयः ||१५||` | "Abundantly consuming the foam of milk flowing from the mouths of calves. ||15||" |
| `Line 4664: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4665: तमभिद्रुत्य वेगेन स राजा संशितव्रतम् |` | "Rushing quickly toward him, that king approached the sage of strict vows," |
| `Line 4666: अपृच्छद्धनुरुद्यम्य तं मुनिं क्षुच्छ्रमान्वितः ||१६||` | "And raising his bow, asked the sage, being afflicted with hunger and fatigue. ||16||" |
| `Line 4667: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4668: भो भो ब्रह्मन्नहं राजा परिक्षिदभिमन्युजः |` | "O Brahmin, I am King Parikshit, son of Abhimanyu," |
| `Line 4669: मया विद्धो मृगो नष्टः कच्चित्त्वं दृष्टवानसि ||१७||` | "A deer pierced by me has disappeared; have you perhaps seen it? ||17||" |
| `Line 4670: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4671: स मुनिस्तस्य नोवाच किञ्चिन्मौनव्रते स्थितः |` | "That sage did not say anything to him, being established in a vow of silence," |
| `Line 4672: तस्य स्कन्धे मृतं सर्पं क्रुद्धो राजा समासजत् ||१८||` | "The angry king placed a dead snake on his shoulder. ||18||" |
| `Line 4673: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4674: धनुष्कोट्या समुत्क्षिप्य स चैनं समुदैक्षत |` | "Having lifted it with the end of his bow, and the sage looked at him," |
| `Line 4675: न च किञ्चिदुवाचैनं शुभं वा यदि वाशुभम् ||१९||` | "But did not say anything to him, whether good or bad. ||19||" |

| `Line 4652: अन्वगच्छद्धनुष्पाणिः पर्यन्वेषंस्ततस्ततः ||१२||` | "Followed it with bow in hand, searching here and there. ||12||" |

| `Line 4655: पूर्वरूपं तु तन्नूनमासीत्स्वर्गगतिं प्रति ||१३||` | "But surely that was a foretoken regarding the path to heaven. ||13||" |

| `Line 4674: धनुष्कोट्या समुत्क्षिप्य स चैनं समुदैक्षत |` | "Having lifted it with the end of his bow, and the sage looked at him," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4676: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4677: स राजा क्रोधमुत्सृज्य व्यथितस्तं तथागतम् |` | "That king, abandoning his anger, distressed upon seeing him in such a condition," |
| `Line 4678: दृष्ट्वा जगाम नगरमृषिस्त्वास्ते तथैव सः ||२०||` | "Went back to his city, while the sage remained there in the same state. ||20||" |
| `Line 4679: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4680: तरुणस्तस्य पुत्रोऽभूत्तिग्मतेजा महातपाः |` | "That sage had a young son of fierce energy and great austerity," |
| `Line 4681: शृङ्गी नाम महाक्रोधो दुष्प्रसादो महाव्रतः ||२१||` | "Named Śṛṅgī, who was extremely wrathful, difficult to please, and of great vows. ||21||" |
| `Line 4682: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4683: स देवं परमीशानं सर्वभूतहिते रतम् |` | "He worshipped the supreme lord [Brahma], who is devoted to the welfare of all beings," |
| `Line 4684: ब्रह्माणमुपतस्थे वै काले काले सुसंयतः ||२२||` | "He approached Brahmā at regular intervals, with great self-control. ||22||" |
| `Line 4685: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4686: स तेन समनुज्ञातो ब्रह्मणा गृहमेयिवान् ||२२||` | "Having been permitted by Brahmā, he returned home. ||22||" |
| `Line 4687: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4688: सख्योक्तः क्रीडमानेन स तत्र हसता किल |` | "There, he was told by a playful, laughing friend," |
| `Line 4689: संरम्भी कोपनोऽतीव विषकल्प ऋषेः सुतः ||२३||` | "That sage's son who was impetuous, extremely irascible, and venomous in nature. ||23||" |
| `Line 4690: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4691: ऋषिपुत्रेण नर्मार्थं कृशेन द्विजसत्तम ||२३||` | "By a thin sage's son named Kṛśa [emaciated one], in jest, O best of the twice-born. ||23||" |
| `Line 4692: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4693: तेजस्विनस्तव पिता तथैव च तपस्विनः |` | "'Your father, though powerful and austere," |
| `Line 4694: शवं स्कन्धेन वहति मा शृङ्गिन्गर्वितो भव ||२४||` | "Is carrying a dead snake on his shoulders. O Śṛṅgī, do not be proud! ||24||'" |
| `Line 4695: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4696: व्याहरत्स्वृषिपुत्रेषु मा स्म किञ्चिद्वचो वदीः |` | "'Do not speak any words among the sons of sages," |
| `Line 4697: अस्मद्विधेषु सिद्धेषु ब्रह्मवित्सु तपस्विषु ||२५||` | "Among accomplished ones like us, who are knowers of Brahman and ascetics. ||25||'" |
| `Line 4698: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4699: क्व ते पुरुषमानित्वं क्व ते वाचस्तथाविधाः |` | "'Where is your manly pride, where are those boastful words of yours," |
| `Line 4700: दर्पजाः पितरं यस्त्वं द्रष्टा शवधरं तथा ||२६||` | "Born of arrogance, when you will see your father bearing a corpse thus? ||26||'" |
translations: | `Line 4676: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4677: स राजा क्रोधमुत्सृज्य व्यथितस्तं तथागतम् |` | "That king, abandoning his anger, distressed upon seeing him in such a condition," |
| `Line 4678: दृष्ट्वा जगाम नगरमृषिस्त्वास्ते तथैव सः ||२०||` | "Went back to his city, while the sage remained there in the same state. ||20||" |
| `Line 4679: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4680: तरुणस्तस्य पुत्रोऽभूत्तिग्मतेजा महातपाः |` | "That sage had a young son of fierce energy and great austerity," |
| `Line 4681: शृङ्गी नाम महाक्रोधो दुष्प्रसादो महाव्रतः ||२१||` | "Named Śṛṅgī, who was extremely wrathful, difficult to please, and of great vows. ||21||" |
| `Line 4682: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4683: स देवं परमीशानं सर्वभूतहिते रतम् |` | "He worshipped the supreme lord [Brahma], who is devoted to the welfare of all beings," |
| `Line 4684: ब्रह्माणमुपतस्थे वै काले काले सुसंयतः ||२२||` | "He approached Brahmā at regular intervals, with great self-control. ||22||" |
| `Line 4685: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4686: स तेन समनुज्ञातो ब्रह्मणा गृहमेयिवान् ||२२||` | "Having been permitted by Brahmā, he returned home. ||22||" |
| `Line 4687: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4688: सख्योक्तः क्रीडमानेन स तत्र हसता किल |` | "There, he was told by a playful, laughing friend," |
| `Line 4689: संरम्भी कोपनोऽतीव विषकल्प ऋषेः सुतः ||२३||` | "That sage's son who was impetuous, extremely irascible, and venomous in nature. ||23||" |
| `Line 4690: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4691: ऋषिपुत्रेण नर्मार्थं कृशेन द्विजसत्तम ||२३||` | "By a thin sage's son named Kṛśa [emaciated one], in jest, O best of the twice-born. ||23||" |
| `Line 4692: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4693: तेजस्विनस्तव पिता तथैव च तपस्विनः |` | "'Your father, though powerful and austere," |
| `Line 4694: शवं स्कन्धेन वहति मा शृङ्गिन्गर्वितो भव ||२४||` | "Is carrying a dead snake on his shoulders. O Śṛṅgī, do not be proud! ||24||'" |
| `Line 4695: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 4696: व्याहरत्स्वृषिपुत्रेषु मा स्म किञ्चिद्वचो वदीः |` | "'Do not speak any words among the sons of sages," |
| `Line 4697: अस्मद्विधेषु सिद्धेषु ब्रह्मवित्सु तपस्विषु ||२५||` | "Among accomplished ones like us, who are knowers of Brahman and ascetics. ||25||'" |

| `Line 4699: क्व ते पुरुषमानित्वं क्व ते वाचस्तथाविधाः |` | "'Where is your manly pride, where are those boastful words of yours," |

| `Line 4709: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4710: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4711: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4712: एवमुक्तः स तेजस्वी शृङ्गी कोपसमन्वितः |` | "Thus addressed, the radiant Śṛṅgī [sage's son], filled with anger," |
| `Line 4713: मृतधारं गुरुं श्रुत्वा पर्यतप्यत मन्युना ||१||` | "Having heard that his guru [teacher] bore a dead snake, was consumed by wrath. ||1||" |
| `Line 4714: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4715: स तं कृशमभिप्रेष्क्य सूनृतां वाचमुत्सृजन् |` | "He, looking at Kṛśa [thin one], speaking gentle words," |
| `Line 4716: अपृच्छत कथं तातः स मेऽद्य मृतधारकः ||२||` | "Asked, 'How is it that my father today bears a dead snake?' ||2||" |
| `Line 4717: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4718: कृश उवाच||` | "Kṛśa said:" |
| `Line 4719: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4720: राज्ञा परिक्षिता तात मृगयां परिधावता |` | "King Parīkṣit [Parikshit], O dear one, while running about hunting," |
| `Line 4721: अवसक्तः पितुस्तेऽद्य मृतः स्कन्धे भुजङ्गमः ||३||` | "Placed a dead serpent [snake] today on your father's shoulders. ||3||" |
| `Line 4722: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4723: शृङ्ग्युवाच||` | "Śṛṅgī said:" |
| `Line 4724: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4725: किं मे पित्रा कृतं तस्य राज्ञोऽनिष्टं दुरात्मनः |` | "What harm did my father do to that evil-minded king?" |

| `Line 4716: अपृच्छत कथं तातः स मेऽद्य मृतधारकः ||२||` | "Asked, 'How is it that my father today bears a dead snake?' ||2||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4726: ब्रूहि त्वं कृश तत्त्वेन पश्य मे तपसो बलम् ||४||` | "Tell me the truth, O Kṛśa, behold the power of my austerities. ||4||" |
| `Line 4727: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4728: कृश उवाच||` | "Kṛśa [the thin one] said:" |
| `Line 4729: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4730: स राजा मृगयां यातः परिक्षिदभिमन्युजः |` | "That king, Parikṣit [son of Abhimanyu], went hunting," |
| `Line 4731: ससार मृगमेकाकी विद्ध्वा बाणेन पत्रिणा ||५||` | "He pursued a deer alone, having pierced it with a feathered arrow. ||5||" |
| `Line 4732: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4733: न चापश्यन्मृगं राजा चरंस्तस्मिन्महावने |` | "And the king did not see the deer while wandering in that great forest," |
| `Line 4734: पितरं ते स दृष्ट्वैव पप्रच्छानभिभाषिणम् ||६||` | "Seeing your father, he questioned him who was not speaking. ||6||" |
| `Line 4735: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4736: तं स्थाणुभूतं तिष्ठन्तं क्षुत्पिपासाश्रमातुरः |` | "To him who was standing motionless like a pillar, the king, afflicted by hunger, thirst, and fatigue," |
| `Line 4737: पुनः पुनर्मृगं नष्टं पप्रच्छ पितरं तव ||७||` | "Again and again asked your father about the lost deer. ||7||" |
| `Line 4738: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4739: स च मौनव्रतोपेतो नैव तं प्रत्यभाषत |` | "And he, observing a vow of silence, did not reply to him," |
| `Line 4740: तस्य राजा धनुष्कोट्या सर्पं स्कन्धे समासृजत् ||८||` | "The king placed a dead snake on his shoulders with the tip of his bow. ||8||" |
| `Line 4741: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4742: शृङ्गिंस्तव पिताद्यासौ तथैवास्ते यतव्रतः |` | "O Śṛṅgin [horned one], your father even now sits there, steadfast in his vow," |
| `Line 4743: सोऽपि राजा स्वनगरं प्रतियातो गजाह्वयम् ||९||` | "And that king has returned to his own city, Gajāhvaya [Hastināpura]. ||9||" |
| `Line 4744: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4745: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4746: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4747: श्रुत्वैवमृषिपुत्रस्तु दिवं स्तब्ध्वेव विष्ठितः |` | "Hearing this, the sage's son stood as if freezing the sky," |
| `Line 4748: कोपसंरक्तनयनः प्रज्वलन्निव मन्युना ||१०||` | "With eyes reddened by anger, as if blazing with wrath. ||10||" |
| `Line 4749: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4750: आविष्टः स तु कोपेन शशाप नृपतिं तदा |` | "Possessed by anger, he then cursed the king," |
translations: | `Line 4726: ब्रूहि त्वं कृश तत्त्वेन पश्य मे तपसो बलम् ||४||` | "Tell me the truth, O Kṛśa, behold the power of my austerities. ||4||" |
| `Line 4727: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4728: कृश उवाच||` | "Kṛśa [the thin one] said:" |
| `Line 4729: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4730: स राजा मृगयां यातः परिक्षिदभिमन्युजः |` | "That king, Parikṣit [son of Abhimanyu], went hunting," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4751: वार्युपस्पृश्य तेजस्वी क्रोधवेगबलात्कृतः ||११||` | "Having touched water [ritual purification], the radiant one was overcome by the force of his anger. ||11||" |
| `Line 4752: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4753: शृङ्ग्युवाच||` | "Śṛṅgī [young sage] said:" |
| `Line 4754: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4755: योऽसौ वृद्धस्य तातस्य तथा कृच्छ्रगतस्य च |` | "That one who, when my elderly father was in such a difficult situation," |
| `Line 4756: स्कन्धे मृतमवास्राक्षीत्पन्नगं राजकिल्बिषी ||१२||` | "Placed a dead snake on his shoulders, that sinful king, ||12||" |
| `Line 4757: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4758: तं पापमतिसङ्क्रुद्धस्तक्षकः पन्नगोत्तमः |` | "That sinful one, Takṣaka [serpent king], the foremost among serpents, extremely enraged," |
| `Line 4759: आशीविषस्तिग्मतेजा मद्वाक्यबलचोदितः ||१३||` | "The venomous one with fierce power, impelled by the force of my words, ||13||" |
| `Line 4760: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4761: सप्तरात्रादितो नेता यमस्य सदनं प्रति |` | "Will lead from today, after seven nights, to the abode of Yama [death god]," |
| `Line 4762: द्विजानामवमन्तारं कुरूणामयशस्करम् ||१४||` | "This insulter of twice-born [Brahmins] who brings disgrace to the Kurus. ||14||" |
| `Line 4763: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4764: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4765: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4766: इति शप्त्वा नृपं क्रुद्धः शृङ्गी पितरमभ्ययात् |` | "Having thus cursed the king in anger, Śṛṅgī approached his father," |
| `Line 4767: आसीनं गोचरे तस्मिन्वहन्तं शवपन्नगम् ||१५||` | "Who was sitting in that pasture, bearing the dead snake. ||15||" |
| `Line 4768: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4769: स तमालक्ष्य पितरं शृङ्गी स्कन्धगतेन वै |` | "Seeing his father with the snake placed on his shoulders," |
| `Line 4770: शवेन भुजगेनासीद्भूयः क्रोधसमन्वितः ||१६||` | "Śṛṅgī was again filled with anger. ||16||" |
| `Line 4771: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4772: दुःखाच्चाश्रूणि मुमुचे पितरं चेदमब्रवीत् |` | "And from sorrow he shed tears and said this to his father:" |
| `Line 4773: श्रुत्वेमां धर्षणां तात तव तेन दुरात्मना ||१७||` | "Having heard of this insult to you, father, by that evil-minded one, ||17||" |
| `Line 4774: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4775: राज्ञा परिक्षिता कोपादशपं तमहं नृपम् |` | "In anger I have cursed that king Parikṣit [Kuru ruler]," |
translations: | `Line 4751: वार्युपस्पृश्य तेजस्वी क्रोधवेगबलात्कृतः ||११||` | "Having touched water [ritual purification], the radiant one was overcome by the force of his anger. ||11||" |
| `Line 4752: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4753: शृङ्ग्युवाच||` | "Śṛṅgī [young sage] said:" |
| `Line 4754: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4755: योऽसौ वृद्धस्य तातस्य तथा कृच्छ्रगतस्य च |` | "That one who, when my elderly father was in such a difficult situation," |
| `Line 4756: स्कन्धे मृतमवास्राक्षीत्पन्नगं राजकिल्बिषी ||१२||` | "Placed a dead snake on his shoulders, that sinful king, ||12||" |
| `Line 4757: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4758: तं पापमतिसङ्क्रुद्धस्तक्षकः पन्नगोत्तमः |` | "That sinful one, Takṣaka [serpent king], the foremost among serpents, extremely enraged," |
| `Line 4759: आशीविषस्तिग्मतेजा मद्वाक्यबलचोदितः ||१३||` | "The venomous one with fierce power, impelled by the force of my words, ||13||" |
| `Line 4760: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4761: सप्तरात्रादितो नेता यमस्य सदनं प्रति |` | "Will lead from today, after seven nights, to the abode of Yama [death god]," |
| `Line 4762: द्विजानामवमन्तारं कुरूणामयशस्करम् ||१४||` | "This insulter of twice-born [Brahmins] who brings disgrace to the Kurus. ||14||" |
| `Line 4763: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4764: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4765: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4766: इति शप्त्वा नृपं क्रुद्धः शृङ्गी पितरमभ्ययात् |` | "Having thus cursed the king in anger, Śṛṅgī approached his father," |
| `Line 4767: आसीनं गोचरे तस्मिन्वहन्तं शवपन्नगम् ||१५||` | "Who was sitting in that pasture, bearing the dead snake. ||15||" |
| `Line 4768: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4769: स तमालक्ष्य पितरं शृङ्गी स्कन्धगतेन वै |` | "Seeing his father with the snake placed on his shoulders," |
| `Line 4770: शवेन भुजगेनासीद्भूयः क्रोधसमन्वितः ||१६||` | "Śṛṅgī was again filled with anger. ||16||" |
| `Line 4771: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4772: दुःखाच्चाश्रूणि मुमुचे पितरं चेदमब्रवीत् |` | "And from sorrow he shed tears and said this to his father:" |
| `Line 4773: श्रुत्वेमां धर्षणां तात तव तेन दुरात्मना ||१७||` | "Having heard of this insult to you, father, by that evil-minded one, ||17||" |
| `Line 4774: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4775: राज्ञा परिक्षिता कोपादशपं तमहं नृपम् |` | "In anger I have cursed that king Parikṣit [Kuru ruler]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 476: यदाश्रौषं श्रान्तमेकं शयानं; ह्रदं गत्वा स्तम्भयित्वा तदम्भः |` | "When I heard that the exhausted one was lying alone, having gone to the lake and frozen its waters," |
| `Line 477: दुर्योधनं विरथं भग्नदर्पं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५०||` | "Duryodhana, chariotless and with broken pride - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||150||" |
| `Line 478: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 479: यदाश्रौषं पाण्डवांस्तिष्ठमाना; न्गङ्गाह्रदे वासुदेवेन सार्धम् |` | "When I heard that the Pandavas were standing at the Ganga lake [sacred river pool] together with Vasudeva [Krishna]," |
| `Line 480: अमर्षणं धर्षयतः सुतं मे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५१||` | "Provoking my impatient son - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||151||" |
| `Line 481: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 482: यदाश्रौषं विविधांस्तात मार्गा; न्गदायुद्धे मण्डलं सञ्चरन्तम् |` | "When I heard, dear one, about the various paths he was moving in circular patterns during the mace duel," |
| `Line 483: मिथ्या हतं वासुदेवस्य बुद्ध्या; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५२||` | "And was falsely defeated by Vasudeva's [Krishna's] strategy - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||152||" |
| `Line 484: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 485: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणपुत्रादिभिस्तै; र्हतान्पाञ्चालान्द्रौपदेयांश्च सुप्तान् |` | "When I heard that by Drona's son [Ashvatthama] and others, the sleeping Panchalas and Draupadi's sons were slain," |
| `Line 486: कृतं बीभत्समयशस्यं च कर्म; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५३||` | "A horrible and inglorious deed was done - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||153||" |
| `Line 487: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 488: यदाश्रौषं भीमसेनानुयातेन; अश्वत्थाम्ना परमास्त्रं प्रयुक्तम् |` | "When I heard that Ashvatthama, pursued by Bhimasena, discharged the supreme weapon," |
| `Line 489: क्रुद्धेनैषीकमवधीद्येन गर्भं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५४||` | "And in anger destroyed the fetus with his reed-weapon [Brahmastra] - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||154||" |
| `Line 490: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 491: यदाश्रौषं ब्रह्मशिरोऽर्जुनेन; मुक्तं स्वस्तीत्यस्त्रमस्त्रेण शान्तम् |` | "When I heard that the Brahma-weapon [divine missile] released by Arjuna neutralized the other weapon with a 'svasti' [blessing]," |
| `Line 492: अश्वत्थाम्ना मणिरत्नं च दत्तं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५५||` | "And that Ashvatthama surrendered his jewel [head gem] - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||155||" |
| `Line 493: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 494: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणपुत्रेण गर्भे; वैराट्या वै पात्यमाने महास्त्रे |` | "When I heard that when Drona's son [Ashvatthama] directed the great weapon at the womb of Virata's daughter [Uttara]," |
| `Line 495: द्वैपायनः केशवो द्रोणपुत्रं; परस्परेणाभिशापैः शशाप ||१५६||` | "Dvaipayana [Vyasa] and Keshava [Krishna] cursed Drona's son with mutual curses - ||156||" |
| `Line 496: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 497: शोच्या गान्धारी पुत्रपौत्रैर्विहीना; तथा वध्वः पितृभिर्भ्रातृभिश्च |` | "Pitiable is Gandhari, bereft of sons and grandsons; likewise the daughters-in-law, of their fathers and brothers," |
| `Line 498: कृतं कार्यं दुष्करं पाण्डवेयैः; प्राप्तं राज्यमसपत्नं पुनस्तैः ||१५७||` | "The Pandavas have accomplished a difficult task; they have regained the kingdom without rivals. ||157||" |
| `Line 499: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 500: कष्टं युद्धे दश शेषाः श्रुता मे; त्रयोऽस्माकं पाण्डवानां च सप्त |` | "Alas! I have heard that only ten survived the war - three of ours and seven of the Pandavas," |
translations: | `Line 476: यदाश्रौषं श्रान्तमेकं शयानं; ह्रदं गत्वा स्तम्भयित्वा तदम्भः |` | "When I heard that the exhausted one was lying alone, having gone to the lake and frozen its waters," |
| `Line 477: दुर्योधनं विरथं भग्नदर्पं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५०||` | "Duryodhana, chariotless and with broken pride - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||150||" |
| `Line 478: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 479: यदाश्रौषं पाण्डवांस्तिष्ठमाना; न्गङ्गाह्रदे वासुदेवेन सार्धम् |` | "When I heard that the Pandavas were standing at the Ganga lake [sacred river pool] together with Vasudeva [Krishna]," |
| `Line 480: अमर्षणं धर्षयतः सुतं मे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५१||` | "Provoking my impatient son - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||151||" |
| `Line 481: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 482: यदाश्रौषं विविधांस्तात मार्गा; न्गदायुद्धे मण्डलं सञ्चरन्तम् |` | "When I heard, dear one, about the various paths he was moving in circular patterns during the mace duel," |
| `Line 483: मिथ्या हतं वासुदेवस्य बुद्ध्या; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५२||` | "And was falsely defeated by Vasudeva's [Krishna's] strategy - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||152||" |
| `Line 484: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 485: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणपुत्रादिभिस्तै; र्हतान्पाञ्चालान्द्रौपदेयांश्च सुप्तान् |` | "When I heard that by Drona's son [Ashvatthama] and others, the sleeping Panchalas and Draupadi's sons were slain," |
| `Line 486: कृतं बीभत्समयशस्यं च कर्म; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५३||` | "A horrible and inglorious deed was done - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||153||" |
| `Line 487: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 488: यदाश्रौषं भीमसेनानुयातेन; अश्वत्थाम्ना परमास्त्रं प्रयुक्तम् |` | "When I heard that Ashvatthama, pursued by Bhimasena, discharged the supreme weapon," |

| `Line 489: क्रुद्धेनैषीकमवधीद्येन गर्भं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५४||` | "And in anger destroyed the fetus with his reed-weapon [Brahmastra] - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||154||" |
| `Line 490: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 491: यदाश्रौषं ब्रह्मशिरोऽर्जुनेन; मुक्तं स्वस्तीत्यस्त्रमस्त्रेण शान्तम् |` | "When I heard that the Brahma-weapon [divine missile] released by Arjuna neutralized the other weapon with a 'svasti' [blessing]," |
| `Line 492: अश्वत्थाम्ना मणिरत्नं च दत्तं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय सञ्जय ||१५५||` | "And that Ashvatthama surrendered his jewel [head gem] - then, Sanjaya, I had no hope for victory. ||155||" |
| `Line 493: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 494: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणपुत्रेण गर्भे; वैराट्या वै पात्यमाने महास्त्रे |` | "When I heard that when Drona's son [Ashvatthama] directed the great weapon at the womb of Virata's daughter [Uttara]," |
| `Line 495: द्वैपायनः केशवो द्रोणपुत्रं; परस्परेणाभिशापैः शशाप ||१५६||` | "Dvaipayana [Vyasa] and Keshava [Krishna] cursed Drona's son with mutual curses - ||156||" |
| `Line 496: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 497: शोच्या गान्धारी पुत्रपौत्रैर्विहीना; तथा वध्वः पितृभिर्भ्रातृभिश्च |` | "Pitiable is Gandhari, bereft of sons and grandsons; likewise the daughters-in-law, of their fathers and brothers," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4776: यथार्हति स एवोग्रं शापं कुरुकुलाधमः ||१८||` | "That very lowest of the Kuru family [Parikshit] deserves this terrible curse. ||18||" |
| `Line 4777: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4778: सप्तमेऽहनि तं पापं तक्षकः पन्नगोत्तमः |` | "On the seventh day, Takshaka, the best of serpents [nāga chief]," |
| `Line 4779: वैवस्वतस्य भवनं नेता परमदारुणम् ||१९||` | "Will lead that sinful one to the abode of Vaivasvata [Yama, death god], most terribly. ||19||" |
| `Line 4780: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4781: तमब्रवीत्पिता ब्रह्मंस्तथा कोपसमन्वितम् |` | "His father said to him, O Brahman [sage], who was thus filled with anger," |
| `Line 4782: न मे प्रियं कृतं तात नैष धर्मस्तपस्विनाम् ||२०||` | "You have not done what pleases me, my son; this is not the dharma [righteous duty] of ascetics. ||20||" |
| `Line 4783: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4784: वयं तस्य नरेन्द्रस्य विषये निवसामहे |` | "We live in the kingdom of that lord of men [king]," |
| `Line 4785: न्यायतो रक्षितास्तेन तस्य पापं न रोचये ||२१||` | "Justly protected by him; I do not approve of his being cursed. ||21||" |
| `Line 4786: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4787: सर्वथा वर्तमानस्य राज्ञो ह्यस्मद्विधैः सदा |` | "The king who always conducts himself properly toward people like us," |
| `Line 4788: क्षन्तव्यं पुत्र धर्मो हि हतो हन्ति न संशयः ||२२||` | "Should be forgiven, my son, for dharma [righteousness] destroyed destroys in return, without doubt. ||22||" |
| `Line 4789: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4790: यदि राजा न रक्षेत पीडा वै नः परा भवेत् |` | "If the king did not protect us, great suffering would befall us," |
| `Line 4791: न शक्नुयाम चरितुं धर्मं पुत्र यथासुखम् ||२३||` | "We would not be able to practice dharma [religious duties] comfortably, my son. ||23||" |
| `Line 4792: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4793: रक्ष्यमाणा वयं तात राजभिः शास्त्रदृष्टिभिः |` | "Being protected, my dear son, by kings who follow the scriptures," |
| `Line 4794: चरामो विपुलं धर्मं तेषां चांशोऽस्ति धर्मतः ||२४||` | "We practice extensive dharma [religious duties], and they have a share in that dharma. ||24||" |
| `Line 4795: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4796: परिक्षित्तु विशेषेण यथास्य प्रपितामहः |` | "Parikshit especially, just like his great-grandfather [Yudhishthira]," |
| `Line 4797: रक्षत्यस्मान्यथा राज्ञा रक्षितव्याः प्रजास्तथा ||२५||` | "Protects us as subjects should be protected by a king. ||25||" |
| `Line 4798: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4799: तेनेह क्षुधितेनाद्य श्रान्तेन च तपस्विना |` | "By him today, hungry and tired, an ascetic [king]," |
| `Line 4800: अजानता व्रतमिदं कृतमेतदसंशयम् ||२६||` | "This was done unknowingly of our vow, without doubt. ||26||" |
translations: | `Line 4776: यथार्हति स एवोग्रं शापं कुरुकुलाधमः ||१८||` | "That very lowest of the Kuru family [Parikshit] deserves this terrible curse. ||18||" |
| `Line 4777: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4778: सप्तमेऽहनि तं पापं तक्षकः पन्नगोत्तमः |` | "On the seventh day, Takshaka, the best of serpents [nāga chief]," |
| `Line 4779: वैवस्वतस्य भवनं नेता परमदारुणम् ||१९||` | "Will lead that sinful one to the abode of Vaivasvata [Yama, death god], most terribly. ||19||" |
| `Line 4780: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4781: तमब्रवीत्पिता ब्रह्मंस्तथा कोपसमन्वितम् |` | "His father said to him, O Brahman [sage], who was thus filled with anger," |
| `Line 4782: न मे प्रियं कृतं तात नैष धर्मस्तपस्विनाम् ||२०||` | "You have not done what pleases me, my son; this is not the dharma [righteous duty] of ascetics. ||20||" |
| `Line 4783: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4784: वयं तस्य नरेन्द्रस्य विषये निवसामहे |` | "We live in the kingdom of that lord of men [king]," |
| `Line 4785: न्यायतो रक्षितास्तेन तस्य पापं न रोचये ||२१||` | "Justly protected by him; I do not approve of his being cursed. ||21||" |
| `Line 4786: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4787: सर्वथा वर्तमानस्य राज्ञो ह्यस्मद्विधैः सदा |` | "The king who always conducts himself properly toward people like us," |
| `Line 4788: क्षन्तव्यं पुत्र धर्मो हि हतो हन्ति न संशयः ||२२||` | "Should be forgiven, my son, for dharma [righteousness] destroyed destroys in return, without doubt. ||22||" |
| `Line 4789: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4790: यदि राजा न रक्षेत पीडा वै नः परा भवेत् |` | "If the king did not protect us, great suffering would befall us," |
| `Line 4791: न शक्नुयाम चरितुं धर्मं पुत्र यथासुखम् ||२३||` | "We would not be able to practice dharma [religious duties] comfortably, my son. ||23||" |
| `Line 4792: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4793: रक्ष्यमाणा वयं तात राजभिः शास्त्रदृष्टिभिः |` | "Being protected, my dear son, by kings who follow the scriptures," |
| `Line 4794: चरामो विपुलं धर्मं तेषां चांशोऽस्ति धर्मतः ||२४||` | "We practice extensive dharma [religious duties], and they have a share in that dharma. ||24||" |
| `Line 4795: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4796: परिक्षित्तु विशेषेण यथास्य प्रपितामहः |` | "Parikshit especially, just like his great-grandfather [Yudhishthira]," |
| `Line 4797: रक्षत्यस्मान्यथा राज्ञा रक्षितव्याः प्रजास्तथा ||२५||` | "Protects us as subjects should be protected by a king. ||25||" |
| `Line 4798: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4799: तेनेह क्षुधितेनाद्य श्रान्तेन च तपस्विना |` | "By him today, hungry and tired, an ascetic [king]," |
| `Line 4800: अजानता व्रतमिदं कृतमेतदसंशयम् ||२६||` | "This was done unknowingly of our vow, without doubt. ||26||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4801: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4802: तस्मादिदं त्वया बाल्यात्सहसा दुष्कृतं कृतम् |` | "Therefore, this evil deed has been done by you hastily out of childishness," |
| `Line 4803: न ह्यर्हति नृपः शापमस्मत्तः पुत्र सर्वथा ||२७||` | "For the king does not deserve a curse from us in any way, O son. ||27||" |
| `Line 4804: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4805: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4806: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4807: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4808: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4809: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4810: ३८` | "38" |
| `Line 4811: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4812: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4813: शृङ्ग्युवाच||` | "Śṛṅgī [sage's son] said:" |
| `Line 4814: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4815: यद्येतत्साहसं तात यदि वा दुष्कृतं कृतम् |` | "Whether this was rashness, father, or whether an evil deed was done," |
| `Line 4816: प्रियं वाप्यप्रियं वा ते वागुक्ता न मृषा मया ||१||` | "Whether pleasing or displeasing to you, the words spoken by me are not false. ||1||" |
| `Line 4817: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4818: नैवान्यथेदं भविता पितरेष ब्रवीमि ते |` | "This will not be otherwise, father, I tell you this," |
| `Line 4819: नाहं मृषा प्रब्रवीमि स्वैरेष्वपि कुतः शपन् ||२||` | "I do not speak falsely even in casual matters, how much less when pronouncing a curse? ||2||" |
| `Line 4820: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4821: शमीक उवाच||` | "Śamīka [sage father] said:" |
| `Line 4822: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4823: जानाम्युग्रप्रभावं त्वां पुत्र सत्यगिरं तथा |` | "I know your terrible power, O son, and that you speak the truth," |
| `Line 4824: नानृतं ह्युक्तपूर्वं ते नैतन्मिथ्या भविष्यति ||३||` | "You have never spoken falsehood before, and this will not prove false. ||3||" |
| `Line 4825: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4803: न ह्यर्हति नृपः शापमस्मत्तः पुत्र सर्वथा ||२७||` | "For the king does not deserve a curse from us in any way, O son. ||27||" |

| `Line 4809: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4826: पित्रा पुत्रो वयःस्थोऽपि सततं वाच्य एव तु |` | "A son, even when grown up [of mature age], should always be instructed by his father," |
| `Line 4827: यथा स्याद्गुणसंयुक्तः प्राप्नुयाच्च महद्यशः ||४||` | "So that he may be endowed with virtues and attain great fame. ||4||" |
| `Line 4828: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4829: किं पुनर्बाल एव त्वं तपसा भावितः प्रभो |` | "How much more so when you are but a child, though empowered by austerities, O lord," |
| `Line 4830: वर्धते च प्रभवतां कोपोऽतीव महात्मनाम् ||५||` | "And the anger of powerful great souls increases exceedingly. ||5||" |
| `Line 4831: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4832: सोऽहं पश्यामि वक्तव्यं त्वयि धर्मभृतां वर |` | "I see what must be said to you, O best of the upholders of dharma [righteousness]," |
| `Line 4833: पुत्रत्वं बालतां चैव तवावेक्ष्य च साहसम् ||६||` | "Considering your status as my son, your childhood, and your rashness. ||6||" |
| `Line 4834: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4835: स त्वं शमयुतो भूत्वा वन्यमाहारमाहरन् |` | "You should be filled with tranquility, subsisting on forest food," |
| `Line 4836: चर क्रोधमिमं त्यक्त्वा नैवं धर्मं प्रहास्यसि ||७||` | "Live abandoning this anger, and thus you will not forsake dharma [righteousness]. ||7||" |
| `Line 4837: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4838: क्रोधो हि धर्मं हरति यतीनां दुःखसञ्चितम् |` | "For anger steals away the dharma of ascetics [renunciates] accumulated through hardship," |
| `Line 4839: ततो धर्मविहीनानां गतिरिष्टा न विद्यते ||८||` | "And for those bereft of dharma, the desired destination does not exist. ||8||" |
| `Line 4840: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4841: शम एव यतीनां हि क्षमिणां सिद्धिकारकः |` | "Tranquility alone is the cause of perfection for ascetics who are forgiving," |
| `Line 4842: क्षमावतामयं लोकः परश्चैव क्षमावताम् ||९||` | "This world and the next belong to those who are forgiving. ||9||" |
| `Line 4843: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4844: तस्माच्चरेथाः सततं क्षमाशीलो जितेन्द्रियः |` | "Therefore, you should always live with a forgiving nature, with controlled senses," |
| `Line 4845: क्षमया प्राप्स्यसे लोकान्ब्रह्मणः समनन्तरान् ||१०||` | "Through forgiveness, you will attain worlds equal to those of Brahma [creator deity]. ||10||" |
| `Line 4846: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4847: मया तु शममास्थाय यच्छक्यं कर्तुमद्य वै |` | "But I, having resorted to tranquility, will do what can be done today," |
| `Line 4848: तत्करिष्येऽद्य ताताहं प्रेषयिष्ये नृपाय वै ||११||` | "I will do that today, my child, I will send a message to the king. ||11||" |
| `Line 4849: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4850: मम पुत्रेण शप्तोऽसि बालेनाकृतबुद्धिना |` | "You have been cursed by my son, a child of undeveloped intellect," |
translations: | `Line 4826: पित्रा पुत्रो वयःस्थोऽपि सततं वाच्य एव तु |` | "A son, even when grown up [of mature age], should always be instructed by his father," |
| `Line 4827: यथा स्याद्गुणसंयुक्तः प्राप्नुयाच्च महद्यशः ||४||` | "So that he may be endowed with virtues and attain great fame. ||4||" |
| `Line 4828: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4829: किं पुनर्बाल एव त्वं तपसा भावितः प्रभो |` | "How much more so when you are but a child, though empowered by austerities, O lord," |
| `Line 4830: वर्धते च प्रभवतां कोपोऽतीव महात्मनाम् ||५||` | "And the anger of powerful great souls increases exceedingly. ||5||" |
| `Line 4831: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4832: सोऽहं पश्यामि वक्तव्यं त्वयि धर्मभृतां वर |` | "I see what must be said to you, O best of the upholders of dharma [righteousness]," |
| `Line 4833: पुत्रत्वं बालतां चैव तवावेक्ष्य च साहसम् ||६||` | "Considering your status as my son, your childhood, and your rashness. ||6||" |
| `Line 4834: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4835: स त्वं शमयुतो भूत्वा वन्यमाहारमाहरन् |` | "You should be filled with tranquility, subsisting on forest food," |
| `Line 4836: चर क्रोधमिमं त्यक्त्वा नैवं धर्मं प्रहास्यसि ||७||` | "Live abandoning this anger, and thus you will not forsake dharma [righteousness]. ||7||" |
| `Line 4837: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4838: क्रोधो हि धर्मं हरति यतीनां दुःखसञ्चितम् |` | "For anger steals away the dharma of ascetics [renunciates] accumulated through hardship," |

| `Line 4847: मया तु शममास्थाय यच्छक्यं कर्तुमद्य वै |` | "But I, having resorted to tranquility, will do what can be done today," |
| `Line 4848: तत्करिष्येऽद्य ताताहं प्रेषयिष्ये नृपाय वै ||११||` | "I will do that today, my child, I will send a message to the king. ||11||" |
| `Line 4849: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4850: मम पुत्रेण शप्तोऽसि बालेनाकृतबुद्धिना |` | "You have been cursed by my son, a child of undeveloped intellect," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4851: ममेमां धर्षणां त्वत्तः प्रेक्ष्य राजन्नमर्षिणा ||१२||` | "Seeing this insult to me from you, O king, I could not tolerate it. ||12||" |
| `Line 4852: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4853: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4854: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4855: एवमादिश्य शिष्यं स प्रेषयामास सुव्रतः |` | "Having thus instructed his disciple, that virtuous one [sage] of great austerity sent him," |
| `Line 4856: परिक्षिते नृपतये दयापन्नो महातपाः ||१३||` | "To King Parikshit, out of compassion, that great ascetic. ||13||" |
| `Line 4857: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4858: संदिश्य कुशलप्रश्नं कार्यवृत्तान्तमेव च |` | "Having instructed him to inquire about the king's welfare and to relate the entire matter," |
| `Line 4859: शिष्यं गौरमुखं नाम शीलवन्तं समाहितम् ||१४||` | "His disciple named Gauramukha, who was virtuous and composed. ||14||" |
| `Line 4860: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4861: सोऽभिगम्य ततः शीघ्रं नरेन्द्रं कुरुवर्धनम् |` | "He then quickly approached the king, the enhancer of the Kuru race," |
| `Line 4862: विवेश भवनं राज्ञः पूर्वं द्वाःस्थैर्निवेदितः ||१५||` | "And entered the king's palace, having been first announced by the doorkeepers. ||15||" |
| `Line 4863: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4864: पूजितश्च नरेन्द्रेण द्विजो गौरमुखस्ततः |` | "And having been honored by the king, the Brahmin Gauramukha then," |
| `Line 4865: आचख्यौ परिविश्रान्तो राज्ञे सर्वमशेषतः ||१६||` | "After resting, related everything in full to the king. ||16||" |
| `Line 4866: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4867: शमीकवचनं घोरं यथोक्तं मन्त्रिसंनिधौ ||१६||` | "The terrible words of Shamika, as spoken in the presence of ministers. ||16||" |
| `Line 4868: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4869: शमीको नाम राजेन्द्र विषये वर्तते तव |` | "O king of kings, in your domain lives one named Shamika," |
| `Line 4870: ऋषिः परमधर्मात्मा दान्तः शान्तो महातपाः ||१७||` | "A sage of supreme righteousness, self-controlled, peaceful, and of great austerity. ||17||" |
| `Line 4871: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4872: तस्य त्वया नरव्याघ्र सर्पः प्राणैर्वियोजितः |` | "O tiger among men [mighty king], you deprived a serpent of its life," |
| `Line 4873: अवसक्तो धनुष्कोट्या स्कन्धे भरतसत्तम ||१८||` | "By hanging it with the tip of your bow on his shoulder, O best of the Bharatas. ||18||" |
| `Line 4874: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4875: क्षान्तवांस्तव तत्कर्म पुत्रस्तस्य न चक्षमे ||१८||` | "Though he forgave your deed, his son did not forgive it. ||18||" |

| `Line 4852: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4853: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4854: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4857: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4858: संदिश्य कुशलप्रश्नं कार्यवृत्तान्तमेव च |` | "Having instructed him to inquire about the king's welfare and to relate the entire matter," |

| `Line 4861: सोऽभिगम्य ततः शीघ्रं नरेन्द्रं कुरुवर्धनम् |` | "He then quickly approached the king, the enhancer of the Kuru race," |
| `Line 4862: विवेश भवनं राज्ञः पूर्वं द्वाःस्थैर्निवेदितः ||१५||` | "And entered the king's palace, having been first announced by the doorkeepers. ||15||" |

| `Line 4865: आचख्यौ परिविश्रान्तो राज्ञे सर्वमशेषतः ||१६||` | "After resting, related everything in full to the king. ||16||" |

| `Line 4872: तस्य त्वया नरव्याघ्र सर्पः प्राणैर्वियोजितः |` | "O tiger among men [mighty king], you deprived a serpent of its life," |

| `Line 4875: क्षान्तवांस्तव तत्कर्म पुत्रस्तस्य न चक्षमे ||१८||` | "Though he forgave your deed, his son did not forgive it. ||18||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4876: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4877: तेन शप्तोऽसि राजेन्द्र पितुरज्ञातमद्य वै |` | "By him you have been cursed, O Rājendra [king of kings], today indeed without your father's knowledge," |
| `Line 4878: तक्षकः सप्तरात्रेण मृत्युस्ते वै भविष्यति ||१९||` | "Takṣaka [serpent king] will be your death within seven nights. ||19||" |
| `Line 4879: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4880: तत्र रक्षां कुरुष्वेति पुनः पुनरथाब्रवीत् |` | "'Take precautions against this,' he said again and again," |
| `Line 4881: तदन्यथा न शक्यं च कर्तुं केनचिदप्युत ||२०||` | "And that cannot be altered by anyone whatsoever. ||20||" |
| `Line 4882: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4883: न हि शक्नोति संयन्तुं पुत्रं कोपसमन्वितम् |` | "For he is unable to restrain his son who is filled with anger," |
| `Line 4884: ततोऽहं प्रेषितस्तेन तव राजन्हितार्थिना ||२१||` | "Therefore I have been sent by him, O king, who desires your welfare. ||21||" |
| `Line 4885: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4886: इति श्रुत्वा वचो घोरं स राजा कुरुनन्दनः |` | "Having heard these terrible words, that king, the descendant of Kuru," |
| `Line 4887: पर्यतप्यत तत्पापं कृत्वा राजा महातपाः ||२२||` | "The king of great austerity was tormented by that sin he had committed. ||22||" |
| `Line 4888: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4889: तं च मौनव्रतधरं श्रुत्वा मुनिवरं तदा |` | "And hearing then that the excellent sage had taken a vow of silence," |
| `Line 4890: भूय एवाभवद्राजा शोकसन्तप्तमानसः ||२३||` | "The king became even more afflicted with grief in his mind. ||23||" |
| `Line 4891: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4892: अनुक्रोशात्मतां तस्य शमीकस्यावधार्य तु |` | "Understanding the compassionate nature of that Śamīka [sage's name]," |
| `Line 4893: पर्यतप्यत भूयोऽपि कृत्वा तत्किल्बिषं मुनेः ||२४||` | "He was tormented even more for having committed that offense against the sage. ||24||" |
| `Line 4894: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4895: न हि मृत्युं तथा राजा श्रुत्वा वै सोऽन्वतप्यत |` | "For the king was not so much tormented after hearing about his death," |
| `Line 4896: अशोचदमरप्रख्यो यथा कृत्वेह कर्म तत् ||२५||` | "The godlike one grieved more for having committed that deed here. ||25||" |
| `Line 4897: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4898: ततस्तं प्रेषयामास राजा गौरमुखं तदा |` | "Then the king sent Gauramukha [minister's name] there," |
| `Line 4899: भूयः प्रसादं भगवान्करोत्विति ममेति वै ||२६||` | "Saying, 'May the venerable one show favor to me again.' ||26||" |
| `Line 4900: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4876: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4877: तेन शप्तोऽसि राजेन्द्र पितुरज्ञातमद्य वै |` | "By him you have been cursed, O Rājendra [king of kings], today indeed without your father's knowledge," |
| `Line 4878: तक्षकः सप्तरात्रेण मृत्युस्ते वै भविष्यति ||१९||` | "Takṣaka [serpent king] will be your death within seven nights. ||19||" |
| `Line 4879: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4880: तत्र रक्षां कुरुष्वेति पुनः पुनरथाब्रवीत् |` | "'Take precautions against this,' he said again and again," |
| `Line 4881: तदन्यथा न शक्यं च कर्तुं केनचिदप्युत ||२०||` | "And that cannot be altered by anyone whatsoever. ||20||" |
| `Line 4882: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4883: न हि शक्नोति संयन्तुं पुत्रं कोपसमन्वितम् |` | "For he is unable to restrain his son who is filled with anger," |
| `Line 4884: ततोऽहं प्रेषितस्तेन तव राजन्हितार्थिना ||२१||` | "Therefore I have been sent by him, O king, who desires your welfare. ||21||" |
| `Line 4885: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4886: इति श्रुत्वा वचो घोरं स राजा कुरुनन्दनः |` | "Having heard these terrible words, that king, the descendant of Kuru," |
| `Line 4887: पर्यतप्यत तत्पापं कृत्वा राजा महातपाः ||२२||` | "The king of great austerity was tormented by that sin he had committed. ||22||" |
| `Line 4888: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4889: तं च मौनव्रतधरं श्रुत्वा मुनिवरं तदा |` | "And hearing then that the excellent sage had taken a vow of silence," |
| `Line 4890: भूय एवाभवद्राजा शोकसन्तप्तमानसः ||२३||` | "The king became even more afflicted with grief in his mind. ||23||" |
| `Line 4891: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4892: अनुक्रोशात्मतां तस्य शमीकस्यावधार्य तु |` | "Understanding the compassionate nature of that Śamīka [sage's name]," |
| `Line 4893: पर्यतप्यत भूयोऽपि कृत्वा तत्किल्बिषं मुनेः ||२४||` | "He was tormented even more for having committed that offense against the sage. ||24||" |
| `Line 4894: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4895: न हि मृत्युं तथा राजा श्रुत्वा वै सोऽन्वतप्यत |` | "For the king was not so much tormented after hearing about his death," |
| `Line 4896: अशोचदमरप्रख्यो यथा कृत्वेह कर्म तत् ||२५||` | "The godlike one grieved more for having committed that deed here. ||25||" |
| `Line 4897: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4898: ततस्तं प्रेषयामास राजा गौरमुखं तदा |` | "Then the king sent Gauramukha [minister's name] there," |
| `Line 4899: भूयः प्रसादं भगवान्करोत्विति ममेति वै ||२६||` | "Saying, 'May the venerable one show favor to me again.' ||26||" |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4901: तस्मिंश्च गतमात्रे वै राजा गौरमुखे तदा |` | "And as soon as he had gone to Gauramukha [a place], the king then," |
| `Line 4902: मन्त्रिभिर्मन्त्रयामास सह संविग्नमानसः ||२७||` | "Consulted with his ministers together, with an anxious mind. ||27||" |
| `Line 4903: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4904: निश्चित्य मन्त्रिभिश्चैव सहितो मन्त्रतत्त्ववित् |` | "Having decided together with his ministers, he who knew the essence of counsel," |
| `Line 4905: प्रासादं कारयामास एकस्तम्भं सुरक्षितम् ||२८||` | "Had a palace built with a single pillar, well-protected. ||28||" |
| `Line 4906: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4907: रक्षां च विदधे तत्र भिषजश्चौषधानि च |` | "And he arranged protection there, physicians and medicines too," |
| `Line 4908: ब्राह्मणान्सिद्धमन्त्रांश्च सर्वतो वै न्यवेशयत् ||२९||` | "And he stationed Brahmins with powerful mantras [sacred chants] all around. ||29||" |
| `Line 4909: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4910: राजकार्याणि तत्रस्थः सर्वाण्येवाकरोच्च सः |` | "Stationed there, he performed all his royal duties," |
| `Line 4911: मन्त्रिभिः सह धर्मज्ञः समन्तात्परिरक्षितः ||३०||` | "Together with his ministers, the righteous one, protected from all sides. ||30||" |
| `Line 4912: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4913: प्राप्ते तु दिवसे तस्मिन्सप्तमे द्विजसत्तम |` | "When the seventh day arrived, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 4914: काश्यपोऽभ्यागमद्विद्वांस्तं राजानं चिकित्सितुम् ||३१||` | "The learned Kāśyapa [sage] came to heal that king. ||31||" |
| `Line 4915: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4916: श्रुतं हि तेन तदभूदद्य तं राजसत्तमम् |` | "For he had heard that today that excellent king," |
| `Line 4917: तक्षकः पन्नगश्रेष्ठो नेष्यते यमसादनम् ||३२||` | "Takṣaka [serpent king], the foremost of serpents, would take to Yama's abode [realm of death]. ||32||" |
| `Line 4918: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4919: तं दष्टं पन्नगेन्द्रेण करिष्येऽहमपज्वरम् |` | "'I will make him, bitten by the lord of serpents, free from fever," |
| `Line 4920: तत्र मेऽर्थश्च धर्मश्च भवितेति विचिन्तयन् ||३३||` | "In this, I will gain both wealth and righteousness'—thinking thus. ||33||" |
| `Line 4921: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4922: तं ददर्श स नागेन्द्रस्तक्षकः काश्यपं पथि |` | "That lord of serpents, Takṣaka, saw Kāśyapa on the way," |
| `Line 4923: गच्छन्तमेकमनसं द्विजो भूत्वा वयोतिगः ||३४||` | "Going with single-minded purpose, having taken the form of an aged Brahmin. ||34||" |
| `Line 4924: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4925: तमब्रवीत्पन्नगेन्द्रः काश्यपं मुनिपुङ्गवम् |` | "The lord of serpents spoke to Kāśyapa, the foremost of sages:" |
translations: | `Line 4901: तस्मिंश्च गतमात्रे वै राजा गौरमुखे तदा |` | "And as soon as he had gone to Gauramukha [a place], the king then," |
| `Line 4902: मन्त्रिभिर्मन्त्रयामास सह संविग्नमानसः ||२७||` | "Consulted with his ministers together, with an anxious mind. ||27||" |
| `Line 4903: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4904: निश्चित्य मन्त्रिभिश्चैव सहितो मन्त्रतत्त्ववित् |` | "Having decided together with his ministers, he who knew the essence of counsel," |
| `Line 4905: प्रासादं कारयामास एकस्तम्भं सुरक्षितम् ||२८||` | "Had a palace built with a single pillar, well-protected. ||28||" |
| `Line 4906: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4907: रक्षां च विदधे तत्र भिषजश्चौषधानि च |` | "And he arranged protection there, physicians and medicines too," |
| `Line 4908: ब्राह्मणान्सिद्धमन्त्रांश्च सर्वतो वै न्यवेशयत् ||२९||` | "And he stationed Brahmins with powerful mantras [sacred chants] all around. ||29||" |
| `Line 4909: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4910: राजकार्याणि तत्रस्थः सर्वाण्येवाकरोच्च सः |` | "Stationed there, he performed all his royal duties," |
| `Line 4911: मन्त्रिभिः सह धर्मज्ञः समन्तात्परिरक्षितः ||३०||` | "Together with his ministers, the righteous one, protected from all sides. ||30||" |
| `Line 4912: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4913: प्राप्ते तु दिवसे तस्मिन्सप्तमे द्विजसत्तम |` | "When the seventh day arrived, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 4914: काश्यपोऽभ्यागमद्विद्वांस्तं राजानं चिकित्सितुम् ||३१||` | "The learned Kāśyapa [sage] came to heal that king. ||31||" |
| `Line 4915: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4916: श्रुतं हि तेन तदभूदद्य तं राजसत्तमम् |` | "For he had heard that today that excellent king," |
| `Line 4917: तक्षकः पन्नगश्रेष्ठो नेष्यते यमसादनम् ||३२||` | "Takṣaka [serpent king], the foremost of serpents, would take to Yama's abode [realm of death]. ||32||" |
| `Line 4918: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4919: तं दष्टं पन्नगेन्द्रेण करिष्येऽहमपज्वरम् |` | "'I will make him, bitten by the lord of serpents, free from fever," |
| `Line 4920: तत्र मेऽर्थश्च धर्मश्च भवितेति विचिन्तयन् ||३३||` | "In this, I will gain both wealth and righteousness'—thinking thus. ||33||" |
| `Line 4921: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4922: तं ददर्श स नागेन्द्रस्तक्षकः काश्यपं पथि |` | "That lord of serpents, Takṣaka, saw Kāśyapa on the way," |
| `Line 4923: गच्छन्तमेकमनसं द्विजो भूत्वा वयोतिगः ||३४||` | "Going with single-minded purpose, having taken the form of an aged Brahmin. ||34||" |
| `Line 4924: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4925: तमब्रवीत्पन्नगेन्द्रः काश्यपं मुनिपुङ्गवम् |` | "The lord of serpents spoke to Kāśyapa, the foremost of sages:" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4926: क्व भवांस्त्वरितो याति किं च कार्यं चिकीर्षति ||३५||` | "Where are you going in such haste, and what task do you wish to accomplish? ||35||" |
| `Line 4927: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4928: काश्यप उवाच||` | "Kāśyapa [sage, son of Marīci] said:" |
| `Line 4929: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4930: नृपं कुरुकुलोत्पन्नं परिक्षितमरिंदमम् |` | "The king born in the Kuru lineage, Parikṣit [Pāṇḍava grandson], the destroyer of enemies," |
| `Line 4931: तक्षकः पन्नगश्रेष्ठस्तेजसाद्य प्रधक्ष्यति ||३६||` | "Takṣaka [serpent king], the foremost among serpents, will burn him today with his power. ||36||" |
| `Line 4932: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4933: तं दष्टं पन्नगेन्द्रेण तेनाग्निसमतेजसा |` | "Him, bitten by that lord of serpents whose power equals fire," |
| `Line 4934: पाण्डवानां कुलकरं राजानममितौजसम् ||३७||` | "The king of immeasurable strength, who continues the lineage of the Pāṇḍavas, ||37||" |
| `Line 4935: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4936: गच्छामि सौम्य त्वरितं सद्यः कर्तुमपज्वरम् ||३७||` | "I go quickly, O gentle one, to immediately make him free from fever. ||37||" |
| `Line 4937: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4938: तक्षक उवाच||` | "Takṣaka [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 4939: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4940: अहं स तक्षको ब्रह्मंस्तं धक्ष्यामि महीपतिम् |` | "I am that Takṣaka, O Brahmin, who will burn that king," |
| `Line 4941: निवर्तस्व न शक्तस्त्वं मया दष्टं चिकित्सितुम् ||३८||` | "Turn back, you are not able to heal one who has been bitten by me. ||38||" |
| `Line 4942: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4943: काश्यप उवाच||` | "Kāśyapa [sage] said:" |
| `Line 4944: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4945: अहं तं नृपतिं नाग त्वया दष्टमपज्वरम् |` | "I, O serpent, will make that king bitten by you free from fever," |
| `Line 4946: करिष्य इति मे बुद्धिर्विद्याबलमुपाश्रितः ||३९||` | "This is my intention, relying on the power of my knowledge. ||39||" |
| `Line 4947: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4948: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4949: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4950: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4951: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4952: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4953: ३९` | "39" |
| `Line 4954: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4955: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4956: तक्षक उवाच||` | "Takṣaka [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 4957: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4958: दष्टं यदि मयेह त्वं शक्तः किञ्चिच्चिकित्सितुम् |` | "If you are able to heal anything that has been bitten by me here," |
| `Line 4959: ततो वृक्षं मया दष्टमिमं जीवय काश्यप ||१||` | "Then revive this tree that has been bitten by me, O Kāśyapa. ||1||" |
| `Line 4960: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4961: परं मन्त्रबलं यत्ते तद्दर्शय यतस्व च |` | "Show the supreme power of your mantras and make an effort," |
| `Line 4962: न्यग्रोधमेनं धक्ष्यामि पश्यतस्ते द्विजोत्तम ||२||` | "I will burn this banyan tree before your eyes, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]. ||2||" |
| `Line 4963: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4964: काश्यप उवाच||` | "Kāśyapa [sage] said:" |
| `Line 4965: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4966: दश नागेन्द्र वृक्षं त्वं यमेनमभिमन्यसे |` | "Bite this tree, O lord of serpents, whichever one you choose," |
| `Line 4967: अहमेनं त्वया दष्टं जीवयिष्ये भुजङ्गम ||३||` | "I will revive it after it has been bitten by you, O serpent. ||3||" |
| `Line 4968: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4969: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4970: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4971: एवमुक्तः स नागेन्द्रः काश्यपेन महात्मना |` | "Thus addressed by the great-souled Kāśyapa, that lord of serpents," |
| `Line 4972: अदशद्वृक्षमभ्येत्य न्यग्रोधं पन्नगोत्तमः ||४||` | "The foremost of serpents approached and bit the banyan tree. ||4||" |
| `Line 4973: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4974: स वृक्षस्तेन दष्टः सन्सद्य एव महाद्युते |` | "That tree, having been bitten by him, O greatly radiant one," |
| `Line 4975: आशीविषविषोपेतः प्रजज्वाल समन्ततः ||५||` | "Filled with the poison of the venomous snake, burst into flames on all sides. ||5||" |
translations: | `Line 4951: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4952: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4954: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4955: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4956: तक्षक उवाच||` | "Takṣaka [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 4957: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4958: दष्टं यदि मयेह त्वं शक्तः किञ्चिच्चिकित्सितुम् |` | "If you are able to heal anything that has been bitten by me here," |
| `Line 4959: ततो वृक्षं मया दष्टमिमं जीवय काश्यप ||१||` | "Then revive this tree that has been bitten by me, O Kāśyapa. ||1||" |
| `Line 4960: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4961: परं मन्त्रबलं यत्ते तद्दर्शय यतस्व च |` | "Show the supreme power of your mantras and make an effort," |
| `Line 4962: न्यग्रोधमेनं धक्ष्यामि पश्यतस्ते द्विजोत्तम ||२||` | "I will burn this banyan tree before your eyes, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]. ||2||" |
| `Line 4963: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4964: काश्यप उवाच||` | "Kāśyapa [sage] said:" |
| `Line 4965: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4966: दश नागेन्द्र वृक्षं त्वं यमेनमभिमन्यसे |` | "Bite this tree, O lord of serpents, whichever one you choose," |
| `Line 4967: अहमेनं त्वया दष्टं जीवयिष्ये भुजङ्गम ||३||` | "I will revive it after it has been bitten by you, O serpent. ||3||" |
| `Line 4968: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4969: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 4970: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4971: एवमुक्तः स नागेन्द्रः काश्यपेन महात्मना |` | "Thus addressed by the great-souled Kāśyapa, that lord of serpents," |
| `Line 4972: अदशद्वृक्षमभ्येत्य न्यग्रोधं पन्नगोत्तमः ||४||` | "The foremost of serpents approached and bit the banyan tree. ||4||" |
| `Line 4973: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4974: स वृक्षस्तेन दष्टः सन्सद्य एव महाद्युते |` | "That tree, having been bitten by him, O greatly radiant one," |
| `Line 4975: आशीविषविषोपेतः प्रजज्वाल समन्ततः ||५||` | "Filled with the poison of the venomous snake, burst into flames on all sides. ||5||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 4976: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4977: तं दग्ध्वा स नगं नागः काश्यपं पुनरब्रवीत् |` | "Having burnt that tree, the nāga [serpent king] spoke again to Kāśyapa," |
| `Line 4978: कुरु यत्नं द्विजश्रेष्ठ जीवयैनं वनस्पतिम् ||६||` | "Make an effort, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin], revive this forest lord [tree]. ||6||" |
| `Line 4979: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4980: भस्मीभूतं ततो वृक्षं पन्नगेन्द्रस्य तेजसा |` | "Then, the tree reduced to ashes by the serpent lord's power," |
| `Line 4981: भस्म सर्वं समाहृत्य काश्यपो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ||७||` | "Gathering all the ashes, Kāśyapa spoke these words: ||7||" |
| `Line 4982: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4983: विद्याबलं पन्नगेन्द्र पश्य मेऽस्मिन्वनस्पतौ |` | "O lord of serpents, behold the power of my knowledge on this forest lord [tree]," |
| `Line 4984: अहं सञ्जीवयाम्येनं पश्यतस्ते भुजङ्गम ||८||` | "I shall revive it before your eyes, O serpent. ||8||" |
| `Line 4985: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4986: ततः स भगवान्विद्वान्काश्यपो द्विजसत्तमः |` | "Then that venerable learned Kāśyapa, best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 4987: भस्मराशीकृतं वृक्षं विद्यया समजीवयत् ||९||` | "Revived the tree reduced to a heap of ashes through his knowledge. ||9||" |
| `Line 4988: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4989: अङ्कुरं तं स कृतवांस्ततः पर्णद्वयान्वितम् |` | "He made it first a sprout, then with two leaves," |
| `Line 4990: पलाशिनं शाखिनं च तथा विटपिनं पुनः ||१०||` | "Then with foliage, branches, and finally a complete tree again. ||10||" |
| `Line 4991: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4992: तं दृष्ट्वा जीवितं वृक्षं काश्यपेन महात्मना |` | "Seeing the tree brought back to life by the great-souled Kāśyapa," |
| `Line 4993: उवाच तक्षको ब्रह्मन्नेतदत्यद्भुतं त्वयि ||११||` | "Takṣaka said, 'O Brahmin, this is not surprising in you. ||11||'" |
| `Line 4994: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4995: विप्रेन्द्र यद्विषं हन्या मम वा मद्विधस्य वा |` | "O foremost of sages, you can neutralize the poison of mine or those like me," |
| `Line 4996: कं त्वमर्थमभिप्रेप्सुर्यासि तत्र तपोधन ||१२||` | "What purpose do you seek to fulfill by going there, O wealth of austerities [ascetic]? ||12||" |
| `Line 4997: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4998: यत्तेऽभिलषितं प्राप्तुं फलं तस्मान्नृपोत्तमात् |` | "Whatever reward you desire to obtain from that best of kings," |
| `Line 4999: अहमेव प्रदास्यामि तत्ते यद्यपि दुर्लभम् ||१३||` | "I myself shall give it to you, even if it is difficult to obtain. ||13||" |
| `Line 5000: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 4976: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4977: तं दग्ध्वा स नगं नागः काश्यपं पुनरब्रवीत् |` | "Having burnt that tree, the nāga [serpent king] spoke again to Kāśyapa," |
| `Line 4978: कुरु यत्नं द्विजश्रेष्ठ जीवयैनं वनस्पतिम् ||६||` | "Make an effort, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin], revive this forest lord [tree]. ||6||" |
| `Line 4979: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 4981: भस्म सर्वं समाहृत्य काश्यपो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ||७||` | "Gathering all the ashes, Kāśyapa spoke these words: ||7||" |
| `Line 4982: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 4983: विद्याबलं पन्नगेन्द्र पश्य मेऽस्मिन्वनस्पतौ |` | "O lord of serpents, behold the power of my knowledge on this forest lord [tree]," |

| `Line 4987: भस्मराशीकृतं वृक्षं विद्यया समजीवयत् ||९||` | "Revived the tree reduced to a heap of ashes through his knowledge. ||9||" |

| `Line 4990: पलाशिनं शाखिनं च तथा विटपिनं पुनः ||१०||` | "Then with foliage, branches, and finally a complete tree again. ||10||" |

| `Line 4993: उवाच तक्षको ब्रह्मन्नेतदत्यद्भुतं त्वयि ||११||` | "Takṣaka said, 'O Brahmin, this is not surprising in you. ||11||'" |

| `Line 4995: विप्रेन्द्र यद्विषं हन्या मम वा मद्विधस्य वा |` | "O foremost of sages, you can neutralize the poison of mine or those like me," |
| `Line 4996: कं त्वमर्थमभिप्रेप्सुर्यासि तत्र तपोधन ||१२||` | "What purpose do you seek to fulfill by going there, O wealth of austerities [ascetic]? ||12||" |

| `Line 4998: यत्तेऽभिलषितं प्राप्तुं फलं तस्मान्नृपोत्तमात् |` | "Whatever reward you desire to obtain from that best of kings," |
| `Line 4999: अहमेव प्रदास्यामि तत्ते यद्यपि दुर्लभम् ||१३||` | "I myself shall give it to you, even if it is difficult to obtain. ||13||" |
