completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5001: विप्रशापाभिभूते च क्षीणायुषि नराधिपे |` | "And when the king [ruler of men] is overwhelmed by a Brahmin's curse and his life-span is diminished," |
| `Line 5002: घटमानस्य ते विप्र सिद्धिः संशयिता भवेत् ||१४||` | "Your efforts, O Brahmin, would yield doubtful success. ||14||" |
| `Line 5003: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5004: ततो यशः प्रदीप्तं ते त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम् |` | "Then your blazing fame, renowned in the three worlds [cosmic realms]," |
| `Line 5005: विरश्मिरिव घर्मांशुरन्तर्धानमितो व्रजेत् ||१५||` | "Would vanish from here like the sun [hot-rayed one] without its rays. ||15||" |
| `Line 5006: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5007: काश्यप उवाच||` | "Kāśyapa said:" |
| `Line 5008: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5009: धनार्थी याम्यहं तत्र तन्मे दित्स भुजङ्गम |` | "I am going there seeking wealth, so give it to me, O serpent [snake-being]," |
| `Line 5010: ततोऽहं विनिवर्तिष्ये गृहायोरगसत्तम ||१६||` | "Then I shall return home, O best of serpents [snake-lord]. ||16||" |
| `Line 5011: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5012: तक्षक उवाच||` | "Takṣaka said:" |
| `Line 5013: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5014: यावद्धनं प्रार्थयसे तस्माद्राज्ञस्ततोऽधिकम् |` | "Whatever wealth you desire from that king, I shall give you even more," |
| `Line 5015: अहं तेऽद्य प्रदास्यामि निवर्तस्व द्विजोत्तम ||१७||` | "I shall give it to you today, turn back, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]. ||17||" |
| `Line 5016: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5017: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5018: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5019: तक्षकस्य वचः श्रुत्वा काश्यपो द्विजसत्तमः |` | "Hearing Takṣaka's words, Kāśyapa, the best of Brahmins [twice-born]," |
| `Line 5020: प्रदध्यौ सुमहातेजा राजानं प्रति बुद्धिमान् ||१८||` | "The highly splendid and wise one pondered about the king. ||18||" |
| `Line 5021: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5022: दिव्यज्ञानः स तेजस्वी ज्ञात्वा तं नृपतिं तदा |` | "That radiant one with divine knowledge, having then understood that the king [ruler]," |
| `Line 5023: क्षीणायुषं पाण्डवेयमपावर्तत काश्यपः ||१९||` | "The Pāṇḍava descendant, was of diminished lifespan, Kāśyapa turned back. ||19||" |
| `Line 5024: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5025: लब्ध्वा वित्तं मुनिवरस्तक्षकाद्यावदीप्सितम् ||१९||` | "The excellent sage having received from Takṣaka as much wealth as he desired. ||19||" |
translations: | `Line 5001: विप्रशापाभिभूते च क्षीणायुषि नराधिपे |` | "And when the king [ruler of men] is overwhelmed by a Brahmin's curse and his life-span is diminished," |
| `Line 5002: घटमानस्य ते विप्र सिद्धिः संशयिता भवेत् ||१४||` | "Your efforts, O Brahmin, would yield doubtful success. ||14||" |
| `Line 5003: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5004: ततो यशः प्रदीप्तं ते त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम् |` | "Then your blazing fame, renowned in the three worlds [cosmic realms]," |
| `Line 5005: विरश्मिरिव घर्मांशुरन्तर्धानमितो व्रजेत् ||१५||` | "Would vanish from here like the sun [hot-rayed one] without its rays. ||15||" |
| `Line 5006: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5007: काश्यप उवाच||` | "Kāśyapa said:" |
| `Line 5008: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5009: धनार्थी याम्यहं तत्र तन्मे दित्स भुजङ्गम |` | "I am going there seeking wealth, so give it to me, O serpent [snake-being]," |
| `Line 5010: ततोऽहं विनिवर्तिष्ये गृहायोरगसत्तम ||१६||` | "Then I shall return home, O best of serpents [snake-lord]. ||16||" |
| `Line 5011: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5012: तक्षक उवाच||` | "Takṣaka said:" |
| `Line 5013: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5014: यावद्धनं प्रार्थयसे तस्माद्राज्ञस्ततोऽधिकम् |` | "Whatever wealth you desire from that king, I shall give you even more," |
| `Line 5015: अहं तेऽद्य प्रदास्यामि निवर्तस्व द्विजोत्तम ||१७||` | "I shall give it to you today, turn back, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]. ||17||" |
| `Line 5016: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5017: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5018: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5019: तक्षकस्य वचः श्रुत्वा काश्यपो द्विजसत्तमः |` | "Hearing Takṣaka's words, Kāśyapa, the best of Brahmins [twice-born]," |
| `Line 5020: प्रदध्यौ सुमहातेजा राजानं प्रति बुद्धिमान् ||१८||` | "The highly splendid and wise one pondered about the king. ||18||" |
| `Line 5021: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5022: दिव्यज्ञानः स तेजस्वी ज्ञात्वा तं नृपतिं तदा |` | "That radiant one with divine knowledge, having then understood that the king [ruler]," |
| `Line 5023: क्षीणायुषं पाण्डवेयमपावर्तत काश्यपः ||१९||` | "The Pāṇḍava descendant, was of diminished lifespan, Kāśyapa turned back. ||19||" |
| `Line 5024: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5025: लब्ध्वा वित्तं मुनिवरस्तक्षकाद्यावदीप्सितम् ||१९||` | "The excellent sage having received from Takṣaka as much wealth as he desired. ||19||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 501: द्व्यूना विंशतिराहताक्षौहिणीनां; तस्मिन्सङ्ग्रामे विग्रहे क्षत्रियाणाम् ॥१५८॥` | "Eighteen akshauhinis [army units] were destroyed in that battle, in that conflict of the kshatriyas [warrior class]. ||158||" |
| `Line 502: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 503: तमसा त्वभ्यवस्तीर्णो मोह आविशतीव माम् |` | "I am overcome by darkness, and delusion seems to enter me," |
| `Line 504: सञ्ज्ञां नोपलभे सूत मनो विह्वलतीव मे ॥१५९॥` | "I cannot maintain consciousness, O Suta [charioteer/bard], my mind seems to be bewildered. ||159||" |
| `Line 505: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 506: इत्युक्त्वा धृतराष्ट्रोऽथ विलप्य बहुदुःखितः |` | "Having spoken thus, Dhritarashtra then lamented, greatly distressed," |
| `Line 507: मूर्च्छितः पुनराश्वस्तः सञ्जयं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥१६०॥` | "Having fainted and regained consciousness, he spoke these words to Sanjaya. ||160||" |
| `Line 508: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 509: सञ्जयैवङ्गते प्राणांस्त्यक्तुमिच्छामि माचिरम् |` | "Sanjaya, in this situation, I wish to abandon my life without delay," |
| `Line 510: स्तोकं ह्यपि न पश्यामि फलं जीवितधारणे ॥१६१॥` | "For I see not even the slightest benefit in continuing to live. ||161||" |
| `Line 511: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 512: तं तथावादिनं दीनं विलपन्तं महीपतिम् |` | "To him who was speaking thus, miserable and lamenting, the ruler of the earth," |
| `Line 513: गावल्गणिरिदं धीमान्महार्थं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥१६२॥` | "Gavalgani [Sanjaya's patronymic] the wise one spoke these profound words. ||162||" |
| `Line 514: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 515: श्रुतवानसि वै राज्ञो महोत्साहान्महाबलान् |` | "You have indeed heard of kings of great enthusiasm and great strength," |
| `Line 516: द्वैपायनस्य वदतो नारदस्य च धीमतः ॥१६३॥` | "From the narrations of Dvaipayana [Vyasa] and the wise Narada. ||163||" |
| `Line 517: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 518: महत्सु राजवंशेषु गुणैः समुदितेषु च |` | "Born in great royal dynasties, endowed with excellent qualities," |
| `Line 519: जातान्दिव्यास्त्रविदुषः शक्रप्रतिमतेजसः ॥१६४॥` | "Born knowers of divine weapons, with splendor equal to Shakra [Indra]. ||164||" |
| `Line 520: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 521: धर्मेण पृथिवीं जित्वा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वाप्तदक्षिणैः |` | "Having conquered the earth righteously, having performed sacrifices with ample gifts," |
| `Line 522: अस्मिँल्लोके यशः प्राप्य ततः कालवशं गताः ॥१६५॥` | "Having attained fame in this world, they then succumbed to the power of time. ||165||" |
| `Line 523: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 524: वैन्यं महारथं वीरं सृञ्जयं जयतां वरम् |` | "Vainya [King Prithu] the great chariot-warrior, the heroic Srinjaya, foremost among conquerors," |
| `Line 525: सुहोत्रं रन्तिदेवं च कक्षीवन्तं तथौशिजम् ॥१६६॥` | "Suhotra, Rantideva, Kakshivanta, and also Aushija [Kakshivan's son]. ||166||" |
translations: | `Line 501: द्व्यूना विंशतिराहताक्षौहिणीनां; तस्मिन्सङ्ग्रामे विग्रहे क्षत्रियाणाम् ॥१५८॥` | "Eighteen akshauhinis [army units] were destroyed in that battle, in that conflict of the kshatriyas [warrior class]. ||158||" |
| `Line 502: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 503: तमसा त्वभ्यवस्तीर्णो मोह आविशतीव माम् |` | "I am overcome by darkness, and delusion seems to enter me," |
| `Line 504: सञ्ज्ञां नोपलभे सूत मनो विह्वलतीव मे ॥१५९॥` | "I cannot maintain consciousness, O Suta [charioteer/bard], my mind seems to be bewildered. ||159||" |
| `Line 505: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 506: इत्युक्त्वा धृतराष्ट्रोऽथ विलप्य बहुदुःखितः |` | "Having spoken thus, Dhritarashtra then lamented, greatly distressed," |
| `Line 507: मूर्च्छितः पुनराश्वस्तः सञ्जयं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥१६०॥` | "Having fainted and regained consciousness, he spoke these words to Sanjaya. ||160||" |
| `Line 508: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 509: सञ्जयैवङ्गते प्राणांस्त्यक्तुमिच्छामि माचिरम् |` | "Sanjaya, in this situation, I wish to abandon my life without delay," |
| `Line 510: स्तोकं ह्यपि न पश्यामि फलं जीवितधारणे ॥१६१॥` | "For I see not even the slightest benefit in continuing to live. ||161||" |
| `Line 511: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 512: तं तथावादिनं दीनं विलपन्तं महीपतिम् |` | "To him who was speaking thus, miserable and lamenting, the ruler of the earth," |
| `Line 513: गावल्गणिरिदं धीमान्महार्थं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥१६२॥` | "Gavalgani [Sanjaya's patronymic] the wise one spoke these profound words. ||162||" |
| `Line 514: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 515: श्रुतवानसि वै राज्ञो महोत्साहान्महाबलान् |` | "You have indeed heard of kings of great enthusiasm and great strength," |
| `Line 516: द्वैपायनस्य वदतो नारदस्य च धीमतः ॥१६३॥` | "From the narrations of Dvaipayana [Vyasa] and the wise Narada. ||163||" |
| `Line 517: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 518: महत्सु राजवंशेषु गुणैः समुदितेषु च |` | "Born in great royal dynasties, endowed with excellent qualities," |
| `Line 519: जातान्दिव्यास्त्रविदुषः शक्रप्रतिमतेजसः ॥१६४॥` | "Born knowers of divine weapons, with splendor equal to Shakra [Indra]. ||164||" |
| `Line 520: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 521: धर्मेण पृथिवीं जित्वा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वाप्तदक्षिणैः |` | "Having conquered the earth righteously, having performed sacrifices with ample gifts," |
| `Line 522: अस्मिँल्लोके यशः प्राप्य ततः कालवशं गताः ॥१६५॥` | "Having attained fame in this world, they then succumbed to the power of time. ||165||" |
| `Line 523: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 524: वैन्यं महारथं वीरं सृञ्जयं जयतां वरम् |` | "Vainya [King Prithu] the great chariot-warrior, the heroic Srinjaya, foremost among conquerors," |
| `Line 525: सुहोत्रं रन्तिदेवं च कक्षीवन्तं तथौशिजम् ॥१६६॥` | "Suhotra, Rantideva, Kakshivanta, and also Aushija [Kakshivan's son]. ||166||" |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5026: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5027: निवृत्ते काश्यपे तस्मिन्समयेन महात्मनि |` | "When Kāśyapa [sage], that great soul, had departed according to the agreement," |
| `Line 5028: जगाम तक्षकस्तूर्णं नगरं नागसाह्वयम् ||२०||` | "Takṣaka quickly went to the city named Nāgasāhvaya [Hastināpura]. ||20||" |
| `Line 5029: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5030: अथ शुश्राव गच्छन्स तक्षको जगतीपतिम् |` | "Then Takṣaka, while going, heard that the lord of the earth [king]" |
| `Line 5031: मन्त्रागदैर्विषहरै रक्ष्यमाणं प्रयत्नतः ||२१||` | "Was being carefully protected by mantras and antidotes that neutralize poison. ||21||" |
| `Line 5032: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5033: स चिन्तयामास तदा मायायोगेन पार्थिवः |` | "Then he thought, 'By means of illusion, the king" |
| `Line 5034: मया वञ्चयितव्योऽसौ क उपायो भवेदिति ||२२||` | "Must be deceived by me. What method would work for this?' ||22||" |
| `Line 5035: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5036: ततस्तापसरूपेण प्राहिणोत्स भुजङ्गमान् |` | "Then Takṣaka, the serpent, sent some snakes in the guise of ascetics," |
| `Line 5037: फलपत्रोदकं गृह्य राज्ञे नागोऽथ तक्षकः ||२३||` | "Carrying fruits, leaves, and water to the king. ||23||" |
| `Line 5038: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5039: तक्षक उवाच||` | "Takṣaka said:" |
| `Line 5040: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5041: गच्छध्वं यूयमव्यग्रा राजानं कार्यवत्तया |` | "Go, all of you, without anxiety, to the king with purpose," |
| `Line 5042: फलपत्रोदकं नाम प्रतिग्राहयितुं नृपम् ||२४||` | "To make the king accept these fruits, leaves, and water as offerings. ||24||" |
| `Line 5043: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5044: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5045: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5046: ते तक्षकसमादिष्टास्तथा चक्रुर्भुजङ्गमाः |` | "Those serpents, instructed by Takṣaka, did exactly that," |
| `Line 5047: उपनिन्युस्तथा राज्ञे दर्भानापः फलानि च ||२५||` | "They brought to the king sacred grass, water, and fruits. ||25||" |
| `Line 5048: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5049: तच्च सर्वं स राजेन्द्रः प्रतिजग्राह वीर्यवान् |` | "And the powerful king accepted all of that," |
| `Line 5050: कृत्वा च तेषां कार्याणि गम्यतामित्युवाच तान् ||२६||` | "And after fulfilling their purpose, he said to them, 'You may go.' ||26||" |
translations: | `Line 5026: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5027: निवृत्ते काश्यपे तस्मिन्समयेन महात्मनि |` | "When Kāśyapa [sage], that great soul, had departed according to the agreement," |
| `Line 5028: जगाम तक्षकस्तूर्णं नगरं नागसाह्वयम् ||२०||` | "Takṣaka quickly went to the city named Nāgasāhvaya [Hastināpura]. ||20||" |
| `Line 5029: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5030: अथ शुश्राव गच्छन्स तक्षको जगतीपतिम् |` | "Then Takṣaka, while going, heard that the lord of the earth [king]" |
| `Line 5031: मन्त्रागदैर्विषहरै रक्ष्यमाणं प्रयत्नतः ||२१||` | "Was being carefully protected by mantras and antidotes that neutralize poison. ||21||" |
| `Line 5032: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5033: स चिन्तयामास तदा मायायोगेन पार्थिवः |` | "Then he thought, 'By means of illusion, the king" |
| `Line 5034: मया वञ्चयितव्योऽसौ क उपायो भवेदिति ||२२||` | "Must be deceived by me. What method would work for this?' ||22||" |
| `Line 5035: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5036: ततस्तापसरूपेण प्राहिणोत्स भुजङ्गमान् |` | "Then Takṣaka, the serpent, sent some snakes in the guise of ascetics," |
| `Line 5037: फलपत्रोदकं गृह्य राज्ञे नागोऽथ तक्षकः ||२३||` | "Carrying fruits, leaves, and water to the king. ||23||" |
| `Line 5038: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 5040: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5041: गच्छध्वं यूयमव्यग्रा राजानं कार्यवत्तया |` | "Go, all of you, without anxiety, to the king with purpose," |
| `Line 5042: फलपत्रोदकं नाम प्रतिग्राहयितुं नृपम् ||२४||` | "To make the king accept these fruits, leaves, and water as offerings. ||24||" |
| `Line 5043: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5044: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5045: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5046: ते तक्षकसमादिष्टास्तथा चक्रुर्भुजङ्गमाः |` | "Those serpents, instructed by Takṣaka, did exactly that," |
| `Line 5047: उपनिन्युस्तथा राज्ञे दर्भानापः फलानि च ||२५||` | "They brought to the king sacred grass, water, and fruits. ||25||" |
| `Line 5048: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5049: तच्च सर्वं स राजेन्द्रः प्रतिजग्राह वीर्यवान् |` | "And the powerful king accepted all of that," |
| `Line 5050: कृत्वा च तेषां कार्याणि गम्यतामित्युवाच तान् ||२६||` | "And after fulfilling their purpose, he said to them, 'You may go.' ||26||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5051: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5052: गतेषु तेषु नागेषु तापसच्छद्मरूपिषु |` | "When those serpents [nāgas] disguised as ascetics had gone," |
| `Line 5053: अमात्यान्सुहृदश्चैव प्रोवाच स नराधिपः ||२७||` | "That king [ruler of men] spoke to his ministers and friends. ||27||" |
| `Line 5054: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5055: भक्षयन्तु भवन्तो वै स्वादूनीमानि सर्वशः |` | "Let your honors eat these delicious fruits completely," |
| `Line 5056: तापसैरुपनीतानि फलानि सहिता मया ||२८||` | "These fruits brought by the ascetics, together with me. ||28||" |
| `Line 5057: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5058: ततो राजा ससचिवः फलान्यादातुमैच्छत |` | "Then the king with his ministers desired to take the fruits," |
| `Line 5059: यद्गृहीतं फलं राज्ञा तत्र कृमिरभूदणुः ||२९||` | "In the fruit that was taken by the king, there was a tiny worm. ||29||" |
| `Line 5060: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5061: ह्रस्वकः कृष्णनयनस्ताम्रो वर्णेन शौनक ||२९||` | "Small, black-eyed, and copper-colored, O Śaunaka. ||29||" |
| `Line 5062: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5063: स तं गृह्य नृपश्रेष्ठः सचिवानिदमब्रवीत् |` | "Taking it, that best of kings said this to his ministers:" |
| `Line 5064: अस्तमभ्येति सविता विषादद्य न मे भयम् ||३०||` | "The sun [Savitā] is setting, but today I have no fear of poison. ||30||" |
| `Line 5065: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5066: सत्यवागस्तु स मुनिः कृमिको मां दशत्वयम् |` | "Let this little worm bite me, for that sage's words are true," |
| `Line 5067: तक्षको नाम भूत्वा वै तथा परिहृतं भवेत् ||३१||` | "Having become Takṣaka [serpent king] by name, thus it shall be fulfilled. ||31||" |
| `Line 5068: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5069: ते चैनमन्ववर्तन्त मन्त्रिणः कालचोदिताः |` | "Those ministers, impelled by fate, followed him," |
| `Line 5070: एवमुक्त्वा स राजेन्द्रो ग्रीवायां संनिवेश्य ह ||३२||` | "Having spoken thus, that king of kings placed it on his neck. ||32||" |
| `Line 5071: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5072: कृमिकं प्राहसत्तूर्णं मुमूर्षुर्नष्टचेतनः ||३२||` | "He laughed quickly at the little worm, about to die, losing consciousness. ||32||" |
| `Line 5073: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5074: हसन्नेव च भोगेन तक्षकेणाभिवेष्टितः |` | "And even as he laughed, he was enveloped by the coils of Takṣaka," |
| `Line 5075: तस्मात्फलाद्विनिष्क्रम्य यत्तद्राज्ञे निवेदितम् ||३३||` | "Who, having emerged from that fruit, was presented to the king. ||33||" |
translations: | `Line 5051: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5052: गतेषु तेषु नागेषु तापसच्छद्मरूपिषु |` | "When those serpents [nāgas] disguised as ascetics had gone," |
| `Line 5053: अमात्यान्सुहृदश्चैव प्रोवाच स नराधिपः ||२७||` | "That king [ruler of men] spoke to his ministers and friends. ||27||" |

| `Line 5064: अस्तमभ्येति सविता विषादद्य न मे भयम् ||३०||` | "The sun [Savitā] is setting, but today I have no fear of poison. ||30||" |

| `Line 5069: ते चैनमन्ववर्तन्त मन्त्रिणः कालचोदिताः |` | "Those ministers, impelled by fate, followed him," |

| `Line 5072: कृमिकं प्राहसत्तूर्णं मुमूर्षुर्नष्टचेतनः ||३२||` | "He laughed quickly at the little worm, about to die, losing consciousness. ||32||" |

| `Line 5074: हसन्नेव च भोगेन तक्षकेणाभिवेष्टितः |` | "And even as he laughed, he was enveloped by the coils of Takṣaka," |
| `Line 5075: तस्मात्फलाद्विनिष्क्रम्य यत्तद्राज्ञे निवेदितम् ||३३||` | "Who, having emerged from that fruit, was presented to the king. ||33||" |

| `Line 5076: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5077: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5078: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5079: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5080: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5081: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5082: ४०` | "40" |
| `Line 5083: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5084: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5085: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5086: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5087: तं तथा मन्त्रिणो दृष्ट्वा भोगेन परिवेष्टितम् |` | "Seeing him thus, the ministers saw him entwined by the serpent's coils," |
| `Line 5088: विवर्णवदनाः सर्वे रुरुदुर्भृशदुःखिताः ||१||` | "All with pale faces, they wept, deeply grieved. ||1||" |
| `Line 5089: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5090: तं तु नादं ततः श्रुत्वा मन्त्रिणस्ते प्रदुद्रुवुः |` | "Hearing that sound, those ministers ran forth," |
| `Line 5091: अपश्यंश्चैव ते यान्तमाकाशे नागमद्भुतम् ||२||` | "And they saw the wondrous serpent departing through the sky. ||2||" |
| `Line 5092: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5093: सीमन्तमिव कुर्वाणं नभसः पद्मवर्चसम् |` | "Creating what seemed like a parting in the sky, radiant like a lotus," |
| `Line 5094: तक्षकं पन्नगश्रेष्ठं भृशं शोकपरायणाः ||३||` | "Takṣaka [serpent king], the foremost of serpents, while they were overcome with grief. ||3||" |
| `Line 5095: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5096: ततस्तु ते तद्गृहमग्निना वृतं; प्रदीप्यमानं विषजेन भोगिनः |` | "Then that palace, engulfed in flames, burning from the serpent's poison," |
| `Line 5097: भयात्परित्यज्य दिशः प्रपेदिरे; पपात तच्चाशनिताडितं यथा ||४||` | "They abandoned in fear and fled in all directions; and it fell as if struck by lightning. ||4||" |
| `Line 5098: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5099: ततो नृपे तक्षकतेजसा हते; प्रयुज्य सर्वाः परलोकसत्क्रियाः |` | "Then, when the king was slain by Takṣaka's power, having performed all the funeral rites," |
| `Line 5100: शुचिर्द्विजो राजपुरोहितस्तदा; तथैव ते तस्य नृपस्य मन्त्रिणः ||५||` | "The pure twice-born [Brahmin] royal priest and those ministers of the king ||5||" |
translations: | `Line 5076: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5077: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5078: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5079: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5080: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5081: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5083: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5084: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5085: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5086: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5087: तं तथा मन्त्रिणो दृष्ट्वा भोगेन परिवेष्टितम् |` | "Seeing him thus, the ministers saw him entwined by the serpent's coils," |
| `Line 5088: विवर्णवदनाः सर्वे रुरुदुर्भृशदुःखिताः ||१||` | "All with pale faces, they wept, deeply grieved. ||1||" |
| `Line 5089: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5090: तं तु नादं ततः श्रुत्वा मन्त्रिणस्ते प्रदुद्रुवुः |` | "Hearing that sound, those ministers ran forth," |
| `Line 5091: अपश्यंश्चैव ते यान्तमाकाशे नागमद्भुतम् ||२||` | "And they saw the wondrous serpent departing through the sky. ||2||" |
| `Line 5092: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5093: सीमन्तमिव कुर्वाणं नभसः पद्मवर्चसम् |` | "Creating what seemed like a parting in the sky, radiant like a lotus," |
| `Line 5094: तक्षकं पन्नगश्रेष्ठं भृशं शोकपरायणाः ||३||` | "Takṣaka [serpent king], the foremost of serpents, while they were overcome with grief. ||3||" |
| `Line 5095: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5096: ततस्तु ते तद्गृहमग्निना वृतं; प्रदीप्यमानं विषजेन भोगिनः |` | "Then that palace, engulfed in flames, burning from the serpent's poison," |
| `Line 5097: भयात्परित्यज्य दिशः प्रपेदिरे; पपात तच्चाशनिताडितं यथा ||४||` | "They abandoned in fear and fled in all directions; and it fell as if struck by lightning. ||4||" |
| `Line 5098: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5099: ततो नृपे तक्षकतेजसा हते; प्रयुज्य सर्वाः परलोकसत्क्रियाः |` | "Then, when the king was slain by Takṣaka's power, having performed all the funeral rites," |
| `Line 5100: शुचिर्द्विजो राजपुरोहितस्तदा; तथैव ते तस्य नृपस्य मन्त्रिणः ||५||` | "The pure twice-born [Brahmin] royal priest and those ministers of the king ||5||" |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5101: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5102: नृपं शिशुं तस्य सुतं प्रचक्रिरे; समेत्य सर्वे पुरवासिनो जनाः |` | "All the city-dwelling people, having assembled, made his son, though a child, the king;" |
| `Line 5103: नृपं यमाहुस्तममित्रघातिनं; कुरुप्रवीरं जनमेजयं जनाः ||६||` | "The people called him Janamejaya [destroyer of enemies], the slayer of foes, the foremost hero of the Kurus. ||6||" |
| `Line 5104: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5105: स बाल एवार्यमतिर्नृपोत्तमः; सहैव तैर्मन्त्रिपुरोहितैस्तदा |` | "That excellent king, though a child, with noble intellect, along with those ministers and priests," |
| `Line 5106: शशास राज्यं कुरुपुङ्गवाग्रजो; यथास्य वीरः प्रपितामहस्तथा ||७||` | "Ruled the kingdom as the foremost of the Kuru bulls, just as his valiant great-grandfather had done. ||7||" |
| `Line 5107: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5108: ततस्तु राजानममित्रतापनं; समीक्ष्य ते तस्य नृपस्य मन्त्रिणः |` | "Then, observing the king, the scorcher of enemies, those ministers of the king," |
| `Line 5109: सुवर्णवर्माणमुपेत्य काशिपं; वपुष्टमार्थं वरयां प्रचक्रमुः ||८||` | "Approached Suvarṇavarmā [golden-armored], the king of Kāśi, and sought Vapuṣṭamā [beautiful-bodied] for marriage. ||8||" |
| `Line 5110: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5111: ततः स राजा प्रददौ वपुष्टमां; कुरुप्रवीराय परीक्ष्य धर्मतः |` | "Then that king, having examined according to dharma, gave Vapuṣṭamā to the Kuru hero," |
| `Line 5112: स चापि तां प्राप्य मुदा युतोऽभव; न्न चान्यनारीषु मनो दधे क्वचित् ||९||` | "And he too, having obtained her, was filled with joy, and never set his mind on any other woman. ||9||" |
| `Line 5113: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5114: सरःसु फुल्लेषु वनेषु चैव ह; प्रसन्नचेता विजहार वीर्यवान् |` | "In blooming lakes and forests indeed, the mighty one, with a cheerful heart, sported," |
| `Line 5115: तथा स राजन्यवरो विजह्रिवा; न्यथोर्वशीं प्राप्य पुरा पुरूरवाः ||१०||` | "Thus that excellent king enjoyed himself, just as Purūravas [ancient king] had done after obtaining Urvaśī [celestial nymph] in ancient times. ||10||" |
| `Line 5116: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5117: वपुष्टमा चापि वरं पतिं तदा; प्रतीतरूपं समवाप्य भूमिपम् |` | "And Vapuṣṭamā too, having obtained the excellent husband, the renowned king of the earth," |
| `Line 5118: भावेन रामा रमयां बभूव वै; विहारकालेष्ववरोधसुन्दरी ||११||` | "The beautiful lady of the inner chambers truly delighted him with her love during times of recreation. ||11||" |
| `Line 5119: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5120: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5121: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5122: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5123: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5124: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5125: ४१` | "41" |

| `Line 5126: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5127: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5128: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5129: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5130: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "At this very time, Jaratkarū [sage's name], of great austerity," |
| `Line 5131: चचार पृथिवीं कृत्स्नां यत्रसायङ्गृहो मुनिः ||१||` | "Wandered over the entire earth, the sage who had no home for the night. ||1||" |
| `Line 5132: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5133: चरन्दीक्षां महातेजा दुश्चरामकृतात्मभिः |` | "Practicing vows difficult to perform for those of undisciplined minds, the highly radiant one," |
| `Line 5134: तीर्थेष्वाप्लवनं कुर्वन्पुण्येषु विचचार ह ||२||` | "Bathing in sacred waters, he wandered through holy places. ||2||" |
| `Line 5135: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5136: वायुभक्षो निराहारः शुष्यन्नहरहर्मुनिः |` | "Subsisting on air, without food, the sage growing drier day by day," |
| `Line 5137: स ददर्श पितृन्गर्ते लम्बमानानधोमुखान् ||३||` | "He saw his ancestors hanging in a pit, head downward. ||3||" |
| `Line 5138: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5139: एकतन्त्ववशिष्टं वै वीरणस्तम्बमाश्रितान् |` | "Hanging by a single remaining thread, clinging to a clump of kusa grass [vīraṇa plant]," |
| `Line 5140: तं च तन्तुं शनैराखुमाददानं बिलाश्रयम् ||४||` | "And that thread was slowly being gnawed by a rat dwelling in a hole. ||4||" |
| `Line 5141: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5142: निराहारान्कृशान्दीनान्गर्तेऽऽर्तांस्त्राणमिच्छतः |` | "Famished, emaciated, miserable, distressed in the pit, seeking protection," |
| `Line 5143: उपसृत्य स तान्दीनान्दीनरूपोऽभ्यभाषत ||५||` | "Approaching those wretched ones, he, with a sorrowful appearance, spoke to them. ||5||" |
| `Line 5144: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5145: के भवन्तोऽवलम्बन्ते वीरणस्तम्बमाश्रिताः |` | "Who are you who hang clinging to this clump of kusa grass," |
| `Line 5146: दुर्बलं खादितैर्मूलैराखुना बिलवासिना ||६||` | "Weakened by its roots being eaten by the hole-dwelling rat? ||6||" |
| `Line 5147: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5148: वीरणस्तम्बके मूलं यदप्येकमिह स्थितम् |` | "Even the single root that remains here in this clump of kusa grass," |
| `Line 5149: तदप्ययं शनैराखुरादत्ते दशनैः शितैः ||७||` | "Even that this rat is slowly gnawing away with its sharp teeth. ||7||" |
| `Line 5150: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 5126: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5127: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 5130: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "At this very time, Jaratkarū [sage's name], of great austerity," |

| `Line 5142: निराहारान्कृशान्दीनान्गर्तेऽऽर्तांस्त्राणमिच्छतः |` | "Famished, emaciated, miserable, distressed in the pit, seeking protection," |
| `Line 5143: उपसृत्य स तान्दीनान्दीनरूपोऽभ्यभाषत ||५||` | "Approaching those wretched ones, he, with a sorrowful appearance, spoke to them. ||5||" |

| `Line 5145: के भवन्तोऽवलम्बन्ते वीरणस्तम्बमाश्रिताः |` | "Who are you who hang clinging to this clump of kusa grass," |
| `Line 5146: दुर्बलं खादितैर्मूलैराखुना बिलवासिना ||६||` | "Weakened by its roots being eaten by the hole-dwelling rat? ||6||" |

| `Line 5148: वीरणस्तम्बके मूलं यदप्येकमिह स्थितम् |` | "Even the single root that remains here in this clump of kusa grass," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5151: छेत्स्यतेऽल्पावशिष्टत्वादेतदप्यचिरादिव |` | "It will be cut off soon, as very little of it remains," |
| `Line 5152: ततः स्थ पतितारोऽत्र गर्ते अस्मिन्नधोमुखाः ||८||` | "Then you will fall headlong into this pit. ||8||" |
| `Line 5153: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5154: ततो मे दुःखमुत्पन्नं दृष्ट्वा युष्मानधोमुखान् |` | "Therefore, grief has arisen in me seeing you hanging head-downward," |
| `Line 5155: कृच्छ्रामापदमापन्नान्प्रियं किं करवाणि वः ||९||` | "Having fallen into dire calamity. What service may I do for you? ||9||" |
| `Line 5156: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5157: तपसोऽस्य चतुर्थेन तृतीयेनापि वा पुनः |` | "With a fourth of my ascetic merit, or even a third," |
| `Line 5158: अर्धेन वापि निस्तर्तुमापदं ब्रूत माचिरम् ||१०||` | "Or even half, to rescue you from this calamity—tell me quickly. ||10||" |
| `Line 5159: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5160: अथवापि समग्रेण तरन्तु तपसा मम |` | "Or even with all of my ascetic merit, may you be rescued," |
| `Line 5161: भवन्तः सर्व एवास्मात्काममेवं विधीयताम् ||११||` | "All of you from this—let it be done according to your wish. ||11||" |
| `Line 5162: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5163: पितर ऊचुः||` | "The Pitṛs [ancestors] said:" |
| `Line 5164: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5165: ऋद्धो भवान्ब्रह्मचारी यो नस्त्रातुमिहेच्छति |` | "Prosperous are you, O celibate one, who wishes to rescue us here," |
| `Line 5166: न तु विप्राग्र्य तपसा शक्यमेतद्व्यपोहितुम् ||१२||` | "But O foremost of Brahmins, this cannot be removed by ascetic merit. ||12||" |
| `Line 5167: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5168: अस्ति नस्तात तपसः फलं प्रवदतां वर |` | "We have, dear child, the fruit of austerities, O best of speakers," |
| `Line 5169: सन्तानप्रक्षयाद्ब्रह्मन्पतामो निरयेऽशुचौ ||१३||` | "But due to the extinction of our lineage, O Brahmin, we are falling into an impure hell. ||13||" |
| `Line 5170: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5171: लम्बतामिह नस्तात न ज्ञानं प्रतिभाति वै |` | "As we hang here, dear child, our knowledge does not shine forth," |
| `Line 5172: येन त्वां नाभिजानीमो लोके विख्यातपौरुषम् ||१४||` | "By which we do not recognize you, who is renowned for prowess in the world. ||14||" |
| `Line 5173: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5174: ऋद्धो भवान्महाभागो यो नः शोच्यान्सुदुःखितान् |` | "Prosperous are you, O fortunate one, who out of compassion," |
| `Line 5175: शोचस्युपेत्य कारुण्याच्छृणु ये वै वयं द्विज ||१५||` | "Laments for us who are pitiable and deeply distressed. Listen to who we are, O twice-born [Brahmin]. ||15||" |
translations: | `Line 5151: छेत्स्यतेऽल्पावशिष्टत्वादेतदप्यचिरादिव |` | "It will be cut off soon, as very little of it remains," |
| `Line 5152: ततः स्थ पतितारोऽत्र गर्ते अस्मिन्नधोमुखाः ||८||` | "Then you will fall headlong into this pit. ||8||" |
| `Line 5153: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5154: ततो मे दुःखमुत्पन्नं दृष्ट्वा युष्मानधोमुखान् |` | "Therefore, grief has arisen in me seeing you hanging head-downward," |
| `Line 5155: कृच्छ्रामापदमापन्नान्प्रियं किं करवाणि वः ||९||` | "Having fallen into dire calamity. What service may I do for you? ||9||" |
| `Line 5156: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5157: तपसोऽस्य चतुर्थेन तृतीयेनापि वा पुनः |` | "With a fourth of my ascetic merit, or even a third," |
| `Line 5158: अर्धेन वापि निस्तर्तुमापदं ब्रूत माचिरम् ||१०||` | "Or even half, to rescue you from this calamity—tell me quickly. ||10||" |
| `Line 5159: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5160: अथवापि समग्रेण तरन्तु तपसा मम |` | "Or even with all of my ascetic merit, may you be rescued," |
| `Line 5161: भवन्तः सर्व एवास्मात्काममेवं विधीयताम् ||११||` | "All of you from this—let it be done according to your wish. ||11||" |
| `Line 5162: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5163: पितर ऊचुः||` | "The Pitṛs [ancestors] said:" |
| `Line 5164: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5165: ऋद्धो भवान्ब्रह्मचारी यो नस्त्रातुमिहेच्छति |` | "Prosperous are you, O celibate one, who wishes to rescue us here," |
| `Line 5166: न तु विप्राग्र्य तपसा शक्यमेतद्व्यपोहितुम् ||१२||` | "But O foremost of Brahmins, this cannot be removed by ascetic merit. ||12||" |
| `Line 5167: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5168: अस्ति नस्तात तपसः फलं प्रवदतां वर |` | "We have, dear child, the fruit of austerities, O best of speakers," |
| `Line 5169: सन्तानप्रक्षयाद्ब्रह्मन्पतामो निरयेऽशुचौ ||१३||` | "But due to the extinction of our lineage, O Brahmin, we are falling into an impure hell. ||13||" |
| `Line 5170: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5171: लम्बतामिह नस्तात न ज्ञानं प्रतिभाति वै |` | "As we hang here, dear child, our knowledge does not shine forth," |
| `Line 5172: येन त्वां नाभिजानीमो लोके विख्यातपौरुषम् ||१४||` | "By which we do not recognize you, who is renowned for prowess in the world. ||14||" |
| `Line 5173: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5174: ऋद्धो भवान्महाभागो यो नः शोच्यान्सुदुःखितान् |` | "Prosperous are you, O fortunate one, who out of compassion," |
| `Line 5175: शोचस्युपेत्य कारुण्याच्छृणु ये वै वयं द्विज ||१५||` | "Laments for us who are pitiable and deeply distressed. Listen to who we are, O twice-born [Brahmin]. ||15||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5176: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5177: यायावरा नाम वयमृषयः संशितव्रताः |` | "We are the Yāyāvara [wandering] sages, of strict vows," |
| `Line 5178: लोकात्पुण्यादिह भ्रष्टाः सन्तानप्रक्षयाद्विभो ||१६||` | "Fallen here from the virtuous world due to the extinction of our lineage, O mighty one. ||16||" |
| `Line 5179: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5180: प्रनष्टं नस्तपः पुण्यं न हि नस्तन्तुरस्ति वै |` | "Our ascetic merit is lost, for we truly have no lineage continuation," |
| `Line 5181: अस्ति त्वेकोऽद्य नस्तन्तुः सोऽपि नास्ति यथा तथा ||१७||` | "There is today only one thread of our lineage, but he too is as good as non-existent. ||17||" |
| `Line 5182: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5183: मन्दभाग्योऽल्पभाग्यानां बन्धुः स किल नः कुले |` | "That unfortunate relative in our family of ill-fated ones," |
| `Line 5184: जरत्कारुरिति ख्यातो वेदवेदाङ्गपारगः ||१८||` | "Is known as Jaratkāru, a master of the Vedas and Vedāṅgas [Vedic auxiliaries]. ||18||" |
| `Line 5185: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5186: नियतात्मा महात्मा च सुव्रतः सुमहातपाः ||१८||` | "Self-controlled, noble-souled, of excellent vows, and of great austerity. ||18||" |
| `Line 5187: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5188: तेन स्म तपसो लोभात्कृच्छ्रमापादिता वयम् |` | "Due to his greed for austerities, we have been brought to this miserable state," |
| `Line 5189: न तस्य भार्या पुत्रो वा बान्धवो वास्ति कश्चन ||१९||` | "He has neither wife, nor son, nor any relative whatsoever. ||19||" |
| `Line 5190: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5191: तस्माल्लम्बामहे गर्ते नष्टसञ्ज्ञा ह्यनाथवत् |` | "Therefore we hang in this pit, unconscious like orphans," |
| `Line 5192: स वक्तव्यस्त्वया दृष्ट्वा अस्माकं नाथवत्तया ||२०||` | "He should be told by you upon seeing him, as our protector. ||20||" |
| `Line 5193: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5194: पितरस्तेऽवलम्बन्ते गर्ते दीना अधोमुखाः |` | "Your forefathers hang in a pit, wretched, with faces downward," |
| `Line 5195: साधु दारान्कुरुष्वेति प्रजायस्वेति चाभिभो ||२१||` | "'Please take a wife and beget children,' O powerful one. ||21||" |
| `Line 5196: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5197: कुलतन्तुर्हि नः शिष्टस्त्वमेवैकस्तपोधन ||२१||` | "For you alone remain as the thread of our family, O wealth of austerities. ||21||" |
| `Line 5198: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5199: यं तु पश्यसि नो ब्रह्मन्वीरणस्तम्बमाश्रितान् |` | "The reed grass clump that you see us clinging to, O Brahmin," |
| `Line 5200: एषोऽस्माकं कुलस्तम्ब आसीत्स्वकुलवर्धनः ||२२||` | "This was the pillar of our family, the propagator of our lineage. ||22||" |
translations: | `Line 5176: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5177: यायावरा नाम वयमृषयः संशितव्रताः |` | "We are the Yāyāvara [wandering] sages, of strict vows," |
| `Line 5178: लोकात्पुण्यादिह भ्रष्टाः सन्तानप्रक्षयाद्विभो ||१६||` | "Fallen here from the virtuous world due to the extinction of our lineage, O mighty one. ||16||" |
| `Line 5179: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5180: प्रनष्टं नस्तपः पुण्यं न हि नस्तन्तुरस्ति वै |` | "Our ascetic merit is lost, for we truly have no lineage continuation," |
| `Line 5181: अस्ति त्वेकोऽद्य नस्तन्तुः सोऽपि नास्ति यथा तथा ||१७||` | "There is today only one thread of our lineage, but he too is as good as non-existent. ||17||" |
| `Line 5182: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5183: मन्दभाग्योऽल्पभाग्यानां बन्धुः स किल नः कुले |` | "That unfortunate relative in our family of ill-fated ones," |
| `Line 5184: जरत्कारुरिति ख्यातो वेदवेदाङ्गपारगः ||१८||` | "Is known as Jaratkāru, a master of the Vedas and Vedāṅgas [Vedic auxiliaries]. ||18||" |
| `Line 5185: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5186: नियतात्मा महात्मा च सुव्रतः सुमहातपाः ||१८||` | "Self-controlled, noble-souled, of excellent vows, and of great austerity. ||18||" |
| `Line 5187: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5188: तेन स्म तपसो लोभात्कृच्छ्रमापादिता वयम् |` | "Due to his greed for austerities, we have been brought to this miserable state," |
| `Line 5189: न तस्य भार्या पुत्रो वा बान्धवो वास्ति कश्चन ||१९||` | "He has neither wife, nor son, nor any relative whatsoever. ||19||" |
| `Line 5190: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5191: तस्माल्लम्बामहे गर्ते नष्टसञ्ज्ञा ह्यनाथवत् |` | "Therefore we hang in this pit, unconscious like orphans," |
| `Line 5192: स वक्तव्यस्त्वया दृष्ट्वा अस्माकं नाथवत्तया ||२०||` | "He should be told by you upon seeing him, as our protector. ||20||" |
| `Line 5193: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5194: पितरस्तेऽवलम्बन्ते गर्ते दीना अधोमुखाः |` | "Your forefathers hang in a pit, wretched, with faces downward," |
| `Line 5195: साधु दारान्कुरुष्वेति प्रजायस्वेति चाभिभो ||२१||` | "'Please take a wife and beget children,' O powerful one. ||21||" |
| `Line 5196: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5197: कुलतन्तुर्हि नः शिष्टस्त्वमेवैकस्तपोधन ||२१||` | "For you alone remain as the thread of our family, O wealth of austerities. ||21||" |
| `Line 5198: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5199: यं तु पश्यसि नो ब्रह्मन्वीरणस्तम्बमाश्रितान् |` | "The reed grass clump that you see us clinging to, O Brahmin," |
| `Line 5200: एषोऽस्माकं कुलस्तम्ब आसीत्स्वकुलवर्धनः ||२२||` | "This was the pillar of our family, the propagator of our lineage. ||22||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 51: अस्मिन्यज्ञे महाभागाः सूर्यपावकवर्चसः |` | "In this sacrifice, the fortunate ones, with radiance like the sun and fire," |
| `Line 52: कृताभिषेकाः शुचयः कृतजप्या हुताग्नयः ||१३||` | "Having performed ablutions, pure, having completed prayers, having offered oblations to fire. ||13||" |
| `Line 53: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 54: भवन्त आसते स्वस्था ब्रवीमि किमहं द्विजाः ||१३||` | "You all are seated comfortably; what shall I speak, O twice-born [Brahmins]? ||13||" |
| `Line 55: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 56: पुराणसंश्रिताः पुण्याः कथा वा धर्मसंश्रिताः |` | "Stories based on the Puranas [ancient texts], virtuous tales based on dharma [righteousness]," |
| `Line 57: इतिवृत्तं नरेन्द्राणामृषीणां च महात्मनाम् ||१४||` | "Or the histories of kings and great-souled sages? ||14||" |
| `Line 58: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 59: ऋषय ऊचुः||` | "The sages said:" |
| `Line 60: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 61: द्वैपायनेन यत्प्रोक्तं पुराणं परमर्षिणा |` | "That which was narrated by Dvaipayana [Vyasa], the great sage," |
| `Line 62: सुरैर्ब्रह्मर्षिभिश्चैव श्रुत्वा यदभिपूजितम् ||१५||` | "Which, having heard, was revered by gods and brahmarshis [sage-seers]. ||15||" |
| `Line 63: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 64: तस्याख्यानवरिष्ठस्य विचित्रपदपर्वणः |` | "Of that most excellent narrative with its wonderful chapters and sections," |
| `Line 65: सूक्ष्मार्थन्याययुक्तस्य वेदार्थैर्भूषितस्य च ||१६||` | "Endowed with subtle meanings and logic, adorned with Vedic meanings. ||16||" |
| `Line 66: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 67: भारतस्येतिहासस्य पुण्यां ग्रन्थार्थसंयुताम् |` | "Of the Bharata [Mahabharata], the sacred history, complete with textual meaning," |
| `Line 68: संस्कारोपगतां ब्राह्मीं नानाशास्त्रोपबृंहिताम् ||१७||` | "Refined, divine, enriched with various scriptures. ||17||" |
| `Line 69: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 70: जनमेजयस्य यां राज्ञो वैशम्पायन उक्तवान् |` | "Which Vaishampayana narrated to King Janamejaya," |
| `Line 71: यथावत्स ऋषिस्तुष्ट्या सत्रे द्वैपायनाज्ञया ||१८||` | "That sage, properly, with joy, during the sacrifice, by the command of Dvaipayana [Vyasa]. ||18||" |
| `Line 72: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 73: वेदैश्चतुर्भिः समितां व्यासस्याद्भुतकर्मणः |` | "Harmonized with the four Vedas, of Vyasa of wonderful deeds," |
| `Line 74: संहितां श्रोतुमिच्छामो धर्म्यां पापभयापहाम् ||१९||` | "We wish to hear that compilation, righteous and removing the fear of sin. ||19||" |
| `Line 75: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 51: अस्मिन्यज्ञे महाभागाः सूर्यपावकवर्चसः |` | "In this sacrifice, the fortunate ones, with radiance like the sun and fire," |
| `Line 52: कृताभिषेकाः शुचयः कृतजप्या हुताग्नयः ||१३||` | "Having performed ablutions, pure, having completed prayers, having offered oblations to fire. ||13||" |
| `Line 53: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 54: भवन्त आसते स्वस्था ब्रवीमि किमहं द्विजाः ||१३||` | "You all are seated comfortably; what shall I speak, O twice-born [Brahmins]? ||13||" |
| `Line 55: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 56: पुराणसंश्रिताः पुण्याः कथा वा धर्मसंश्रिताः |` | "Stories based on the Puranas [ancient texts], virtuous tales based on dharma [righteousness]," |
| `Line 57: इतिवृत्तं नरेन्द्राणामृषीणां च महात्मनाम् ||१४||` | "Or the histories of kings and great-souled sages? ||14||" |
| `Line 58: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 59: ऋषय ऊचुः||` | "The sages said:" |
| `Line 60: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 61: द्वैपायनेन यत्प्रोक्तं पुराणं परमर्षिणा |` | "That which was narrated by Dvaipayana [Vyasa], the great sage," |
| `Line 62: सुरैर्ब्रह्मर्षिभिश्चैव श्रुत्वा यदभिपूजितम् ||१५||` | "Which, having heard, was revered by gods and brahmarshis [sage-seers]. ||15||" |
| `Line 63: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 64: तस्याख्यानवरिष्ठस्य विचित्रपदपर्वणः |` | "Of that most excellent narrative with its wonderful chapters and sections," |
| `Line 65: सूक्ष्मार्थन्याययुक्तस्य वेदार्थैर्भूषितस्य च ||१६||` | "Endowed with subtle meanings and logic, adorned with Vedic meanings. ||16||" |
| `Line 66: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 67: भारतस्येतिहासस्य पुण्यां ग्रन्थार्थसंयुताम् |` | "Of the Bharata [Mahabharata], the sacred history, complete with textual meaning," |
| `Line 68: संस्कारोपगतां ब्राह्मीं नानाशास्त्रोपबृंहिताम् ||१७||` | "Refined, divine, enriched with various scriptures. ||17||" |
| `Line 69: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 70: जनमेजयस्य यां राज्ञो वैशम्पायन उक्तवान् |` | "Which Vaishampayana narrated to King Janamejaya," |
| `Line 71: यथावत्स ऋषिस्तुष्ट्या सत्रे द्वैपायनाज्ञया ||१८||` | "That sage, properly, with joy, during the sacrifice, by the command of Dvaipayana [Vyasa]. ||18||" |
| `Line 72: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 73: वेदैश्चतुर्भिः समितां व्यासस्याद्भुतकर्मणः |` | "Harmonized with the four Vedas, of Vyasa of wonderful deeds," |
| `Line 74: संहितां श्रोतुमिच्छामो धर्म्यां पापभयापहाम् ||१९||` | "We wish to hear that compilation, righteous and removing the fear of sin. ||19||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5201: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5202: यानि पश्यसि वै ब्रह्मन्मूलानीहास्य वीरुधः |` | "O Brahman [learned sage], the roots of this creeper that you see here," |
| `Line 5203: एते नस्तन्तवस्तात कालेन परिभक्षिताः ||२३||` | "These are our lineage threads, dear one, being devoured by Time [personified]. ||23||" |
| `Line 5204: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5205: यत्त्वेतत्पश्यसि ब्रह्मन्मूलमस्यार्धभक्षितम् |` | "And this root that you see, O Brahman, half-eaten," |
| `Line 5206: तत्र लम्बामहे सर्वे सोऽप्येकस्तप आस्थितः ||२४||` | "On it we all hang, while that one [Jaratāru] is engaged in austerities alone. ||24||" |
| `Line 5207: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5208: यमाखुं पश्यसि ब्रह्मन्काल एष महाबलः |` | "The rat that you see, O Brahman, is mighty Time itself," |
| `Line 5209: स तं तपोरतं मन्दं शनैः क्षपयते तुदन् ||२५||` | "It slowly consumes that slow-witted one absorbed in austerities, gnawing away. ||25||" |
| `Line 5210: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5211: जरत्कारुं तपोलुब्धं मन्दात्मानमचेतसम् ||२५||` | "Jaratāru, greedy for austerities, slow-minded and thoughtless. ||25||" |
| `Line 5212: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5213: न हि नस्तत्तपस्तस्य तारयिष्यति सत्तम |` | "Indeed, his austerities will not save us, O excellent one," |
| `Line 5214: छिन्नमूलान्परिभ्रष्टान्कालोपहतचेतसः ||२६||` | "With our roots cut, fallen away, our minds destroyed by Time. ||26||" |
| `Line 5215: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5216: नरकप्रतिष्ठान्पश्यास्मान्यथा दुष्कृतिनस्तथा ||२६||` | "See us destined for hell, like evildoers. ||26||" |
| `Line 5217: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5218: अस्मासु पतितेष्वत्र सह पूर्वैः पितामहैः |` | "When we fall here along with our forefathers," |
| `Line 5219: छिन्नः कालेन सोऽप्यत्र गन्ता वै नरकं ततः ||२७||` | "Cut off by Time, he too will then go to hell. ||27||" |
| `Line 5220: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5221: तपो वाप्यथवा यज्ञो यच्चान्यत्पावनं महत् |` | "Austerities, sacrifices, or any other great purifying act," |
| `Line 5222: तत्सर्वं न समं तात सन्तत्येति सतां मतम् ||२८||` | "None of these equals progeny, dear one - this is the opinion of the virtuous. ||28||" |
| `Line 5223: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5224: स तात दृष्ट्वा ब्रूयास्त्वं जरत्कारुं तपस्विनम् |` | "Having seen this, dear one, you should tell the ascetic Jaratāru," |
| `Line 5225: यथादृष्टमिदं चास्मै त्वयाख्येयमशेषतः ||२९||` | "And you should relate to him completely everything as you have seen it. ||29||" |
translations: | `Line 5201: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5202: यानि पश्यसि वै ब्रह्मन्मूलानीहास्य वीरुधः |` | "O Brahman [learned sage], the roots of this creeper that you see here," |
| `Line 5203: एते नस्तन्तवस्तात कालेन परिभक्षिताः ||२३||` | "These are our lineage threads, dear one, being devoured by Time [personified]. ||23||" |
| `Line 5204: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5205: यत्त्वेतत्पश्यसि ब्रह्मन्मूलमस्यार्धभक्षितम् |` | "And this root that you see, O Brahman, half-eaten," |
| `Line 5206: तत्र लम्बामहे सर्वे सोऽप्येकस्तप आस्थितः ||२४||` | "On it we all hang, while that one [Jaratāru] is engaged in austerities alone. ||24||" |
| `Line 5207: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5208: यमाखुं पश्यसि ब्रह्मन्काल एष महाबलः |` | "The rat that you see, O Brahman, is mighty Time itself," |
| `Line 5209: स तं तपोरतं मन्दं शनैः क्षपयते तुदन् ||२५||` | "It slowly consumes that slow-witted one absorbed in austerities, gnawing away. ||25||" |
| `Line 5210: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5211: जरत्कारुं तपोलुब्धं मन्दात्मानमचेतसम् ||२५||` | "Jaratāru, greedy for austerities, slow-minded and thoughtless. ||25||" |
| `Line 5212: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5213: न हि नस्तत्तपस्तस्य तारयिष्यति सत्तम |` | "Indeed, his austerities will not save us, O excellent one," |
| `Line 5214: छिन्नमूलान्परिभ्रष्टान्कालोपहतचेतसः ||२६||` | "With our roots cut, fallen away, our minds destroyed by Time. ||26||" |
| `Line 5215: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5216: नरकप्रतिष्ठान्पश्यास्मान्यथा दुष्कृतिनस्तथा ||२६||` | "See us destined for hell, like evildoers. ||26||" |
| `Line 5217: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5218: अस्मासु पतितेष्वत्र सह पूर्वैः पितामहैः |` | "When we fall here along with our forefathers," |
| `Line 5219: छिन्नः कालेन सोऽप्यत्र गन्ता वै नरकं ततः ||२७||` | "Cut off by Time, he too will then go to hell. ||27||" |
| `Line 5220: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5221: तपो वाप्यथवा यज्ञो यच्चान्यत्पावनं महत् |` | "Austerities, sacrifices, or any other great purifying act," |
| `Line 5222: तत्सर्वं न समं तात सन्तत्येति सतां मतम् ||२८||` | "None of these equals progeny, dear one - this is the opinion of the virtuous. ||28||" |
| `Line 5223: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5224: स तात दृष्ट्वा ब्रूयास्त्वं जरत्कारुं तपस्विनम् |` | "Having seen this, dear one, you should tell the ascetic Jaratāru," |
| `Line 5225: यथादृष्टमिदं चास्मै त्वयाख्येयमशेषतः ||२९||` | "And you should relate to him completely everything as you have seen it. ||29||" |

| `Line 5226: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5227: यथा दारान्प्रकुर्यात्स पुत्रांश्चोत्पादयेद्यथा |` | "How he should take a wife and how he should beget sons," |
| `Line 5228: तथा ब्रह्मंस्त्वया वाच्यः सोऽस्माकं नाथवत्तया ||३०||` | "Thus, O Brahman [sage], you should instruct him, who is like a protector to us. ||30||" |
| `Line 5229: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5230: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5231: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5232: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5233: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5234: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5235: ४२` | "42" |
| `Line 5236: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5237: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5238: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5239: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5240: एतच्छ्रुत्वा जरत्कारुर्दुःखशोकपरायणः |` | "Hearing this, Jaratkāru, overwhelmed with grief and sorrow," |
| `Line 5241: उवाच स्वान्पितृन्दुःखाद्बाष्पसंदिग्धया गिरा ||१||` | "Spoke to his forefathers with a voice choked with tears due to sorrow. ||1||" |
| `Line 5242: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5243: अहमेव जरत्कारुः किल्बिषी भवतां सुतः |` | "I am indeed Jaratkāru, your sinful son," |
| `Line 5244: तद्दण्डं धारयत मे दुष्कृतेरकृतात्मनः ||२||` | "Therefore, impose punishment on me, the evil-doer with an undisciplined self. ||2||" |
| `Line 5245: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5246: पितर ऊचुः||` | "The forefathers said:" |
| `Line 5247: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5248: पुत्र दिष्ट्यासि सम्प्राप्त इमं देशं यदृच्छया |` | "Son, fortunately you have arrived at this place by chance," |
| `Line 5249: किमर्थं च त्वया ब्रह्मन्न कृतो दारसङ्ग्रहः ||३||` | "But why, O Brahman [ascetic], have you not taken a wife? ||3||" |
| `Line 5250: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 5226: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5227: यथा दारान्प्रकुर्यात्स पुत्रांश्चोत्पादयेद्यथा |` | "How he should take a wife and how he should beget sons," |
| `Line 5228: तथा ब्रह्मंस्त्वया वाच्यः सोऽस्माकं नाथवत्तया ||३०||` | "Thus, O Brahman [sage], you should instruct him, who is like a protector to us. ||30||" |
| `Line 5229: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5230: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5231: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5232: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5233: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5234: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5236: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 5238: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5239: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5240: एतच्छ्रुत्वा जरत्कारुर्दुःखशोकपरायणः |` | "Hearing this, Jaratkāru, overwhelmed with grief and sorrow," |
| `Line 5241: उवाच स्वान्पितृन्दुःखाद्बाष्पसंदिग्धया गिरा ||१||` | "Spoke to his forefathers with a voice choked with tears due to sorrow. ||1||" |
| `Line 5242: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5243: अहमेव जरत्कारुः किल्बिषी भवतां सुतः |` | "I am indeed Jaratkāru, your sinful son," |
| `Line 5244: तद्दण्डं धारयत मे दुष्कृतेरकृतात्मनः ||२||` | "Therefore, impose punishment on me, the evil-doer with an undisciplined self. ||2||" |
| `Line 5245: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5246: पितर ऊचुः||` | "The forefathers said:" |
| `Line 5247: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5248: पुत्र दिष्ट्यासि सम्प्राप्त इमं देशं यदृच्छया |` | "Son, fortunately you have arrived at this place by chance," |
| `Line 5249: किमर्थं च त्वया ब्रह्मन्न कृतो दारसङ्ग्रहः ||३||` | "But why, O Brahman [ascetic], have you not taken a wife? ||3||" |
| `Line 5250: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5251: जरत्कारुरुवाच॥` | "Jaratkāru said:" |
| `Line 5252: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5253: ममायं पितरो नित्यं हृद्यर्थः परिवर्तते |` | "O fathers, this thought constantly revolves in my heart:" |
| `Line 5254: ऊर्ध्वरेताः शरीरं वै प्रापयेयममुत्र वै ॥४॥` | "As a celibate [ūrdhvaretās], I would indeed carry my body to the other world. ||4||" |
| `Line 5255: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5256: एवं दृष्ट्वा तु भवतः शकुन्तानिव लम्बतः |` | "But having seen you hanging like birds," |
| `Line 5257: मया निवर्तिता बुद्धिर्ब्रह्मचर्यात्पितामहाः ॥५॥` | "My mind has turned away from celibacy, O grandfathers. ||5||" |
| `Line 5258: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5259: करिष्ये वः प्रियं कामं निवेक्ष्ये नात्र संशयः |` | "I will fulfill your dear wish and marry, there is no doubt about this," |
| `Line 5260: सनाम्नीं यद्यहं कन्यामुपलप्स्ये कदाचन ॥६॥` | "If I ever find a maiden who bears the same name as mine. ||6||" |
| `Line 5261: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5262: भविष्यति च या काचिद्भैक्षवत्स्वयमुद्यता |` | "And she should be one who comes forward herself like a beggar," |
| `Line 5263: प्रतिग्रहीता तामस्मि न भरेयं च यामहम् ॥७॥` | "I will accept her, but not one whom I would have to maintain. ||7||" |
| `Line 5264: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5265: एवंविधमहं कुर्यां निवेशं प्राप्नुयां यदि |` | "I would marry in this manner if I find such a bride," |
| `Line 5266: अन्यथा न करिष्ये तु सत्यमेतत्पितामहाः ॥८॥` | "Otherwise I will not do so - this is the truth, O grandfathers. ||8||" |
| `Line 5267: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5268: सूत उवाच॥` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5269: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5270: एवमुक्त्वा तु स पितृंश्चचार पृथिवीं मुनिः |` | "Having spoken thus to his ancestors, the sage wandered over the earth," |
| `Line 5271: न च स्म लभते भार्यां वृद्धोऽयमिति शौनक ॥९॥` | "But he did not find a wife, as people thought, 'He is old,' O Śaunaka. ||9||" |
| `Line 5272: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5273: यदा निर्वेदमापन्नः पितृभिश्चोदितस्तथा |` | "When he became despondent, and was thus urged by his ancestors," |
| `Line 5274: तदारण्यं स गत्वोच्चैश्चुक्रोश भृशदुःखितः ॥१०॥` | "Then, going to the forest, he cried out loudly, deeply distressed. ||10||" |
| `Line 5275: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 5251: जरत्कारुरुवाच॥` | "Jaratkāru said:" |
| `Line 5252: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5253: ममायं पितरो नित्यं हृद्यर्थः परिवर्तते |` | "O fathers, this thought constantly revolves in my heart:" |
| `Line 5254: ऊर्ध्वरेताः शरीरं वै प्रापयेयममुत्र वै ॥४॥` | "As a celibate [ūrdhvaretās], I would indeed carry my body to the other world. ||4||" |

| `Line 5257: मया निवर्तिता बुद्धिर्ब्रह्मचर्यात्पितामहाः ॥५॥` | "My mind has turned away from celibacy, O grandfathers. ||5||" |

| `Line 5273: यदा निर्वेदमापन्नः पितृभिश्चोदितस्तथा |` | "When he became despondent, and was thus urged by his ancestors," |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 526: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 527: बाह्लीकं दमनं शैब्यं शर्यातिमजितं जितम् |` | "Bāhlīka, Damana, Śaibya, Śaryāti, Ajita, Jita," |
| `Line 528: विश्वामित्रममित्रघ्नमम्बरीषं महाबलम् ||१६७||` | "Viśvāmitra the destroyer of enemies, Ambarīṣa of great strength. ||167||" |
| `Line 529: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 530: मरुत्तं मनुमिक्ष्वाकुं गयं भरतमेव च |` | "Marutta, Manu, Ikṣvāku, Gaya, and Bharata too," |
| `Line 531: रामं दाशरथिं चैव शशबिन्दुं भगीरथम् ||१६८||` | "And Rāma the son of Daśaratha, Śaśabindu, and Bhagīratha. ||168||" |
| `Line 532: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 533: ययातिं शुभकर्माणं देवैर्यो याजितः स्वयम् |` | "Yayāti of virtuous deeds, who was himself worshipped by the gods," |
| `Line 534: चैत्ययूपाङ्किता भूमिर्यस्येयं सवनाकरा ||१६९||` | "Whose land was marked with sacrificial posts [yūpa] and filled with sacred groves. ||169||" |
| `Line 535: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 536: इति राज्ञां चतुर्विंशन्नारदेन सुरर्षिणा |` | "Thus these twenty-four kings were by Nārada, the divine sage," |
| `Line 537: पुत्रशोकाभितप्ताय पुरा शैब्याय कीर्तिताः ||१७०||` | "Recounted in the past to Śaibya who was afflicted with grief for his son. ||170||" |
| `Line 538: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 539: तेभ्यश्चान्ये गताः पूर्वं राजानो बलवत्तराः |` | "And before them went other kings who were even mightier," |
| `Line 540: महारथा महात्मानो सर्वैः समुदिता गुणैः ||१७१||` | "Great chariot-warriors [maharathas], great souls, endowed with all excellent qualities. ||171||" |
| `Line 541: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 542: पूरुः कुरुर्यदुः शूरो विष्वगश्वो महाधृतिः |` | "Pūru, Kuru, Yadu, Śūra, Viṣvagaśva of great resolve," |
| `Line 543: अनेना युवनाश्वश्च ककुत्स्थो विक्रमी रघुः ||१७२||` | "Anena, Yuvanāśva, Kakutstha, and the valiant Raghu. ||172||" |
| `Line 544: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 545: विजिती वीतिहोत्रश्च भवः श्वेतो बृहद्गुरुः |` | "Vijitī, Vītihotra, Bhava, Śveta, Bṛhadguru," |
| `Line 546: उशीनरः शतरथः कङ्को दुलिदुहो द्रुमः ||१७३||` | "Uśīnara, Śataratha, Kaṅka, Duliduha, Druma. ||173||" |
| `Line 547: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 548: दम्भोद्भवः परो वेनः सगरः सङ्कृतिर्निमिः |` | "Dambhodbhava, Para, Vena, Sagara, Saṅkṛti, Nimi," |
| `Line 549: अजेयः परशुः पुण्ड्रः शम्भुर्देवावृधोऽनघः ||१७४||` | "Ajeya, Paraśu, Puṇḍra, Śambhu, Devāvṛdha the sinless one. ||174||" |
| `Line 550: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 526: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 527: बाह्लीकं दमनं शैब्यं शर्यातिमजितं जितम् |` | "Bāhlīka, Damana, Śaibya, Śaryāti, Ajita, Jita," |
| `Line 528: विश्वामित्रममित्रघ्नमम्बरीषं महाबलम् ||१६७||` | "Viśvāmitra the destroyer of enemies, Ambarīṣa of great strength. ||167||" |
| `Line 529: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 530: मरुत्तं मनुमिक्ष्वाकुं गयं भरतमेव च |` | "Marutta, Manu, Ikṣvāku, Gaya, and Bharata too," |
| `Line 531: रामं दाशरथिं चैव शशबिन्दुं भगीरथम् ||१६८||` | "And Rāma the son of Daśaratha, Śaśabindu, and Bhagīratha. ||168||" |
| `Line 532: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 533: ययातिं शुभकर्माणं देवैर्यो याजितः स्वयम् |` | "Yayāti of virtuous deeds, who was himself worshipped by the gods," |
| `Line 534: चैत्ययूपाङ्किता भूमिर्यस्येयं सवनाकरा ||१६९||` | "Whose land was marked with sacrificial posts [yūpa] and filled with sacred groves. ||169||" |
| `Line 535: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 536: इति राज्ञां चतुर्विंशन्नारदेन सुरर्षिणा |` | "Thus these twenty-four kings were by Nārada, the divine sage," |
| `Line 537: पुत्रशोकाभितप्ताय पुरा शैब्याय कीर्तिताः ||१७०||` | "Recounted in the past to Śaibya who was afflicted with grief for his son. ||170||" |
| `Line 538: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 539: तेभ्यश्चान्ये गताः पूर्वं राजानो बलवत्तराः |` | "And before them went other kings who were even mightier," |
| `Line 540: महारथा महात्मानो सर्वैः समुदिता गुणैः ||१७१||` | "Great chariot-warriors [maharathas], great souls, endowed with all excellent qualities. ||171||" |
| `Line 541: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 542: पूरुः कुरुर्यदुः शूरो विष्वगश्वो महाधृतिः |` | "Pūru, Kuru, Yadu, Śūra, Viṣvagaśva of great resolve," |
| `Line 543: अनेना युवनाश्वश्च ककुत्स्थो विक्रमी रघुः ||१७२||` | "Anena, Yuvanāśva, Kakutstha, and the valiant Raghu. ||172||" |
| `Line 544: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 545: विजिती वीतिहोत्रश्च भवः श्वेतो बृहद्गुरुः |` | "Vijitī, Vītihotra, Bhava, Śveta, Bṛhadguru," |
| `Line 546: उशीनरः शतरथः कङ्को दुलिदुहो द्रुमः ||१७३||` | "Uśīnara, Śataratha, Kaṅka, Duliduha, Druma. ||173||" |
| `Line 547: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 548: दम्भोद्भवः परो वेनः सगरः सङ्कृतिर्निमिः |` | "Dambhodbhava, Para, Vena, Sagara, Saṅkṛti, Nimi," |
| `Line 549: अजेयः परशुः पुण्ड्रः शम्भुर्देवावृधोऽनघः ||१७४||` | "Ajeya, Paraśu, Puṇḍra, Śambhu, Devāvṛdha the sinless one. ||174||" |
| `Line 550: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5276: यानि भूतानि सन्तीह स्थावराणि चराणि च |` | "Whatever beings exist here, both immovable and movable," |
| `Line 5277: अन्तर्हितानि वा यानि तानि शृण्वन्तु मे वचः ||११||` | "Or those that are invisible, let them all hear my words. ||11||" |
| `Line 5278: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5279: उग्रे तपसि वर्तन्तं पितरश्चोदयन्ति माम् |` | "Engaged in severe austerities, my ancestors [forefathers] urge me," |
| `Line 5280: निविशस्वेति दुःखार्तास्तेषां प्रियचिकीर्षया ||१२||` | "'Settle down,' they say, afflicted with sorrow; desiring to please them ||12||" |
| `Line 5281: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5282: निवेशार्थ्यखिलां भूमिं कन्याभैक्षं चरामि भोः |` | "For the purpose of settling down, I wander the entire earth begging for a maiden, oh!" |
| `Line 5283: दरिद्रो दुःखशीलश्च पितृभिः संनियोजितः ||१३||` | "Poor and accustomed to suffering, commissioned by my ancestors. ||13||" |
| `Line 5284: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5285: यस्य कन्यास्ति भूतस्य ये मयेह प्रकीर्तिताः |` | "Whichever being has a daughter among those I have addressed here," |
| `Line 5286: ते मे कन्यां प्रयच्छन्तु चरतः सर्वतोदिशम् ||१४||` | "Let them give me a maiden as I wander in all directions. ||14||" |
| `Line 5287: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5288: मम कन्या सनाम्नी या भैक्षवच्चोद्यता भवेत् |` | "A maiden who has the same name as mine and who would be offered like alms," |
| `Line 5289: भरेयं चैव यां नाहं तां मे कन्यां प्रयच्छत ||१५||` | "And whom I would not have to support—give me such a maiden. ||15||" |
| `Line 5290: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5291: ततस्ते पन्नगा ये वै जरत्कारौ समाहिताः |` | "Then those serpents [nāgas] who were attentive to Jaratkāru," |
| `Line 5292: तामादाय प्रवृत्तिं ते वासुकेः प्रत्यवेदयन् ||१६||` | "Taking that information, reported it to Vāsuki [serpent king]. ||16||" |
| `Line 5293: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5294: तेषां श्रुत्वा स नागेन्द्रः कन्यां तां समलङ्कृताम् |` | "Hearing them, that lord of serpents, taking his well-adorned daughter," |
| `Line 5295: प्रगृह्यारण्यमगमत्समीपं तस्य पन्नगः ||१७||` | "The serpent went to the forest near him. ||17||" |
| `Line 5296: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5297: तत्र तां भैक्षवत्कन्यां प्रादात्तस्मै महात्मने |` | "There, he offered that maiden like alms to that great soul," |
| `Line 5298: नागेन्द्रो वासुकिर्ब्रह्मन्न स तां प्रत्यगृह्णत ||१८||` | "Vāsuki, the lord of serpents, O Brahman [sage], but he did not accept her. ||18||" |
| `Line 5299: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5300: असनामेति वै मत्वा भरणे चाविचारिते |` | "Thinking 'she is not of the same name,' and without considering her maintenance," |
translations: | `Line 5276: यानि भूतानि सन्तीह स्थावराणि चराणि च |` | "Whatever beings exist here, both immovable and movable," |
| `Line 5277: अन्तर्हितानि वा यानि तानि शृण्वन्तु मे वचः ||११||` | "Or those that are invisible, let them all hear my words. ||11||" |
| `Line 5278: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5279: उग्रे तपसि वर्तन्तं पितरश्चोदयन्ति माम् |` | "Engaged in severe austerities, my ancestors [forefathers] urge me," |
| `Line 5280: निविशस्वेति दुःखार्तास्तेषां प्रियचिकीर्षया ||१२||` | "'Settle down,' they say, afflicted with sorrow; desiring to please them ||12||" |
| `Line 5281: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5282: निवेशार्थ्यखिलां भूमिं कन्याभैक्षं चरामि भोः |` | "For the purpose of settling down, I wander the entire earth begging for a maiden, oh!" |
| `Line 5283: दरिद्रो दुःखशीलश्च पितृभिः संनियोजितः ||१३||` | "Poor and accustomed to suffering, commissioned by my ancestors. ||13||" |
| `Line 5284: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5285: यस्य कन्यास्ति भूतस्य ये मयेह प्रकीर्तिताः |` | "Whichever being has a daughter among those I have addressed here," |
| `Line 5286: ते मे कन्यां प्रयच्छन्तु चरतः सर्वतोदिशम् ||१४||` | "Let them give me a maiden as I wander in all directions. ||14||" |
| `Line 5287: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5288: मम कन्या सनाम्नी या भैक्षवच्चोद्यता भवेत् |` | "A maiden who has the same name as mine and who would be offered like alms," |
| `Line 5289: भरेयं चैव यां नाहं तां मे कन्यां प्रयच्छत ||१५||` | "And whom I would not have to support—give me such a maiden. ||15||" |
| `Line 5290: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5291: ततस्ते पन्नगा ये वै जरत्कारौ समाहिताः |` | "Then those serpents [nāgas] who were attentive to Jaratkāru," |
| `Line 5292: तामादाय प्रवृत्तिं ते वासुकेः प्रत्यवेदयन् ||१६||` | "Taking that information, reported it to Vāsuki [serpent king]. ||16||" |
| `Line 5293: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5294: तेषां श्रुत्वा स नागेन्द्रः कन्यां तां समलङ्कृताम् |` | "Hearing them, that lord of serpents, taking his well-adorned daughter," |
| `Line 5295: प्रगृह्यारण्यमगमत्समीपं तस्य पन्नगः ||१७||` | "The serpent went to the forest near him. ||17||" |
| `Line 5296: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5297: तत्र तां भैक्षवत्कन्यां प्रादात्तस्मै महात्मने |` | "There, he offered that maiden like alms to that great soul," |
| `Line 5298: नागेन्द्रो वासुकिर्ब्रह्मन्न स तां प्रत्यगृह्णत ||१८||` | "Vāsuki, the lord of serpents, O Brahman [sage], but he did not accept her. ||18||" |
| `Line 5299: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5300: असनामेति वै मत्वा भरणे चाविचारिते |` | "Thinking 'she is not of the same name,' and without considering her maintenance," |

| `Line 5301: मोक्षभावे स्थितश्चापि द्वन्द्वीभूतः परिग्रहे ||१९||` | "Though established in the state of liberation [mokṣa], he became conflicted regarding acceptance [of a wife]. ||19||" |
| `Line 5302: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5303: ततो नाम स कन्यायाः पप्रच्छ भृगुनन्दन |` | "Then, O Bhṛgunandana [descendant of Bhṛgu], he asked the name of the maiden," |
| `Line 5304: वासुके भरणं चास्या न कुर्यामित्युवाच ह ||२०||` | "And said to Vāsuki, 'I shall not maintain her.' ||20||" |
| `Line 5305: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5306: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5307: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5308: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5309: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5310: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5311: ४३` | "43" |
| `Line 5312: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5313: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5314: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5315: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5316: वासुकिस्त्वब्रवीद्वाक्यं जरत्कारुमृषिं तदा |` | "Then Vāsuki spoke these words to the sage Jaratkarū," |
| `Line 5317: सनामा तव कन्येयं स्वसा मे तपसान्विता ||१||` | "This maiden, my sister, bearing your name, is endowed with austerity [tapas]. ||1||" |
| `Line 5318: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5319: भरिष्यामि च ते भार्यां प्रतीच्छेमां द्विजोत्तम |` | "I shall maintain your wife; accept her, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 5320: रक्षणं च करिष्येऽस्याः सर्वशक्त्या तपोधन ||२||` | "And I shall protect her with all my power, O wealthy in austerities [tapas]. ||2||" |
| `Line 5321: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5322: प्रतिश्रुते तु नागेन भरिष्ये भगिनीमिति |` | "When the serpent [nāga] promised, 'I shall maintain my sister,'" |
| `Line 5323: जरत्कारुस्तदा वेश्म भुजगस्य जगाम ह ||३||` | "Jaratkarū then went to the dwelling of the serpent. ||3||" |
| `Line 5324: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5325: तत्र मन्त्रविदां श्रेष्ठस्तपोवृद्धो महाव्रतः |` | "There, the foremost among knowers of mantras [sacred formulas], grown in austerity, of great vows," |
translations: | `Line 5301: मोक्षभावे स्थितश्चापि द्वन्द्वीभूतः परिग्रहे ||१९||` | "Though established in the state of liberation [mokṣa], he became conflicted regarding acceptance [of a wife]. ||19||" |
| `Line 5302: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5303: ततो नाम स कन्यायाः पप्रच्छ भृगुनन्दन |` | "Then, O Bhṛgunandana [descendant of Bhṛgu], he asked the name of the maiden," |
| `Line 5304: वासुके भरणं चास्या न कुर्यामित्युवाच ह ||२०||` | "And said to Vāsuki, 'I shall not maintain her.' ||20||" |
| `Line 5305: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5306: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5307: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5308: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5309: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5310: ` | [Blank line] |
