| `Line 5313: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5314: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5315: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5316: वासुकिस्त्वब्रवीद्वाक्यं जरत्कारुमृषिं तदा |` | "Then Vāsuki spoke these words to the sage Jaratkarū," |
| `Line 5317: सनामा तव कन्येयं स्वसा मे तपसान्विता ||१||` | "This maiden, my sister, bearing your name, is endowed with austerity [tapas]. ||1||" |
| `Line 5318: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5319: भरिष्यामि च ते भार्यां प्रतीच्छेमां द्विजोत्तम |` | "I shall maintain your wife; accept her, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 5320: रक्षणं च करिष्येऽस्याः सर्वशक्त्या तपोधन ||२||` | "And I shall protect her with all my power, O wealthy in austerities [tapas]. ||2||" |
| `Line 5321: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5322: प्रतिश्रुते तु नागेन भरिष्ये भगिनीमिति |` | "When the serpent [nāga] promised, 'I shall maintain my sister,'" |
| `Line 5323: जरत्कारुस्तदा वेश्म भुजगस्य जगाम ह ||३||` | "Jaratkarū then went to the dwelling of the serpent. ||3||" |
| `Line 5324: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5325: तत्र मन्त्रविदां श्रेष्ठस्तपोवृद्धो महाव्रतः |` | "There, the foremost among knowers of mantras [sacred formulas], grown in austerity, of great vows," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5326: जग्राह पाणिं धर्मात्मा विधिमन्त्रपुरस्कृतम् ||४||` | "The righteous one [Jaratakāru] took her hand with proper mantras and rituals. ||4||" |
| `Line 5327: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5328: ततो वासगृहं शुभ्रं पन्नगेन्द्रस्य संमतम् |` | "Then to a splendid dwelling place, approved by the serpent lord [Vāsuki]," |
| `Line 5329: जगाम भार्यामादाय स्तूयमानो महर्षिभिः ||५||` | "He went, taking his wife, being praised by the great sages. ||5||" |
| `Line 5330: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5331: शयनं तत्र वै कॢप्तं स्पर्ध्यास्तरणसंवृतम् |` | "A bed was arranged there, covered with enviable bedding," |
| `Line 5332: तत्र भार्यासहायः स जरत्कारुरुवास ह ||६||` | "There Jaratakāru dwelt with his wife as companion. ||6||" |
| `Line 5333: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5334: स तत्र समयं चक्रे भार्यया सह सत्तमः |` | "That excellent one made an agreement there with his wife," |
| `Line 5335: विप्रियं मे न कर्तव्यं न च वाच्यं कदाचन ||७||` | "'Nothing unpleasant should be done to me, nor should anything disagreeable ever be said. ||7||'" |
| `Line 5336: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5337: त्यजेयमप्रिये हि त्वां कृते वासं च ते गृहे |` | "'I would abandon you if anything unpleasant is done, and also my residence in your house,'" |
| `Line 5338: एतद्गृहाण वचनं मया यत्समुदीरितम् ||८||` | "'Accept these words that have been uttered by me.' ||8||" |
| `Line 5339: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5340: ततः परमसंविग्ना स्वसा नागपतेस्तु सा |` | "Then, extremely agitated, that sister of the serpent lord [Vāsuki]," |
| `Line 5341: अतिदुःखान्विता वाचं तमुवाचैवमस्त्विति ||९||` | "Filled with great distress, said to him, 'Let it be so.' ||9||" |
| `Line 5342: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5343: तथैव सा च भर्तारं दुःखशीलमुपाचरत् |` | "And she served her husband, who was of a melancholy disposition," |
| `Line 5344: उपायैः श्वेतकाकीयैः प्रियकामा यशस्विनी ||१०||` | "With rare and extraordinary [white-crow-like] methods, the illustrious one desiring to please him. ||10||" |
| `Line 5345: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5346: ऋतुकाले ततः स्नाता कदाचिद्वासुकेः स्वसा |` | "Then once, having bathed at the proper time [for conception], Vāsuki's sister," |
| `Line 5347: भर्तारं तं यथान्यायमुपतस्थे महामुनिम् ||११||` | "Approached her husband, the great sage, according to proper custom. ||11||" |
| `Line 5348: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5349: तत्र तस्याः समभवद्गर्भो ज्वलनसंनिभः |` | "There in her was conceived an embryo resembling fire," |
| `Line 5350: अतीव तपसा युक्तो वैश्वानरसमद्युतिः ||१२||` | "Endowed with extreme ascetic power, with radiance equal to Vaiśvānara [fire deity]. ||12||" |
translations: | `Line 5326: जग्राह पाणिं धर्मात्मा विधिमन्त्रपुरस्कृतम् ||४||` | "The righteous one [Jaratakāru] took her hand with proper mantras and rituals. ||4||" |
| `Line 5327: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5328: ततो वासगृहं शुभ्रं पन्नगेन्द्रस्य संमतम् |` | "Then to a splendid dwelling place, approved by the serpent lord [Vāsuki]," |
| `Line 5329: जगाम भार्यामादाय स्तूयमानो महर्षिभिः ||५||` | "He went, taking his wife, being praised by the great sages. ||5||" |
| `Line 5330: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5331: शयनं तत्र वै कॢप्तं स्पर्ध्यास्तरणसंवृतम् |` | "A bed was arranged there, covered with enviable bedding," |
| `Line 5332: तत्र भार्यासहायः स जरत्कारुरुवास ह ||६||` | "There Jaratakāru dwelt with his wife as companion. ||6||" |
| `Line 5333: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5334: स तत्र समयं चक्रे भार्यया सह सत्तमः |` | "That excellent one made an agreement there with his wife," |
| `Line 5335: विप्रियं मे न कर्तव्यं न च वाच्यं कदाचन ||७||` | "'Nothing unpleasant should be done to me, nor should anything disagreeable ever be said. ||7||'" |
| `Line 5336: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5337: त्यजेयमप्रिये हि त्वां कृते वासं च ते गृहे |` | "'I would abandon you if anything unpleasant is done, and also my residence in your house,'" |
| `Line 5338: एतद्गृहाण वचनं मया यत्समुदीरितम् ||८||` | "'Accept these words that have been uttered by me.' ||8||" |
| `Line 5339: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5340: ततः परमसंविग्ना स्वसा नागपतेस्तु सा |` | "Then, extremely agitated, that sister of the serpent lord [Vāsuki]," |
| `Line 5341: अतिदुःखान्विता वाचं तमुवाचैवमस्त्विति ||९||` | "Filled with great distress, said to him, 'Let it be so.' ||9||" |
| `Line 5342: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5343: तथैव सा च भर्तारं दुःखशीलमुपाचरत् |` | "And she served her husband, who was of a melancholy disposition," |
| `Line 5344: उपायैः श्वेतकाकीयैः प्रियकामा यशस्विनी ||१०||` | "With rare and extraordinary [white-crow-like] methods, the illustrious one desiring to please him. ||10||" |
| `Line 5345: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5346: ऋतुकाले ततः स्नाता कदाचिद्वासुकेः स्वसा |` | "Then once, having bathed at the proper time [for conception], Vāsuki's sister," |
| `Line 5347: भर्तारं तं यथान्यायमुपतस्थे महामुनिम् ||११||` | "Approached her husband, the great sage, according to proper custom. ||11||" |
| `Line 5348: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5349: तत्र तस्याः समभवद्गर्भो ज्वलनसंनिभः |` | "There in her was conceived an embryo resembling fire," |
| `Line 5350: अतीव तपसा युक्तो वैश्वानरसमद्युतिः ||१२||` | "Endowed with extreme ascetic power, with radiance equal to Vaiśvānara [fire deity]. ||12||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5351: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5352: शुक्लपक्षे यथा सोमो व्यवर्धत तथैव सः ||१२||` | "Just as the Soma [moon] waxes in the bright fortnight, so did he grow. ||12||" |
| `Line 5353: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5354: ततः कतिपयाहस्य जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "Then after a few days, Jaratkarū [sage], of great austerity," |
| `Line 5355: उत्सङ्गेऽस्याः शिरः कृत्वा सुष्वाप परिखिन्नवत् ||१३||` | "Placing his head on her lap, fell asleep as if exhausted. ||13||" |
| `Line 5356: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5357: तस्मिंश्च सुप्ते विप्रेन्द्रे सवितास्तमियाद्गिरिम् |` | "And while that foremost of Brahmins was asleep, the Savitā [sun] set behind the mountain," |
| `Line 5358: अह्नः परिक्षये ब्रह्मंस्ततः साचिन्तयत्तदा ||१४||` | "At the end of the day, O Brahman [sage], then she began to think. ||14||" |
| `Line 5359: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5360: वासुकेर्भगिनी भीता धर्मलोपान्मनस्विनी ||१४||` | "Vāsuki's sister [Jaratkāru], thoughtful and afraid of violating dharma [religious duty]. ||14||" |
| `Line 5361: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5362: किं नु मे सुकृतं भूयाद्भर्तुरुत्थापनं न वा |` | "What would be the right thing for me to do—to wake my husband or not?" |
| `Line 5363: दुःखशीलो हि धर्मात्मा कथं नास्यापराध्नुयाम् ||१५||` | "For he is righteous but easily distressed—how might I not offend him? ||15||" |
| `Line 5364: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5365: कोपो वा धर्मशीलस्य धर्मलोपोऽथ वा पुनः |` | "Either the anger of the righteous one, or the violation of dharma again," |
| `Line 5366: धर्मलोपो गरीयान्वै स्यादत्रेत्यकरोन्मनः ||१६||` | "The violation of dharma would be more serious here—thus she made up her mind. ||16||" |
| `Line 5367: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5368: उत्थापयिष्ये यद्येनं ध्रुवं कोपं करिष्यति |` | "If I wake him, he will surely become angry," |
| `Line 5369: धर्मलोपो भवेदस्य सन्ध्यातिक्रमणे ध्रुवम् ||१७||` | "But there will certainly be a violation of dharma if he misses the twilight prayers. ||17||" |
| `Line 5370: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5371: इति निश्चित्य मनसा जरत्कारुर्भुजङ्गमा |` | "Having thus decided in her mind, Jaratkāru of the serpent race," |
| `Line 5372: तमृषिं दीप्ततपसं शयानमनलोपमम् ||१८||` | "To that sage of blazing austerity, who was sleeping, resembling fire, ||18||" |
| `Line 5373: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5374: उवाचेदं वचः श्लक्ष्णं ततो मधुरभाषिणी ||१८||` | "Spoke these gentle words, she of the sweet speech. ||18||" |
| `Line 5375: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 5351: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5352: शुक्लपक्षे यथा सोमो व्यवर्धत तथैव सः ||१२||` | "Just as the Soma [moon] waxes in the bright fortnight, so did he grow. ||12||" |
| `Line 5353: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5354: ततः कतिपयाहस्य जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "Then after a few days, Jaratkarū [sage], of great austerity," |
| `Line 5355: उत्सङ्गेऽस्याः शिरः कृत्वा सुष्वाप परिखिन्नवत् ||१३||` | "Placing his head on her lap, fell asleep as if exhausted. ||13||" |
| `Line 5356: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5357: तस्मिंश्च सुप्ते विप्रेन्द्रे सवितास्तमियाद्गिरिम् |` | "And while that foremost of Brahmins was asleep, the Savitā [sun] set behind the mountain," |
| `Line 5358: अह्नः परिक्षये ब्रह्मंस्ततः साचिन्तयत्तदा ||१४||` | "At the end of the day, O Brahman [sage], then she began to think. ||14||" |
| `Line 5359: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5360: वासुकेर्भगिनी भीता धर्मलोपान्मनस्विनी ||१४||` | "Vāsuki's sister [Jaratkāru], thoughtful and afraid of violating dharma [religious duty]. ||14||" |
| `Line 5361: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5362: किं नु मे सुकृतं भूयाद्भर्तुरुत्थापनं न वा |` | "What would be the right thing for me to do—to wake my husband or not?" |
| `Line 5363: दुःखशीलो हि धर्मात्मा कथं नास्यापराध्नुयाम् ||१५||` | "For he is righteous but easily distressed—how might I not offend him? ||15||" |
| `Line 5364: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5365: कोपो वा धर्मशीलस्य धर्मलोपोऽथ वा पुनः |` | "Either the anger of the righteous one, or the violation of dharma again," |
| `Line 5366: धर्मलोपो गरीयान्वै स्यादत्रेत्यकरोन्मनः ||१६||` | "The violation of dharma would be more serious here—thus she made up her mind. ||16||" |
| `Line 5367: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5368: उत्थापयिष्ये यद्येनं ध्रुवं कोपं करिष्यति |` | "If I wake him, he will surely become angry," |
| `Line 5369: धर्मलोपो भवेदस्य सन्ध्यातिक्रमणे ध्रुवम् ||१७||` | "But there will certainly be a violation of dharma if he misses the twilight prayers. ||17||" |
| `Line 5370: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5371: इति निश्चित्य मनसा जरत्कारुर्भुजङ्गमा |` | "Having thus decided in her mind, Jaratkāru of the serpent race," |
| `Line 5372: तमृषिं दीप्ततपसं शयानमनलोपमम् ||१८||` | "To that sage of blazing austerity, who was sleeping, resembling fire, ||18||" |
| `Line 5373: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5374: उवाचेदं वचः श्लक्ष्णं ततो मधुरभाषिणी ||१८||` | "Spoke these gentle words, she of the sweet speech. ||18||" |
| `Line 5375: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5376: उत्तिष्ठ त्वं महाभाग सूर्योऽस्तमुपगच्छति |` | "Rise up, O fortunate one [great-blessed], the sun is setting," |
| `Line 5377: सन्ध्यामुपास्स्व भगवन्नपः स्पृष्ट्वा यतव्रतः ||१९||` | "Worship the twilight [sandhyā], O lord, after touching water, with controlled vows. ||19||" |
| `Line 5378: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5379: प्रादुष्कृताग्निहोत्रोऽयं मुहूर्तो रम्यदारुणः |` | "This is the time for performing Agnihotra [fire sacrifice], a beautiful reddish moment," |
| `Line 5380: सन्ध्या प्रवर्तते चेयं पश्चिमायां दिशि प्रभो ||२०||` | "And this twilight proceeds in the western direction, O master. ||20||" |
| `Line 5381: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5382: एवमुक्तः स भगवाञ्जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "Thus addressed, the venerable Jaratkāru [sage] of great austerity," |
| `Line 5383: भार्यां प्रस्फुरमाणोष्ठ इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ||२१||` | "With quivering lips, spoke these words to his wife: ||21||" |
| `Line 5384: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5385: अवमानः प्रयुक्तोऽयं त्वया मम भुजङ्गमे |` | "This insult has been inflicted by you upon me, O serpent woman," |
| `Line 5386: समीपे ते न वत्स्यामि गमिष्यामि यथागतम् ||२२||` | "I shall not dwell near you; I shall depart as I came. ||22||" |
| `Line 5387: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5388: न हि तेजोऽस्ति वामोरु मयि सुप्ते विभावसोः |` | "There is no power, O beautiful-thighed one, for the sun [fire-lord] to set while I sleep," |
| `Line 5389: अस्तं गन्तुं यथाकालमिति मे हृदि वर्तते ||२३||` | "To go to setting at its proper time - this dwells in my heart. ||23||" |
| `Line 5390: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5391: न चाप्यवमतस्येह वस्तुं रोचेत कस्यचित् |` | "And no one who is insulted would like to stay here," |
| `Line 5392: किं पुनर्धर्मशीलस्य मम वा मद्विधस्य वा ||२४||` | "How much less for one devoted to dharma [righteousness] like me or those like me? ||24||" |
| `Line 5393: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5394: एवमुक्ता जरत्कारुर्भर्त्रा हृदयकम्पनम् |` | "Thus addressed by her husband, Jaratkāru [female form], with a trembling heart," |
| `Line 5395: अब्रवीद्भगिनी तत्र वासुकेः संनिवेशने ||२५||` | "The sister of Vāsuki spoke there in Vāsuki's dwelling: ||25||" |
| `Line 5396: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5397: नावमानात्कृतवती तवाहं प्रतिबोधनम् |` | "I did not awaken you out of disrespect," |
| `Line 5398: धर्मलोपो न ते विप्र स्यादित्येतत्कृतं मया ||२६||` | "I did this so that you, O Brahmin, would not neglect dharma [religious duty]. ||26||" |
| `Line 5399: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5400: उवाच भार्यामित्युक्तो जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "Having been thus addressed, Jaratkāru of great austerity said to his wife:" |
translations: | `Line 5376: उत्तिष्ठ त्वं महाभाग सूर्योऽस्तमुपगच्छति |` | "Rise up, O fortunate one [great-blessed], the sun is setting," |
| `Line 5377: सन्ध्यामुपास्स्व भगवन्नपः स्पृष्ट्वा यतव्रतः ||१९||` | "Worship the twilight [sandhyā], O lord, after touching water, with controlled vows. ||19||" |
| `Line 5378: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5379: प्रादुष्कृताग्निहोत्रोऽयं मुहूर्तो रम्यदारुणः |` | "This is the time for performing Agnihotra [fire sacrifice], a beautiful reddish moment," |
| `Line 5380: सन्ध्या प्रवर्तते चेयं पश्चिमायां दिशि प्रभो ||२०||` | "And this twilight proceeds in the western direction, O master. ||20||" |
| `Line 5381: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5382: एवमुक्तः स भगवाञ्जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "Thus addressed, the venerable Jaratkāru [sage] of great austerity," |
| `Line 5383: भार्यां प्रस्फुरमाणोष्ठ इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ||२१||` | "With quivering lips, spoke these words to his wife: ||21||" |
| `Line 5384: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5385: अवमानः प्रयुक्तोऽयं त्वया मम भुजङ्गमे |` | "This insult has been inflicted by you upon me, O serpent woman," |
| `Line 5386: समीपे ते न वत्स्यामि गमिष्यामि यथागतम् ||२२||` | "I shall not dwell near you; I shall depart as I came. ||22||" |
| `Line 5387: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5388: न हि तेजोऽस्ति वामोरु मयि सुप्ते विभावसोः |` | "There is no power, O beautiful-thighed one, for the sun [fire-lord] to set while I sleep," |
| `Line 5389: अस्तं गन्तुं यथाकालमिति मे हृदि वर्तते ||२३||` | "To go to setting at its proper time - this dwells in my heart. ||23||" |
| `Line 5390: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5391: न चाप्यवमतस्येह वस्तुं रोचेत कस्यचित् |` | "And no one who is insulted would like to stay here," |
| `Line 5392: किं पुनर्धर्मशीलस्य मम वा मद्विधस्य वा ||२४||` | "How much less for one devoted to dharma [righteousness] like me or those like me? ||24||" |
| `Line 5393: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5394: एवमुक्ता जरत्कारुर्भर्त्रा हृदयकम्पनम् |` | "Thus addressed by her husband, Jaratkāru [female form], with a trembling heart," |
| `Line 5395: अब्रवीद्भगिनी तत्र वासुकेः संनिवेशने ||२५||` | "The sister of Vāsuki spoke there in Vāsuki's dwelling: ||25||" |
| `Line 5396: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5397: नावमानात्कृतवती तवाहं प्रतिबोधनम् |` | "I did not awaken you out of disrespect," |
| `Line 5398: धर्मलोपो न ते विप्र स्यादित्येतत्कृतं मया ||२६||` | "I did this so that you, O Brahmin, would not neglect dharma [religious duty]. ||26||" |
| `Line 5399: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5400: उवाच भार्यामित्युक्तो जरत्कारुर्महातपाः |` | "Having been thus addressed, Jaratkāru of great austerity said to his wife:" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5401: ऋषिः कोपसमाविष्टस्त्यक्तुकामो भुजङ्गमाम् ||२७||` | "The sage, filled with anger, desired to leave the serpent woman. ||27||" |
| `Line 5402: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5403: न मे वागनृतं प्राह गमिष्येऽहं भुजङ्गमे |` | "My word has never spoken falsehood. I shall depart, O serpent woman," |
| `Line 5404: समयो ह्येष मे पूर्वं त्वया सह मिथः कृतः ||२८||` | "For this was the agreement previously made between you and me. ||28||" |
| `Line 5405: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5406: सुखमस्म्युषितो भद्रे ब्रूयास्त्वं भ्रातरं शुभे |` | "I have dwelt happily here, O blessed one. Tell your brother, O auspicious lady," |
| `Line 5407: इतो मयि गते भीरु गतः स भगवानिति ||२९||` | "'When I departed from here, O timid one, that venerable one also departed.' ||29||" |
| `Line 5408: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5409: त्वं चापि मयि निष्क्रान्ते न शोकं कर्तुमर्हसि ||२९||` | "And you too, when I have gone, should not grieve. ||29||" |
| `Line 5410: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5411: इत्युक्ता सानवद्याङ्गी प्रत्युवाच पतिं तदा |` | "Thus addressed, she of faultless limbs then replied to her husband," |
| `Line 5412: जरत्कारुं जरत्कारुश्चिन्ताशोकपरायणा ||३०||` | "Jaratkāru to Jaratkāru, overwhelmed with anxiety and sorrow. ||30||" |
| `Line 5413: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5414: बाष्पगद्गदया वाचा मुखेन परिशुष्यता |` | "With a voice choked with tears and with a parched mouth," |
| `Line 5415: कृताञ्जलिर्वरारोहा पर्यश्रुनयना ततः ||३१||` | "With folded hands, the beautiful woman with eyes full of tears, ||31||" |
| `Line 5416: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5417: धैर्यमालम्ब्य वामोरूर्हृदयेन प्रवेपता ||३१||` | "Summoning courage, the fair-thighed one, with a trembling heart, ||31||" |
| `Line 5418: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5419: न मामर्हसि धर्मज्ञ परित्यक्तुमनागसम् |` | "You should not, O knower of dharma, abandon me who am innocent," |
| `Line 5420: धर्मे स्थितां स्थितो धर्मे सदा प्रियहिते रताम् ||३२||` | "Me who stands firm in dharma, as you stand in dharma, always devoted to your welfare and happiness. ||32||" |
| `Line 5421: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5422: प्रदाने कारणं यच्च मम तुभ्यं द्विजोत्तम |` | "The purpose for which I was given to you, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 5423: तदलब्धवतीं मन्दां किं मां वक्ष्यति वासुखिः ||३३||` | "Not having achieved that, what will the unhappy one [Vāsuki] say to me, unfortunate as I am? ||33||" |
| `Line 5424: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5425: मातृशापाभिभूतानां ज्ञातीनां मम सत्तम |` | "For my kinsmen who are afflicted by their mother's curse, O excellent one," |
translations: | `Line 5401: ऋषिः कोपसमाविष्टस्त्यक्तुकामो भुजङ्गमाम् ||२७||` | "The sage, filled with anger, desired to leave the serpent woman. ||27||" |
| `Line 5402: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5403: न मे वागनृतं प्राह गमिष्येऽहं भुजङ्गमे |` | "My word has never spoken falsehood. I shall depart, O serpent woman," |
| `Line 5404: समयो ह्येष मे पूर्वं त्वया सह मिथः कृतः ||२८||` | "For this was the agreement previously made between you and me. ||28||" |
| `Line 5405: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5406: सुखमस्म्युषितो भद्रे ब्रूयास्त्वं भ्रातरं शुभे |` | "I have dwelt happily here, O blessed one. Tell your brother, O auspicious lady," |
| `Line 5407: इतो मयि गते भीरु गतः स भगवानिति ||२९||` | "'When I departed from here, O timid one, that venerable one also departed.' ||29||" |
| `Line 5408: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5409: त्वं चापि मयि निष्क्रान्ते न शोकं कर्तुमर्हसि ||२९||` | "And you too, when I have gone, should not grieve. ||29||" |
| `Line 5410: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5411: इत्युक्ता सानवद्याङ्गी प्रत्युवाच पतिं तदा |` | "Thus addressed, she of faultless limbs then replied to her husband," |
| `Line 5412: जरत्कारुं जरत्कारुश्चिन्ताशोकपरायणा ||३०||` | "Jaratkāru to Jaratkāru, overwhelmed with anxiety and sorrow. ||30||" |
| `Line 5413: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5414: बाष्पगद्गदया वाचा मुखेन परिशुष्यता |` | "With a voice choked with tears and with a parched mouth," |
| `Line 5415: कृताञ्जलिर्वरारोहा पर्यश्रुनयना ततः ||३१||` | "With folded hands, the beautiful woman with eyes full of tears, ||31||" |
| `Line 5416: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5417: धैर्यमालम्ब्य वामोरूर्हृदयेन प्रवेपता ||३१||` | "Summoning courage, the fair-thighed one, with a trembling heart, ||31||" |
| `Line 5418: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5419: न मामर्हसि धर्मज्ञ परित्यक्तुमनागसम् |` | "You should not, O knower of dharma, abandon me who am innocent," |
| `Line 5420: धर्मे स्थितां स्थितो धर्मे सदा प्रियहिते रताम् ||३२||` | "Me who stands firm in dharma, as you stand in dharma, always devoted to your welfare and happiness. ||32||" |
| `Line 5421: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5422: प्रदाने कारणं यच्च मम तुभ्यं द्विजोत्तम |` | "The purpose for which I was given to you, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 5423: तदलब्धवतीं मन्दां किं मां वक्ष्यति वासुखिः ||३३||` | "Not having achieved that, what will the unhappy one [Vāsuki] say to me, unfortunate as I am? ||33||" |
| `Line 5424: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5425: मातृशापाभिभूतानां ज्ञातीनां मम सत्तम |` | "For my kinsmen who are afflicted by their mother's curse, O excellent one," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5426: अपत्यमीप्षितं त्वत्तस्तच्च तावन्न दृश्यते ||३४||` | "The desired offspring from you is not yet seen. ||34||" |
| `Line 5427: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5428: त्वत्तो ह्यपत्यलाभेन ज्ञातीनां मे शिवं भवेत् |` | "By obtaining offspring from you, there would be welfare for my relatives," |
| `Line 5429: सम्प्रयोगो भवेन्नायं मम मोघस्त्वया द्विज ||३५||` | "Let this union with you not be fruitless, O twice-born [Brahmin]. ||35||" |
| `Line 5430: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5431: ज्ञातीनां हितमिच्छन्ती भगवंस्त्वां प्रसादये |` | "Desiring the welfare of my relatives, O lord, I beseech you," |
| `Line 5432: इममव्यक्तरूपं मे गर्भमाधाय सत्तम ||३६||` | "Place in me this unmanifested form of a child, O excellent one. ||36||" |
| `Line 5433: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5434: कथं त्यक्त्वा महात्मा सन्गन्तुमिच्छस्यनागसम् ||३६||` | "How can you, being a great soul, wish to depart leaving me who is innocent? ||36||" |
| `Line 5435: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5436: एवमुक्तस्तु स मुनिर्भार्यां वचनमब्रवीत् |` | "Thus addressed, that sage spoke these words to his wife," |
| `Line 5437: यद्युक्तमनुरूपं च जरत्कारुस्तपोधनः ||३७||` | "Words that were proper and appropriate, Jaratkāru, the wealth of austerities [ascetic sage]. ||37||" |
| `Line 5438: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5439: अस्त्येष गर्भः सुभगे तव वैश्वानरोपमः |` | "This child exists in you, O fortunate one, comparable to Vaiśvānara [fire deity]," |
| `Line 5440: ऋषिः परमधर्मात्मा वेदवेदाङ्गपारगः ||३८||` | "A sage of supreme righteousness, master of the Vedas and Vedāṅgas [auxiliary texts]. ||38||" |
| `Line 5441: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5442: एवमुक्त्वा स धर्मात्मा जरत्कारुर्महानृषिः |` | "Having spoken thus, that righteous-souled Jaratkāru, the great sage," |
| `Line 5443: उग्राय तपसे भूयो जगाम कृतनिश्चयः ||३९||` | "Went again for severe austerities, having made his decision. ||39||" |
| `Line 5444: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5445: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5446: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5447: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5448: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5449: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5450: ४४` | "44" |
translations: | `Line 5426: अपत्यमीप्षितं त्वत्तस्तच्च तावन्न दृश्यते ||३४||` | "The desired offspring from you is not yet seen. ||34||" |
| `Line 5427: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5428: त्वत्तो ह्यपत्यलाभेन ज्ञातीनां मे शिवं भवेत् |` | "By obtaining offspring from you, there would be welfare for my relatives," |
| `Line 5429: सम्प्रयोगो भवेन्नायं मम मोघस्त्वया द्विज ||३५||` | "Let this union with you not be fruitless, O twice-born [Brahmin]. ||35||" |
| `Line 5430: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5431: ज्ञातीनां हितमिच्छन्ती भगवंस्त्वां प्रसादये |` | "Desiring the welfare of my relatives, O lord, I beseech you," |
| `Line 5432: इममव्यक्तरूपं मे गर्भमाधाय सत्तम ||३६||` | "Place in me this unmanifested form of a child, O excellent one. ||36||" |
| `Line 5433: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5434: कथं त्यक्त्वा महात्मा सन्गन्तुमिच्छस्यनागसम् ||३६||` | "How can you, being a great soul, wish to depart leaving me who is innocent? ||36||" |
| `Line 5435: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5436: एवमुक्तस्तु स मुनिर्भार्यां वचनमब्रवीत् |` | "Thus addressed, that sage spoke these words to his wife," |
| `Line 5437: यद्युक्तमनुरूपं च जरत्कारुस्तपोधनः ||३७||` | "Words that were proper and appropriate, Jaratkāru, the wealth of austerities [ascetic sage]. ||37||" |
| `Line 5438: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5439: अस्त्येष गर्भः सुभगे तव वैश्वानरोपमः |` | "This child exists in you, O fortunate one, comparable to Vaiśvānara [fire deity]," |
| `Line 5440: ऋषिः परमधर्मात्मा वेदवेदाङ्गपारगः ||३८||` | "A sage of supreme righteousness, master of the Vedas and Vedāṅgas [auxiliary texts]. ||38||" |
| `Line 5441: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5442: एवमुक्त्वा स धर्मात्मा जरत्कारुर्महानृषिः |` | "Having spoken thus, that righteous-souled Jaratkāru, the great sage," |
| `Line 5443: उग्राय तपसे भूयो जगाम कृतनिश्चयः ||३९||` | "Went again for severe austerities, having made his decision. ||39||" |
| `Line 5444: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5445: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5446: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 551: देवाह्वयः सुप्रतिमः सुप्रतीको बृहद्रथः |` | "Devāhvaya, Supratima, Supratīka, Brihadratha," |
| `Line 552: महोत्साहो विनीतात्मा सुक्रतुर्नैषधो नलः ||१७५||` | "Mahotsāha, Vinītātmā, Sukratu, and Nala of Nishadha [famous king]. ||175||" |
| `Line 553: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 554: सत्यव्रतः शान्तभयः सुमित्रः सुबलः प्रभुः |` | "Satyavrata, Śāntabhaya, Sumitra, Subala, Prabhu," |
| `Line 555: जानुजङ्घोऽनरण्योऽर्कः प्रियभृत्यः शुभव्रतः ||१७६||` | "Jānujaṅgha, Anaraṇya, Arka, Priyabhṛtya, Śubhavrata. ||176||" |
| `Line 556: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 557: बलबन्धुर्निरामर्दः केतुशृङ्गो बृहद्बलः |` | "Balabandhu, Nirāmarda, Ketuśṛṅga, Brihadbala," |
| `Line 558: धृष्टकेतुर्बृहत्केतुर्दीप्तकेतुर्निरामयः ||१७७||` | "Dhṛṣṭaketu, Bṛhatketu, Dīptaketu, Nirāmaya. ||177||" |
| `Line 559: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 560: अविक्षित्प्रबलो धूर्तः कृतबन्धुर्दृढेषुधिः |` | "Avikṣit, Prabala, Dhūrta, Kṛtabandhu, Dṛḍheṣudhi," |
| `Line 561: महापुराणः सम्भाव्यः प्रत्यङ्गः परहा श्रुतिः ||१७८||` | "Mahāpurāṇa, Sambhāvya, Pratyaṅga, Parahā, Śruti. ||178||" |
| `Line 562: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 563: एते चान्ये च बहवः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः |` | "These and many others, by hundreds and thousands," |
| `Line 564: श्रूयन्तेऽयुतशश्चान्ये सङ्ख्याताश्चापि पद्मशः ||१७९||` | "Are heard of in tens of thousands, and others counted by millions [padmas]. ||179||" |
| `Line 565: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 566: हित्वा सुविपुलान्भोगान्बुद्धिमन्तो महाबलाः |` | "Having abandoned vast enjoyments, these intelligent and mighty," |
| `Line 567: राजानो निधनं प्राप्तास्तव पुत्रैर्महत्तमाः ||१८०||` | "Greatest of kings have met their death at the hands of your sons. ||180||" |
| `Line 568: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 569: येषां दिव्यानि कर्माणि विक्रमस्त्याग एव च |` | "Whose divine deeds, valor, and generosity," |
| `Line 570: माहात्म्यमपि चास्तिक्यं सत्यता शौचमार्जवम् ||१८१||` | "As well as greatness, faith, truthfulness, purity, and straightforwardness, ||181||" |
| `Line 571: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 572: विद्वद्भिः कथ्यते लोके पुराणैः कविसत्तमैः |` | "Are spoken of in the world by the learned, by ancient [purāṇas] and excellent poets," |
| `Line 573: सर्वर्द्धिगुणसम्पन्नास्ते चापि निधनं गताः ||१८२||` | "They too, endowed with all prosperous qualities, have met their end. ||182||" |
| `Line 574: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 575: तव पुत्रा दुरात्मानः प्रतप्ताश्चैव मन्युना |` | "Your sons, evil-souled and consumed by anger," |
translations: | `Line 551: देवाह्वयः सुप्रतिमः सुप्रतीको बृहद्रथः |` | "Devāhvaya, Supratima, Supratīka, Brihadratha," |
| `Line 552: महोत्साहो विनीतात्मा सुक्रतुर्नैषधो नलः ||१७५||` | "Mahotsāha, Vinītātmā, Sukratu, and Nala of Nishadha [famous king]. ||175||" |
| `Line 553: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 554: सत्यव्रतः शान्तभयः सुमित्रः सुबलः प्रभुः |` | "Satyavrata, Śāntabhaya, Sumitra, Subala, Prabhu," |
| `Line 555: जानुजङ्घोऽनरण्योऽर्कः प्रियभृत्यः शुभव्रतः ||१७६||` | "Jānujaṅgha, Anaraṇya, Arka, Priyabhṛtya, Śubhavrata. ||176||" |
| `Line 556: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 557: बलबन्धुर्निरामर्दः केतुशृङ्गो बृहद्बलः |` | "Balabandhu, Nirāmarda, Ketuśṛṅga, Brihadbala," |
| `Line 558: धृष्टकेतुर्बृहत्केतुर्दीप्तकेतुर्निरामयः ||१७७||` | "Dhṛṣṭaketu, Bṛhatketu, Dīptaketu, Nirāmaya. ||177||" |
| `Line 559: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 560: अविक्षित्प्रबलो धूर्तः कृतबन्धुर्दृढेषुधिः |` | "Avikṣit, Prabala, Dhūrta, Kṛtabandhu, Dṛḍheṣudhi," |
| `Line 561: महापुराणः सम्भाव्यः प्रत्यङ्गः परहा श्रुतिः ||१७८||` | "Mahāpurāṇa, Sambhāvya, Pratyaṅga, Parahā, Śruti. ||178||" |
| `Line 562: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 563: एते चान्ये च बहवः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः |` | "These and many others, by hundreds and thousands," |
| `Line 564: श्रूयन्तेऽयुतशश्चान्ये सङ्ख्याताश्चापि पद्मशः ||१७९||` | "Are heard of in tens of thousands, and others counted by millions [padmas]. ||179||" |
| `Line 565: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 566: हित्वा सुविपुलान्भोगान्बुद्धिमन्तो महाबलाः |` | "Having abandoned vast enjoyments, these intelligent and mighty," |
| `Line 567: राजानो निधनं प्राप्तास्तव पुत्रैर्महत्तमाः ||१८०||` | "Greatest of kings have met their death at the hands of your sons. ||180||" |
| `Line 568: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 569: येषां दिव्यानि कर्माणि विक्रमस्त्याग एव च |` | "Whose divine deeds, valor, and generosity," |
| `Line 570: माहात्म्यमपि चास्तिक्यं सत्यता शौचमार्जवम् ||१८१||` | "As well as greatness, faith, truthfulness, purity, and straightforwardness, ||181||" |
| `Line 571: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 572: विद्वद्भिः कथ्यते लोके पुराणैः कविसत्तमैः |` | "Are spoken of in the world by the learned, by ancient [purāṇas] and excellent poets," |
| `Line 573: सर्वर्द्धिगुणसम्पन्नास्ते चापि निधनं गताः ||१८२||` | "They too, endowed with all prosperous qualities, have met their end. ||182||" |
| `Line 574: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 575: तव पुत्रा दुरात्मानः प्रतप्ताश्चैव मन्युना |` | "Your sons, evil-souled and consumed by anger," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 576: लुब्धा दुर्वृत्तभूयिष्ठा न ताञ्शोचितुमर्हसि ||१८३||` | "They were greedy and mostly of bad conduct; you should not grieve for them. ||183||" |
| `Line 577: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 578: श्रुतवानसि मेधावी बुद्धिमान्प्राज्ञसंमतः |` | "You are learned, intelligent, wise, and respected by the wise." |
| `Line 579: येषां शास्त्रानुगा बुद्धिर्न ते मुह्यन्ति भारत ||१८४||` | "Those whose intellect follows the scriptures [śāstras] do not become deluded, O Bhārata [Dhritarashtra]. ||184||" |
| `Line 580: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 581: निग्रहानुग्रहौ चापि विदितौ ते नराधिप |` | "Punishment and favor are both known to you, O ruler of men." |
| `Line 582: नात्यन्तमेवानुवृत्तिः श्रूयते पुत्ररक्षणे ||१८५||` | "Excessive attachment is not prescribed in the protection of sons. ||185||" |
| `Line 583: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 584: भवितव्यं तथा तच्च नातः शोचितुमर्हसि |` | "What is destined to happen will happen thus; therefore you should not grieve." |
| `Line 585: दैवं प्रज्ञाविशेषेण को निवर्तितुमर्हति ||१८६||` | "Who can avert fate [divine will] even with exceptional wisdom? ||186||" |
| `Line 586: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 587: विधातृविहितं मार्गं न कश्चिदतिवर्तते |` | "No one can transgress the path ordained by the Creator [Vidhātṛ]." |
| `Line 588: कालमूलमिदं सर्वं भावाभावौ सुखासुखे ||१८७||` | "All this—existence and non-existence, happiness and sorrow—is rooted in Time [Kāla]. ||187||" |
| `Line 589: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 590: कालः पचति भूतानि कालः संहरति प्रजाः |` | "Time ripens all beings; Time destroys all creatures." |
| `Line 591: निर्दहन्तं प्रजाः कालं कालः शमयते पुनः ||१८८||` | "Time, which consumes all creatures, is itself pacified by Time again. ||188||" |
| `Line 592: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 593: कालो विकुरुते भावान्सर्वाँल्लोके शुभाशुभान् |` | "Time transforms all states in the world, both auspicious and inauspicious." |
| `Line 594: कालः सङ्क्षिपते सर्वाः प्रजा विसृजते पुनः ||१८९||` | "Time contracts all beings and creates them again. ||189||" |
| `Line 595: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 596: कालः सर्वेषु भूतेषु चरत्यविधृतः समः ||१८९||` | "Time moves among all beings, unrestrained and impartial. ||189||" |
| `Line 597: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 598: अतीतानागता भावा ये च वर्तन्ति साम्प्रतम् |` | "All conditions—past, future, and those existing at present—" |
| `Line 599: तान्कालनिर्मितान्बुद्ध्वा न सञ्ज्ञां हातुमर्हसि ||१९०||` | "Understanding them to be created by Time, you should not lose your composure. ||190||" |
| `Line 600: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 576: लुब्धा दुर्वृत्तभूयिष्ठा न ताञ्शोचितुमर्हसि ||१८३||` | "They were greedy and mostly of bad conduct; you should not grieve for them. ||183||" |
| `Line 577: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 578: श्रुतवानसि मेधावी बुद्धिमान्प्राज्ञसंमतः |` | "You are learned, intelligent, wise, and respected by the wise." |
| `Line 579: येषां शास्त्रानुगा बुद्धिर्न ते मुह्यन्ति भारत ||१८४||` | "Those whose intellect follows the scriptures [śāstras] do not become deluded, O Bhārata [Dhritarashtra]. ||184||" |
| `Line 580: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 581: निग्रहानुग्रहौ चापि विदितौ ते नराधिप |` | "Punishment and favor are both known to you, O ruler of men." |
| `Line 582: नात्यन्तमेवानुवृत्तिः श्रूयते पुत्ररक्षणे ||१८५||` | "Excessive attachment is not prescribed in the protection of sons. ||185||" |
| `Line 583: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 584: भवितव्यं तथा तच्च नातः शोचितुमर्हसि |` | "What is destined to happen will happen thus; therefore you should not grieve." |
| `Line 585: दैवं प्रज्ञाविशेषेण को निवर्तितुमर्हति ||१८६||` | "Who can avert fate [divine will] even with exceptional wisdom? ||186||" |
| `Line 586: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 587: विधातृविहितं मार्गं न कश्चिदतिवर्तते |` | "No one can transgress the path ordained by the Creator [Vidhātṛ]." |
| `Line 588: कालमूलमिदं सर्वं भावाभावौ सुखासुखे ||१८७||` | "All this—existence and non-existence, happiness and sorrow—is rooted in Time [Kāla]. ||187||" |
| `Line 589: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 590: कालः पचति भूतानि कालः संहरति प्रजाः |` | "Time ripens all beings; Time destroys all creatures." |
| `Line 591: निर्दहन्तं प्रजाः कालं कालः शमयते पुनः ||१८८||` | "Time, which consumes all creatures, is itself pacified by Time again. ||188||" |
| `Line 592: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 593: कालो विकुरुते भावान्सर्वाँल्लोके शुभाशुभान् |` | "Time transforms all states in the world, both auspicious and inauspicious." |
| `Line 594: कालः सङ्क्षिपते सर्वाः प्रजा विसृजते पुनः ||१८९||` | "Time contracts all beings and creates them again. ||189||" |
| `Line 595: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 596: कालः सर्वेषु भूतेषु चरत्यविधृतः समः ||१८९||` | "Time moves among all beings, unrestrained and impartial. ||189||" |
| `Line 597: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 598: अतीतानागता भावा ये च वर्तन्ति साम्प्रतम् |` | "All conditions—past, future, and those existing at present—" |
| `Line 599: तान्कालनिर्मितान्बुद्ध्वा न सञ्ज्ञां हातुमर्हसि ||१९०||` | "Understanding them to be created by Time, you should not lose your composure. ||190||" |
| `Line 600: ` | [Blank line] |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 601: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 602: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 603: अत्रोपनिषदं पुण्यां कृष्णद्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् |` | "Here, Krishna Dvaipāyana [Vyāsa] spoke this sacred Upanishad [esoteric teaching]," |
| `Line 604: भारताध्ययनात्पुण्यादपि पादमधीयतः ||१९१||` | "Even for one who studies just a quarter of the holy Bhārata [Mahābhārata]. ||191||" |
| `Line 605: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 606: श्रद्दधानस्य पूयन्ते सर्वपापान्यशेषतः ||१९१||` | "For the one who has faith, all sins are purified completely. ||191||" |
| `Line 607: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 608: देवर्षयो ह्यत्र पुण्या ब्रह्मराजर्षयस्तथा |` | "Indeed, here the divine sages, the brahmarṣis [Brahmin sages] and rājarṣis [royal sages]," |
| `Line 609: कीर्त्यन्ते शुभकर्माणस्तथा यक्षमहोरगाः ||१९२||` | "Are glorified for their auspicious deeds, as well as the Yakṣas [demigods] and Mahoragas [great serpents]. ||192||" |
| `Line 610: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 611: भगवान्वासुदेवश्च कीर्त्यतेऽत्र सनातनः |` | "And Lord Vāsudeva [Krishna], the eternal one, is glorified here," |
| `Line 612: स हि सत्यमृतं चैव पवित्रं पुण्यमेव च ||१९३||` | "For he is truth, immortality, purity, and virtue indeed. ||193||" |
| `Line 613: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 614: शाश्वतं ब्रह्म परमं ध्रुवं ज्योतिः सनातनम् |` | "The eternal Brahman [Absolute], supreme, immutable, the eternal light," |
| `Line 615: यस्य दिव्यानि कर्माणि कथयन्ति मनीषिणः ||१९४||` | "Whose divine deeds the wise ones narrate. ||194||" |
| `Line 616: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 617: असत्सत्सदसच्चैव यस्माद्देवात्प्रवर्तते |` | "From which deity proceeds the unmanifest, the manifest, and that which is both manifest and unmanifest," |
| `Line 618: सन्ततिश्च प्रवृत्तिश्च जन्म मृत्युः पुनर्भवः ||१९५||` | "And continuity, activity, birth, death, and rebirth. ||195||" |
| `Line 619: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 620: अध्यात्मं श्रूयते यच्च पञ्चभूतगुणात्मकम् |` | "And what is heard as spiritual knowledge, composed of the qualities of the five elements," |
| `Line 621: अव्यक्तादि परं यच्च स एव परिगीयते ||१९६||` | "And that which is beyond the unmanifest beginning—He alone is celebrated. ||196||" |
| `Line 622: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 623: यत्तद्यतिवरा युक्ता ध्यानयोगबलान्विताः |` | "That which the best of ascetics [yatis], concentrated and endowed with the power of meditation yoga," |
| `Line 624: प्रतिबिम्बमिवादर्शे पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् ||१९७||` | "See established in their own self, like a reflection in a mirror. ||197||" |
| `Line 625: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 601: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 602: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 603: अत्रोपनिषदं पुण्यां कृष्णद्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् |` | "Here, Krishna Dvaipāyana [Vyāsa] spoke this sacred Upanishad [esoteric teaching]," |
| `Line 604: भारताध्ययनात्पुण्यादपि पादमधीयतः ||१९१||` | "Even for one who studies just a quarter of the holy Bhārata [Mahābhārata]. ||191||" |
| `Line 605: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 606: श्रद्दधानस्य पूयन्ते सर्वपापान्यशेषतः ||१९१||` | "For the one who has faith, all sins are purified completely. ||191||" |
| `Line 607: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 608: देवर्षयो ह्यत्र पुण्या ब्रह्मराजर्षयस्तथा |` | "Indeed, here the divine sages, the brahmarṣis [Brahmin sages] and rājarṣis [royal sages]," |
| `Line 609: कीर्त्यन्ते शुभकर्माणस्तथा यक्षमहोरगाः ||१९२||` | "Are glorified for their auspicious deeds, as well as the Yakṣas [demigods] and Mahoragas [great serpents]. ||192||" |
| `Line 610: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 611: भगवान्वासुदेवश्च कीर्त्यतेऽत्र सनातनः |` | "And Lord Vāsudeva [Krishna], the eternal one, is glorified here," |
| `Line 612: स हि सत्यमृतं चैव पवित्रं पुण्यमेव च ||१९३||` | "For he is truth, immortality, purity, and virtue indeed. ||193||" |
| `Line 613: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 614: शाश्वतं ब्रह्म परमं ध्रुवं ज्योतिः सनातनम् |` | "The eternal Brahman [Absolute], supreme, immutable, the eternal light," |
| `Line 615: यस्य दिव्यानि कर्माणि कथयन्ति मनीषिणः ||१९४||` | "Whose divine deeds the wise ones narrate. ||194||" |
| `Line 616: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 617: असत्सत्सदसच्चैव यस्माद्देवात्प्रवर्तते |` | "From which deity proceeds the unmanifest, the manifest, and that which is both manifest and unmanifest," |
| `Line 618: सन्ततिश्च प्रवृत्तिश्च जन्म मृत्युः पुनर्भवः ||१९५||` | "And continuity, activity, birth, death, and rebirth. ||195||" |
| `Line 619: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 620: अध्यात्मं श्रूयते यच्च पञ्चभूतगुणात्मकम् |` | "And what is heard as spiritual knowledge, composed of the qualities of the five elements," |
| `Line 621: अव्यक्तादि परं यच्च स एव परिगीयते ||१९६||` | "And that which is beyond the unmanifest beginning—He alone is celebrated. ||196||" |
| `Line 622: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 623: यत्तद्यतिवरा युक्ता ध्यानयोगबलान्विताः |` | "That which the best of ascetics [yatis], concentrated and endowed with the power of meditation yoga," |
| `Line 624: प्रतिबिम्बमिवादर्शे पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् ||१९७||` | "See established in their own self, like a reflection in a mirror. ||197||" |
| `Line 625: ` | [Blank line] |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 626: श्रद्दधानः सदोद्युक्तः सत्यधर्मपरायणः |` | "One who is faithful, always diligent, and devoted to truth and righteousness," |
| `Line 627: आसेवन्निममध्यायं नरः पापात्प्रमुच्यते ||१९८||` | "A person who regularly studies this chapter is freed from sins. ||198||" |
| `Line 628: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 629: अनुक्रमणिमध्यायं भारतस्येममादितः |` | "This index chapter [anukramaṇi] of the Bharata from the beginning," |
| `Line 630: आस्तिकः सततं शृण्वन्न कृच्छ्रेष्ववसीदति ||१९९||` | "A believer [āstika] who constantly listens to it does not sink in difficulties. ||199||" |
| `Line 631: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 632: उभे सन्ध्ये जपन्किञ्चित्सद्यो मुच्येत किल्बिषात् |` | "One who recites even a little of it at both twilights [dawn and dusk] is immediately freed from sin," |
| `Line 633: अनुक्रमण्या यावत्स्यादह्ना रात्र्या च सञ्चितम् ||२००||` | "Whatever sins are accumulated during day and night, through the index [anukramaṇī]. ||200||" |
| `Line 634: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 635: भारतस्य वपुर्ह्येतत्सत्यं चामृतमेव च |` | "This is indeed the body of the Bharata, both truth and immortality," |
| `Line 636: नवनीतं यथा दध्नो द्विपदां ब्राह्मणो यथा ||२०१||` | "As butter is from curd, as the Brahmin is among bipeds [humans]. ||201||" |
| `Line 637: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 638: ह्रदानामुदधिः श्रेष्ठो गौर्वरिष्ठा चतुष्पदाम् |` | "As the ocean is the best among lakes, as the cow is the foremost among quadrupeds," |
| `Line 639: यथैतानि वरिष्ठानि तथा भारतमुच्यते ||२०२||` | "Just as these are the best, so is the Bharata declared to be. ||202||" |
| `Line 640: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 641: यश्चैनं श्रावयेच्छ्राद्धे ब्राह्मणान्पादमन्ततः |` | "Whoever recites this to Brahmins during a śrāddha [ancestral rite], even just a portion," |
| `Line 642: अक्षय्यमन्नपानं तत्पितृंस्तस्योपतिष्ठति ||२०३||` | "Inexhaustible food and drink reach his ancestors. ||203||" |
| `Line 643: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 644: इतिहासपुराणाभ्यां वेदं समुपबृंहयेत् |` | "One should supplement the Veda with Itihāsas [histories] and Purāṇas [ancient texts]," |
| `Line 645: बिभेत्यल्पश्रुताद्वेदो मामयं प्रतरिष्यति ||२०४||` | "The Veda fears one of little learning, thinking 'he will misinterpret me'. ||204||" |
| `Line 646: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 647: कार्ष्णं वेदमिमं विद्वाञ्श्रावयित्वार्थमश्नुते |` | "The learned one, having recited this Veda of Kṛṣṇa [Vyāsa's text], obtains wealth," |
| `Line 648: भ्रूणहत्याकृतं चापि पापं जह्यान्न संशयः ||२०५||` | "And even the sin of killing a fetus [brūṇahatyā] is abandoned, without doubt. ||205||" |
| `Line 649: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 650: य इमं शुचिरध्यायं पठेत्पर्वणि पर्वणि |` | "Whoever, being pure, recites this chapter at each parvan [sacred occasion]," |
translations: | `Line 626: श्रद्दधानः सदोद्युक्तः सत्यधर्मपरायणः |` | "One who is faithful, always diligent, and devoted to truth and righteousness," |
| `Line 627: आसेवन्निममध्यायं नरः पापात्प्रमुच्यते ||१९८||` | "A person who regularly studies this chapter is freed from sins. ||198||" |
| `Line 628: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 629: अनुक्रमणिमध्यायं भारतस्येममादितः |` | "This index chapter [anukramaṇi] of the Bharata from the beginning," |
| `Line 630: आस्तिकः सततं शृण्वन्न कृच्छ्रेष्ववसीदति ||१९९||` | "A believer [āstika] who constantly listens to it does not sink in difficulties. ||199||" |
| `Line 631: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 632: उभे सन्ध्ये जपन्किञ्चित्सद्यो मुच्येत किल्बिषात् |` | "One who recites even a little of it at both twilights [dawn and dusk] is immediately freed from sin," |
| `Line 633: अनुक्रमण्या यावत्स्यादह्ना रात्र्या च सञ्चितम् ||२००||` | "Whatever sins are accumulated during day and night, through the index [anukramaṇī]. ||200||" |
| `Line 634: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 635: भारतस्य वपुर्ह्येतत्सत्यं चामृतमेव च |` | "This is indeed the body of the Bharata, both truth and immortality," |
| `Line 636: नवनीतं यथा दध्नो द्विपदां ब्राह्मणो यथा ||२०१||` | "As butter is from curd, as the Brahmin is among bipeds [humans]. ||201||" |
| `Line 637: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 638: ह्रदानामुदधिः श्रेष्ठो गौर्वरिष्ठा चतुष्पदाम् |` | "As the ocean is the best among lakes, as the cow is the foremost among quadrupeds," |
| `Line 639: यथैतानि वरिष्ठानि तथा भारतमुच्यते ||२०२||` | "Just as these are the best, so is the Bharata declared to be. ||202||" |
| `Line 640: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 641: यश्चैनं श्रावयेच्छ्राद्धे ब्राह्मणान्पादमन्ततः |` | "Whoever recites this to Brahmins during a śrāddha [ancestral rite], even just a portion," |
| `Line 642: अक्षय्यमन्नपानं तत्पितृंस्तस्योपतिष्ठति ||२०३||` | "Inexhaustible food and drink reach his ancestors. ||203||" |
| `Line 643: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 644: इतिहासपुराणाभ्यां वेदं समुपबृंहयेत् |` | "One should supplement the Veda with Itihāsas [histories] and Purāṇas [ancient texts]," |
| `Line 645: बिभेत्यल्पश्रुताद्वेदो मामयं प्रतरिष्यति ||२०४||` | "The Veda fears one of little learning, thinking 'he will misinterpret me'. ||204||" |
| `Line 646: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 647: कार्ष्णं वेदमिमं विद्वाञ्श्रावयित्वार्थमश्नुते |` | "The learned one, having recited this Veda of Kṛṣṇa [Vyāsa's text], obtains wealth," |
| `Line 648: भ्रूणहत्याकृतं चापि पापं जह्यान्न संशयः ||२०५||` | "And even the sin of killing a fetus [brūṇahatyā] is abandoned, without doubt. ||205||" |

| `Line 650: य इमं शुचिरध्यायं पठेत्पर्वणि पर्वणि |` | "Whoever, being pure, recites this chapter at each parvan [sacred occasion]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 651: अधीतं भारतं तेन कृत्स्नं स्यादिति मे मतिः ||२०६||` | "The entire Bharata would be studied by him - this is my belief. ||206||" |
| `Line 652: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 653: यश्चेमं शृणुयान्नित्यमार्षं श्रद्धासमन्वितः |` | "And whoever listens to this sage-composed [ārṣa] text regularly with faith," |
| `Line 654: स दीर्घमायुः कीर्तिं च स्वर्गतिं चाप्नुयान्नरः ||२०७||` | "That person attains long life, fame, and the path to heaven [svargati]. ||207||" |
| `Line 655: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 656: चत्वार एकतो वेदा भारतं चैकमेकतः |` | "The four Vedas on one side and the Bharata alone on the other side," |
| `Line 657: समागतैः सुरर्षिभिस्तुलामारोपितं पुरा ||२०८||` | "Were placed on a scale by the assembled divine sages [surarṣi] in ancient times. ||208||" |
| `Line 658: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 659: महत्त्वे च गुरुत्वे च ध्रियमाणं ततोऽधिकम् ||२०८||` | "And in greatness and weight, it was held to be superior. ||208||" |
| `Line 660: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 661: महत्त्वाद्भारवत्त्वाच्च महाभारतमुच्यते |` | "Due to its greatness [mahattva] and weightiness [bhāravattva], it is called the Mahābhārata," |
| `Line 662: निरुक्तमस्य यो वेद सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ||२०९||` | "One who knows this etymology [nirukta] is freed from all sins. ||209||" |
| `Line 663: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 664: तपो न कल्कोऽध्ययनं न कल्कः; स्वाभाविको वेदविधिर्न कल्कः |` | "Austerity is not impurity [kalka], study is not impurity; the natural Vedic procedure is not impurity;" |
| `Line 665: प्रसह्य वित्ताहरणं न कल्क; स्तान्येव भावोपहतानि कल्कः ||२१०||` | "Forcible taking of wealth is not impurity; these very things when corrupted by evil intent become impurity. ||210||" |
| `Line 666: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 667: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 668: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 669: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 670: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 671: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 672: पर्वसंग्रहपर्व` | "Parvasaṃgraha Parva [Chapter summarizing sections]" |
| `Line 673: २` | "2" |
| `Line 674: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 675: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 651: अधीतं भारतं तेन कृत्स्नं स्यादिति मे मतिः ||२०६||` | "The entire Bharata would be studied by him - this is my belief. ||206||" |
| `Line 652: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 653: यश्चेमं शृणुयान्नित्यमार्षं श्रद्धासमन्वितः |` | "And whoever listens to this sage-composed [ārṣa] text regularly with faith," |
| `Line 654: स दीर्घमायुः कीर्तिं च स्वर्गतिं चाप्नुयान्नरः ||२०७||` | "That person attains long life, fame, and the path to heaven [svargati]. ||207||" |
| `Line 655: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 656: चत्वार एकतो वेदा भारतं चैकमेकतः |` | "The four Vedas on one side and the Bharata alone on the other side," |
| `Line 657: समागतैः सुरर्षिभिस्तुलामारोपितं पुरा ||२०८||` | "Were placed on a scale by the assembled divine sages [surarṣi] in ancient times. ||208||" |
| `Line 658: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 659: महत्त्वे च गुरुत्वे च ध्रियमाणं ततोऽधिकम् ||२०८||` | "And in greatness and weight, it was held to be superior. ||208||" |
| `Line 660: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 661: महत्त्वाद्भारवत्त्वाच्च महाभारतमुच्यते |` | "Due to its greatness [mahattva] and weightiness [bhāravattva], it is called the Mahābhārata," |
| `Line 662: निरुक्तमस्य यो वेद सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ||२०९||` | "One who knows this etymology [nirukta] is freed from all sins. ||209||" |
| `Line 663: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 664: तपो न कल्कोऽध्ययनं न कल्कः; स्वाभाविको वेदविधिर्न कल्कः |` | "Austerity is not impurity [kalka], study is not impurity; the natural Vedic procedure is not impurity;" |
| `Line 665: प्रसह्य वित्ताहरणं न कल्क; स्तान्येव भावोपहतानि कल्कः ||२१०||` | "Forcible taking of wealth is not impurity; these very things when corrupted by evil intent become impurity. ||210||" |

|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 676: ऋषय ऊचुः॥` | "The sages said:" |
| `Line 677: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 678: समन्तपञ्चकमिति यदुक्तं सूतनन्दन |` | "O Sūta-nandana [son of Sūta], what has been mentioned as Samantapañcaka [five lakes region]," |
| `Line 679: एतत्सर्वं यथान्यायं श्रोतुमिच्छामहे वयम् ॥१॥` | "All this we wish to hear properly in detail. ||1||" |
| `Line 680: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 681: सूत उवाच॥` | "Sūta said:" |
| `Line 682: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 683: शुश्रूषा यदि वो विप्रा ब्रुवतश्च कथाः शुभाः |` | "If you, O Vipras [learned Brahmins], wish to listen to auspicious stories from me," |
| `Line 684: समन्तपञ्चकाख्यं च श्रोतुमर्हथ सत्तमाः ॥२॥` | "Then you deserve to hear about the place called Samantapañcaka, O excellent ones. ||2||" |
| `Line 685: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 686: त्रेताद्वापरयोः सन्धौ रामः शस्त्रभृतां वरः |` | "At the junction of Tretā and Dvāpara [yugas/ages], Rāma [Paraśurāma], the best among weapon-bearers," |
| `Line 687: असकृत्पार्थिवं क्षत्रं जघानामर्षचोदितः ॥३॥` | "Repeatedly slaughtered the Kṣatriya [warrior] class, impelled by anger. ||3||" |
| `Line 688: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 689: स सर्वं क्षत्रमुत्साद्य स्ववीर्येणानलद्युतिः |` | "Having exterminated the entire Kṣatriya class by his own prowess, he who had the brilliance of fire," |
| `Line 690: समन्तपञ्चके पञ्च चकार रुधिरह्रदान् ॥४॥` | "Created five lakes of blood at Samantapañcaka. ||4||" |
| `Line 691: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 692: स तेषु रुधिराम्भस्सु ह्रदेषु क्रोधमूर्च्छितः |` | "In those lakes filled with bloody waters, overcome with rage," |
| `Line 693: पितृन्सन्तर्पयामास रुधिरेणेति नः श्रुतम् ॥५॥` | "He satisfied his ancestors with blood offerings - thus we have heard. ||5||" |
| `Line 694: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 695: अथर्चीकादयोऽभ्येत्य पितरो ब्राह्मणर्षभम् |` | "Then, approaching the bull among Brahmins [Paraśurāma], his ancestors led by Ṛcīka," |
| `Line 696: तं क्षमस्वेति सिषिधुस्ततः स विरराम ह ॥६॥` | "Restrained him saying, 'Desist from this,' and then he stopped. ||6||" |
| `Line 697: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 698: तेषां समीपे यो देशो ह्रदानां रुधिराम्भसाम् |` | "That region which is near those lakes of bloody waters," |
| `Line 699: समन्तपञ्चकमिति पुण्यं तत्परिकीर्तितम् ॥७॥` | "Is celebrated as the sacred Samantapañcaka. ||7||" |
| `Line 700: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 676: ऋषय ऊचुः॥` | "The sages said:" |
| `Line 677: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 678: समन्तपञ्चकमिति यदुक्तं सूतनन्दन |` | "O Sūta-nandana [son of Sūta], what has been mentioned as Samantapañcaka [five lakes region]," |
| `Line 679: एतत्सर्वं यथान्यायं श्रोतुमिच्छामहे वयम् ॥१॥` | "All this we wish to hear properly in detail. ||1||" |
| `Line 680: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 681: सूत उवाच॥` | "Sūta said:" |
| `Line 682: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 683: शुश्रूषा यदि वो विप्रा ब्रुवतश्च कथाः शुभाः |` | "If you, O Vipras [learned Brahmins], wish to listen to auspicious stories from me," |
| `Line 684: समन्तपञ्चकाख्यं च श्रोतुमर्हथ सत्तमाः ॥२॥` | "Then you deserve to hear about the place called Samantapañcaka, O excellent ones. ||2||" |
| `Line 685: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 686: त्रेताद्वापरयोः सन्धौ रामः शस्त्रभृतां वरः |` | "At the junction of Tretā and Dvāpara [yugas/ages], Rāma [Paraśurāma], the best among weapon-bearers," |
| `Line 687: असकृत्पार्थिवं क्षत्रं जघानामर्षचोदितः ॥३॥` | "Repeatedly slaughtered the Kṣatriya [warrior] class, impelled by anger. ||3||" |
| `Line 688: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 689: स सर्वं क्षत्रमुत्साद्य स्ववीर्येणानलद्युतिः |` | "Having exterminated the entire Kṣatriya class by his own prowess, he who had the brilliance of fire," |
| `Line 690: समन्तपञ्चके पञ्च चकार रुधिरह्रदान् ॥४॥` | "Created five lakes of blood at Samantapañcaka. ||4||" |
| `Line 691: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 692: स तेषु रुधिराम्भस्सु ह्रदेषु क्रोधमूर्च्छितः |` | "In those lakes filled with bloody waters, overcome with rage," |
| `Line 693: पितृन्सन्तर्पयामास रुधिरेणेति नः श्रुतम् ॥५॥` | "He satisfied his ancestors with blood offerings - thus we have heard. ||5||" |
| `Line 694: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 695: अथर्चीकादयोऽभ्येत्य पितरो ब्राह्मणर्षभम् |` | "Then, approaching the bull among Brahmins [Paraśurāma], his ancestors led by Ṛcīka," |
| `Line 696: तं क्षमस्वेति सिषिधुस्ततः स विरराम ह ॥६॥` | "Restrained him saying, 'Desist from this,' and then he stopped. ||6||" |
| `Line 697: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 698: तेषां समीपे यो देशो ह्रदानां रुधिराम्भसाम् |` | "That region which is near those lakes of bloody waters," |
| `Line 699: समन्तपञ्चकमिति पुण्यं तत्परिकीर्तितम् ॥७॥` | "Is celebrated as the sacred Samantapañcaka. ||7||" |
| `Line 700: ` | [Blank line] |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 701: येन लिङ्गेन यो देशो युक्तः समुपलक्ष्यते |` | "By which characteristic a region is observed to be distinguished," |
| `Line 702: तेनैव नाम्ना तं देशं वाच्यमाहुर्मनीषिणः ||८||` | "By that very name that region should be called, say the wise ones. ||8||" |
| `Line 703: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 704: अन्तरे चैव सम्प्राप्ते कलिद्वापरयोरभूत् |` | "And when the interval between Kali [dark age] and Dvapara [third age] arrived," |
| `Line 705: समन्तपञ्चके युद्धं कुरुपाण्डवसेनयोः ||९||` | "At Samantapanchaka [five lakes region] occurred the war between the armies of the Kurus and Pandavas. ||9||" |
| `Line 706: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 707: तस्मिन्परमधर्मिष्ठे देशे भूदोषवर्जिते |` | "In that most righteous region, free from defects of the earth," |
| `Line 708: अष्टादश समाजग्मुरक्षौहिण्यो युयुत्सया ||१०||` | "Eighteen akshauhinis [army divisions] assembled with the desire to fight. ||10||" |
| `Line 709: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 710: एवं नामाभिनिर्वृत्तं तस्य देशस्य वै द्विजाः |` | "Thus the derivation of the name of that region, O twice-born [Brahmins]," |
| `Line 711: पुण्यश्च रमणीयश्च स देशो वः प्रकीर्तितः ||११||` | "That sacred and delightful region has been described to you. ||11||" |
| `Line 712: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 713: तदेतत्कथितं सर्वं मया वो मुनिसत्तमाः |` | "All this has been told by me to you, O best of sages," |
| `Line 714: यथा देशः स विख्यातस्त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः ||१२||` | "How that region became renowned, celebrated in the three worlds [heaven, earth, netherworld]. ||12||" |
| `Line 715: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 716: ऋषय ऊचुः||` | "The sages said:" |
| `Line 717: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 718: अक्षौहिण्य इति प्रोक्तं यत्त्वया सूतनन्दन |` | "What you have mentioned as 'akshauhinis', O son of Suta [bard/charioteer]," |
| `Line 719: एतदिच्छामहे श्रोतुं सर्वमेव यथातथम् ||१३||` | "We wish to hear all about this exactly as it is. ||13||" |
| `Line 720: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 721: अक्षौहिण्याः परीमाणं रथाश्वनरदन्तिनाम् |` | "The measure of an akshauhini in terms of chariots, horses, men, and elephants," |
| `Line 722: यथावच्चैव नो ब्रूहि सर्वं हि विदितं तव ||१४||` | "Tell us properly, for everything is known to you. ||14||" |
| `Line 723: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 724: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 725: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 701: येन लिङ्गेन यो देशो युक्तः समुपलक्ष्यते |` | "By which characteristic a region is observed to be distinguished," |
| `Line 702: तेनैव नाम्ना तं देशं वाच्यमाहुर्मनीषिणः ||८||` | "By that very name that region should be called, say the wise ones. ||8||" |
| `Line 703: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 704: अन्तरे चैव सम्प्राप्ते कलिद्वापरयोरभूत् |` | "And when the interval between Kali [dark age] and Dvapara [third age] arrived," |
| `Line 705: समन्तपञ्चके युद्धं कुरुपाण्डवसेनयोः ||९||` | "At Samantapanchaka [five lakes region] occurred the war between the armies of the Kurus and Pandavas. ||9||" |
| `Line 706: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 707: तस्मिन्परमधर्मिष्ठे देशे भूदोषवर्जिते |` | "In that most righteous region, free from defects of the earth," |
| `Line 708: अष्टादश समाजग्मुरक्षौहिण्यो युयुत्सया ||१०||` | "Eighteen akshauhinis [army divisions] assembled with the desire to fight. ||10||" |
| `Line 709: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 710: एवं नामाभिनिर्वृत्तं तस्य देशस्य वै द्विजाः |` | "Thus the derivation of the name of that region, O twice-born [Brahmins]," |
| `Line 711: पुण्यश्च रमणीयश्च स देशो वः प्रकीर्तितः ||११||` | "That sacred and delightful region has been described to you. ||11||" |

| `Line 713: तदेतत्कथितं सर्वं मया वो मुनिसत्तमाः |` | "All this has been told by me to you, O best of sages," |
| `Line 714: यथा देशः स विख्यातस्त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः ||१२||` | "How that region became renowned, celebrated in the three worlds [heaven, earth, netherworld]. ||12||" |
| `Line 715: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 716: ऋषय ऊचुः||` | "The sages said:" |

| `Line 718: अक्षौहिण्य इति प्रोक्तं यत्त्वया सूतनन्दन |` | "What you have mentioned as 'akshauhinis', O son of Suta [bard/charioteer]," |
| `Line 719: एतदिच्छामहे श्रोतुं सर्वमेव यथातथम् ||१३||` | "We wish to hear all about this exactly as it is. ||13||" |

| `Line 721: अक्षौहिण्याः परीमाणं रथाश्वनरदन्तिनाम् |` | "The measure of an akshauhini in terms of chariots, horses, men, and elephants," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 726: एको रथो गजश्चैको नराः पञ्च पदातयः |` | "One chariot, one elephant, five men as foot-soldiers," |
| `Line 727: त्रयश्च तुरगास्तज्ज्ञैः पत्तिरित्यभिधीयते ||१५||` | "And three horses - by those who know, this is called a patti [basic military unit]. ||15||" |
| `Line 728: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 729: पत्तिं तु त्रिगुणामेतामाहुः सेनामुखं बुधाः |` | "The wise call three such pattis a senāmukha [battalion head]," |
| `Line 730: त्रीणि सेनामुखान्येको गुल्म इत्यभिधीयते ||१६||` | "Three senāmukhas are called one gulma [troop division]. ||16||" |
| `Line 731: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 732: त्रयो गुल्मा गणो नाम वाहिनी तु गणास्त्रयः |` | "Three gulmas are named a gaṇa [brigade], and three gaṇas are a vāhinī [division]," |
| `Line 733: स्मृतास्तिस्रस्तु वाहिन्यः पृतनेति विचक्षणैः ||१७||` | "Three vāhinīs are remembered by the discerning as a pṛtanā [army corps]. ||17||" |
| `Line 734: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 735: चमूस्तु पृतनास्तिस्रस्तिस्रश्चम्वस्त्वनीकिनी |` | "Three pṛtanās make a camū [army], and three camūs make an anīkinī [large army]," |
| `Line 736: अनीकिनीं दशगुणां प्राहुरक्षौहिणीं बुधाः ||१८||` | "The wise declare ten anīkinīs to be an akṣauhiṇī [complete army]. ||18||" |
| `Line 737: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 738: अक्षौहिण्याः प्रसङ्ख्यानं रथानां द्विजसत्तमाः |` | "The enumeration of chariots in an akṣauhiṇī, O best of twice-born [Brahmins]," |
| `Line 739: सङ्ख्यागणिततत्त्वज्ञैः सहस्राण्येकविंशतिः ||१९||` | "According to those who know the principles of numerical calculation, is twenty-one thousand. ||19||" |
| `Line 740: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 741: शतान्युपरि चैवाष्टौ तथा भूयश्च सप्ततिः |` | "And eight hundred, and furthermore seventy," |
| `Line 742: गजानां तु परीमाणमेतदेवात्र निर्दिशेत् ||२०||` | "The measure of elephants should be indicated as exactly the same here. ||20||" |
| `Line 743: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 744: ज्ञेयं शतसहस्रं तु सहस्राणि तथा नव |` | "It should be known that one hundred thousand and nine thousand," |
| `Line 745: नराणामपि पञ्चाशच्छतानि त्रीणि चानघाः ||२१||` | "And fifty and three hundred men, O sinless ones [sages]. ||21||" |
| `Line 746: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 747: पञ्चषष्टिसहस्राणि तथाश्वानां शतानि च |` | "Sixty-five thousand, and hundreds of horses," |
| `Line 748: दशोत्तराणि षट्प्राहुर्यथावदिह सङ्ख्यया ||२२||` | "Six hundred and ten more, they declare here according to the proper count. ||22||" |
| `Line 749: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 750: एतामक्षौहिणीं प्राहुः सङ्ख्यातत्त्वविदो जनाः |` | "This is what those who know the principles of enumeration declare to be an akṣauhiṇī [complete army]." |
translations: | `Line 726: एको रथो गजश्चैको नराः पञ्च पदातयः |` | "One chariot, one elephant, five men as foot-soldiers," |
| `Line 727: त्रयश्च तुरगास्तज्ज्ञैः पत्तिरित्यभिधीयते ||१५||` | "And three horses - by those who know, this is called a patti [basic military unit]. ||15||" |
| `Line 728: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 729: पत्तिं तु त्रिगुणामेतामाहुः सेनामुखं बुधाः |` | "The wise call three such pattis a senāmukha [battalion head]," |
| `Line 730: त्रीणि सेनामुखान्येको गुल्म इत्यभिधीयते ||१६||` | "Three senāmukhas are called one gulma [troop division]. ||16||" |
| `Line 731: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 732: त्रयो गुल्मा गणो नाम वाहिनी तु गणास्त्रयः |` | "Three gulmas are named a gaṇa [brigade], and three gaṇas are a vāhinī [division]," |
| `Line 733: स्मृतास्तिस्रस्तु वाहिन्यः पृतनेति विचक्षणैः ||१७||` | "Three vāhinīs are remembered by the discerning as a pṛtanā [army corps]. ||17||" |
| `Line 734: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 735: चमूस्तु पृतनास्तिस्रस्तिस्रश्चम्वस्त्वनीकिनी |` | "Three pṛtanās make a camū [army], and three camūs make an anīkinī [large army]," |
| `Line 736: अनीकिनीं दशगुणां प्राहुरक्षौहिणीं बुधाः ||१८||` | "The wise declare ten anīkinīs to be an akṣauhiṇī [complete army]. ||18||" |
| `Line 737: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 738: अक्षौहिण्याः प्रसङ्ख्यानं रथानां द्विजसत्तमाः |` | "The enumeration of chariots in an akṣauhiṇī, O best of twice-born [Brahmins]," |
| `Line 739: सङ्ख्यागणिततत्त्वज्ञैः सहस्राण्येकविंशतिः ||१९||` | "According to those who know the principles of numerical calculation, is twenty-one thousand. ||19||" |
| `Line 740: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 741: शतान्युपरि चैवाष्टौ तथा भूयश्च सप्ततिः |` | "And eight hundred, and furthermore seventy," |
| `Line 742: गजानां तु परीमाणमेतदेवात्र निर्दिशेत् ||२०||` | "The measure of elephants should be indicated as exactly the same here. ||20||" |
| `Line 743: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 744: ज्ञेयं शतसहस्रं तु सहस्राणि तथा नव |` | "It should be known that one hundred thousand and nine thousand," |
| `Line 745: नराणामपि पञ्चाशच्छतानि त्रीणि चानघाः ||२१||` | "And fifty and three hundred men, O sinless ones [sages]. ||21||" |
| `Line 746: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 747: पञ्चषष्टिसहस्राणि तथाश्वानां शतानि च |` | "Sixty-five thousand, and hundreds of horses," |
| `Line 748: दशोत्तराणि षट्प्राहुर्यथावदिह सङ्ख्यया ||२२||` | "Six hundred and ten more, they declare here according to the proper count. ||22||" |
| `Line 749: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 750: एतामक्षौहिणीं प्राहुः सङ्ख्यातत्त्वविदो जनाः |` | "This is what those who know the principles of enumeration declare to be an akṣauhiṇī [complete army]." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 751: यां वः कथितवानस्मि विस्तरेण द्विजोत्तमाः ||२३||` | "Which I have narrated to you in detail, O best of the twice-born [Brahmins]. ||23||" |
| `Line 752: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 753: एतया सङ्ख्यया ह्यासन्कुरुपाण्डवसेनयोः |` | "According to this enumeration, the armies of the Kurus and Pandavas" |
| `Line 754: अक्षौहिण्यो द्विजश्रेष्ठाः पिण्डेनाष्टादशैव ताः ||२४||` | "Consisted of exactly eighteen akshauhinis [complete armies] in total, O foremost of the twice-born. ||24||" |
| `Line 755: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 756: समेतास्तत्र वै देशे तत्रैव निधनं गताः |` | "Assembled in that place, they met their destruction in that very place," |
| `Line 757: कौरवान्कारणं कृत्वा कालेनाद्भुतकर्मणा ||२५||` | "With the Kauravas as the cause, by Time [destiny] of wonderful deeds. ||25||" |
| `Line 758: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 759: अहानि युयुधे भीष्मो दशैव परमास्त्रवित् |` | "Bhishma, the supreme weapon-knower, fought for exactly ten days," |
| `Line 760: अहानि पञ्च द्रोणस्तु ररक्ष कुरुवाहिनीम् ||२६||` | "While Drona protected the Kuru army for five days. ||26||" |
| `Line 761: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 762: अहनी युयुधे द्वे तु कर्णः परबलार्दनः |` | "Karna, the tormentor of enemy forces, fought for two days," |
| `Line 763: शल्योऽर्धदिवसं त्वासीद्गदायुद्धमतः परम् ||२७||` | "Shalya was (commander) for half a day, and after that was the mace duel. ||27||" |
| `Line 764: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 765: तस्यैव तु दिनस्यान्ते हार्दिक्यद्रौणिगौतमाः |` | "At the end of that very day, Hardikya [Kritavarma], Drauni [Ashvatthama], and Gautama [Kripa]" |
| `Line 766: प्रसुप्तं निशि विश्वस्तं जघ्नुर्यौधिष्ठिरं बलम् ||२८||` | "Slew the sleeping, unsuspecting Pandava army at night. ||28||" |
| `Line 767: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 768: यत्तु शौनकसत्रे ते भारताख्यानविस्तरम् |` | "But in Shaunaka's sacrificial session, the detailed narration of the Bharata story" |
| `Line 769: आख्यास्ये तत्र पौलोममाख्यानं चादितः परम् ||२९||` | "I shall narrate there, beginning with the excellent Pauloma tale. ||29||" |
| `Line 770: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 771: विचित्रार्थपदाख्यानमनेकसमयान्वितम् |` | "A narrative with diverse meanings and words, containing many contexts," |
| `Line 772: अभिपन्नं नरैः प्राज्ञैर्वैराग्यमिव मोक्षिभिः ||३०||` | "Sought after by wise men, like detachment is by those seeking liberation. ||30||" |
| `Line 773: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 774: आत्मेव वेदितव्येषु प्रियेष्विव च जीवितम् |` | "Like the Self among things to be known, like life among things dear," |
| `Line 775: इतिहासः प्रधानार्थः श्रेष्ठः सर्वागमेष्वयम् ||३१||` | "This history [Mahabharata] with its principal meaning is the best among all scriptures. ||31||" |
translations: | `Line 751: यां वः कथितवानस्मि विस्तरेण द्विजोत्तमाः ||२३||` | "Which I have narrated to you in detail, O best of the twice-born [Brahmins]. ||23||" |
| `Line 752: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 753: एतया सङ्ख्यया ह्यासन्कुरुपाण्डवसेनयोः |` | "According to this enumeration, the armies of the Kurus and Pandavas" |
| `Line 754: अक्षौहिण्यो द्विजश्रेष्ठाः पिण्डेनाष्टादशैव ताः ||२४||` | "Consisted of exactly eighteen akshauhinis [complete armies] in total, O foremost of the twice-born. ||24||" |
| `Line 755: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 756: समेतास्तत्र वै देशे तत्रैव निधनं गताः |` | "Assembled in that place, they met their destruction in that very place," |
| `Line 757: कौरवान्कारणं कृत्वा कालेनाद्भुतकर्मणा ||२५||` | "With the Kauravas as the cause, by Time [destiny] of wonderful deeds. ||25||" |
| `Line 758: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 759: अहानि युयुधे भीष्मो दशैव परमास्त्रवित् |` | "Bhishma, the supreme weapon-knower, fought for exactly ten days," |
| `Line 760: अहानि पञ्च द्रोणस्तु ररक्ष कुरुवाहिनीम् ||२६||` | "While Drona protected the Kuru army for five days. ||26||" |
| `Line 761: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 762: अहनी युयुधे द्वे तु कर्णः परबलार्दनः |` | "Karna, the tormentor of enemy forces, fought for two days," |
| `Line 763: शल्योऽर्धदिवसं त्वासीद्गदायुद्धमतः परम् ||२७||` | "Shalya was (commander) for half a day, and after that was the mace duel. ||27||" |
| `Line 764: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 765: तस्यैव तु दिनस्यान्ते हार्दिक्यद्रौणिगौतमाः |` | "At the end of that very day, Hardikya [Kritavarma], Drauni [Ashvatthama], and Gautama [Kripa]" |
| `Line 766: प्रसुप्तं निशि विश्वस्तं जघ्नुर्यौधिष्ठिरं बलम् ||२८||` | "Slew the sleeping, unsuspecting Pandava army at night. ||28||" |
| `Line 767: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 768: यत्तु शौनकसत्रे ते भारताख्यानविस्तरम् |` | "But in Shaunaka's sacrificial session, the detailed narration of the Bharata story" |
| `Line 769: आख्यास्ये तत्र पौलोममाख्यानं चादितः परम् ||२९||` | "I shall narrate there, beginning with the excellent Pauloma tale. ||29||" |
| `Line 770: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 771: विचित्रार्थपदाख्यानमनेकसमयान्वितम् |` | "A narrative with diverse meanings and words, containing many contexts," |
| `Line 772: अभिपन्नं नरैः प्राज्ञैर्वैराग्यमिव मोक्षिभिः ||३०||` | "Sought after by wise men, like detachment is by those seeking liberation. ||30||" |
| `Line 773: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 774: आत्मेव वेदितव्येषु प्रियेष्विव च जीवितम् |` | "Like the Self among things to be known, like life among things dear," |
| `Line 775: इतिहासः प्रधानार्थः श्रेष्ठः सर्वागमेष्वयम् ||३१||` | "This history [Mahabharata] with its principal meaning is the best among all scriptures. ||31||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 76: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 77: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 78: आद्यं पुरुषमीशानं पुरुहूतं पुरुष्टुतम् |` | "The primeval Person [Purusha], the Lord, the much-invoked, the much-praised," |
| `Line 79: ऋतमेकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्यक्ताव्यक्तं सनातनम् ||२०||` | "The Truth, the one-syllabled Brahman [Absolute], the manifest and unmanifest, the eternal. ||20||" |
| `Line 80: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 81: असच्च सच्चैव च यद्विश्वं सदसतः परम् |` | "He who is both non-existence and existence, the universe, beyond both being and non-being," |
| `Line 82: परावराणां स्रष्टारं पुराणं परमव्ययम् ||२१||` | "The creator of the high and low, the ancient, the supreme and imperishable. ||21||" |
| `Line 83: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 84: मङ्गल्यं मङ्गलं विष्णुं वरेण्यमनघं शुचिम् |` | "The auspicious, the blessed Vishnu [all-pervading deity], the most excellent, the sinless, the pure," |
| `Line 85: नमस्कृत्य हृषीकेशं चराचरगुरुं हरिम् ||२२||` | "Having bowed to Hrishikesha [lord of senses], the teacher of the moving and unmoving, Hari [remover of obstacles]. ||22||" |
| `Line 86: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 87: महर्षेः पूजितस्येह सर्वलोके महात्मनः |` | "Of the great sage who is worshipped in this world, the great-souled one," |
| `Line 88: प्रवक्ष्यामि मतं कृत्स्नं व्यासस्यामिततेजसः ||२३||` | "I shall declare the complete doctrine of Vyāsa [compiler of Vedas] of immeasurable splendor. ||23||" |
| `Line 89: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 90: आचख्युः कवयः केचित्सम्प्रत्याचक्षते परे |` | "Some poets have narrated it, others are narrating it now," |
| `Line 91: आख्यास्यन्ति तथैवान्ये इतिहासमिमं भुवि ||२४||` | "And others will likewise narrate this history [itihāsa] on earth. ||24||" |
| `Line 92: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 93: इदं तु त्रिषु लोकेषु महज्ज्ञानं प्रतिष्ठितम् |` | "This great knowledge is established in the three worlds [triloka]," |
| `Line 94: विस्तरैश्च समासैश्च धार्यते यद्द्विजातिभिः ||२५||` | "Which is preserved by the twice-born [Brahmins] in detailed and condensed forms. ||25||" |
| `Line 95: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 96: अलङ्कृतं शुभैः शब्दैः समयैर्दिव्यमानुषैः |` | "Adorned with auspicious words, with divine and human conventions," |
| `Line 97: छन्दोवृत्तैश्च विविधैरन्वितं विदुषां प्रियम् ||२६||` | "Composed in various meters [chandas], dear to the learned. ||26||" |
| `Line 98: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 99: निष्प्रभेऽस्मिन्निरालोके सर्वतस्तमसावृते |` | "When this (universe) was without light, without illumination, covered with darkness on all sides," |
| `Line 100: बृहदण्डमभूदेकं प्रजानां बीजमक्षयम् ||२७||` | "There was one great cosmic egg [Brahmanda], the imperishable seed of all creatures. ||27||" |
translations: | `Line 76: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |

| `Line 87: महर्षेः पूजितस्येह सर्वलोके महात्मनः |` | "Of the great sage who is worshipped in this world, the great-souled one," |

| `Line 98: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 99: निष्प्रभेऽस्मिन्निरालोके सर्वतस्तमसावृते |` | "When this (universe) was without light, without illumination, covered with darkness on all sides," |
| `Line 100: बृहदण्डमभूदेकं प्रजानां बीजमक्षयम् ||२७||` | "There was one great cosmic egg [Brahmanda], the imperishable seed of all creatures. ||27||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 776: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 777: इतिहासोत्तमे ह्यस्मिन्नर्पिता बुद्धिरुत्तमा |` | "In this supreme historical narrative [itihāsa], the finest intellect has been invested," |
| `Line 778: स्वरव्यञ्जनयोः कृत्स्ना लोकवेदाश्रयेव वाक् ||३२||` | "Complete in vowels and consonants, like speech founded on worldly knowledge and Vedas. ||32||" |
| `Line 779: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 780: अस्य प्रज्ञाभिपन्नस्य विचित्रपदपर्वणः |` | "Of this wisdom-filled narrative with its diverse chapters and sections," |
| `Line 781: भारतस्येतिहासस्य श्रूयतां पर्वसङ्ग्रहः ||३३||` | "Listen to the summary of sections of the historical narrative [itihāsa] of Bharata. ||33||" |
| `Line 782: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 783: पर्वानुक्रमणी पूर्वं द्वितीयं पर्वसङ्ग्रहः |` | "First is the table of contents [Parvānukramaṇī], second is the summary of sections [Parvasaṅgraha]," |
| `Line 784: पौष्यं पौलोममास्तीकमादिवंशावतारणम् ||३४||` | "The Paushya, Pauloma, Āstīka, and the Descent of the First Dynasty [Ādivaṃśāvataraṇa]. ||34||" |
| `Line 785: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 786: ततः सम्भवपर्वोक्तमद्भुतं देवनिर्मितम् |` | "Then comes the marvelous divine-created section called Sambhava [Origin]," |
| `Line 787: दाहो जतुगृहस्यात्र हैडिम्बं पर्व चोच्यते ||३५||` | "The burning of the lac house is here, and the section called Hiḍimba is mentioned. ||35||" |
| `Line 788: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 789: ततो बकवधः पर्व पर्व चैत्ररथं ततः |` | "Then comes the section on the slaying of Baka, and then the Chaitraratha section," |
| `Line 790: ततः स्वयंवरं देव्याः पाञ्चाल्याः पर्व चोच्यते ||३६||` | "Then is mentioned the section on the self-choice [svayaṃvara] of the Panchala princess [Draupadi]. ||36||" |
| `Line 791: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 792: क्षत्रधर्मेण निर्जित्य ततो वैवाहिकं स्मृतम् |` | "Having conquered according to Kshatriya duty, then comes the section on marriage [Vaivāhika]," |
| `Line 793: विदुरागमनं पर्व राज्यलम्भस्तथैव च ||३७||` | "The section on Vidura's arrival, and likewise the obtaining of the kingdom. ||37||" |
| `Line 794: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 795: अर्जुनस्य वने वासः सुभद्राहरणं ततः |` | "Arjuna's dwelling in the forest, then the abduction of Subhadra," |
| `Line 796: सुभद्राहरणादूर्ध्वं ज्ञेयं हरणहारिकम् ||३८||` | "After the abduction of Subhadra, know the section called Haraṇahārika [Gifts after abduction]. ||38||" |
| `Line 797: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 798: ततः खाण्डवदाहाख्यं तत्रैव मयदर्शनम् |` | "Then the section called the burning of Khandava forest, and therein the appearance of Maya [architect]," |
| `Line 799: सभापर्व ततः प्रोक्तं मन्त्रपर्व ततः परम् ||३९||` | "Then is declared the Assembly Hall section [Sabhāparva], and after that the Council section [Mantraparva]. ||39||" |
| `Line 800: ` | [Blank line] |
translations: | `Line 776: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 777: इतिहासोत्तमे ह्यस्मिन्नर्पिता बुद्धिरुत्तमा |` | "In this supreme historical narrative [itihāsa], the finest intellect has been invested," |
| `Line 778: स्वरव्यञ्जनयोः कृत्स्ना लोकवेदाश्रयेव वाक् ||३२||` | "Complete in vowels and consonants, like speech founded on worldly knowledge and Vedas. ||32||" |
