completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5701: गच्छाम्यहं तं त्वरितः सद्यः कर्तुमपज्वरम् |` | "I will go to him quickly to immediately make him free from fever," |
| `Line 5702: मयाभिपन्नं तं चापि न सर्पो धर्षयिष्यति ||१७||` | "And the serpent will not harm him who is protected by me. ||17||" |
| `Line 5703: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5704: तक्षक उवाच||` | "Takshaka [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 5705: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5706: किमर्थं तं मया दष्टं सञ्जीवयितुमिच्छसि |` | "Why do you wish to revive him who has been bitten by me?" |
| `Line 5707: ब्रूहि काममहं तेऽद्य दद्मि स्वं वेश्म गम्यताम् ||१८||` | "Tell me your desire, I shall grant it to you today. Return to your own home. ||18||" |
| `Line 5708: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5709: मन्त्रिण ऊचुः||` | "The ministers said:" |
| `Line 5710: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5711: धनलिप्सुरहं तत्र यामीत्युक्तश्च तेन सः |` | "He (Kashyapa) said, 'I go there desiring wealth,' and that one (Takshaka)" |
| `Line 5712: तमुवाच महात्मानं मानयञ्श्लक्ष्णया गिरा ||१९||` | "Addressed that great soul, honoring him with gentle words: ||19||" |
| `Line 5713: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5714: यावद्धनं प्रार्थयसे तस्माद्राज्ञस्ततोऽधिकम् |` | "Whatever wealth you desire from that king, even more than that," |
| `Line 5715: गृहाण मत्त एव त्वं संनिवर्तस्व चानघ ||२०||` | "Take from me instead, and turn back, O sinless one. ||20||" |
| `Line 5716: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5717: स एवमुक्तो नागेन काश्यपो द्विपदां वरः |` | "Thus addressed by the serpent, Kashyapa [sage], the best among the twice-born [Brahmins]," |
| `Line 5718: लब्ध्वा वित्तं निववृते तक्षकाद्यावदीप्सितम् ||२१||` | "Having received from Takshaka as much wealth as he desired, turned back. ||21||" |
| `Line 5719: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5720: तस्मिन्प्रतिगते विप्रे छद्मनोपेत्य तक्षकः |` | "When that Brahmin had returned, Takshaka, approaching in disguise," |
| `Line 5721: तं नृपं नृपतिश्रेष्ठ पितरं धार्मिकं तव ||२२||` | "That king, O best of kings, your righteous father, ||22||" |
| `Line 5722: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5723: प्रासादस्थं यत्तमपि दग्धवान्विषवह्निना |` | "Though he was vigilant in his palace, (Takshaka) burned him with his poison-fire," |
| `Line 5724: ततस्त्वं पुरुषव्याघ्र विजयायाभिषेचितः ||२३||` | "Thereafter you, O tiger among men [heroic king], were crowned for victory. ||23||" |
| `Line 5725: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 5701: गच्छाम्यहं तं त्वरितः सद्यः कर्तुमपज्वरम् |` | "I will go to him quickly to immediately make him free from fever," |
| `Line 5702: मयाभिपन्नं तं चापि न सर्पो धर्षयिष्यति ||१७||` | "And the serpent will not harm him who is protected by me. ||17||" |
| `Line 5703: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5704: तक्षक उवाच||` | "Takshaka [serpent king] said:" |
| `Line 5705: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5706: किमर्थं तं मया दष्टं सञ्जीवयितुमिच्छसि |` | "Why do you wish to revive him who has been bitten by me?" |
| `Line 5707: ब्रूहि काममहं तेऽद्य दद्मि स्वं वेश्म गम्यताम् ||१८||` | "Tell me your desire, I shall grant it to you today. Return to your own home. ||18||" |
| `Line 5708: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5709: मन्त्रिण ऊचुः||` | "The ministers said:" |
| `Line 5710: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5711: धनलिप्सुरहं तत्र यामीत्युक्तश्च तेन सः |` | "He (Kashyapa) said, 'I go there desiring wealth,' and that one (Takshaka)" |
| `Line 5712: तमुवाच महात्मानं मानयञ्श्लक्ष्णया गिरा ||१९||` | "Addressed that great soul, honoring him with gentle words: ||19||" |
| `Line 5713: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5714: यावद्धनं प्रार्थयसे तस्माद्राज्ञस्ततोऽधिकम् |` | "Whatever wealth you desire from that king, even more than that," |
| `Line 5715: गृहाण मत्त एव त्वं संनिवर्तस्व चानघ ||२०||` | "Take from me instead, and turn back, O sinless one. ||20||" |
| `Line 5716: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5717: स एवमुक्तो नागेन काश्यपो द्विपदां वरः |` | "Thus addressed by the serpent, Kashyapa [sage], the best among the twice-born [Brahmins]," |
| `Line 5718: लब्ध्वा वित्तं निववृते तक्षकाद्यावदीप्सितम् ||२१||` | "Having received from Takshaka as much wealth as he desired, turned back. ||21||" |
| `Line 5719: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5720: तस्मिन्प्रतिगते विप्रे छद्मनोपेत्य तक्षकः |` | "When that Brahmin had returned, Takshaka, approaching in disguise," |
| `Line 5721: तं नृपं नृपतिश्रेष्ठ पितरं धार्मिकं तव ||२२||` | "That king, O best of kings, your righteous father, ||22||" |
| `Line 5722: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5723: प्रासादस्थं यत्तमपि दग्धवान्विषवह्निना |` | "Though he was vigilant in his palace, (Takshaka) burned him with his poison-fire," |
| `Line 5724: ततस्त्वं पुरुषव्याघ्र विजयायाभिषेचितः ||२३||` | "Thereafter you, O tiger among men [heroic king], were crowned for victory. ||23||" |
| `Line 5725: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5751: द्विजप्रभावाद्राजेन्द्र जीवितः सवनस्पतिः ||३०||` | "Due to the Brahmin's [twice-born] power, O lord of kings, the tree with its forest was revived. ||30||" |
| `Line 5752: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5753: तेन गत्वा नृपश्रेष्ठ नगरेऽस्मिन्निवेदितम् |` | "Having gone there, O best of kings, he reported everything in this city," |
| `Line 5754: यथावृत्तं तु तत्सर्वं तक्षकस्य द्विजस्य च ||३१||` | "All that had happened between Takshaka [serpent king] and the Brahmin, exactly as it occurred. ||31||" |
| `Line 5755: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5756: एतत्ते कथितं राजन्यथावृत्तं यथाश्रुतम् |` | "This has been told to you, O king, exactly as it happened, exactly as we heard it," |
| `Line 5757: श्रुत्वा तु नृपशार्दूल प्रकुरुष्व यथेप्सितम् ||३२||` | "Having heard this, O tiger among kings [mighty ruler], do as you desire. ||32||" |
| `Line 5758: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5759: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5760: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5761: मन्त्रिणां तु वचः श्रुत्वा स राजा जनमेजयः |` | "Having heard the words of the ministers, that King Janamejaya," |
| `Line 5762: पर्यतप्यत दुःखार्तः प्रत्यपिंषत्करे करम् ||३३||` | "Was consumed with grief, afflicted with sorrow, and rubbed one hand against the other. ||33||" |
| `Line 5763: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5764: निःश्वासमुष्णमसकृद्दीर्घं राजीवलोचनः |` | "The lotus-eyed [beautiful-eyed] king repeatedly heaved hot, long sighs," |
| `Line 5765: मुमोचाश्रूणि च तदा नेत्राभ्यां प्रततं नृपः ||३४||` | "And then the king shed continuous tears from his eyes. ||34||" |
| `Line 5766: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5767: उवाच च महीपालो दुःखशोकसमन्वितः ||३४||` | "And the ruler of the earth spoke, overcome with grief and sorrow. ||34||" |
| `Line 5768: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5769: श्रुत्वैतद्भवतां वाक्यं पितुर्मे स्वर्गतिं प्रति |` | "Having heard your words regarding my father's journey to heaven [death]," |
| `Line 5770: निश्चितेयं मम मतिर्या वै तां मे निबोधत ||३५||` | "My mind is now made up; know this decision of mine. ||35||" |
| `Line 5771: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5772: अनन्तरमहं मन्ये तक्षकाय दुरात्मने |` | "I think I must immediately retaliate against the wicked Takshaka," |
| `Line 5773: प्रतिकर्तव्यमित्येव येन मे हिंसितः पिता ||३६||` | "Indeed, I must take revenge on him by whom my father was killed. ||36||" |
| `Line 5774: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5775: ऋषेर्हि शृङ्गेर्वचनं कृत्वा दग्ध्वा च पार्थिवम् |` | "Having fulfilled the words of sage Shringi and having burnt the king [Parikshit]," |
translations: | `Line 5751: द्विजप्रभावाद्राजेन्द्र जीवितः सवनस्पतिः ||३०||` | "Due to the Brahmin's [twice-born] power, O lord of kings, the tree with its forest was revived. ||30||" |
| `Line 5752: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5753: तेन गत्वा नृपश्रेष्ठ नगरेऽस्मिन्निवेदितम् |` | "Having gone there, O best of kings, he reported everything in this city," |
| `Line 5754: यथावृत्तं तु तत्सर्वं तक्षकस्य द्विजस्य च ||३१||` | "All that had happened between Takshaka [serpent king] and the Brahmin, exactly as it occurred. ||31||" |
| `Line 5755: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5756: एतत्ते कथितं राजन्यथावृत्तं यथाश्रुतम् |` | "This has been told to you, O king, exactly as it happened, exactly as we heard it," |
| `Line 5757: श्रुत्वा तु नृपशार्दूल प्रकुरुष्व यथेप्सितम् ||३२||` | "Having heard this, O tiger among kings [mighty ruler], do as you desire. ||32||" |
| `Line 5758: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5759: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5760: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5761: मन्त्रिणां तु वचः श्रुत्वा स राजा जनमेजयः |` | "Having heard the words of the ministers, that King Janamejaya," |
| `Line 5762: पर्यतप्यत दुःखार्तः प्रत्यपिंषत्करे करम् ||३३||` | "Was consumed with grief, afflicted with sorrow, and rubbed one hand against the other. ||33||" |
| `Line 5763: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5764: निःश्वासमुष्णमसकृद्दीर्घं राजीवलोचनः |` | "The lotus-eyed [beautiful-eyed] king repeatedly heaved hot, long sighs," |
| `Line 5765: मुमोचाश्रूणि च तदा नेत्राभ्यां प्रततं नृपः ||३४||` | "And then the king shed continuous tears from his eyes. ||34||" |
| `Line 5766: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5767: उवाच च महीपालो दुःखशोकसमन्वितः ||३४||` | "And the ruler of the earth spoke, overcome with grief and sorrow. ||34||" |
| `Line 5768: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5769: श्रुत्वैतद्भवतां वाक्यं पितुर्मे स्वर्गतिं प्रति |` | "Having heard your words regarding my father's journey to heaven [death]," |
| `Line 5770: निश्चितेयं मम मतिर्या वै तां मे निबोधत ||३५||` | "My mind is now made up; know this decision of mine. ||35||" |
| `Line 5771: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5772: अनन्तरमहं मन्ये तक्षकाय दुरात्मने |` | "I think I must immediately retaliate against the wicked Takshaka," |
| `Line 5773: प्रतिकर्तव्यमित्येव येन मे हिंसितः पिता ||३६||` | "Indeed, I must take revenge on him by whom my father was killed. ||36||" |
| `Line 5774: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5775: ऋषेर्हि शृङ्गेर्वचनं कृत्वा दग्ध्वा च पार्थिवम् |` | "Having fulfilled the words of sage Shringi and having burnt the king [Parikshit]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5651: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5652: सख्युः सकाशात्पितरं पित्रा ते धर्षितं तथा ||३||` | "From his friend about his father being thus insulted by your father. ||3||" |
| `Line 5653: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5654: मृतं सर्पं समासक्तं पित्रा ते जनमेजय |` | "A dead serpent was placed by your father, O Janamejaya [king, Parikshit's son]," |
| `Line 5655: वहन्तं कुरुशार्दूल स्कन्धेनानपकारिणम् ||४||` | "On the shoulder of the innocent one who carried it, O tiger among Kurus [royal epithet]. ||4||" |
| `Line 5656: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5657: तपस्विनमतीवाथ तं मुनिप्रवरं नृप |` | "That ascetic who was exceedingly the foremost among sages, O king," |
| `Line 5658: जितेन्द्रियं विशुद्धं च स्थितं कर्मण्यथाद्भुते ||५||` | "Self-controlled, pure, and engaged in wonderful austerities. ||5||" |
| `Line 5659: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5660: तपसा द्योतितात्मानं स्वेष्वङ्गेषु यतं तथा |` | "His self illumined by austerities, disciplined in all his limbs," |
| `Line 5661: शुभाचारं शुभकथं सुस्थिरं तमलोलुपम् ||६||` | "Of virtuous conduct, pleasant speech, steadfast and free from desires. ||6||" |
| `Line 5662: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5663: अक्षुद्रमनसूयं च वृद्धं मौनव्रते स्थितम् |` | "Not mean-minded, free from envy, aged, observing the vow of silence," |
| `Line 5664: शरण्यं सर्वभूतानां पित्रा विप्रकृतं तव ||७||` | "A refuge for all beings - was insulted by your father. ||7||" |
| `Line 5665: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5666: शशापाथ स तच्छ्रुत्वा पितरं ते रुषान्वितः |` | "Having heard that, he cursed your father, filled with anger," |
| `Line 5667: ऋषेः पुत्रो महातेजा बालोऽपि स्थविरैर्वरः ||८||` | "The sage's son of great splendor, though a child, superior to elders. ||8||" |
| `Line 5668: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5669: स क्षिप्रमुदकं स्पृष्ट्वा रोषादिदमुवाच ह |` | "He quickly touched water [purification ritual] and in anger said this," |
| `Line 5670: पितरं तेऽभिसन्धाय तेजसा प्रज्वलन्निव ||९||` | "Addressing your father, blazing as it were with energy. ||9||" |
| `Line 5671: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5672: अनागसि गुरौ यो मे मृतं सर्पमवासृजत् |` | "He who placed a dead serpent on my innocent father [guru]," |
| `Line 5673: तं नागस्तक्षकः क्रुद्धस्तेजसा सादयिष्यति ||१०||` | "Him shall the angry serpent Takshaka [serpent king] destroy with his power. ||10||" |
| `Line 5674: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5675: सप्तरात्रादितः पापं पश्य मे तपसो बलम् ||१०||` | "Within seven nights from now, O sinner, behold the power of my austerities. ||10||" |
translations: | `Line 5651: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 5653: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5654: मृतं सर्पं समासक्तं पित्रा ते जनमेजय |` | "A dead serpent was placed by your father, O Janamejaya [king, Parikshit's son]," |
| `Line 5655: वहन्तं कुरुशार्दूल स्कन्धेनानपकारिणम् ||४||` | "On the shoulder of the innocent one who carried it, O tiger among Kurus [royal epithet]. ||4||" |

| `Line 5664: शरण्यं सर्वभूतानां पित्रा विप्रकृतं तव ||७||` | "A refuge for all beings - was insulted by your father. ||7||" |

| `Line 5669: स क्षिप्रमुदकं स्पृष्ट्वा रोषादिदमुवाच ह |` | "He quickly touched water [purification ritual] and in anger said this," |
| `Line 5670: पितरं तेऽभिसन्धाय तेजसा प्रज्वलन्निव ||९||` | "Addressing your father, blazing as it were with energy. ||9||" |

| `Line 5672: अनागसि गुरौ यो मे मृतं सर्पमवासृजत् |` | "He who placed a dead serpent on my innocent father [guru]," |
| `Line 5673: तं नागस्तक्षकः क्रुद्धस्तेजसा सादयिष्यति ||१०||` | "Him shall the angry serpent Takshaka [serpent king] destroy with his power. ||10||" |

| `Line 5675: सप्तरात्रादितः पापं पश्य मे तपसो बलम् ||१०||` | "Within seven nights from now, O sinner, behold the power of my austerities. ||10||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5726: एतद्दृष्टं श्रुतं चापि यथावन्नृपसत्तम |` | "This has been seen and heard exactly as it happened, O best of kings [royal epithet]," |
| `Line 5727: अस्माभिर्निखिलं सर्वं कथितं ते सुदारुणम् ||२४||` | "Everything has been told to you by us in full, this most terrible event. ||24||" |
| `Line 5728: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5729: श्रुत्वा चैतं नृपश्रेष्ठ पार्थिवस्य पराभवम् |` | "Having heard this, O foremost of kings [royal epithet], about the defeat of the king [your father]," |
| `Line 5730: अस्य चर्षेरुत्तङ्कस्य विधत्स्व यदनन्तरम् ||२५||` | "And of this sage Uttanka, decide what should be done next. ||25||" |
| `Line 5731: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5732: जनमेजय उवाच||` | "Janamejaya said:" |
| `Line 5733: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5734: एतत्तु श्रोतुमिच्छामि अटव्यां निर्जने वने |` | "But I wish to hear about this, in the desolate forest in the wilderness," |
| `Line 5735: संवादं पन्नगेन्द्रस्य काश्यपस्य च यत्तदा ||२६||` | "The conversation between the lord of serpents [Takshaka] and Kashyapa [sage] that took place then. ||26||" |
| `Line 5736: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5737: केन दृष्टं श्रुतं चापि भवतां श्रोत्रमागतम् |` | "By whom was it seen and heard, and how did it come to your ears?" |
| `Line 5738: श्रुत्वा चाथ विधास्यामि पन्नगान्तकरीं मतिम् ||२७||` | "After hearing it, I shall then form a resolution to destroy the serpents [snake sacrifice]. ||27||" |
| `Line 5739: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5740: मन्त्रिण ऊचुः||` | "The ministers said:" |
| `Line 5741: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5742: शृणु राजन्यथास्माकं येनैतत्कथितं पुरा |` | "Listen, O king, how this was told to us before," |
| `Line 5743: समागमं द्विजेन्द्रस्य पन्नगेन्द्रस्य चाध्वनि ||२८||` | "About the meeting of the foremost Brahmin [Kashyapa] and the lord of serpents on the way. ||28||" |
| `Line 5744: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5745: तस्मिन्वृक्षे नरः कश्चिदिन्धनार्थाय पार्थिव |` | "In that tree, O ruler [Janamejaya], a certain man in search of firewood," |
| `Line 5746: विचिन्वन्पूर्वमारूढः शुष्कशाखं वनस्पतिम् ||२९||` | "Had previously climbed that forest tree with dry branches. ||29||" |
| `Line 5747: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5748: अबुध्यमानौ तं तत्र वृक्षस्थं पन्नगद्विजौ ||२९||` | "The serpent and the twice-born [Brahmin] were unaware of him there in the tree. ||29||" |
| `Line 5749: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5750: स तु तेनैव वृक्षेण भस्मीभूतोऽभवत्तदा |` | "But he, along with that very tree, was reduced to ashes then," |
translations: | `Line 5726: एतद्दृष्टं श्रुतं चापि यथावन्नृपसत्तम |` | "This has been seen and heard exactly as it happened, O best of kings [royal epithet]," |
| `Line 5727: अस्माभिर्निखिलं सर्वं कथितं ते सुदारुणम् ||२४||` | "Everything has been told to you by us in full, this most terrible event. ||24||" |
| `Line 5728: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5729: श्रुत्वा चैतं नृपश्रेष्ठ पार्थिवस्य पराभवम् |` | "Having heard this, O foremost of kings [royal epithet], about the defeat of the king [your father]," |
| `Line 5730: अस्य चर्षेरुत्तङ्कस्य विधत्स्व यदनन्तरम् ||२५||` | "And of this sage Uttanka, decide what should be done next. ||25||" |
| `Line 5731: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5732: जनमेजय उवाच||` | "Janamejaya said:" |
| `Line 5733: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5734: एतत्तु श्रोतुमिच्छामि अटव्यां निर्जने वने |` | "But I wish to hear about this, in the desolate forest in the wilderness," |
| `Line 5735: संवादं पन्नगेन्द्रस्य काश्यपस्य च यत्तदा ||२६||` | "The conversation between the lord of serpents [Takshaka] and Kashyapa [sage] that took place then. ||26||" |
| `Line 5736: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5737: केन दृष्टं श्रुतं चापि भवतां श्रोत्रमागतम् |` | "By whom was it seen and heard, and how did it come to your ears?" |
| `Line 5738: श्रुत्वा चाथ विधास्यामि पन्नगान्तकरीं मतिम् ||२७||` | "After hearing it, I shall then form a resolution to destroy the serpents [snake sacrifice]. ||27||" |
| `Line 5739: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5740: मन्त्रिण ऊचुः||` | "The ministers said:" |
| `Line 5741: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5742: शृणु राजन्यथास्माकं येनैतत्कथितं पुरा |` | "Listen, O king, how this was told to us before," |
| `Line 5743: समागमं द्विजेन्द्रस्य पन्नगेन्द्रस्य चाध्वनि ||२८||` | "About the meeting of the foremost Brahmin [Kashyapa] and the lord of serpents on the way. ||28||" |
| `Line 5744: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5745: तस्मिन्वृक्षे नरः कश्चिदिन्धनार्थाय पार्थिव |` | "In that tree, O ruler [Janamejaya], a certain man in search of firewood," |
| `Line 5746: विचिन्वन्पूर्वमारूढः शुष्कशाखं वनस्पतिम् ||२९||` | "Had previously climbed that forest tree with dry branches. ||29||" |
| `Line 5747: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5748: अबुध्यमानौ तं तत्र वृक्षस्थं पन्नगद्विजौ ||२९||` | "The serpent and the twice-born [Brahmin] were unaware of him there in the tree. ||29||" |
| `Line 5749: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5750: स तु तेनैव वृक्षेण भस्मीभूतोऽभवत्तदा |` | "But he, along with that very tree, was reduced to ashes then," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5801: आरुरोह प्रतिज्ञां स सर्पसत्राय पार्थिवः ||१||` | "That king ascended to the vow for the serpent sacrifice. ||1||" |
| `Line 5802: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5803: ब्रह्मन्भरतशार्दूलो राजा पारिक्षितस्तदा ||१||` | "O Brahmin, that tiger among the Bharatas [heroic descendant], King Parikshit, then ||1||" |
| `Line 5804: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5805: पुरोहितमथाहूय ऋत्विजं वसुधाधिपः |` | "The lord of the earth, having summoned the family priest and the officiating priests," |
| `Line 5806: अब्रवीद्वाक्यसम्पन्नः सम्पदर्थकरं वचः ||२||` | "Spoke, endowed with eloquence, words conducive to prosperity and purpose: ||2||" |
| `Line 5807: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5808: यो मे हिंसितवांस्तातं तक्षकः स दुरात्मवान् |` | "That evil-souled Takshaka who killed my father," |
| `Line 5809: प्रतिकुर्यां यथा तस्य तद्भवन्तो ब्रुवन्तु मे ||३||` | "How I may retaliate against him, let your honors tell me. ||3||" |
| `Line 5810: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5811: अपि तत्कर्म विदितं भवतां येन पन्नगम् |` | "Is there any ritual known to you by which the serpent," |
| `Line 5812: तक्षकं सम्प्रदीप्तेऽग्नौ प्राप्स्येऽहं सहबान्धवम् ||४||` | "Takshaka, along with his relatives, I might obtain in the blazing fire? ||4||" |
| `Line 5813: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5814: यथा तेन पिता मह्यं पूर्वं दग्धो विषाग्निना |` | "Just as my father was previously burned by him with poison-fire," |
| `Line 5815: तथाहमपि तं पापं दग्धुमिच्छामि पन्नगम् ||५||` | "So I too wish to burn that sinful serpent. ||5||" |
| `Line 5816: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5817: ऋत्विज ऊचुः||` | "The priests [ritual officiants] said:" |
| `Line 5818: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5819: अस्ति राजन्महत्सत्रं त्वदर्थं देवनिर्मितम् |` | "There exists, O king, a great sacrifice designed by the gods for your purpose," |
| `Line 5820: सर्पसत्रमिति ख्यातं पुराणे कथ्यते नृप ||६||` | "Known as the Serpent Sacrifice, it is described in the Puranas [ancient texts], O ruler. ||6||" |
| `Line 5821: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5822: आहर्ता तस्य सत्रस्य त्वन्नान्योऽस्ति नराधिप |` | "The performer of that sacrifice is none other than you, O lord of men," |
| `Line 5823: इति पौराणिकाः प्राहुरस्माकं चास्ति स क्रतुः ||७||` | "Thus the knowers of Puranas have declared, and we possess knowledge of that ritual. ||7||" |
| `Line 5824: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5825: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
translations: | `Line 5801: आरुरोह प्रतिज्ञां स सर्पसत्राय पार्थिवः ||१||` | "That king ascended to the vow for the serpent sacrifice. ||1||" |
| `Line 5802: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5803: ब्रह्मन्भरतशार्दूलो राजा पारिक्षितस्तदा ||१||` | "O Brahmin, that tiger among the Bharatas [heroic descendant], King Parikshit, then ||1||" |
| `Line 5804: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5805: पुरोहितमथाहूय ऋत्विजं वसुधाधिपः |` | "The lord of the earth, having summoned the family priest and the officiating priests," |
| `Line 5806: अब्रवीद्वाक्यसम्पन्नः सम्पदर्थकरं वचः ||२||` | "Spoke, endowed with eloquence, words conducive to prosperity and purpose: ||2||" |
| `Line 5807: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5808: यो मे हिंसितवांस्तातं तक्षकः स दुरात्मवान् |` | "That evil-souled Takshaka who killed my father," |
| `Line 5809: प्रतिकुर्यां यथा तस्य तद्भवन्तो ब्रुवन्तु मे ||३||` | "How I may retaliate against him, let your honors tell me. ||3||" |
| `Line 5810: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5811: अपि तत्कर्म विदितं भवतां येन पन्नगम् |` | "Is there any ritual known to you by which the serpent," |
| `Line 5812: तक्षकं सम्प्रदीप्तेऽग्नौ प्राप्स्येऽहं सहबान्धवम् ||४||` | "Takshaka, along with his relatives, I might obtain in the blazing fire? ||4||" |
| `Line 5813: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5814: यथा तेन पिता मह्यं पूर्वं दग्धो विषाग्निना |` | "Just as my father was previously burned by him with poison-fire," |
| `Line 5815: तथाहमपि तं पापं दग्धुमिच्छामि पन्नगम् ||५||` | "So I too wish to burn that sinful serpent. ||5||" |
| `Line 5816: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5817: ऋत्विज ऊचुः||` | "The priests [ritual officiants] said:" |
| `Line 5818: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5819: अस्ति राजन्महत्सत्रं त्वदर्थं देवनिर्मितम् |` | "There exists, O king, a great sacrifice designed by the gods for your purpose," |
| `Line 5820: सर्पसत्रमिति ख्यातं पुराणे कथ्यते नृप ||६||` | "Known as the Serpent Sacrifice, it is described in the Puranas [ancient texts], O ruler. ||6||" |
| `Line 5821: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5822: आहर्ता तस्य सत्रस्य त्वन्नान्योऽस्ति नराधिप |` | "The performer of that sacrifice is none other than you, O lord of men," |
| `Line 5823: इति पौराणिकाः प्राहुरस्माकं चास्ति स क्रतुः ||७||` | "Thus the knowers of Puranas have declared, and we possess knowledge of that ritual. ||7||" |
| `Line 5824: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5825: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5851: यस्मिन्देशे च काले च मापनेयं प्रवर्तिता ||१५||` | "In which place and at which time this measurement [ritual procedure] was established. ||15||" |
| `Line 5852: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5853: ब्राह्मणं कारणं कृत्वा नायं संस्थास्यते क्रतुः ||१५||` | "Making a Brahmin the cause [instrument], this sacrifice will not be completed. ||15||" |
| `Line 5854: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5855: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु राजा स प्राग्दीक्षाकालमब्रवीत् |` | "Having heard this, the king, before the time of initiation [consecration ceremony], said," |
| `Line 5856: क्षत्तारं नेह मे कश्चिदज्ञातः प्रविशेदिति ||१६||` | "To the chamberlain [doorkeeper]: 'Let no unknown person enter here.' ||16||" |
| `Line 5857: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5858: ततः कर्म प्रववृते सर्पसत्रे विधानतः |` | "Then the ritual procedures of the snake sacrifice [serpent offering] began according to the prescribed rules," |
| `Line 5859: पर्यक्रामंश्च विधिवत्स्वे स्वे कर्मणि याजकाः ||१७||` | "And the priests moved about properly in their respective duties. ||17||" |
| `Line 5860: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5861: परिधाय कृष्णवासांसि धूमसंरक्तलोचनाः |` | "Wearing black garments, with eyes reddened by smoke," |
| `Line 5862: जुहुवुर्मन्त्रवच्चैव समिद्धं जातवेदसम् ||१८||` | "They made offerings with mantras into the blazing Jatavedas [fire deity]. ||18||" |
| `Line 5863: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5864: कम्पयन्तश्च सर्वेषामुरगाणां मनांसि ते |` | "They caused the minds of all the serpents [snake beings] to tremble," |
| `Line 5865: सर्पानाजुहुवुस्तत्र सर्वानग्निमुखे तदा ||१९||` | "And offered all the serpents there into the mouth of fire [sacrificial flame] then. ||19||" |
| `Line 5866: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5867: ततः सर्पाः समापेतुः प्रदीप्ते हव्यवाहने |` | "Then the serpents fell into the blazing Havyavahana [fire carrier]," |
| `Line 5868: विवेष्टमानाः कृपणा आह्वयन्तः परस्परम् ||२०||` | "Writhing pitifully, calling out to one another. ||20||" |
| `Line 5869: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5870: विस्फुरन्तः श्वसन्तश्च वेष्टयन्तस्तथा परे |` | "Hissing, gasping, and coiling, others," |
| `Line 5871: पुच्छैः शिरोभिश्च भृशं चित्रभानुं प्रपेदिरे ||२१||` | "With their tails and heads violently entered Chitrabhaanu [fire deity]. ||21||" |
| `Line 5872: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5873: श्वेताः कृष्णाश्च नीलाश्च स्थविराः शिशवस्तथा |` | "White, black, and blue ones, the old and the young alike," |
| `Line 5874: रुवन्तो भैरवान्नादान्पेतुर्दीप्ते विभावसौ ||२२||` | "Uttering terrible cries, fell into the blazing Vibhaavasu [fire deity]. ||22||" |
| `Line 5875: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 5851: यस्मिन्देशे च काले च मापनेयं प्रवर्तिता ||१५||` | "In which place and at which time this measurement [ritual procedure] was established. ||15||" |
| `Line 5852: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5853: ब्राह्मणं कारणं कृत्वा नायं संस्थास्यते क्रतुः ||१५||` | "Making a Brahmin the cause [instrument], this sacrifice will not be completed. ||15||" |
| `Line 5854: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5855: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु राजा स प्राग्दीक्षाकालमब्रवीत् |` | "Having heard this, the king, before the time of initiation [consecration ceremony], said," |
| `Line 5856: क्षत्तारं नेह मे कश्चिदज्ञातः प्रविशेदिति ||१६||` | "To the chamberlain [doorkeeper]: 'Let no unknown person enter here.' ||16||" |
| `Line 5857: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5858: ततः कर्म प्रववृते सर्पसत्रे विधानतः |` | "Then the ritual procedures of the snake sacrifice [serpent offering] began according to the prescribed rules," |
| `Line 5859: पर्यक्रामंश्च विधिवत्स्वे स्वे कर्मणि याजकाः ||१७||` | "And the priests moved about properly in their respective duties. ||17||" |
| `Line 5860: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5861: परिधाय कृष्णवासांसि धूमसंरक्तलोचनाः |` | "Wearing black garments, with eyes reddened by smoke," |
| `Line 5862: जुहुवुर्मन्त्रवच्चैव समिद्धं जातवेदसम् ||१८||` | "They made offerings with mantras into the blazing Jatavedas [fire deity]. ||18||" |
| `Line 5863: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5864: कम्पयन्तश्च सर्वेषामुरगाणां मनांसि ते |` | "They caused the minds of all the serpents [snake beings] to tremble," |
| `Line 5865: सर्पानाजुहुवुस्तत्र सर्वानग्निमुखे तदा ||१९||` | "And offered all the serpents there into the mouth of fire [sacrificial flame] then. ||19||" |
| `Line 5866: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5867: ततः सर्पाः समापेतुः प्रदीप्ते हव्यवाहने |` | "Then the serpents fell into the blazing Havyavahana [fire carrier]," |
| `Line 5868: विवेष्टमानाः कृपणा आह्वयन्तः परस्परम् ||२०||` | "Writhing pitifully, calling out to one another. ||20||" |
| `Line 5869: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5870: विस्फुरन्तः श्वसन्तश्च वेष्टयन्तस्तथा परे |` | "Hissing, gasping, and coiling, others," |
| `Line 5871: पुच्छैः शिरोभिश्च भृशं चित्रभानुं प्रपेदिरे ||२१||` | "With their tails and heads violently entered Chitrabhaanu [fire deity]. ||21||" |
| `Line 5872: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5873: श्वेताः कृष्णाश्च नीलाश्च स्थविराः शिशवस्तथा |` | "White, black, and blue ones, the old and the young alike," |
| `Line 5874: रुवन्तो भैरवान्नादान्पेतुर्दीप्ते विभावसौ ||२२||` | "Uttering terrible cries, fell into the blazing Vibhaavasu [fire deity]. ||22||" |
| `Line 5875: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5826: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5827: एवमुक्तः स राजर्षिर्मेने सर्पं हि तक्षकम् |` | "Thus addressed, that royal sage [king-seer] believed that the serpent Takshaka" |
| `Line 5828: हुताशनमुखं दीप्तं प्रविष्टमिति सत्तम ||८||` | "Had entered the blazing mouth of the fire [Hutashana], O excellent one. ||8||" |
| `Line 5829: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5830: ततोऽब्रवीन्मन्त्रविदस्तान्राजा ब्राह्मणांस्तदा |` | "Then the king addressed those Brahmins [twice-born], who were knowers of mantras, saying:" |
| `Line 5831: आहरिष्यामि तत्सत्रं सम्भाराः सम्भ्रियन्तु मे ||९||` | "I shall perform that sacrificial session [snake sacrifice]; let the materials be gathered for me. ||9||" |
| `Line 5832: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5833: ततस्ते ऋत्विजस्तस्य शास्त्रतो द्विजसत्तम |` | "Then those priests [ritual performers] of his, according to the scriptures, O best of the twice-born," |
| `Line 5834: देशं तं मापयामासुर्यज्ञायतनकारणात् ||१०||` | "Measured that place for the purpose of constructing the sacrificial altar. ||10||" |
| `Line 5835: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5836: यथावज्ज्ञानविदुषः सर्वे बुद्ध्या परं गताः ||१०||` | "All those knowledgeable ones, with proper understanding, reached the highest level of wisdom. ||10||" |
| `Line 5837: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5838: ऋद्ध्या परमया युक्तमिष्टं द्विजगणायुतम् |` | "Endowed with supreme prosperity, desired, filled with groups of Brahmins," |
| `Line 5839: प्रभूतधनधान्याढ्यमृत्विग्भिः सुनिवेशितम् ||११||` | "Abundant in wealth and grain, well-arranged by the priests. ||11||" |
| `Line 5840: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5841: निर्माय चापि विधिवद्यज्ञायतनमीप्सितम् |` | "And having constructed according to the rules the desired sacrificial altar," |
| `Line 5842: राजानं दीक्षयामासुः सर्पसत्राप्तये तदा ||१२||` | "They initiated the king then for the accomplishment of the snake sacrifice [serpent ritual]. ||12||" |
| `Line 5843: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5844: इदं चासीत्तत्र पूर्वं सर्पसत्रे भविष्यति |` | "And this happened there before the snake sacrifice was to take place," |
| `Line 5845: निमित्तं महदुत्पन्नं यज्ञविघ्नकरं तदा ||१३||` | "A great omen arose then, creating an obstacle to the sacrifice. ||13||" |
| `Line 5846: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5847: यज्ञस्यायतने तस्मिन्क्रियमाणे वचोऽब्रवीत् |` | "While that sacrificial altar was being constructed, these words were spoken" |
| `Line 5848: स्थपतिर्बुद्धिसम्पन्नो वास्तुविद्याविशारदः ||१४||` | "By the architect [master builder], endowed with intelligence, expert in the science of construction. ||14||" |
| `Line 5849: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5850: इत्यब्रवीत्सूत्रधारः सूतः पौराणिकस्तदा |` | "Thus spoke the master architect [string-holder], the Suta [bard], the reciter of Puranas at that time." |
translations: | `Line 5826: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5827: एवमुक्तः स राजर्षिर्मेने सर्पं हि तक्षकम् |` | "Thus addressed, that royal sage [king-seer] believed that the serpent Takshaka" |
| `Line 5828: हुताशनमुखं दीप्तं प्रविष्टमिति सत्तम ||८||` | "Had entered the blazing mouth of the fire [Hutashana], O excellent one. ||8||" |
| `Line 5829: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5830: ततोऽब्रवीन्मन्त्रविदस्तान्राजा ब्राह्मणांस्तदा |` | "Then the king addressed those Brahmins [twice-born], who were knowers of mantras, saying:" |
| `Line 5831: आहरिष्यामि तत्सत्रं सम्भाराः सम्भ्रियन्तु मे ||९||` | "I shall perform that sacrificial session [snake sacrifice]; let the materials be gathered for me. ||9||" |
| `Line 5832: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5833: ततस्ते ऋत्विजस्तस्य शास्त्रतो द्विजसत्तम |` | "Then those priests [ritual performers] of his, according to the scriptures, O best of the twice-born," |
| `Line 5834: देशं तं मापयामासुर्यज्ञायतनकारणात् ||१०||` | "Measured that place for the purpose of constructing the sacrificial altar. ||10||" |
| `Line 5835: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5836: यथावज्ज्ञानविदुषः सर्वे बुद्ध्या परं गताः ||१०||` | "All those knowledgeable ones, with proper understanding, reached the highest level of wisdom. ||10||" |
| `Line 5837: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5838: ऋद्ध्या परमया युक्तमिष्टं द्विजगणायुतम् |` | "Endowed with supreme prosperity, desired, filled with groups of Brahmins," |
| `Line 5839: प्रभूतधनधान्याढ्यमृत्विग्भिः सुनिवेशितम् ||११||` | "Abundant in wealth and grain, well-arranged by the priests. ||11||" |
| `Line 5840: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5841: निर्माय चापि विधिवद्यज्ञायतनमीप्सितम् |` | "And having constructed according to the rules the desired sacrificial altar," |
| `Line 5842: राजानं दीक्षयामासुः सर्पसत्राप्तये तदा ||१२||` | "They initiated the king then for the accomplishment of the snake sacrifice [serpent ritual]. ||12||" |
| `Line 5843: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5844: इदं चासीत्तत्र पूर्वं सर्पसत्रे भविष्यति |` | "And this happened there before the snake sacrifice was to take place," |
| `Line 5845: निमित्तं महदुत्पन्नं यज्ञविघ्नकरं तदा ||१३||` | "A great omen arose then, creating an obstacle to the sacrifice. ||13||" |
| `Line 5846: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5847: यज्ञस्यायतने तस्मिन्क्रियमाणे वचोऽब्रवीत् |` | "While that sacrificial altar was being constructed, these words were spoken" |
| `Line 5848: स्थपतिर्बुद्धिसम्पन्नो वास्तुविद्याविशारदः ||१४||` | "By the architect [master builder], endowed with intelligence, expert in the science of construction. ||14||" |
| `Line 5849: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5850: इत्यब्रवीत्सूत्रधारः सूतः पौराणिकस्तदा |` | "Thus spoke the master architect [string-holder], the Suta [bard], the reciter of Puranas at that time." |

| `Line 5876: एवं शतसहस्राणि प्रयुतान्यर्बुदानि च |` | "Thus hundreds of thousands, millions, and tens of millions" |
| `Line 5877: अवशानि विनष्टानि पन्नगानां द्विजोत्तम ||२३||` | "Of helpless serpents [snake beings] were destroyed, O best of the twice-born [Brahmin]. ||23||" |
| `Line 5878: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5879: इन्दुरा इव तत्रान्ये हस्तिहस्ता इवापरे |` | "Some there were like large rats, others like elephant trunks," |
| `Line 5880: मत्ता इव च मातङ्गा महाकाया महाबलाः ||२४||` | "And some like intoxicated elephants, with massive bodies and great strength. ||24||" |
| `Line 5881: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5882: उच्चावचाश्च बहवो नानावर्णा विषोल्बणाः |` | "Many were of various sizes, diverse colors, swollen with poison," |
| `Line 5883: घोराश्च परिघप्रख्या दन्दशूका महाबलाः ||२५||` | "Terrible and resembling iron clubs, these mighty biters [venomous serpents]. ||25||" |
| `Line 5884: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5885: प्रपेतुरग्नावुरगा मातृवाग्दण्डपीडिताः ||२५||` | "The serpents fell into the fire, tormented by the mother's curse [Kadru's words]. ||25||" |
| `Line 5886: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 5896: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5897: सर्पसत्रे तदा राज्ञः पाण्डवेयस्य धीमतः |` | "In that serpent sacrifice [snake ritual] of the wise king, descendant of the Pandavas [Pandava lineage]," |

| `Line 5986: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5987: तत आहूय पुत्रं स्वं जरत्कारुर्भुजङ्गमा |` | "Then Jaratkaaru [serpent woman], the serpent, having called her son," |
| `Line 5988: वासुकेर्नागराजस्य वचनादिदमब्रवीत् ||१||` | "Spoke these words at the command of Vaasuki [serpent king], the king of serpents. ||1||" |
| `Line 5989: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5990: अहं तव पितुः पुत्र भ्रात्रा दत्ता निमित्ततः |` | "O son, I was given to your father by my brother for a specific purpose," |
| `Line 5991: कालः स चायं सम्प्राप्तस्तत्कुरुष्व यथातथम् ||२||` | "And that time has now arrived; therefore, do what must be done. ||2||" |
| `Line 5992: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5993: आस्तीक उवाच||` | "Aastika [sage's name] said:" |
| `Line 5994: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5995: किंनिमित्तं मम पितुर्दत्ता त्वं मातुलेन मे |` | "For what purpose were you given to my father by my maternal uncle?" |
| `Line 5996: तन्ममाचक्ष्व तत्त्वेन श्रुत्वा कर्तास्मि तत्तथा ||३||` | "Tell me this truthfully; after hearing it, I shall act accordingly. ||3||" |
| `Line 5997: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 5999: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 6001: भगिनी नागराजस्य जरत्कारुरविक्लवा ||४||` | "The sister of the Nāga-king [serpent ruler], the steadfast Jaratkāru. ||4||" |
| `Line 6002: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6003: भुजगानामशेषाणां माता कद्रूरिति श्रुतिः |` | "Kadrū is known as the mother of all the serpents [snake beings]," |
| `Line 6004: तया शप्ता रुषितया सुता यस्मान्निबोध तत् ||५||` | "By her, enraged, her sons were cursed - hear the reason why. ||5||" |
| `Line 6005: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6006: उच्छैःश्रवाः सोऽश्वराजो यन्मिथ्या न कृतो मम |` | "Because Uchchaihshravas, that king of horses [divine steed], was not falsely represented for me," |
| `Line 6007: विनतानिमित्तं पणिते दासभावाय पुत्रकाः ||६||` | "In the wager with Vinatā, you, my sons, were reduced to slavery. ||6||" |
| `Line 6008: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6009: जनमेजयस्य वो यज्ञे धक्ष्यत्यनिलसारथिः |` | "In Janamejaya's sacrifice, the fire [wind-charioteer] shall consume you," |
| `Line 6010: तत्र पञ्चत्वमापन्नाः प्रेतलोकं गमिष्यथ ||७||` | "There, meeting your end, you shall go to the world of the dead [afterlife realm]. ||7||" |
| `Line 6011: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6012: तां च शप्तवतीमेवं साक्षाल्लोकपितामहः |` | "And to her who had pronounced this curse, the Grandfather of the worlds [Brahmā] himself," |
| `Line 6013: एवमस्त्विति तद्वाक्यं प्रोवाचानुमुमोद च ||८||` | "Said 'So be it,' confirming her words with his approval. ||8||" |
| `Line 6014: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6015: वासुकिश्चापि तच्छ्रुत्वा पितामहवचस्तदा |` | "And Vāsuki, having heard these words of the Grandfather [Brahmā]," |
| `Line 6016: अमृते मथिते तात देवाञ्शरणमीयिवान् ||९||` | "When the nectar [immortality elixir] was churned, O dear one, sought refuge with the gods. ||9||" |
| `Line 6017: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6018: सिद्धार्थाश्च सुराः सर्वे प्राप्यामृतमनुत्तमम् |` | "And all the gods, having achieved their purpose by obtaining the supreme nectar," |
| `Line 6019: भ्रातरं मे पुरस्कृत्य प्रजापतिमुपागमन् ||१०||` | "Placing my brother at their head, approached Prajāpati [creation lord]. ||10||" |
| `Line 6020: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6021: ते तं प्रसादयामासुर्देवाः सर्वे पितामहम् |` | "All those gods propitiated the Grandfather [Brahmā]," |
| `Line 6022: राज्ञा वासुकिना सार्धं स शापो न भवेदिति ||११||` | "Along with King Vāsuki, (praying) that the curse might not come to pass. ||11||" |
| `Line 6023: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6024: वासुकिर्नागराजोऽयं दुःखितो ज्ञातिकारणात् |` | "This Vāsuki, king of serpents [Nāga ruler], distressed for the sake of his kinsmen," |
| `Line 6025: अभिशापः स मात्रास्य भगवन्न भवेदिति ||१२||` | "(Pleaded) 'O Lord, may the curse of his mother not come to pass.' ||12||" |
translations: | `Line 6001: भगिनी नागराजस्य जरत्कारुरविक्लवा ||४||` | "The sister of the Nāga-king [serpent ruler], the steadfast Jaratkāru. ||4||" |
| `Line 6002: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6003: भुजगानामशेषाणां माता कद्रूरिति श्रुतिः |` | "Kadrū is known as the mother of all the serpents [snake beings]," |
| `Line 6004: तया शप्ता रुषितया सुता यस्मान्निबोध तत् ||५||` | "By her, enraged, her sons were cursed - hear the reason why. ||5||" |
| `Line 6005: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6006: उच्छैःश्रवाः सोऽश्वराजो यन्मिथ्या न कृतो मम |` | "Because Uchchaihshravas, that king of horses [divine steed], was not falsely represented for me," |
| `Line 6007: विनतानिमित्तं पणिते दासभावाय पुत्रकाः ||६||` | "In the wager with Vinatā, you, my sons, were reduced to slavery. ||6||" |
| `Line 6008: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6009: जनमेजयस्य वो यज्ञे धक्ष्यत्यनिलसारथिः |` | "In Janamejaya's sacrifice, the fire [wind-charioteer] shall consume you," |
| `Line 6010: तत्र पञ्चत्वमापन्नाः प्रेतलोकं गमिष्यथ ||७||` | "There, meeting your end, you shall go to the world of the dead [afterlife realm]. ||7||" |
| `Line 6011: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6012: तां च शप्तवतीमेवं साक्षाल्लोकपितामहः |` | "And to her who had pronounced this curse, the Grandfather of the worlds [Brahmā] himself," |
| `Line 6013: एवमस्त्विति तद्वाक्यं प्रोवाचानुमुमोद च ||८||` | "Said 'So be it,' confirming her words with his approval. ||8||" |
| `Line 6014: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6015: वासुकिश्चापि तच्छ्रुत्वा पितामहवचस्तदा |` | "And Vāsuki, having heard these words of the Grandfather [Brahmā]," |
| `Line 6016: अमृते मथिते तात देवाञ्शरणमीयिवान् ||९||` | "When the nectar [immortality elixir] was churned, O dear one, sought refuge with the gods. ||9||" |
| `Line 6017: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6018: सिद्धार्थाश्च सुराः सर्वे प्राप्यामृतमनुत्तमम् |` | "And all the gods, having achieved their purpose by obtaining the supreme nectar," |
| `Line 6019: भ्रातरं मे पुरस्कृत्य प्रजापतिमुपागमन् ||१०||` | "Placing my brother at their head, approached Prajāpati [creation lord]. ||10||" |
| `Line 6020: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6021: ते तं प्रसादयामासुर्देवाः सर्वे पितामहम् |` | "All those gods propitiated the Grandfather [Brahmā]," |
| `Line 6022: राज्ञा वासुकिना सार्धं स शापो न भवेदिति ||११||` | "Along with King Vāsuki, (praying) that the curse might not come to pass. ||11||" |
| `Line 6023: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6024: वासुकिर्नागराजोऽयं दुःखितो ज्ञातिकारणात् |` | "This Vāsuki, king of serpents [Nāga ruler], distressed for the sake of his kinsmen," |
| `Line 6025: अभिशापः स मात्रास्य भगवन्न भवेदिति ||१२||` | "(Pleaded) 'O Lord, may the curse of his mother not come to pass.' ||12||" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 6026: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6027: ब्रह्मोवाच॥` | "Brahma [creator deity] said:" |
| `Line 6028: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6029: जरत्कारुर्जरत्कारुं यां भार्यां समवाप्स्यति |` | "The Jaratkaru [sage's name] who will obtain Jaratkaru [female counterpart] as his wife," |
| `Line 6030: तत्र जातो द्विजः शापाद्भुजगान्मोक्षयिष्यति ॥१३॥` | "The twice-born [brahmin] born from that union will free the serpents from the curse. ||13||" |
| `Line 6031: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6032: जरत्कारुरुवाच॥` | "Jaratkaru [mother] said:" |
| `Line 6033: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6034: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु वचनं वासुकिः पन्नगेश्वरः |` | "Having heard these words, Vasuki [serpent king], the lord of serpents," |
| `Line 6035: प्रादान्माममरप्रख्य तव पित्रे महात्मने ॥१४॥` | "Gave me to your noble father, who was like an immortal. ||14||" |
| `Line 6036: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6037: प्रागेवानागते काले तत्र त्वं मय्यजायथाः ॥१४॥` | "Before the appointed time arrived, you were born to me. ||14||" |
| `Line 6038: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6039: अयं स कालः सम्प्राप्तो भयान्नस्त्रातुमर्हसि |` | "Now that time has arrived; you should save us from this fear," |
| `Line 6040: भ्रातरं चैव मे तस्मात्त्रातुमर्हसि पावकात् ॥१५॥` | "And you should save my brother from that fire [sacrificial fire]. ||15||" |
| `Line 6041: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6042: अमोघं नः कृतं तत्स्याद्यदहं तव धीमते |` | "Let our efforts not be in vain, that I was given to your wise," |
| `Line 6043: पित्रे दत्ता विमोक्षार्थं कथं वा पुत्र मन्यसे ॥१६॥` | "Father for the purpose of liberation. What do you think, my son? ||16||" |
| `Line 6044: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6045: सूत उवाच॥` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 6046: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6047: एवमुक्तस्तथेत्युक्त्वा सोऽस्तीको मातरं तदा |` | "Having been thus addressed, Astika [sage's name] said 'So be it' to his mother then," |
| `Line 6048: अब्रवीद्दुःखसन्तप्तं वासुकिं जीवयन्निव ॥१७॥` | "And spoke to the grief-stricken Vasuki, as if giving him new life. ||17||" |
| `Line 6049: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6050: अहं त्वां मोक्षयिष्यामि वासुके पन्नगोत्तम |` | "I will free you, O Vasuki, best of serpents," |

| `Line 6042: अमोघं नः कृतं तत्स्याद्यदहं तव धीमते |` | "Let our efforts not be in vain, that I was given to your wise," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5901: विषादजननेऽत्यर्थं पन्नगानां महाभये ||२||` | "In causing extreme dejection and great fear among the serpents [snake beings]. ||2||" |
| `Line 5902: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5903: सर्वं विस्तरतस्तात भवाञ्शंसितुमर्हति |` | "O dear one [term of respect], you should narrate everything in detail," |
| `Line 5904: सर्पसत्रविधानज्ञा विज्ञेयास्ते हि सूतज ||३||` | "For you are known to be knowledgeable in the procedures of the serpent sacrifice, O son of Suta [bard lineage]. ||3||" |
| `Line 5905: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5906: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5907: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5908: हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि नामानीह मनीषिणाम् |` | "Well then, I shall tell you the names of the wise men," |
| `Line 5909: ये ऋत्विजः सदस्याश्च तस्यासन्नृपतेस्तदा ||४||` | "Who were the priests [ritual officiants] and assembly members of that king at that time. ||4||" |
| `Line 5910: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5911: तत्र होता बभूवाथ ब्राह्मणश्चण्डभार्गवः |` | "There, the Hota [chief priest] was the Brahmin Chanda Bhargava," |
| `Line 5912: च्यवनस्यान्वये जातः ख्यातो वेदविदां वरः ||५||` | "Born in the lineage of Chyavana, renowned as the best among the knowers of the Vedas. ||5||" |
| `Line 5913: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5914: उद्गाता ब्राह्मणो वृद्धो विद्वान्कौत्सार्यजैमिनिः |` | "The Udgata [chanting priest] was the learned elderly Brahmin Kautsarya Jaimini," |
| `Line 5915: ब्रह्माभवच्छार्ङ्गरवो अध्वर्युर्बोधपिङ्गलः ||६||` | "Sharngrava became the Brahma [supervising priest], and Bodha Pingala was the Adhvaryu [procedural priest]. ||6||" |
| `Line 5916: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5917: सदस्यश्चाभवद्व्यासः पुत्रशिष्यसहायवान् |` | "And Vyasa became a Sadasya [assembly member], accompanied by his sons and disciples," |
| `Line 5918: उद्दालकः शमठकः श्वेतकेतुश्च पञ्चमः ||७||` | "Uddalaka, Shamathaka, and Shvetaketu the fifth. ||7||" |
| `Line 5919: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5920: असितो देवलश्चैव नारदः पर्वतस्तथा |` | "Asita, Devala, and also Narada, Parvata likewise," |
| `Line 5921: आत्रेयः कुण्डजठरो द्विजः कुटिघटस्तथा ||८||` | "Atreya, Kundajathara, the twice-born [Brahmin] Kutighata likewise. ||8||" |
| `Line 5922: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5923: वात्स्यः श्रुतश्रवा वृद्धस्तपःस्वाध्यायशीलवान् |` | "The elderly Vatsya Shrutashrava, devoted to austerities and Vedic study," |
| `Line 5924: कहोडो देवशर्मा च मौद्गल्यः शमसौभरः ||९||` | "Kahoda, Devasharma, and Maudgalya Shamasaubhara. ||9||" |
| `Line 5925: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 5901: विषादजननेऽत्यर्थं पन्नगानां महाभये ||२||` | "In causing extreme dejection and great fear among the serpents [snake beings]. ||2||" |
| `Line 5902: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5903: सर्वं विस्तरतस्तात भवाञ्शंसितुमर्हति |` | "O dear one [term of respect], you should narrate everything in detail," |
| `Line 5904: सर्पसत्रविधानज्ञा विज्ञेयास्ते हि सूतज ||३||` | "For you are known to be knowledgeable in the procedures of the serpent sacrifice, O son of Suta [bard lineage]. ||3||" |
| `Line 5905: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5906: सूत उवाच||` | "Suta [bard/narrator] said:" |
| `Line 5907: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5908: हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि नामानीह मनीषिणाम् |` | "Well then, I shall tell you the names of the wise men," |
| `Line 5909: ये ऋत्विजः सदस्याश्च तस्यासन्नृपतेस्तदा ||४||` | "Who were the priests [ritual officiants] and assembly members of that king at that time. ||4||" |
| `Line 5910: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5911: तत्र होता बभूवाथ ब्राह्मणश्चण्डभार्गवः |` | "There, the Hota [chief priest] was the Brahmin Chanda Bhargava," |
| `Line 5912: च्यवनस्यान्वये जातः ख्यातो वेदविदां वरः ||५||` | "Born in the lineage of Chyavana, renowned as the best among the knowers of the Vedas. ||5||" |
| `Line 5913: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5914: उद्गाता ब्राह्मणो वृद्धो विद्वान्कौत्सार्यजैमिनिः |` | "The Udgata [chanting priest] was the learned elderly Brahmin Kautsarya Jaimini," |
| `Line 5915: ब्रह्माभवच्छार्ङ्गरवो अध्वर्युर्बोधपिङ्गलः ||६||` | "Sharngrava became the Brahma [supervising priest], and Bodha Pingala was the Adhvaryu [procedural priest]. ||6||" |
| `Line 5916: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5917: सदस्यश्चाभवद्व्यासः पुत्रशिष्यसहायवान् |` | "And Vyasa became a Sadasya [assembly member], accompanied by his sons and disciples," |
| `Line 5918: उद्दालकः शमठकः श्वेतकेतुश्च पञ्चमः ||७||` | "Uddalaka, Shamathaka, and Shvetaketu the fifth. ||7||" |
| `Line 5919: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5920: असितो देवलश्चैव नारदः पर्वतस्तथा |` | "Asita, Devala, and also Narada, Parvata likewise," |
| `Line 5921: आत्रेयः कुण्डजठरो द्विजः कुटिघटस्तथा ||८||` | "Atreya, Kundajathara, the twice-born [Brahmin] Kutighata likewise. ||8||" |
| `Line 5922: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5923: वात्स्यः श्रुतश्रवा वृद्धस्तपःस्वाध्यायशीलवान् |` | "The elderly Vatsya Shrutashrava, devoted to austerities and Vedic study," |
| `Line 5924: कहोडो देवशर्मा च मौद्गल्यः शमसौभरः ||९||` | "Kahoda, Devasharma, and Maudgalya Shamasaubhara. ||9||" |
| `Line 5925: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 6051: तस्माच्छापान्महासत्त्व सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ||१८||` | "Therefore, O mighty one [great-souled being], I tell you truly about this curse. ||18||" |
| `Line 6052: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6053: भव स्वस्थमना नाग न हि ते विद्यते भयम् |` | "Be at ease in your mind, O Nāga [serpent lord], for you have nothing to fear." |
| `Line 6054: प्रयतिष्ये तथा सौम्य यथा श्रेयो भविष्यति ||१९||` | "I shall strive, O gentle one, so that good will come of it. ||19||" |
| `Line 6055: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6056: न मे वागनृतं प्राह स्वैरेष्वपि कुतोऽन्यथा ||१९||` | "My words have never spoken falsehood, even in jest, how then otherwise? ||19||" |
| `Line 6057: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6058: तं वै नृपवरं गत्वा दीक्षितं जनमेजयम् |` | "Going to that excellent king, the initiated Janamejaya [snake-sacrifice performer]," |
| `Line 6059: वाग्भिर्मङ्गलयुक्ताभिस्तोषयिष्येऽद्य मातुल ||२०||` | "I shall please him today with auspicious words, O maternal uncle. ||20||" |
| `Line 6060: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6061: यथा स यज्ञो नृपतेर्निर्वर्तिष्यति सत्तम ||२०||` | "So that the sacrifice of the king will be completed, O best of beings. ||20||" |
| `Line 6062: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6063: स सम्भावय नागेन्द्र मयि सर्वं महामते |` | "Therefore, O lord of serpents [Nāga-king], trust everything in me, O great-minded one." |
| `Line 6064: न ते मयि मनो जातु मिथ्या भवितुमर्हति ||२१||` | "Your trust in me should never prove false. ||21||" |
| `Line 6065: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6066: वासुकिरुवाच||` | "Vāsuki said:" |
| `Line 6067: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6068: आस्तीक परिघूर्णामि हृदयं मे विदीर्यते |` | "Āstīka, I am reeling, my heart is breaking," |
| `Line 6069: दिशश्च न प्रजानामि ब्रह्मदण्डनिपीडितः ||२२||` | "I cannot discern the directions, oppressed by Brahmā's punishment [divine curse]. ||22||" |
| `Line 6070: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6071: आस्तीक उवाच||` | "Āstīka said:" |
| `Line 6072: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6073: न सन्तापस्त्वया कार्यः कथञ्चित्पन्नगोत्तम |` | "You should not grieve in any way, O best of serpents [snake-lord]," |
| `Line 6074: दीप्तादग्नेः समुत्पन्नं नाशयिष्यामि ते भयम् ||२३||` | "I shall destroy your fear arising from the blazing fire [sacrificial flames]. ||23||" |
| `Line 6075: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 6051: तस्माच्छापान्महासत्त्व सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ||१८||` | "Therefore, O mighty one [great-souled being], I tell you truly about this curse. ||18||" |
| `Line 6052: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6053: भव स्वस्थमना नाग न हि ते विद्यते भयम् |` | "Be at ease in your mind, O Nāga [serpent lord], for you have nothing to fear." |
| `Line 6054: प्रयतिष्ये तथा सौम्य यथा श्रेयो भविष्यति ||१९||` | "I shall strive, O gentle one, so that good will come of it. ||19||" |
| `Line 6055: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6056: न मे वागनृतं प्राह स्वैरेष्वपि कुतोऽन्यथा ||१९||` | "My words have never spoken falsehood, even in jest, how then otherwise? ||19||" |
| `Line 6057: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6058: तं वै नृपवरं गत्वा दीक्षितं जनमेजयम् |` | "Going to that excellent king, the initiated Janamejaya [snake-sacrifice performer]," |
| `Line 6059: वाग्भिर्मङ्गलयुक्ताभिस्तोषयिष्येऽद्य मातुल ||२०||` | "I shall please him today with auspicious words, O maternal uncle. ||20||" |
| `Line 6060: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6061: यथा स यज्ञो नृपतेर्निर्वर्तिष्यति सत्तम ||२०||` | "So that the sacrifice of the king will be completed, O best of beings. ||20||" |
| `Line 6062: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6063: स सम्भावय नागेन्द्र मयि सर्वं महामते |` | "Therefore, O lord of serpents [Nāga-king], trust everything in me, O great-minded one." |
| `Line 6064: न ते मयि मनो जातु मिथ्या भवितुमर्हति ||२१||` | "Your trust in me should never prove false. ||21||" |
| `Line 6065: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6066: वासुकिरुवाच||` | "Vāsuki said:" |
| `Line 6067: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6068: आस्तीक परिघूर्णामि हृदयं मे विदीर्यते |` | "Āstīka, I am reeling, my heart is breaking," |
| `Line 6069: दिशश्च न प्रजानामि ब्रह्मदण्डनिपीडितः ||२२||` | "I cannot discern the directions, oppressed by Brahmā's punishment [divine curse]. ||22||" |
| `Line 6070: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6071: आस्तीक उवाच||` | "Āstīka said:" |
| `Line 6072: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6073: न सन्तापस्त्वया कार्यः कथञ्चित्पन्नगोत्तम |` | "You should not grieve in any way, O best of serpents [snake-lord]," |
| `Line 6074: दीप्तादग्नेः समुत्पन्नं नाशयिष्यामि ते भयम् ||२३||` | "I shall destroy your fear arising from the blazing fire [sacrificial flames]. ||23||" |
| `Line 6075: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 6076: ब्रह्मदण्डं महाघोरं कालाग्निसमतेजसम् |` | "The terrifying Brahmā's punishment [divine curse], with radiance equal to the fire of cosmic dissolution [world-ending flame]," |
| `Line 6077: नाशयिष्यामि मात्र त्वं भयं कार्षीः कथञ्चन ||२४||` | "I shall destroy it; do not fear in any way whatsoever. ||24||" |
| `Line 6078: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6079: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-narrator] said:" |
| `Line 6080: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6081: ततः स वासुकेर्घोरमपनीय मनोज्वरम् |` | "Then, having removed the terrible mental anguish of Vāsuki [serpent king]," |
| `Line 6082: आधाय चात्मनोऽङ्गेषु जगाम त्वरितो भृशम् ||२५||` | "And taking (the burden) upon his own limbs, he departed in great haste. ||25||" |
| `Line 6083: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6084: जनमेजयस्य तं यज्ञं सर्वैः समुदितं गुणैः |` | "To Janamejaya's sacrifice, complete with all excellent qualities," |
| `Line 6085: मोक्षाय भुजगेन्द्राणामास्तीको द्विजसत्तमः ||२६||` | "For the liberation of the serpent lords [nāga chiefs], went Āstīka, best of the twice-born [brahmin sage]. ||26||" |
| `Line 6086: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6087: स गत्वापश्यदास्तीको यज्ञायतनमुत्तमम् |` | "Going there, Āstīka beheld the excellent sacrificial arena," |
| `Line 6088: वृतं सदस्यैर्बहुभिः सूर्यवह्निसमप्रभैः ||२७||` | "Surrounded by many priests [ritual experts] with radiance equal to the sun and fire. ||27||" |
| `Line 6089: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6090: स तत्र वारितो द्वाःस्थैः प्रविशन्द्विजसत्तमः |` | "There, though stopped by the doorkeepers, the best of the twice-born [brahmin sage] entered," |
| `Line 6091: अभितुष्टाव तं यज्ञं प्रवेशार्थी द्विजोत्तमः ||२८||` | "And began to praise that sacrifice, the excellent brahmin desiring entry. ||28||" |
| `Line 6092: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6093: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6094: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6095: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 6096: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6097: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6098: ५०` | "50 [chapter number]" |
| `Line 6099: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6100: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6101: आस्तीक उवाच||` | "Āstīka said:" |
| `Line 6102: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6103: सोमस्य यज्ञो वरुणस्य यज्ञः; प्रजापतेर्यज्ञ आसीत्प्रयागे |` | "The sacrifice of Soma [moon deity], the sacrifice of Varuṇa [water deity]; the sacrifice of Prajāpati [creation lord] was at Prayāga [sacred confluence]." |
| `Line 6104: तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ||१||` | "So is this sacrifice of yours, O foremost of Bharatas [Kuru dynasty]; O Pārīkṣita [Parikshit's son], may there be well-being for our dear ones. ||1||" |
| `Line 6105: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6106: शक्रस्य यज्ञः शतसङ्ख्य उक्त; स्तथापरस्तुल्यसङ्ख्यः शतं वै |` | "The sacrifices of Śakra [Indra] are said to number a hundred; likewise another hundred of equal number indeed." |
| `Line 6107: तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ||२||` | "So is this sacrifice of yours, O foremost of Bharatas [Kuru dynasty]; O Pārīkṣita [Parikshit's son], may there be well-being for our dear ones. ||2||" |
| `Line 6108: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6109: यमस्य यज्ञो हरिमेधसश्च; यथा यज्ञो रन्तिदेवस्य राज्ञः |` | "The sacrifice of Yama [death deity] and of Harimedhasa [sage]; like the sacrifice of King Rantideva [legendary king]." |
| `Line 6110: तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ||३||` | "So is this sacrifice of yours, O foremost of Bharatas [Kuru dynasty]; O Pārīkṣita [Parikshit's son], may there be well-being for our dear ones. ||3||" |
| `Line 6111: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6112: गयस्य यज्ञः शशबिन्दोश्च राज्ञो; यज्ञस्तथा वैश्रवणस्य राज्ञः |` | "The sacrifice of Gaya [royal sage] and of King Śaśabindu [ancient king]; likewise the sacrifice of King Vaiśravaṇa [Kubera]." |
| `Line 6113: तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ||४||` | "So is this sacrifice of yours, O foremost of Bharatas [Kuru dynasty]; O Pārīkṣita [Parikshit's son], may there be well-being for our dear ones. ||4||" |
| `Line 6114: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6115: नृगस्य यज्ञस्त्वजमीढस्य चासी; द्यथा यज्ञो दाशरथेश्च राज्ञः |` | "The sacrifice of Nṛga [ancient king] and of Ajamīḍha [Kuru ancestor] was; like the sacrifice of King Dāśaratha [Rama's father]." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 6136: शक्रः साक्षाद्वज्रपाणिर्यथेह; त्राता लोकेऽस्मिंस्त्वं तथेह प्रजानाम् |` | "As Śakra [Indra] himself, the wielder of the thunderbolt, is here; so are you the protector of the people in this world." |
| `Line 6137: मतस्त्वं नः पुरुषेन्द्रेह लोके; न च त्वदन्यो गृहपतिरस्ति यज्ञे ||१२||` | "You are regarded by us as the foremost among men in this world; and there is no host of the sacrifice other than you. ||12||" |
| `Line 6138: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6139: खट्वाङ्गनाभागदिलीपकल्पो; ययातिमान्धातृसमप्रभावः |` | "You are equal to Khaṭvāṅga [royal sage], Nābhāga [virtuous king], and Dilīpa [legendary king]; with power comparable to Yayāti [ancient king] and Māndhātṛ [sovereign king]." |
| `Line 6140: आदित्यतेजःप्रतिमानतेजा; भीष्मो यथा भ्राजसि सुव्रतस्त्वम् ||१३||` | "With radiance equal to the splendor of the sun; you shine like Bhīṣma [Kuru elder], steadfast in your vows. ||13||" |
| `Line 6141: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6142: वाल्मीकिवत्ते निभृतं सुधैर्यं; वसिष्ठवत्ते नियतश्च कोपः |` | "Your composure and steadfastness are like Vālmīki's [sage poet]; your anger is controlled like Vasiṣṭha's [royal priest]." |
| `Line 6143: प्रभुत्वमिन्द्रेण समं मतं मे; द्युतिश्च नारायणवद्विभाति ||१४||` | "Your lordship is, I believe, equal to Indra's [king of gods]; and your splendor shines like Nārāyaṇa's [Vishnu]. ||14||" |
| `Line 6144: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6145: यमो यथा धर्मविनिश्चयज्ञः; कृष्णो यथा सर्वगुणोपपन्नः |` | "Like Yama [death deity], you are knowledgeable in determining dharma [righteousness]; like Kṛṣṇa [divine hero], you are endowed with all virtues." |
| `Line 6146: श्रियां निवासोऽसि यथा वसूनां; निधानभूतोऽसि तथा क्रतूनाम् ||१५||` | "You are the abode of wealth like the Vasus [wealth deities]; you are the repository of sacrificial rites. ||15||" |
| `Line 6147: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6148: दम्भोद्भवेनासि समो बलेन; रामो यथा शस्त्रविदस्त्रविच्च |` | "In strength, you are equal to Dambhodbhava [mighty king]; like Rāma [warrior prince], you are skilled in weapons and missiles." |
| `Line 6149: और्वत्रिताभ्यामसि तुल्यतेजा; दुष्प्रेक्षणीयोऽसि भगीरथो वा ||१६||` | "You have radiance equal to Aurva [fire-sage] and Trita [Vedic deity]; you are as magnificent to behold as Bhagīratha [Ganga-bringer]. ||16||" |
| `Line 6150: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6151: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-sage] said:" |
| `Line 6152: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6153: एवं स्तुताः सर्व एव प्रसन्ना; राजा सदस्या ऋत्विजो हव्यवाहः |` | "Thus praised, all became pleased - the king, the assembly members, the priests, and Havyavāha [fire deity]." |
| `Line 6154: तेषां दृष्ट्वा भावितानीङ्गितानि; प्रोवाच राजा जनमेजयोऽथ ||१७||` | "Seeing their pleased expressions, King Janamejaya [snake-sacrifice performer] then spoke. ||17||" |
| `Line 6155: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 6147: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 6148: दम्भोद्भवेनासि समो बलेन; रामो यथा शस्त्रविदस्त्रविच्च |` | "In strength, you are equal to Dambhodbhava [mighty king]; like Rāma [warrior prince], you are skilled in weapons and missiles." |

| `Line 6149: और्वत्रिताभ्यामसि तुल्यतेजा; दुष्प्रेक्षणीयोऽसि भगीरथो वा ||१६||` | "You have radiance equal to Aurva [fire-sage] and Trita [Vedic deity]; you are as magnificent to behold as Bhagīratha [Ganga-bringer]. ||16||" |
| `Line 6150: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6151: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-sage] said:" |
| `Line 6152: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6153: एवं स्तुताः सर्व एव प्रसन्ना; राजा सदस्या ऋत्विजो हव्यवाहः |` | "Thus praised, all became pleased - the king, the assembly members, the priests, and Havyavāha [fire deity]." |
| `Line 6154: तेषां दृष्ट्वा भावितानीङ्गितानि; प्रोवाच राजा जनमेजयोऽथ ||१७||` | "Seeing their pleased expressions, King Janamejaya [snake-sacrifice performer] then spoke. ||17||" |
| `Line 6155: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 6116: तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ||५||` | "Likewise is this sacrifice of yours, O foremost of Bharatas [Kuru dynasty]; O Pārīkṣita [Janamejaya], may there be well-being for our loved ones. ||5||" |
| `Line 6117: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6118: यज्ञः श्रुतो नो दिवि देवसूनो; र्युधिष्ठिरस्याजमीढस्य राज्ञः |` | "We have heard of the sacrifice in heaven of the son of gods [Yudhiṣṭhira], the king of Ajamīḍha's line [Kuru dynasty]," |
| `Line 6119: तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ||६||` | "Likewise is this sacrifice of yours, O foremost of Bharatas [Kuru dynasty]; O Pārīkṣita [Janamejaya], may there be well-being for our loved ones. ||6||" |
| `Line 6120: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6121: कृष्णस्य यज्ञः सत्यवत्याः सुतस्य; स्वयं च कर्म प्रचकार यत्र |` | "The sacrifice of Krishna [Vyāsa], the son of Satyavatī, where he himself performed the rituals," |
| `Line 6122: तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ||७||` | "Likewise is this sacrifice of yours, O foremost of Bharatas [Kuru dynasty]; O Pārīkṣita [Janamejaya], may there be well-being for our loved ones. ||7||" |
| `Line 6123: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6124: इमे हि ते सूर्यहुताशवर्चसः; समासते वृत्रहणः क्रतुं यथा |` | "These priests with radiance like the sun and fire are seated here, as at the sacrifice of Vṛtrahana [Indra, slayer of Vṛtra]," |
| `Line 6125: नैषां ज्ञानं विद्यते ज्ञातुमद्य; दत्तं येभ्यो न प्रणश्येत्कथञ्चित् ||८||` | "Their knowledge cannot be fully comprehended today; what is given to them would never perish in any way. ||8||" |
| `Line 6126: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6127: ऋत्विक्समो नास्ति लोकेषु चैव; द्वैपायनेनेति विनिश्चितं मे |` | "There is none in the worlds equal to the priest [ritual officiant] Dvaipāyana [Vyāsa]; this is my firm conviction," |
| `Line 6128: एतस्य शिष्या हि क्षितिं चरन्ति; सर्वर्त्विजः कर्मसु स्वेषु दक्षाः ||९||` | "His disciples indeed walk the earth; all priests [ritual officiants] are skilled in their respective duties. ||9||" |
| `Line 6129: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6130: विभावसुश्चित्रभानुर्महात्मा; हिरण्यरेता विश्वभुक्कृष्णवर्त्मा |` | "Vibhāvasu [fire deity], the brilliantly radiant great soul, Hiraṇyaretā [golden-seed fire], the all-consuming one with the dark path," |
| `Line 6131: प्रदक्षिणावर्तशिखः प्रदीप्तो; हव्यं तवेदं हुतभुग्वष्टि देवः ||१०||` | "With flames spiraling clockwise, blazing brightly; this god Hutabhug [fire deity] desires your oblation. ||10||" |
| `Line 6132: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6133: नेह त्वदन्यो विद्यते जीवलोके; समो नृपः पालयिता प्रजानाम् |` | "There exists no king in this world of the living equal to you as a protector of subjects," |
| `Line 6134: धृत्या च ते प्रीतमनाः सदाहं; त्वं वा राजा धर्मराजो यमो वा ||११||` | "I am always pleased with your steadfastness; you are either a king, Dharmarāja [Yudhiṣṭhira], or Yama [death god] himself. ||11||" |
| `Line 6135: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 6116: तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ||५||` | "Likewise is this sacrifice of yours, O foremost of Bharatas [Kuru dynasty]; O Pārīkṣita [Janamejaya], may there be well-being for our loved ones. ||5||" |

| `Line 6156: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6157: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6158: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6159: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6160: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6161: ५१` | "51 [chapter number]" |
| `Line 6162: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6163: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6164: जनमेजय उवाच||` | "Janamejaya [snake-sacrifice king] said:" |
| `Line 6165: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6166: बालो वाक्यं स्थविर इव प्रभाषते; नायं बालः स्थविरोऽयं मतो मे |` | "This youth speaks words like an elder; I do not consider him a child but an elder." |
| `Line 6167: इच्छाम्यहं वरमस्मै प्रदातुं; तन्मे विप्रा वितरध्वं समेताः ||१||` | "I wish to grant him a boon; O assembled Brahmins [priests], allow me to bestow it. ||1||" |
| `Line 6168: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6169: सदस्या ऊचुः||` | "The assembly members said:" |
| `Line 6170: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6171: बालोऽपि विप्रो मान्य एवेह राज्ञां; यश्चाविद्वान्यश्च विद्वान्यथावत् |` | "Even a young Brahmin [priest] is worthy of respect from kings; whether he is unlearned or learned as he should be." |
| `Line 6172: सर्वान्कामांस्त्वत्त एषोऽर्हतेऽद्य; यथा च नस्तक्षक एति शीघ्रम् ||२||` | "He deserves all desires from you today; and may Takshaka [serpent king] come to us quickly. ||2||" |
| `Line 6173: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6174: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-sage] said:" |
| `Line 6175: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 6156: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6157: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6158: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 6161: ५१` | "51 [chapter number]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 6176: व्याहर्तुकामे वरदे नृपे द्विजं; वरं वृणीष्वेति ततोऽभ्युवाच |` | "As the king, the bestower of boons, was about to speak to the Brahmin, saying 'Choose a boon,' then..." |
| `Line 6177: होता वाक्यं नातिहृष्टान्तरात्मा; कर्मण्यस्मिंस्तक्षको नैति तावत् ||३||` | "The hotā [chief priest] spoke these words, with a not-too-pleased heart: 'In this sacrifice, Takṣaka [serpent king] has not yet come.' ||3||" |
| `Line 6178: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6179: जनमेजय उवाच||` | "Janamejaya [snake-sacrifice performer] said:" |
| `Line 6180: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6181: यथा चेदं कर्म समाप्यते मे; यथा च नस्तक्षक एति शीघ्रम् |` | "So that this sacrifice of mine may be completed; and so that Takṣaka may come to us quickly," |
| `Line 6182: तथा भवन्तः प्रयतन्तु सर्वे; परं शक्त्या स हि मे विद्विषाणः ||४||` | "Let all of you strive with your utmost power; for he is my bitter enemy. ||4||" |
| `Line 6183: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6184: ऋत्विज ऊचुः||` | "The priests said:" |
| `Line 6185: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6186: यथा शास्त्राणि नः प्राहुर्यथा शंसति पावकः |` | "According to what the scriptures tell us, and as the fire [Agni] proclaims," |
| `Line 6187: इन्द्रस्य भवने राजंस्तक्षको भयपीडितः ||५||` | "Takṣaka, stricken with fear, is in Indra's [king of gods] abode, O king. ||5||" |
| `Line 6188: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6189: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-sage] said:" |
| `Line 6190: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6191: यथा सूतो लोहिताक्षो महात्मा; पौराणिको वेदितवान्पुरस्तात् |` | "As the noble red-eyed Sūta [royal chronicler], the knower of ancient lore, had known beforehand," |
| `Line 6192: स राजानं प्राह पृष्टस्तदानीं; यथाहुर्विप्रास्तद्वदेतन्नृदेव ||६||` | "He, when asked, then told the king: 'What the Brahmins say is true, O lord of men. ||6||'" |
| `Line 6193: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6194: पुराणमागम्य ततो ब्रवीम्यहं; दत्तं तस्मै वरमिन्द्रेण राजन् |` | "Based on the Purāṇas [ancient texts], I tell you this: Indra has given him a boon, O king," |
| `Line 6195: वसेह त्वं मत्सकाशे सुगुप्तो; न पावकस्त्वां प्रदहिष्यतीति ||७||` | "'Stay here with me, well-protected; the fire shall not burn you.' ||7||" |
translations: | `Line 6176: व्याहर्तुकामे वरदे नृपे द्विजं; वरं वृणीष्वेति ततोऽभ्युवाच |` | "As the king, the bestower of boons, was about to speak to the Brahmin, saying 'Choose a boon,' then..." |

| `Line 6177: होता वाक्यं नातिहृष्टान्तरात्मा; कर्मण्यस्मिंस्तक्षको नैति तावत् ||३||` | "The hotā [chief priest] spoke these words, with a not-too-pleased heart: 'In this sacrifice, Takṣaka [serpent king] has not yet come.' ||3||" |

| `Line 6182: तथा भवन्तः प्रयतन्तु सर्वे; परं शक्त्या स हि मे विद्विषाणः ||४||` | "Let all of you strive with your utmost power; for he is my bitter enemy. ||4||" |

| `Line 6196: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6197: एतच्छ्रुत्वा दीक्षितस्तप्यमान; आस्ते होतारं चोदयन्कर्मकाले |` | "Hearing this, the consecrated one [king], burning with anticipation, sat urging the hotā [chief priest] at the time of ritual." |
| `Line 6198: होता च यत्तः स जुहाव मन्त्रै; रथो इन्द्रः स्वयमेवाजगाम ||८||` | "And the attentive hotā [chief priest] made offerings with mantras; then Indra [king of gods] himself came in his chariot. ||8||" |
| `Line 6199: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6200: विमानमारुह्य महानुभावः; सर्वैर्देवैः परिसंस्तूयमानः |` | "The mighty one [Indra], mounted on his celestial vehicle, being praised by all the gods," |
| `Line 6201: बलाहकैश्चाप्यनुगम्यमानो; विद्याधरैरप्सरसां गणैश्च ||९||` | "And followed by clouds, Vidyādharas [knowledge-bearers], and groups of Apsarās [celestial nymphs]. ||9||" |
| `Line 6202: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6203: तस्योत्तरीये निहितः स नागो; भयोद्विग्नः शर्म नैवाभ्यगच्छत् |` | "That serpent [Takshaka], hidden in his [Indra's] upper garment, terrified with fear, found no peace." |
| `Line 6204: ततो राजा मन्त्रविदोऽब्रवीत्पुनः; क्रुद्धो वाक्यं तक्षकस्यान्तमिच्छन् ||१०||` | "Then the king, desiring Takshaka's end, spoke again angrily to the mantra-knowers [priests]. ||10||" |
| `Line 6205: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6206: इन्द्रस्य भवने विप्रा यदि नागः स तक्षकः |` | "O Brahmins [priests], if that serpent Takshaka is in Indra's abode," |
| `Line 6207: तमिन्द्रेणैव सहितं पातयध्वं विभावसौ ||११||` | "Make him fall into the fire [sacrificial flame] together with Indra himself. ||11||" |
| `Line 6208: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6209: ऋत्विज ऊचुः||` | "The priests said:" |
| `Line 6210: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6211: अयमायाति वै तूर्णं तक्षकस्ते वशं नृप |` | "O king, Takshaka is quickly coming under your control." |
| `Line 6212: श्रूयतेऽस्य महान्नादो रुवतो भैरवं भयात् ||१२||` | "His loud, terrifying cry can be heard as he roars from fear. ||12||" |
| `Line 6213: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6214: नूनं मुक्तो वज्रभृता स नागो; भ्रष्टश्चाङ्कान्मन्त्रविस्रस्तकायः |` | "Surely that serpent has been released by the thunderbolt-bearer [Indra], falling from his lap, his body loosened by the mantras." |
| `Line 6215: घूर्णन्नाकाशे नष्टसञ्ज्ञोऽभ्युपैति; तीव्रान्निःश्वासान्निःश्वसन्पन्नगेन्द्रः ||१३||` | "The lord of serpents approaches, whirling in the sky, unconscious, breathing heavy breaths. ||13||" |
translations: | `Line 6196: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 6197: एतच्छ्रुत्वा दीक्षितस्तप्यमान; आस्ते होतारं चोदयन्कर्मकाले |` | "Hearing this, the consecrated one [king], burning with anticipation, sat urging the hotā [chief priest] at the time of ritual." |

| `Line 6198: होता च यत्तः स जुहाव मन्त्रै; रथो इन्द्रः स्वयमेवाजगाम ||८||` | "And the attentive hotā [chief priest] made offerings with mantras; then Indra [king of gods] himself came in his chariot. ||8||" |
| `Line 6199: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6200: विमानमारुह्य महानुभावः; सर्वैर्देवैः परिसंस्तूयमानः |` | "The mighty one [Indra], mounted on his celestial vehicle, being praised by all the gods," |
| `Line 6201: बलाहकैश्चाप्यनुगम्यमानो; विद्याधरैरप्सरसां गणैश्च ||९||` | "And followed by clouds, Vidyādharas [knowledge-bearers], and groups of Apsarās [celestial nymphs]. ||9||" |
| `Line 6202: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6203: तस्योत्तरीये निहितः स नागो; भयोद्विग्नः शर्म नैवाभ्यगच्छत् |` | "That serpent [Takshaka], hidden in his [Indra's] upper garment, terrified with fear, found no peace." |
| `Line 6204: ततो राजा मन्त्रविदोऽब्रवीत्पुनः; क्रुद्धो वाक्यं तक्षकस्यान्तमिच्छन् ||१०||` | "Then the king, desiring Takshaka's end, spoke again angrily to the mantra-knowers [priests]. ||10||" |
| `Line 6205: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6206: इन्द्रस्य भवने विप्रा यदि नागः स तक्षकः |` | "O Brahmins [priests], if that serpent Takshaka is in Indra's abode," |
| `Line 6207: तमिन्द्रेणैव सहितं पातयध्वं विभावसौ ||११||` | "Make him fall into the fire [sacrificial flame] together with Indra himself. ||11||" |
| `Line 6208: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6209: ऋत्विज ऊचुः||` | "The priests said:" |
| `Line 6210: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6211: अयमायाति वै तूर्णं तक्षकस्ते वशं नृप |` | "O king, Takshaka is quickly coming under your control." |
| `Line 6212: श्रूयतेऽस्य महान्नादो रुवतो भैरवं भयात् ||१२||` | "His loud, terrifying cry can be heard as he roars from fear. ||12||" |
| `Line 6213: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 6214: नूनं मुक्तो वज्रभृता स नागो; भ्रष्टश्चाङ्कान्मन्त्रविस्रस्तकायः |` | "Surely that serpent has been released by the thunderbolt-bearer [Indra], falling from his lap, his body loosened by the mantras." |

| `Line 6215: घूर्णन्नाकाशे नष्टसञ्ज्ञोऽभ्युपैति; तीव्रान्निःश्वासान्निःश्वसन्पन्नगेन्द्रः ||१३||` | "The lord of serpents approaches, whirling in the sky, unconscious, breathing heavy breaths. ||13||" |
