| `Line 6216: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6217: वर्तते तव राजेन्द्र कर्मैतद्विधिवत्प्रभो |` | "This sacrifice of yours, O Rājendra [king of kings], is proceeding according to the proper rituals, O lord." |
| `Line 6218: अस्मै तु द्विजमुख्याय वरं त्वं दातुमर्हसि ||१४||` | "But to this foremost of Brahmins [dvija-mukhya], you should grant a boon. ||14||" |
| `Line 6219: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6220: जनमेजय उवाच||` | "Janamejaya [snake-sacrifice performer] said:" |
| `Line 6221: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6222: बालाभिरूपस्य तवाप्रमेय; वरं प्रयच्छामि यथानुरूपम् |` | "To you, who are young and handsome, O immeasurable one, I shall grant a suitable boon." |
| `Line 6223: वृणीष्व यत्तेऽभिमतं हृदि स्थितं; तत्ते प्रदास्याम्यपि चेददेयम् ||१५||` | "Choose whatever you desire, that which is in your heart; I shall grant it to you, even if it is something that should not be given. ||15||" |
| `Line 6224: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6225: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-sage] said:" |
| `Line 6226: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6227: पतिष्यमाणे नागेन्द्रे तक्षके जातवेदसि |` | "As Takṣaka, the lord of serpents [nāgendra], was about to fall into the fire [jātavedas]," |
| `Line 6228: इदमन्तरमित्येवं तदास्तीकोऽभ्यचोदयत् ||१६||` | "Thinking 'This is the opportunity,' Āstīka then urged (the king). ||16||" |
| `Line 6229: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6230: वरं ददासि चेन्मह्यं वृणोमि जनमेजय |` | "If you grant me a boon, I choose this, O Janamejaya:" |
| `Line 6231: सत्रं ते विरमत्वेतन्न पतेयुरिहोरगाः ||१७||` | "Let this sacrifice of yours cease; let no more serpents [uragas] fall into it. ||17||" |
| `Line 6232: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6233: एवमुक्तस्ततो राजा ब्रह्मन्पारिक्षितस्तदा |` | "Having been thus addressed, King Pārikṣita [Janamejaya], O Brahmin," |
| `Line 6234: नातिहृष्टमना वाक्यमास्तीकमिदमब्रवीत् ||१८||` | "With a not-too-pleased mind, spoke these words to Āstīka. ||18||" |
| `Line 6235: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 6216: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6217: वर्तते तव राजेन्द्र कर्मैतद्विधिवत्प्रभो |` | "This sacrifice of yours, O Rājendra [king of kings], is proceeding according to the proper rituals, O lord." |
| `Line 6218: अस्मै तु द्विजमुख्याय वरं त्वं दातुमर्हसि ||१४||` | "But to this foremost of Brahmins [dvija-mukhya], you should grant a boon. ||14||" |
| `Line 6219: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6220: जनमेजय उवाच||` | "Janamejaya [snake-sacrifice performer] said:" |
| `Line 6221: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6222: बालाभिरूपस्य तवाप्रमेय; वरं प्रयच्छामि यथानुरूपम् |` | "To you, who are young and handsome, O immeasurable one, I shall grant a suitable boon." |

| `Line 6223: वृणीष्व यत्तेऽभिमतं हृदि स्थितं; तत्ते प्रदास्याम्यपि चेददेयम् ||१५||` | "Choose whatever you desire, that which is in your heart; I shall grant it to you, even if it is something that should not be given. ||15||" |
| `Line 6224: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6225: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-sage] said:" |
| `Line 6226: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6227: पतिष्यमाणे नागेन्द्रे तक्षके जातवेदसि |` | "As Takṣaka, the lord of serpents [nāgendra], was about to fall into the fire [jātavedas]," |
| `Line 6228: इदमन्तरमित्येवं तदास्तीकोऽभ्यचोदयत् ||१६||` | "Thinking 'This is the opportunity,' Āstīka then urged (the king). ||16||" |
| `Line 6229: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6230: वरं ददासि चेन्मह्यं वृणोमि जनमेजय |` | "If you grant me a boon, I choose this, O Janamejaya:" |
| `Line 6231: सत्रं ते विरमत्वेतन्न पतेयुरिहोरगाः ||१७||` | "Let this sacrifice of yours cease; let no more serpents [uragas] fall into it. ||17||" |
| `Line 6232: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6233: एवमुक्तस्ततो राजा ब्रह्मन्पारिक्षितस्तदा |` | "Having been thus addressed, King Pārikṣita [Janamejaya], O Brahmin," |
| `Line 6234: नातिहृष्टमना वाक्यमास्तीकमिदमब्रवीत् ||१८||` | "With a not-too-pleased mind, spoke these words to Āstīka. ||18||" |
| `Line 6235: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 6236: सुवर्णं रजतं गाश्च यच्चान्यन्मन्यसे विभो |` | "Gold, silver, cows, and whatever else you desire, O mighty one [brahmin]," |
| `Line 6237: तत्ते दद्यां वरं विप्र न निवर्तेत्क्रतुर्मम ||१९||` | "I shall give you that boon, O brahmin, but my sacrifice should not cease. ||19||" |
| `Line 6238: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6239: आस्तीक उवाच||` | "Āstīka said:" |
| `Line 6240: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6241: सुवर्णं रजतं गाश्च न त्वां राजन्वृणोम्यहम् |` | "Gold, silver, and cows I do not choose from you, O king," |
| `Line 6242: सत्रं ते विरमत्वेतत्स्वस्ति मातृकुलस्य नः ||२०||` | "Let this sacrifice of yours cease, for the welfare of our maternal lineage [snake clan]. ||20||" |
| `Line 6243: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6244: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta said:" |
| `Line 6245: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6246: आस्तीकेनैवमुक्तस्तु राजा पारिक्षितस्तदा |` | "When thus addressed by Āstīka, King Parikshit [Janamejaya's father] then," |
| `Line 6247: पुनः पुनरुवाचेदमास्तीकं वदतां वरम् ||२१||` | "Again and again said this to Āstīka, the best among speakers: ||21||" |
| `Line 6248: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6249: अन्यं वरय भद्रं ते वरं द्विजवरोत्तम |` | "Choose another boon, good fortune to you, O best of the excellent twice-born [brahmin]," |
| `Line 6250: अयाचत न चाप्यन्यं वरं स भृगुनन्दन ||२२||` | "But he, O descendant of Bhrigu [Shaunaka], did not ask for any other boon. ||22||" |
| `Line 6251: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6252: ततो वेदविदस्तत्र सदस्याः सर्व एव तम् |` | "Then all the Veda-knowers [priests] there, the assembly members," |
| `Line 6253: राजानमूचुः सहिता लभतां ब्राह्मणो वरम् ||२३||` | "Together said to the king: 'Let the brahmin obtain his boon.' ||23||" |
| `Line 6254: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6255: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 6236: सुवर्णं रजतं गाश्च यच्चान्यन्मन्यसे विभो |` | "Gold, silver, cows, and whatever else you desire, O mighty one [brahmin]," |
| `Line 6237: तत्ते दद्यां वरं विप्र न निवर्तेत्क्रतुर्मम ||१९||` | "I shall give you that boon, O brahmin, but my sacrifice should not cease. ||19||" |
| `Line 6238: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6239: आस्तीक उवाच||` | "Āstīka said:" |
| `Line 6240: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6241: सुवर्णं रजतं गाश्च न त्वां राजन्वृणोम्यहम् |` | "Gold, silver, and cows I do not choose from you, O king," |
| `Line 6242: सत्रं ते विरमत्वेतत्स्वस्ति मातृकुलस्य नः ||२०||` | "Let this sacrifice of yours cease, for the welfare of our maternal lineage [snake clan]. ||20||" |
| `Line 6243: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6244: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta said:" |
| `Line 6245: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6246: आस्तीकेनैवमुक्तस्तु राजा पारिक्षितस्तदा |` | "When thus addressed by Āstīka, King Parikshit [Janamejaya's father] then," |
| `Line 6247: पुनः पुनरुवाचेदमास्तीकं वदतां वरम् ||२१||` | "Again and again said this to Āstīka, the best among speakers: ||21||" |
| `Line 6248: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6249: अन्यं वरय भद्रं ते वरं द्विजवरोत्तम |` | "Choose another boon, good fortune to you, O best of the excellent twice-born [brahmin]," |
| `Line 6250: अयाचत न चाप्यन्यं वरं स भृगुनन्दन ||२२||` | "But he, O descendant of Bhrigu [Shaunaka], did not ask for any other boon. ||22||" |
| `Line 6251: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6252: ततो वेदविदस्तत्र सदस्याः सर्व एव तम् |` | "Then all the Veda-knowers [priests] there, the assembly members," |
| `Line 6253: राजानमूचुः सहिता लभतां ब्राह्मणो वरम् ||२३||` | "Together said to the king: 'Let the brahmin obtain his boon.' ||23||" |

| `Line 6260: ५२` | "52 [chapter number]" |
| `Line 6261: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6262: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6263: शौनक उवाच||` | "Śaunaka [sage-questioner] said:" |
| `Line 6264: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6265: ये सर्पाः सर्पसत्रेऽस्मिन्पतिता हव्यवाहने |` | "Those serpents [sarpas] who fell into the fire [havyavāhana] during this serpent sacrifice," |
| `Line 6266: तेषां नामानि सर्वेषां श्रोतुमिच्छामि सूतज ||१||` | "I wish to hear the names of all of them, O son of Sūta [sūtaja]. ||1||" |
| `Line 6267: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6268: सूत उवाच||` | "Sūta [bard-sage] said:" |
| `Line 6269: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6270: सहस्राणि बहून्यस्मिन्प्रयुतान्यर्बुदानि च |` | "Many thousands, tens of millions [prayuta], and hundreds of millions [arbuda] (of serpents)" |
| `Line 6271: न शक्यं परिसङ्ख्यातुं बहुत्वाद्वेदवित्तम ||२||` | "Cannot be counted due to their great number, O best knower of Vedas [vedavittama]. ||2||" |
| `Line 6272: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 6273: यथास्मृति तु नामानि पन्नगानां निबोध मे |` | "But listen to me as I recall the names of the serpents [pannagas]," |
| `Line 6274: उच्यमानानि मुख्यानां हुतानां जातवेदसि ||३||` | "As I recite (the names) of the chief ones who were offered into the fire [jātavedas]. ||3||" |
| `Line 6275: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 5601: एवं सञ्चोदिता राज्ञा मन्त्रिणस्ते नराधिपम् |` | "Thus urged by the king, those ministers addressed the ruler," |
| `Line 5602: ऊचुः सर्वे यथावृत्तं राज्ञः प्रियहिते रताः ||१९||` | "All of them narrated the events as they occurred, devoted to the welfare and good of the king. ||19||" |
| `Line 5603: ` | [Blank line] |
| `Line 5604: बभूव मृगयाशीलस्तव राजन्पिता सदा |` | "Your father, O king, was always fond of hunting," |
| `Line 5605: यथा पाण्डुर्महाभागो धनुर्धरवरो युधि ||२०||` | "Just like the illustrious Pandu [Pandava father], the foremost archer in battle. ||20||" |
| `Line 5606: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 5608: ` | [Blank line] |

| `Line 5621: ततो राजा क्षुच्छ्रमार्तस्तं मुनिं स्थाणुवत्स्थितम् |` | "Then the king, afflicted by hunger and fatigue, seeing that sage standing still like a post [sthāṇu]," |

| `Line 5776: यदि गच्छेदसौ पापो ननु जीवेत्पिता मम ||३७||` | "If that sinful one [Takshaka] had gone away, would not my father still be alive? ||37||" |
| `Line 5777: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5778: परिहीयेत किं तस्य यदि जीवेत्स पार्थिवः |` | "What would have been lost to him if that king [Parikshit] had lived," |
| `Line 5779: काश्यपस्य प्रसादेन मन्त्रिणां सुनयेन च ||३८||` | "By the grace of Kashyapa [snake-charming sage] and through the good policy of the ministers? ||38||" |
| `Line 5780: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5781: स तु वारितवान्मोहात्काश्यपं द्विजसत्तमम् |` | "But he [Takshaka], out of delusion, stopped Kashyapa, the best of the twice-born [Brahmin]," |
| `Line 5782: सञ्जिजीवयिषुं प्राप्तं राजानमपराजितम् ||३९||` | "Who had arrived to revive the unconquered king. ||39||" |
| `Line 5783: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5784: महानतिक्रमो ह्येष तक्षकस्य दुरात्मनः |` | "This is indeed a great transgression of the wicked Takshaka," |
| `Line 5785: द्विजस्य योऽददद्द्रव्यं मा नृपं जीवयेदिति ||४०||` | "Who gave wealth to the twice-born [Kashyapa] so that he would not revive the king. ||40||" |

| `Line 5926: एते चान्ये च बहवो ब्राह्मणाः संशितव्रताः |` | "These and many other Brahmins of strict vows [disciplined practitioners]," |
| `Line 5927: सदस्या अभवंस्तत्र सत्रे पारिक्षितस्य ह ||१०||` | "Became assembly members there at the sacrificial session of Parikshita [Janamejaya's father], indeed. ||10||" |
| `Line 5928: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5929: जुह्वत्स्वृत्विक्ष्वथ तदा सर्पसत्रे महाक्रतौ |` | "When the priests were making offerings in that great snake sacrifice [sarpa-satra]," |
| `Line 5930: अहयः प्रापतंस्तत्र घोराः प्राणिभयावहाः ||११||` | "Terrible snakes fell there, causing fear to living beings. ||11||" |
| `Line 5931: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5932: वसामेदोवहाः कुल्या नागानां सम्प्रवर्तिताः |` | "Streams carrying fat and marrow of the serpents [nagas] flowed forth," |
| `Line 5933: ववौ गन्धश्च तुमुलो दह्यतामनिशं तदा ||१२||` | "And a tumultuous smell wafted from those being continuously burned then. ||12||" |
| `Line 5934: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5935: पततां चैव नागानां धिष्ठितानां तथाम्बरे |` | "Of the falling serpents and those stationed likewise in the sky," |

| `Line 5937: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 5947: प्रसादितो मया पूर्वं तवार्थाय पितामहः |` | "Pitamaha [Brahma, grandfather] has been propitiated by me earlier for your sake." |
| `Line 5948: तस्मात्तव भयं नास्ति व्येतु ते मानसो ज्वरः ||१७||` | "Therefore, you have no fear; let your mental fever [anxiety] depart. ||17||" |

| `Line 5954: अल्पशेषपरीवारो वासुकिः पर्यतप्यत ||१९||` | "Vasuki [naga king], with few attendants remaining, suffered greatly. ||19||" |
| `Line 5955: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 5946: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5947: प्रसादितो मया पूर्वं तवार्थाय पितामहः |` | "Pitamaha [Brahma, grandfather] has been propitiated by me earlier for your sake." |
| `Line 5948: तस्मात्तव भयं नास्ति व्येतु ते मानसो ज्वरः ||१७||` | "Therefore, you have no fear; let your mental fever [anxiety] depart. ||17||" |
| `Line 5949: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5950: एवमाश्वासितस्तेन ततः स भुजगोत्तमः |` | "Thus reassured by him, then that foremost of serpents [naga lord]," |
| `Line 5951: उवास भवने तत्र शक्रस्य मुदितः सुखी ||१८||` | "Dwelt there in the abode of Shakra [Indra], happy and content. ||18||" |
| `Line 5952: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5953: अजस्रं निपतत्स्वग्नौ नागेषु भृशदुःखितः |` | "As the serpents [nagas] fell incessantly into the fire, deeply distressed," |
| `Line 5954: अल्पशेषपरीवारो वासुकिः पर्यतप्यत ||१९||` | "Vasuki [naga king], with few attendants remaining, suffered greatly. ||19||" |
| `Line 5955: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5956: कश्मलं चाविशद्घोरं वासुकिं पन्नगेश्वरम् |` | "And a terrible swoon [unconsciousness] overtook Vasuki, the lord of serpents [naga king]." |
| `Line 5957: स घूर्णमानहृदयो भगिनीमिदमब्रवीत् ||२०||` | "He, with his heart reeling [dizzy], said this to his sister. ||20||" |
| `Line 5958: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5959: दह्यन्तेऽङ्गानि मे भद्रे दिशो न प्रतिभान्ति च |` | "My limbs are burning, O auspicious one [sister], and the directions do not appear clear to me." |
| `Line 5960: सीदामीव च संमोहाद्घूर्णतीव च मे मनः ||२१||` | "I seem to be sinking from confusion, and my mind seems to be whirling. ||21||" |
| `Line 5961: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5962: दृष्टिर्भ्रमति मेऽतीव हृदयं दीर्यतीव च |` | "My vision wanders excessively, and my heart seems to be breaking." |
| `Line 5963: पतिष्याम्यवशोऽद्याहं तस्मिन्दीप्ते विभावसौ ||२२||` | "Helpless, today I shall fall into that blazing fire [Agni]. ||22||" |
| `Line 5964: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5965: पारिक्षितस्य यज्ञोऽसौ वर्ततेऽस्मज्जिघांसया |` | "That sacrifice of Parikshita's son [Janamejaya] proceeds with the desire to kill us." |
translations: | `Line 5956: कश्मलं चाविशद्घोरं वासुकिं पन्नगेश्वरम् |` | "And a terrible swoon [unconsciousness] overtook Vasuki, the lord of serpents [naga king]." |
| `Line 5957: स घूर्णमानहृदयो भगिनीमिदमब्रवीत् ||२०||` | "He, with his heart reeling [dizzy], said this to his sister. ||20||" |
| `Line 5958: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5959: दह्यन्तेऽङ्गानि मे भद्रे दिशो न प्रतिभान्ति च |` | "My limbs are burning, O auspicious one [sister], and the directions do not appear clear to me." |
| `Line 5960: सीदामीव च संमोहाद्घूर्णतीव च मे मनः ||२१||` | "I seem to be sinking from confusion, and my mind seems to be whirling. ||21||" |
| `Line 5961: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5962: दृष्टिर्भ्रमति मेऽतीव हृदयं दीर्यतीव च |` | "My vision wanders excessively, and my heart seems to be breaking." |
| `Line 5963: पतिष्याम्यवशोऽद्याहं तस्मिन्दीप्ते विभावसौ ||२२||` | "Helpless, today I shall fall into that blazing fire [Agni]. ||22||" |
| `Line 5964: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5965: पारिक्षितस्य यज्ञोऽसौ वर्ततेऽस्मज्जिघांसया |` | "That sacrifice of Parikshita's son [Janamejaya] proceeds with the desire to kill us." |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 5966: व्यक्तं मयापि गन्तव्यं पितृराजनिवेशनम् ||२३||` | "Surely I too must go to the abode of the king of ancestors [Yama's realm]. ||23||" |
| `Line 5967: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5968: अयं स कालः सम्प्राप्तो यदर्थमसि मे स्वसः |` | "This is that time which has arrived, for which purpose you are my sister," |
| `Line 5969: जरत्कारोः पुरा दत्ता सा त्राह्यस्मान्सबान्धवान् ||२४||` | "Given earlier to Jaratkaru. May she save us along with our relatives. ||24||" |
| `Line 5970: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5971: आस्तीकः किल यज्ञं तं वर्तन्तं भुजगोत्तमे |` | "Astika [sage son] will indeed stop that sacrifice proceeding against the best of serpents [nagas]," |
| `Line 5972: प्रतिषेत्स्यति मां पूर्वं स्वयमाह पितामहः ||२५||` | "Pitamaha [Brahma] himself told me earlier. ||25||" |
| `Line 5973: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5974: तद्वत्से ब्रूहि वत्सं स्वं कुमारं वृद्धसंमतम् |` | "Therefore, dear one [daughter], tell your son, the youth respected by the elders," |
| `Line 5975: ममाद्य त्वं सभृत्यस्य मोक्षार्थं वेदवित्तमम् ||२६||` | "For the liberation of me and my servants today, O most knowledgeable in the Vedas. ||26||" |
translations: | `Line 5966: व्यक्तं मयापि गन्तव्यं पितृराजनिवेशनम् ||२३||` | "Surely I too must go to the abode of the king of ancestors [Yama's realm]. ||23||" |
| `Line 5967: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5968: अयं स कालः सम्प्राप्तो यदर्थमसि मे स्वसः |` | "This is that time which has arrived, for which purpose you are my sister," |
| `Line 5969: जरत्कारोः पुरा दत्ता सा त्राह्यस्मान्सबान्धवान् ||२४||` | "Given earlier to Jaratkaru. May she save us along with our relatives. ||24||" |
| `Line 5970: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5971: आस्तीकः किल यज्ञं तं वर्तन्तं भुजगोत्तमे |` | "Astika [sage son] will indeed stop that sacrifice proceeding against the best of serpents [nagas]," |
| `Line 5972: प्रतिषेत्स्यति मां पूर्वं स्वयमाह पितामहः ||२५||` | "Pitamaha [Brahma] himself told me earlier. ||25||" |
| `Line 5973: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 5974: तद्वत्से ब्रूहि वत्सं स्वं कुमारं वृद्धसंमतम् |` | "Therefore, dear one [daughter], tell your son, the youth respected by the elders," |
| `Line 5975: ममाद्य त्वं सभृत्यस्य मोक्षार्थं वेदवित्तमम् ||२६||` | "For the liberation of me and my servants today, O most knowledgeable in the Vedas. ||26||" |

| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 7596: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7597: धरो ध्रुवश्च सोमश्च अहश्चैवानिलोऽनलः |` | "Dhara [earth-bearer], Dhruva [steadfast one], Soma [moon deity], Aha [day], and also Anila [wind] and Anala [fire]," |
| `Line 7598: प्रत्यूषश्च प्रभासश्च वसवोऽष्टाविति स्मृताः ||१७||` | "Pratyūṣa [dawn] and Prabhāsa [radiance] - these are remembered as the eight Vasus [divine beings]. ||17||" |
| `Line 7599: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7600: धूम्रायाश्च धरः पुत्रो ब्रह्मविद्यो ध्रुवस्तथा |` | "Dhara is the son of Dhūmrā [smoke-colored], and similarly Dhruva is (the son) of Brahmavidyā [Vedic knowledge]," |
| `Line 7601: चन्द्रमास्तु मनस्विन्याः श्वसायाः श्वसनस्तथा ||१८||` | "Chandramās [moon] is (the son) of Manasvinī [thoughtful one], and similarly Śvasana [breath] is (the son) of Śvasā. ||18||" |
| `Line 7602: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7603: रतायाश्चाप्यहः पुत्रः शाण्डिल्याश्च हुताशनः |` | "Aha [day] is the son of Ratā [beloved], and Hutāśana [fire-consumer] is (the son) of Śāṇḍilyā," |
| `Line 7604: प्रत्यूषश्च प्रभासश्च प्रभातायाः सुतौ स्मृतौ ||१९||` | "Pratyūṣa and Prabhāsa are remembered as the two sons of Prabhātā [dawn]. ||19||" |
| `Line 7605: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 7596: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7597: धरो ध्रुवश्च सोमश्च अहश्चैवानिलोऽनलः |` | "Dhara [earth-bearer], Dhruva [steadfast one], Soma [moon deity], Aha [day], and also Anila [wind] and Anala [fire]," |
| `Line 7598: प्रत्यूषश्च प्रभासश्च वसवोऽष्टाविति स्मृताः ||१७||` | "Pratyūṣa [dawn] and Prabhāsa [radiance] - these are remembered as the eight Vasus [divine beings]. ||17||" |
| `Line 7599: ` | "[Blank line]" |

| `Line 7601: चन्द्रमास्तु मनस्विन्याः श्वसायाः श्वसनस्तथा ||१८||` | "Chandramās [moon] is (the son) of Manasvinī [thoughtful one], and similarly Śvasana [breath] is (the son) of Śvasā. ||18||" |
| `Line 7602: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7603: रतायाश्चाप्यहः पुत्रः शाण्डिल्याश्च हुताशनः |` | "Aha [day] is the son of Ratā [beloved], and Hutāśana [fire-consumer] is (the son) of Śāṇḍilyā," |
| `Line 7604: प्रत्यूषश्च प्रभासश्च प्रभातायाः सुतौ स्मृतौ ||१९||` | "Pratyūṣa and Prabhāsa are remembered as the two sons of Prabhātā [dawn]. ||19||" |
| `Line 7605: ` | "[Blank line]" |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 7606: धरस्य पुत्रो द्रविणो हुतहव्यवहस्तथा |` | "Dhara's son is Draviṇa, and also Hutahavyavaha [fire-offering carrier]," |
| `Line 7607: ध्रुवस्य पुत्रो भगवान्कालो लोकप्रकालनः ||२०||` | "Dhruva's son is the illustrious Kāla [Time deity], the illuminator of worlds. ||20||" |
| `Line 7608: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7609: सोमस्य तु सुतो वर्चा वर्चस्वी येन जायते |` | "Soma's [Moon god] son is Varchā, through whom one becomes radiant [varchasvī]," |
| `Line 7610: मनोहरायाः शिशिरः प्राणोऽथ रमणस्तथा ||२१||` | "From Manoharā [mind-captivating goddess] were born Śiśira [cool season], Prāṇa [life-breath], and Ramaṇa [delighter]. ||21||" |
| `Line 7611: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7612: अह्नः सुतो स्मृतो ज्योतिः श्रमः शान्तस्तथा मुनिः |` | "The son of Ahan [Day] is remembered as Jyotis [light], Śrama [exertion], Śānta [peace], and Muni [sage]," |
| `Line 7613: अग्नेः पुत्रः कुमारस्तु श्रीमाञ्शरवणालयः ||२२||` | "Agni's [fire god] son is Kumāra [youth-deity], the illustrious one who dwells in reed-beds [Śaravaṇālaya]. ||22||" |
| `Line 7614: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7615: तस्य शाखो विशाखश्च नैगमेशश्च पृष्ठजः |` | "His (Kumāra's) sons are Śākha, Viśākha, Naigameśa, and Pṛṣṭhaja [born from the back]," |
translations: | `Line 7606: धरस्य पुत्रो द्रविणो हुतहव्यवहस्तथा |` | "Dhara's son is Draviṇa, and also Hutahavyavaha [fire-offering carrier]," |
| `Line 7607: ध्रुवस्य पुत्रो भगवान्कालो लोकप्रकालनः ||२०||` | "Dhruva's son is the illustrious Kāla [Time deity], the illuminator of worlds. ||20||" |
| `Line 7608: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7609: सोमस्य तु सुतो वर्चा वर्चस्वी येन जायते |` | "Soma's [Moon god] son is Varchā, through whom one becomes radiant [varchasvī]," |
| `Line 7610: मनोहरायाः शिशिरः प्राणोऽथ रमणस्तथा ||२१||` | "From Manoharā [mind-captivating goddess] were born Śiśira [cool season], Prāṇa [life-breath], and Ramaṇa [delighter]. ||21||" |
| `Line 7611: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7612: अह्नः सुतो स्मृतो ज्योतिः श्रमः शान्तस्तथा मुनिः |` | "The son of Ahan [Day] is remembered as Jyotis [light], Śrama [exertion], Śānta [peace], and Muni [sage]," |
| `Line 7613: अग्नेः पुत्रः कुमारस्तु श्रीमाञ्शरवणालयः ||२२||` | "Agni's [fire god] son is Kumāra [youth-deity], the illustrious one who dwells in reed-beds [Śaravaṇālaya]. ||22||" |
| `Line 7614: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7615: तस्य शाखो विशाखश्च नैगमेशश्च पृष्ठजः |` | "His (Kumāra's) sons are Śākha, Viśākha, Naigameśa, and Pṛṣṭhaja [born from the back]," |

completed_batches.content:
| **Sanskrit** | **English Translation** |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| `Line 7616: कृत्तिकाभ्युपपत्तेश्च कार्त्तिकेय इति स्मृतः ||२३||` | "And due to his association with the Kṛttikās [Pleiades stars], he is remembered as Kārttikeya [son of Kṛttikās]. ||23||" |
| `Line 7617: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7618: अनिलस्य शिवा भार्या तस्याः पुत्रः पुरोजवः |` | "Anila's [wind god] wife is Śivā, and her son is Purojava [swift-moving]," |
| `Line 7619: अविज्ञातगतिश्चैव द्वौ पुत्रावनिलस्य तु ||२४||` | "And Avijñātagati [of unknown course] - these two are the sons of Anila. ||24||" |
| `Line 7620: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7621: प्रत्यूषस्य विदुः पुत्रमृषिं नाम्नाथ देवलम् |` | "They know Pratyūṣa's [dawn] son as the sage named Devala [divine one]," |
| `Line 7622: द्वौ पुत्रौ देवलस्यापि क्षमावन्तौ मनीषिणौ ||२५||` | "And Devala also has two sons, both patient and wise. ||25||" |
| `Line 7623: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7624: बृहस्पतेस्तु भगिनी वरस्त्री ब्रह्मचारिणी |` | "Bṛhaspati's [preceptor of gods] sister is an excellent woman, a celibate [brahmacharini]," |
| `Line 7625: योगसिद्धा जगत्सर्वमसक्तं विचरत्युत ||२६||` | "Accomplished in yoga, she wanders throughout the entire world, unattached. ||26||" |
| `Line 7626: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7627: प्रभासस्य तु भार्या सा वसूनामष्टमस्य ह ||२६||` | "She is the wife of Prabhāsa [radiance], the eighth of the Vasus. ||26||" |
| `Line 7628: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7629: विश्वकर्मा महाभागो जज्ञे शिल्पप्रजापतिः |` | "Viśvakarmā [universal architect], the illustrious one, was born as the lord of crafts [śilpa-prajāpati]," |
| `Line 7630: कर्ता शिल्पसहस्राणां त्रिदशानां च वर्धकिः ||२७||` | "The creator of thousands of crafts and the carpenter of the thirty [tridaśa] gods. ||27||" |
| `Line 7631: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7632: भूषणानां च सर्वेषां कर्ता शिल्पवतां वरः |` | "The maker of all ornaments, the best among craftsmen," |
| `Line 7633: यो दिव्यानि विमानानि देवतानां चकार ह ||२८||` | "Who created the divine aerial chariots [vimāna] for the deities. ||28||" |
| `Line 7634: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7635: मनुष्याश्चोपजीवन्ति यस्य शिल्पं महात्मनः |` | "Humans also live by the craft of that great-souled one," |
| `Line 7636: पूजयन्ति च यं नित्यं विश्वकर्माणमव्ययम् ||२९||` | "And they worship daily that imperishable Viśvakarmā. ||29||" |
| `Line 7637: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7638: स्तनं तु दक्षिणं भित्त्वा ब्रह्मणो नरविग्रहः |` | "Breaking through the right breast of Brahmā [creator god], in human form," |
| `Line 7639: निःसृतो भगवान्धर्मः सर्वलोकसुखावहः ||३०||` | "Emerged the divine Dharma [righteousness], who brings happiness to all worlds. ||30||" |
| `Line 7640: ` | "[Blank line]" |
translations: | `Line 7616: कृत्तिकाभ्युपपत्तेश्च कार्त्तिकेय इति स्मृतः ||२३||` | "And due to his association with the Kṛttikās [Pleiades stars], he is remembered as Kārttikeya [son of Kṛttikās]. ||23||" |
| `Line 7617: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7618: अनिलस्य शिवा भार्या तस्याः पुत्रः पुरोजवः |` | "Anila's [wind god] wife is Śivā, and her son is Purojava [swift-moving]," |
| `Line 7619: अविज्ञातगतिश्चैव द्वौ पुत्रावनिलस्य तु ||२४||` | "And Avijñātagati [of unknown course] - these two are the sons of Anila. ||24||" |
| `Line 7620: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7621: प्रत्यूषस्य विदुः पुत्रमृषिं नाम्नाथ देवलम् |` | "They know Pratyūṣa's [dawn] son as the sage named Devala [divine one]," |
| `Line 7622: द्वौ पुत्रौ देवलस्यापि क्षमावन्तौ मनीषिणौ ||२५||` | "And Devala also has two sons, both patient and wise. ||25||" |
| `Line 7623: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7624: बृहस्पतेस्तु भगिनी वरस्त्री ब्रह्मचारिणी |` | "Bṛhaspati's [preceptor of gods] sister is an excellent woman, a celibate [brahmacharini]," |
| `Line 7625: योगसिद्धा जगत्सर्वमसक्तं विचरत्युत ||२६||` | "Accomplished in yoga, she wanders throughout the entire world, unattached. ||26||" |
| `Line 7626: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7627: प्रभासस्य तु भार्या सा वसूनामष्टमस्य ह ||२६||` | "She is the wife of Prabhāsa [radiance], the eighth of the Vasus. ||26||" |
| `Line 7628: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7629: विश्वकर्मा महाभागो जज्ञे शिल्पप्रजापतिः |` | "Viśvakarmā [universal architect], the illustrious one, was born as the lord of crafts [śilpa-prajāpati]," |
| `Line 7630: कर्ता शिल्पसहस्राणां त्रिदशानां च वर्धकिः ||२७||` | "The creator of thousands of crafts and the carpenter of the thirty [tridaśa] gods. ||27||" |
| `Line 7631: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7632: भूषणानां च सर्वेषां कर्ता शिल्पवतां वरः |` | "The maker of all ornaments, the best among craftsmen," |
| `Line 7633: यो दिव्यानि विमानानि देवतानां चकार ह ||२८||` | "Who created the divine aerial chariots [vimāna] for the deities. ||28||" |
| `Line 7634: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7635: मनुष्याश्चोपजीवन्ति यस्य शिल्पं महात्मनः |` | "Humans also live by the craft of that great-souled one," |
| `Line 7636: पूजयन्ति च यं नित्यं विश्वकर्माणमव्ययम् ||२९||` | "And they worship daily that imperishable Viśvakarmā. ||29||" |
| `Line 7637: ` | "[Blank line]" |
| `Line 7638: स्तनं तु दक्षिणं भित्त्वा ब्रह्मणो नरविग्रहः |` | "Breaking through the right breast of Brahmā [creator god], in human form," |
| `Line 7639: निःसृतो भगवान्धर्मः सर्वलोकसुखावहः ||३०||` | "Emerged the divine Dharma [righteousness], who brings happiness to all worlds. ||30||" |
| `Line 7640: ` | "[Blank line]" |
